reviews.text: Gouda Good is arguable San Francisco's most underrated individual sandwich.  Bite knows how to make sandwiches, bookmark this place and try a few.  Parking is horrible, go early to secure a spot or, have somebody else drive; order to-go since you'll freak-out at the meter fees.

My other favorite sandwich place in San Francisco. The Gouda Good is incredibly good. I lived a few blocks from this place and eat there 3-5 times a week. I've had the "Gotti" one time thinking it'd be as good as the Italian in Boy's Deli, but it wasn't. It doesn't matter, just get the Gouda Good and don't look back.
Great sandwiches, I'd recommend any of the Chicken or Tuna ones I've tried a handful and they're all worth it.  It's not too heavy either.  Not a sit-down place.  Service is good.
I see the owner is active here, so hopefully some of this can be taken constructively.
I am in town for business and saw that this place had good reviews so thought I'd give it a go.
A Mighty Delicious Sandwich
I probably go here once a week because it really is that addicting (granted I live about 4 blocks away).

This is definitely the quintessential hole in the wall amazing find restaurant. The most guys I've ever seen behind the counter is three, and the whole place is probably about the size of a small studio apartment.
Cowboy melt is the best sandwich I have ever eaten! Their rotisserie chicken is heaven! This place has good vibes. Everyone is friendly. Keep up with the good work, Bite!

In my opinion, best sandwiches in the bay. Quality ingredients, good recipes, and overall care very much make this tiny shop work. One would think that a sandwich would be a paint by numbers recipe. If you are of this mind frame, you should not be reviewing food. I have had the Napa, kitchen sink, fire cracker, skins... Man, and so may more. This is a one of a kind shop in sf that deserves so many accolades. Fresh bread, meat, and veggies. A staple.

Bite is my go-to place for speedy and consistently delicious sandwiches in my neighborhood; I eat there at least once or twice a week and get the same order virtually almost every time (the Treesitter). Many say it's the 'Ikes North of Market' and I'd have to agree - the delicious creations on the menu are on point.
I had a genoa salami on dutch crunch. It was a decent sandwich at a decent price. I've definitely had better but I've also had worse. I would probably go back only because it's close to work.

From the outside it doesnt look like much, no real seating to speak of, and their signage doesnt really scream for someone to stop at this place for lunch or dinner. That being said, it would be the biggest mistake not stopping here and getting a "bite" to eat (i know i'm hilarious)
Good food, make sure you read the top of the board for all the extras they put on automatically.

My family and I just stayed at a hotel nearby and were originally just going to go to Subway until one of the porters at The Beresford Arms Hotel highly recommend Bite.  We are SO glad he did because their food is FANTASTIC!
Bottom Line: one of the premier sandwich spots in the city.
I would give this place a six star rating if I could. I tried the 'Cowboy Melt' sandwich and it was literally an orgasm in my mouth.
The chicken was a little bit on the dry side and seating is limited. Good enough for $10.

Despite there good food and big portions, they lack workers which slows down everyone's order. There's usually only like 2 people working including the person making the sandwich and the person working at the cashier. There's usually people always ordering food but the wait time is just ridiculous.

I don't typically get on line to write a review however this restaurant has opened a new   restaurant at 916 sutter. The restaurant is next door and serves burritos and various mexican meals. I was happy to explore since it is close to my hospital job. During my visit I spoke with the guy about sending him business and requested menus that he did not have. I continued on to order when I observed him handling money and food without changing his glove. I politely informed him that patrons and especially hospital workers would rip him a new one for this practice.  He immediately froze but what really upset me was his comment.  My hint of his unsanitary practice I thought would give him some idea of what was wrong. He proceeded to ask me if I wanted the burrito or not. I was so disappointed the other person who was subject to the unsanitary act before his attempt to make my burrito came back to question the practice chimed in to say he would write a review as well.  This place did not have a logo or name at the time but it is under bites and next to the store. I am hopeful they see this review and correct it but I will not come back and I will tell all fellow nurses and staff of the situation.
Perfect neighborhood deli. Sweet people work there and they make amazing wraps and sandwiches. Open later too!

I've become a regular here pretty quickly. Easily the most delicious sandwiches in San Francisco. I'm a huge fan of their peppercorn turkey and the Day After Thanksgiving sandwich. Their wraps are also huge! Nothing fulfills my cravings better than Bite.
I've tried just about everything on the menu here. I love the leafy gallina, and the porky's revenge sandwich with sour cream instead of bbq sauce.
Had the gouda good the other day and it was delicious!  Highly recommend this place - consistently good sandwiches.
I was hoping for Ike's or better, but it wasn't quite there. Why?

It was 11pm and as usual, I was starving in my dorm. I decided to walk up the street to this place and fell in love with the food. I had the Day After Thanksgiving Sandwich plain, and it was soooo amazing. Plus I love that they stay open late, for late night cravings.
fantastic sandwiches, some of the options are a little pricey but delicious overall

I got the good Gouda add jalapenos the other night and I'm still thinking about it  we also ordered the uncle vinny meatball sandwich and yum!  I can't wait to go back . Only thing, I ordered one of the big pickles and when I got home realized it wasn't with the rest of my order :( next time I've gotta make sure it's in there.

This was the first place that we tried upon arriving in San Fran. I had an aloe watermelon drink with my Napa sandwich and a post lunch cookie. The ol' ball and chain had the Gouda Good and a cookie and washed it down with a Coke. It was a short walk from our hotel and freaking delicious. I love it when a sandwich shop stands out and you can taste the difference between them and the chains. The people were nice, but keep in mind that this is a small location with limited seating. There were a few tables outside and I don't remember seeing any inside. Luckily the weather was much better here than in Phoenix where we traveled from. I'd go back and try some of the other options on the menu if we returned to San Francisco. Well worth the visit.
Overall experience 4/5

I got the Sleeper which was good and my wife got the veggie sandwich which was just OK.  Only caveat that I had about the place is the wait is too long (2.30pm on labor day).   We waited almost 20 mins for our food and I realized that others were getting their sandwiches earlier than us.  That was a disappointment.

Damn, I was hella disappointed with Bite. I got the Gouda Good and was so looking forward to it, but it was not what I was expecting. I think my mistake was going on a Friday at around 7:30pm, but that really shouldn't be an excuse. The bread was hard and crusty. The chicken was dry. Not cool.

First time in SF and looking for something quick on our way to our hotel late at night. Bite provided great tasting sandwiches (get the ones with the rotisserie chicken) with really fresh ingredients; cutting apples at midnight surely rates high in my book.
Used to get the gouda good, which was about 3.5 stars. Made the switch to the mama mia plus the peppersauce, and haven't looked back since. I hope they franchise and open where ever I live.

I visited this restaurant on my trip to San Francisco for the SF Marathon last month. Basically, you can customize your sandwich any way you want. I got a turkey on 9-grain bread with avocado, provolone and I can't remember what else. I do remember it was assembled efficiently and was a satisfying meal. Yum! Too bad my stay was so short in SF, there are a lot of great places to catch a bite, and this is one.
I had the gouda good and the Napa sandwiches here.
Time: 12:07pm/70°F mostly cloudy
Excellent sandwiches and deli meat.  Gouda Good and Kitchen Sink the best!
Best sandwich in town.  All of them are great.  Must be the some kind of crack they add to the ingredients.  I just don't understand why its so good.

I hate this place.  I can't just eat here one day like a normal person. If I get one of these sandwiches I end up in a downward spiral where I'm there 18 times that week.  Just a really solid sandwich and compared to deli board and Ike's I think it's a way better value.  Try any of the sandwiches w/ the rotisserie chicken as it seems like that's their specialty, they're all really good.
Ok, so the first time I dined here, I was all about it. Small, family-owned joint, on Geary and Van Ness.

Amazing Manto, chicken kabob, beef kabob and Chapli kabob!!!! Cute smaller restaurant with a warm ambience. Nice service provided by a very friendly staff. All items ordered were delicious  and food was served quickly. Very enjoyable.
There is nothing in the bay area like de afghan for kabobs. I drive from berkley just to have kabob. Hate that they moved from berkley
Came here and both times are awesome. The place is quite small so it might be tricky for big groups.
This location is not as good as De Afghanan in Fremont. A very small restaurant with a limited menu.

Food is alright if you ever get it S and I went for dinner, the place is very small, about 8 tables, and two waiters. We ordered two veggie dishes to share, rice and bread. One dish came out readonably quickly but really needed to be eaten with bread or rice. No bread, no rice. 15 mins elapse. Waiter swings by and leaves empty drink glasses on the table, not asking if we'd like water but inquiring to us if the rest of our food had come out. It had not. Another 10-15 mins elapse, the waiter came by, left to the empties again, and once again asked us if the rest of our food has come out. The rest of the food comes out about 5 minutes later, we finished the first fish without bread and rice since it's basically gotten cold by now. The waiter still hasn't cleared our empties, and our tiny table is getting cramped.
Omg the Best Afghan food in Town! The lamb kabob...tender juicy cooked to perfection! Food and service awesome. I love this place and would recommend it to everyone!
Simply outstanding. Truly home cooked style Afghan food. The chaplee kabob is the best. Delicious, savoury and hearty.

This place is great.  This is the first time I had Afghan food and it was absolutely delicious.  The boyfriend and I shared the Eggplant appetizer and the Triple Kabob since we wanted to try all the meats.  The afghan bread was also really good with the appetizer and the green chutney that sits on every table.  It's right next to the AMC movie theater so we are here before the movie.
Awsome spot
Great food and good service. Chicken and tekka Kebap so delicious. Icecream and rice pudding was tasteful. The most importantly you don't feel heavy after a heavy meal!

I came across with this Establishment while waiting for my Bus to arrived.. Never ate afghan food .. Took my chances late afternoon..Ordered to go the combo kebab .. Chicken N Beef with bismati rice.. .. IT'S AWESOME! !! Never regretted coming over..Beef's Soo tender And the Chicken was perfect.. I work out n don't eat Rice.. But after I tasted a few!! I finished it all.. The green spicy beans was good too.. Verdict?? I'd be back here n order to Go.. Place is home style.. The Lady who I talked too was nice enough To explain what's afghan food is .. It's a learning experience .. I'd recommend it !!!

My partner and I came here before the end of Ramadan. It was an amazing sight to see people gather around, order their food, and wait until it was time that they could finally break their fast. This, coupled with many of the paintings that depict images of what has and is going on in Afghanistan, really puts things into perspective. It was just an amazing intercultural and interfaith exchange going on that I observed and enjoyed seeing take place.
This is a truly special place.  Wonderful food and even more wonderful hosts. The

Never had afghan food before coming to this place, wasnt sure what to expect except I saw something on food network where the dude at a piece of a goat or lambs head at the place in berkley.  Anyway it made me want to come here.   I liked the food, didnt have the lamb thing i saw on tv, but it was legit.  I remember the bread things reminded me of the asian onion pancakes.  Food was good, I liked it.
This is by far the best afghan food in the area, however, the service is a bit impersonal. but their kabobs are just awesome.
The food is excellent authentic Afghan cuisine. The staff are friendly and courteous. This is a great place to eat at reasonable prices.

Popeye would have been four times as big if he ate spinach this good. And everything else is equally good (except perhaps the beef kebab which I would only give four stars). Great service too. Come, order too much and enjoy.
Best Afghan food I have ever had. The Lamb Kabob has no match so does the service.

I didn't think I would rate this place 5 stars when I walked in! You know by now red walls are not my thing...however as soon as the food arrived it was a different story. This was 5th time in a row of faultless culinary experience in SF. I do not dish 5 stars all the time...honest.
lamb shank and rice is amazing! meat is so tender it just slides off the bone...

Amazing and delicious food. We came from San Diego and stop for a lunch. Clean, casual and small place with great food. The food was cooked and served fast. Meat was tender and delicious, rice was cook to perfection.
This place is absolutely amazing. Authentic afghani food, and amazing taste!
There chaplee and chicken is always on point. I was apprehensive coming here just because their Fremont branch is their flagship restaurant.

The food was really delicious and the service was so fast. We had the potatoes and leek baloni which came out piping hot and was more than filling as an appetizer. We also had the lamb kabob platter and the triple meat platter. The rices were delish, as were the meats. I feel that the chicken and lamb were the most well received, but everything was delicious. The salad was the only problematic part. I could not eat it due to the extreme bitterness of the cilantro, but my partner enjoyed it. The service was great and friendly. And you gotta love the affordable prices. Definitely coming back!

This place is high on flavor but low on hospitality. They could easily upgrade the venueand double the prices as the food supports it. However, its a uncomfortable dining experience with the smells of the tenderloin wafting in th open door and overpowering the aroma of the food.
Glad to try qabili lamb shank dish and the chaplee kabob so flavorful.
Excellent food at great price. Chicken Kabob was incredible. All kebabs are served with sides like rice and some greens. They also give complimentary sides which were tangy and bit spicy but good.

I was a regular at De Afghanan in Berkeley and always had a great experience at the restaurant.   I recently went to De Afghanan in SF and had a new male waiter.  He was extremely unfriendly, uncaring, overwhelmed, and rude.  We had to get our own menus, our own water after waiting for the waiter to pay some attention to us.  We then had to flag him down multiple times before he came to take our order.  After a long wait, we got our food.  The food was, as usual, delicious.  But, we then had to wait 30/40 minutes for him to run our credit card.  He only did it when we physically got up and stood over him to get him to run our cards so we could leave.  Extremely frustrating experience and beyond poor service.

The chicken and tekka kabob combo were tender, juicy, and nicely flavored! You can obviously tell they took their time to slow cook the meat. I'd definitely come back again and try other items on the menu. Oohhh...and the firni milk pudding dessert is a must try!!!
Really nice spicy and flavorful food. The service is good and fast enough. It's also very reasonably priced! Must go for vegetarians!
Self service.
Great food. Lamb shank was amazing - didn't think I could finish it; I finished it. Prices are best.

i ordered their lamb kebab and it came with seasoned basmati rice. it was so tasty. i would come here again. its a small place and they dont do reservations so just fyi. it can get packed during dinner time.

Lots to love about this place, service is great, food is excellent... and the prices are totally reasonable. I've been to 4 places in the city which serve lamb kebab and this is the only place where the lamb is tender and flavorful, absolutely outstanding!

First time here, food is delicious, just tried the Triple Kabob. Next time I'd spare the Chicken as it was dry to my taste and ask for Lamb or Chaplee (my favorite). Kabob took longer than expected for a semi empty place but it was definitely worth the wait. Would come back.

First place I visited when I came to SF. This was also the first time I was trying Afghani food. All I have to say is that the food was amazing. I had the beef kabob and the meat was cooked correctly and the rice is very unique and tasty. The portion sizes were also very filling. I also had a dessert which was ice-cream with crushed pistachios and rose water and that too was amazing. The place is small, so it's a artsy hole in the wall. Service was great and I saw a lot of locals come in which usually means it's a solid place. I highly recommend them.

I love middle eastern food, and dinner here was tasty but not stellar like I read in some other reviews. I ordered the spiced pumpkin app ($7, really good) and the Chicken Qorma ($12, decent but wouldn't write home about it). It tasted authentic and on balance it was "pretty good". They only had one floor staff when I was there - and to be fair it's a tiny place so 2 might be overkill - but that meant somewhat slow service when it was getting busy. All that said, I'll probably grub here again every so often. Worth the initial trip if you like Afghan food.
The food here is *delicious*... worth the drive into the city just for their mantu.  Very flavorful food, cooked perfectly, no excess oils, and spiced just right.

I work on union square and I have a million options for lunch. Had to walk 15 minutes to get here. It was worth it. The food was delicious and quick. Had the lamb dish. The meat literally melted off the bone. No gaminess. Also had the spinach appetizer was good but a tad salty. My friend had the chicken in red sauce. ( sorry not sure about the names) also was excellent.

My friends and I stumbled into Sweet Woodruff after a long Sunday trek across the TenderNob area for a brunch spot. Jones was unexpectedly closed, so we hiked 2 blocks back up the hill to test it out. Upon entering, we were greeted by the friendly (perhaps over-friendly for anyone hungover) hipster cashier who handed us the menu.

After walking by a million times seeing the place pretty mellow in the early evenings, my husband and I popped into Sweet Woodruff for brunch on a rainy Saturday. Do you to the restaurant's layout it is loud and busy from the kitchen prep sounds. The menu is small but has something for everyone I think. Salads, burgers, and breakfast dishes are all well-sized, but make note that the Coke and sparkling water are teeny tiny glass bottles so not worth it. I do like their social media approach that offers a free mimosa or PBR with a photo on Instagram. Definitely a hip a little spot to pop in for a party of one or two.

Great tasting food but expect to leave hungry (very small portions) and to have frustratingly long wait times at brunch after you order.  Good coffee too but I gave up on trying to get a refill after about 10-15 minutes of trying.

Came in and ordered a meatball sandwich a week ago. Waited for 30 mins. Brought up the wait time to the man at the till who looked extremely stoned. He had no idea what we even ordered. The place was definitely not full. He scrambled to look for our ticket. Couldn't find it. Began to help another five customers after us. We went back to ask him what was going on, he didn't apologize and kind of just snapped, "I'm talking to the chef ok?" Waited another ten minutes. He served other people their sandwiches. Still did not address us. We decided to leave and ask for our money back. He started fumbling with food receipts and exchanged a few words with a woman behind the counter who did not assist, smile, help or apologize either. We got our money back and left without any sincere apology. Met up with friends after and shared our experience. Wouldn't ever recommend it.

I absolutely love the vibe of this place! We went for breakfast and we had a lovely meal at the bar. The staff were friendly and informative and our food was really good - can recommend the lemon oatmeal. The coffee wasn't very good but we think that about most American coffee (we are spoiled for quality in Australia) so that might just be us. If you come here, you're guaranteed to have a good time!

Hipster Food and Service. If you're looking for service where you're an annoyance and retro food then make a bee line for Sweet Woodruff. By retro food, I mean a gray, soulless, griddle-cooked, hamburger patty that I last recall seeing at my middle school cafeteria. By hipster service, I mean where you get annoyed looks when asking about the ingredients in a dish and where 75% of the restaurant is sweltering because they won't put down the shades on the windows. Even the guy taking orders at the register was squinting from the sun, but still wouldn't do anything about it.
Pretty good place except for the fact that they call ketchup "tomato jam". Really??? They lose 1 star for that.

What a lovely little place! I had the "Hippie Salad," & daughter had a yummy sandwich. We shared an order of tapenade , goat cheese & toasted bread. Only downside- small size & noise, but great products. That salad would be my regular order if I could go regularly.

A little pricey, but definitely delicious. The ambiance is nice- pretty hipster, but I like how you can see the food being prepped. I wish there was a little more seating, as this place fills up super fast. Overall, I have enjoyed my food every time I've dined here. I also like that they do random cooking classes that you can sign up for. Great addition to the neighborhood!
Fast casual hipster food without a wait. The staff is friendly and accommodating - they even have been nice enough to throw in a free cookie for slow service.

My friend and I stumbled across this place for a late brunch, and boy are we glad we did!  There is limited seating inside, but it's bright, cozy, and inviting.  We went late enough that there was plenty of seating.  The service was personable and funny.

Great friendly service and the food was sexy amazing. Not only were the grilled cheese and tomato soup heavenly, the presentation was very appealing. They serve actual Mexican coke--which is so good, if you've never tasted one before. I would come back again--in fact I want to return as I type. It was just that good.
Finding a Sweet Spot
Great place for a sandwich. We had the brunch burger and it was phenomenal. Great flavor, reasonable portions and good prices on the beer. We highly recommend this joint.

Perfect brunch. Staff is so friendly and nice! There were a lot of people on a Saturday morning but the line moves quickly and no one was lacking for seating. I hung out for awhile (I was by myself) it's a great spot to look out the window and people watch. Overall it was a super relaxing Saturday morning brunch with cool people and chill environment. Definitely the spot.
This place simply kicks ass. Rotating menus, really friendly and efficient service, great food, and half a block from my spot!! Love it.
Cozy casual spot for quality food. Works well for lunch or quick pre-theater dinner.

This place is pretty great. With its open kitchen layout, It reminds me of a trendy pop-up in NYC but it's all the better since it's right here in the city. SF locals definitely frequent it and it's usually pretty busy, so be prepared to wait if you would like to sit at one of the tables.

I love the atmosphere and the open kitchen. The staff is incredibly friendly and the food is yum. We got the watermelon gazpacho which was refreshing and not too sweet. The mussels were fresh and the broth they were in was perfect. My only qualm was the spicy macaroni and cheese needed more cheese. It was too creamy and didn't have enough density. But that being said, it's a great place to drop in for a casual, after work dinner. I'll go back.
California and Pastrami sandwiches are so so good. Boyfriend said it was the best Pastrami sandwich he has ever had! I'm also a sucker for lemonade in a mason jar :)
Got the breakfast sandwich. It was good, but not worth the over 30 minute wait time. Probably won't be back

I really like this place - it's like a bunch of bros cooking at home and serving whatever they cook up to house guests.  They put a lot of heart into the cooking and the serving size is really fair.  Their sandwiches are great.
Great local place in the neighborhood. A small but delectable menu with great service and a warm atmosphere.

So good I had to visit twice during a very short stay in San Francisco. The first was a quick snack before an experimental music performance at the nearby Meridian Gallery. We didn't want to be late for the show but needed a quick bite to hold us over. I'd passed Sweet Woodruff on my way to the Golden Coffee Shop the previous morning and made a mental note. Upon finding out its close proximity to the Meridian, I was excited to try it out for our snack.
Being fairly new to the hood, I was searching handy Yelp to satisfy a mac and cheese craving and up comes SW. So on I go looking for the menu to order for pickup. But here's where it gets sticky.
One of the best hidden gems in SF!
Perfect nice/casual lunch. Pretzel was straightup sexy -- cheesy with good mustard. Then the California sandwich , which was super simple and delicious. Would love to go back for dinner or brunch.

Woodruff has great food with attention paid to quality ingredients.  It's a funky space with an open kitchen and a fun (if limited) beverage offering.  Service can be a bit stand-offish and at times erratic, but you're not going for the service.  It's a fun place to go for a decent meal at reasonable prices, and you might hear some good music at the same time.

My mother and I were just in there and were about to order until we noticed this girl behind the counter who was handling equipment in the back (my mother noticed when she used the restroom), was eating a sandwich behind the counter, had mayonnaise on her face and hands, and was scratching her head. It grossed us out so much we left!

looking for a late night sandwich and some dessert.  I ordered take out.  I had the burger with greens on the side, huge chocolate chip cookie, and molten lava cookie.  When I got my order, they gave me two lava cookies because they were small.  Very sparse minimal industrial look.
delicious, inventive menu... lively and bright space...  cookies (molten chocolate or chocolate chip) to die for.

Only a few menu options, but they all sounded delicious! We got the breakfast sandwiches and perfect mimosas. Being vegetarian I got the sandwich sans bacon, which sometimes can make for a sad meal but it was still so tasty and satisfying! Awesome atmosphere and staff :)

So delish! Had the soft scramble eggs and a side of potatoes and my brother had the brunch burger. Super fresh and great ambiance. Small seating area so not the best for big groups, but awesome music, awesome food, awesome place.
A sister restaurant of my beloved Sons & Daughters.  Sweet Woodruff is a restaurant that can't be overlooked.
i love this place so much!! my bf stumbled in this place as we were walking around his neighborhood.
This is one of my favorite spots to meet people for breakfast or brunch. There's always seating in the morning, and the coffee is excellent.
Teague M: thanks for your reply, and I am glad you agree, but I would expect more.

Sweet Woodruff is one of my favorite spots in the neighborhood. This place is just wonderful. The menu changes every day which makes every visit its own unique experience. I've been here half a dozen times already and each time has been great. I really recommend coming for brunch though! They have amazing things ranging from biscuits and gravy to homemade pretzels and brunch burgers.

This was such a great find when visiting San Francisco. The food was delicious- I wish I had the opportunity to eat there again before I left. It's not your typical menu, which makes it even more fantastic. I have the spicy mussels with a plum cobbler!

Great atmosphere!  Hipsters rule at this industrial hang out.  Open seating, open kitchen, limited menu with great ingredients.  Avocado sandwich and burger are great.  Must try the taters -- roasted and with lemony sauce. Nice place to check out, not your typical bar or pub fare.

The concept, of course, is awesome and the food is equally good. I got the savory tart, which was very good. My friend got the daily toast and that was also amazing. I love the concept of the daily toast... hope I can find something like that down in LA :)
Best breakfast place we've been to in a long time! We had 3 out of the 4 specials and they were all equally good. Will definitely come back!
Stopped by here one morning while in San Fran.  What a great place!  I had the ham croissant with boiled eggs and a cafe latte.  They were both tremendous!

Coffee servings are very small.  Service is slow.  Toast is mediocre for the price.  The egg croissant is actually really great though! I've never had anything like it.  Only things I'd order if I went there again.  Not much seating at all.

Stood at a tiny table outside this place. I think that everything at this establishment was accidentally scaled down by 40% average human size. The food, the tables, the interior, the menu- all were too small for comfort.

Fun location for a quick brunch. Be forewarned, this place is smaller than your living room so be prepared to huddle at the door in line. Seating is first come, first serve and very minimal (1 communal picnic table, 2-3 tables outside, and a small window counter)

4 stars for being a friendly, quaint, and healthful restaurant. It's tiny with 1 communal table inside and 2 tables outside. Breakfast menu is small but fresh and really delicious. I had the frittata which was delicious and it came with greens. Hubs had the daily toast which was loaded with fresh fruit! It was delicious. All of our food was. I had the chai latte with almond milk that also included matcha tea, so yum! All in all we enjoyed our breakfast and the friendly service.

Small venue (with out door seating) but everything at Farm:Table is TDF! They offer the same selection of ~4-5 meal items & also a half dozen drinks. Highly recommend the egg croissant (egg, ham, cheese, arugula) and the toast (creamy sweet spread with pistachios and fruits)

Farm:Table serves fresh food from a small menu and gourmet coffee/other caffeine options from an extensive menu.  The establishment is extremely small with almost no seating and is definitely one of the better coffee stops in the area.

Very small place with 5 menu items. But don't be scared: lack of options means that what they sell is pretty darn good. We had a ciabatta egg sandwich and the savory tart, coffee and a honey milk, and a muffin. We loved the place and since we live around the corner, we will def be back.
I have been to this place for a few years, it has been a weekend tradition for morning breakfast sandwich and coffee. For the first and last time I will visit farm table.

Love this lil nook! Great coffee, small menu but solid food. Recommend: TenderNob, Egg on Crossiant, and the Tart of the day. Really small spot so on weekends especially there isn't much space to leisurely go about your morning routine w/o glaring eyes and people hovering your table or seat, so get comfortable on the oddly designed Parklet out front.

Finally got to try this place after getting up right before they opened on a weekend morning!!! It was worth it! Ham and cheese croissant, stuffed bell pepper and iced coffee... all great! Local and fresh ingredients. The big con not reflective of its food? It's a tiny place with one small communal table inside and two small tables outside. I hope they can find and afford a bigger space in Sf!
How can I write a review that they truly deserve? This place is truly amazing!

Excellent coffee.....the menu is small and perfect..... A great place to stop in the morning and get a great cup of coffee.  A couple of outdoor seats and a table inside with a couple of benches. Leave a big group at home.  I had an egg on croissant and it was awesome.  All ingredients tasted fresh, the croissant was crispy and light.  Perfect quick breakfast spot in San Francisco.
Can't beat fresh and simple. I would have their daily toast and egg and ham croissant everyday if I had my way. Easily accessible from Union square with a short bus ride.

Farm:Table is right across from my apartment and I go here several times a week. The daily toast is killer and they use TCHO chocolate in their mochas. So good!! They also have a really nice tea selection from Red Blossom Tea Company, local to SF. Seating is very limited, but the communal table inside is cozy and a great way to meet friendly regulars. Definitely check out this farm-to-table cafe and enjoy all the fresh,local ingredients.

Good coffee... decent food with a limited menu. I had the egg croissant with candied bacon and ordered the daily toast to-go. Although the food was yummy, it was nothing particularly extraordinary. The interior is cute but super cramped and tiny inside. We ended up sitting outside at one of their small tables.

I'm glad yelp introduced me to this place. It was very close to our hotel in San Francisco. We headed here for breakfast this morning, and I had one of the tastiest and freshest breakfast sandwiches I've ever had. The croissant with ham, egg and cheese was absolutely delicious. They have a limited menu, but everything looks delicious.

You pay a lot for a little. Food is okay, nothing to rave about. I got the croissant egg sandwich thing, it wasn't bad. The coffee was tiny for the 4 dollars I paid. The staff is nice and friendly. But, the food and prices doesn't make me come back.

On a busy Sunday morning the line went quickly. Amazing, AMAZING coffee today. Ethiopian single source. Plus the food was delicious!!  If you like good coffee and real food then it's a must go in San Francisco!!

The food was fantastic but just a heads up that it's not a sit down restaurant. You order at the front counter and there is literally one table inside, and 2 on the sidewalk. The menu is as short as it gets too - you basically have a choice between a breakfast sandwich or toast. But like I said the food is great. Next time Id probably hit this place on the way out of town and take it to go. Eat it in the park.

Options were limited - both on the menu and in terms of seating... I expected more out of the daily toast, given the price and hype from other reviews. The bread wasn't anything special, and it overwhelmed the toppings due to sheer size. Skimpy on the cheese. What's more, it was all hard to eat (the nuts should probably be placed directly on the cheese if you want them to stay put...).
Fresh fruit and fresh yogurt were great.  Nice and small place to grab quick food. Everyone is very friendly

After seeing pictures of the delicious food on yelp, i decided to give this breakfast a try on one of my trips to San Francisco. I walked up and was shocked at the size of the location. It only had about 3 customers and was unable to accommodate my party of 3. They're was barely enough space to enter. And there was only like a couple of food options. Its probably a good option for to go orders but if you want to sit down and eat breakfast with others than not a good place. We ended up going to a breakfast joint a Couple of blocks down....

Iced coffee was delicious. Small, cute spot on Post. We got the croissant sandwich which was quite creative and tastey, and the quiche which was fantastic. The quiche was better than the sandwich, but both were pretty small portions. For $7.50 though, I wasn't complaining about the portions.
Small place, nice staff.

Cue what Monica T. said. While the service was good and the simple food straightforward and tasty, I found the place to be too TINY and the wait too be too long. I am pretty sure I waited over twenty minutes for 1. an iced coffee and 2. some toast with fruit.
Fantastic "Daily toast" and really good espresso! Service is also good. Did not really agree with prices there, otherwise i would give 5 stars:)

I don't know what happened, but this place has really gone down hill in the last year and a half. I think there was an ownership or chef change. Anyways, the pastries aren't as good anymore, the daily items are never as good, and the service isn't as friendly and up beat.

I came here hungry on a Sunday morning excited to grab a quick breakfast and try out their very popular "daily toast". When my bf and I arrived, we were surprised with how tiny the cafe was, there's one communal table that sits about 8 people tightly. It was about the size of a small living room and there was barely any space to move around, but the decor was rustic and very very charming. Without the crowds of people waiting to order food, it actually felt very cozy and quite nice.

Small, cute brunch spot. There's real limited seating here and small menu. The food's good, but pretty simple and could probably be made easily at home. Small portions for the price, but a healthy/reasonable portion size.

I really thought I would like farm:table. I wanted to like them too. An ever changing menu with locally sourced fresh ingredients? How can you go wrong with that? On this Thursday morning, I ventured through the tenderloin to find out what this place was all about.
Tiny place, be prepared to wait or eat outside. That said, amazing egg sando.. would eat it again!

Loved the toast with berries and fruit, and since I can't have dairy, they substituted almond butter for the mascarpone!  It was delicious!!!  The house juice was fantastic, too, and the presentation was beautiful. I loved sitting outside on the wooden planter next to the mint to eat.
We expected better given the reviews. Over-hyped. Sandwich was very good, but nothing truly special. Cereal was unremarkable. Seating was limited. Coffee was pretty.

Small size and lack of seating (especially indoors) make it better for a standing meal or takeaway.  I had a kouign amman with a black coffee, both were pretty good.  I don't think I'd go out of my way for this place again, but it was decent considering I didn't have to wait too long compared to other brunch spots in the Tenderloin.

Found farm:table on Yelp and decided to give it a try. My friend and I stopped by for brunch around 12:30 p.m. on a Saturday and it wasn't too crowded. All the seats were taken, but we got there as people were finishing up. We ordered the egg croissant and the toast of the day (I think that's what it was called -- had mascarpone and fresh fruit). I had the House Juice, which was pretty good but the cup was rather small for $3. My friend got a latte and she seemed to enjoy it. The egg croissant ($7.50) was good, but very small. The toast ($7.50) was very yummy, and it was pretty big. While we enjoyed the meal, this place was definitely more for the "look" and "hipstery" feel rather than food (I hope that makes sense). While it was a cute little cafe/restaurant, the food was overpriced (and serve in those paper dishes that are for fries...) and the restaurant was very small.
Delicious, unique, creative and tiny...Worth a visit and a wait for a special breakfast.
Steep on price but deliver with taste! Best veggie burger in the city!
The burgers are amazing. We came in here one night very drunk and very loud and was rewarded with delicious burgers and really kind and patient service...def kinder than we probably deserved.

Pearl's has got the real deal burgers, baby. I miss the days of living down the street from what I consider the best burger in the city. I mean, they have kobe and BUFFALO burgers in addition to traditional beef. They served sweet potato fries before every restaurant and their mom's started serving them (talk about OGs). Their french fries are thick and meaty and fried up with what I consider a great balance of crispiness and greasiness.
Good, but nothing overly special.  The fries are good, but not unique, I've had the exact ones at other restaurants, so they are ordered from somewhere else.

I was literally starving yesterday evening and was dreaming on a delicious burger. My friend took me to Pearl's Deluxe Burgers, and that was it! Burgers were awesome, i was full by eating only one even though i was so hungry.

Very courteous.   We went on a Friday @ noon and didn't have to wait in line.  Very fast service, and good food.  We took ours to go, as seating for 5 is sparce in the downtown area.  Burgers, fries, onion rings and shakes!  Great choices,  and they make and weigh their own burgers.  Very tasty.  Highly recommend,  and will definitely go back.
Spectacular burger, the guy in the cashier was the nicest person I ever met in a fast food place :) will def be back when I'm craving some burgers! :)

Went here for a late night burger when I was staying at a hotel in Union Square and I'm glad I did! It was fairly late so there wasn't a line. It's a small place with limited seating, but I was doing take out so that really wasn't an issue for me.

I have had this place book marked for a while. Not sure how I found out about this place, maybe someone recommended it to me. Anyways we had a friend in town who always eats here when he visits so we decided to join him. I ordered a pearl deluxe mini. The bun was the highlight of the burger. The meat and filling was ok. Not super flavorful or anything. Hubby got the burger with the goat cheese. He said it was ok, a little on the salty side. My little one seemed to enjoy their sweet potato fries. Banana shake was nothing spectacular. Overall the burgers look better than they actually taste.

Nice burger joint and a lot of different options! I ordered the Bula burger and the sauce was a little too much for me but that is my personal taste :) Would like to come back again and try the Deluxe. Cash only but they have an ATM located in store.
Whenever I come here I always order a mini sized burger and get an order of garlic fries on the side. Garlic Fries = MUST

I finally understand the fuss. We were craving burgers and Pearls was the answer! We went mid afternoon and it was busy but not crazy. We parked in parking lot on Cosmo Place for $6/hour which was expensive but  felt a little more secure than street parking. Burgers were fresh, well prepared and very filling.
Came here while on vacation in SF, and really enjoyed it!  We had read great reviews on Yelp and decided to try it out since it was a short walk from where we were staying.
I was craving a burger for dinner and found this place on Yelp. It's located in the Tenderloin district of SF (which is not one of the safest areas).
So good. But ooooh so bad. I need to sleep this food off.

Delicious burgers, free pickles and fantastic price! Pearl's was the first place we went to in San Fran and didn't we pick a winner! My partner said "that was the most perfect dinner ever." Will be back!
Amazing! Got the Bula burger and springs and they were delicious. The spicy pineapple gave the burger a unique twist. Huge portion so come hungry. Highly recommend it!

The family and I are in San Francisco for a couple of days and have been trying different restaurants, since my father is more of a burger and fries kind of guy we compromised and settled on Pearls over a fast food chain. I had the Pearl, hubby had a bacon cheeseburger, my mother had a chicken mushroom burger and my dad (the burger guy) had a hot dog...yeah, I know :/  we all enjoyed our choices as well as the regular and sweet potato fries and the onion rings. Everything was cooked to our liking and definitely hit the spot. But as much as we enjoyed our food we loved the service better, the gentleman working at roughly 3:30 pm was top notch, he was helpful from the moment we walked in, when my 3 year old decided to have a mini melt down he stepped in and tried to help without ever looking irritated. When he found out we were visiting San Francisco celebrating my son's first birthday he brought him and my daughter some ice cream. We have been in town a couple of days and have been eating out quite a bit and have noticed that service in many restaurants is so rushed and cold, the service we got at Pearls was a breathe of fresh air. I strongly recommend Pearls for their delicious burgers and awesome service, we will definitely eat here again when we visit San Francisco in the future.

A bit overhyped but pretty tasty burgers.    We tried two different burgers based in large part from the Yelp reviews.  In our opinion, the food was good, but either we picked the wrong burgers or they are good, but not great.  My Pearl pick with blue cheese, bacon, and grilled onions was good, cooked to my liking (medium) but a bit on the greasy side and the onions were too large and overpowering.   Wife had the Bulga and the spicy pineapple wasn't too spicy.  Service was friendly and thoughtful.   Cash only is a bit of a drag.  Bacon in the burgers was really pretty good. If I was in the area again and wanted a burger, I wouldn't hesitate to try Pearls again, but compared to Super duper and In and Out, I would be hard pressed to opt for Pearls.
One of the best burgers I have ever had, cooked perfect, thick cut bacon, onion rings were awesome.

I went for an early dinner, aound 4:30, so it was quiet and only two other patrons were there when I came in. I sat at the little table. There were two tables for 4, and a few stools at the counter at the window.
We go here during DreamForce and the burgers are worth the hike. Best bacon western buyer I have ever had. Not fancy but ridiculously good. Awesome onion rings. One of the best burgers ever.
This place is the spot if you're looking for a hamburger spot!!  Loved their Strawberry Milkshake! Oh, and is Cash Only!!!
Great burger joint. Cash only. I had the pesto burger and my husband had their special burger of the day and onion rings. Both were great.

This place is worth a try.  The staff was very friendly.  The place was clean and easy to find.  The food was great.  I had the spicy pineapple burger which had great flavor was cooke perfectly.  The sweet potato fires and onion rights were good.  I would go back.

Make sure to have cash on hand. There is an ATM on hand for a $2 service charge. Burger was good, should have ordered the avocado burger with the habanero sauce. Instead I went with the bula burger. The sweet potato fries and onion rings weren't cooked all the way so they were soggy and tasteless. Not worth it for the price.
The BBQ burger is on fire meaning it's good really good. Also the sweet potato fries is a must. The burgers are big so you have to take big bite don't be shy to indulge in public.
Stopped by here today for lunch!!! To be honest we knew this place was going to be good as there were two police officers in the queue ahead of us, so obviously a good sign!!!

Affordable hamburgers stacked high with delicious and quality toppings. Being a fan of blue cheese burgers, the prized pearl was a win. The bun left to be wanted, as another reviewer mentioned the inclusion of pretzel bun alternatives would be a plus. Also, their garlic chips were delicious but basically merely chips topped with some this fell short of super dupers garlic chips that were coated and bursting with flavor. These few criticisms aside, pearls is well deserving of 5 stars for some unbelievable hamburgers and friendly service. DELICIOUS!
Burgers are Awesome !! We came here for the second time and it was So gooood!

First, let me say that we found this place under the category, "burgers and beer". We walked 15 minutes based on the category and the reviews. Alas, they don't serve beer. After I got over the disappointment of not being able to have a beer with my burger, I ordered the Kobe bleu cheese burger. Juicy enough to fall apart in my hands, it was tasty. Not over the top, but tasty.
Beat burger place ever! They BBQ burger with Avocado is mouth watering. Great service great food! Highly recommended
This is the first time I've been and I took my order to go.
Excellent little burger joint. In addition to beef, they've also got Bison burgers (and chicken too, I think), which I'm always looking for.
I walked into to this restaurant with no expectations. I was just craving for a burger and i yelped this place. I just wanted a simple burger no fancy ass burger just a yummmy delicious burger.

Too much hipe for this joint. I thought it was going to be one of those great hole on the wall, but I got disappointed. The burger has nothing to write back home. I order the pesto burger and it was OK.

This place used to rock. Now- it borderline sucks. The guy at the register was rude and commented on the large quantity of food I ordered for myself. If I gave any fucks, I might be offended. The fries were underdone and the burger lacked the pizazz it used to posses. Not sure what's going on. Maybe living in New York has turned me into a snob. Or maybe this place just lost a few key employees. Big fat bummer.

Excellent San Francisco burger place. High quality, wide selection and excellent customer service are just a few things that make this place great. Fries and rings are especially good. Only drawback is limited seating. Highly recommend.

Yes Sylvia I did order my burger as a lettuce wrap. I got a bacon avacado burger with sweet potatoe fries. My wife got the same thing but hers had cheddar on it. Very good and will be stopping in again!!
I found this place thanks to yelp! It was SO good. The service was great!!
As of late the TenderKnob has been one of my favorite areas to do HH.  There's plenty of places in the area to go to, I suppose, but Redford has won my heart...very deserving of the 4 stars.

Great place for happy hour (all night on Tuesdays!!).  We split a bottle of Syrah, which was tasty and ended up being an amazing deal (50% off!) between two people. We also split the antipasto plate, the giant meatball, and the tuna tacos.  My only gripe is that I would have preferred the anti-pasto plate to come out first (it came out last...) and it was seriously underwhelming (large but the charcuterie was mehhhhh and the accompaniments were just OK). The meatball on the other hand was DELICIOUSSSSS and we soaked up all of the sauce with the extra bread.  The tuna tacos were very good as well, nice amount of heat.
Yelp was spot on.  This spot is close to the trendy Union Square and was just as wonderful as the reviews promised.

I wish this was around when I was living in SF years ago. Honestly I never ventured to the Tenderloin area when I was here in the past due to safety concerns. I was surprised how popular and fun but safer this area is. Redford was the highlight of the Friday evening I was here.

Wanted to checkout a new spot in the neighborhood and Redford was a nice surprise.  Ambiance is great and perfect spot to grab a drink, appetizers or full blown dinner.  They have Happy Hour all day Tuesdays and the menu if perfect.  I ordered the deviled eggs, Mac cheese and the Bratwurst Board.  Also, if you like a good Moscow Mule here's your place.
I hesitate to write this review - because I don't want to give away my new favorite after work spot!

Excellent attentive service and fantastic food at reasonable prices. Favorites in our party included fried pickles, deviled eggs, spaghetti with meatball, and burrata and fig with chicken added. Mac n cheese was not well liked but everything else was perfect.

This place is basically fucking Applebees. Its very generic lookong inside, sporting the same brass/wood look as every other bar in SF now. The food/drink is overpriced/mediocre and the clone sheeple that patronize this place all seem to be the dbag tech crowd, content to listen to top 40 bullshit, yammering about vesting schedules and tech crap that even people in the industry dont want to hear. If hanging out in a TGIF filled with tech bros and 3 semi attractive women is your thing you'll love this shithole.
Spent an amazing birthday night here with friends. Was able to reserve a tiny table but we made it work. The food was incredible. Deviled eggs, Burrata, charcuterie, pizza etc.

We decided on this restaurant because of the ratings and reviews and because it was near our hotel. Boy are we happy we went there! The atmosphere is amazing and the food is delicious! This would definitely become a staple if I lived in SF.

Came here with a big group and was highly impressed. Cozy interior, good food (liked the pizza), and a very patient staff who politely put up with our drunken party with smiles on their faces. Someone else in my party said bottles of wine are half off if you get there early. Great bar!
Possibly THE BEST place for happy hour in San Francisco!!!

We stumbled upon Redford accidentally for happy hour because Rye across the street wasn't yet opened.  Redford was a great experience.  We sat at the bar and it was good that we got there early because it got crowded pretty fast.

Loved this place! We had a huge party that came in staggered groups and our waiter remembered everything. He even suggested drink alterations to suit our tastes. Great experience, fun bar, good food, no bill mixups.

Ate and drank here shortly after they opened. Great value-- you get lots of food for what you pay, a real rarity in SF. For a bar of its size, it has a weirdly limited draft beer selection. For quality of food and drink, it's really more of a three-star for me-- the tots are great (always, but how do you mess up tots?) and the salad was quite good, too, but the pizza seemed like something I could make in the microwave at home. What pushed me into four-star territory overall, though, was the tremendously good service we had there. Our waitress was super friendly and prompt with taking orders and bringing food and drink. It's also a festive scene and a good place to watch sports.
We went for happy hour before dinner, since I was craving some bourbon-based mixed drink.
I rolled over to Robert Redford's for some happy hour. Some kid smoking outside called it Redford. The sign above read REDFORD in red letters.
Great spot for happy hour because the drinks are good and there is enough space to spread out. Just wish there were a few healthier options on the menu...

Great upstairs area-their is a large back section good for a group, a few four tops scattered and a couple in front of the bar. I like the easy access to the bar and feels a little more intimate despite the close quarters.
Pretty good food, lots of different options.   Nice drink menu.   Cool decor.    Overall a pretty stand up place!

Spent the weekend in San Fran for a friends wedding and glad to have come across the Redford! This was a great spot for late night drinks after a long flight to the city. The atmosphere is casual and the service was outstanding. The GM spent time chatting with us and was there to take care of our table. Definitely a place worth checking out if you are visiting from out of town and are looking for a good spot to sit with friends and have a beer.

1st time I walked out of a bar. Service was horrible, wait there was no service! Bartender paid no attention to his guests and it was a slow Sunday night. Had no greeting when I walked in. The bartender didn't seem to care who was at his bar. I live around the corner and just moved to the area, this place just lost a potential regular who also Bartends and knows how the service industry works. Sorry Redford you're nothing but a code red.
Redford is my home away from home. You can bring your co workers, parents, best friend, tinder date whatever floats your boat and have a guaranteed good time.
This bar restaurant was a nice place for me to go with my family on vacation. My 19-year-old son was allowed in to eat. The wait staff was friendly and helpful.
Redford, encapsulated in haiku:

Absolutely a great place! After having an awful experience at another bar, I decided to move my going away party to this bar. The bouncer at the door was incredibly friendly and thanked us for coming in and the bartenders made great drinks. I really wish I had found this place beforehand. All of my friends had a wonderful time and are planning to come back...thank you Redford for saving my going away party!
Excellent ambiance, awesome venue.

So not only do they make a great rye old fashioned, but when I had a charge on my card that seemed out of place they literally went back in their records and sent me the receipt.  Kudos to the amazing customer service and my apologies for the mistake!

Randomly stumbled into Redford a few months ago...lucky for us (Papi & I) they were celebrating their one year anniversary of being open. It was such a treat! We had the opportunity to sample a few of the items on their food menu (my favorite being their deviled eggs and pork belly wrap).

Food was good, Service only okay. No hostess so had to hover arround a table that already had it's check for 20 minutes waiting to snag it as soon as they decided to leave. Then were promptly asked to move to a smaller table as soon as one came available. Guess what, one wasn't available when we were asked to move! We were suspect when the waitress didn't write down our order and messed up repeating them back to us. Of course, two of the three drinks missing, one of the sides was wrong, and when corrected showed up 10 minutes after the entrees. But hey, at least she was having a blast chatting it up with a buddy who came in to drink at the bar... doubt we'll return, certainly won't recommend.
Stopped in for Wednesday happy hour, and my only regret is that I didn't do so sooner!
We popped in here for a quick bite before a reservation as a nearby whiskey bar.
Super legit bar.

I was actually fairly impressed with this place. It was located next door to the apartment we were renting for the weekend and was super convenient in our search for some Ketel One. We walked in and grabbed the first open bar seats and proceeded to order.

What a gem in an unsuspecting location....great cocktails, great atmosphere, great service.  Basil gimlet and orange blossom are two fantastic cocktails - Scottie at the bar knows how to make them right.

BEWARE of the whiskey plank. Although it sounds like a GREAT idea at first. A wooden plank with 4 large shots of whiskey - who would say no? They usually pour it with their house made whiskey, it's infused with fruit juices or w/e but it can get pretty diluted. If you're really just looking for something to get the job done, you can ask for the plank with any of the whiskeys on shelf.
Love this classic American style bar and restaurant.  I love the chicken pot pie and all of the flatbreads.
Cucumber gimlet, cheese plate, mac n cheese pretty delicious.
Love coming here on Tues for HH all night.
Just had their vegetarian tofu yellow curry with brown rice tonight! Sooooo delicious! Wish I took a pic but we all dug in too quickly.
Love the community table vibe! Each dish was excellent! Especially loved the coconut soup!
Garlic & Pepper Wabbit, Garlic & Ginger Fried Rice... Koong Chu-Chee (raw Prawns in lemon juice, garlic, ginger n Chilis)

The food was very unique.  I had the frog and could have definitely just snacked on that all night.  The seating was kind of annoying since we had to sit very close to people in bench style seating.  It was really busy when we got there, but it died out almost immediately as we were finishing our meal.  There were a lot of unique foods on the menu, and I would go back to try them.

Awesome. Great meal! Came here on a Friday night after a few drinks and was very impressed by the food. Very authentic Thai restaurant. A few wines and beers to choose from, but the main event here is definitely the food. We shared a bunch of dishes: fried tofu, chicken skewers, Papaya salad, chicken pad thai, chicken thai basil and 2 types of  pork spear ribs. I have to say that everything was delicious and very flavorful and I'd love to come back! You can easily walk by the place and not think much of it, but looks can be deceiving and I'm telling you to go in and give it a shot.

I had the pad kee mao noodle dish, which is pork 2 ways over ramen-like noodles. The dish surprised me in its simplicity (no colored sauce) and pleasant flavors/textures. I initially thought there might be too many noodles, but it was the perfect noodle to pork/veggie/peanut/onion ratio. My wine was also very nice, as were all the staff. This is the first Thai restaurant I've been to where no wholesale sauce was used and the dish seemed like something I'd eat in a modern/urban Thai home. In comparison, much, much better than SPICE in NYC.
Authentic thai food, mostly and pretty tasty too. Make a reservation cause they're always busy.

Really delicious Thai food.  The food quality was also good as well. This is a great find in the neighborhood and in a good location in the Mission. My favorite thai place in the city. Very good quality food.

Really nothing I can say that doesn't involve "yum nom nom noms" about this place. I always get the pad see ew with beef here because its my favorite thing to eat and it never disappoints. I've tried some of the other "more exotic" things that they offer on the menu (which is actually pretty extensive and more exotic than I expected as well) such as the alligator and the rabbit, but I always come back to the simple things. Most dishes are about $10.

Loved it...not in a great area but once you are in it is great. Fun place. Excellent food. Had garlic frog, chicken satay, yellow curry and red curry with prawn (a la carte). Service was good and with wine x 1 glass we spent $60 and ate well.
Delicious Thai food. Some items were great, some we would not order again. For example, our ribs were too tough. But overall very good.

It was a shot in the dark, but a culinary bull's eye. A friendly patron recommended the Pad Kee Mow noodle dish with flat pan fried noodles. We got it with beef and it's the definition of comfort food. We also ordered the pork belly with basil, Pad...Krow...Mob. Delicious! A bit heavy of a meal when ordered together. Dinner and drinks for two adults for under $50 in Hayes Valley...not bad at all!

I don't know, I wasn't sold. I was expecting way more quality and oomph, I guess. The portion sizes were okay, but I didn't like either red or green curry. Veggies with peanut sauce were great though. I think I'd need to come back during dinner and try their exotic meats before making a final decision on this place.

Too spicy for me, but I still torture myself to eat here just because their dishes are authentic and great! I always order the crocodile, rabbit, boar dish. I mean if you are just going to order the conservative stuff, no need to go here and wait in the line right?
Hands down some of the best Thai food I've had. I had the Pad Woon Sen and pork balls and they were delicious!
Stick with chicken and Sake. it can get any better than that. The price is decent and the food is very good.
Really delicious Thai food.  Everything that is not "white washed" is good, and pretty authentic.

We waited about 30 minutes to get a table but it was well worth the wait. The service was by far the best I've ever had. The food was delish. I love hot tea, and most restaurants give you one cup and thats it.. This place refilled my tea without me asking about 4 times. As soon as we put down our cups it was refilled instantaneously. I would wait an hour for a restaurant with such great food and service.
Papaya shrimp salad does not disappoint!! We got the pad Thai and Tom yum soup as well

Terrible customer service, too hot inside, not enough room on the tables for all the plates and food and kept getting bumped while I sat by the wait staff. Just terrible. Food is not very authentic either.
Such cool decor -- trendy community table in the middle, writing and quotes on the walls.

Got sick after eating here. It must have been the terrible fried rabbit special, all bones and nary a meat. Or, was it the Tom yum? Squirming in my seat at the opera after the meal was a nightmare. Can't believe at all the favorable reviews.

We waited for more than 1.5hrs, but the wait wasn't worth it. It was like any other thai restaurant, but with tiny tiny stools where we had to squeeze and huddle. The portions and the menu options are plenty, but for the wait. Don't even think of going here without a reservation.

A surprisingly filling Thai restaurant that completely obliterated my past experiences of mediocre Thai food. Great lunch special with the appreciated option of brown rice. Rich flavors without being too salty. All around delectable with a classy yet laid back Ambience.
GREAT LAST MINUTE DATE NIGHT PLACE!!!!
I heard from a friend that if I wanted legit Thai food, this was the place to go.
Look... I requested a big catering order to be delivered at 11:30.. Not 12... Not 12:15... 11:30pm.
This place has amazing Pad Kee Mao (aka drunken noodles) and Red Curry! Even their spring rolls are as fresh as they come. Would definitely recommend it to new comers if they need assurance.

I had never eaten true Thai cuisine before but Lers Ros Thai came highly recommended by a friend who lives in San Francisco who said it's some of the best Thai food he's ever had anywhere in the world. Needless to say, Lers Ros Thai had a lot to live up to. On a Sunday night the place was packed, with those waiting to get seats standing awkwardly at the front of the restaurant near the door. Just hope that when you are seated you don't get a table near the door because these waiting people will be literally standing right next to you while you dine. We ordered two appetizers and two main dishes to split among two of us. The Koh Moo Yang, with its grilled slices of pork shoulder was so tender and was perfect when dipped in the chili and rice powder sauce. The Nuer Tod (fried sun-dried beef) was delicious. Though the restaurant was busy our waitress was very attentive and pleasant. If you're looking for authentic Thai food in San Francisco, definitely give Lers Ros Thai a taste.

Consistently good and better than any Thai restaurant in the area. Been to the Hayes Valley and Larkin St locations, think I like this one more. But I'm bias as a local. You can feed 2 for $20, or share plates family style. Wait staff is always friendly and accommodating, even when you come for take out. Get the fried chicken over garlic rice and pad Thai, which is not too greasy and very tasty with good shrimps in it. Usually busy for dinner but you could get in without a reservation, though you're safer if you make one.

I am thoroughly confused as to why this place is so highly rated. Maybe I got the wrong items, but typically I order two basic dishes when trying a new Thai restaurant (and explore from there). I got the papaya salad with blue crab and my first bite was filled with shell. The crab was raw as well, which was not what I had expected I guess. The shrimp pad thai lacked flavor and the shrimp still had the mud veins in it. Needless to say, I was not impressed and will not go back.

My friend and I were happy to find a chill place open late. I don't eat Thai often and this was her first time. We were able to find fresh, authentic tasting dishes that we could identify with, and the late night crew was attentive and polite.
I'm so confused, last time I went to lers ros and ate there it was really good.. But this time we ordered for delivery and it was disappointing.
excellent food and the place was really nice.!! The only thing i did not like about it is the waiters dont speak english and was hard to explain what i want !!!!
Some of the best Thai food I've EVER had!

These guys went above and beyond when it really counted. When I sat down, I have to admit I was a little underwhelmed by the service. They did not seem to have communication among the staff and so we had three different people ask us if we wanted more beer, but didn't get a single one until about fifteen minutes later, and then there was still a mistake with the number of beers actually purchased.

Went to dinner with some family friends, and overall it was a really great place!  We got there without a reservation not realizing how popular the place was, but we were seated in about 15 minutes and the staff at the bar was very nice in the wait time.  I got the pad thai with chicken, which was everything I hoped it would be.  My boyfriend originally ordered a meal with catfish, not realizing that the fish had not been deboned.  We felt bad but after taking a few bites and having small bones poke into his cheek, he asked if they could replace it with red curry instead.  The staff was incredibly nice about it, and he was extremely pleased with the curry.  The staff were very attentive, and overall we had a great night out!

My friend and I ordered two dishes to share...the food brought out to us was neither of the dishes we ordered. So, service certainly needs improvement as many others have noted. However, the food we were brought was so incredibly delicious we didn't care. The Tom Kha Gai was absolutely amazing, I'm still drooling from it!!

The Tom Kha Kai soup was really good and hit the spot for me.. esp on a cold SF day. It seemed like a Olive Garden's endless soup deal!!! We split it amongst just two of us, and had 3 bowls each and it didn't even look like we made a dent! Fantastic! I love the little hot pot concocotion that it was in! The Rad Nah was good, a bit salty and didn't have enough noodle to pork ratio. The bbq chicken and chili sauce was good but overdone. Customer service was great!
Yummmmmmmmmmm
The Andouille Organic Sausage was incredibly delicious. Thank you for toasting the bun! Can't wait to try out other options on the menu! Will be back again soon!

Mango's is a good, small sandwich shop close to Union Square.  I enjoyed my chicken guacamole sandwich when I had lunch here with a friend who works nearby.  The owner was very friendly and clearly remembered my friend from when he'd come in the past.  She even gave us a couple freshly-made cookies on the house when we finished our sandwiches.  I'll stop in again if I ever pass by around lunchtime.
Good sandwiches. Tried the California and the chipotle. Both were good but the California was better. A bit more expensive then you would think for a sandwich but I think that is common in San Fran.
Overpriced given the quality, and the lady has a really bad attitude!

Absolutely love this spot!  I go here to grab a sandwich for lunch quite often, as it's just around the corner from the office.  The owner is very sweet, and the sandwiches are fantastic.  It's surprisingly difficult to get solid deli sandwiches in SF, and this place delivers.
If you have forever the panini's are big and tasty. The place is very small so you'll be lucky to get a seat.

Ate a late lunch here today with my husband and three kids. The place is very small with only enough seating for 6. Perfect for us!  I had the California panini, which was slightly spicy and very yummy. My daughter loved her Caprese panini. The special was a club sandwich. My husband ordered that and enjoyed it. The boys had bagels and they gobbled them right up. They lady behind the counter was helpful and friendly. We thoroughly enjoyed our lunch at the Mango Cafe.
Booom! Go here if your in San Fran. Amazing food and plenty to choose from. If you want a quick sandwich to go this is your place. Enjoy!

I'm glad I checked Yelp on this one!! After arriving in San Fran from the east coast, I needed someplace to get lunch on my first day in town! I read the reviews of other sandwich places in my close general area and found Mango's. Decided to give it a shot. Normally an avid coffee drinker, I decided to spice things up and get a chai latte (get it?? SPICE things up?? Chai!) and the chipotle panini. Both BLEW. MY. MIND. I'm so glad I checked Yelp before eating out, otherwise I might've missed this place entirely!! Not the place to go if you're in a rush, but the food and the charming woman working there definitely made me feel like I would be back soon if I was staying in town longer than four days. :)

Let me tell you! I was so surprised that this tiny cafe is so great! I didn't even bother going on yelp, I just randomly stopped by on the way to Lands End and I'm glad I did. The nicest lady and man helped me, and she made the best iced green tea latte I've ever had! I have no idea how she made it but it just reminded me of home and being a child. Weird I know. My friends also got the pumpkin chai iced latte and his was delicious as well. I did not realize how famous this little place was until I looked on yelp. Now I wish I had ordered something from their food selection while I was there. Definitely coming back!

One of the reasons why I love yelp. I had a interview across the street but arrived a little early so I figured I'd get a little bite to eat.  First I went to a Mexican food spot next door but didn't look appetizing. So I looked on yelp and found this place.

This place is an absolute gem! The food was fantastic and the service was excellent... A great place to grab a quick bite out of the hustle of the Union Square area. The potato salad was a special highlight and the cheesecake was perfect! Would def go again!
Had a few of the vegan hotdogs and they were a-ok, if you like tofu you'll enjoy these dogs :)

Although pricey at $9.73 with tax, the caprese panini was excellent, the best panini bread i've ever had, light and crisp on the outside yet soft and warm with oil and vinegar on the inside.  Of my walking- distance- from- the- hotel restaurants, this one is the best so far.

Good food prepared by very friendly staff, the Mango Cafe is a very pleasant experience. My sandwich was prepared right there, and it was delicious. It has a very small dine-in section, but is within walking distance of many hotels. Definitely worth the visit!
Really pleasant place to stop and have a tea/coffee drink or lunch.

Fantastic sandwich shop! This is a small little shop with a great menu. We stopped in for lunch and had the Baja sandwich with pastrami and the California Panini with side salads. We had the brussel sprout kale salad and the  brussel sprout with corn salad. All choices were super delicious!! In my opinion, the Baja sandwich was one the most amazing sandwiches I have ever had. Highly recommend trying it!  The service was very friendly, and the small shop was very comfortable and relaxing.
Seriously delicious paninis and chai latte.  The owner was very friendly and warm.  Go visit her :)
I used to live in Cuba when I was a gun runner/interior designer. Not since then have I had such a delicious sandwich.

This is my favorite place to go in San Francisco for amazing espresso drinks & homemade deli, baked goodies & the best fresh grilled panini sandwiches. Very reasonably priced, high quality, great service, & a yummy variety of delicious flavors! Also, the owner is so warm & friendly I love coming here! :)

Mamgo"s cafe has a "small town deli vide"  located btw union square and the tenderloin. They have a limited but nice selection of cold pasta salads, coffees, panini"s. I opted for a classic: chicken salad on whole wheat. It was very nice, fresh with crisp lettuce. I shall return some day!!!
I can't believe that I have been getting my nails done right next door for almost a year and it never stepped into this café before today.
What a gem in the middle of the madness! Best chai I've ever had. The owner is such a sweetheart and I'll defiantly be back.
Had a wonderful chipotle chicken panini here on a break from a conference. Highly recommended for a quick, quality meal in a friendly atmosphere.

This is a great little sandwich shop! The decor is very quaint and charming. The female working the sandwich counter could not have been more pleasant. There is a great variety of sandwiches to include hot and cold, salads, and sides to include pasta salads and deviled eggs. The prices are very reasonable for a sandwich that is made with more care than you'll find at a big chain, especially the chain that encourages you to "eat fresh." The only negative I can claim is the turkey used on my sandwich was a pre-packaged brand I've seen at Safeway. This was only a negative because I saw her slice my roast beef fresh. I'm hoping this is just an off thing and that they were out of turkey breast which caused them to resort to pre-packaged product. In any event, it was a great sandwich and will be going back for sure when I'm working in the area.

Such a cute and tiny place! The owner is very sweet and was doing everything her self! My husband and I had panini's and they were very good! The California was spicy but SO good! The watermelon ice tea is a MUST! It was delicious!! There are only 3 tiny tables in the place so it's probably better to just pick up food to go. But it is worth it for sure!  I am pretty sure it was cash only so remember that!

This is a little hole in the wall coffee shop/cafe that I found walking around my hotel. The owner is the nicest lady and she makes all the sandwiches right there in front of you. I ordered the caprese panini and it was so good. Perfectly crisp on the outside and melt in your mouth fresh gooey goodness on the inside. All the ingredients are very fresh and everything is made of love.

An unexpected treat near Union Square- we just popped in looking for a cup of coffee which was great.  Also had a nutella croissant which was a sweet surprise.  My partner also had a deviled egg- random, but just what he was looking for, and tasty, he said.  Great place to stop in.
Love this place!  Their coffee is amazing I'm addicted to their mocha latte.  The pumpkin chai is really good too.
good sandwiches and watermelon iced tea!
Chicken Panini was excellent and very filling, latte was excellent, and the owners are very, very friendly. Definitely going to go there again for lunch.

California Chicken Panini exploded in my mouth and made me feel like I was in one of those Carls Jr. TV ads where they spill it all over themselves but it looks totally hot and they don't care because its heaven.
Mango's is a tiny - and I mean tiny - deli within walking distance of Union Square. I found the food to be OK, but not worthy of some of the 5-star reviews I've seen on Yelp.
