unfortunately, i did not have a good experience here.  we ordered 2 sandwiches and a box of coconut water. the sandwiches were tasty- we had the chicken chipotle and california chicken.  the red pepper aioli is SUPER spicy and i think she put way too much of it on the sandwich, but otherwise they were pretty good and pretty sizeable.  the coconut water tasted kind of sour which was a total bummer and service is SO SLOW.
Really like the food here! Only one person behind the counter so it was slow but worth the wait.
looks like they are closed...
Best coffee in town , Angelica is just the nicest person on the planet. Oh and she has the best homemade cookies and delicious sandwiches.

found this place while staying at the Serrano around the corner. i was looking for a patisserie, croissants, bagels, etc. but this place wored just fine..(plus i couldnt walk down Ellis St. any longer). A very cute place and vey clean. All her pastries are made on site, zucchini loafs, cranberry orange loafs and muffins, fresh, moist, de-lish..! Plus, she made me a great cafe au lait..=)
Excellent paninis at a reasonable price. Currently my favorite lunch spot in the area.
My favorite place to stop for a soy chai in the entire city.
Girlfriend and I both needed the perfect hangover cure while visiting SF.

Went here to get the wonton noodle to go. Got the thick noodle and it was delicious. Will definitely come back. The wonton noodle comes with 5 wonton, 3 shrimp, 2 slices of fish cakes, and plenty of chicken and pork. It's a lot of food for $8. Great food. Great price. They also separate out the soup and the noodle if you order to go. So it's perfect.

I love Hai Ky Mi Gia noodle house! Been eating here since my playing hooky High School days. Love that it is a family own business that last this long. It sure shows small business can still run strong and out beat big cooperations. Hai Ky is just a simple noodle restaurant that just serve noodles Trieu Chau style. If you think all those Ramen Houses which pops up every week is all the rage! You should come to Hai Ky Mi Gia and eat your first noodle bowl of soup. After all, they are the King of Noodles!
I love this place. Quick service, good food, great price.
I've been lucky enough to be eating here for at least 20 years, and now my kids are luckier than I enjoying this establishment younger than when I started.

We were quite undecided as to what to order. The manager was very friendly and could tell we had questions. I ordered the house dish with a mix of thick rice noodles and thin egg noodles. My wife had the braised duck leg which just fell off the bone. The soup broth was super hot and tasty. This was a hearty dish to start the morning.

I heard of this place through the recommendation of an old man who claimed that these were the best noodles that he has ever had. Well one day I was trying to hit up "Turtle Tower" when I was in the area but it was CLOSED. Dang, I wanted me some chicken pho but Turtle Tower wasn't having none of that. I saw this place around the corner and remembered the recommendation from that old man.. and I thought to myself "guess I will try this place out..."
My favorite noodle place in San Francisco!
The place to go in the Tenderloin for noodle soup - ample portions, inexpensive, tasty. Get the braised duck leg with the soup!

I've been eating at Hai Ky Mi Gia a Chinese/Vietnamese restaurant for about 20 years. Their Roasted Duck Noodle/Wonton Soup is one of the most comforting, delicious soups I know. The stock is complex and so satisfying and that moist duck leg the crowning glory.
3.5 stars

The perfect hangover cure or Sunday morning ritual: braised duck leg soup with egg noodles and a glass of house made soymilk! The noodles are always cooked just right, slightly chewy. Sometimes I add wontons to my bowl of soup, because why not? The duck leg is fall-off-the-bone tender, but you can tell they make a batch ahead of time since it's usually cold when they serve it. You can choose whatever noodles you want with your soup, but I usually opt for the fat egg noodles.

Fantastic bahn mi beef noodle dish. A friend recommended THICK, but I can't imagine the THIN lagging too far behind. My favorite part of this particular dish was the texture. It was earthy- not the typical smooth feel one usually experiences with noodles. No, this dish embodied a rugged, palatable, unique sensation that was utterly delightful. Another pro was that the subtle nuttiness flavor. Initially I was frightened I had put something resembling mediocre pad Thai in my mouth. Far from it.

There was about a 20 minute wait when I came for lunch on a Sunday afternoon.  I was looking forward to the braised duck leg this place is known for, but was quickly let down when they said they were sold out of this dish.  I didn't even have a backup plan and my companion sent the waitress away before I could hastily order the seafood egg noodle soup and the chicken with egg noodle.
Fast service, great noodles and awesomely friendly staff. All the aunties are really nice and remember what you usually order and how you like it. Very sweet.
Extremely disappointing. I was surprised it was so busy at 10:30 in the morning, which was a weird time to go to begin with...

In my new year reso back in jan, I've made it a point to yelp more as my own personal log  of all the different new places I've tried. I must admit, I've failed badly!!!!! Think I yelped about 1/3 of the places down.... Sf life there ain't no time to yelp. It's hard enough to make time to sleep as is.
Overall the best noodle place in SF. I just love the hai key special dry with thin egg noodles. Perfect with a Vietnamese lemon soda
If you like soupy noodles, pho-get all of the pho shops down the street--this is the real deal.
Awesome.  One of favorite places in the city.  Braised duck leg with the egg noodles is the way to go.
Braised Duck Leg w/ thin noodles (wet)

I ordered the duck wonton with egg noodles. The broth was flavorful! My order came in fast and the service friendly enough. The ambiance was perfect for me. If you want a place with authentic cuisine, this is the place.

Best deal in town. Fast, cheap, and delicious. This is my go to spot when I got my zipperheads in town. They all think Little Saigon in OC and SJ are the one. Nuh uh mom. Here in SF's Little Saigon, you can get the best duck noodle soup around and watch a guy shoot up. Filll your belly and your soul with the thought that, "it could be worse"

The duck noodle soup is delicious! Clearly the broth is the star of the soup, but every element makes this dish great. The duck soup is completely customizable - I recommend the thick rice noodles. The egg noodles (thick or thin) are also great, but I like the rice noodles better. Also, you can ask for the soup separately. I do agree with peoples' reviews below that the braised duck leg is a little dry, but it's a great portion for the price.

This is one of them staple places where you come, spend a little and eat some delicious noodle. I love the dry thick noodle with shrimp and innards toppings. It is especially good if you smother it with the house made chili, vinegar and Sriracha. Such simple pleasure only cost you 9 dollars. Line might be long but it goes quickly. Oh and remember to bring cash!

I wanted to try this place Bc my friend has been raving how good the egg noodles w braised duck is sooooo good here.  So, I ordered the thick egg noodles w braised duck meat as my friend's recommended.  I honestly thought the only thing that was good was the noodles.  The broth was too salty for my taste and the meat was dry and hard.  Not the type of place I would drive for one hour and pay money for parking.
Had the duck leg noodle with wontons. Both the wontons and duck leg left something to be desired. The duck was dry and flavorless. The wontons were not made with quality meat.

Best noodle place in the tenderloin. Skip the braise duck leg BS and just get straight up wonton noodle soup with flat rice noodles. Plenty of proper sized wontons with seafood and pork mix ins. I love it here!
Hai Ky Won Ton Egg Noodle (Dry) with Soup on the side.
Came here with my brother after the Pride Parade and the service was quick and efficient. The lady was both courteous and helpful
Really nice. Different that the usual pho bo house. Bowls are smaller, have more delicate flavors - especially fried shallot - and the noodles are lighter. A really nice change.

Experienced another "why did it take me this long to come here?!" moment while getting lunch with Cindy A last weekend. But better late than never, and hoorah for finally crossing this off my list (and adding it to another)! The two of us ended up sharing the:

Always looking for adventure in the TL, my coworker and I hunkered down in this promising little noodle joint. We walked in to a bustling and noisy and jam packed dining area that was huge for this part of town. The almost 100% Chinese patrons was a def good sign.

I'm always down for a bowl of fishball noodles - this place does a really good job of it and the coffee shop ambience reminded me of local coffee shops back home in Singapore. Tip: order your noodles dry (it comes with a side of soup) and squirt some of the tomato sauce in and mix them up!

Okay let me start off by saying this is in one of the worst parts of SF. Dangerous and accidents all around. Bloody accidents with alot of homeless people lurking around. Anyway, growing up in the city, it did not phase me. I've wanted to try this place for almost a year now. But could never get there because they close at 6pm. This time we got there by 5:30pm. Only because we could not find parking near the embarcadero. We got there and go seated right away by the owner/manager. Anyway, we both knew we wanted the duck leg braised wonton noodles. The marinated veggies came out first. It comes free with any meal you order. The vegetables were crunchy and sweet. Nothing like the free veggies you get from Koi Palace that are soggy. Anyway, when it came out the braised duck leg was moist and the noodles were crunchy. You could tell that the wontons were fresh. I was SO happy after a long day at work. It was SO good. The only thing I forgot to tell them was NO cilantro on my food. I made the exception by moving it to the side. It was DELISHUSH! Afterwards we talked to the owner she said that the location on Noriega has nothing to do with their restaurant. It's an ex employee trying to copy them. So now I know not to bother with the so called sister restaurant on Noriega. Give it a try! But this place opens at 8am-6pm on weekdays. The owner told us to go on the weekend but you know we stay in our neighborhood on the weekends.

This place is too overrated.  I gave it a try few years ago but was disappointed.  Tried again this time and still disappointed.  I rather walk over to turtle tower and enjoy a nice bowl of noodle soup.  Will never be back again.

This is one of my favorite noodle soup restaurants in the city. I came here initially because of the braised duck leg wonton noodle soup and really liked it, but the duck is a little heavy for lunchtime.

Probably one of the best food places Ive been to in a while. My friend brought me here for the first time and told me that he orders "The Vivian", and I ended up ordering too and it was one of the most amazing dishes Ive had in a really long time. It was named after a girl who would go there a lot so they named it after her. It consists of 2 different noodles, ground beef, wontons, bean sprouts, cilantro, and the soup broth on the side; IT IS DELICIOUS. Service is good, they treat you nice, fill up your water, food comes out fast. They only take cash but it's totally worth taking out some cash to come to this place, you wont regret it!

Walked in for lunch the other day because i was told great things. the food was very delicious and flavorful but i felt like i was eating noodles drenched in oil. After the meal i felt sick and as if i just went to an all you can eat fried chicken joint when all i had was a bowl of noodle soup...
Anyone out here a gaginang?
Great sushi. Kind of chaotic and very bar-like, but is expected for a late night eatery. Good place to eat if you don't mind the smell of booze and hot musky atmosphere.

Such a busy little restaurant! The long wait time was totally worth it. The sushi absolutely fresh and tasted amazing. We took the recommendation of our server and got the 49er roll... greatest.decision.ever! One of the best rolls I have ever eaten... so definitely a winner!

This place is not your usual sushi bar. Great music playing immediately upon entering. Staff are friendly and attentive. They have Asahi, Sapporo and Ryoko's beer on tap. I went specifically to have Asahi but next time will definitely have the Ryoko's draft.
My friend had his birthday dinner here a couple of weeks ago. It's one of his favorite places.
Sushi was good. Somewhat like eating in a cobalt blue underground dive bar...but i heard politicians eat here? What? There was a wait...I'm not a sushi buff.
Ok, seriously this is probably one of the coolest sushi places in SF.  Why?  Because who else has a DJ spinning while you eat dinner!?!  Kendrick Lamar!?  I mean...

Ahhh. Pretty close to a full satisfaction. Just a preamble: we went there and the wait was more than an hour. We put our names on the list, walked to another place, had sushi, and on the way back we just decided to swing by to taste some fish here if our name was still on the list. And as soon as we walked downstairs our name was called and we sat at the bar.

Don't go! Luckily I came early and didn't have to wait, but hearing the quoted times people are waiting for, I would be pissed. It smells like moldy wet towels inside. We spent half of our dinner swatting away flies.... So gross. Sushi was ok, on the cheaper side but cuz portions are not big. Wouldn't come back. Ever.

Can I give extra stars?? This place is amazing!!! The most fresh sashimi I've ever had.. Uni and hotate are a must try. however, expect a long wait on date nights (Fridays and saturdays)...overall this place is officially my most favorite sushi restaurant in the city

What a great little place. You would probably never see it or think of walking in there but its worth the visit. Fast service, amazing fresh fish, fair pricing. My husband and I visited SF from LA where we know what GOOD sushi is and I must say this place didn't disappointed us. Go there while in SF you wont regret it.

AHHH-MAZING!  Yum yum and oh did I mention... YUM?!  Ryoko is definitely a must go-to place if you are desiring some of the freshest fish and sea creature meat out there!  Definitely come early right when the door opens as there is always a line out the block and around the corner!  We got there 5 min before the rope drop opening on a Saturday night, and there was already a good 20 people waiting outside.  Come ready to drink, eat, and fest!
So... 2 stars are for the good sushi, BUT, after taking our order the waitress (accidentally) BROKE my iPhone, totally smashed it.
Good food, good drinks. Open late.
I don't know how this place has 4 stars.  3 star is generous enough!
Delicious beautiful fresh fish, open really late & there's a dj spinning hip hop on the weekends. Not to mention the owner is super nice!

Ryoku's blows every other local sushi place out of the water. While the wait can be long, it's worth it. I've gotten several of the sushi and nigiri platters here, and haven't been disappointed - it's the only sushi place since coming back from Japan that I felt compared to the cuts of fish I had there. My only wish is that they had take-out!

Wow! At a conference this week and had a taste for Sushi. Happened upon this place and at first glance was a bit concerned but once inside the place was packed with a 40 min wait. sunday evening at 8:30 so the place had to be good. Had a couple of rolls one with peanut butter and jalapeno's with some Fatty Tuna on top...Outstanding. All around great vibe and fantastic sushi.
By far one of the worst sushi places ever!!!!!!!! I have no idea how this place ranks so high. I've had sushi all over the west coast and this ranks at the bottom, if not THE very bottom.
Good chef(food), cozy little place. Don't care much for the service though. Waited to be seated but pay at counter? Might be a language barrier..

A basement sushi house!! Open late, too. The nigiri was fresh and tasty, albeit with seemingly elevated pricing, but the rolls, also fresh and delicious are reasonably priced. The atmosphere is dark though inviting, and the crowd lively and friendly, as are the servers and chefs. It's definitely a gem of a sushi restaurant.

If you're starving and just happen to be in the area, this isn't the place for you. The wait time is super long and you will be forced to wait awkwardly on a flight of stairs, trying not to make eye contact with all the food that is passing by.
great place, the wait was really long but it was well worth it :)
I'm a huge sushi fan - but this is by far the best sushi I have ever had. The uni and ikura in particular were amazing.
Quick service, great sushi that's very reasonably priced. Went on a Saturday at 11:30 pm when they had a DJ so it was really loud.  Had the mochi for dessert and it was perfect!

Me and my wife decided to check out this little sushi bar because of all the good reviews we saw on yelp. Overall it was above average but nothing to spectacular. The restaurant reminded me of the sushi restaurants I see on tv because of the small and eclectic area. We were somewhat disappointed in the food because The sushi and sashimi we ordered was just okay, nothing spectacular like the reviews suggested.

Ryoko's regularly draws a long line out the door, so come right at opening time if you want to be seated immediately (worked for us on a Friday night). I'm not sure why it has rave reviews, because it's not too much of a step up from any other Japanese restaurant in SF. The plates are mostly tapas-style, so you'll be getting less for your money than anticipated.

The HOT TUNA roll was awesome, but don't order the "Jumping Tuna" as I has to wait 30 more minutes to get and our meal was done already. The "Jumping Tuna" had a bad fish taste too (not a fan) :( . Beyond the bad experience with the "Jumping Tuna" roll I thought the overall experience was quite good.

Searched for sushi on Yelp near Union Square. My fellow Yelpers did not steer my wrong. Super fresh, phenomenal sushi. Had sashimi, a few rolls, soft shell crab.  The place is super busy.  Service isn't the best because it's so busy, but the quality of the sushi makes up for it. Expect a wait, but it's worth it.
average quality sushi. funky ambiance. if i was ever in SF again and hungry at 1 am I would go.....

Never been a fan of sushi but Ryoko's is a really good place. The wait was almost 40min but worth it. The menu had variety and it was all fresh. Service was nice we didn't have to ask for much they took care of us well. Definitely recommended if you're looking for a good sushi place.
Amazing! The best sushi I have ever had.
Great food, great prices, highly recommend!

The sushi itself is pretty decent, wasn't overly impressed compared to what all the five star reviews were calling out. I would say it is on par for the price they are charging. $15 for a pitcher of Asahi was the best bargain for the evening by far.
I adore this place. It's the sushi equivalent of my favorite neighborhood dive bar.

Very spectacular rolls! I got here just before the line got long so there was a short wait to get in (it gets insanely busy even on a weekday dinner night, so try to get here by 630 to beat the crowd!)

Well fucking done! Good food and great hours. Only complaint is that it took an hour to get our check. But I'm going to give benefit of the doubt and say maybe this was just a one time thing because up until the actual check time our servers were really engaged with us.

The host was the one of the most crude people I have ever met. I have never been treated so poorly in my life. I have been on the service industry for over 10 years and this is by far my worst experience.
Most of us have tried hot or cold sake Ryoko's also has Shōchū a Japanese distilled beverage like vodka made from either rice, potato or barley which is best savored straight up or on the rocks.

This is a bar.  An expensive bar.  If you keep that in mind, then it's pretty nice. The food is expensive and in small portions.  The quality of the food is okay.  The music energetic.  The room is painted in ugly blue but I think that's makes it trendy.
I usually get the tamarind prawns but I've never been disappointed by anything I've tried.

I'm surprised this place is almost empty on Sunday night, it is at least 3x cleaner than most vietnamese places in the city, provided that its in the tenderloin and maybe because its right across from Lers Rose. Pho was really good, imperial rolls were ok (maybe 7/10) and glass noodles with crab and shrimp was delicious. This place hits the spot in terms of taste, environment and cleanness. Menu is huge and i'll def go back to try other dishes!
the banh cuon was delicious.
Good Vietnamese food. Prices are average. One thing I disliked about the place is their $10 minimum on cards. I don't get why people do that it is so annoying for clients.
I am not a regular at Vietnamese restaurants, but Four Seasons makes me think I should change my ways.
Overall, I thought this place had very good food.
there was a hair in my banh cuon.

After reading the reviews here, I suggested to try it with a group friends.  We ordered the few "GOOD" dishes that were mentioned on Yelp .. Shaken Beef with Garlic noodle, Banh Cuon, Vermicelli with grilled pork, pho, and some vegetarian dishes.

So you probably figured out from the Tenderloin location that this has nothing to do with the fancy-schmancy hotel on Market Street, the one where Yahoo! CEO Marissa Mayer lives. But this is a surprisingly spotless place for Little Saigon and just far enough away from the hubbub of its cacophonous culinary competition. I happened by it on my way home one evening and caught sight of the cavernous space and white tablecloths. I was a bit hesitant since only three tables were occupied, but a quick look at the Yelp app put me a bit more at ease since the ratings were consistently high. The menu was quite comprehensive with a whole lot of garlic noodle and rice plates. No complaints from me 'cause that's what I was after.
Controversial post to Ha Nam Ninh loyalists (or those that claim they found the best pho @ HNN):
Got the fillet minion plate. Didn't seem like a Vietnamese dish, but it was pretty good. Came with garlic noodles and veggies. 11$. In the tenderloin.
Delicious!! Craving more than the usual traditional pho or bun noodles we decided to try this spot after a shopping session in dwt sf.
Very very fast at serving food. Some wait staff don't speak very good english, so had a tiny communication problem, but the food was good, and it didn't affect my dining experience.

Papaya salad was delcious.We were ultimately looking for a "pho" place however everywhere around only accepted cash. This place accepted credit cards and had very friendly customer service!  Not very authentic but they do serve a little bit of everything.

This restaurant offers both Bun Cha Ha-Noi (Grilled Pork Patties) and Nem Cua Be (Crabmeat Eggroll) USD 10 each for lunch, so I was hopeful to find this to link my dining experience back to the wonderful experience from Bun Cha Ha-noi Nem Cua Be Dac Kim visiting Hanoi.  Both failed to inspire me for that linkage.  The Bun Cha Ha-Noi pork patties were hardened to bite into, the fish sauce was spicier than I like here, I've tasted a more satisfying experience in Oakland.  The Nem Cua Be was different and not very satisfying, the wrapper felt like clinging to my teeth on every bite, the accompanying fish sauce looked like it would be spicier than I would have liked, so I mostly avoided it with the little red flecks floating.  The Vietnamese Iced Coffee was good, but at USD 4 was a bit high.  Chocolate Mousse USD 5, decent tasting, looked like it was one from Smart Food Service.  They totaled the bill incorrectly for my friend's bill.  USD 15 corkage fee.  Credit card minimum USD 10

#25 Shaking Beef & Garlic Noodles ($11) was excellent. Added french fries was odd, but goes well with the beef. Portion on the smaller side, but if you savory the food versus stuffing your face, it will be enough! The Beef was really tender. Wife tried a bit and thought it was oversalted. I, on the other hand, liked it!

It was Labor Day Weekend, and my friend and I were initially looking for a Korean place to eat at. We were disappointed to find that they were closed (boo!), and so after some Philz Coffee and a walk through the interesting neighborhood of the Tenderloin, we decided to stop here to eat.
Quick service, great tasting viet food! We got rare steak pho and BBQ pork imperial roll vermicelli noodles-- both delicious!

Reeaaalllly shady area but the pho is good! My bf and I came on a Sunday night and definitely were a bit creeped out walking here. We live in the south bay, so I definitely wasn't used to the area at all.

Flies flies flies. Flies in my face, flies on the wall, flies trying to get at my plate, flies on my glass. My goodness. I came here to have a meal, not to spend half an hour trying to swat away little pests.  There were 6 persistent flies at our table the whole time. Yuck.  Now onto the food

I went here with my cousin and sister today at around 2 p.m. The decor was cool sorta vintge fancy but a hilariously asian altar thing. Service was....meh. Messed up the first order and ran out of the Banh Cuon (one of the recommended dishes) but the food wasnt bad. I thought it was pretty good actually. But there were FLIES!! They kept on flying around the food! But overall it was alright. When you in the mood for some Viet food, choose Thai if you dont like flies. ..like whut??
YAY I love banh cuon but I usually have to go to Oakland or San Jose to get my fix. But now that I've found a location in SF....Woohooo! I'm screaming for joy!
4.5 STARS

Was here with on August 30. Ordered most of there chef recommendation to try. Was here cuz of the rating on yelp. A little disappointed on the price vs portion. Flavors was ok. It was not bad; but nothing to write home about.
The Vietnamese coffee is the best in the whole wide world.
I will come back here for an actual dinner dish. I only had some appetizers but they were all pretty good!
Hot Pot Catfish Soup - Excellent
Great service, I had number 25, beef and garlic noodles. The flavor of the beef was just AMAZING!!! Go!

Had the wonton and shredded chicken noodle soup (#17D) - really good and hit the spot . Comes with hong kong style thin egg noodles, a nice surprise. Judging by this dish I bet their pho ga is good too. Summer rolls with shrimp was very fresh and the free tea has nice slight herbal tastw (ginseng, dates?). Also attentive service with a smile.
very delicious ...I like the shrimp cake with potatoes and beef garlic noodle ..amazing source ... The best Vietnamese food i never ate b4.cant express how delicious it is

Honey butter ribs with garlic noodles are great and so is the filet mignon with fries. Definitely get the shrimp cakes with sweet potato and summer rolls for appetizers. Also, the tea is pretty caffeinated which I love. Overall, great food and a good vibe.
Delicious!!  There are a lot of options in this area but this place is a must try.  Pho is real good. And not sure anyone else serves bun cha.  Tasty!!
I got one of my friends hooked on bo tai canh (beef carpaccio or raw beef salad) so when she said she wanted to have lunch, I didn't mind at all that she wanted to come back to Four Seasons.
Winter, spring, summer or fall, I LOVE this place!

Brett's new favorite Vietnamese restaurant  - he is hooked on the bo luc lac, which reminds me of the lomo saltado because it has crinkly fries in it.  I like the beef carppacio and crab glass noodles.  Salad with a honey mustard dressing is always on the house, very nice gesture!

I went with co-workers for lunch and am glad I did or I would have missed out. Give it a try. I had a few things that I wouldn't have normally ordered and was pleasantly surprised. Great food and service, nice atmosphere.

Glad I stopped into this place. It's very clean inside, and the staff are all very nice. I ordered the fried rolls, and the beef pho. They brought out hot tea, and a complimentary salad. Everything was delicious. The service was fast and friendly. I will definitely be back.

On a recent visit to my old office, my co-workers decided to come to Four Seasons for lunch since I have never been there.  The restaurant is clean and spacious and the waiters were friendly and attentive during our visit.

Believe it or not, you can find Bun Cha Ha Noi (this is the Northern version of much more popular Grilled Pork Vermicelli - Bun Thit Nuong) at this place! This dish is really really hard to find anywhere in the US. The key difference you can notice is that, with Bun Cha Ha Noi, the grilled pork is put in a bow with dipping sauce and noodles is put separately on a plate (together with other herbs and veggie). The taste is pretty authentic and it really made me feel like I am in Ha Noi. Thanks for bringing this traditional dish into your menu. I would definitely come back just because of this dish.

My vietnamese food adventures in the Tenderloin continue! My buddies and I came to this place after our quest for some dry pho, otherwise known as crack noodles, at Ha Nam Ninh (#25 if you must know!) failed. We wandered listlessly around until we finally came upon Four Season. At this point we didn't care much about what we were going to put in our mouths since we were getting pretty hungry.
Happy hour deals are really good! The chicken quesadilla was A-MAZINNNG!!!!

Always visit this place when on holiday in San Francisco, an excellent old San Francisco Bar, just what you expect and not at all contrived, it just is what it is. Great bar staff, a fab place to have a few drinks and relax. Have also eaten there in the past, bar snacks also good.
The Blanco pizza had become a favorite! Their happy hour (12-6:30pm) is such a great deal. A nice sized gourmet pizza for about $5!
Had the brick burger, it came with good toppings, quality fries (worth the $2 upgrade) and at a good price.
PIZZA!!!

I try to reserve five starts for places that I can confidently say that if you go to that place you will enjoy yourself. With that in mind, this is one of my most confidence five star reviews. I have only been to the Sutter Fly Bar as I frequent this area more so I can't speak to how this transfers over to the other one.

My coworkers and I needed a happy hour, and we realized we hadn't been here in a year!  Our happy hour crew had grown since then, which is why we remembered Fly Bar and how accommodating this place is with large parties.
It wasn't that busy but still very loud.
The shroom pie pizza and baked Brie are filling, yummy appetizers! Love the atmosphere of this place because it's cozy and vibrant even though it's a bar.
Heart you Fly. Heart your happy hour pizzas even more. You changed your menu recently but you still have my heart.
Just the two of us, looking for a late night spot to enjoy a beer and catch up.
Happy hour pizzas, sangria, and shuffleboard are a winning combination.
An absolute must for a late night meal!
The food was great, the atmosphere was awesome and the price was nothing to complain about! Overall great place!
Came here because our Hotel was nearby. Prices were very fair and the pizzas very tasty. Good value for money.

Happy hour!!! $6 pizzas! Came here with 3 friends and got the pitcher of sangria & 2 pizzas! The pizzas were delicious and the drinks were good! Just wished happy hour would go on a little longer :) our server was also great, he kept coming to us and asking if we needed anything.

This place is right next door to the Hotel Carlton, which I stayed in for 4 days. I read the great reviews, and after a long week of training at my new job, I called in an order to go. I ordered the goat cheese/chicken quesadilla and a side salad. The quesadilla was yummy, and a big sized portion.  The salad was fresh and yummy. The dressing was super thick, didn't like that. The bartender was very friendly, and asked me if I wanted a drink while I was waiting. i told her no, as my hotel has free wine hour! Yipee, free is good! All in all good service, good food. I would definitely try drinks and other food next time i come to SF!
This place has an excellent happy hour if you can make it!

They have a really great happy hour menu. Go during happy hour: $5 pizza, beer and cocktail specials. Gets pretty busy at night and is a place in the neighborhood that doesn't disappoint. It is more of a bar, don't expect a restaurant, expect a bar with food and you will be satisfied. Never had bad service here and the artichoke dip is delish. Atmosphere is pretty relaxed, they have some really interesting art on the walls as well.
Stopped by after realizing it was a sister restaurant to a place back home in Tampa. Totally different menu which made it a treat.

My army guy friend brought me here. I love this place. Their food are superb. My soldier ordered the overstuff spinach pizza and it's delish. Their cosmopolitan are delicious too. The place were pretty crowded and the setting of this bar is very welcoming. I would want to come back here again next time I visit with him....I love it that i was the only asian the night I came down there :)) not only that it was the  amazing bar but I was with my amazing date.
I had high expectations for this place because it looked pretty cool in the pictures and when I would walk by. However I was not that impressed after trying it.
This place is ok for what it is, I'm not usually impressed with their food but since I live close by it is good for when I need grub after 10pm.

decent american style bar/pub.  the french fries are seven dollars! i can't even think clearly at this point so all caps is a must.  seven f_cking dollars for a potato dunked in oil.  think about it.  a potato cost on the high end $1.00, and that is for some machapichu grown, organically farmed potato that was shipped first class on virgin air laying on a pillow that is sitting on kate upton's legs.  please rethink this.

This place was pretty chill. We dominated the shuffle board and had a great time doing it. Ordered a ton of apps and all shared them. The nachos were really good and so were the pizzas! Mmmmm. Also had sangria which was really good too. This place is not too bad in price and it has a calm chill atmosphere in the early evenings. Never came here at night but I would not mind going and checking it out.

I've been here twice over the past month and loved the food each time! I'd definitely recommend the Thai Basil Chicken Pizzetta, which is basically salad on a pizza. The peanut sauce gave the pizza a sweet taste (I know it's supposed to be spicy, and it was that too - but it was more sweet), and the salad, tomatoes, and cucumber made the pizza refreshing.
Used to live in S.F, off Post and Hyde, would walk up to Ace's Bar, and head over to Fly Bar for happy hour, awesome pizzas, all kinds of great offerings.
This place used to be my local bar.

Wow. It has been 5 years since I updated my review on Fly. Back in 2009 I think they had just opened and the staff was almost completely different. Over the past 5 years, I have become a Fly Bar "regular" and can honestly say that this place is just the freakin best, if you are looking for a casual atmosphere with great drinks, fun food, and friendly staff.
This was the first spot we hit on our trip to San Fran.
Dropped by here before an event at Hemlock in search of good eats and drinks - we were not disappointed.

This place was soo good! Good atmosphere. Good service and a good crowd. We got the goat cheese quesadilla which was amazing! Also ordered the BBQ pizza and the Hawiian. Which were equally good. Tried 3 different speciality drinks. The sangria was ok. I don't remember the other two but they had interesting taste to them. Definitely thinking outside the box. Would definitely go back! Price was good too.
great bar right next o my hotel..  very good food and decent prices!  Try the nachos, they are very good!  and they serve food pretty late.
Love the chicken Nachos here and the beer variety.  Great bar seating area and music.  I need to frequent this place more often.
Great food. Good service. Fun, relaxing and chill ambiance. Great background music, classic rock genre.

It's actually three stars for the bar and 2 for the food.  We had the Shroom Pie which was okay but nothing special.  I didn't like the pesto drizzled across the top of it like mustard.  Weird.  And the mixed salad was ok.  Nice vibe in the restaurant and a bottle of wine didn't set us back too much.  I would come back for drinks but not their food.
they serve wine in normal glass cups which feels odd, but holy balls this margarita pizza is the TITS
Decently priced, chill vibe, friendly staff, food's good and they've got a selection of House creations that are pretty cool
Had a very tasty Greek pizza for lunch- will definitely be back to check out the beers and nightlife!

This place was right by our hotel and stopped for a quick bite during happy hour. There was a crowd but still plenty of room for us. Food was amazing for a local bar. Spinach dip, pizza and fruit n nut salad. To die for! Our waitress was extremely nice and attentive. Great HH prices. Definitely a must if in the mood for a coold beer and a delish pizza pie.
Food was underwhelming. I had the seafood paella and part of the arroz con pollo. Not bad, but not very good either.

I had only 3 plates, and 2 of them were delicious: Ceviche and Mussles.  For me the scallops with cheese were not the best but only because the cheese was killing the taste.  For sure i'll be back for more.
Giving it 4 stars since it's my first time going here and I got take-out. So this is purely based on first impressions and food taste.
Great ceviche! Went here on date night and got ceviche and sangria. The family atmosphere and charming vibe was amazing!

How this place was able to get 4 stars baffles me. I came here for a friend of a friends bday dinner and was apprehensive prior. I should've stuck with my instincts. The food is shitty (no other word can really say it better than that) the taste was non existant, plain, and not made with love. There wasnt one dish that was good. There was only two other tables eating there as well. I also had to eat my dinner while having to inhale cleaning detergent that smelled like the floor had been just mopped. What a fricken waste of money and an appetite.

Been going to Fina Estampa since the days it was located on 20th / Mission and for good reason. Thus, it being alive and in business since the real early 90's with the owner also being the chef! It always tastes as authentic as my H.S. Girlfriend's fathers cooking from Peru! I've tried several other Peruvian restaurants and this comes closest to home cooking without all the "fusion" involvement! I recommend a visit and the prices / portions are equal and fair! Hope all enjoys this place as I have since childhood! Thx Fina Estampa for being there!

I tried this place on a whim and absolutely loved it! We were seated right away and our waiter was very friendly and helpful. We shared everything family style and asked for some suggestions. We ended up eating the Ceviche, Lomo Saltado, Arroz con pollo, and a carafe of Sangria. The chicken was incredibly moist and flavorful and the rice it came with was equally delicious. The ceviche and lomo saltado were also amazing. I definitely plan on coming back and would recommend it to anyone.
Best culinary experience available in the tenderloin besides ler ros I absolutely loved the Lomo Saltado! This is the only restaurant with Peruvian Malbec wine in the whole city!!!

I agree that this place is a nice little hidden gem. The place is more spacious inside than it looks outside. I came here due to the good Yelp reviews and I was not disappointed. Tasty Peruvian food. They had the standard dishes such as Lomo Saltado. But I elected to try the Bistec a la Pobre which was steak with a cooked banana and egg. My friend had a buttery stuffed crab dish. Both were good. The dishes ranged from $15-20. They also had 3 tasty dipping sauces for the bread and food. I only wished that the bread was warmed. There was no difficulty in getting a seat on the weekend evening.
Awesome food and waiter is very nice.  It wasn't busy on a Saturday at 6:30 dinner.  I hope this place succeeds because they do have good food and service.

Stumbled upon this place with a friend last night. What a gem! The service was awesome, the prices were on point, and the food was absolutely delicious. I had the Arroz con Pollo and my friend had the Bisteck a lo Pobre. The servings are very generous and even though we were full about half-way through we pushed on because the flavors are so good. Don't be shy about using the toppings they provide on the table either (minty spicy awesomeness).

I am a fan! Literally a hole in the wall in the heart of the Tenderloin. The restaurant itself carries a very pleasing intimate quiet atmosphere with dim lighting.  It's not as loud or busy as the popular Fresca, Mi Lindo Peru or Limon, so if you want to enjoy a quiet  peaceful dinner, then this place is for you. The food is delicious food and the service is fantastic. If you love seafood or Peruvian food in general, I would highly recommend this place. My favorite dish is the Cangrejo Relleno (stuffed crab shell with seafood and a buttery sauce) Its definitely underrated!

I walked in and was seated right away (lucky me, I was the first customer for the evening and beat the rush).  My server recommended a seafood dish and it was divine! He provided excellent customer service and the manager even came by to check on me to see if everything was to my liking (of course, I said yes).

I love peruvian food. This place is really good and the price is great. Not too expensive. I love the lomo saltado y la papa a la huancaina. The service is great too. Looking forward to go there again. Taste fresh.
This place is a hole in the wall, family owned Peruvian restaurant vs your chain peruvian restaurants such as Limon and Fresca.

Go here, get the bisteak a lo pobre, and I swear on my Yelp account you'll love it. It's a thin steak draped over a piece of fried bread, topped with onions, tomatoes, and a fried egg, served with sweet fried banana, fried potato, and rice. Topped with their sensational chimmichurri, it's explosively flavorful. I've taken a dozen people to Fina over the years and each one has raved about the bisteak. It's hands-down my favorite dish in San Francisco.
Some friends who live in the area took me here, and I'm glad they did.  Warning: Avoid if you're in a hurry or on a schedule for some reason!  Seems like they tend to be a little slow.

I really like this place.  Ceviche Mixto is amazing.  And the sauces with bread are great too.  Actually, everything I have tried in my four visits has been great.  Salad. Steak. Purple corn drink thing...  all really good.
It's really pricey, and the food is "okay". There are better options in the city.

One of the best Peruvian locations I've been to in a long time! The food quality was excellent and the service was also very pleasant. I had the lomo saltado and the beef quality was very good. The meat was very tender and grade A steak quality. The majority of our party had the saltado de pollo and was also very satisfied with their meals. We had a party of 10 and the server was very attentive and welcoming. Very clean location in the downtown area. A bit pricey, but given the food quality, very well worth the cost. I will be making it a point to come back on my next visit to SF.

OVERPRICED. Small selection. Small portions. Not very authentic at all. Try Mi Lindo Peru or Cholo Soy if you want more authenticity. If you want some good Pollo a la Brasa (rotisserie chicken), Limon is very good as well. The better Peruvian places are in the Mission.

Fabulous find off the beaten path. Ceviche is fresh and authentic. Excellent! Paella, arroz con pollo, and sangria are delicious. Prices average $15 per dish; portions are large and great for family style. Service can be slow, but staff is very friendly and accommodating. It's now on our family's regular restaurant rotation.

I was a bit skeptical because of the outside decor but once we ordered food I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly and prompt plus recommended dishes for us. The crispy chicken was not greasy but perfectly cooked. The scallops were yummy along with the sangria. The only dish I didn't like (but my friends did) was the feta cheese potatoes. Great little find that is perfect for small plates

I went there with my mom a few weeks ago to try the lomo saltado. It was delicious! The restaurant was completely empty when we went on a Wednesday afternoon. Don't know if it gets more busy on other nights. You also get the standard sauces and bread at the beginning of your meal. Overall, it was a nice place with decent prices and good food.

By far would give it 10 stars if I could! Same owners from old locale on Van Ness. Food is just as delicious if not better. Best authentic Peruvian food in all of SF!!! Bistec a lo pobre, anticuchos, papa a la huancaina, I could go on. Yummy!!!
Great service! Had the lemon chicken tapas and paella Valencia! Great neighborhood spot!

Looked for Peruvian restaurants in San Francisco and saw this place , tried to find parking, found one, put in $2.00 and walked inside and they said they are closed. They had people inside still but I guess not taking new customers, I checked opening hours before going and they we're suppose to be open until 11pm. They should fix there opening hours, so I don't waste my time looking for parking. If you check it right now, it says open :{, but luckily found another great place.
We were quite surprised at how good the food was here.
Brought me back to Peru and my childhood memories, doesn't get more peruvian than that. Food, service, atmosphere  are awesome. Best peruvian place in SF.
3.5 stars.
Wow this is a great Peruvian restaurant!!! Tammy and her Husband are super nice and the food is perfect.

I've been going here since it was located on Geary and Van Ness.  I love their complimentary aji sauces.  I typcially get the Lomo Saltado with a Crystal (beer not the champagne!).  The ambience of the new location is great.

I love this place, it is my hidden gem in SF. I live extremely close to La Fina Estampa and this is one of my go-to dinner date spots for many reasons. You can typically get a table without a res, the food is amazing, sangria is awesome (and cheap), and the owner / waiter Luis is them man as well. The sangria is key for dates at it just keeps flowing and is delicious, so every one gets a little loose by the end of the meal. Perfect. The vibe inside is classy and romantic. It's decor has nice wooden paneling with candles on every table. I was shocked how nice it was inside when I first ate there as the outside of the restaurant is so unassuming. They should put some tables outside for lunch on the weekend!

This restaurant never fails me. Their service is always excellent and food is so scrumptious everytime my family and I visit. I love their cangrejo relleno, arroz con pollo and chicharron de pollo. I am always satisfied and full when I leave this place! I highly recommend this restaurant.

Randomly walked into this place for a late lunch.  We haven't eaten all day, so we asked if they would serve us from the dinner menu (to which they graciously accommodated) and then proceeded to order a ton of food!

Mu husband and I were new to the area when we first tried La Fina Estampa.  We were looking for peruvian food and found this place on Yelp.  He orderes the lomo saltado and I had the paella valenciana - both were fantastic! We alsoo started with the causa rellena appetizer (potatato stuffed with chicken), which was different than what we had expected but SO good.  We just returned for our 3nd time on Friday.  We had the lomo saltado (again, can't go wrong) and arroz con pollo.  We got the causa again too. So delicious - definitely a keeper!

This place was a hike to get to, but well worth the hike! Like people suggested I ordered the Lomo Saltado - the BEST lomo saltado. I also got the chicha morada and an order of ceviche. The food was really good, I was so happy I made it here all the way from Market street. It was a slow night, only one other table of four and only one waiter (who was very attentive) and one cook. Lucky for them there werent many tables, and at first I was hesitant to go inside since it was pretty empty. Glad I went in, this place is a def must go to when in SF.
Definitely a place to try. Big portions and really friendly wait staff. The prices seem to be rising but you could definitely split an entree and get an appetizer. Bread and sauces are delicious.

the place itself is OK, but nothing fancy, I wasn't impressed with food either. I was expecting something different, special, but service not the greatest, waiting time slightly to long. Not a lot of Peruvian food restaurants in San Fran. Not my favorite one.

I am a Peruvian San Francisco native and grew up eating homemade Peruvian food that my father prepared with his recipes that have been passed down from my abuela. I know good authentic Peruvian food and fina estampa is it! I have been to limon, la mar, fresca, and another small Peruvian restaurant over by the ballpark and this is by far the BEST Peruvian restaurant in San Francisco. The chef and my father come from the same small town, Callao, Peru and share the same cooking styles. They actually know each other so My sister and I are always greeted warmly and treated like family. It feels just like home. They have excellent service and amazing food, a truly authentic and family owned&operated restaurant. If you are looking for the real deal this is it! I reccomend the papa a la huancaina, tallarin saltado, lomo saltado, ceviche, everything is good!
Lovely dining room.  I want mine to look like this. Super chic mid century details throughout, warm, thoughtful and pleasant.

In the renovated Warwick San Francisco Hotel, a very convenient location for shows at the Curran Theater: across the street! We were seated promptly at our reservation time and had great service throughout. We had a table for two at the window, nice and quiet with sidewalk entertainment.

Excellent foods & ambiance for a GNO or a romantic dinner for two.   Let's start with the limited parking space in that heart of downtown SF & the price gauging valet parking $30, my advice; try to give yourself amble time to look for a free street parking.

I went to Aveline for a get-together with several friends and we were immediately seated next to the open kitchen, which was a delight because those of us nearest the kitchen watched the fascinating actions of the staff as they prepared many mouth-watering dishes right before our eyes.
Sad but true - Aveline does not live up to it's expectations and hype.
Good ambiance,  good service, good drinks, great food presentation. However, all the dishes lacked in taste a bit. Everything seemed a bit bland. The crab macaroons were the highlight.
I'm unfortunately out of the runnings for 2014 Bikini Competitor #HiromiN #humanterminator due to the indulgence which was every. single. bite. of every. emmereffin. dish.
Trendy, with way too much attitude!

On my most recent trip to San Francisco I had a really lovely large group dinner at Aveline. We had a set menu because there were so many of us, but with each course I still managed to have a tough time choosing between just two option. I ended up with an avocado based starter, the fried chicken with kimchi powder and pickled vegetables for my main, and a peanut butter and devil's food cake dessert. It was all super delicious as was the strawberry butter and bread the table shared before any of our course came out.

The food here was quite different and uniquely presented.  For example their crab macarons came in a little rectangular box with a little string bow tied around it. Then they had the bread plate which was so good but a little expensive.  They had three types on the platter that night but they don't really give one of each per person.  We had to share one of them and there was another one that was good but we got one regular size piece and one end cut....bummer...  Their black cod was good but a little on the cold side. I would've asked to have them re-heat it but with company being there, I just sucked it up.  The other thing that was unique was their "batter" dessert. We ordered the brownie one and it was a lot of fun eating it but it needed something else to go with it. Even though it looked like a big glob of brown stuff, it was actually quite tasty.  Who knew white bean, prunes and sweet potatoes with chocolate could be a good combo.

We had a six o'clock reservation for pre theater - enough time, one would think, to have dinner and get to the show on time.  Little did we know.  The first course took too long and it got worse.  We had to wait over a half hour for our mushroom course, then another 25 minutes for our mains.  At the same time the couple at the next table, who seemed to be known to the management, came, were served, and left in less than an hour.  We barely made our 8:00 show.  The food was very good but I guess we didn't rate.  We won't go back.
Besides the crab macaroons, I was really disappointed with the rest of the food.

For the third time dining at aveline i have found there to be a lack of leadership. I asked about an obscure wine that i was happy to see on the list and received little to no knowledgable help. This was followed by my second dining experience a couple weeks ago when the gentleman saying he was general manager couldnt answer simple questions regarding the food. Ok, move on. We received our food and all was forgotten about the winelist. Amazing presentation and flavors. The innovative dishes that chef casey comes up with are a breath of fresh air in this city. Nice to see a woman chef succeed. Especially with a great name like casey. ;)
Delicious and creative food, beautiful presentation, fantastic cocktails and exceptional service!

OMG!  This restaurant was sent from heaven.  We arrived promptly at 5:30 and were escorted through the informally formal dining room and seated in a window looking out at the world coming home from work.  Our waiter Lance was the best combination of friendly and professional.  His suggested wine pairing with trousseau gris grapes was just right.
Stopped by for a recovery dinner on the weekend of Nike Women's Half. A friend recommended the Crab Macarons, so I had to see for myself!
Decent but not great. I was actually pretty stunned to read after eating here that the chef was a Top Chef winner.
Not great . Will not recommend

There were some high points of the meal - the crab macaroons which others have recommended - were truly amazing. However, other elements were lacking. The fried chicken was very bland - and the brownie batter was just sort of weird - it should have been great but the texture was just off. The pasta with pork cheeks was definitely a standout. Seems like there are still some kinks to work out.

All I can say is get the yolk beignet and crab macaroons. There is nothing like it, and you won't be disappointed unless you don't eat meat or shellfish. The place is pricey, but these two items on the menu are fantastic! Was here last night for dinner. Returned tonight to have the beignet as dessert - keep in mind this is a savory beignet, but it's my dessert tonight!

Reservations were easy on Yelp and we walked there due to the madness of salesforce, Nike Women's Marathon Expo and the Giants game (Go Giants!).  At first we thought the restaurant replaced Millennium but realized that was on the next block.  The hostess and waitress, Maria, were nice and pleasant.
Despite the calming pastel hues, the 2011 Merlot and the couples canoodling all around, the table of three guys dining before the board meeting was still tense.
Cute little place, apparently just opened.  I barely had an appetite for food that day so can't really comment too much other than the small sampling bites from other people.
One of the best new restaurants I encountered recently in SF.
What a swanky, cool new-ish restaurant and right across from Clift!

It's fortunate that the food was SO GOOD that the little angel on my shoulder was able to shove the little devil on the other shoulder down for the win.  Because it was close. The service would barely make 3 stars.  This meal had some of the most delicate, lovely, astonishing moments that I've experienced this year.  Presentation was stellar as well.  People ain't lying when they recommend the macarons and the fried chicken.  Angel cheers.  The cold seafood, avocado, and dessert (I believe it was simply called "carrot") also got the angel all excited.  But the devil had his moments with the late seating for our res (30 mins) and the extremely long wait between courses.  But mostly it was the fact that noone acknowleged this with a simple "sorry for the wait."  By the time they sat us it was almost 9:30, so we didn't get too cranky that they sold out of the sea bass.  And for me, most of the dishes were oversalted - but being a subjective thing, the devil only gets a sliver of a point here.   So angel wins and I'm giving it the four.  I hope they get it together and find their footing, because this could be a really heavenly (groan) dining experience.
There were several times during the night where I said, " this is the best .... I've ever had".

Food was excellent and the service was great. The restaurant was a little loud being right off the lobby and being so close to Union Square with lots of noisy celebrating tourists. The raw seafood was pleasant but not the best I've had. I really enjoyed the red abalone dish which was quite different than anything I've had before. The abalone was perfectly cooked, and was served with some lightly cooked greens and a thin broth. Also, the fried chicken was awesome - very light tempura style batter, but perfectly moist chicken underneath, and with a spicy kick to boot

In September I called to reserve a table/private room for 15 for a party on a Saturday night in December.   The restaurant was so loud, I literally had to yell into the phone to the person who answered.   I was told my reservation was on the books and that someone would call soon to discuss details.  No one ever did.  I called again in the beginning of October and guess what, no reservation.   Get it together.    I'm taking my party elsewhere.   No wonder all the bad reviews lately.

Hubby and I are huge Top Chef fans, so on our last night in the city, we went here for dinner. Had a small bite with zucchini, crab and black beans. Very tasty. Split the avocado appetizer and found it pleasant, although the ice cream was our least favorite. Hubby had the abalone,and I had the tomato pasta. Both were utterly scrumptious !!! Wish Casey had come out, but alas no. Compliments to her, as she has a hit on her hands!!!
I love this place. The place is nicely decorated for a date night, or just a night out with your girlfriends.

We came here on a Friday night to celebrate s small occasion.  We entered off Geary Street though you could also enter from the hotel. During dinner two girls rushed in trying to get away from a man who also rushed in after them.  A bit disturbing but I could tell the front of house was trying to get them to leave. We were promptly seated for our reservation.  We sat on some wood chairs but it wasn't quite big enough for my bag so my bag sat on the floor.

The crab macarons were incredible with big chunks of meat and cute presentation; definitely the highlight of the meal. The rest of dinner unfortunately failed to live up to expectations and price tag.

This place is its own worst enemy.  Like that very talented but self-destructive friend who can only help his or herself while you stand by, its problems are all self-inflicted and can be fixed if they want to.  And, like that friend, I very much hope they do.

Can't say I was too impressed with the place. Maybe I had high expectations, but the food here seems to be form over taste. They spend too much time worrying about fancy techniques than the flavor of the food. The problem with establishments that dabble in molecular gastronomy is that they need to be prefect in order to have the food actually taste good instead of just being presented in an unusual and unexpected way.
Wow!
Restaurant for tourists with terrible service, mixed food, 7$ bread and a cafe ambiance.
Absolutely wonderful. Located inside a boutique hotel.  All the dishes we ordered was balanced and suprising well portioned. Everything was well balanced and was devine.

My friend treated my boyfriend and I to this place she wanted to check out by someone's recommendation.  Service and food were exceptionally executed.  We ordered a myriad of items of ones that still linger in my memory is the campanelle pig cheek entree and red abalone.

Aveline is a great place. Each dish is a piece of art for all senses. We tried the beautifully decorated Vegetable Garden, the best Oisters we ever had, Red Abalone, Sea Bass and the best ever American Waguy. Everything was perfectly cooked. The service was great and we could share everything. Definitely coming back.
Everything on the menu , except for the Tajine and tea , is Tunisian not Moroccan. Make sure to try the briks and the couscous.

This cafe is located on a lively corner of Polk street. It is clean and tidy. The lentil soup in town is delicious, with a zesty lemon accent. The tuna salad sandwich is massive, perfect for sharing. Tunisian style tuna salad - with green olives and hard boiled eggs - is piled high atop freshly baked french bread.
I'd walked by this place so many times, usually very briskly, as a few years ago that corner was much more sketchy than it is now.  Little did I know I was missing out on some really wonderful food.

I really wanted to like this place -- a Moroccan run restaurant filled with Moroccans. But not sure what all the rave reviews are about. The staff there are alternately rude or distracted/ignore you, and food is hit or miss. I've ordered 3 different items on the menu at various times and this 3rd time finally inspired me to review on Yelp -- the shawarma I recently ordered had a lovely grilled shell but was a gooey mess of raw and grilled onions with 4 tiny pieces of meat swimming in sauce (I think Tahini but it tasted different than usual) and a couple of tomato and cucumber cubes, inside. If there was eggplant or anything else in it, the taste was overwhelmed by the onion. Out of the 100's of shawarma's I've ordered in my life from London to NY to Seattle, this was the 2nd worst. Plus I asked for no hot sauce/mild and it nevertheless came out super spicy, as if to spite me for even asking for it to be mild. Plus it costs $9 compared to $7-8 at most other places in SF. The only saving grace was that the 4 pieces of meat that I picked out to eat were very flavorful, and the fries ($3.25 extra) were killer, hence the extra star above one. So stick to the kebobs and tagine here basically.
Okay, this place has the oddest hours. I've lived nearby it for almost a year and only recently got to try it because it's always been closed.
Yummy food I loved it very nice staff members i would totally go there again and the location was awesome hats off to the chef!
Okay, okay, I was really mad when I wrote my last review so I take it back.  They finally fixed their website to say that they DON'T deliver, so at least there's that.

All the great stuff I said still stands but they seem to change their hours by the day so  of the last ten times I have gone back they have only been open once.  They post apologies on their door, but its TERRIBLE for business because I rarely even think of them as an option anymore.  So its not a place you can really PLAN to go to, but if it is open, by all means go.
Nice little local spot, very homely feeling. The lentil soup is wicked. And the combo kebab plate is amazeballs. Good prices and great service.
I LOVE THIS PLACE. Sadly it shuts at seven just when we're warming up for a relaxed meal to catch up after a long day.
Great local spot. I recommend the hummus/baba ghanoush appetizer and the lamb kebobs if you're a lamb lover (how could you not be?). You won't be disappointed.

Best Arab restaurant I've eaten at in the Bay Area, hands down. The owner is incredibly nice, all five dishes we ordered were stellar, including the loobia, kofta and chicken tajines, the chicken kabab platter, and the Moroccan eggplant. Mint tea and harissa/basboosa dessert capped off a perfect meal. Clean place, delicious food, nice staff and great prices. My wife and I have tried about ten other Arab restaurants in the area, ranging from Egyptian to Yemeni to Lebanese to Jordanian, but none were really that good. Cafe Zitouna is the real deal.
Great service! I'd go back for the B'Stilla!
Great service and the tanjine chicken is amazing. Loved the harissa baboussa cake - must not miss this place! Go for the iced min tea too.
This place is open again!  And it's still as good as ever!
Wow things have changed...The meat I received was extremely tough and dry.  I threw most of it out.  Very disappointing.
I'm so happy that Cafe Zitouna is back open, I've missed the Chicken Kebob Couscous, and the Mint Tea about as badly as I could miss anything.
Wonderful little place, with great moroccan food. The tajines are especially great. I usually get one of the lamb dishes. I can recommend this place highly.
What they don't tell you is that the shawarma here will ruin you because you'll never have another as delicious as it is here.

Such a delightful experience dining here. It had a very homey feeling from its food. We had a vegetable soup that was nothing special but very pleasant. And the dessert (I'm not sure what it's called, but it's like a cake thing with pistachio pieces on top, with some syrup on the bottom) was simply heavenly!

I tried almost everything in this place and its definitely the best Moroccan I know! My mother in law is Algerian so I know how great Cous Cous is supposed to taste! And the portions are huge so you wont leave hungry thats for sure! Mint tea is great, and the pistachio cake is so yummy! The owner is really nice too and talks to my husband in French. Sometimes we got free dessert!
Amazing!
Good.  I got the Pie from Heaven, it was a little too sweet for an entree, and would have been good as 1/3 of my meal instead of the entire thing.

The Morroccan Mint tea is delicious. The roasted saffron potatoes that come with the Chicken Tajine are sometimes otherworldly. The olive oil they use to dip the bread is very tasty. The B'Stilla is okay, though not my fave. Couscouses, tajines and everything are usually pretty solid but it doesn't blow me out of the water. We used to come here pretty regularly when we lived in SF. Very good overall.
This small cafe was so good. Everything we tried was so memorable and so delicious. It gets four stars for the lack of ambience and for closing early.
Authentic Moroccan by skilled Mexican cooks. Owner is lazy and rude. Makes guests uncomfortable and ruins the whole experience.
This place is a delight!!! I had the lamb couscous and the lamb & white bean tajine, both were delicious! The bread that comes with the tajine was warm and crusty-so perfect.
Delicious food, great value, awesome service. Don't listen to the nay-sayers, this is one of the best options in the area.

So delicious!  Everything was really tasty and affordable, served hot and fresh.  Good, friendly and relatively fast service.  I highly recommend the pie from heaven...satisfies all your taste buds-- it has a sweet cinnamon nuttiness, along with a savory and buttery, chicken flavor, both complimenting the other well.

went with ar, jk, and rn.  nice corner space with lots of windows.  lamb stew with white beans was fantastic.  lamb fell off the bone.  beans werent overdone.  kebabs were juicy and tender.  b'stilla was a good mix of sweet and savory.  very thick.
Service is a 1.

Haven't read the zagat review of this restaurant but it must be good. Café zitouna (which means olives in Arabic) offers Great authentic Moroccan and Tunisian cuisine. The server was very friendly and so was the restaurant owner. Though they didn't offer the carrot salad and a prune tagine I have to say this was some of the best food I've had in a long time. This is the best Moroccan and Tunisian cuisine I've had in the us and is as good as in France and North Africa.

Heard about this place thanks to Yelp and saw that great reviews so my mom and I had to try out their food and we picked what seems like the best place in San Francisco! Their food is delicious! We had coffee to start, my mom had the African salad and I had the Couscous/Lamb Sausage plate; first off, the food portions are HUGE so you get A LOT of food for what you pay for, and their couscous is accompanied by spicy stew on the side, along with steamed vegetables atop the plate! A french roll also comes on the side for dipping. My mom and I were a little out of our element when it came to figuring out how to "properly" eat our dinner, but it was delicious! If you haven't tried this place yet, give it a try!

I've eaten here maybe 5-6 times, and am trying to be objective, as so many people I know rave about this place. (especially people I know from down the street at the Lush Lounge). The last 2 times, both of my meals (Both were To Go) have either been the Lamb Tajine or a Lamb meatball dish with egg. The previous dish was so salty I couldn't eat it..Very disappointing. I thought, well-I'll give this another shot. Tonight I had a Lamb meatball dish (I forgot the exact name) but it had a fried egg with it and gravy. I brought it home and by the time I went to eat it, the grease laden gravy had soaked through my cloth bag and had permeated all the produce I had bought from the store. It took me a good 30-45 mins to clean up the mess and then try to separate the grease from the meatballs and the gravy. All in all, very disappointing..All my meals were in the $13-14 dollar range and weren't worth the hassle. I wish this place was better, but unfortunately, it was sadly disappointing on more than one occasion..
Great food but they close and take off for months out of the year.

Don't get me wrong, I really like this spot. I love their Tunisian sandwich. The food is all yummy and the prices are very reasonable. The service can be lacking sometimes, but that adds to the authenticity and makes me feel like I'm a tourist in a big city in North Africa where the servers could care less about me. The food generally comes out quite quickly.
Only four stars as the waiter, albeit a nice guy, forgot my soup.  Other than that food was awesome, rice was fantastic as was the mint tea.  We had dinner for less than $50, well worth it.
yummy lamb tagine- even yummier wraps!
This place is awesome! It's very small, so you might have to wait for a table, but it is well worth it. Plus the staff is friendly.
Can't help but write a review for this awesome, quaint, family run Moroccan restaurant.

I have been wanting to go to Millennium for the longest time and I finally made it with family. We were so fortunate to get the last parking spot at a garage about 50 ft from the restaurant and at a very good price ($10). We were seated at a rather small table but it was fine for the 3 of us. I enjoyed the vintage quaintness yet classy setting. Our waiter really knew the wine list and was great at helping us pick out a bottle that would compliment our food choices. He also led us to a wine made locally, Quinta Cruz, which I really like to support. We started with the lentil spread and bread, the bread being hearty and tasty while the lentil spread was delightful! We had the shaved brussel sprouts with BBQ tofu pieces....yum, herbed olives and the pad thai salad. For our entrees we had the tamale, cauliflower and squash entrees. We shared everything which is the way to go as I could never pick one item here and feel like I got to experience Millennium. My only suggestion would be that we should have been given larger plates rather than just using the bread plate. It was rather awkward but we managed and we were so excited that we didn't take the time to ask for a larger plate! Service was good, waiter and busboy were very attentive and personable. Don't wait as long as I did to try Millennium!
We have eaten here before and had much better food.

The food here was amazing, and the fact that all the ingredients are vegan and locally sourced is definitely a plus. The potatoes with zaatar, dumplings, pickled vegetables, and raw pad thai were all great starters. For entrees, we ordered the tamale, tempeh, and celery uttapam. The uttapam was my favorite by far. It was moist and savory, sitting on top of a bed of rice with coconut curry. Overall, I had a wonderful experience and it definitely helped that we received 25% off our order, an offer for meat-eaters they have every other Wednesday.

Superb vegan vegetarian organic (as much as possible I understand) cuisine.  The ambience is superb.  (The location is average.)  The service outstanding. Quiet enough and absolutely fine dining experience each and every time.
Excellent food and great service. Make reservations so you don't miss out on experiencing this amazing place.
Excellent vegetarian experience, innovative and tasty!

I'm sorry but Millennium deserves and earns five stars absolutely.  It is fantastic, top to bottom.   And  those of you who offer refined, erudite critiques in justification of your nuanced, misguided three or four star reviews (for fucksake)  -- Nothing more than miscreant haters.  Thank Millennium for offering cruelty free extraordinary cuisine, libations, and wonderful service ...
One of my favorite restaurants in the city. Awesome cocktails, delicious and healthy food, amazing service and ambience.
There's a reason why this place is booked solid on a Saturday eve... their food is AMAZING. It's literally the stuff dreams are made of.

Millennium was one of my favorite dining experiences I have ever had. I want to preface this review by mentioning I don't frequent "upscale" dining places very often, and I live in Birmingham, AL where there are no true vegan dining options. So this was very unique and special for me :)

Sad I can't eat here every meal every day. Everything made me stop and say, "are you kidding me?" Delicious, original and incredibly fresh and flavorful everything! The ambiance was awesome and upscale too. Now need to come here at least once a year for my birthday

Don't waste your money or your time going to this place. I was really looking forward to trying this place, but the hostesses had a really bad attitude. They were not friendly or welcoming when we arrived so we decided to leave and try some place else.
Wonderful food here. Great creative menu, love all the flavors they achieve with no meat or dairy, very impressive!

We had multiple problems with the service, and we were not the only ones who did.   We were not seated for a full hour after our scheduled reservation time of 9 pm, and it took an hour after seating to get an entree.  Waiting next to the hostess' station, we could hear her converse with her friends who did not have reservations.  One woman said to her, "Our reservation is for tomorrow, but we're hungry now!"  And she promptly took them to a table (quite possibly ours).  We waited with 3 other parties (one included a pregnant woman who was visibly uncomfortable), starving for an hour.  The manager promised us free drinks as an apology.  No drinks materialized.  When the bill came, every item was full price.

Sunday evening 6:30 no reservations available but can sit at the bar, we were attended to by a young efficient woman.  The courses were a revelation. Never been to a veggie only restaurant before and it was scrumptious. The tamale, the tiki thing, and roasted cauliflower which were out of this world, then two deserts which we almost licked the place.  Our dishes were served from behind so hardly even saw

Millenium is the best gourmet vegan restaurant in the world. If you want macrobiotic wonder, this is not the place for it. But your body will feel just as wonderful after a meal here given their ingenious ingredient pairings. To make similar food at home would take years of culinary school and lots of patience. This is where I go when I deserve a treat and want to indulge in fancy vegan pleasures. Although the location is sketcy, seedy, the restaurant itself is beautiful inside. Don't be fooled by the Hotel California in which the restaurant resides. You may never get to check out of the Hotel California, which ain't such a lovely place, but the restaurant will be happy to when you check out to make the table available for someone else. They won't rush you though, and the ambience is quiet.

Had never consciously eaten "vegan" before and will definitely return to Millennium.  Food was delicious and very filling.  The woman I was with is allergic to a few seasonings and ingredients.  The waitress circled items on the menu that did not contain them which helped make wise choices.
Wow, I can't believe I haven't written a review of this place yet! This is long overdue, then.
Great vegetarian restaurant!

Everything about this place was spot on! The ambiance was incredible. The food was beyond my highest expectations. I got maple roasted squash and my bf got the Bastilla, a Moroccan inspired plate. PHENOMENAL!! This will become a regular go to every time we visit the city.

Had the four-course with wine pairings - menu changes every weekend, but our meal was delicious!  South-East Asian and very innovative, wine pairings were superb except for a disappointing dessert wine.  Our waiter Michael was superb, accommodating, and the atmosphere was pleasant.  Yay!

I stopped in one night for dinner. I always like to go to a new vegetarian restaurant. I would say it was pretty good. Overall I found the food to be more on the sweet side rather then the savory side. Would I come back? The answer is probably not. I am glad that I went however. If you have never been I do recommend that you try it and enjoy yourself.
Summary: phenomenal food with a great ambience
Went here for our 7-year anniversary, was perfect! Everything was delicious. Rare white-cloth fancy vegan restaurant. We will be back every time we visit the city.

This is one of my favorite Restaurants. I've introduced many friend and all have become fans. I've been eating with them since before they moved from their old location and honestly this restaurant only gets better.

I am an unrepentant carnivore and yet I would call my meal at Millennium one of the ten best meals I have ever had.  Everything was the highest caliber, from the service to the presentation to the actual food.
