The food was amazing! We had the Tamale, Potato Tikka and the Sweat Ending. They were all wonderful. I will definitely go back again and I am not a Vegetarian but loved the food. At this place you don't need meet to make a dish taste amazing!
I am not a vegan.  A friend from India wants to dine here every visit.  The staff is great.  The food is artfully plated.
Genius.

This was really an incredible meal which also happened to be vegan as well.  The trumpet mushroom  appetizer was sensational.  Our waiter was friendly and helpful, suggesting a wine (Italian red don't remember the name) which turned out to be a perfect pairing with our meal.  The ambiance was a little on the noisy side but also felt like it had a San Francisco buzz which I enjoyed. Portobella mushroom dish was also a real winner.  We look forward to our next Millennium experience!
Best vegetarian food I ever had . We had the radicchio and fig salad and the gnocchi !!!

Food at this place is great probably the best American vegetarian food I've had anywhere  would have given it 5 stars if not for the poor service from the bar tender.  Bearded bar tender was rude both times I went...first time  never checked on us once, second time never checked on my food and told me he doesnt know if my food is ready since he isn't the one that cooks it when I asked him if my food was ready was ready.
Because of the high price time, this is only the second time I've been to Millenium and it was to celebrate my 30th birthday with a fellow vegetarian/vegan friend.
Spectacular vegan food at the highest standards!
5 stars, 5 STARS!!!!
We are a couple, so we have split reviews:

Everything about my dinner at Millennium was excellent! The menu was very creative with plenty of range for a vegan restaurant. My food was excellent, delicious and very reasonably priced for SF. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to others and hope to go back when I a next in the city.
Great vegetarian restaurant with full bar and great wine selections for all tastes. Even if you aren't a vegetarian you'll love the food and come away very satisfied!
Some of the best vegetarian food I've ever eaten at a restaurant.

Best vegan/veg dining experience ever! Great food and amazing atmosphere , it's also a cool date spot.  They have an extensive craft cocktail list, with as many  non alcoholic drinks as alcoholic beverages. I've been to vegan/vegetarian restaurants all over the us and even the world and this place is in my top 5.

Awesome mom and pop spot on the tenderloin. I generally get mamas fried chicken spicy and gyoza when in a snack mood! I love the soaked daikon that comes along side the order. They're open pretty late generally and whip up Togo orders in ten minutes or less. Would recommend this spot if you're in the area.

Small but mighty :) definitely the best korean food in the city. Whenever i miss my mothers cooking this place hits the spot. One time for a friends birthday I asked if i could cater for about 30 people and the friendly couple gave us so muxh good food for a great price. Great place, good people, and i would recommend

Tried the spicy rice cake (Ttok bok ki), all types of the fried chicken, spicy radish side dish and fried noodle roll. The fried roll was super greasy and the rest were waaaaay too salty! Also, their fried chicken is NOT authentic "Korean style". If you've been to or lived in Korea and are expecting real KFC, this is not it.

I recommend their kimbap, fried chicken, and spicy rice cake. They sell a variety of porridge only 2 days a week during fall/winter along with basic side dishes throughout the year. Aria is a great hole-in-the-wall that sells decent Korean comfort food (for SF standards.)
I have eaten countless Korean food, and so far this place is only A-OK, even if I consider it just a "snack bar."

Delicious, cheap, very satisfying Korean comfort food. Gotta get the fried chicken and the chewy rice cakes! The couple who runs this are so sweet and cute. I've never had bad service here, whether I show up and order or call ahead for pickup.

Korean Fried Chicken was pretty legit; however, the seafood pancake left something to be desired. Honestly the sauces aren't all that special, but they brand it as mama's sauce which is nice. I went as a group of 4 people and we ordered two large KFC baskets with each of the sauces. It was a lot of food and as my friend stated "I just got my fried chicken fix for the month. This is a good day."  Overall I am a fan. It is moist, crispy, de-boned chicken with good sauce. The place is small so expect to carry out. The area isn't super sketch but I wouldn't walk around alone at night. I would recommend this place and would definitely visit again to try their other menu options.
Korean Fried Chicken. The only KFC you'll ever need.

This is a cute hole in the wall with friendly owners. I would probably come to this place more if I was a local. If you're not familiar with the Tenderloin, the surroundings can be a little intimidating. The food was so-so and prices were fair.
Was excited to go here after reading the positive reviews...disappointed for several reasons.

The owners are so down to earth and so nice. Remind me of my grandparents and how they shower me with korean food when I visit korea. The food is also amazing and authenic korean street food. I wish I could give this place more stars
Average Korean food, pretty good for the price. This also seems more like a takeout place since it's really small and they only have 3 tables.
First off, I've experienced Korean food from NorCal to SoCal. Sure I haven't been to Korea but I've been to some pretty damn good Korean restaurants.

I haven't tried any other fried chicken in the area so I'm not exactly sure how good it is in comparison to the others, but it was definitely some pretty good chicken. I also had the ramen/rice cake dish () which was a bit salty for my tastes, but still good overall. Can't wait to try out some of the other foods,
The food is pretty good if you're willing to wait the 15+ minutes for them to cook it up.

It's literally a hole in the wall. The place is trashy and dirty and there's no room for more than 3 people max at a time.  However, that's not the point. You order, eat and get out. The fried chicken is a must have. Light and crispy. The ramen with rice cakes was decent as well.

There aren't many places to get Korean food in this city which is sad because I love Korean food. Of the few, this one is closest to me, the prices are decent, and the food was good. I had the fried rice with shrimp. The restaurant itself is very small and cramped. No place to sit or stand really. They have a microwave which is usually a bad sign in a restaurant but they didn't use it on my food so that was ok..
One word : LEGIT

This place is family orientated which seems like a husband and wife. They are so cheerful and was always smiling and making a conversation when me and my boyfriend were there. The service here is good because they talk to you trying to make you feel comfortable as you're there sitting and eating. However, the place is a bit small and you would kind of feel cramp inside but you kinda expect this size when its like a mini restaurant and food is meant for to go. The rice cake with ramen is delicious but I didn't realize the base would be thick like how regular rice cakes were but if you like spicy then you would like this dish. Its a must!! I suggest to try this place at least once because its a snack bar that is at fast pace.

Absolutely delicious! I got the fried chicken & pot stickers. But don't be like the guy that came in after me & asked if they had "something simple that isn't fried, like teriyaki." Its Korean...not Japanese!! I think his friend felt embarrassed because we both rolled our eyes.

not bad for a hole in the wall.... for the price and the amount of food... I'll give it 4.... prob s/b a 3.75 but, it's a mom/pop and I love helping out mom/pop. Chap Chae... pretty much just vermicelli, a few sliver of veggies (i.e. carrots, cabbage)... pork cutlet /rice ... beef bugulgi ... not bad... probably for  a guy, you may need 2... fried chicken... taste better hot.... ok... i do like the new year cake in spicy red sauce...8 items... only $74.00 ... not bad..area is a bit sketchy... but its ok... you can probably find meter parking in front or nearby!

I will give it a 3 star because there is nothing really special or a must try in this place. You can get similar taste at Kukje supermarket or any home cook korean restaurant. But i will say the fried chicken is pretty good, better than average. But overall, i would say is a good experience and getting a quick bite will be a good place to go for.
Fried chicken was ok. The batter seemed to be over cooked or burnt. I've definitely experienced better. I guess if you've got a strong craving and was around the area, it'd suffice.

Aria has quickly become one of my favorite places to eat, perfect for takeout or a delicious no-frills Korean meal in the TL. Despite the American in the name, this hole in the wall with exactly three mismatched tables makes you feel like you're in Asia, or at least Vancouver. For the bathroom, disregard the "employees only" sign and head down a dark hallway that leads to someone's apartment (not kidding). But the man's warm manner will make you feel welcome, and the delicious KFC will satisfy your belly. Get it a la carte with radish cubes, or as a lunch box with rice and kimchee. Don't miss the intriguing fried seaweed rolls stuffed with japchae noodles (good dipped in the KFC sauce!), the toothsome spicy rice cake, or the incredibly comforting tofu soup generously laced with oysters.
Delicious!

The most adorable Korean couple command this teeny-tiny hole-in-the-wall roost. There are about 8 seats max but good thing an unusually rainy day keeps all the ravenous snackers away. The menu was surprisingly robust with everything from dduk bbok ki to soon doo boo and my favorite core food group: KFC (Korean Fried Chicken yo!)

We enjoyed our food here but don't expect much in terms of atmosphere. It's a small family run business that would hold 8 people max -- and that's pretty damn close. We found it on the internets in search of some good KFC. Alas, that wasn't to be but we did manage to put a dent in some food.

Dingy little hole-in-the-wall that serves up basic Korean treats. I had the KFC and the kimchi fried rice (bonus: comes with a fried egg). I can't say I was blown away, but the chicken was pretty good. The fried rice was just okay. A bit expensive ($18ish for both). And they have vinyl records in the corner.

This place is great but tiny. In total it seats about 6-7 people so best to plan on take-out. I was hoping to find Korean Fried Chicken with the hardened outer shell and glaze but this was not it. However, everything was still really good including the seafood pancake.
The hot spicy rice cake with ramen and your sinuses are clear.

This place serves the best spicy rice cakes I've ever had from a Korean restaurant. They are SUPER chubby and tender. A lot of Korean places tend to make their rice cakes on the sweet side, but these were def on the spicy side which I love!

This is one of my favorite places to eat in San Francisco. I've been here a lot and have gotten to know the two owners. They are the sweetest and really go out of their way to take care of me. It is not the cheapest place to eat and it takes time for the food to be prepared because it is just the two of them manning the ship but the wait is worth it. The food and the service really makes me feel like I'm eating with my family at home.
I've tried all the other dishes. The menu has expanded and it's amazing. I love the spicy military jjigae and the hot & spicy rice cake. Super nice owners. Eat here！
It's not cheap, but I've heard Korean food in San Francisco is pretty pricey. $50 if you include a 10% tip for 4 items: Kimbap, fried chicken, seafood pancake and pan-fried kimchi and tofu.
:::The short of it:::
Best tasting tap water ever! The right mix of chilled water and lemon.
This place is awesome, and run by the cutest Korean-American couple.

Good, cheap, and delish. Had kimchi fried rice, KFC, and spicy squid. All good and worth the $$. Side dishes of young cucumber very good and spicy. I love Korean food but don't love BBQ. Highly recommend. Service good. Ambiance TL-style.
Im visiting SF from LA. I didnt get any good korean food in SF even I got a popular korean restaurant.

There's nothing I enjoy more than a hole in the wall food spot. The mom and pops here are very friendly. I like the spicy rice cakes most, but have tried fried seaweed roll, bibimbap (both decent), and of course their fried chicken (good).
Good food decent price, try the Schwarma!!!

Delicious! Best falafel I've ever had...it wasn't dry and it had sesame seeds on it-just mmmmmm. The guy that helped us was great and the food came out in about 5 minutes. I definitely recommend it to anyone that enjoys Mediterranean food.
Great spot for a late night meal after 620 jones or bourbon and branch. Try their chicken shawarma wrap - spicy of course ! Very tasty.

This place was definitely average. I wanted to like it because I am really into Mediterranean food. I feel that is like fast food Mediterranean quality but the food comes out slow. I've tasted better.
Wavered on whether it would be worth it based on reviews, but I decided to hike from The Pickwick. It was!

Interesting Egyptian Mediterranean mix here. To my surprise, I have not seen this hybrid before. I had the Chicken Shawarma plate. All of the food was good and their chicken and rice had a nice different spin on it, including the chicken being ground. I just wish there was a little bit of more meat.

Yesterday I went to this restaurant. I spent great time with my family.  Worker into restaurant are professional . They have  delicious foods. It has Arabica food. Also, the restaurant is  a quiet. I will back another time soon.

Food was so old, and When  I told the owner what's up with the food , it's so old and over cocked, he said how Egyptian food are. (I'm Egyptian )I would give this place 0 stars if I could. The food was terrible.
Amazing authentic Egyptian food ...just like home :)

So my birthday was this Saturday and mid hangout with my friends we got hungry. We called upon this restaurant and even though they didn't quite deliver to the area they obliged. They were the sweetest and even wrote 'happy birthday' on my bag. Great service and good taste as well as generous portions everybody was satisfied. I regreto not giving them enough tip, but I shall double next time I go :D

this is ONE excellent place to eat - i am eating the lamb & beef schwarma wrap as i am typing (and messing up the keyboard)  -- the meat is PERFECTLY spiced!   i ordered medium, makes me want to try hot next time!
Great service and excellent food.

Delicious! This was my first time here and I will go back. They have Egyptian style falafel, made from fava beans. Quite a bit different than falafel made from chick peas. I think it was more moist and flavorful than chick pea falafel. Yum!
Pretty tasty, but I wasn't wowed. I couldn't help thinking I've had better gyros/shwarmas in the city with the same price tag.
I would give this place 0 stars if I could. The food was terrible. I don't know if the owner has friends and family rating this place, but as an objective reviewer, the food was terrible. Avoid.

Typically I order delivery from this place. Ordered a falafel wrap to go "mild" .. I guess because I didn't tip the to go order they decided to make the wrap extra spicy. Thanks I really enjoyed your food until now

Granted our group came in at 2:00 AM on a Saturday night. I ordered a lamb and shawarma plate with added falafel. I thought I annunciated my order properly and even left a $2 tip. I was the last to order out of my group, yet mine took the longest to come out by like 20 min. By the time I got my order the rest of my group were either half way done or finished.

I was staying at a nearby hotel and ordered delivery and i was highly impressed! I had the mummy with fried chicken inside and it was delicious. I will definitely be ordering from here next time i am in town. The delivery wait want too long and the food was good. Get extra sauce, if your a saucy person...
As a vegan I've had my fair share of falafel wraps but this place just takes the cake. Spicy pharaoh wrap is where it's at! By far the best to date.

Pharaoh's has entered my regular "I don't wanna cook" rotation as one of the best takeout/delivery places in the area. The chicken shawarma platter is my go-to; it's juicy, delicious, and such a generous portion that if you get an appetizer, it can stretch to two meals.
This is a solid shwarma place. Food is flavorful and the staff here is super friendly. I'm a fan and will be coming back.

Top recommendations: #1 KUSHARI!! #2 shawarma plate. The meat is just bursting with flavor and not greasy; that's how you know it's cooked right. Comfortable atmosphere, very friendly staff. Left off the 4th star because their is no public restroom. Will be back for sure!
How can something that looks and smells good taste so bad..Fries were cool

Oh man the food here tastes exactly like the food back home in the Egypt country. And the portions are as generous as like I am eating at siti's (grandma). Trust me when I say this to you, the Egyptian grandmother feed their grandchildren very good. This place is a number one for the food and a number one for the service bas el location is a little too much of a garbage. Bas overall I still give a five star because I am a big boy and I like to eat sank me!
My  favorite  Egyptian Eatery in SF,..I LOVE it.
One night I ordered delivery including a hawawshi and a kebab wrap. This is what the hawawshi looked like as soon as I unwrapped it BEFORE I TOOK A SINGLE BITE:

Authentic Egyptian food. It is not high end, but it is very close to the Egyptian fast food cuisine. A few items on their menu can be considered from the sophisticated side of the Egyptian kitchen, for example the Bashamel Pasta is always a homey kind of meal. It was great to find it in a restaurant. Excellent place overall.

It's unfortunately that this was my first shawarma experience. I had been drinking all night, and was a bit hungry, the shawarma was really whatevers. I didn't really like it. The pizza next door was sooo much better.

I have the biggest crush on eateries in "not so reputable areas". Such food finds over the years have been a mix of great to aweful experiences, yet I keep looking and hoping. I have found myself next to pharaohs several times while hunting for spices in the shop next door. One of those days the smell of their sandwiches got me through the door, my +1 said "are you serious it is 3 stars on Yelp I'm not eating here" he checked Yelp again and this time it moved to 4 stars. Score, we sat down to order.
Pharaohs averages out between four and five stars, and it does for a simple reason-  TASTY!!!

I wish this place was closer to me! As a little Egyptian girl in California it's hard for me to find koshari so I was ecstatic when I learned about this place! I went crazy with ordering almost everything; koshari, ful, hummus, falafel and the lamb burger for the boyfriend.
(+): probably my favorite arabic food in the city. their eggplant is awesome, because it doesn't taste burnt like baba ghannouj usually does at mediterranean places.

Always wanted to try this place and after months and months of waiting I finally got the chance to. All I gotta say is that this place is DAAA BOMB! Ordered the lamb/beef and it was on point. Too good to pass and whenever I'm in the area mos def I'll be back.

If you're looking for a good experience in the tenderloin, you have many options. However, few of them are food experiences. Pharoahs is the exception. They're inexpensive, huge portions and delicious.The pharoah's falafel wrap. I can't recommend it highly enough.
Most disgusting food ever! I had to wait over an hour for delivery and the best part was the canned soda. Avoid this like a plague.

Recently ordered dinner from them with est delivery time of 45 min - had to call twice to get an update when we still had not received anything - food did not arrive till 2 hr 10 min from when we placed the order. Eating dinner close to 10:45 pm was less than ideal to say the least

You can't go wrong with anything here. Almost all menu items are less than $10 (the platters being the exception) and the portion sizes are huge. The wraps are so good with really flavorful meat and sauces, and the pita is always warm and grilled.
Koshari tastes just like it does in Egypt :) love this place.

I liked this delivery food. Definitely different flavors than what I'm usually used to (I usually eat Lebanese, Greek and Syrian) but everything was fresh and tasty. Delivery was fast and correct (despite a HUGE order) except it was missing hot sauce...but maybe they don't have hot sauce?
As we were leaving Swig...
I got a savory chicken special one. After finishing it, I couldn't help myself, I had to get a chocolate and banana for desert!

Crepes Ooh La La is a small, take-out centered savory and sweet crepery that makes a darned good smoked salmon crepe. I came around 8PM on a weekday night and there wasn't really a line. I got to watch the chef make the crepe right in front of me which was a great!  The pricing is fair (not cheap and not expensive for San Francisco) and this place is also not good for big groups as there isn't much seating at all. I absolutely loved the flavor blends of my smoked salmon, basil, and tomato crepe, and I think the only thing I would've done differently at my visit here is order a second crepe.
After a night of bar hopping, we all have at least a couple of needs before heading home to collapse in bed.
Great crepes and the place is owned by a French guy so he knows what he's talking about.
I love coming here! Their crepes are really fresh and flavorful. It's also open late night.
the best 'creperie' in the city. Crepes are prepared with passion by a Uber adorable chef. A must try!

Now Creperies is that a word? It is now!! Well they come and go. But this one should be here. It's delicious. Service was clean. Last time I was here there weren't on yelp but now they are! And they are always excellent. Whoever the gentleman was that worked pride weekend at night  (on Sunday) was excellent!! And always is.

The crepes here are so DELICIOUS! I tried a strawberry with nutella crepe and a King Lias (claimed as the sweetest crepe on the menu and that's absolutely true!). My favorite fruit is strawberries and I was surprised that the crepe contained so much of it! I absolutely loved that they do not skimp out on ingredients. I expected a tiny bit of Nutella but there was so much inside when I got it that it was hard to cut with a plastic knife since it kept oozing everywhere, but I'm not complaining. That's what I love about it! An overfilled crepe is simply amazing.
Decent price for yummy crepes. The amount of sweetness is just right in the dessert crepes.  you get a decent-sized crepe and have the option of adding whip cream.
$6 for a strawberry and Nutella crepe.
Excellent crepes and the staff are very friendly.

Pick what you want and put it in a crepe! Sounds good to me. I think they could to more with their own recipes though. There's not much happening creatively or in any culinary way. Its really pretty basic which is good, but not amazing. Same with the whole look of the restaurant. Its pretty plain and could use a redesign in a big way.

LOVED this, best crepe of my life. Had the king crepe walking to-go. Nutella+bananas+whipped+raspeberry+coconut+$7.00 for a huge crepe? I'm sold every single time. Killer crepe, fast and friendly service. Great little cozy spot on Polk.
5 stars for the best crepes in the city.
You almost have to ask yourself, why are you not eating a crepe today?

Well what can I say about this place...... I love it!!!!! Even though my diet wishes I didn't!!!!! I usually get the dessert crepes, yum who can say no to a crepe with Nutella bananas and raspberries.... As a mater of fact simply writing this review is making me want to go get one. Place isn't I'm the best of neighborhoods and sometimes there are bums by the front door which can be annoying. Also not very fond if the stench of pee when you walk out of the front door but hey that's the price you pay for loving a place that's located on sutter and Polk. The guy who works seems like he is there everyday 24 hours a day because I don't think I've been there yet without him being there making my crepe. They are open Til about 2:30-3am on the weekends so if you ever get a craving for something sweet or savory for that matter late night def give this place a try.

Was craving for something sweet and when I found out that there was a crepe place near my apartment I was so happy.  I've eaten in Crepes A Go Go in SOMA how different could it be.  Walked over to Polk Street. Crepes Ooh La La is in a good location situated around the restaurants and bars in the Polk Gulch.  It is a small space, when you walk in, it doesn't look very tidy and clean but my expectations were low. They have an extensive menu with different kinds of crepes to choose from from sweet to savory crepes depending on what you feel like ordering.
Love, love! (I would have put a third love if the place were a little hygienic)

Great crepes. I like usually get the one with salmon, spinach, caramelized onions, jack cheese, and tomatos. Great service from all of the staff. Opens till 3am on weekends. Good place to people watch drunk people after hours while your having a bomb crepe.

Literally my favorite crepe place in the world. This sweet man- I'm not sure if he's the only one who works there, but he's the only one I've seen in all the years I've visited this place - is so dedicated and thorough in his store maintenance and cooking. The crepes are large, delicious, warm and fresh. They're heavenly drunk food, too, and the place is crazy popular at night when people are bar-crawling up and down Polk st.
They have a really good savory crepe with spinach, artichoke hearts, and cheese.
Crepes are one of my favorite things in the world!  Crepes A Go Go is my favorite in the city, and Genki's is 2nd.  I've taken cabs just to go here in the evening.
always amazing for a late night snack.  Try to avoid the post-last call bar crowd though or you could be waiting for a while.

How often does one crave for crepes? You would, once you have tried this place.  I went back to France earlier this year and decided to do a taste test when I came back.  Bottom line, I kept coming back to Ooh La La and tried different crepes (savory/sweet) 4 weekends in a row.  Great-tasting, paper thin and fresh!  Personal favorites: Turkey, spinach, eggs & cheese; Nutella & banana; Fresh raspberry and cream; Plain chocolate.

Second time being there tonight. The crepe was good but not as great as the first time..the crepe itself was really spongy and had no crisp. I can't believe I'm actually writing about this but whatever.
PHA-NOM-I-NAL
I love quick delicious things.
Getting my crepe on!!
Yay crepes!
Bacon wrapped hot dogs, jack in the box, taco trucks, pizza stands....and then there's Crepes, the junk food's evil healthier cousin.
I absolutely LOVE this place! I always come here when I want something a little "different" than the usual Thai or Vietnamese food that is so abundant around my work neighborhood.

Let me start by saying that I have been a long time fan of this chain, tried all of their locations in the past, going back to when they were called "Crepes A-go-go", and have always loved the crepes. I think that maybe the night we were there was an aberration, but also it sounds like the main cook/owner wasn't there, so perhaps that made the difference.
Friendly service and the best kept lil' secret in the city! Friendly service and a smile are sure finds when you visit this Polk Street original!
okay changed my mind AGAIN.  came back here last night with a friend.  crepes were bigger this time i think because we were chatting up the cook and watching him make the crepe...
This place is awsome I had the Cheese, Smoked Salmon, Spinach, Avocado and Sour Cream Jalapenos which was excellent.

A small unassuming annex to a coffeeshop. This place is relatively new and the little frenchman working there is such a sweetheart. You can tell he's passionate about his creations, and they turn out amazing!
FOOD:
Cheese. Smoked turkey. Cranberry sauce.

It was after 9:30 PM and we got hungry so the decision was made to try their crepes. I liked the apple cinnamon and Kris liked her cranberry turkey so no complaints. This is a take-out kind of place and its located right next to several popular Polk St. bars. That's the primary advantage of this joint. Beware of the one man operation situation here because there's technically only one person working the whole restaurant :-).

A great crepe place, sober or drunk!! Good prices and a nice selection of ingredients. They lure you in, making crepes fresh in the window! Get the jack cheese/tomatoes/caramelized onions combo!! Total greatness!! And a few frenchies I know are fond of it, so that says something.

I think the only thing that deserved a 4 star out of the stuff we ordered was their goat karahi. The meat was cooked so nicely and the curry was superb. I also ordered channa which turned out to be too bland, garlic naan which just had chunks of garlic in it which i didnt like and gulab jamun at the end which were cold :-(... I just assumed all restaurants serve the gulab jamuns hot. Anyways, would prob just order their meat dishes if i end up going there again.

For the prices (~$8-9 per person), I was expecting much larger portion sizes. I actually left hungry after ordering a vegetable dish and one naan for myself. The food was decent and seemed more home-y than your usual Americanized Indian place.

Food had authentic taste, although the biriyani was not like the biriyani in India (coming from Kolkata, I am really fond of the Lucknowi school of biriyani, and I haven't found a restaurant in US which can match the taste). The chicken tikka masala and other side dishes were very spicy, so if you are weak in heart or stomach, please be careful. The lassi was great. I won't complain about the not so welcoming location or the shabby interior, very often in India, the old and authentic famous eateries don't try to score with their decors. But I can't see how it would do any harm if the people who work  here portray a little more hospitality.

Definitely one of the best Indian restaurants in the city. Been coming here for years and have never been disappointed by the food. It's flavorful and really authentic you can smell it from outside. The only problem I have about the place is it's location not the best but for this food and these prices it's worth it!
Two words : FOOD POISONING ...........

Heard a lot about this place. I have visited their other branch in Las Vegas quite a few times so was excited to give it a shot. Pricey but then again its SF, what isn't. Bad neighborhood, not that big of a problem. Its minutes on foot from union square. Took a long time before we were able to place order. Then waited another 45 minutes for the food to arrive. But that's usual at most restaurants which serve desi food. My only issue was the quality of the food being on the lower end of the spectrum.

This place I'd always crowdedness...same with chutney . Although they both have some featured items  which undoubtably are very tasty they can't compete with Naan n curry O farell ....... It's not as busy as these restaurant high .  I have no doubt that in the upcoming weeks shalwar will lose a handful of customers... To Naan m curry ofarell
The food was outstanding, great flavor and very fresh. Service was sparse with self service ordering. The ambiance was authentic based on my time in Pakistan.
ths place is in a not so desirable neighborhood. The food is great. I have been to the restaurant for years and love their chicken tikka masala and lamb and beef shish kabob.

I have been coming to this place for over 10 years. Mind you, I have tried Indian Pakistani food all over the Bay Area and keep coming back to this place. Its not much of an atmosphere and service is basic. Where they shine is their food and fresh naan from the oven. My favorites are the chicken tikka masala, chicken meatballs, meat kabab and brain masala. Mixing a side of onions with lemon on the side completes the meal with the warm nan bread. Its a pretty affordable and hearty meal one can get in downtown SF nowadays.

As good as it gets taste wise. Total dive in a bad neighborhood but I didn't  care, I loved the food here. Once I came in and their back door was open: a pigeon strolled in and was pecking at the tub of raw chicken on the floor. I didn't even care - I loved the food that much.
Authentic amazing been coming here for years love this place wish it was closer to my home

This place is almost a hole in the wall. It's sparsely decorated and somewhat sketchy-looking (like most of Tenderloin). The service is fine but not great (sometimes you have to try a little to get their attention). But the food...wow, this is some pretty great Indian food!
Best food you can have. Goat karahi is best. Service is excellent and very fast. Staff is very friendly and always happy to serve.
Review #1000. Had dinner from here last night and it reminded me of the food I had in Lahore, Pakistan -- fresh, authentic, delicious, amazing. Go.

This is a hole-in-the-wall with AMAZING Pakistani food! We went to this restaurant several times while in San Fran, and twice just for the chai! If you want authentic Pakistani food and chai, this is the place to go. It's not pretty, it's in a questionable part of town, and it looks like a typical fast food joint, but there is a reason it is Zagat rated-it is delicious!
0MG.

I went there for the first time yesterday, that would definitely be my last! I usually don't write negative reviews, but in this case I couldn't help myself. This place is filthy!!!! disgusting!!! I am surprised the health department hasn't shut them down! However the food OK. Nothing too delicious! But the place was soo dirty and there were a lot of insects!

My wife and I are pretty adventurous.  We're up for any obscure hole-in-the-wall dive if it promises authentic, high-quality ethnic food.  Unfortunately Shalimar disappointed in all respects.  We walked through a cloud of flies around the front door, some of which joined us for our entire meal. I had to give back some of the silverware because it was still dirty. After all that the food turned out to be meh, at best. Tandoori was ok. Okra was bland and kind of oily. I get that it's in the Tenderloin and everything.  I make allowance for that.  But these guys have got to get their act together.
My first time there was yesterday and it will be the last for sure
Really good Pakistani food. It's fresh, hot and just about the right amount of spice.
Four stars for the naan hands down!

Wow. It might seem mundane to order chicken tikka masala at an Indian joint, but this one is righteous. The blend of spices and the well balanced creaminess of the sauce is as good as it gets. Paired with naan and a mango lassi to cool down equals a happy me. The chicken boti wasn't as good, but if you add some green sauce from the fridge it helps.
First timer... good food. Really good prices and incredibly fast. I really enjoyed the chicken masala.
One of the best indian restaurants in the city. The food is authentic,fresh, quick and cheap. Not a fine dining option by any means, but great if you are looking for a quick fix of Indian food.
Good food and chai tea. Nan is hot and fluffy and the tikka masala is on point. All the standard indian dishes are up to par.

I can overlook the fact that the place is just dirty and ugly...but the quality of food was really bad. Worst palak paneer i ever had...under cooked and stale paneer pieces...not at all worth a visit..
Frequent this restaurant a lotttt - favorite place for Indian food. Basmati rice, chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and chai tea on the house hits the spot every. single. time.

I've always had good food here.  Anything from the clay oven, but beware if you plan on going to the theater after eating here.  It's so filled with mesquite smoke the people sitting basically on your lap at ACT will assume you're working for SFFD.

Not the cleanest kitchen/staff in the world but the food is good. Would I go back?  No. If you disagree with this review,  go in there and observe the kitchen staff and chefs how unclean they really are!!!  Thanks!
Wonderful food at a great price! It doesn't get better than that. The neighborhood is a little dodgy, but it's worth it.

The best indi/paki food I've ever had. It is a loud, not so elegant hole in the wall in a shady neighborhood with the best food. Come for the food flavors and authenticity. Don't come for customer service, clean environment and credit cards-----cash only foolz!!!

This place is "slap yo mamma" good! Not much to look at & the service is what it is, but the food is an absolute dream. The flavors & spices are ever present. I ordered all vegetarian dishes; rice, bhindi, spinach & cheese & chickpeas,  Accompanied with the lightest naan known to (wo)man. The spinach had such a kick, but didn't lack for flavor. The chickpeas were the absolute best I've ever had on either coast. So soft, buttery and perfectly seasoned; I think I've died and gone to heaven. I will be back here every time I visit San Fran. These men "put their foot in it!" All phrases in quotes are complements of the highest level!!!
they had the best chicken tikka masala.  it was great last year.  i went this year, and it seemed to have dropped a notch.  but i shall return and re-review if it goes back to my prior visits.
Shalimar is my new favorite Indian place in the city. It has no pretension. You have to go to the counter to order your food and the decor is...hmmm...let's just say plain.
HORRIBLE,

This is by far my favorite Indian food restaurant. I use to live in SF and would visit this place so when I came to visit the Bay Area I had to stop here. I brought my Dad and brother and they loved it.

This is my go to place for real Pakistani food. It's legit and it's a lot different from Indian Cuisine, so don't get ur shit twisted. Expect super spicy intense flavors. And don't get scared when u bite into a herb pod.. it's just part of the experiance .
Good quality food. We tried their Chicken Tikka Masal and Nihari. Both were to our expectation and would certainly go back when I am back in town.
My favorite - Goat Karahi and Chicken Tikka Masala :-)

Reliably delicious Turkish food in not-the-best neighborhood.  I have been to SF more than 50 times in the past 12 years, and i almost always fit in a casual dinner here.  Reminds me of the little diner-type places in Istanbul.   The burek and grilled meat plaster are not to be missed.
Typical moderate Turkish restaurant. I been in much better places. Prices are very reasonable but the foods are moderate.
The food was excellent and served pretty quickly. Service was slow however. Water and the bill were both difficult to wave down. Still, good food is worth small inconveniences, don't you agree?

I been coming to this place quite a bit and it's seriously it's always a welcoming place the prices are super reasonable and the staff is always friendly and attentive. When I go there I always get a side order of  Baba ghanoush dish and it's the best I've ever had its seasoned right and the constancy is perfect, the bread is another delicious thing they make there it's made right at the restaurant and I've had a few times rolls that where fresh out of the oven BOMB!! My other dish I recommend is the pides there delicious.
I would say I've been here/got takeout about 75x since it opened.
One word: beyti.
lamb beyti was phenomenal and filling. they don't seem to care how long you sit. I haven't been able to resist the rice pudding for dessert yet. kind service
BEST TASTING TEA EVER!!! Kebab meals always fill you up just right. Very relaxed atmosphere and excellent service with a smile. Can't ask for more.
Food was delicious!... believe I had the combo.  It was busy and we still got in, seated, and served like clockwork.

The best Turkish food in the city! Great portions, good price, loving the wall decor. If you in the mood for some authentic Turkish food this is a spot for you to come! Their bread is amazing, fresh hot and delicious! Its a hard spot to find parking, but you won't regret!

Possibly the WORST customer service of my life. But this was the best Turkish food I've ever had in my life, so I'll deal with it. Considering moving to San Francisco from San Diego just so I can be closer to this place- I've had dreams of their food since I left SF a couple of weeks ago. This is love.
Get for an appetizer:  PATLICAN BIBER KIZARTMA- Fried eggplant and green pepper served with red house sauce garlic and yogurt. Super tasty.
What can I say about this place. My boyfriend took me here and I was skeptical at first...which quickly changed. The service is good. The food AMAZING.

Fantastic dining experience. The only thing better than the food was the top notch service. I took my girlfriend here for her birthday and they went out of the way to make her and our experience feel special!

The doner sandwiches are terrible. And the service seems to have gotten worse since i first dined here. The waiters and waitresses seem to forget which tables they were attending too and are not even responsive to  eye contact by customers. Very unprofessional...
Some dishes are hit or miss but I really liked the Iskender. The rice pudding for dessert is the best thing ever
I'm a fan.

I was there once, and the food was ok. I've tried borek and lamb wrap, and (coming from a country where we eat turkish food on a daily basis), I'd say the food is 3/5. Service was good, friendly and fast.
Really a surprise!  Not a fancy place, but clean and very reasonable. Great food. Turkish food made really well. ..

A nice Turkish restaurant tucked away in the corner of the Tenderloin. Its located across the street from Dominos. They have fresh lamb and chicken doner/gyro, not the frozen Kronos garbage most places falsely advertise.
Iskander lamb is incredible. Tender soft beef and lamb. Hot bread and grape leaves are delicious!!!!!! I highly recommend this especially for Eurasian tourist, great taste of something familiar.
Great food. The lamb chops, chicken kabob and chicken beyti are some of the excellent items on the menu. Do not miss the Ayran yogurt drink. Simply delicious. And great hosts!
This place has gotten significantly better in the last year or so! Their kebabs plates are excellent and their deserts are great too!
I also googled the 7x7 article and thought the restaurant looked interesting.  Don't let the exterior and neighborhood fool you -- the food is delicious and the staff is warm and efficient.
Oh my wonderfulness!! A very nice place for traditional Turkish food.
I've been here, yesterday and Its best place to have a turkish food in SF i ever been,service is really good.

I googled best cheap eats in SF and an article by 7x7 popped up.  A La Turca was at the top of their list and it was Turkish, a cuisine I've always wanted to try. I ordered what 7x7 recommended, the Beyti Kabap and the Sucuk Pides. I had no idea what a pides was so I was happy to learn that it was cheesey goodness wrapped in the right amount of soft fluffy dough. The pides I order also had little bits of meat sausage in it. For the meat, I was expecting a different texture than a meat stick that's been slice into little pieces and mixed into the cheese. Still good.

I hadn't been here since moving from the Hood a couple of years ago. Went with friends who'd never been. A La Turca was just as good as I remembered. The food is so fresh and delicious, nicely presented and reasonably priced. The dolmas are the best I've eaten outside of Chicago. Salad that accompanies the entrees is crisp and good with housemade dressing. Rice pudding is exquisite. Turkish coffee done right rounds out the experience.
Had the ezme and heytai kebap. Both really excellent. Small menu, friendly service. Definite upgrade to union square places.
Real Turkish home-style cooking, just like the good stuff my BF's anne whips up back home in IST.

Don't know where to begin. Love all the food from entree to desserts. Love love the Turkish coffee. Favorites are the kofte plate & any donner plate.  The desserts are yum!  The cheese bread is a great starter along with the simple but delicious salad.

I was in this area for a sponsored party at a nearby bar and realized after a couple of drinks that I was in urgent need for dinner. There were a few Asian places and pizza-by-the-slice counter stores but figured a Turkish meal would be a treat. This place seems authentic and family owned.

Surprisingly good basic Turkish cafe in the Tenderloin.  They have a lot of Turkish street food standards, like gozleme, which I don't really see elsewhere, even at La Troya.  If only they had manti, they'd be perfect.

My hubby and I tried A La Turca for the first time for lunch yesterday. My review is based on the excellent Turkish red lentil soup I had there and the wonderful warm fluffy homemade bread. I had this kind of soup at one other place in Notting Hill London and loved it so much I hated to leave London, because where would I ever get it again. I could hardly tell the difference and am so happy to have a "go to" place for this soup. I also had their red pepper appetizer (ezme) and it was good, though not as good as the same dish in London. My hubby had the tripe soup (a special) and he didn't like it (he usually loves tripe).
This place is awesome on the taste buds.
Still very good. Was just back last week and the meats were excellent as was the hummus and fresh baked bread. Yum.
Stopped in by happenstance for lunch and was pleasantly surprised.  I had a wonderful chicken dish with great Turkish tea.  Service was top notch.  I'm sure to try again next time I'm in the area.
Guest Contributor:  The Wife

While not as good as the food I very much enjoyed while in Istanbul, this place is pretty good. I could live on red lentil soup alone and thankfully this place does not fall short! The kabobs and pides have also been good each time. This place also got some major points with me when they had manti as a special one night. I think they could greatly improve their salad dressings, or serve grilled vegetables like most Turkish restaurants. The price is also very reasonable.
This place is excellent. Very low key in decor but nice. The people are very kind and nice and the food is excellent.
Great sandwich place!

I'm usually there during lunch, which is great!  But the night staff is awful. Very dismissive. A little rude. I get you want to go home but that shouldn't show. The girl was very dismissive and the guy barely showed interest. I will go to Sliders next time.
Super relaxed atmosphere and tasty sandwiches.

One of the best sandwich/wrap shops we ever ate at. I ordered a bratwurst dog with the chili on top (this is not a menu item), the chili was fresh, nothing like those can tasting crap you find in some hot dog stands, the order comes with french fries. My girlfriend ordered the bbq chicken sandwich...lets just say we both devoured our food. We also got an order of the sweet potato fries...we are defenatly coming back for more.
Came in for some late grub around like 10. I got the cowboy my boy got a turkey club wrap.
Loved this sandwich place! A lot for your money, they hook it up with their toppings and most were under $10... Kinda hard to find 'round here nowadays! Staff was super nice too! I'll def be back!
Great sandwiches and wraps. Local feel and trendy decor.

Popped in for a late night bite after searching the neighborhood...this was all that was open that seemed unique and inventive.  I should have gone hungry.  The place is pretty divey but with good service.  The menu appeared very attractive to me...pork belly this, truffle that, blue-cheese stuffed this...but all that glitters is not gold.
I love this place. My husband and I come in all the time. I get the day after thanksgiving and he gets the fire cracker. They are both amazing. The Dutch crunch bread is great.
I am an easy person and don't ask much!
I happened to stumble upon this place and decided to go in for lunch. I ordered the New York sandwich. It was really good and a lot of food. Although a little pricey I will definitely be going back!

This place is great for sandwiches if you're all about getting value and more wrap or sandwich than you can eat for $8-$10.  The portion sizes here are enormous and half of a sandwich or wrap is the size of a fist here.  Our hero was comped an "Unholy Trinity" sandwich here by the server as his fries were incredibly late due to a backlog of orders at the frier.  They apparently only have one frier here and it takes a long time for them to process orders for anything fried.

This place almost deserves 5 stars, but since its a little pricey I have to give it 4. The Gouda Good is definitely my favorite and I believe their most popular. The Porkys Revenge is tasty as well, but I was a bit weirded out that their pulled pork sandwich did not have any barbecue sauce on it? Maybe it's just me but a pulled pork sandwich should have bbq sauce! The flavor is still great. My sister absolutely loves the Cowboy Melt. We also get the sweet potato fries and add garlic-yum!  Onion rings are delicious as well. Literally can't complain about anything here except the price. 18$ for a sandwich + fries and a drink is just a little steep!

After traveling from Sacramento, my boyfriend and I had just gotten into our hotel room at the Hotel Carlton when we realized that we hadn't eaten all day. We quickly explored the area, and we came across Eleven O One.
The cowboy melt and the Moshe Moshe are probably the best sandwiches you will ever have in your life!
Perfect for a late night bite, especially if you're bar hopping on Polk street.  I love the popcorn chicken, the fries and Sleeper or New York sandwich.  Don't forget to grab a cold Lagunitas too!

The food was good. I enjoy their sandwiches a lot. They're a little pricey, by my standards, but pretty good. I had their pastrami sandwich and my girlfriend had their chicken wings and they were both fresh and were well made.
OMG YUM! Great atmosphere,  everything so good. The Hanks Blue Bites delish. Gouda Good, Corn Dog, fries, chicken wings....it's all amazing.

I would give it a 7/5 if it was an option. This place was amazing. all sandwiches were HUGE- and delicious, and very reasonably priced. Stuffed with tons of meat, fresh veggies, and the expensive blue cheese.HANKS BLUE BITES, were also OUt of this world, with blue cheese and truffle oil. OMG, orgasmic meal, i couldnt even eat all of it. The salads were fresh and the garlic fries were also Very good, not too greasy, just right.... AMAZING!!!!!

Pretty bad experience all around. Took forever to get my food. The guy at the register wasn't all that friendly. My wrap was way too saucey and totally fell apart when I picked it up. Only to find out that there was hardly any chicken in it. Weak.
The sweet potato fries are delicious, served with a spicy mayo sauce.
The place is okay, maybe because I only got a salad. The portions are huge though, so there's that. Updated review to come once I eat something fried...
Only thing you need to know: this is THE best sandwich spot... Ever. Try the Unholy matrimony... Delicious beyond words. Staff very friendly & attentive. MUST try.

Nothing special about this sandwich place at all. They took forever and for what? Everything was bland. No seasoning, no sauce, no flavor, just mayo. I even had jalapeno poppers in mine and they were tiny, soggy and I couldn't even taste them. Just a disappointment all around. Even though its such a big sandwich with a bunch of ingredients, it tastes like nothing. It feels like such a waste.
Four words:  Blue Cheese Tater Tots.
1101 is a Great place to grab a healthy bite When In the loin. Their rotisserie chicken in particular is amazing and servings are generous.
The kitchen is clean. The dining area is clean. The food is tasty and affordable. What more could you ask for from a sandwich place?

Great sandwiches and generous portions. Large menu if wraps, sandwiches and more. Try the Gobble! Nice nook of a place and great for people watching in the Loin, or relaxing or catching up with a friend. Friendly service and the cashier was nice enough to run after me when I accidentally left my folder of papers behind. Thanks again and I'll be back to try some other great eats from your menu.
EVERYTHING is delicious! You can't go wrong!
This was good. Undecided whether really good. Will need to give it another try. Oh noes, poor us. ;)

Was craving a dutch crunch sandwich so made a short trek out from my office to Eleven O One. Extensive menu. Had the Gobbler. Very good sandwich. More meat would have been nice, but it was still sufficient for a quick lunch.

my new late night munchie spot, open til 2 am some nights.  food was hot and tasty, fresh cut fries.  the only complaint i could have, would be no salt on the fries.  but i ordered at 130 am, and was met with good customer service when i arrived.
I love the sandwiches from there, they are big and good, the only problem is that they dont have soft drinks or juices, only beer

This gem is amazing!!! Not only do they have numerous beers to choose from, a little upstairs area to enjoy your food. But the sandwiches are absolutely mouth wateringly excellent. I've done the fire cracked and the unholy matrimony. Both of which I'd highly recommend. Both times I've been there it seemed mellow and quick, very convenient and one of the best spots to eat quick on Polk. Plus I saw that they are open late on weekends now, 2 am.
this place has some decent chicken sandwich and salads. The service is great and the prices are reasonable. I eat here at least 3 times a week, and always had a decent meal.

This is my go-to place when I want a great sandwich and a glass of wine.  The staff is super efficient,  and the sandwiches are consistently great.  Pretty much any sandwich you can imagine is on the menu (plus some you've never imagined!), and they're very open to making anything you want.
Not helpful.  No sandwich.

I came in and left wondering why this place is under the sports bar category when there's nothing bar like about this place, other then the fact that they serve beer and wine, which we all know, does not a bar make. Elven O One isn't a bar but a place to sit down and enjoy some good eats. My friend and I were in the neighborhood to check out some places to celebrate my upcoming birthday. Both of us were hungry so I suggested we stop in. I ordered Hank's Blue Cheese Bites (tater tots drenched in blue cheese goodness) for my friend and I (even though I ended up eating most of them, I feel no shame), a Texas wrap that was oozing barbeque sauce and each jalapeño was more spicy than the first, and a Bitter American all for $17. My friend originally ordered a California Hillbilly wrap but after being informed they were out of pork decided to get a Texan wrap as well. One wrap could easily feed two people but we were both hungry and left our plates practically empty. The guys working behind the counter were friendly and gave good service. The décor was nice but the couches and throw pillows had some wear and tear. Next time I'm bar hopping in the neighborhood and in need of pre drink or after drink(s) food I'll spend my money here rather than sliders and I'll drag whomever I'm out with, with me.
Great sandwich spot, open as late or later than Polk St. bars most nights!
3.5 stars! Swung by here for a bite to get ready for drinking.

Came here for lunch at 2 pm today and it was busy!  The service was super fast.  The waitress practically takes your order while she is running around. I mean I was literally still ordering as she turned her back and walked away.

Unagi donburi was good, not the best I've ever had but still pretty good. The fish and rice overall seemed to be quality stuff but the options given on the menu were kinda plain. My biggest complaint though is the service. The server was nice but one of our group was served pretty quickly while the rest of us were waiting maybe 20 minutes which was weird bc it was like 3 or 4pm so it wasn't super busy. If you're looking for something simple and easygoing this is the place to be but if you're looking for some unique sf sushi then this might not be for you.

I should have ordered sashimi but decided to get the mixed sushi. I am usually a fan of salmon and tuna. However, I despise California rolls or any roll with imitation crab. Besides my hate for the cali rolls, everything else including the service was good. We had a good time dining here.

We found this place on Yelp and were enticed by all the great reviews. We were not super hungry for sushi, but wanted to see what the hype was all about. The restaurant itself was very cozy, warm and inviting; it has a couple separate sections, so it can seat more people than it looks.
Very good sign when a Sushi restaurant is packed with people from Japan! Good food and very yummy sauces!

The black cod with real miso beans sauce is memorable and 5 stars.  The eel donburi is great but expensive at $20.  Wife's tempura and sauce were excellent with three nice shrimps.  Service was okay as they kept up with water and tea but they weren't personable.
Well. This place is just average. Nothing special or appealing about the service, environment, or the food. It could as well fit in a strip mall in suburbia.

Wonderful food and service! Returned two times during our five day stay in San Francisco because the dishes were fresh, service was quick and friendly. The lady sushi chef behind the counter even remembered us and said "welcome back!" I ordered the uni in the avocado which you mix up yourself and it was amazing! Even better still was the naked uni you roll up in seaweed. You can tell the chefs really care about each dish they put out. Will definitely return as it was one if our favorite spots in SF!
Great sushi in one of my favorite cities.

I came in for lunch with my boyfriend and everything tasted amazing and so fresh! I would definitely have given this place 5 stars if the environment and the service had been a little more welcoming and friendly

Came here for my girlfriend's birthday last Friday. She made on a reservation  earlier in the week through the phone and when we arrived, we were told that her name was not on there. They were kind enough to squeeze us in, but the waitress rudely told us that we only have 1.5 hours to eat and we have to leave right away for the next part that booked it. Who rushes business away? I guess Sanraku does. We ordered a large amount of food and weren't full. They were also out of uni, which half of the party wanted. The Hamachi dynamite was one of my favorites along with the negitoro with quail egg on top. The shrimp & scallop nigiri were my second favorite. The donburi was quite flavorful as well, but was not a big portion for its price. the Sushi deluxe each had nigiri with wasabi in between the fish and rice, which was a surprise, but what disappointed me most was that all the sushi fell apart too easily. Once I picked up my nigiri or California roll, it broke and the rice grains just fell all over. Quality sushi never does that - thus my 2 stars. Probably won't return due to the service we got and the poor sushi quality.
I really enjoyed the food here. Red Miso - Akadashi and Shiro Maguro Poke Roll were both great! I also tried the salad they serve with a vinaigrette dressing, yummy! I really fell in love with that.

Stellar! Absolutely stellar! I only deprive this place of the elusive 5th star because I want to go back and try more rolls to confirm that is really is amazing through and through. I ordered a Spicy Tuna roll and a 49ers roll (sadly, my order did not help the Niners win:/). The spicy tuna roll was good! A well done take on this classic. But the 49ers roll- get it! The caramelized lemon was a game changer- so interesting and an addition which made it a standout! The crunch of the lemon and the quality fish made this roll clean, filling, and delicious. The service was great- highly recommend!
4.5 stars. I come to this place on such a regular basis for lunch that I would be lost without this cozy Japanese restaurant within 10 minute walk.

This is a quaint little place in the heart of union square. Nothing fancy and seemed like a lot of locals come here. We got here at around 6:30 on a Saturday night and had no trouble getting seated.  But it got quickly crowded right after that.
The food is very tasty. I discovered some new flavors. The service was very friendly. Absolutely loved the place!

Fantastic quality. Sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chefs and servers were really friendly and attentive. Started with the Arajiru soup and then moved on to the 49ers Roll, Shiro Maguro Poke Roll and salmon nigiri which were all excellent. Red snapper sushi was also available and loved every bite. Nothing bad to say about this place!

It's been awhile since I've gone here, and its just as amazing delicious as I remember! Actual bite size roll pieces (I'm not sure where the trend of huge monster rolls started, but I'm over it!), and soft and slightly warm sushi rice. Mmmmmm....

The interior is shabby. I can't remember what sashimi I ordered but I thought it was decent. Admittedly, I don't "know" much about sushi but I have eaten enough of it to know that what I ordered was neither here nor there.
Stopped in on the advice of the concierge of our hotel
Delicious, good service. Interior is meh but that's okay!

They were very busy and just managed to fit us in and everything we tried was excellent. Gyoza, sushi, sashimi and good service, reasonable prices. Place had a waiting line when we left at almost 10pm on a weekend.

There was nothing special about this place. The service was disappointing (seemed biased toward certain guests) and super slow. The salad dressing was probably the tastiest thing. The tempura batter flavor was good but it was not crispy. The chicken teriyaki was really dry. There are too many better Japanese restaurants for me to come back.
Service and quality definitely went downhill at this sushi place in past few years. Poor service, average quality, high prices not worth a repeat. Sad because few years ago this place was quite good.
I loved the food and outstanding customer service at this restaurant. Highly recommend the toro kama and can only say the best about Hirohito, the waiter who took care of us.
3.5 stars

We ordered both food and sushi for dinner. The sushi pieces (albacore, hamachi, amaebi, salmon, unagi, and uni were all great. The gyoza was also great. The beef teriyaki was too fatty for the pieces served
Great sushi, sanraku was my option and really enjoyed a good combination of shrimp and eel. The service was fantastic. It was really crowded but manage to seat at the bar right away
Amazing food, but the dinner menu is overpriced. Been here about 50 times and the service is always great!
Sushi here is fresh and affordable. I usually get the specials which is a steak for lunch at $10.50 per person. Tuesdays sashimi salad and spicy roll is my favorite.
Simply the best sushi place in the country. I have been to dozens of places, nothing comes close. My to-go place every time I am in San Francisco.
Great taste very fresh flavors! The king crab roll and Spicy Trio roll (although not very spicy) were awesome! Salmon belly...yum!!

Although I have yet to visit Japan, the decor in this restaurant is what I imagine to be stereotypical to what you would find in their country. Clean white walls, minimal decor, bamboo colored tables and chairs. Quite the opposite of trendy, but distinctly Japanese.

Really great, authentic Japanese food! The sushi was very fresh but there was also a good variety of Japanese for those who may not be sushi-lovers. It is a pretty small restaurant so make a reservation if you have a large group!
Really brilliant sushi.  Wonderful rolls but the highlight is their seasonal fish from Japan.  Had barracuda tonight that was amazing.
I like this place.
I like this place. I would love this place if the sushi served was a little bigger.
Great place for sushi. Service was awesome the sushi chef was amazing, seems loke he really enjoyed talking with people while working. Highly recommend.

I had a light and delicious meal tonight at Sanraku. Had the three seaweed salad (a Sanraku special) with light ginger dressing.  Also had the broiled makerel (aka Saba) which was tasty.  A lot of veggies.  The service was excellent, friendly and accomodating.  Great seating and atmosphere for single diners as well as groups.
Delicious, fresh sushi rolls. Great small location, friendly and professional staff. We ordered the Rainbow, Rock N Roll, Crunch, and their Specialty roll. All were on point.
So delicious. The place is quite small but the food is so good and inexpensive. Highly recommend if you are looking for a home feel kind of place.
The restaurant is a little small so it's definitely not good for large parties. The breakfast is excellent. Friendly, family owned and operated.

This place is a great hole-in-the-wall breakfast place. It offers generous portions at inexpensive prices. The hash browns, omelettes, or cream cheese-stuffed french toast won't disapoint.  The MA and pop owners are sweet and friendly.

It is one of the few brunch spots in SF that you don't have to wait in line. It's french toast and pancakes are HUGE - that will stuff your face. The place is ran by a korean family and they are quite friendly. And the owner will refill your coffee all the time. The only downside is that they don't have egg benedict... But the korean short ribs could kinda make up for that. The bacon and poached eggs are gooood. Ham could be a bit salty, so hit or miss. It is a brunch place, so prepare to come and leave with a satisfying food coma. It is definitely a hidden gem and I don't really want too many people to discover it.

Food was greasy, my breakfast sandwich came with no cheese even though I asked for cheese and they got creeped out when I asked for no meat in it and tomatoes instead. That seemed to have thrown the cook off and she therefore forgot the cheese. And I didn't get a refill of my coffee until after almost an hour. Food took 30 minutes to come out too. Friend's garden omelette was ok but it was very greasy. Took a few bites and decided it tastes like oily cheese. Maybe I'll try pancakes but eh, they probably don't have real maple syrup to go with them. I'll pass.
simple. amazing. good music.  good people. best breakfast. get the garden omelette with polish sausage

Had to stop in as our hotel was a few blocks away. Despite reviews was able to sit right down with no wait. Very much a hole in the wall with excellent food! Enjoyed the cream cheese French toast! Definitely a place id recommend and visit again! Just don't come too hungry because owner is the only one cooking but well worth the wait! Cheers!!

I feel like breakfast is pretty hard to get wrong. Maybe if I wanted to make this a whole day event I could see this being 3 stars. My coffee, whilst being refilled for a good 45 minutes went from: luke warm and watery to being 50 shades of coffee (read: they refilled it 8 times and no refill was alike). Tried to walk out, but that was not an option according to our apathetic/intense waiter. Really couldn't tell what the worst part of the food was, but it vacillated between salty, greasy, and burnt. Quantity for sure, no quality. Also smelled super weird in here.

The wait is long for food because a old woman is cooking EVERYTHING. Imagine what time she has to get to work every morning to prep for all the food she's gonna cook. She's probably at least 60 years old for crissakes. Then some fuckin assholes on YELP gotta make mean comments on the wait or complain their pancakes weren't 'perfect'. Man, fuck you guys!

I don't like to have to leave a bad review but this case was extraordinary. Me and a buddy decided to try a new breakfast spot in the TL, we waited for 20 minutes to be seated even though there were empty tables available. That was the first sign that the experience was going to be very subpar. I ordered two scrambled eggs with four bacon, toast and hash browns. I asked if I could substitute two sausages for two of the bacons since they were exactly the same price on the menu and he said no because the cook would become confused if I didn't order exactly what was on the menu. I said fine, and then we waited. And we waited. And we waited... after 45 minutes I got up to pay for the coffee and to tell our server that we were leaving. He said no, your food is ready, offered no explanation or apology and simply came and set our food down. At that point we decided to stay. The food was mediocre even for diner food. Most annoying of all however was the older Asian man that was our server and possibly owner of the establishment. He was rude and very unpleasant. I will not be coming back, I will let others know what they can expect should they choose to try this place. Bummer.

I am a fan!  Wonderful people who own this little hole-in-the-wall diner.  Good food, plenty of it, and very lovely sweet people who own the restaurant.  Their signature dish is anything with ham.  Best cured ham I have eaten.  Wait can long so not a good place if you are in a hurry.  Go when you want to relax.

Such a welcoming environment, was looking for a spot to eat near my hotel and moulin rouge was great!  They were incredibly nice and the portions were very big for very good prices!  Food was great!  Definitely happy with my choice of eating here!

This is a small, couple owned restaurant in the Tenderloin. While it is in a sketchy area, during the day it feels safe and fine. When we arrived there was no line and we were seated promptly. They do seat according to the number of people in your party, so don't expect to seat in a roomy 4-top if you're two people. The wife is very sweet and greeted us as we walked in. The husband is a bit aggressive and seems grumpy, but I think that's just how he comes across. He's actually quite nice when you don't ask him for things.

The cutest, yummiest breakfast spot. It feels like your in this couple's personal kitchen. They were so genuine and happy to talk to us. The food and service was beyond amazing and beautifully presented.  Everything was fresh and made with love. The owners are the cutest couple ever and it was a perfect experience. Definitely recommend going!!

This little place was pretty good. The couple that runs the place are super cute and super nice. The wait is pretty long, but the food quantity is huge. I don't think it was worth the extensive wait. I would have like the waitress to acknowledge our table or any table. We had to ask for water after waiting around 10 minutes with empty glasses. There was no apology for the extensive wait. They just dropped the food off and left, never to be seen again. We had to once again ask for water, but they were sure on top of it to drop off the check.

A warm and cozy kind of place you'd like to go when you have nothing else on your schedule or have a slight hangover. Don't worry about the wait because that's all you have to do here. Give the couple some time for their best services, and you too, take this quality time to chat with your companion. The foods are great and huge! Traditional pancakes, meatlover omlette and cream cheese stuffed french toast w/ bacon and egg are highly recommended
Charming spot for a hearty and tasty breakfast. The pictures speak for themselves. Loved the cream cheese stuffed French toast and the short rib breakfast

I would just come to this cafe because the old Asian couple that owns this restaurant are just too stinkin' cute! That aside, the stuff french toast is where it is. Don't be scared because it is in the "bad part of town" the walk over was not bad. The breakfast is TOTALLY WORTH IT.

If I could give ZERO stars, I would. My pancakes were burnt and crispy. My toast had pieces of hash brown. My friend ordered hash brown and a garden omelet and they were both drowning in grease. I asked for the check, I had no intention of not paying and the old man who was waiting tables asked me why I didn't touch my food. I said mine was burnt and he started raising his voice saying it was cooked right. I paid my $24.13 and was happy to leave.

This is a hidden gem. A mom and pop joint where husband and wife take care of customers, cook and do it all. Be prepared to wait as the owner cooks everything by herself! Food is amazing and portions are huge. You can tell these two take pride on their food. Delicious! Very recommended!

I dig the Mom and Pop vibe of this place. They treat their customers with warmth and courtesy. Ordered the Cream Cheese stuffed French toast combo because of the other rave reviews. I have to admit the French toast itself was pretty tasty, but not quite as decadent as I thought it would be. Maybe that's a good thing? The texture of it was great (crunchy edges with soft, fluffy middle), but the cream cheese was a little on the tangy side. I wasn't really expecting that, but it was enjoyable enough and I finished almost all of it. The bacon I ordered with it was cooked a little hard for my liking and was also kind of dry. The one scrambled egg that came with the combo was cooked so hard that I  really could not enjoy it at all, but I ate it anyway. The seating in this place is a little tight, not good at all for parties of more than 4 people. Don't think I will be back here soon, but I did appreciate the kind customer service.

This little ma and pa joint is cute:) the portions are HUGE and super yummy. The banana walnut pancakes are to die for! Not in the best neighborhood ( tenderloin) but its fine during the day. I definately reccomend!

Really enjoyed this friendly mom and pop breakfast spot! I had the garden omelette which was huge and filled with lots of nice veggies. The toast was also perfect. Hash browns are ok but a bit greasy for my taste. My bf had the corned beef hash which he enjoyed but said he prefers the ham and eggs. Coffee was also great and only $1.50!
My satanic, devil-worshipping ex-gal pal and I ate breakfast here almost every weekend. It's a mom & pop shop - that's mostly why I love it so.
i like their food, but they're so slow... we've been there three times, I'd say average 25 min wait from the time you order till you get your food.

This place is a city staple and a hidden gem. It is run by a husband and wife who have been serving amazing hearty food with great prices for 38 years! The banana walnut pancakes and the hash browns are delicious! They make sure to give you a huge amount of food and friendly great service. The food takes a little while to come out, but trust me, it is worth the wait.
This place is great. My family and I are visiting and stopped in for a home cooked meal. Great service, good food and all served with a smile.
Wow!  I can not believe we have lived a block away from this place for 8 months and we just happened to eat there today...we have clearly been missing out!
Good food that is not pretentious. Very fair prices and service from an older couple that reminds me of the good ok' days.

I could write for days about this place. My partner and I were in San Francisco for three days and we ate here two of the three days. Had we found it a day earlier we would've eaten here all three days. When you first walk in you're instantly greeted by the cutest Korean man and he sits you at the nearest table and takes your drink order. I'm not sure where people are coming up with this long wait time problem because we were not only greeted right as we walked in the door, but right when the drinks were brought to us we our food order was taken and delivered pretty promptly.
Banana walnut pancakes were delicious!!! The old couple who owns the place really made the experience though. They were delightful! Had no problem finding parking nearby at 10 am on a Saturday.

Go for the most adorable Korean couple that owns this place. Yeah the service is slow but that's because Mrs. Owner is cooking all meals by herself to order while her husband smiles as the only waiter. They did chastise us for not finishing our giant portions but in an "ooooo I want them to be my grandparents can I adopt them" way.

Best omelet in San Francisco, hands down!  Also spectacular has browns!!  Too small for groups lager than 4. Very comfy atmosphere, reminds me of a small restaurant in Paris I used to visit, and the customer service was prompt and polite, better than most restaurants in sf
My hashbrowns were overcooked and the sausage omelet was bland. The owners were very nice and friendly.
Great food and big portions that are value for money. Family vibe with friendly service.

I read about this place on yelp, and we decided to give it a shot for breakfast, as it was a few blocks from our hotel.  I had delicious blueberry pancakes, and we ordered a fruit salad that came with a nice, fresh selection that most diners don't offer.  The couple who run the place were very sweet.  If I were a local, I 'd for sure come back.

I've reviewed this place before but I have to say once more -- the best breakfast in SF, and perhaps the cheapest -- don't go in a hurry, but take your time to enjoy the throw-back decor and the sweetness of the staff...

Delicious homemade breakfast with crispy hash browns and an adorable moulin rouge theme that hasn't been updated since the late 70s! The mom and dad small diner here delivers tasty fresh food at a reasonable cost.
Sweetest staff ever and solid breakfast fare to boot -- and decor that took me back to my Glasgow childhood

I feel like this is one the last affordable, friendly, good food spots in the city (in most restaurants that serve breakfast, I feel like it's like, just pick one; affordable, friendly, or good). The couple who own it are super friendly and sweet! If you come in enough, they will totally remember who you, and they always serve a large amount of food. They don't have a huge menu, but they have quality food and service! You can't get better than this! And it's nice and tucked away. You can go in here and forget that the whole city is going to hell in a hand basket. I go here as much as I can ( I used to go A LOT because my good friend lived down the street, but now I just get to go when I crash in the city or decide that I'm going to trek out just for this breakfast...it's happened.)

Great food, but service wasn't great, and the ambience is terrrrrrrrible. They play korean music videos-- which probably deters 90% of their possible consumer base. I felt like I needed to be a 19-year-old girl to feel comfortable in there. Regardless, I liked the food. Would probably only do take-out in the future.
OMG i llluuuurrrveee 707. it is my FAVE korean spot in the city, BY FAR.

Food was pretty tasty but service was so-so. Came here because a friend was visiting from out of town.
