We had a total of 6 people eating dinner, but me and a friend were first to arrive and be seated. We weren't really served (ie given water) until more people in our party came. While we waited, I was pretty thirsty, and eventually I couldn't wait any longer and asked for a glass.  I learned that service starts once everyone arrives and is seated, otherwise you'll be pretty much be ignored.
Bad on so many levels, but they get an extra star from me because the service was friendly. (I'm tempted to say 1.5 stars?)

korean soju bang in the city...dark, loud and k-pop...young employees...order of soju $11 and pitcher of beer $15...drinks before deciding on food...group of four and on 2nd round of drinks in the city...budaejjigae (army stew) $26  to simmer on the table top...quite large and enough for 3 or 4 people...has a slight sweetness and buttery note to the broth...army stew is a mix of everything processed...hotdogs, spam, packaged ramen, msg seasoning packets from the ramen, and add vegetables and more...a stew from the korean war...armerican military bringing spam and processed meats...add korean noodles and seasoning...bring to a boil and enjoy...kimchi fried rice is $10 and good...mix in the egg and eat...soy garlic fried chicken wings $14 and lightly sauced in sweet sticky coating...pretty decent and $99 total for group of 4 after tax, tip and drinking...

We've tried bulgogi, beef skewers, potstickers and seafood pancake-everything tasted great! The portions are pretty generous. One star out for a very small variety of salad plates I am used to getting in all Korean places...

Truly great Korean food! It looks very genuine, much different than in the places advertised as "Korean BBQ". Everything I've had there looked interesting and tasted intriguing. They also have a great choice of Korean alcohols, both beer and liquors. A nice feature is a giant screen displaying kpop, which makes the food even better. The only downsides are the decor and men's restroom that gets clogged quite often.

First restaurant we ate at in San Fran! We had the Creamy Tteok Bok Ki rice cake, vegetables and bacon with cream sauce as our appetizer..omg it was DELICIOUS! Also, the dish is huge too...I guess you do get what you pay for because it's the price of an entree! We totally recommend that! For our entree, we decided to try the Bu Dae Jji Gae and see how it matches Pocha (my fav Korean eat in NYC)...and unfortunately, it doesn't match..Pocha's had the cheese and that was the gem that ties the whole dish together! Anyways, the food is still good and I will definitely return when I'm in San Fran! One thing that I really like about the atmosphere was that it is really airy which is great because I don't want to smell like grease after dinner.

This place is a little bizarre, what with the Korean pop vids being projected on the wall. But that was hands-down the best bibimbob I've had in my life. And the price for what you get is insanely low.

My first time trying Korean in SF.... I should have listened to my SF friend and driven further out west. I had been craving soondubu but the one they serve here tastes watered down and almost flavorless. The japchae was better although a bit too sweet, and the kalbi was just ok. The only thing that came out perfect was my lychee martini.
Came here around 1am after enjoying a tipsy night at Bill Graham watching The Weeknd/ Jhene Aiko/ Schoolboy Q.

707 is a decent Korean restaurant. They met all of the standards, but didn't have anything extra. The beef bulgogi was very well-seasoned and tender.  My rice bowl with spicy pork was also tasty, but the pork was a bit fatty.  They did not have pickled cucumbers or Korean potatoes, which are my 2 favorite sides. The beef dimpling soup was average. The restaurant was a good size and full. Yet there were only 2 wait people. They were running with their heads cut off. The girl was a bit clumsy and spilled things and ran into chairs and table.  We had the guy. He was pretty good, but too busy for his own good.

Always the spot when I want a late night bite after work. This is in lower nob by the way, not TL. Servers are always attentive, small Korean dishes or banchan are always tasty, fairly large menu, atmosphere is trendy with kpop playing from a projector to the wall.

Food was great, came to the table piping hot. Ordered pot stickers which were amazing and spicy wings which had a deliciously sweet spicy sauce on them. Ordered the beef as well which was really good as well. Atmosphere is casual and staff very friendly. I will come here again!

the best tofu soup i have tasted to date..very flexible, can make a lot of items vegetarian if needed.. excellent service, extra helpings of the pumpkin appetizer upon request (a must-have)..minus one star for the guy on the phone who said the wait was an hour plus (we got our table in 20 mins when we go there)..will definitely go back!
Good food, good vibe, good service! The projector playing Korean pop also contributes to this cool hip place.

First time trying here, me and my girlfriend (she's Korean and she hated it) ordered corn cheese, beef soft tofu soup and bibim nang myun (spicy cold noodle) and it does NOT taste good. The soup doesn't even taste Korean and it's really salty. The cold noodles aw really saucy which was why it was also salty. The only thing that was good was the corn cheese ($6) which can be easily made at home. Their food is too pricy for it's taste! Don't come here!!
DON'T get the soon tofu here, especially if you're not inebriated. If you ARE, then this place should do just fine for you.

So all this time the good Korean restaurants were hidden around the TL!! Like Cocobang, 707 Sutter is has casual atmosphere serving the usual soju and beers along with your late night cravings for fried chicken, dukbokki, and casseroles. Then there's the usual soondoobu and bimbimbap but that's not the focus here (that's right--I never order tofu unless I'm held at knifepoint. They are evil blocks of soy).
Went here for the first time last night. Service was good, K-Pop rockin', but had hoped for better on the some dishes. By the way, this isn't Terderloin - it's Lower Nob Hill.

came here two days ago for the first time, and I would def come back. service is great, food is great. we ordered a soondobu with beef and grilled salmon. soup was nice and spicy, just how I like it. the salmon was good too, not dry and went really well with the onions in the sauce.

We were in a group of around 20 people. We was a little drunk so the food tasted very good!! Edward the waiter was very friendly and gave us a very good service! But the short korean girl was like not happy with her work I guess so she was cold and not friendly at all. Over all the food was alright~ good enough if you are craving korean food!

Came here before a show in the area, made reservations for 9:30, we walked in and noticed that all the tables were taken..hmm..the manager or whoever came over and said that they have people leaving soon and that we'll have a table ready soon.  My question was just what if that weren't the case? lol seemed pointless to have a reservation if they don't reserve a table.
As good as the best in LA's Koreatown, but shockingly reasonably-priced for a restaurant in Downtown San Francisco.

Great korean food (for SF). Seafood pancake, japchae, soft tofu, ribs, and etc. Ra bok ki looked amazing but we didn't order it and I will definitely be back to get that. The fried chicken was okay but nothing like bonchon which I really really wish they had. Blue moon was $15 a pitcher.

This restaurant gets 4 stars only because of the food. I came here with my family   is yesterday, and we were concerned about their service cause it pretty much sucked. the only had two people working. One was working as the server, host, and cashier while another person was a lone ranger in the kitchen. One person in the kitchen isn't the best idea for a restaurant that is always filled with tourists. Anyways, they had amazing food that made us wanting more.

I've made a lot of great memories at this place over the years. The restaurant feels pretty spacious relative to a lot of its competitors. The service is always very nice and doesn't freak too much out when we come in with large group. It's a great place to just hang out.

I've been here about... 4 times within the month and needless to say, I do love it here. They're open till 2am, got great service (props to the waiters who don't need to write our orders down!), delicious Korean food, and a home-y environment. Although, I believe the music videos on the projector could be a little loud, I think it's a great conversation starter!

Late night craving for some Korean comfort food and don't want to leave downtown? Don't hesitate and head over to 707 Sutter. This isn't an ideal date spot (way to loud), but probably one of the best places you can go to if you're looking to host a small to large group of people with food and drinks.
Food:  We ordered Jokbal and Dubu Kimchi.  The pig's feet was absolutely delicious and the consistency of the meat was perfect.  Dubu Kimchi was good too but a little bit on the sweet side.

Came here because my boss took me out for my birthday lunch. Their seafood pancake and tofu soup were my favorite! Coworker wanted to try their pig feet but it was too much! Will be back to try their soju!
It was an unexpected visit after an unsuccessful trip visiting the Ramen fest.

DELICIOUS! This was my first time having Korean food and I did'nt know i was missing out on such great food! I ordered the Soft Tofu Soup with Kimchi and it was spicy and good! I was recommended this dish from my Korean friend and I am so glad I listened! It was amazing and I am going to be back and try it again!

Only visit here was some of the best Korean food I've had outside Seoul. The seafood pancake was delicious, as was the kimchee jigae and Mandu soup. Not as impressed with the chapjae, and the dolsot bibimbap was good but would recommend trying something other than the seafood variety.
I've been here twice now, and I'm giving 707 the benefit of the doubt. The first time was great, but the second time was slightly mehhhh.

Maybe this place would have done it for me in my early 20s, but probably not.  Walked in to get take out and restaurant was extremely dark and the music was blaring. It was after 10pm, so I will give them that, but I would still not eat dinner here if this is their normal atmosphere.  Ordered the Kimchi Fried Rice to go...the servers were polite enough, and the food came out within a decent period of time.  But the dish itself is mediocre at best.  It's like hamburger helper made with rice and spice.  Not sure I can finish it it's so unsatisfying.  Not going back.  There's better Korean in San Francisco.

Been here a couple of times and it's now my favorite place to go to whenever I'm craving some dukbokki! They come in a pretty large serving and I recommend the creamy dukbokki, it's AMAZING!! Out of the times I've been there, it's usually not very packed and the service is pretty quick. Also love the kpop videos the sometimes play with an overhead projector onto the wall.
YUM!

After a long day out of town, my boy friend and I decided to go for Korean food. This is probably the first Korean restaurant that I had ever gone to besides Korean BBQs. When we arrived, the restaurant had dim lighting and soft music playing in the back ground. The waitress greeted us accordingly and we got to choose our seats. First off, 707 Sutter's menu is GREAT. I am a picture type of person (which is why I look on yelp before ordering at many restaurants that I have never been to before). My boy friend and me ordered tteokbokki with ramen noodles and kimchi fried rice. After we ordered, the waitress brought over a long plate of mini individual samplers of kimchi, veges, noodles, and fried tofu (I believed).  When our meal arrived, we dove in. I honestly loved the dishes that we ordered. It was yummy!!
Service was very good.  Food was okay.  Music was great if you are a Kpop lover.  It was funny watching PSY vomiting in the toliet (Hangover music video) while we were having fried chicken and beer.

I have no clue what the owner is saying when he talks to me but the food is damn good. I usually get the rare steak and brisket, both cuts of meat are very tender and of high quality, the broth is light and refreshing. The prices here are a bit higher than most pho restaurants but it's not unreasonable.

The best cure to a hang over.  The broth was good and flavorful and they don't skimp on the noodles/meat/broth.  It's in the TL but not too far from Union Square, so you can eat quick style then gtfo.  We got plain pho and #23, which has brisket in size medium and large.  Sounds like we're talking t-shirts, but if you're going to get the large, come prepared with a big appetite.
Found a cocoon of some kinda of bug on a piece of basil. When I came back the did nothing but give me more bug infested basil. Horrible service and over priced.

This place is great. Had #12 Rare Beef. Medium bowl was a little too much for me to finish. Nice family wait staff. Place is pretty clean but a little stagnant. But let's be real, you go here for pho, not for the decor. Decent pricing, cash only. Definitely worth checking out. It's legit. I'll be back.
I got a #23, which is is the Beef Pho with well done brisket, and a condensed milk coffee.

Meatball, tendon, rare on side. Rare was VERY thinly sliced (great), tendon a little soft but good and plentiful, Broth was great, dark and complex. Served w/extra small bowl of broth only to get ur bowl back goin at the end. Sawtooth coriander always a plus on herb plate. Loved it.

Pretty good food, and the service is so quick! I had the BBQ shrimp bun vermicelli and egg roll, and it was filled with delicious lettuce, mint, and tons of rice noodles. I loved the side sauce that accompanied as well!
your standard pho place. can't understand anything the owners say. cash only, pay up front. variety of choices. but let's face it, when you're hungover, you just want a large bowl of rare steak pho.
#21 pho well done brisket and tendon = win! I ate it all.

Ever since I found Golden Star, I've been hesitant about getting pho anywhere else, because, well, they're pretty damn good. So, when my friend suggested that we all meet up here, I showed up with a bit of skepticism, that dissipated pretty quickly once I got my #8 pho.

A typical authentic Vietnamese spot in a really dumpy part of town. I have no idea what the guy that sits you is saying, and I don't care. Feels more like Hanoi that way. Solid portions, solid Pho (that beef broth!), not solid prices. Almost $9 for 4 tiny egg rolls is a bit excessive. ***Cash only*** and not open at night (not that I'd want to be anywhere near Ellis/Jones at night), however a great lunch time spot to grab a bowl.
Great tasty beef pho yummy cha gao egg rolls fast service.
Unfortunately I didn't have Pho here despite it being a pho establishment. I did have the shrimp roll appetizer which was pretty large and too heavy for me to finish on my own, but tasty nonetheless.
Prob one of the best soup base in the city. It's really sweet and tasty! Portions are good everyone seemed happy w their food. Only down side was the spring roll and egg roll... Blah!
Super tasty food. I'm one of the only white guys there. Love it.
Consistent and delicious, one of those go-to places for a cheap bite. The service is great, i get the number 41, grilled pork and imperial rolls, a must!

GREAT food, SCARY neighborhood.  I went at 8:30 a.m. on a SUNDAY, and there was a bum war going on right in front in the street!  its sad because the restaurant is clean, food fantastic, and service pretty good.  My pho tai came out in TWO minutes!  And it was piping hot.  Granted, the restaurant was half empty, but the food was very good, and they give you a whole lotta meat!  I wish they were one block east away from the Tenderloin.  Location is the ONLY thing that makes me hesitate to return.  Otherwise, great food, good service, and clean.
Well I can't remember if I ever had Pho or not. It's reminds me too much like Ramen but from what I can tell it was pretty good.
Flew cross country. Hangray. Wanted some phõ. Yelp helped!
6 of us, 2 ordered of egg rolls and it came out to $87 bucks,  NEVER again!

With a bunch of New Yorkers who really wanted to try Vietnamese food from San Fran since ppl say it's better than NY. The spring rolls and summer rolls are definitely   better. But it is also a lot more $$. The soup base tastes more home made and less msg. There were a lot more meat like all other reviewer stated but I didn't like the noodle. It has a rubbery/elastic texture that's kinda weird.
Phos were huge and had lots of meat! Soup was flavorful but the noodles were overdone which resulted in a mushy mess. Spring rolls were crispy and tasty. Summer rolls were also very good.
Excellent service.
You can order a Small, Medium, or Large size soup. The broth is delicious. They throw a lot of onions and cilantro in. All of the ingredients were extremely fresh.

All I got to say is dhiarea.  This was the only thing I ate all day the beef and beef ball pho and eggrolls. The beef soup and beef had that weird old meat iron taste. I said to my friend this taste funky and I joked lets see what happens in a few hours. Dhiarea happened.
Great Vietnamese place in Little Saigon. The bossman is hilarious and a great host. Food is always fresh. I've been to Vietnam and I can say that this food is authentic. Would recommend for lunch.
I like pho! so much. You should come here if you are sick of american big dish or big Mac.
the only place in sf that i can find with good chili oil! and the size of the small is so huge! love it

Came here on a rainy day with a group for  soup. I had a chicken pho, this was my first pho, didn't really know what I was getting myself into, but I would recommend it, just super messy to eat unless you get a system down.

Ordered the chicken pho with young eggs. It was my first time having young eggs and it is just like a firmer, smaller egg yolk. At first, I was disappointed. Where's my chicken, I thought. But as I started eating the pho, I noticed more pieces of meat popping up to the top of my bowl and the noodles disappearing. Holy moly the meat to noodle ratio was awesome!
Best Pho I've had in the city.  Usually very good service, but sometimes it gets a little busy.

If I went by service this would be a three star.   I went by appearance this would be a two star.  If I went by neighborhood this would be a one star.  But, if I go by food quality and experience alone, this is a five!

I had the well done brisket tendon and tripe pho. Initially I came here bc it was open early in the morning. A nice gentleman offered me tea when I arrived. Score. Friendly staff in general. Broth was not thin or thick. Taste wise pretty good. Noodles were firm - half way through I gave up on trying to squeeze-cut them with my chopsticks and instead began to inhale them. Simple interior. Not in the best part of town but if this little Asian girl could walk 3 blocks alone then no biggie. Bill came out to $9.40 inc tax, FYI.
AWESOME!

Pho Tan Hoa has some of the best Pho in SF. The service isn't amazing as the staff barely  speaks English, but with that being said they didn't mess up on any of our orders and everything was delicious.
Little hole in the wall that is AMAZING.
this is one of my favorite Vietnamese restaurants in the city. I go here once a while I crave viet food.
This is my go-to pho spot in SF!
Pho Tan Hoa exemplifies everything I hate about San Francisco.

My measure of a good pho restaurant is how they do the special pho or the "Pho Dac Biet" it has all the meats on the menu in it. I thought this place was very good however what turned me off was the price. I'm used to paying 7-8 dollars for good bowl of pho and that's usually for a large. Because I'm trying the whole "maybe you shouldn't eat until you hate yourself" diet, I was turned off that I paid 10 bucks for a medium size.

I went for lunch and having previously eaten Himalayan food in both Utah and SoCal, I was expecting the same amount of heat in the food. The quality and taste the food was delicious. They cook the meal fresh upon ordering. Please note there is a wait, as this preparation takes time it is not served from a steam table. The only con is they needed to make the food a little more spicy. Perhaps in San Francisco people are not used to more heat and I had to ask for more spice to be added to the dishes. However, over all the flavor of the food was savory, moist, and definitely pleasing to my palate. Service was attentive and we felt very welcomed in the restaurant. If you enjoy Himalayan food this is a definite place you must try.
Outstanding flavor.   Simple,  authentic and deliciousness.   Food is on point, spice level it up yourself.
Just visted this place again. After a long time and they changed the menu a bit, after i asked , i got down to the following...
Great authentic nepali food. Service was quick and food was great. The price is great for the bay area. Definitely would go again.
This was my first visit -- I'm usually all about Shalimar. But this place was good. Great spicy veggie main dish, scooped up with chunks of their house naan. I will be back -- you should visit.
My partner and I stumbled on this place and decided to try it. So glad we did. I had the lamb achar and she had the chicken tikka masala, both excellent, as was the garlic nan.
Yumm!!!! Lamb Saag, Garlic Naan, Onion Naan and Vegetable Momo.  I love this place.  I try to make it every time I'm in SF.

Not what I would call a light hand with the spices. Probably single-handedly flaoating caraway seed futures, but completely adequate Indian food. Had tikka masala, samosas, rice, and the aforementioned potato + caraway and fennel seed naan. Totally fine. Satisfying on a Friday night after a very long work week.
Ordered for the first time for delivery.  Had samosas, daal, paneer masala, garlic naan and chicken tikka masala.  It arrived more or less on time and most of it was still piping hot.

I ordered from Red Chilli on Grubhub.  The order was over an hour late.  GrubHub claimed to be contacting the restaurant and kept providing (inaccurate) estimates.  Finally the delivery arrived.  Ice cold.  Sullen delivery guy.  GrubHub informed me that after repeated calls the restaurant would not issue a credit.
Wonderful food at a great price!  I was very happy with the service, nicely sized portions.  I had the plain nan, basmati rice and saag paneer.
The food here tastes exactly like in Nepal and their momo is just amaaaazing! :)

I ordered lunch from Red Chili for a working lunch meeting. Our order was: butter chicken, curry shrimp, naan, rice, samosas, vegetable mix, saag paneer.  Roshan was very friendly and responsive via email and while talking on the phone - he wasn't just about the sell but wanted to provide the best dishes that would compliment each other.  The food was very tasty, delivered on-time, and actually Roshan provided extras beyond what I ordered. My group enjoyed it very much.  I would recommend Red Chilli for any lunch meetings.  I actually had someone come into my office yesterday who was impressed with the lunch and wanted to inquire which restaurant provided the food. I have't visited the restaurant yet but am hoping to do so soon.
The food gets five stars!

I love Indian food and red chili was awesome. I had the vegetable Somoza, garlic naan, chicken momo, and dal soup and was in heaven. I never got to tell the waiter that the meal I had was the best meal I've had in a long time so hopefully this review gets through. I'm definitely going back to try everything on the menu.
The momos were pretty good - would have still given these only 6.5 on 10 in Delhi, but this isn't Delhi. Haha!
Good food and price. I've had better pad thai though. Close to my house and plenty parking.

Good food at good price. That would summarize the place nicely in one line. We liked chicken achar and garlic naan. Mixed vegetables were okay. Its a small place, has a unique setup. You can see what's going inside the kitchen. One downside was the locality it was in, saw a lot of homeless people on the street.
The food was good

The prices are right.  The food wasn't bad but also not very memorable.  It made my bowels absolutely explode before I even left the restaurant.  I would come here again if a friend wanted to - it wasn't that bad!
The service was great and I loved the Chicken Tikka Masala. The spice was just right...the garlic naan was crispy and light. Our waitress was pleasant.
decent hole in the wall if you are looking for indianesque Nepali food.
Terrific service and excellent food.

Food was okay but the service was terrible and we were treated unprofessional.  We were treated okay until we ate and paid then rushed out by the pudgy woman.  This hefty one even had the audacity to tell us we were at too large of a table and had to leave after we ate - what a Lahore.

Red chilli is thay best food ever I eat.  Soo delicious good customer servicemen I had lamb tikkal Masala is sooo good and yamm . Also order the chicken tender is the best ever I eat .  I will be back this week for sure .

Very mediocre. Did takeout Saturday 5 pm. Tikka masala. Tibetan dumplings. Grilled Tandoori sampler. expensive and dry for $17.95. Tiny ras malai and gulab jamun that sated like breadcrumbs. Naan very pancakey and meh. Skip it much better choices. Not even close to mehfil.
The 1 star was because I feel generous.

Came here for the first time since I hadn't had Nepali food in a long time.. At first glance, it seem like the vegetarian dishes were the only once with authentic Nepali dishes.. The meat dishes seemed like the regular north Indian dishes

I ordered take out delivery from this place and it's take 2 hours. If the food is on point I'll update my review and give it the appropriate stars but for now this is redic. This place is 1 mile away. I could have walked by this point! Geezz!!!

Delicious food at great prices! I had the Nepalese lunch special - a delicious and flavorful combination of a garbanzo dish, potatoes, chicken special, and pounded rice. It was definitely a spicy / flavorful meal, but thoroughly enjoyable. A perfect hole-in-the-wall restaurant with quality food that is not overly oily. The service was friendly as well.
Yummy yummy food in my tummy :)
Good Indian delivery. Fresh yummy food. The bengan bhartha could have been creamier. CTM was really good. Shrimp tandoori too.
Although you rarely see the name "Chilli" spelled this way outside of strip clubs or R&B girl groups, don't go thinking their game is weak.
Went on a Wednesday night. Quiet. Lots of seating.

Absolutely delicious and very affordable...what a value! The food presentation was good, the dishes were fresh, the garlic naan was light, fluffy and flavorful, and the saag paneer was spiced just right (with slices of ginger on top).
5 stars for food

Heads up: VERY DIVEY! Place looks like what I would imagine an authentic diner in India might look like. But nothing wrong with that... Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because last time I went for dinner they had run out of chai... And let's face it, bottomless chai is half the reason why we love these places! Other than that, excellent curries, samosas, deeeelicious garlic naan. Quick service too.

We have only gotten take out from this place. The food is consistent. My favorites are the Saag Paneer, and their Momo's are amazing. I feel like Kung Fu Panda...I can eat a million of those little delicious dumplings!!

Delicious!  Great prices, outstanding momos (taste just like those I had when I lived in Nepal) and terrific, buttery naan.  Wait staff was kind and attentive.  Only downside was a not so great odor.  But that didn't stop me from enjoying my lunch.

This is one of the best Indian food places for  late night chowtime -Don't go by the neighborhood or the size of the place - these folks show the true  spirit of wholesome Indian/Nepali food at unbeatable prices!

Went there to eat tonight. One word for it....PATHETIC. I have been eating here for the past 5 years, at least once a month. But there quality of both food and servic has gone down the hole. The guy at the counter taking the order was so rude. Except for the naan all the food we ordered was tasteless. When we complained about how bland and tastless the food was he tells us that he did not force us to come here. This place is for people who have not tasted real Pakistani or Indian food. Go to Shalimar or pakwan instead, at least the food is genuine. Get your money's worth there.
This place used to be wonderful. Paneer tikka masala WAS the best. Has undeniably gone downhill recently. Not quite sure what happened but definitely on the hunt for a new place to call home.

Chicken Tikka Masala is fabulous. The chicken Korma curry tastes great too, but the meat is full of little bone fragments etc, which is insanely annoying and takes all of the fun out an otherwise decent dining experience.
I truly do not know what to pen down in this review. Because I am so disappointed and the only word that comes to my mind, is "meh".

I crave soup for lunch after a night of drinking. For dinner, I crave Indian food! Not sure why. It's just warm and comforting to me. I can never make the minimums for delivery when ordering for myself. Plus I've been bored with all the Indian places in my neighborhood. Last Friday, I decided to pick up take out by work on the way home. Ordered via
Pretty nice place . The curry and naan here are awesome. BTW, I would forget the kabobs.
I love CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA and fish tandoori when the fish was not burnt.

I don't like indian food usually my husband wanted to go there so we gave it a shot, OMG unbelievable,  the food is soo good and their bread is to die for, i will be definitely there again, specially for their tea

Chutney is one level above hole-in-the-wall. You still order, pay at the counter and it's BYOB if you want to drink alcohol but it's less cramped, better lit and a more pleasant dining experience than most of the other 'loin Indian establishments.
This place is absolutely amazing.
I ate at Chutney earlier tonight after about two years (the last time the food was just average).
Good food. Good prices. Bunch of liars.
My friend had a complaint about the service and the cashier told her to "get fucked." Incredibly rude. Don't go here.

I've gone everywhere in San Francisco looking for good Indian food... after one taste, I knew this was the place. The Indian food is rich in flavor and the service is excellent. Try the chicken tiki masala, the lamb biryani, chicken tandoori, and of course the garlic naan.
CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA, NAAN and TEA.
Delicious Indian/Pakistani food. We used to go to Naan And Curry but this place won us over. Hard to beat. Free hot chai tea in the back.
I walked in based on the high rating. As I waited for my takeout I read the reviews of the last months - they all talked of seeing roaches! :-/
This is the best Indian restaurant. My favorite food is Tandoori Chicken & Naan.

Love the very non-authentic food but excellent regardless. Dodgy neighborhood in the Tenderloin, and a few health things for those who are squeamish but way better than the nearby comparables shall we say. The odd roach, given, the overall context, is nothing that I've ever seen and wouldn't deter me anyway and I've been there dozens of times. Go there and feast for $20. Love the place. Pack heat after dark (kidding, but use a cab.....). No booze as it's a muslim place but that's not the point of it...
Good lamp chop kebab !!!! Perfect naan and good tikka masala .

Chutney used to be my go to clean and reasonable indian..but as i stood waiting for my to go chicken roti order i watched as the chef reached into the pre-cooked roti bucket with his bare hands and disturbed a baby roach on the rim..

No roaches that we saw, pretty clean actually. All-you-can-drink CHAI. If you care about the food after that last sentence, let me say that it was very good, with the only drawback being that my lamb was on the bony side. That said, the authenticity is way up there. Delicious and great service and cheaper than any Indian food in my hometown by at least $4 a plate. Would definitely go again.
Always end up eating here when in town.  Not impressed with the decor, but Good food, great price; what really matters.

There are no words to describe how good this place is.  As my girlfriend noted, the only thing audible out of my mouth whilst eating was a series of grunts that confirmed the greatness of this meal.  If you like Indian food, Chutney is a must. In fact, Chutney is a requirement if you are in the city.  Now if I could only convince the owners to expand into the South Bay...
Service was nice. And the ambiance was pleasant. Though from previous reviews I expected the best chicken tikka masala. It was ok in flavor but the chicken was tough. Sad face.
Horrible experience.  Ordered chicken saag and seems days old stuff. Had bad feeling all day in stomach.

I love this place. Definitely my favorite Indian Restraunt in the city. I have ordered many different items from the menu but I tend to always return to the always faithful Chicken Tikka Masala. Sadly I think they have changed the recipe, because it is still good but just a different taste than it used to be. I love this place though and will continue to come back!

Absolutely terrible customer service. Never order from here. The people threatened to beat me up and sweared at me when I called to cancel the order immediately after i placed it online and discovered that it was for pick up and not delivery. The hosts name is Moe.

Was disappointed with this place based on the reviews it got and its place in many a guidebook. Had the Chicken Korma Curry, wasn't really that impressed. The portions were small and there were bones in most of the chicken, making half of it inedible. Was still hungry after the meal. Naan wasn't as fluffy as I would've wanted and they refused to bring me a side order of daal, even though you pay at the end. The curry sauce was good, if a bit too spicy for my taste. Chicken was definitely not good quality. They also don't serve alcohol, which was frustrating. Have had much better Indian/Pakistani food elsewhere. I suggest you look around the city, since there were about 10 other choices that are probably better.
3.5 stars
Okay so mediocre, good at best.
Lol the host was adorable! I was gonna tip but he said that was unnecessary. What? Haha.
We ordered food to go, and my hon of hons husband double parked while I ran in to pick up our order.  As the guy was totaling it up, I noticed a cockroach on the counter.
Maybe the meat dishes are great here but for vegetarians you're better off going to another establishment.
After seeing a cockroach in my Tikki Masala dish I was sick to my stomach . I will not return .

I must say Chutney Restaurant on Jones St. San Francisco has the BEST chicken Tika masala in town! Hands down! Highly recommend this restaurant! The menus are great too and each time I come here it never fails to amaze me. The BEST!

I went to this place so excited and left totally unsatisfied. Granted, this was probably my 3rd or 4th time eating Indian cuisine so I'm no expert on how the best should taste.  However, I felt like Chutney prepared their food half-heartedly and the ingredients used to prepare the dishes weren't that fresh.

The Dahl and Tandoori fish were OK. However, the shrimp biryani tasted weird. I would have loved to have given more stars given that the staff were working so hard and the cashier was a lovely gentleman.

Had Daal Masala, Paneer Tikka Masala. Excellent food, albeit the Tikka was a bit too sugary. Good chutney. Mango lassi a touch too sweet.  Good level of spicyness for us (I like my spicy at 6 out of 1-10).
This place is a dump. Their quality of food and service went down from when they first opened up.

We had the carnes asada fries and two puposas for the table. I then had the carnitas super burrito (basically with everything). The meal is cheap and delicious and super filling. I ended up taking the burrito to go because if I had eaten it there, i wouldn't have been able to move for at least two hours.

I'm a proud salvadoreño and I did not appreciate the fact that the people here say they serve the food from my country. I ordered two pupusas revueltas. This means. Beans. Chees. And pork. All I got is chees. And a pinch of pork. customer service was horrible. I re - ordered the two pupusas. And specifically asked for all three ingredients.  And I got a pupusa full of beans. I can say I'm never eating here again.
I tried their popusas and they were pretty good! Their horchata was bomb too. I just hoped they would have had different types of salsa.

Really filling meal at good prices. The Papusa was great. I liked the cheese and pork much more than the cheese and lorocco or whatever it's called. I'd pass on the beans and rice too. I deducted a star for the waitress who was the master of sass (not the good kind)

Solid choice for mexican without having to go to the mission. A super burrito with the works is only $8.50. That's less than what I normally pay for a box of lettuce in the FiDi. I agree with other reviewers that the staff weren't too warm or anything but it's takeout so I don't really care.
Carne asada fries and the fish tacos were amazing. I definitely recommend! Employees were very sweet.

My name is Olive and I dine at Olivo's. The pupusas are delishas. The carne asada fries will cause carnal cries of joy. That's all I've had there actually. Once I get on a kick, I stick with it. Call it a habit or a tick. You can't beat it off with a stick. No matter the trick, I can't scam a gal into touching my d.....

The food was delicious but the WORST customer service. The waitress was beyond rude.  We get seated we ask for hot salsa. She says their restaurant only has one salsa. Ok, rude.  Our menus come a couple minutes later.  When we order our food she seems annoyed. We ask for chips and salsa and she says she needs to give the other table their food before us.  UMM, no one said give it right away, we just asked for it!  She gives us the food and doesn't give me a plate. I ask for one a couple minutes later and she yells in Spanish at someone in the kitchen as she rolls her eyes at us.  Sorry, it is so much trouble to get a plate! But, who doesn't give 2 plates when someone orders nachos to share?   She did not want to be there and was extremely rude. I would not recommend this place unless you order take out when you'll have limited interaction with the waitress.

I am born and raised in the Tenderlion and Olivo's have great tacos and Pupusa. The service, is nice and very accommodating towards me and my husband and the food is great. My new spot to get my Salvadorian pupusas and my first love....the tacos!!!!!
Sketch neighborhood. Lots of She-mans. But the staff are friendly and the food is delish.

Was in the city with my nieces and they are the pickiest people to figure out where to get to lunch at, one is 10, other is 16 so I stopped giving suggestions and just said hey I'm not into going to McDonald or Burger King, so let's figure something out, they both said with let's get Mexican food, well hot damn we have a goal.

Very little parking. Bad customer service, lady who took our order was rude and had a bad tone to her voice, sounds like she didn't even wan to take our order. Only 3 kind of meat style they had, pork beef and chicken, only grilled. Oh and yeah, check your food closely for the cooks hair. Found a strain of hair in my wife's plate. It's funny how people said they have the cheapest Cali burrito there, it's because you get what you pay for.

Two papusas (1 bean & cheese, one cheese and lorroco), beans and rice for $7.50?!!  yes, please.  Service was fast and friendly.  Food was so delicious I can't believe i haven't discovered this place sooner!

5 STARS because this is the only place that serves California Burrito for less than $8. Also it is the best Cali burrito in the city. I would definitely recommened this place. I can't get enough of that burrito.
I wouldn't go back. Chips are from some store bought bag and otherwise the flavors are completely uninspired. Their Tamarindo is quite tasty,  though.
Pupusas are delicious. La Carne asada with onions was fantastic. And great and helpful service.

Not a fan for me and my sister. We ordered 2 burritos: pollo asado burrito with black beans and California burrito. The carne asada in the California burrito is ok. Too much of the fatty pork in it. Some became crispy though, which is better. The fries inside the burrito was not crispy at all, so not our favorite burrito. As for the other burrito, we could smell the pork grease in it. I think they re-used the pan to cook the pollo asado after cooking the carne asada. Also, not a big fan.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!! I love coming here because they treat you like family and the food reminds me of my mother's home cooking, DELICIOUS! My favorite's always been the Pupusas but recently I tried the Beef Soup, and it is to DIE FOR!!! I love seeing Lizzie, daughter of the owners. She's so beautiful and we have the most awesome and funniest conversations. :) THANK YOU OLIVO'S! please don't go anywhere!!!
OMG the carne asada fries! Mmmmm sooo good! Also tried the carne asada burrito and 2 pupusas: cheese and beans/ cheese and pork. Everything was good!
The fish tacos are awesome !!

Olivo's is definitely not located in the best neighborhood and I would not recommend eating in, but this is my new go-to burrito place. I got the California burrito (french fries inside the burrito), which was INCREDIBLE. The burrito was the size of my thigh, I could not even finish half of it!
Probably the best Hispanic food you can get in the Tenderloin area of SF.
I LOVE OLIVO'S!!!  I live around the corner and I have to fight the urge to eat there several times a week.  My favorites are:
this is my neighborhood go to for a burrito, tacos, and I'm obsessed with the plantains. Don't expect the friendliest service or fine dining but it's pretty quick, high quality, and delicious.
Nacho fries are delicious . All our food was yummy ! Very generous portions ! Price is cheap for the amount of food we got! It's a hole in the wall but well worth giving it a shot!
First timer but I think they got a repeater in making!

Minus one star today. I had a pupusa craving (Of course, I did!). It was a weekend, so there was another woman, a larger, full-figured one, was working. I put in my order and told her I would go to the store and I would return. Upon my return, I offered to pay for my order. She said she couldn't accept it. AND PROCEEDED TO PLAY ON HER SMARTPHONE. Actually, I'll deduct one more star. And no tip for her!!!
Delicious! My group fully enjoyed our meals. Whether chicken or beef, you can't go wrong. Definitely coming back here next time I'm in San Francisco.

Nothing to rave about. I had the super carnitas burrito, it was ok but not extraordinary. The people working there seem completely disinterested, and almost bothered you're there. And don't expect to be served, if you need anything, stand up and go directly at the counter.
Love this restaurant!  I go for the carnitas plate and the beef soup.  You definitely cannot go wrong with this joint.  Portions are fantastic!  Beware, it's cash only.

Carne asada fries and california burrito! What?! In NorCal? Pretty awesome stuff. I try not to get this every time I go here, but I do! I just love French fries everything. I would say I've had better in SD, but this place isn't bad! Prob best in the city.

This is a tiny Mexican-Salvadoran place in the tenderloin.  I discovered this because of a tip from a hotel bell hop who told me that even if they claim not to they will make a pupusa revuelta even if they may not say it on the menu.
Found this today on yelp. Tried it and loved it. Delicious and clean and the service was friendly. And bc it's in the middle of the tenderloin I got parking pretty easily.
I'm not always in the mood to trek to the Mission and Olivos is a solid option. So far everything I've had has been great, or at least very tasty.
CASH ONLY.  Went here for the pupusas and carne asada fries.

I really liked this place. It had the best of both worlds. You have the choice of getting Salvadorian food or Mexican food. So that's exactly what I did. I ordered the California burrito along with two pupusas revueltas. My girlfriend ordered the three choice platter. She got the chile relleno, chicken tostada and a chicken enchilada.

Hands down the best burrito I've tasted in the city. It is a simple burrito with amazing flavor. One of the differences between traditional Mexican and El Salvadoran, aside from yummy delicious pupusas, is the use of saffron in their rice instead of tomato. This imparts a fragrance lacking in most burritos. Also Olivos nails the char flavored meat with perfect seasoning... Tastes like it came right off the wood-fired BBQ.
I lived right by this place for a year, so I went countless times.
Most amazing Pupusas ever
Aye Dios mío.

After a long day at work, I walked from the Waterfront on Market, down Post and all the way to Van Ness where I was staying. After the first couple blocks, I was on the lookout for a nice restaurant to enjoy a relaxing hour in front of a delicious meal and glass of wine.
LISTEN to the customer! I order the "way" I like it. Better Mediterranean fare on Polk St folks...

Did indeed go back the following week to try their chicken, artichoke, spinach, feta pita pizza.  Have to say, didn't disappoint.  Was very tasty, a fairly hearty portion (piled high with toppings) without being excessive.  Price was SF-reasonable ($12) for a good dinner.

perfect spot for a date , food never disappoints especially if you are familiar with mazzat in hayes valley , having the chance to try different things form the appetizer menu or the lebanese tapas makes your experience there perfect , nice wine and beer selection . cant wait to go back and explore more of the creative mazza they have .
Pass on seconds.
We ended up eating here for free - crazy, right?
This is really an excellent place for Lebanese food.  The atmosphere is just as good.  I would highly recommend it.  Great lentil soup!

We are always searching for nice places to eat pre-opera and we are so happy to have found Mazza Luna. We ate there last night and it was truly a wonderful experience. The ambiance is elegant, with a modern feel to it. The music was kept low, so it was quiet. The food was outstanding, very fresh and bursting with great flavors. We had two eggplant dishes that I would call "don't miss" - the Fatet (a delicious fried eggplant with pine nuts and airy croutons, topped with a garlic-yogurt sauce) and the Babaganouge. The Tabouli was also outstanding. The menu was filled with enticing items (like the roasted palm dates stuffed with goat cheese that we have to try next time!) It was also interesting to try Lebanese wine. The cabernet-syrah blend we had was very good. We are definitely going back!

Almaza and "cheese borak" a.k.a. "those Lebanese fried cheese rolls you must have": what else do you want?  The humus with beef was super good, with that flavorful oil that dish always seems to include.

This place is a hidden gem. You would never expect such a gorgeous  place on Van Ness avenue.  I've been there three times and the food is always excellent.  The special with five different dishes combined is tasty, seasoned well and just yummy.  My last visit was two weeks ago on my birthday. This restaurant is perfect for groups or To stop by alone for a glass of wine. Aesthetically pleasing, lounge/restaurant.  Great service, good food and wine makes a happy girl.  The sexy owner doesn't hurt either

We stopped in after a matinee at SF Opera and were delightfully surprised. We had the deluxe sampler platter.   The server / owner was very easy going when we asked to substitute the watermelon salad for one of the other dishes. The food was fantastic and a great value.   The a ambiance  suggests a much higher price. Would highly recommend it.
This place was pleasant, not too packed, and the food sort of did what it was supposed to, but it was not extraordinary.  Good service!

We had a terrific early dinner here. Watermelon salad and moussaka were a great complement to each other, and the kids loved the chicken pita thing. Flawless service, comfy chairs, and generous portions. We'll be back!

The food was tasty but be prepared to deal with some real shady, underworld service.  The owner insisted we try a bottle of their "best" Lebanese wine, which he brought to our table already uncorked.  I'm no wino but where I come from they uncork the bottle at your table.  We ordered the cheese borak, roasted cheese dates, and kaft bil sayniye.  The owner brought us the fatet betnjan- when we questioned the mix up he was adamant that we'd ordered that dish. Wrong! When we rebuttaled he changed his story, stating they were out of the cheese borak.  I didn't just fall off the turnip truck yesterday-- I don't like being played a fool.  Next time I'm in town, I'm taking my tummy and my money elsewhere.

Love the music, food is great. Our server was attentive and patient. We ordered a bottle of Spanish cava and a few appetizers. Food came out quickly, and the portions were definitely to share. We came around 5 pm, too early for the dinner traffic, so we were seated and attended immediately.
Awesome food, was surprisingly empty in the afternoon. Great staff & delicious food with a good wine selection. Great for a social outing!

For a long stretch of Van Ness, there really aren't that many options to grab a bite if you happen to be walking toward Civic Center after a movie at AMC Van Ness. Oh sure, there's Mel's, Max's, Tommy's or other cavernous places that clog the arteries of suburbanites and seniors alike with their grease-laden plates of diner fare. While Jamie W. and I weaken to their belly-gurgling calls from time to time, we were in the mood for something a bit more interesting. Mazza Luna comes from Adam Chamsine, who owns he popular Mazzat in Hayes Valley. I've been wanting to try that place, but it's always packed with locals looking for Lebanese food. No such problem exists here as it was nearly empty the night we came in from the rain.
Everything was so great. The setting was very classy and romantic as well. More people should know about this place.
We ordered hummus, falafels, tabbouleh. Hummus was super smooth and delicious. Falafel were not too dry or dense...one of the better ones I've had in the city.

So impressed with my experience at Mazza Luna. There was no wait for a Friday dinner. When I walked in and saw the chic atmosphere, I was instantly nervous that it was expensive. But no, the prices are reasonable; it just feels very upscale. (And the chairs are so comfortable!)
Mazza Luna is a convenient place to accommodate groups for Happy Hour in the Tenderloin area. There are a couple large tables and a long L-shaped booth area to squeeze everyone in.
Simple yet cool decoration. Attentive staffs. Good food with reasonable pricing. Go for a deluxe sampler for $22 a person if your party is not more than 2 ppl.
Great restaurant! Friendly staff, nice atmosphere, and the cauliflower and eggplant dishes are out of this world.
Looks like a lounge and it has amazing Lebanese food. Definitely worth going here!
Best meal I have had in San Francisco this trip. Beautiful ambience, very flavorful food, and fantastic service!

I came here for my cousin's birthday dinner knowing nothing about this place. I didn't realize that this place was more about sharing the food with the group instead of ordering individual dishes. I ordered the falafel. The falafel was pretty good. I also tried a bit of the Batata Harra. That was good as well.
Quite possibly the worst meal I've ever had in San Francisco.
I'm thrilled to have this place around the corner from us, in an area where good restaurants are sorely lacking.
The grilled halloumi cheese is amazing!
I am giving it two stars instead on one because finding anything even moderately decent in this area is a challenge.
Large, cheapish dishes

The appetizers were pretty tasty (babaganouse and watermelon salad.) They were fresh and well prepared. The house red wine wasn't that good but not a bad price during happy hour. The dinner I got lamb schwarma, but it wasn't that flavorful and kinda dry meat. My friend said her meat was dry too but I dont know what she got- a pizza of some kind. My other friend got an eggplant dish that was delicious.

Really my rating is a 3.5.  We were looking for a casual place to meet friends for dinner where we could actually talk and hang out (on a Sat night).  This place was perfect for that.  We sat at a table with a sofa and lounged over dinner and conversation.  The service was very nice.  The ambiance/decor was just ok, but fine for what we needed.  The menu is good... I love sharing tapa style plates with friends, so the selection was easy.  The food was just ok.  Nothing really wowed me, but everything was tasty enough.  We may go back if we need a convenient, easy, mellow place again.
Such a good spot! It's a diamond in the rough.

This place is the bomb, even for vegetarians.  I went during happy hour, the service was perfect and the manager/owner was really nice.  They even sent us over an appetizer they were experimenting with (sweetened goat cheese in a date).  Food was fantastic, the pomegranate eggplant was especially great (can't remember the name).
This place deserves all 5 stars!
This place was cute!!!! I loved the plush decor. The staff was super nice and the food was amazing. I did not know how much my bf loves this type of food so it was great for him.

My friend and I really enjoyed our lunch at Mazza Luna.  We had a tasty salad and pita pizza.  The wait staff was very friendly, with a genuine concern for our experience.  The restaurant was very comfortable and quiet.  We felt the cost-value was very good, too.  We will return to Mazza Luna.
Went on a random Tuesday night and got a few dishes, the highlight of which were:

Loved this place!  Will definitely go back.  stopped here for dinner before a show, during their happy hour.  My friend and ordered three plates and it as the perfect amount. the kibbeh was delicious combo of fried and meaty goodness.  The stuffed grape leaves were superb and we also got a cheese dish with not, fresh pita.  Oh, so good.  The restaurant has beautiful decor.  Ran into a friend looking at the menu outside, and his comment was, "the menu is beautiful".   I couldn't agree more. The service was great - both pleasant and attentive.  The bathroom is as fancy as the restaurant.  Definitely check this place out.
Super legit. So good. No lines. Call ahead and it will be ready in 5 minutes. My faves are the special and meatball. Yummy! And the lady who makes the sandwiches are really nice.

I just went here for the first time and had a chicken bahn mi sandwich.  It was so good, I was sorry I didn't get a second one.  For me, it's also a super affordable option. For $7 to get a sandwich and a Vietnamese ice coffee? Better to have this over american fast food junk food anytime.

Had seen this small hole in the wall before and always thought to myself "how clean and quaint". Finally got to try it today. Everyone inside was Vietnamese which only proves it's authentic. Great chicken sandwich! Will definitely come back to try the pork sando soon. Delish!
Worth a try! This place gets a solid 4 stars. It's $4 a sandwich, which isn't necessarily cheaper than Saigon, and I wouldn't say it's more food either. The differences:

After reading a lot of reviews My friend and I decided to goto Saigon sandwich. A bit disappointed with the slightly bland roast pork sandwhich which also had a bit too much bread. Also felt sauce was a little bit skimpy.
Legit bahn mi, combo (headcheese, pate, fancy pork, red pork house made).

Tastier and cheaper than the competitors in the area. I grabbed lunch here at least once a week when I lived in the area. The baguette is crunchy but doesn't hurt the roof of my mouth when I bite down. Sing Sing uses the right amount of sauce for my liking so that the baguette doesn't get soggy. For whatever reason I just feel like this sandwich shop and tea house has an abundance of character and charm. If you're in the Tenderloin and want a banh mi, go here and not to that awful other place.
I stumbled upon this place looking for vietnamese sandwiches.
I had seen a review via the SF Gate that Sing Sing had the most authentic Banh mi in San Francisco , so just had to check it out.

If you think I'm going to review this secret place, and talk about how mind blowingly good the banh mi are, how congenial the people who run it, how this whole experience makes you feel glad to be alive, you must be crazy.
My favorite Vietnamese sandwich shop, reminds me of Vietnam.

I love sing sing sandwiches and Vietnamese ice coffee. For all your long days' worked hard. You can sit and enjoy drunk Vietnamese coffee and sandwich too. Most I like cheaper not even $4. Best of the best, for yourself, friends, kids playing around there. I am happy there. :)

Pretty good banh mi but not my favorite (meatball banh mi @ Dinosaurs!). It's not clear from the reviews but there is a selection of sandwiches, not just one choice. And it's not any cheaper than Saigon Sandwich or any other banh mi around town. It's not that hard to find despite being off the main drag of Little Saigon - there's a sign above the door.

Always the best vietnamese sandwiches to get from norcal to socal. Had a few sandwiches down south and around the city and so far... This sandwich is by far the best and the most authentic. Feels like youre eating a sandwich off those carts u find around vietnam. Banh mi saigon is down the block and its literally bbq meat and not the real authentic kind. If u want that americanize stuff get it elsewhere but if u want it to be legit... This place is a must try.
I looooove their Vietnamese coffee ($3). It feels like robbery when you're paying a dollar or so more for a full sandwich.  Ask for extra EXTRA light cream otherwise it's too sweet.
Written from a Vietnamese person's perspective that has visited Vietnam about 8 times, this is the best Vietnamese banh mi in America.

The first thought that comes quite uncharitably to ones mind when going to this place is that the characters loitering outside might possibly have been inhabitants of another place with a similar name ...but it behooves you to power through those misgivings and go to this place.  It takes a bit of finding, but you know when you see the tiny shop with a garish neon sign advertising "sandwiches" that this will be good.  This place is a bahn mi shop which to me is the king (or queen) of all sandwiches.

Very much a hole in the wall with lots of Asian men hanging around drinking coffee and watching the TV. The bahn mi altogether was pretty good (but not the best I've had) -- it had limited meats in it compared to bahn mi's from other places, but overall still good and cheap!

I used to live right by this place and every time I'd walk by there would be a good number of Vietnamese men standing around just chillin.  There's no ambiance inside but the lady that makes the sandwiches is so nice.
One of the only reasons I make it into the TL!

Updated review. The older vietnamese guy no longer makes the sandwiches and has his wife doing it. She's often very slow and rude and overdoes the sandwiches with the sauce. Will probably no longer be going here.

After reading all of the glowing reviews I was really looking forward to an amazing banh mi since I really love them.  The price tag was definitely right since both sandwiches were only $7.  Unfortunately there wasn't much flavor or spice and there was a lot of fat on the meats.  Disappointing to say the least.

I pretty much just narrowed it down to Hoang Dat & Sing Sing for my Banh Mi fix. I've tried quite a few others throughout the city- and keep coming back to Sing Sing. It's got that authentic/down home/Mama's kitchen flavor I appreciate. Plus, the lady is super cool and a boss with the toaster.

This place gives Saigon Sandwich a good challenge however Saigon is still tops. Very tasty and extra jalapeños are kicking my butt on the pork sandwich! The Vietnamese iced coffee is pretty good and I would order again. No menu from what I can see and very little English so you need to know what you want and just let them do their thing. Price is right but the TV playing a very loud singing show can give you a real authentic experience. I would make this a fist timer joint but work your way down here once you know what your doing with Vietnamese sandwiches.
I don't venture out to the Tenderloin often, but for bahn mi, I braved it. This was the first stop in my bahn mi haul.
I love the banh mi pate.
There's only one thing to get here - pork sandwich.
I looooove banh mi! The pork banh mi was amazing! Just be careful with the jalapeño... Pretty spicy if you take a huge bite out of it.

This has taken over as my go to place for a Vietnamese sandwich. It's in the Tenderloin district, not the safest part of town but well worth the trip. They only have 1 sandwich choice available so don't even ask. It's a usual combo but it has just the right amount of pate, bread is fresh, don't skimp on the pepper, and they go easy on the pickled radish type stuff. Why not 5 stars? They had a fly trap type thingy over the sink next to the area where they made the sammi. Not good as the wifey says.
Crap....uncle Pony tail increased the sando price to $3.50.  That's pushing it.  Will need to drop to four stars if it increases to $4.

Sing Sing is tricky to spot, it is a single doorway leading to a basement. Inside it is basic to say the least, patio furniture springs to mind. IT definitely feels authentic, and to the unadventurous intimidating.
Not too good. Pork had a gross rind on it. Good bread though. Go to Saigon Sandwich for a waaaaay better eat.

Yes the sandwiches are great, and super cheap too! But not worth the scary walk through the 'hood (Tenderloin). I wish they had real pork and not sliced processed meat, but the place was filled with Asians so it must be good and authentic, or just cheap since they may qualify for low-income housing in the hood for being immigrants (I did my research afterwards). Anyways, I liked it, would I come back? Don't know, maybe I will find another Vietnamese shop in a less scary area :)

Finally made it here after years of hearing ppl rave about their banh mi. A friend of mine mentioned that the owner of my fav place Hoang Dat and owner of Sing Sing are brothers and said I must try it.  So I did!

I'm a Vietnamese, so I might be too picky for saying that the sandwich here is just so so. The bread was too hard, and the taste was not as good as I hope. The counter looked dirty and the place is very Vietnamese (by that I mean there were a lot of Vietnamese men cursing and talking loudly). However, the old woman was very nice, and that why I gave two stars.

Sam had a review from "Inside Scoop SF" that claimed the best banh mi in North America was here so I had to check it out.  Nearby on street parking is pretty easy and the girls back at the office wanted a banh mi too so I bought a bunch of them to go.
Summary: Good sandwiches, too much cigarette smoke.

I know I am strange since i hate Mayo. My sammiches usually get a bit dry. But the combination sandwich here at sing sing was not dry at all. The perfect size for me so for others it may be a bit small. Wonderful sandwich. My 2nd most favorite viet sandwich place in SF.

I'm Vietnamese so I have certain expectations for a good banh mi, Vietnamese  baguette with the center hollowed out, mayonnaise or liver pate with flavorful thin slices of meat, great pickled carrots and daikon, and fresh cilantro, green onions and jalapeño slices.
They only make one thing. the special combo bahn mi.
Walked in here to enjoy some soup but the overwhelming smell of urine and old movie theater was too much.
I haven't been here for a couple years so this review is long overdue but I love OSHA's! Late night delicious Thai food. Service has been good when I've gone.

It's A-okay. I had the pad see ew, which was not bad, and they gave me a large portion - I couldn't even finish it. Service wasn't bad for a to-go order, but it was nothing I haven't tried before. Will be back if I am ever in the area, but parking is pretty hard around here.

Decent food. Seating environment is nothing to write home about. Food was solid, particularly their panang curry. The angel wings we ordered as an appetizer didn't taste fresh. May have been a reheated item dropped in sauce. Pad Thai was pretty good with chicken.
I've always loved this place since college.  Every time I come visit in SF, I'll stop by and eat here.

I had the lemon grass sauce with chicken as take out. I went on the recommendation of a tour operator who liked to point out inexpensive neighborhood joints. The dish was very savory and I would definitely go again.
Great place for lunch.

Friends and I were checking out the bars around the area but we wanted to get a bite to eat first. Friend suggested osha because he saw that other people have eaten there so we decided to stop by this location.
Love this place!! Cashew chicken and yellow curry all the way!! :) Park in the garage for easy access

This place is passable for late night eats if you happen to be in the Tenderloin. We dropped in here after drinks at Rye next door and there were quite the characters dining all around us. Probably saw a couple drug transactions go down in the bathroom during our meal. I was pretty hungry, so the pad see euw was decent, but the beef was pretty tough. Spicy eggplant with tofu was fine. Country chicken is a must not. The hostess/waitress was a bit gruff but I really couldn't blame her. On the flip side the rest of the waitstaff was very pleasant and efficient. While I admire the owner and the staff's tenacity for serving this neighborhood, but there are better Thai options in SF.
We rolled into Frisco late and I was starving. Walked through SOMA after midnight, and was glad we did.
I would give this place 0 star if I could. Came here on a Sunday night with my boyfriend around 11:30pm.... place was pretty empty.

I have been going here for many years, but last night was my last. Sat down and the first thing i noticed was a dirty fork...Nvm that, I ordered my 3 favorite appetizers and every one of them not only shrunk but the quality of the meat used is of shameful quality. My favorite Thai restaurant was disappointment beyond repair. i honestly felt like i was robbed. Then you have poor service or rather no service. to top it off the restroom was something you would expect in a porta-potty, lucky for me i used it after eating. Shame of you for making a long time customer feel upset, disgusted, and betrayed.

Rude host ignored us on a busy night said they called our name, but I hadn't moved from the same spot the whole 20 minutes I waited. Food is OK, a bit over priced. But one measly star for this particular location.
Very oily good. We got the pad kee mao and the naked wings. The wings were drenched jn sauce and oil.
What's going on here, Osha???

i wouldnt say that this is the best thai food i've had but it was pretty good. being from NY, i came here on a trip to san fran and the food wasn't half bad. we were seated right away and my friend needed his phone charged so the staff was nice enough to let him charge his phone behind the bar.

We came here at dinner time for a small birthday meal on a Sunday. It was not empty, but not full. The place has a very modern feel with white "plastic-y" walls with hot pink decorations on walls and tables, and white plastic "scoop chairs". It is not your traditional hole-in-the-wall thai restaurant with thai decorations everywhere.

Great place, great value! Ordered the go-go off the special pride drink menu which was delicious. The lemonade is also amazing! The lamb was the greatest thing I have ever eaten! I will definitely go back every time I'm in San Francisco!
My favorite Thai restaurant in SF!
Ordered the chicken fried rice. Big-ass bowl of the stuff. Delish!
Ordered takeout recently for dinner and food quality was significantly lower. Next time I'll just walk the extra few blocks to get takeout from ler ros instead.
We went to Osha because we had a coupon and it was nearby. Honestly, didn't check the review till now, which was a mistake.

Staff is very friendly, helpful and patient while you try to figure out what to order. The food is average but you can serve yourself Thai tea and Thai coffee with cream-yum. The place has minimalist, green interiors with techno music blaring which is kind of weird but it doesn't matter. Bonus: All "to go" containers are eco-friendly.

Checked out this place at 10:30 on a Saturday night. They were busy but not slammed. A good ambience is important to me. I drove past this place a few night before and I was excited because it looked like a 60s/70s chill vibe, but when we actually sat down it wasn't that neat. It read a little more like The Waffle House, but not in a bad way. I read the reviews on Yelp and got the Volcano Beef. It was fantastic. The beef was tender(loin. HA! Get it? Anyway...) in a savory sauce with veggies and it was served with onion rings and a side of steamed rice. Presentation was beautiful. My husband got the tofu pad thai, and it was delicious.
Definitely a great place to go eat late night. Came here close to midnight and was seated right away.

Have never had Thai before and this was my first attempt. I am a VERY picky eater and this place surpassed all expectations. Drinks were amazing; food was even better! Very trendy atmosphere. Prices were very reasonable.
Service is so slow.  It's always chaos and confusion.  Think they have one cook who works at a snails pace.  Don't go there if you're hungry because it will be a while. With that said, food is good.
I went here with my friends on 6-22-14 1:30am'sh.  I ordered the chicken pad thai $10'

Had Volcanic Beef and Pan Fried Noodle with Duck. Great presentation, it surprised me! Because from outside it doesn't look like an upscale place, and price is very reasonable. Volcanic Beef is good, a little too salty. The noddle has many pieces of roasted duck, but the duck is not the freshest. Overall, it is a good neighborhood restaurant for quick meals.

I  think there is a better thai place in the tenderloin called Lers Ros. BUT this place is good and has some sushi type dishes for people who don't feel like noodles. I usually get the Tuna Poke which is a raw tune salad with avocado and mango with a side of won ton crisps. Very yummy.

Everyone needs a sudsy lair to regroup from the night's festivities and add a little carbo loading against the demon rum. The devil here is the crab fried rice, maybe the best pre-hangover dish I have had, outside the eggs and waffles while being parked at Waffle House at 3 in the morning bombed out of your mind. Fluffy rice with the perfect ratio of crab and veggies. Yes, you want this dish.

Dropped in for an early dinner. Got a som tum salad and the sea bass they had on the specials menu. The som tum was very good, prolly the best tasting I've had in the states, but doesn't compare at all to what I've had in Thailand and that's totally expected tho. It was very spicy which was perfect.  Lips, mouth, throat on fire.  Head rushing pain. Sweating and runny nose.  Intense punch in face that lingered for 10-15mins. Almost a drug like high.  I LOVED IT : )
I have been going here for a decade now somethings change in preparation but the flavor is always there. And this locations food is better for me over all the others in SF...
A regular vegetable fried rice, no meat, no tofu, picked up and $12!
This was a fancy Thai restaurant. I'm more partial to the hole in the wall because the food is more authentic but we were meeting a group who chose this place so why not try it out?
the go to thai spot. they make me salmon with yellow curry (all salmon) not on the menu. like adult candy!

We came in as a group of friends after a short night of having a few drinks. I politely asked the server if we could get two beers with our meal and she said no. When I asked the host he claimed that we were way too drunk and that he could smell it on my breath.  I told him all I wanted was a beer with my food and he again declined. It was 1:45am and just felt like they where being rude and short with me.   :(
This place was hoppin when I arrived on a Thursday night just after 8pm. Trendy music and a bustling but very friendly waitstaff make for a great start.
My Fiance had Crab Fried Rice and he enjoyed it a lot. As for me I had Chicken pad thai and it was delicious! THe portion was big, though a bit on the pricey side.
We have been wanting to eat here forever but they are only open for dinner. I usually like to eat Vietnamese for lunch.. I guess because it's so light and healthy.
Sketchy neighborhood, but that's just the Tenderloin for you!

Excellent!!  My dinner which was a Shrimp wonton soup and bbq chicken and beef ribs hit the spot.  I was the only non Vietnamese patron, which should tell you they have the respect of their comrades and cook to perfection.  I wish I lived here because I would come at least once a week!!!!
Food here is always delicious. Their shrimp paste sauce is out of this world.  You will feel like a glutton after eating here and may hate yourself, but it was definitely worth it.
Very bad experience !!!!! No customer service at all ... From the beginning I sat down and I asked for tea...!!! But nothing comes up till I done dinner !!!! And food is so so ... Not so good !!!
Not very good.
So I'm guessing they pay yelp to advertise for them? I'm 90% sure the waiter spit in my food.

Came here for the 7 courses of beef, I've personally never heard of it before but I like making spring rolls so I'm all up for it. Parking isn't the easiest, parked about two blocks away which isn't bad for the area. Two of my friends told me that #1 and #7 of the 7 course of beef is some basic dishes that you can cook for $2. So instead, we ordered #2-5 a la carte and doubled up on beef sausages and pate. Turned out the meal ended up being cheaper than the full 7 courses and we got more bang for our buck. Everything was ridiculously good. This place gets a double thumbs up from me.
The beef course is excellent. I also love the sugarcane shrimp.

It was fine.  Nothing great or amazing about the food, it was fine.  I was there at 5:00 on Sun. and one other couple was in the restaurant.  It took me 45 mins to get my to go order of rib/chicken combo.  I also ordered soup but they "forgot" and told me it would take another 10-15 mins; so I passed.  This is the beginning of Little Vietnam; go another couple of blocks and there are fabulous choice where you will want to go back.  Even though this is 1 block from my apt, not returning.
We've been coming here for over 25 years and the food has always been deliciously consistent.
I come here for the 7 course beef, beef carpaccio and fried Imperial rolls. Always a lovely time - eating with your hands and plenty of fish sauce.

umm...yeah this place is for real.  i'm not vietnamese but i have a lot vietnamese peeps in my circle and they vouch for this place.  we went here for the 7 beef course and i swear i died and went to food coma!!  it's freaking amazing and that is all that needs to be said.   i'm sure it doesn't quite live up if you can make the 7 beef course homemade and all, but for restaurant made i think it redeems itself pretty well.  service is eh, but it's an asian restaurant so i never expect service to be all that.  i go for the food not the service...and food did not disappoint here!

They are famous for there 7 courses beef.  It comes with a bunch of fresh vegetable and rice paper to roll your meal.  This is the place for all the CARNIVORES.  It is simple DELIOUS!  I always order the vermicelli plate cause I need some carb to go with my meat.  Please remember not to make the roll to big or you won't be able to end the roll.

Came here for pho, and must say this is one of the better spots for pho.  I normally wouldn't come to this neighborhood, but my friend convinced me to try their food - and it really is better and/or cheaper than other Viet places in the city.

This was the first Anh Hong restaurant and I used to come here with my Vietnamese friends who taught me how to do 7 courses of beef right!  Since then I like to bring my other friends and colleagues for this awesome experience here.  The menu is slightly different than Berkeleys -- they do shabu shabu with the sliced beef here, where Berkeley does carpaccio.  Both are good.  The SF restaurant is more plain and not as nice as Berkeley, but the service is still pretty decent.  Food is consistently good and I always love their sugar cane shrimp with purple perilla.

I ate here for the first time on the weekend from a recommendation from my nail salon (they're Vietnamese of course so they definitely know the best Vietnamese places to eat). Let's just say they were right, but don't expect bells and whistles. You're down to eat here! Their specialty of the 7 course beef is fabulous, the fondue beef is fabulous and finishing with beef congee, they sure have the flavoring right!

The food here was just okay and probably lower-than-average for Vietnamese restaurants in the city. I tried the grilled pork rice plate and my bf had the lemongrass chicken. The portions were large and the taste was there, but we felt that the quality of ingredients used were poor.

Come here with the family for father's day. It was pretty busy by the time we came to the restaurant and this place is small so it can pack fast. This place is known for 7 beef course. It costs $21.95 per person for the 7 beef course. Its quite pricy but the food can get you full. This 7 beef course consists of beef salad, beef fondue, steamed beef pate, grilled beef sausage, beef wrapped in Hawaiian(lot) leaf, grilled beef with lemon grass, and ended with beef rice porridge soup. They also give you rice paper and vegetables so you can make spring roll from all meats they give you. Also they provide sauces as well so your created spring roll can have some flavors.
I wasn't blown away by the 7 course beef. Maybe because I'm comparing it to my boyfriend's mother's cooking and really, nothing beats her Vietnamese cooking and home made fish sauce!

Go to the Berkeley location instead. This location has a much smaller menu and the service could be much better. Once we were finished with our meal we had to ask for our check three times and wait 45 minutes for it!

I've walked by this place a million times and peered in. It's usually full of families congregated around giant round tables laughing and chatting while small children scamper around.  The tables spilling over with vibrant mint and other herbs,  with noodles and colorful vegetables commanding attention in an otherwise spartan environment. It was always busy.  I had to find out what was so special about this place.
I come here every few years because:
