My family and I use to always come here, and we would order the seven course beef. After all these years, it still tastes delicious! The meats are flavorful, and the serving sizes are just right.

Not in the best part of town to say the least, but this joint still serves up some of the best food in the city regardless of price.  I've taken friends and relatives to this place, and they all loved it.  In fact, some of them became regulars like us, despite the trouble it takes to get here and park.
Strong love for this place for the great tasting authentic Viet 7 meat dishes their congee and generous greens served to make me feel less guilt with eatting so much meat
Large and roomy inside. It felt very authentic since some of the waiters had a hard time understanding what we wanted.
I and my family, friends there. We loved to eat 7 kinds of beef style. Good Vietnamese food. Have fun there too.
So, I came with Alice L a few weeks ago, and we didn't do the 7 course beef that everyone else did, because, well, we eat like waify little people. Instead, we ordered their:
7 course beef and an order of their eggrolls and you're good to go!
Reservations mean nothing. Plan on waiting. Good news is there is a liquor store close by with a nice selection of beer and wine.

I would not recommend this place if you don't speak Vietnamese. I loved this place the first time I went with my Vietnamese friend. The workers catered to us and there were no problems. However, the next time I went our group didn't have a vietnamese-speaking person and we waited 10 minutes to even get a menu. We also never got our rice noodles after asking the workers twice. In the end, they still charged us for the noodles.
Man I love this spot!  Such contrasting flavors and really nice service.

Met with two of my BFFs for dinner on a friday night for Chinese new year. We made reservations, sat us right away. We been here many times before. We had: raw beef salad, shrimp and beef sald, shrimp wrap in sugar cane, egg rolls w noodles, beef wrapped in lot leaves, beef sausage (was not good this time around) we asked for crab claws, waiter said, "no more" ooohhh no! I can hear my son across the table. Surprisingly the service was attentive during this visit. Usually its so slow, i sort of get the feeling once i get my orders, I'm fending for myself.
Get the 7 courses of beef and the shrimp balls with sugar cane

Service was really bad. Was in a big group and made a reservation, but they gave our table away so we waited 40 minutes for enough space to open up. A lot of food was ordered so I'm not really reviewing that. 7 course was fine, nothing spectacular, but the basics of a restaurant seems to be missed. For example, when we ask 4 separate times for water, we shouldn't get it during the 4th course. We even ordered appetizers but they never entered it to be made!
Meat meat meat and more meat.  Great place if you like your meat.

I absolutely love this place. It's a unique dinner experience where you hand roll your own spring rolls. From dipping the rice paper in hot water to soften it, to picking out your choice of fresh vegetables, to the meat you choose to put in there. My family and I usually come here for birthday dinners or whenever we deem is a good time to feast.
Always enjoy coming here.
I'm torn writing this review because their food was so dang good but it was one of the most frustrating customer service experiences ever.

The sushi was okay, but the waiter was so rude that I have to give this a zero. We were waiting at the door and he completely ignored is. We ended up seating ourselves. He gave us menus after like 10 minutes, he never gave us refills, he was nicer to other people besides us. He didn't want us to be there at all. I used to work in the food industry and I tried to be understanding but he was so rude, I didn't even tip him. He was so mad that we didn't tip he ran after us ALL THE WAY ACROSS THE STREET. He started going off on us and saying that we should have taken out if we weren't going to tip, and how he was so busy, yet he had time to run after us. He gave so much attitude and he was just so unprofessional. Never going again. Would definitely not recommend. And I'm pretty sure all the other reviews are about him being rude too. If you want bad service, go there!

The sushi is okay, have taken out from here twice.  It is fresh and the rolls are good but nothing solid.  I always find the service a little arrogant and less friendly than other comparable restaurants, costing it a star.
Absolutely Fantastic!!   Sushi is excellent. Service and atmosphere is also great.   This is not a fancy restaurant. It is a place you go if you want great food.   Prices are low for what you get.
I had a sushi sashimi combination at the balcony, which was a perfect light meal before going out at night.

The food was good. I liked the menu, and the chef seemed to have good sanitary skills with the fish. We waited about 45 minutes for a table. It is not a place for the ambiance or environment for date night, but good food.
Fantastic sushi.  I would have given it 5 stars if the waiter guy learned how to smile.  Not letting you sit at a table because you are alone does help either.
This convenient spot gets five stars for having in stock what's on the menu. Friendly and fast. Presentation and flavors are spot on.
Great late night stop.  Very friendly service.  I'm not a connoisseur, but I like what I had.
Why so negative people?   I had a really lovely meal here and look forward to taking my spouse when we are in San Francisco next month.   Nothing fancy.  Just really good food and pleasant service.
0 stars!!!
Great sushi everywhere in union square but the ramen is also great here and a good variety of options.   Not too fancy but not too casual or loud either.  They don't take Amex.

Traveling solo and I tried to get into a sushi place up the street that was jam packed. Spotted an empty seat in here and decided to go in. Quick service and tasty sushi rolls. Casual with no frills but great for a quick meal!
Very welcoming ambience/good service when you walk in.
Sakana is my kind of place. Great food, good service, unpretentious.
Service - exceptional!
Sushi here is decent and tasty.  Prices were also very reasonable and the staff was nice.

Excellent!  All the sushi fish was high quality and flavorful.  We ordered a sushi omakase (chefs choice of 8 pieces) and 2 california rolls.  We were quite pleased.  We ha a waitress who was very nice.
Very nice place. Not very expensive, sushi rolls flavorful and quick to come. We sat at the bar and enjoyed a few rolls and some miso soup and a quick, delicious and healthy meal. We will come back.

Stopped in during a work trip this past week as I do each time I'm in San Francisco for business. I can confirm that this is a small no frills location to eat, but I'm there for the food first. Don't go with a big party (5 or more) and don't expect candlelight.

I thought this spot was excellent! We called to see if getting a table would be a problem. Assured they could take care of us, we drove on over. We were surprised when they asked if I was the one who called; they had reserved their best table for us! We each ordered the sashimi combo, and it was excellent.

I was a bit worried about service after reading the yelp reviews.  Actually had a great time.  We weren't in a hurry so we didn't care so much but we were in and out within 45 minutes.  Everyone was super nice and the sushi was good.  I did order fatty tuna that ebbed up being a bit more fatty than I've been used to in the past but still good
Ummmmm.... yummmmmm... possibly the best sushi ever. This may be the alcohol talking... But so what.

The food was actually pretty good, unfortunately the service was horrible. Slow, inattentive, and rude.  They struggled to sit us because we had a larger party and threw us some dirty looks. No one smiled or greeted us. They constantly seemed to be in a rush and never made eye contact. They auto tip on parties of 5 or more.

My family is from Japan and I often crave authentic Japanese food. I feel nostalgic when I eat here. My favorite food to eat is the Gindara Misoyaki, Nameko miso soup, Yamaimo ume-ae, and the ume-maki. These are all dishes I would eat as a kid so I'm grateful there's a place I can go to enjoy these dishes now!

I visited this place from out of town.  The sushi was really fresh.  The waitress was very kind, as our nieces and nephews were all gluten free and were allergic to sesame seeds, so she kindly gave us gluten free soy sauce and put in our order for rolls without sesame seeds.
Enjoy this place. Teka don and salmon nigiri. Both were tasty. Salmon was really buttery delicious!
Excellent sushi place! Walking distance from our hotel. Prompt service sushi was very fresh and tasty! Miso soup was great! I would definitely visit here more often if I lived in the area.

I can't review the food, because we didn't stay.  We walked in last night for the first time.  We were greeted with a terse command to put our name on the list, which we did (no greeting, no eye-contact, and the list was not in an obvious place).  There was one name ahead of us, and two tables empty, waiting to be cleared and re-set, so we waited by the door.  After a minute, the same waiter that told us to sign in passed by and asked us if we had.  We said yes, and he rudely ordered us to wait outside.  It was not busy, we were not in the way and we weren't given a chance to be anything but polite.  We left and had a pleasant meal around the corner.  Sakana was half empty when we walked by on our way back to the car.

Mediocre Japanese restaurant. From sushi to appetizers to noodles, nothing is bad, or good. Definitely overpriced given the taste. And the owner/waiter are not particularly welcoming. Had a cold face all the time we were there.

Great sushi place, although REALLY pricey. Then again, sushi are expensive, I suppose. I came here with my sister on a Saturday afternoon. It was very quiet, only about 2 tables there. A middle age woman was our server and she was a really nice and accomodating person. Our tea cups are constantly filled and the wait wasn't long at all.
This is reasonably priced and just what the doctor ordered!!! Rainbow roll caterpillar roll vegetable tempura very good!
Rating really 3.5

We aren't sushi experts or anything but we sort of ended here the other night because we didn't feel like waiting for the Italian place across the street or a steakhouse around the corner.  Thank goodness we stumbled into this tiny place.  We waited for about ten minutes for seats but it was the whole time we were there.  Wife loved the warm sake.  I enjoyed the miso.  She said it was the best sushi she's had and I was brave enough to try some rolls I've never been brave enough to try back home.  I guess I trusted that SF has better quality ingredients than AZ.  Go figure.  Anyways, we loved it so much that we seriously considered dinner again the next night in spite of only having three dinner nights in San Francisco to sample what was there on our vacation.  If we're back in SF, we will definitely be back to Sakana!
Visited Sakana for the first time and had great, fresh sushi. The service was quick and attentive. I recommends Sakana for a quality sushi meal.

3.5 rounded up!  I went for dinner with a couple little ladies from my building, and we were able to grab a nice table by the window.  I was super hungry so I got the saba, tempura and sashimi dinner combination, which comes with miso soup and rice.  My miso soup was gone in seconds!  The sashimi was really fresh - totally enjoyed that.  The batter on the tempura was just slightly heavier than I like, but there was a nice variety of shrimp, squash, carrots, broccoli.  My saba was just slightly overcooked - I like it soft and fall-off-the-fork cooked, but the flavor was wonderful.  One of the ladies ordered the saba shioyaki, and there were quite a few bones that she had to pick out - not sure, if they meant it to be like that, but she was a little irritated.  I wouldn't mind, but my saba didn't have any bones in it.  Our tea and waters were filled frequently and service was friendly.  If Ryoko is too crowded, head over to Sakana!

Beyond horrible. Uni was spoiled and when we tried to send it back, the manager claimed that we didn't know what uni tasted like. Also ordered agadashi tofu and when the waiter failed to bring it out near the end of the meal, he replied "you may or may not have ordered it."

Came back here after a long hiatus. We actually too my inlaws here and the fish was so buttery and fresh. It's not a budget sushi place but on the same token they execute really well. My inlaws love a place that I will not mention in the Peninsula that is well known for their portions it really puts things in perspective on how good the quality is here for the sashimi and nigiri. I love that they also have the specials that we were able to try such as long neck clams and abalone. The best thing we ordered was the Sashimi combo which every piece of sashimi was buttery and delicious.
This is my neighborhood sushi joint, and that makes me happy!

The sushi rolls were so fresh and tasty!  We were visiting the area and just happened to walk up on this place.  We sat at the bar and placed our order for sushi.  The place is really small and stays busy and packed.  Our sushi came out really quick.  I ordered the roll with eel, shrimp and avocado.  Yummy!!!
Ordered to-go. Pretty good. The best sushi I've tried so far around the area compare to others! Try their rolls, pretty good too!
Solid place worth returning to, but not the best in the world.

I'd actually give the food here 3 stars but I tacked on another because we had really great service. We tried the pho and vermicelli noodles with bbq pork. The pho was average and the vermicelli noodles didn't seem cooked all the way through, but the bbq pork was very tasty. I'm a little surprised at all the rave reviews but perhaps we came on an off day. Great and quick service though!
Decent pho for a weekend hangover... Place is small and def in the ghetto. But that's why I love it.  Doesn't compare to San Jose, but it'll do for me in SF.
I've eaten Pho all over the world. Literally 50+ places. This is the best. Hands down. All of the neighboring places are garbage by comparison.
Was insanely hungover one Sunday morning and this was one of the only place open that had veggie pho with veggie broth. SO glad I came here!
I don't typically like to give away a good thing, because then it becomes trendy and expensive and you have to wait in lines.  But.....
Good food. Possibly the best viet rice plates.

The pho here is the bomb. I love the number 1 over here, don't remember what it's called. The noodle here is really tender not so sogy like the other one I tried. This is the place to go if you want pho. Service here is excellent too.

I am upgrading my review to 5 stars. Their pho ga chicken broth is just some of the best I've ever had. Wow. Really great service and prices. One of the better spots i Little Saigon. I know they put sugar in their 5 hour broth, I've talked to female cook who makes it. I'm not sure about MSG, but if so, I like it!
Just a quick review~

I can't believe the amount of stars this place has received. Let me start off by saying I was really turned off by the sight of the microwave. And I know I know I'm sure there are other restaurants that use them but just seeing how much they used it already started giving me bad vibes. But I true to put that aside and judge them on the food.
Cash only! Don't forget to grab a stamp card!
Pho 2000...got me feelin' like it's OVAHHHHH 9000!!!!! (get it? if not, just move on to review)

Came here for lunch and saw that the LARGE pho was HUGE! Hubby ordered the pho but in regular size and it was the same standard size as it in Houston. I ordered the banh xeo and it was nice and crispy but a bit on the oily side. This place was ok, and after seeing the LARGE bowl, i can see why its a bit on the busy side here.

Service is good, fast! Stopped in during lunch time (1pm on a Thursday) and served promptly. Didn't get the staple Vietnamese items on the menu, so can't judge based on that. I don't care for fish sauce that's on the sweeter side, or egg rolls that are soaked in old, dark oil, so those were turn offs for me. Plus, my lemongrass tofu wasn't very lemongrassy. That doesn't mean I wouldn't go back to try the pho!

This is usually my first place I go to, to get pho in the Tenderloin. I usually don't have to wait that long for a table and it's cheap. A lot of young tourists come here, I think they are staying at near by hostels.  The pho is good. Their banh xeo, Vietnamese pancake is very oily, but crispy. They have really ugly table cloths but reminds me of being in Vietnam. If you're a regular like me, get a stamp card. When you reach 10 pho bowls, you get a free pho or imperial rolls. I'm 4 bowls away!

Had my usual pho tai after a night of drinking.  I remember one time in san jose at pho y 1 and how that hit the spot so well in this same situation.  But not so at pho 2000 this time for me.  The broth was very clean and thin, but a bit oily and lacked depth of beef flavors.  The meat and noodles were fine, both good portions and meat was sliced thin and nice to have on side to dip in for a only a few seconds.  The broth was very hot, used some mung bean sprouts to cool it down but it still stayed very hot to the end, which is a plus.
Gray Boiled Beef or Gray Boiled Chicken? The Watery Oily Broth is NOT Pho-nomenal! Add a few spoons of Lemon-seeds & you've got Pho 2000!
Great place to grab Pho togo - I have only had the phoga (chicken noodle soup) and it's amazing!

I thought their spring rolls were amazing, however (and this may be because i saw the huge pot of meat right when I walked in) the actual pho was not as good as I have had at other places. There were little bits of chicken skin floating in my soup and it was freaking me out. I loved the jasmine tea they serve with their meals though, but I also was not a fan of their homemade chili sauce. The consistency was off and made it hard for me to make my perfect combo of spice with soy sauce.

First off, I will openly admit I may not have had enough pho to be a pro at figuring out who does it better. With that said, overall, it was good. The broth was yummy, a tad on the salty side but not ridiculously so. I am not sure this is the best pho I have had but it is definitely on the "would do it again" list. I had pho ga - simply chicken, noodles broth and a bunch of stuff to put in. The bean sprouts, basil, and jalapenos were very fresh, definitely making a difference in the quality of the pho. They used mostly white meat which I like and it was not over cooked, very shreddy. I like the shreddy because it absorbs the broth nicely.
i  haven't Written a review in a few years, DO NOT GO HERE UNLESS YOU HAVE TO. The only reason i did, it was after 5, and the best pho in the TL closes at 5

Got pho dac biet small and it was so fulfilling I was ready to crawl in my bed and K.O. Nothing beats pho from Little Saigon in the OC but this was pretty good. My only complaint: I wish there was more tripe or bigger pieces of it in my bowl.
Good vietnamese food, fast, good price can't complain. Can't really compare to so-cal but its best to look at whats available in the area.
Bottom line: Decent Vietnamese food. Would go back but wouldn't suggest to others.

MMMMMMMMMM, Pho 2000.  A nice place in the city with that family ran vibe I love.  The staff is great which only adds to the fact that they can really make you a nice meal.  I recommend anyone try this place.  My favorite is the crab paste soup, just thinking about it makes me which I was there now =)
Ordered a large Bun Rieu and Coconut Juice here. Affordable, yummy and there is upstairs seating! No wonder this place is pretty packed during the weekends!

Like many others before me, I came here as a plan B to turtle tower being closed. The soup was very good and comparable to the soup base used at turtle tower. Good pho, would come again, maybe even over turtle tower.

I kind of don't want the secret to get out about this place because it's my go-to spot and the pho here is solid! Probably the most underrated pho in the city, and (IMHO) much better than the surrounding places. Not knocking Hanoi style, but this place gives you all the veggies you want in pho and has all the flava. Also the giant pots up front are constantly making broth that is cooked to perfection.
Every time I visit SF, this my go to Pho spot!

My go to spot for Pho in San Francisco.  I prefer to come to Pho 2000 over the nearby Turtle Tower.  The portions are very generous, flavor is good, and they are cheap.  I usually order the small size and that fills me up.
Two people, a big bowl of garlic noodles and a plate of super awesome imperial rolls, and a bill totaling $14?

This is my go-to pho restaurant in San Francisco. The food comes out quickly and the staff always takes care of my idiosyncratic needs no matter how much of a jerk I am being. The only thing holding this place back for me is that it is cash only. I guess I should expect all restaurants in this god-forsaken city to be cash only by now but I guess I'm just not smart enough to carry a bunch of cash with me all the time.
Came here on one of those mornings when you wake up thinking ugh... I need brothy noodles. Yep. I'm hungover.

Went here today for my on going quest to find the best Bún riêu.  This place is quite nice although you have to walk through all the nastiness that is the tenderloin to get there.  That however is a small price to pay.  This place has a friendly staff and clean environment.  The portions are HUGE!  Unfortunately as I am always on the quest for Bun Rieu,  I have had much better elsewhere.  This soup had more pork flavor than crab.  I would come back and try their Pho as I believe this is their strong point.

I had high hopes of taking my mom to Turtle Tower before we went to the Symphony last Friday night for her birthday, but alas the TL location closes at 5PM. She had her hopes up for Pho, so we settled for Pho 2000.
Cash only, pretty fatty broth.
Really good pho and bun. Wish we lived closer by so we could come here more often. They have a card that you can get stamped for a free bowl of pho after buying 10.
Moved to San Fran four months and have been on a mission to find the everyday pho place! And this is it!!! Great price, great service and awesome pho! We will definitely be back a lot!
Solid Vietnamese food! Food comes out quickly (I find this to be true of most Vietnamese noodle shops).

Awesome ribs! Stumbled upon this place while walking through TL and figured I'd give it a shot with a to-go order. The owner was super nice and helpful. Ended up getting ribs, collard greens, and cajun potato salad. I was happy with all three.

Five stars are not enough. The food was phenomenal. I still dream about those beef ribs. The proprietor looked after us with extreme care. Treated us like a local, which was an honor. May you be so lucky as to find yourself here for dinner some evening.
I can't decide whether the food or the service was better I will be back again and again and again and again 11/10

WTF SF?! What's up with the awesome yelp score? Do you know NOTHING about BBQ? All of our food was microwaved. In front of our faces. The butter cake was drenched in liquor and tasted sour. The owner is undoubtedly the nicest business owner in the TL, and she earned the two stars with her smile and demeanor. But being honest? This place kind of offended me. You cannot call what I ate Texas pulled pork. If you are from the south, don't come here looking for a taste of home.

Hyde Away Blues BBQ is a special place. As the name implies, it is hidden away on Hyde street in the Tenderloin. If it weren't for the quaint BBQ sign hanging on the side of the building, or the hand written sandwich board announcing the daily specials, you might miss it. Stepping inside feels like coming home. It is the neighborhood kitchen that you wish you grew up in -- a place where friends stop in just to say hello, and neighbors get to know one another. Something about sharing a single table and the cozy decor makes you feel like it's your favorite aunt's kitchen. The owner, Tammy, is the heart and soul of the place. She seems to know everyone who passes in front of her door, and has always made me feel me and my boyfriend feel like regulars, even though we only stop in about once a month. I can't describe the love that I feel when I sit down in here. It just flows out of Tammy and into the food. The food! The food is absolutely top-notch. The menu is extensive and full of award winning dishes, but I usually just order whatever is on special. To be honest, I'm happy to get whatever is not sold out. It is my understanding that because the restaurant has no kitchen, the food is prepared in advance off-site, heated in the restaurant, and once they are sold out for the day, that's it, come back tomorrow. I'm okay with this system because the food tastes unmistakably home made and I like knowing that everything is fresh for the day. My only complaint is that I always get there too late for dessert -- the pecan pie and peach cobbler always seem to be the first items to sell out.  This is comfort food, plain and simple. The kind that leaves a smile on your face and eases you into a blissful sleep. Too rich for everyday eating, but perfect for a special indulgence.

Like many other reviews have stated, it really is a shame to give this place such a low rating. The lady/owner was really nice and sweet but that can't make up for the fact that all of our food was microwaved. Also, when we came in at around 730, she only had 3 things left: ribs, pulled pork, and lobster mac. Even though she had multiple chalkboards listing so much more, it was kind of a disappointment to only have 3 things to choose from.
OMG this place is da bomb. I've had lots of bbq but this is my new #1. Best Mac salad
Made a stop through to say Hey to the Hostess with the cute smile Ms. Tammy n she hooked me up with the Fried Chicken and Lobster Mac. Delicious Looking forward too the Meatballs on the next visit.

I've been to a few soul food restaurants. This is what I call a heart and soul food restaurant!!! The food was fantastic!! The service was very friendly the woman working there made all of my friends and I feel very much at home!! It was an overall wonderful experience that had me walking out of the restaurant happy!!

Love this place! Don't come here if you want to eat at some fancy hip new tenderloin restaurant. This is a small little hole in the wall place with one woman cooking. She is an absolute sweetheart and cooks the most authentic southern food I've ever had in San Francisco. Takes a while to get your food but it's well worth it. The ribs are my favorite! Little bit pricey but worth it for the authenticity.
as a bay area local i have eaten at many bbq joints, nothing holds the worlds smallest tea candle to hyde away blues.
Overpriced and too salty! Confusing menu.
Delicious food and a friendly host.

Long overdue review...but i had to share my experience here.  First off the don't have a clear menu. You are bombarded with "award winning" items written on a huge wall. It wasn't that big of a deal for my boyfriend and I because we knew exactly what we wanted.
if you've seen House of Cards, I think this is the kind of place Frank would go to if he was living in SF.

This is a family-owned, hole-in-the-wall BBQ joint that I really, really wanted to like. There was a cute dining table outside the restaurant with a chalkboard sign. When you enter, you are immediately bombarded by chalkboards along either side filled with dishes. It was a bit overwhelming as I didn't even know where to begin. My friend and I came here for ribs, and it said "award winning" next to the bourbon ribs, so that's what we got. It was $15.99 for 3 ribs and one side (we had a choice of potato salad, beans, or cole slaw). I asked for collard greens as a side, but that was "extra" cost. I've never heard of collard greens being so pricey that it couldn't be a side dish....
Way too expensive for the quality you get. No idea why people rate this place well! Got ribs for take out. $18 got me only three of the bourbon ribs.

This place is by far my new favorite restuarant in SF. It 'a very similar to "Freddie's" from House of Cards. It's a small tiny little place hidden away in the TL at the corner of Hyde and O'Farrell.  There's only a few places to sit but that's one of the best things about it. It's very homie and Tammy herself is so incredibly nice and happy and friendly.  Everything on the menu is phenomenal. I ate the Hickory Smoked Bourbon Ribs with corn bread, lobster Mac n Cheese,  baked beans with bacon and a sweet peach ice tea. Best dining experience in SF in a very long time. Nothing but good things to say about this place. Part of me wants to keep this a secret but this place is too awesome not to share with the world.
This place is hidden on the side of the street. I thought it was a tiny bodega, but lo-and-behold, a southern BBQ joint.

Liked the owner. Definitely a sweetheart. Definitely expensive. She had a packed house though, so who knows - maybe she could charge more. Really, the only thing that she could improve is the price. A grown man could easily eat $40 worth w/out tip. BBQ shouldn't be that expensive unless it comes with a wait staff and is still cheaper.

Oh man. I ordered the pulled pork, hot links, cornbread and peach cobbler.  It was all better than you deserve (yeah you). The soul proprietor (pun intended) is Tammy. Tammy puts alot of love into what she does and it shows big time. Now that Big Nates is gone, Tammy is the BBQ queen (Memphis Minnies, I still love you and Texas Red sauce and we will always have our weekly date...until I have a heart attack from poor eating habits). I actually just ate some of this honey bourbon cornbread and had to change my review from 4 stars to 5.

San Francisco is a food mecca. With so much competition, it is hard to stand out. Hyde Away Blues BBQ is not in the best neighborhood. It is small enough to walk past even with knowledge of the address. And it has seating for about 6 people at most. Nonetheless, this place has amazing bbq!

I've had BBQ all over town and am pretty damn happy with Hyde Away.  It was delivered to my office in a cardboard box... and that's perfect in my book.  BBQ shouldn't be fancy... it should be good, and this is.
Um... Bomb! Got over here!
You know when.....

I came to Hyde Away as I was wandering through the Tenderloin with one goal: get a good a** meal. I'm so glad that I bypassed Vietnamese for a night to come here. We asked May to bring us the two best entrees and three best sides. She came out with some ribs, some chicken in a mango sauce, and three orders of the crawfish mac and cheese.
OMG.. she now has this pulled pork sandwich with coleslaw and waffles for the bread.  I could eat one every day for the rest of my life.
Super yummy bbq!!!  All the food I have had is excellent!  Lil May is the bomb!!!!!

outstanding.  not the place to go if you want fancy table service or low fat california cuisine.  this is flavor-soaked barbecue everything (and often bourbon soaked too).  go early, because when it runs out, it's off the menu, and when it all runs out, she closes.
We have found it!! Our new spot for bbq! It is tiny, like 6 people in there at a time. The food is killer though. Its definately not cheap but it is delicious.
I don't know.. I've had much better BBQ for the price. The ambience and experience was kind of fun though!
Mad props to this business owner who does it all! We loved the jerk wings sauce was yummy & the meat fell of the bone.
I've been going to Hyde Away Blues BBQ for a while, but I only just recently retrieved my Yelp password, and so I can finally write the review it deserves.
I don't have much to say, other than this is one of the best places ever. Love the food, and the owners are beyond great.

I travel all over the country for work and am especially picky when it comes to BBQ.  I constantly search out the best BBQ joints. When I say this place is good, I put it up against some of the best restaurants and competition BBQ in the entire country.
Come here for soup.  And by soup I mean sickeningly sweet BBQ sauce with some meat in it.

Great southern barbecue made with a lot of love.  Pulled pork, chicken, ribs and especially the lobster mac & cheese are delicious.  The desserts are tasty as well! (Note that if you are only into vinegar based sauces, you won't be too happy.). This is definitely a must stop for anyone living, or visiting the 'loin.
Sweet + Saucy != BBQ

I feel bad leaving a bad review- the person who helped me here was super nice.  However the food was really sub-par.  The meat was dry (even though it was swimming in BBQ sauce when it got it) and the whole meal cost a little more than I expected. I'm from the south and have a pallet seasoned for BBQ.  It becomes apparent when all the chef does it cook the (redacted) out of the meat and smoother it in store bought sauce.
Awesome place! Great food, didn't take too long. Great service. Love the guy outside with the smoker, filling up the TL with great smells!

This is my go-to when I'm hungry and nothing else sounds good. That sounds horrible but I'm still never hungry enough to go to Jack in the Box or McDonalds so this place is not that bad. It horrifies me seeing their aquarium with crabs just stacked on top of each other. It sounds like a horrible way to live the last days of your life so the sense that they have no care for an animal makes my heart break. The food though is fairly decent and better than things you would get in deeper TL or Chinatown. Pretty standard seafood bed you at a Vietnamese / Chinese restaurant. Fairly clean great family restaurant nice people service is quick and it's fairly affordable no its actually really affordable.
Yum! Portion sizes are smaller than the usual "cheap asian food" restaurant category but you definitely get a great value.

The salted baked crab made the trip to this restaurant so so worth it. Like 6 stars this dish.  Do yourself a favor an order a beer with that dish, it's salty and messy and spicy and amazing. don't bother the spring rolls but the goeduck and quail were good.  Atmosphere is nothing but the crab takes care of that. ;)

We went to this place yesterday night,They were about too close. I was like would they give me the left over food. Wow I was wrong. We order 4 plate. Fried rice, clam, salted crab, and shrimp. Wow the food was so fresh and good. Saw the cook went to the tank. To pick out the crab. And the fried rice was reAlly good to. I would say this is the best Chinese Vietnamese food ever eaten. Perfectly flavor, and price are reasonable.Will come back the next time in sf.

This place has very good traditional Chinese food and some Vietnamese plates as well. Beware they do not have pho, but do have some sort of Chinese soup that comes at the same size and even though different than pho it is still a good choice.

I have never had a succulent, moist baked crab at any spot that offers chopsticks as utensils. The interior is always dry, sometimes cuttlefish-dry, which means that I throw away a perfectly good crab each time I forget.
Pushy waiters, bare aspect, rude manager, charge extra for rice with a standard meal, and portions look small.  No thanks.
So yesterday I went to this restaurant and ordered Garlic Noddles. They where good with a hint of spicy. I recommend this place for the food and it's in a cool area of the Tenderloin.

3 stars for the OK food, 1 star for the seriously small portions! I ordered a garlic noodle and charbroiled chicken with the smallest imperial roll I've ever seen. I'm a small Asian girl and usually eating two dishes would make me stuffed, but I was still a bit hungry after.

Me and my husband went to this place because of great reviews. What a disappointment! The charbroiled shrimp noodles tasted like soap! They should also state in the menu if the dish is served  cold. I paid 8.95 USD for a dish I couldn't eat. The staff also also not helpful. It was one of the worst experiences I've had in a long time. Awful!
Great atmosphere and great food! Extremely friendly staff with excellent service! I'll definitely be back...
Awesome food!!! The crispy quails and Mongolian beef are excellent! The crab and seafood also looked great! Maybe next time.

My family was visiting from LA and I brought them here...they loved it!  This time I tried the ginger beef and it was tender and flavorful.  The sweet and sour chicken tasted even better this time and of course I had those awesome garlic noodles.  The service was great and I got my sticks right away this time.  The waiter barely spoke English but he is friendly and efficient.  Fast and friendly staff, and great food.
Eh.. Ambiance is lacking.  Food was low quality and cheap.
My grandfather was treating our entire family to dinner after visiting my great great grandmother's grave. My aunt heard great things about Kim Thanh and recommended we go there.

I was shocked at how me and my friends where treated when we walked in here. We were given very dirty looks and no hospitality. The people here were defiantly raciest, and wanted us out of there asap. I gave them 0 tip, and we walked out. Our food experience was ruined. And I'm disappointed this place is even open in such a diverse place like sf.
Enjoyed a full-course dinner here, including the restaurant's famous baked and salted crab. Service was fast and the price was more than reasonable for what we got.

My parents and I visited here once then we had to come back twice. The seafood is fresh, tastes great and the cooking style are very "Vietnamese". The service is incredibly fast. Best ever place Ive been to in SF. Price is also reasonable! We love the lobster fried with salt and the spicy sour soup (canh chua). Definitely recommended!

Great food. One of the best walnut prawns I've ever had. However, the staff needs to relax, every 2 minutes they tried to take our plates away, even though I said I wasn't finished... Only to see the two of them eating on their break as I left the restaurant!!

The food at this place was right on point . The walnut shrimp and the garlic noodles and along with fried pork . The wonton noodle soup good as well my daughter said the broth was the best she's ever had and she 4

We had the Imperial Rolls and chicken and beef lemongrass.  All were excellent.  Close walk from Union Square, but not full of tourists,  who we walked past to get to this little gem. Great service, to boot!!!

I went here with my friends on 8-16-14 9:15pm'sh.  We ordered the beef carpacio, crab with fried rice, fried egg rolls, cold shrimp rolls, clams with black bean sauce, chicken with veggies, garlic noodle, and rice, also had a Sapporo ($3.75) for myself. The food was better than I expected.  Decent service, the worker there was kind enough to take a photo of all of us.

This restaurant has the real deal in Chinese food. For those who eats Panda express or PF Chang's, check out this restaurant. I got to try out the hot kung pao chicken and chow mein. The food was delicious especially with the steam rice which was the best part in Chinese cuisine. However, I would like to go to this restaurant again for the next trip to San Francisco. The bottom line is that you go to this restaurant before you try out panda express or PF Chang's
The crab and lobster here is super amazing. Anyone in the mood for some pretty authentic seafood dishes in SF, this is your place to go.
This place is freaking delicious.   I cannot recommend enough.  Every single item I have eaten is delicious.
I haven't been here in a long time but I just recently became a yelp member and I had to write a review!!! Every time i visit San Francisco I have to eat here! It's a tradition!!!!

Visiting SF and ate here on the strength of the reviews. Had the best Chinese/Vietnamese food ever. Accommodated our choices and the Vietnamese hot and sour soup was amazing. Kenny waited on us and was wonderful. Entire staff was super. Will eat again while here in SF and come back when in in town.

Alright, I'm a convert, the food here was absolutely ridiculous.  Started off with a seafood clay pot and that alone was really good...piping hot, lots of flavor, get ready to burn your tongue a few times.  Next I got one of the fried fishes, whatever was the special of the day and the batter that they used was insane.  I'm pretty sure if I used that batter on anything it'd taste delicious.  Can't recommend this place enough and am kind of bummed I missed out on the crab.

The pictures & yelp reviews really convinced me I should go here for dinner last night.  I ordered the salted soft baked crab with garlic noodles. The crab tasted amazing at first but after a while the taste got very overwhelming. I didn't even eat my garlic noodles bc it was covered in garlic! It really intimidated me. I felt as thought my mouth will be raw after the combination of salt and minced garlic. I was super dehydrated after I finished the meal and was thirsty for hours on end! I should have known that..."salted". I guess I'm a low sodium type of gal. I'm glad I got to try to place out at least once but I don't think I will be returning.

Post-triathlon training continued our tradition of dining in the Tenderloin. Admittedly attempted to go to Ha Namh Ninh (apparently closed for re-location)! Decided on Kim Thanh after seeing it on a Yelp search last time.
Claypot catfish 3 yelps small portion but tasty

I came here with the  team of party after a happy day over the city. It was then packed. As we reserved the seat so ours was blanked soon. Fried rich, beef and duck was orderd for every one. But it was not possible for each to take the whole of them as they were in a larger size but the price was same as others. Must back here in the next with whole family.

This place is next door to my apartment and I have been here twice and have never been disappointed. I pretty much get the same thing, but each time I am pleasantly surprised by how delicious it is and how yummy everything looks that other people ordered. Happy to have this next door so I can get my pho on anytime I want.

Disheartened that Kare-Ken across the street just happened to be closed on 7/18 unexpectedly, I shuffled over to Kim Than for take-out.  I was a bit overwhelmed by the extensive menu and having to shift my mental mindset from Japanese to Chinese, but the staff were quick to offer up recommendations.

This place was LEGIT. I had a friend in town who Yelp'ed up this restaurant since it was near his hotel and we found ourselves here several minutes later. So glad my friend found this place- it was a great surprise and definitely a restaurant I'll be returning to.

I would say it's -1 place was absolutely terrible. Ordered CHICKEN lemon grass 3 times they brought out beef lemon grass saying I ordered wrong. My girlfriend waited 15mins for her dish after I was done eating. We both got SICK. Horrible horrible never eat there again. Worst service who tells a customer there wrong about what they ordered. They must hate Americans

Wow!  The food here is outstanding in portion and quality!   Small place with zero ambiance but if you're wanting quality Thai near union square, this is the place!  We tried 7 items and they were all 5 star!
The food was very average. We had some of the soups, flavor was 'meh'. Service was awkward as they kept lurking to take our dishes away. Was expecting more and was disappointed.
The food was amazing. And they have tanks up front in case you want really fresh seafood.  I found some great dishes that are hard to find like raw beef salad.
Great salt baked crab and garlic noodles.  Friendly service and good value.  Highly recommended!
I love red crafish! The food is excellent and the service is great! Ill probaby eat here again soon! SO YUMMMMMY hah

I think their quality has gone down.  Just came back from there, was so disappointed that I have to write this review.  I love seafood, crab, crawfish, lobsters, shrimps, clams... but it was so bad that I will not eat crawfish for awhile:(  It was very fishy, felt like undercooked, they took it back to cook more, a bit better afterwards but still not good.  Crawfish did not taste fresh, the salt & pepper flavor did not get into the meat.  Everything else was disappointing too but not as bad, papaya salad, gumbo, corn.  Fries and garlic chicken wings were ok.  Will not recommend it.
I only had Cajun cuisine in New Orleans, so I might have higher standards of it, and shouldn't have expected much from a Tenderloin place.

My friend and I ordered their group meal #1 and it was definitely fit for at least 3-4 people. Side of garlic bread, garlic noodles, sweet potato fries, and 3 pounds of shrimp with some sausage and corn. It normally comes with crawfish but I'm glad we substituted them for shrimp. They were huge shrimp but slightly over cooked.

I really like getting shrimp here with their Red Crawfish Special sauce.  If you ask for spicy, be prepared for spicy.  Definitely really tasty.  My boyfriend is a fan of the fried catfish and cajun fries. We live nearby, so we usually order in for a pick up and they are always really fast with making the order. We've had their clam chowder which is pretty good as well.
I've only ordered from here take-out. Delivery is usually fast, but I can't comment at all on what the restaurant is like beyond its food.

I've been to all cajun seafood restaurants in San Francisco and a couple outside of the city. I am a huge cajun fan. Red Crawfish is the only cajun restaurant that I've been to uses FROZEN CLAMS. FROZEN, not fresh. Secondly, the shrimps are not fresh as well. The shrimps I had all had black spots on their heads. This is a sign a bad shrimp. I grew up by the water and I love seafood.  I love to chew on the shrimp heads and suck on the juice, but the shrimp heads from red crawfish are bitter and nasty. YUCK.
Very good food and pretty quick deliver on a Friday night.

I was staying in San Francisco for a business trip for 3 days and actually ordered from this place twice through my eat24 app. Once ordered they said to allow 1 hour for delivery but they  came much faster than that. The flavor of the seafood was amazing and the sides equally as good. I plan on going back the next time Im in the Bay area, I personally like this place better than the Boiling Crab.

Not the best crawfish joint I've been to, but it hits the spot when you have that crave. Got the Cajun and the garlic butter. The Cajun even medium spice has a strange kick when you inhale it. It was ok on flavor. I really liked the garlic butter better so i ended up dipping the meat from the Cajun into the garlic butter. That sauce also belongs on the garlic noodles.  Mountains and mountains of garlic. The corn is always a good call cause it soaks up flavor so well. The sausage was meh.. I could have done without.
Best crawfish place for me! I love their original + garlic butter mixed together. I like mine spicy. Their spicy is spicy. Their garlic butter crab is off the chain. Big crawfish.

This was my second time back to this establishment and the spice level was considerably spicy for our group. I'm all about the spicy (as I've read that eating jalapenos will help stimulate your metabolism) but we only got the medium spicy with original crawfish seasoning and everyone was chugging their beer/water and trying to mask the spice with the garlic noodles. Our second round of seafood, we opted for garlic butter as we needed a break from the spice. It hit the spot. The cajun fries/wings were spot on delicious. We had the whole place to ourselves for a good hour during prime time dining on a Tuesday night which was nice. Service was a bit slow, but we were taking our time catching up. I'll be back
Holy crawfish, batman this place is so good!

This place is cool for the location it is in. We loved the garlic noodles and the shrimp was really fat.  I give them 3 stars because their clams were so small that they evaporated, I pulled 5 clams out and there was nothing inside. We had to speak to our server to see what he can do about it. He came back with clams with CLAMS inside. The Mild sauce was spicy but that's what we asked for, if your not a spicy person I would suggest to go with the regular sauce. Overall this place is good. I would come back and not order the clams.

We came here for a birthday celebration. I'd never heard of it but what a deal! $249 fed 14 of us. It included shrimp, crawfish, broccoli, asparagus, corn, fried octopus, fried catfish. Also, there is a Vietnamese fusion to it. They also have noodles.  Of course that did not include drinks.
5 STARS for the best garlic noodles in SF! (Bold statement I know...). Good Cajun broth, and not my favorite crawfish spot, but it hits the spot.

Recently we took a visiting friend here for dinner. We've visited the restaurant several times and while the service wasn't really spot on, this time was just horrible.The timing of our meal was atrocious, with appetizers coming out after main entrees, main entrees all coming out at different times, incorrect sizes of meals arriving, incorrect food items, etc. When we asked to have an appetizer returned as a result of its late delivery, the wait staff seemed completely confused. After speaking to the equally oblivious 'manager on duty' (apparently the real manager wasn't in yet, though he 'should have been'), they ultimately gave us an order of free beignets when we didn't want dessert. Overall a disappointing experience that we won't be repeating anytime soon.
Well....what can I say. ....GARLIC! That pretty much sums it up!! Too much freaking garlic and they dont know how to properly cook crawfish!!! This was such a disappointment. ....
For delivery it was good. The food arrived sort of warm, as expected.

I hope I don't jinx it - but this place is really awesome. I can only order delivery, and they DELIVER ;) I mean they honor your special requests, and make the most awesome crawfish in SF - my favorite being the cajun seasoned one. I usually get 2 pounds - one for me, one for my SO. I get mine spicy and it has a solid kick, she gets it medium - and still complains of burning :)

I've been here a few times, and everything has been pretty solid. This time I ordered medium spicy take out, it ended up being extra spicy. I never have a problem with spicy Indian, Chinese, or other cuisines. This time it was obviously wrong. After consuming my extremely spicy meal and about 4 hours later, my stomach was upset for the rest of the night and ended up having the worst diarrhea ever.

I am a Cajun. This place is lame. Also, I'm not sure what non-Cajun freak pepper of Satan sauce was used in my seafood combo of boiled meat-but the waitress could have you know,  gotten me some water in a timely fashion.

Heeeey! My first time here after hearing so many great things! I had the garlic noodles and added shrimp! DELICIOUS! PLUS the seafood combo which included perfectly fried catfish, shrimp, squid, oysters and my fav....sweet potato fries! I will be back for the rest of the menu!!
Too expensive for the quantity and quality.
I don't see what the fuss is all about.  Maybe I'm the anomaly? But here's the breakdown:
Chines and Cajun? The garlic noodles are great, so much flavor and not all that greasy. The Imperial Rolls were also killer.

This was the first really awful meal that my husband and I have had since moving to san Francisco almost two years ago. The garlic noodles seemed to be just greasy spaghetti with garlic on it. The general chicken wings were too suspect for me to eat. I think maybe they were freezer burnt? Either way, we will never return to this place.
The food was amazing! We had 2 orders of the crawfish( original seasoning) spicy is really spicy and a crab ( garlic & butter). The corn was also really good!!

I ate here for my bday jan 2 2014.... the food was good it just took a while for the food to come. I only turned 26 so the fact that they did not have a bar or cocktails sucked... but I had a watermelon mimosa it was tasty noise level was low ... place was pretty small not good for big groups

Quite disappointed. Maybe it's because I didn't try the crawfish but I did try the salt and pepper calamari and beignets and both were pretty bad. The calamari was very fishy and the beignets were stale donut holes!! The only thing that was edible was my friend's sesame chicken and the garlic noodles- both just ok.

Really delicious find in the TL! I got the pound of shrimp, medium with the classic crawfish seasoning, tons of flavor! I actually think it's better then the boiling crab in San Jose! The service was a little slow, I went on my lunch break from school, it's was around 3 and there was only 1 other party in there besides me. If I wasn't in such a rush I probably would have been more patient tho! I will def be back and try other items on the menu!

Red Crawfish is such a great find!! We were craving seafood and wanted to try something new, and happened to find this place on Yelp. We decided to give it a try and headed over there around 7:30. When we first got there it was completely empty, which didn't me a lot of confidence, but within 20 minutes of being sat the place began to fill up.
Garlic overload! And I loved it!
I think they should work on their ambiance. Bare tables and a dirty mirror doesn't help me forget the seediness of the street outside, food was good but nothing to make a special trip about.
Red crawfish is my go to for garlic noodle and cajun shrimp in the city. There is no wait and prices are not over the top.
This is a hole in the wall in the Tenderloin area, but don't overlook how good this place is.

This place is super overrated.  I will admit that after seeing it consistently packed every evening that I walked by, I did have somewhat high expectations.  Went with a group of friends, got the combo #2 which came with a whole crab, some shrimp, and some crawfish.  The shrimp was kinda tough and overcooked, the crawfish were almost inedibly tiny (some smaller than the shrimp!), and the garlic crab really wasn't all that flavorful.  The papaya salad, garlic noodles, and dessert beignets were definitely up to par, but we didn't exactly come here for salad and noodles... we came here for the seafood, which was pretty mediocre.  I think that for the price we paid, I've definitely been to MUCH better places that serve seafood in this same exact fashion.
PREPARE 2 get your hands DIRTY! :)
I have been here a couple times.  Red beans and rice is yummy, although needs a little extra salt.  Last time I ordered the salt and pepper crab - very tasty.  The fries are really good too.
My friend brought me here once during the evening. We had little red crawfish, it was so good. We also got the garlic noodles as well. Be prepared to get your fingers dirty too.

I would say this is one of "must-try" places in San Francisco. Food is amazing!!! The best Middle Eastern I've ever had, outside of Middle East. I've dined in as well as take-outs numerous times, and I have never disappointed. Lastly, I recently ordered for twenty people and they gave us lots of food. Again the food was excellent and everyone was so satisfied, and had food-coma!!! This place is a local gem. I love it.

I had been wanting to try this place ever since it opened, and finally got the chance on a recent Indian Summer evening. My dinner companion hesitated when he realized that they do not serve alcohol, but I was able to appease him with promises of an after dinner drink at the Fly bar across the street.

I had no food, so I can't comment on that. No one seated me / greeted me. I was ignored completely by whoever was supposed to be there. I walked to a table and everyone turned around. Not one person was a woman. All men! I quickly turned around and left. #wtf moment

Real authentic arabic  Yemeni food ( most customers are From Yemen . Just stick with signature lamb and goat dishes , really delicious . Ask for extra salsa type side sauce . Rice really good but I like with lot of sauce .

Ate dinner here just now. Good not great. I had the shawarma which was well seasoned but a little dry. Rice had little flavor. Salad was light and refreshing. I was also a bit destructed by the pigeon that had gotten in that none of the employees seemed interested in shooing. Probably won't come back.

It was our last night in S.F. and our friends who live there recommended it.  The food was excellent.  My wife did not have a large selection because she is allergic to corn and all of it's by-products but she loved what she had.  I had a salmon special that I loved.  They let us stay chatting for a long time and I left my ball cap there.  Hopefully they will send it to me.
Ugh, another place with amazing food and substandard service.
Uncooked chicken. Awful. They served us RAW chicken. They were sorry when we sent it back but that doesn't cancel the fact that we put raw chicken in our mouth.
Awesome. If you want people to look and speak exactly as you do, San Francisco is not the place for you
rice was really good
This place was fantastic. Frankly, I do not know much about Yemeni food, and although I love Middle Eastern food, I am typically ignorant when it comes to the names of the dishes.
Amazing restaurant, fresh food, halal which is considered to be very delicious. I literally love to eat there!!
Good food.  Service could have been better. Meat and rice were not as soft as it was supposed to be. Overall , nice place to eat. Consider the crowded parking around the restaurant.

Whoa - this was unexpectedly fantastic.  My husband and I decided to walk home from Union Square, since it happened to be a fairly beautiful evening out.  The smells coming from Yemeni's drew us in - I can't resist a good kebab and the hubs likes to keep me happy, so in we went.
The food is great but I'm sorry to say that their customer service really sucks especially when I order over the phone . Work on that please .
No doubt this place is the best middle eastern food in the city.

We went there for a quick dinner before a movie. The server was courteous, quick and considerate. We ordered 2 appetizers and a salad, to which our server recommended to order the appetizer platter that has a sample of all of them and more. The falafel was amazing. The main dish was also delicious. I recommend this restaurant. We'll go back for sure. One thing to know is that their in-house beverages are very sweet. I got a cup of their tea. It was way too sweet for my taste. I could hardly down it.
Yummy and a great value as prices are very reasonable for heaping portions.

I came back Tues night and tried the baked lamb. It was tender and moist. It came with the same yummy rice and salad. I called it in, and took it back to my hotel. I am glad this place isn't in LA, or I would gain a ton of weight eating here all the time. Service is quick and friendly. Will definitely come again and again when visiting SF.
I visited this place with my dad. The food is great. I had chai too which was different than any chai I have tried. The ambiance is cool. I feel like being  in yamn

Ordered for delivery and it was horrible!  All the various meat dishes were way overcooked and dry and tough.  The lentil soup was dry!!  Seriously, no liquid, just paste.  The rice was dry and almost hard.  Ended up throwing out most of the food and won't order from there again.
This is a nice restaurant. Food is usually good. Portions are big, plenty of rice with almost every item. Only problem with the food is that sometimes meat tend to be a little bit dry.

My friend and I were initially interested in going to Saha, but the two-hour wait eventually steered us across the street to this Yemeni restaurant. The interior was large, spacious, and filled with Yemeni customers of all ages. Upon entering, there was a two-tier platform overlooking the open floor and cash register. Lighting was a tad bright for dinner, but the trade off was the feel of authenticity in the air.
Pretty good lamb!
I loved this place/ wonderful taste/ dont forget to try their free tea it is amazing/ I ordered Mandi Plate also Lamb ribs both were great.

Their food was super delicious. The best middle eastern i've had in a long time, and i've been to several middle eastern counties. We started off with the mar'a soup, and the mixed appetizer which is falafel, hummus, labneh, baba ganoush, tabuleh salad and fresh baked bread. Then for the main dish my husband and I ordered i think it was called handeel or hadim, which is lamb in a little tomatoe sauce just for flavor on a bed of nicely flavored rice and salad. And then finished off with some tea. Their portions were very big. I took most of it home, but an hour later I was craving some more and was able to finish it off. Their food had all the right flavors and not too spicy hot. Their service was excellent, our waitress was very polite. Next time we go to San Francisco this place is on our list for sure.
I came here again this past weekend, and I feel like the quality has dropped somehow.
The food was so delicious and comes in big portions, the hospitality and service were outstanding. I am from Florida and I will defiantly come here again.
Mixed food experience but got a seat really easily and the other guests did seem to be regulars.
I'm  big fan of Middle Eastern food in general. Even though of all the recommendations, this place is nothing special. Everything was a little bland sorry to say.
BE AWARE THAT THIS PLACE DOES NOT HONOR THEIR RESTAURANT.COM DISCOUNT COUPONS.  For this reason I give it a one star rating.

I've been here 3 times. The first time was several years ago and it was a bit of a let down. I decided to try it again about a month ago and loved it so I came back again and it was great both times. I think it's a family run business. They are very nice and checked on us multiple times to make sure everything was going well. The food was great and has an authentic homemade feel. Prices are extremely reasonable and portions are large. I recommend the baked lamb
Great service. Food was really good. Great quality. The saltha was spicy and enough to share between 2 people. The highlight by far is their bread.
Good food nothing special but it is nice to have some variety in the neighborhood.

Pretty sure I'm gaining extra weight right now because of the rice. I can't stop eating it! Everything else I've eaten has been delicious, particularly the rice, chicken, rice, veggies, and have I mentioned their rice?

First time coming to this restaurant after seeing the pictures on yelp! The dishes I got were excellent and I was surprised by how good was and how much food they gave for one person! Food was fresh and one dish could be eaten by 2 people. Definitely coming  back here soon.

Good authentic food, really nice service. A nice ethnic neighborhood restaurant -- we need to keep these going. It was tasty - the hummus was smooth and the lamb was tender. Felt like eating at your Yemeni grandma's house.

The shawarma and honey drizzled flatbread are insanely good, so good I went into a coma because I couldn't handle the rich flavors drop kicking my taste buds. If it wasn't for The Avengers, I would never have found the power of shawarma.

I was fortunate to have been staying at the Hotel Carlton which is just right across for this restaurant. It's walking distance to a variety restaurants, this being one. Ordered for pick up and got the appetizer sampler and that was really good. My bf got the beef shawarma and I got beef kebabs. Both were good but the meat was a tad dry which was a bummer.

I love this place the food is awesome i tried the mendi , combo chicken and kofta, trout everything was soo good, i love the manager (Sana) she's so sweet and lovely her service was awesome very good hospitality.
The carne asada tacos were outstanding, fast service, great price. Chips and salsa are on par, would eat here again.
A great surprise and a great find. Working off Van Ness today and was craving Mexican food. The super carnitas burrito left me very satisfied. I'll be trying the tacos next time.

Delicious, convenient, and reasonably priced. Not 5 stars because it didn't wow me in any way (food, service, ambience, price). The tacos are stuffed pretty well. We had a chicken, a prawn, and a fish. All were overstuffed and delicious.
quick and dirty mexican food- that's all it's about after a long night of raging on polk. This place is predominantly a grocery store, but serves tacos, burritos, etc. and smoothies on the side.

Last night my neighbor Julie and I needed a bite to eat but didn't want to go out so we agreed on burritos but from  where? Apparently my go to taqueria El Castellito on Golden Gate is closed so I had to find a new place and that's where Yelp comes in. Using the neighborhood search I found Los Hermanos which was only 6blocks from my apartment plus they had solid reviews, sold!
I didn't expect to eat some of the best Mexican food in a place that's half restaurant / half convenience story, but there you go.

Fantastic Mexican food! Don't judge me, I had to be super white and get the prawn chimichanga. Bomb salsas too! Happy to have you in the hood, I hate traveling to the mission for good Mexicali action! Next up, fish tacos!
what a great gem inside of Mid City Foods! Directly across the street from A La Turca. had the fish tacos and regular tacos (beef and chicken) and loved it. Salsas are amazing as well.
Burritos are so delish ! Will definitely recommend this taqueria! Awesome people!

My friend and I wandered down Polk to a closed Super Burrito location - at the time we thought it was the biggest disappointment of the night, turns out it was the best thing that ever happened to us. We quickly pulled up Yelp and stared at our phones while we walked into the Tenderloin at 12am - thats safe right? We found what I like to call a "hidden burrito gem". The people are nice and the burritos are delicious. To quote Arnold Schwarzenegger, we will be back!

a mega jump up from the previous management and kitchen.  for old hands, it'll be enough to tell you that i recognized at the grills an old face from chile verde (on 6th near market) and castillito b (when it was first starting).  a master taquerieño, this one.
Quick pit stop for a late lunch... Excellent quality and excellent flavor.  Three tacos with carne asada, well priced and quickly served and out the door!
under new management, and the food is very good......

Gotta love the new name, and the food quality has changed 1000 percent , if you are a meat lover  go for the super carne asada Burrito the meat is beautifully seasoned will be back there to explore more things , you can also enjoy a corona while watching people walk by .

El Tesoro is finally under new management this place is right next to me but the quality of meat they use wasn't all that, I just recently notice that they changed ownership and the have new name so I decided to give it another try and iam glad I did, it's great, los Hermanos is my new favorite taqueria
This review is based on my TO-GO experience.

This place was interesting. I came here with a friend thinking it was a typical pho place that is talked about a lot. After eating here, I don't feel like what they call "pho" was really pho. The broth, the noodles and the veggies for the pho were all different from typical pho. However, it was pretty good! More like a fusion or a spin off of pho.

I love Turtle Tower's Pho Ga! The broth is unique and very flavorful. It's nothing like the typical pho broth I've encountered but it's delicious. I love that it's wider noodles too. I'm tired of the typical pho vermicelli noodles lol

I was really excited to check this place out after all the hype I'd heard about it. I'm sad to say that it didn't live up to the hype, though part of it may be my fault on choosing the wrong item on the menu...

We wanted a Saturday hangover lunch, so we went searching for Vietnamese. Decided on this place over the other popular options in the area (Pho 2000 and Hai Ky Mi Gia) purely based on the cleanliness and natural lighting that the place provided. Looks can be deceiving!

I've been coming to Turtle Tower for years when it was at its older (smaller) location just down the street.  I'm not sure if I'm just imagining it, but I've been to the new location twice and it's been a bit disappointing.  Still good pho, just not as amazing as I remembered.  Ordered the pho ga (no skin) and it was really mostly just noodles with very little chicken (along with some skin still floating around the soup).   One benefit is that the wait is shorter at least.

I was craving pho. I noticed they didn't have oyster sauce which made me sad. I saw they used different noodles which scared me. Once I got my pho and had a taste it was delicious. It tastes homemade. Clean and flavorful. I ordered the small and I am stuffed. They give you a lot more noodles than other places. Will be coming back.

Came all the way from Tracy to eat here in Little Saigon.  Heard good things. Had the number 9 and the 12 for my wife.  Both of us had the same conclusion. Wasted trip better food in our area. Enough said.
I was craving pho and stumbled upon this place based on my housemate's recommendation.

The server said he couldn't finish a small bowl of pho, but the large left me hungry.  I'm not a fan of being outside in the Civic Center area, but I came in for lunch with some coworkers.  The new place is nice.  It's clean, big, and well lit.  Oddly enough, a new pho place opened in the old location down the block.
Delicious spring roles for a better price than I've seen at other Vietnamese joints- $5.25 for 4 shrimp/roast pork rolls.

Love the chicken pho here! The service is good and fast. I am taking one star out because of cash only policy and also because the soup flavor is not consistent- sometimes it tastes pretty bland, and other times it's great.
Turtle Tower is a great way to warm up on a cold day. They are known for their chicken pho, which is the one I tried.

I love this place, I could literally eat here everyday. The chicken pho with the giblets is on point and the best. The service is great and consistent; everyone that works here is very nice and friendly. This place never disappoints.

Finally went to turtle tower and was pleasantly surprised on how great everything tasted. The pho (stir fry beef with veggies) was great with flavorful broth.  The small was large enough.  The banh mee was ok.  I would go for the pho alone.
The #4 is the best. The meat is extremely tender and they give you a lot. The meat is thick and succulent.

Service is unbelievably rude toward us ( we are Vietnamese American ) by the bald head host . But we observed his service toward Caucasian is totally opposite? Weird but we're not here to complaint about their service . The pho ga ( chicken pho) was so bland we asked for hoysin sauce . The mean waitress told us no sauce no veggies , wow they really think their pho soup is the best .

Maybe I have a high standard when it comes to pho since I've eaten it most of my life. This place is terrible. A friend of ours recommended this place to us. Said it was out-of-this-world good. My boyfriend and I were beyond disappointed with both the beef and chicken pho we ordered. Not only did it lack the infamous pho flavor, it did not come with our accustomed bean sprouts and greens side. Something we're not used to. Definitely will not be back. Thanks for the horrifying experience though, Turtle Tower.
I finally decided to try Turtle Tower...it's just been too long.
GREAT PHO GA!

Great for traditional style Phô but didn't knock completely knock it out of the park but, this restaurant did pop my Phô cherry and now im completely hooked! My wife had the rare beef Phô and it was by far better than my chicken Phô so I ended up stealing hers. Their spring rolls were soo delicious and the peanut sauce was phenomenal and better then any others I've ever had. Highly recommended however that you get there early because we had a party of 6 at 10:00 am and there was no wait but shortly after the line was out the door.
Best chicken noodle soup pho I've had. Period. Let's call this the Asian version of the American chicken noodle soup. :)
Northern style pho, aka chicken pho.

They remodeled and moved into a bigger spot in the tenderloin. I really like the broth and noodles at turtle tower because it doesn't taste as heavy as the pho at other places. However my husband prefers more of the southern Vietnamese pho style . I always get the chicken pho. It has never disappoint since they first opened in the tiny alley corner spot. Service is fine and quick. One star down because there is always a wait time because their busy even with the larger space and also because the pho is still good but it didn't taste as good as the earlier days. Still recommend it for pho though!

Quick service and good Pho. Their small is definitely filling and large enough for a solo. The fresh coconut juice is AHUMAZING!! Its refreshing with large chunks of coconut in it, so it comes with a spoon you usually get for ice cream sundaes so you can scoop out the chunky coconut. Id come back just for that!
Stop #2 on our petite adventure
What the hell happened to Turtle Tower? I remember when this was the platinum standard against which all other pho houses aspired (previous review:
Overdue review:

Long waits for this place and it isn't even amazing. It's more northern style vietnamese pho where they don't offer hoise  sauce. The pho was ok. I expected more for the wait. Also I enjoy going to a vietnamese restaurant where I can speak vietnamese to the staff but apparently everyone there was chinese.

Pretty much the most overrated Pho place I've ever been to.  Broth is super oily and price is a bit high for chicken pho.  Generates a lot of hype and seems to be Vietnamese mecca for non vietnamese people.  Expect long waits and long lines.
The beef noodle soup is  the best.  very tasty with a excellent soup base.  Sometimes there is a wait but usually no more than 10 minutes.

damn good chicken noodle soup, probably the one of the best! only thing is the weird vibe and snobby hipster customers in there who seem to be competing with you from the moment u walk in the door. lots of up and down looks and smirks. everytime i go there the same thing, but has nothing to do with the food or the service, js the customers....its like a room full of haters, hahaha. maybe my pants arent tight enough, sorry forgot my pink rimmed sunglasses. but yea the food is very good
It's not the same!!
Located in the heart of Little Saigon of SF.

Delicious pho! I've eaten pho many times and have always ordered it with beef broth. This time, I went for the pho ga (chicken). The broth was delicious and the chicken was oh so tender. SO good that I will be ordering pho ga instead of beef in the future. I'm sold!
My Chicken noodle soup had dish soap taste to it. I am not picky when it comes to food, but the soap taste just simply ruined my appetite. I had few tries and couldn't eat it anymore.
Cash only! And come before 11, the lunch rush starts then.

Read highly rated reviews throughout yelp so we decided to stop here while visiting sf....we ordered pho tai and pho ga.  The broth taste ok but the noodles are large rice version not the thin one.   Services were good but nothing to rave about.  Kinda disappointing.

The constant tug and pull in the battle for noodle soup dominance occurs every time I sit down to a good bowl of one. Whether it's a laksa, duck leg and wonton noodle, or tsukune ramen, I'm always torn as to which flavor and texture profile I adore more.  Then I eat turtle Towers pho ga. Over. Done. Vietnamese rules supreme in my humble overweight decision.

There's always a wait whenever we're here. One thing I noticed is the pho ga broth is inconsistent, one day the flavors were on point. The broth flavors were perfect as there was no need to add spice to balance out the flavors. Everything worked perfectly. However, the next day or two, we went back and the broth flavors were a little bland. I was disappointed. On the other hand, the chicken with my soup was very moist and fresh.
We come after every Escape Games nearby. Great food with excellent prices, and they're always great for our small group.

I was on my way to House of Thai on Larkin (formerly Thai House Express) when I passed by Modern Thai, which I hadn't seen before.  I looked them up on Yelp, they had some good reviews, plus a free Thai Iced Tea offer, so I thought I'd give it a try.  Although they have a nice ambience, including a covered outside sidewalk area, and their staff is friendly, and the Thai Iced Tea was great and served in one of those very tall glasses, I thought the actual food was just 'ok.'   I ordered the chicken satay and although it was served in a nice, long dish, the way it was prepared it was a bit dry and not very flavorful.   I then ordered my favorite type of curry, mussaman, which is usually made with beef cubes, but this time with chicken.  Now I've had a lot of mussaman in my many varied visits to Thai restaurants (with R'noh Thai in Larkspur making it the very best), but this was NOT Mussaman, or at least the way I know it.  I don't know what it was but it had a very different flavor, a bit bland, the peanuts were uncooked and there were no potatoes.  The chicken, which she said was white meat, was not -- it was thigh and leg -- which, for some people, is absolutely fine -- but I only like white meat chicken in my curry dishes because it soaks up the curry sauce much better.  It was a misunderstanding -- she didn't understand what I meant by white meat -- so I'm not rating them on that -- but I simply have had better Thai food elsewhere.
Delivery, fast, yummy. Great price, good portions.

The food was good, i had the Green curry and the fried veggie rolls. My low review comes from the spicyness level of the green curry was way above what i am used to.  When the restaurant takes time to specify some dishes as spicy, i assumed this would not be.

I've come here often since it's so close, and offers a wide variety of menu options. The Pad Thai has a great flavor, and the crab moon cheese is delicious. My only complaint is it's a bit on the pricey side compared to other thai restaurants nearby.
This place is awesome!
Ordered for delivery, I got the MT mango entree with Thai iced tea and blueberry roti. Lived the roti, and enjoyed the mango entree as well. Would order from here again

The food at this place was great. The atmosphere was somewhat awkward. The service was horrible and none of the servers were able to speak any English enough to get our order correct. There was a $5 service charge for eating with 4 people and a mandatory tip of 20%. The waiter actually chased us to our car in the parking garage, demanding us to pay the addition 5%. We were never informed of such rules and it was quite embarrassing.

I ate here today, everything was fine until an Entree was not how I ordered it and when i tried to explain that was not correct the manager got an attitude because I would not accept to eat something I didn't want, and she was really rude.
