Restaurant etiquette is a negative. Plus there was a $4.50 Service charge for a party of two....this place is a must avoid in San Francisco, good thing I only drove 600 miles to have bad service.

Flavorless pad thai. The lime was the only flavor to the dish. Waitress had attitude. Just a bad experience all around. I didn't get food poisoning so I'll give it 2 stars. But  I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

Modern Thai is just OK. There wasn't anything in particular we tasted that I thought "WOW, I need to have that again". That's not always a bad thing; I've noticed San Francisco has quite a few Thai restaurants and this ranks amongst the most average of them. I will say that I was impressed with their shrimp spring rolls. I could actually taste each element and not just a mess of greens. The Singapore noodles and Pad Thai were good but not knockout.

Love the food and ambiance.  They definitely give you your money's worth. The waitress was very nice.  Their lunch menu seems more like dinner because of the amount of food. I will definitely be back!!!!!!!!
I haven't had many of the other dishes, but the Tom Yum is great!

Went on a really warm day and the interior of the restaurant didn't help since there was no apparent AC. Service was slow, but the 4 starts comes from the unexpected spiciness of my green curry fried rice which was delicious. Also, I have never had green curry fried rice before and it was a great dish that I would try again, but after I've tried more items on their menu!

Definitely our favorite Thai restaurant in SF. The food is always flavorful and fresh. When we order delivery through GrubHub, they typically beat the projected delivery time by at least 15 minutes. Our favorites are the pumpkin curry and the crispy pumpkin (like pumpkin french fries!), as well as the spring rolls and pad see ew. We eat a lot of Thai food and almost every time we decide to stray from Modern Thai, we wish we hadn't.
I've been to the Modern Thai several times ... With my husband, with friends ... And they all loved it ! (Me too)

This review is only for delivery. I ordered delivery 3 times from Modern Thai the first time perfect took about 45 but that's fine everything is kind of slow for delivery around here. Second time the food was a little cold and they forgot one thing. The third time they brought me the wrong food, when I called them the women on the phone yelled at me insisted that I had gotten the right food (funny thing she hadn't asked for my address so how did she know what my order was??) and then when she finally agreed to replace my order she told me that I better of not eaten the wrong food because it needed to be returned. So because they are rude as*^%#oles I will not be ordering from them again. Also this was an online order and I went back and checked that I had put the order in correctly.

Best Pad See Ew I've ever had! Some places make it dry and bland, this one the noodles have just the right amount of sauce and it comes with plenty of vegetables. My roommate tried it for the first time this weekend and couldn't believe how good it was! And they bring out your food really fast, even on a Saturday when there was a fair amount of customers. I've been here loads of times and it's good comfort Thai food. Also, the Thai Iced Tea is delicious and comes in a fun glass. Can't beat that!

We ordered crab rangoon, crab fried rice, and red curry delivery via Seamless tonight, first time eating from here. Delivery was quick, right about 40 minutes and food came hot which was great. One downfall, and I am pretty disappointed about it, is that curry doesn't come with rice which I've never heard of - I always assumed it was part of the dish. But the flavor of everything was fantastic and I'd definitely eat here again. Tip to management, just add $1-2 to the curry and have it come with rice so customers don't get surprised.

I absolutely love the good here. It is by far my favorite thai good place. The decor is nice the food is delicious and thru keep the place clean. I love the peanut sauce, they have good red curry, and they have this spicy calamari dish that is so yummy! I have been going here for years and every time i try a new thai food place I end up being disappointed.
Excellent authentic thai cuisine. A highlight on Polk street. Would definitely recommend.
Hella good!!! friendly servers too, and good location, nice place t go to after a few drinks from one of the several bars close by.

I think I like almost all the dishes we've ordered. Very very good. Just the service needs to improve because it's horrible. I think they are only there to write your order down, bring your food, and give "I hate my life" expressions. All well, food is good, thats' why we're there.
Great place to bring a lunch date, the food is fantastic and very timely. I had the Pad Thai and it was delicious, as well as a chai tea in a fancy glass.

I really don't have anything bad to say about this place.  The food is good, service is friendly, nice interior design, standard prices for thai.  You get a free Thai iced tea when you check in on yelp!
Pad Sieng Hai is so good

Update: the Thai fried rice is probably one of the best items. The beef salad was tasty but not the traditional style/flavor. Crab moons were good but very standard, and the pad Thai noodles are very skinny and the flavor tangy.
the pumkin curry is a must try!!!! I also really like the coconut shrimp skewers
HANDS DOWN MY FAVORITE THAI PLACE!!

Ordered delivery last night. The foods were good, esp the tom yum goong with shrimp was excellent. To tell you the truth, I have no expectation on delivery foods, but this place packed their foods neatly and look appetizing! Will def get foods from here again!

Totally impressed!  Had chicken satay skewers & coconut shrimp.  Then the Pumpkin Red Curry & Thai Fried Rice with beef.  Could not finish all so a bonus lunch for one tomorrow.  We shared a dessert, fried banana with coconut ice cream. Everything came out promptly and the waiter was very attentive. We have travelled to Thailand many times & love Thai food & this rates as one of the best!   Will definitely be back and highly recommend.

Everyone, stop everything, I just had the best chicken chow mein in San Francisco (make sure to ask for American broccoli instead of Chinese unless that's your thing).  I need this delivered intravenously.
Free thai ice tea with check in :) Waitress is very friendly!! Not the best thai food but also not the worst. Quiet and clean environment.
Came here on a Wednesday night after my boxing class to grab some take out.

I have high standards for thai food, and this place lives up to them. The first time I ate there I forgot my leftovers in my friend's fridge and I was so upset that I drove back to SF from Oakland just to pick them up. It's that good.

I am a fan of its lunch menu, and in particular its pad seew.  The restaurant is nice, service depends on the wait person, some good some just OK.   I live close to the restaurant, so it is convenient.

A little over priced but the food is awesome ! I've been here countless times and no complaints so far. My favorite dish is Yellow Sea. Idk wha they put in it to make it so darn delicious but whatever it is keep it up !
Really like this place!

I have been to this restaurant couple of times. It is my favorite restaurant. Some of the dishes need to be improved. Sticky rice were not well cook. Fried tofu not hot and soft enough, feel like eating plastic. Fried coconut shims have not coconut taste at all.
Don't bother with delivery. It takes more than double the estimate time, and arrives cold and soggy.
Absolutely loved the food and the vibe! Our server Bridget was amazing and so sweet/knowledgable! Will be back!

Jasper's is a cool gastropub in a not so desirable neighborhood. Great cocktails, food in an environment that transitions seamlessly from day to night. Casual or intimate, you can't go wrong here. Watch sports when available! It wasn't my first choice to go to, but I was pleasantly surprised to find this cool spot in the TL.
When we were in San Fran we visited this place twice.  It has a great microbrew selection and the crispy piggy bites are amazing!!!  For dessert the fried bread pudding was pretty good too!
Great food, a little pricey, beers good, service is good! Went here for our anniversary and it's right below our hotel.
Party of five for Sunday brunch this morning - all Bay Area locals.
I heard this place had great food. The food was mediocre. It was bland, taste and boring. Might as well just gone down the street to get excellent slice of pizza for a better price.

They had the best breakfast I can remember. The Chelaquila was a unique omelette of pulled pork, blackbeans, cheese, tacos and a spicy sauce. Very nice. The Jasper omelette was also very good. We started with a yogurt parfait that had very fresh fruit.
Good drinks, interesting greens. The wait on a Saturday w/o a reservation wasn't bad--maybe fifteen minutes. The service was friendly if a little slow.
Great if your in a hurry, very friendly staff. Food is ok, not great.
I've been to Jasper's almost a dozen times in the past two years. Their beer list used to be very good and the food was great.

My co-workers and I just finished volunteering at Glide and wanted to get a drink afterwards. Heading up on Taylor, we found this place (I've passed by before, it's right in the middle of TL at the corner of Taylor and O'Farrell).

Nice decent place to have a drink/appetizer in the theater district.  We went in to have a drink before our show the other night.  Place is busy and it can be hard to get a seat at the bar.  We sat first at the window and then moved to the bar when some seats opened up.  Servers were not pleased with us for moving and did not even try to hide their displeasure.  It took a while to be served as well.  Do not make the mistake we did and order "house wine" when you mean "happy hour wine".  Your bill will reflect your mistake.  Over all a nice place.  If in the neighborhood, we might return.

So I want to preface this review with the fact that the girl helping me today was SUPER nice and really intended well, but this is just more of a complaint about the overall service. I came in today with a colleague, took me a while to order, then I ordered a soup and salad. 30 minutes later it was still not there and there were only 1-2 other tables filled at the restaurant. I expressed my concern for the timing because I had a 1 PM meeting and at 12:58 they brought out the soup only. I tried to pay so I could leave and mentioned just leaving the salad there so I can come back. It took another 5 minutes to try to pay and I was late for my meeting. When I came back an hour later, the salad had cheese and I made it super clear that I was allergic and could not have cheese. I called back after I got to my office and the lady said that she is positive she put the order in with no cheese and offered for me to come back and pick it up. Again, she did all the right things but spending all this time waiting and not getting the right order with pointed fingers really isn't the best solution. I used to take all my clients and friends there because it's so close to my office but I think this is my last time going.

Jasper's is attached to the Serrano hotel. Being that it was there I decided to try it and was not disappointed. If you can get past the indifferent hostess the waitress and other staff are quite friendly. Let's start by saying the drinks are strong but well made. For me, it was the food that was the star. The jasper fries are a great start off with a mix of sweet potato and regular fries topped with a great aioli and spicy peppers. The roasted chicken breast was spectacular. A melange of flavors working together to dance upon the palate. The pan drippings mingled well with the sautéed mushrooms and the perfectly cooked chicken breast with crunchy skin. The fresh arugula added just the right peppery notes to the whole dish. Only sampling a few items I can say Jasper's should be a place you at least try out with some good friends.
I mean if you're ready to throw the diet out the window this is the place to go.  I had the chocolate peanut butter brownie & grilled cheese - they were absolutely scrumptious.

We dropped in for breakfast and stood waiting for a table for 10 minutes. No one greeted or acknowledged us, and finally when we got someone's attention they waved us to an open table. They weren't busy at all, yet it took another 15 minutes for someone to come by and get our order. I felt like we were in the Twilight Zone.

Visiting San Francisco and was looking for a cool place to get a burger and some beers... This place advertised "the happiest happy hour ever.". Sold!! When we walked in, a plaid flannel wearing gentleman with a headband looked us up and down and said, judgingly, "do you have a reservation?" So we told him we just wanted to sit at the bar for happy hour, and he rolled his eyes and told us there were two seats available in the corner. Lol...we sat there, ordered the beer and burger happy hour special... The burger and fries were great, the service and general overall attitude from the staff was annoying.  Wouldn't necessarily make an extra trip to come back... Have had great burgers at much happier happy hours

Came on a Monday night. Good crowd but only one waiter so it took a looong time to get service. We are leaving tomorrow so won't be back at Jaspers. Hopefully though management will read this and better staff the restaurant. This place has so much potential.

I was from out of town for business and found Jasper's while looking for a decent bar during a World Series game. I don't know about you, but I've been to a lot of gastropubs and find myself satisfied with the "gastro" part of it if there's decent high fat food to go along with a beer that I like (their J-burger and IPA's fit the bill). They are all usually pricey but what distinguishes them for me are the attitudes of the service staff. My bartender (dark-haired young woman) made me feel welcome and I enjoyed my evening.

#Ive been to Jaspers 4× times. The place can be hella busy at times.Especially on Game days & Weekends. If you're in a hurry to eat...Chill..the food is off the hook! Worth the wait..drinks are good. Bartenders Steve , Morgan  & Urosh are Awesome. I've been served by each. Next time ill try Happy Hour.

I originally found this place when I stayed at the Serrano Hotel while looking for apartments in the city when I first moved here from Las Vegas. The first time I came the service was great and the fish I had for dinner and chilequiles I had for breakfast were awesome! The second time I came here was a few weeks ago with my 21 year old daughter. We walked in and waited a few minutes before seating ourselves then maybe 10 plus minutes later the hostess walked up and offered us drinks and a menu. 20 minutes went by no drinks and no acknowledgment we were there! Was about to leave and then Jessie saved the day! He came by asked if we had placed our order and we said yes with her pointing at "hostess" I assume? He said what was your order? He got us drinks right away and apologized as she forgot all about our order! We then had the pretzels and Jasper fries which were both great! This neighborhood can be tricky when booking hotels I have found a few sketchy ones over the years but the Serrano next door and Jaspers is my top recommendation if you are staying in this part of downtown on a smaller budget. Enjoy...
Jasper's was right across the street from our hotel. It says it's in the Tenderloin, but it's not that seedy.
the fish smelled horrible, so several people in our group changed their order.
Jasper's has a warm and intimate atmosphere with it's leather seating and dim lighting. This is definitely a nice place to go on a casual date or hang out with friends.

Excellent bar selection......good was great...based on previous reviews I had the fish and chips....go with three fillets instead of two if you are hungry...the fish and batter were perfect.....we tried the riblets first for an appetizer they were great, perfect portion.  Ashley was our server and did a great job.  Very friendly and helped point out local things to see.  It was very noisy which is to be expected in a bar during game 4 of the NLCS.  Overall if you want a drink and quick snack I highly recommend it

We had a group of 8 women come in on a Saturday afternoon, the wait was no more than 10 minutes.  Once seated we literally waited over 10 minutes to be greeted and it took 20 minutes total to even get a drink order in. No exaggerations here. I witnessed a two top leave because by the time the slow server made it to their table, they learned that the kitchen had just closed. There was nothing exciting about the food, nothing memorable about the drinks. The only unfortunate memory that my friends and I have is how weak their service was. Oh and that they were out of muffins for Eggs Benedict, out of sweet potato fries (if I remember correctly) and the sever did not know if they had Ranch. (They do not, they have an Aioli) I believe I had their burger and bottomless mimosas. Over half of us have worked in the industry and there's no excuse for the lack service detail, even a manager could have at least greeted us, explained the wait. Never again.

Must try the grilled cheese n pork, eggs, Brussel sprouts n the organic salad.  Will be back soon since everything on the tables around us also looked great n you can hear the raves from the other tables.
The atmosphere is great with plenty of seating. The food was quite good - I had the Bekky grilled cheese, which was cheese, eggs and pork belly. Grant had Benedict, also good.

Jesse was a great server and super attentive! I thought the food was all right. The Jasper fries were good.  I ordered the tomato soup and the brussels sprouts. I think the soup was a bit salty and the brussels could've been more tender. The dessert was awesome though! We ordered the bread pudding. They also have lots of TVs to watch the game :)

I only went here because of the free Yelp appetizer offer, i was only able to choose from two appetizers. It took forever for our waitress to come and the food wasn't even that Good. Good selection of beers at the bar but my girlfriends well drink barely had any alcohol.
Worst service EVER. Hostess is MIA, you have to flag down your waiter and good luck getting water. Had to ask bartender for the check.
They were out of 1/2 of what we ordered. Forgot two meals. And were really slow. Food was iffy
I like the variety of menu items, beers, and drinks.

Really, really wanted their food, but unfortunately, the kitchen was closed by 11pm. Sigh. Other than that though (and some pretty pricey drinks), the drinks are great. Selection of beers and whiskey is pretty extensive, and they do great cocktails. They'll even spike the non-alcoholic drinks for you. Nice. I'll be back for the food. Oh, just be careful of the new server/bartender. He's a little slow. Nice, but still learning.

So bad, at least for brunch. The venue is cool and it's a good location. But the (brunch) food is mediocre at best and the service is beyond awful. Went there for a pre-theater Sunday brunch (with a reservation) and though there were many empty tables it was hard to even get a menu. The brunch menu was very limited and on a par with "Leggo my Eggo." We complained to the manager who was very professional and apologetic -- and then took another 10 minutes just to get our check.
Typical downtown SF bar. Overpriced, lots of nifty brews and sides.
Pretty good for the usual Union Square tourist trap establishments.  I had the short rib mac & cheese for lunch there and it was really good :)

I don't know who Jasper is but if I ever met him I would thank him for this place. I don't know if you can rate an entire experience based on one dish but I am going to do it because it was that damn good.

This place was great to have attached to the hotel when I was there. They had pretty good food, some very nice staff and decent prices. They had quite a selection of drinks and were more than happy to offer a sample or taste of something before you made up your mind. I ate here 3 or 4 times and each time it was a nice experience. On my last night (a Thursday) the place was packed and they had the game on TV. It wasn't too loud but was a fun nice place. About the only downside is the Tenderloin. There was a dude outside the place asking for change and one across the street yelling at cars. Could have served as entertainment though if you were not into sports.
I've come here a couple more times, from a work dinner to a regular Happy Hour and I am still impressed with Japser's.
You will not find better, friendlier service in SF that this little cafe.  Prices are really good and excellent coffee.
Un Caecito looks spacious for a coffee/sammie spot in the 'loin. lots of tables. very bright and clean. 2 welcoming ladies are at the left counter. simple menu of expresso, sammies, juices, etc.

They serve pre cut Pupusas, where in the World. I went back and asked the lady why the pupusa had aside cut; her response was that the pupusa broke when she was heating up- (you knew about the discrepancy and did not bother to give me another one) - Horrible service but I can only Imagen the places where you eat. I really don't understand why this lady got upset from my constructive critic; the pupusa looked as if someone else has previously eaten it. First lady when someone asks to speak with you aside; you should not feel so comfortable just because we speak the same language and asked me to make the complain in front of people.  HORRIBLE SERVICES CHECK YOUR FOOD BEFORE LEAVING THIS HOLE. Ah another one; a month ago they charge me twice for a coffee -paid attention to the customer and less talk.- Friendly does not mean great services; it just a complement to the service in order for you to succeed.
A wonderful oasis in the Tenderloin.  Two delightful and welcoming women serve up delicious food and juice drinks.
Really good sandwiches and a very welcoming environment. The lady that works there is friendly. Try the chicken pesto sandwich and the strawberry smoothie.
Try the chicken basil sandwich on a croissant.  Yum. Top it off with the great Mexican Cake cookie and you will walk out smiling.  Great little oasis in the Tenderloin.

What this lovely little place is:  an oasis in the middle of one of S.F.'s most blighted, yet-to-be gentrified neighborhoods where a very large proportion of the city's homeless, mentally troubled and substance addicted live.  It is a clean, welcoming, space where two sweet young women lovingly prepare simple, delicious fresh food with great care, and graciously welcome people of all descriptions.

On a Saturday morning I was working in the tender loin   I was kind of hungry so I walked on Jones St.  And saw this place call Un cafecito and I said to myself "DALE" Spanish word for go ahead. So I went in and ordered a breakfast burrito... Wow! Honestly the best breakfast burrito I ever taste,  since that day I go to Un Cafecito every day I even quitted going to star bucks. This girls  are the best.  Excellent  food.  Treat yourself to Un Cafecito  and you'll see.....

If possible I'd give this place 1.5 stars. This review is for pastries, bagels, and espresso, they were the standard/warehouse/wholesale brought in types. And when I went the place wreaked of cigarettes from people smoking on the patio and sidewalk. I dedicate my Saturday mornings to finding "hidden gems" guess today is not my day.
Amazing service and good food.
This is a place to oh for a nice cup of coffee and quick delicious breakfast  and the owners are really attentive and professiona

A gem of a coffee shop. I work in the TL and there are not many mom and pop coffee shops. This is the best one around. The owner is such a sweetheart. Terrific fresh food- I love the breakfast burrito and tamales in particular. And it's the best deal for food I've found. Feel good supporting a good business here.
This place is an absolute GEM!!

Very sweet people! The first time I went, my friend and I didn't have cash but they gave us two free cups of coffee just for stopping by. If you're ever in need of a good red eye, stop in and give these friendly ladies a visit.

I usually stick to the Lower Nob, but this hidden gem is totally worth a walk down into the 'Loin.  There is a ton of great seating- cozy seats and giant tables. The lighting is fantastic- thanks to two huge skylights.  The house coffee is GOOD and only $2 for a large.  The service is fantastic- fast and full of smiles.  They have a sweet front patio with plants- love a little greenery.  Oh- and they have $3 tamales on the menu (next time).  I am so excited I found un cafecito!
They are the sweetest people creating a very homey/locals vibe. This past summer they provided space for a kids' talent show.

Talk about a diamond in the rough. This oasis is in the heart of the 'Loin. Friendly staff, Nice patio and great breakfast options. I had the Mexican mocha which was simply divine. Only knock is they are currently not open Sundays. If I promise to come twice a week will you reconsider, Un Cafecito?

I loved coming across Un Cafecito. The cafe con leche was very good. I met Alejandra & Karina, the two owners and felt their enthusiasm for being a successful neighborhood business even though they never said it explicitly. I've been telling people about it and hope to return soon.
Great place, friendly staff, superb coffee! Good stop when exploring the Tenderloin.

This place recently opened up and I am loving it. The staff is very warm and the atmosphere is friendly! Every drink I have had here has been great, every sip is like drinking sunshine! ;)  They have strong, flavorful coffee and I will definitely back on a regular basis!

Awesome little cafe. Friendly staff. Been there a few times now and I haven't had a bad drink. Its a bright spot in a rougher neighborhood. I encourage you to check it out and support the local business! It's a great way to help promote positive long-term change in the Tenderloin neighborhood.
This place is knew the two girls that work there are friendly

The main reason to go here is the service.  Chelsea has to be one of the very best waiters working today, and will make you feel absolutely pampered.  He also makes sure that all the waitstaff are working in concert to clear the table, keep the water full, etc.  Make a reservation and ask for his section.

Was staying across the street and ventured into this place after reading reviews on Yelp.  It was a slow night so I got lots of attention.  The host offered a spot at the bar which was perfect because they have a few tables in addition to the bar seats.  The wine list was brief, but I managed a glass of Cabernet.  I enjoyed the artichoke salad. The artichoke was lightly fried and sprinkled over greens with light dressing.  The cioppino was also very nice with endless bread to soak the sauce.  Other than that, I found the menu limiting and not particularly impressive.  In all, I'd go back, perhaps to try the chicken.
Limited menu and sketchy neighborhood. Good deal through open table and good food

Located in a near-sketchy area on the border of the Tenderloin, with minimal signage to clue in customers as to its presence, Fish & Farm is a diamond in the rough.  We went on a Sunday night and had no problem getting seated. Our waiter was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu and wines.  The star was, of course, the food.
This place is SO.  EFFING.  GOOD.
The salmon was cooked perfectly and they exchange the potatoes with a salad. Good service and good food
Excellent service and atmosphere . Chef soto is a genius, the clam chowder was the best I ever had and the pork chop was so tender and juicy, I can't wait to come back!

Made reservation for 5:30. Food didn't come out till 30 minutes later. Timing was the only problem here, as the food was delicious. My fried chicken was hot, crispy and delicious. Hubby's fish was also very tasty. Other than the wait for food, no issues.
The fish & Farm was the great place to buy the fish.Recently I was liked the NOPA But,Now i like the Fish& Farm.

Weekend in SF for wife's birthday.  Searched for quiet place near Union Square.  Saw mixed reviews but gave it a chance.  Wow, far exceeded our expectations!  Restaurant much more appealing than pictures give credit.  Fantastic, friendly and knowledgeable server.  Their go to entree is the pork chop and it delivered big time.

A small group of friends and I recently dined at Fish & Farm before heading to the theater.  The good:  The mussels with chorizo, wine, garlic and parsley and the fries that accompanied them were delicious.  The bad:  The service was slow and peculiar (the server described the off-menu specials to us twice before we ever got the menu--and we had to ask him for that), the sauvignon blanc was warm, the cod was rubbery and swimming in some sort of overly-sweet sauce, and the chocolate mouse had the consistency of a chewy brownie.  Also strange:  The specialty cocktail menu features about thirteen different takes on an Old Fashioned and one traditional Manhattan.  A little variety there would have been nice.  All around it was an odd experience that left me feeling disappointed.  Without a doubt, you can get a much better bang for your buck in many of the restaurants within a one-block radius.

The burger is the only reason to come here. Forget the rest of the food. If I'd only had the burger, I'd probably give Fish & Farm 4-5 stars, but since I'm grading all the dishes, I'm averaging it out to 3.

This place is tucked away in the Tenderloin district of SF: not one of the best areas to be in. However, the ambience of the place is very comfortable and located in a very quaint upscale hotel. There are 4 downsides I have to the place:
I thought this place was great! A little hidden gem inside the Mark Twain hotel, basically across the street from the Hilton we stayed in.

With everybody raving about the burger here, I rocked up to the bar, which scarily smelled like stale beer -- no matter where you sat -- and ordered up.  The menu used to state that it was a "Niman Ranch Cheeseburger," but strangely, they have reprinted it to simply say, "Cheeseburger."  Burger was served to temp (medium rare), but had a severe char on the outside.  Normally, that's not a bad thing, but this one was very close to being burnt and gave off that pseudo flavor.  YET AGAIN I've been foiled by the poor taste buds of the new crowd who eat out in this city.

As a previous resident of SF, whenever I was visiting town from Korea this place was on my list of must-go especially for their burgers. Every time I come here I swear I will try something different but never make it past the burger.

This is one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco! The salmon is SO GOOD! I am a big fan of fresh food and that is exactly what you get here. I did a private party here and it was a good experience, they communicated with me well prior to the event and the space was nice.

The food was mediocre.  I've had (and made) better.  The bread was forgettable.  The lobster bisque was oddly tomato-y.  I had fried goat cheese disks on what was supposed to be watercress, but in actuality was arugula.  Hubby had salmon, and I had vegetable risotto.  Both were fine.  Both the host and our waitress suffered from zero personality.  Never offered to refill waters or drinks.  I couldn't wait to leave.

I was looking forward to Fish and Farm, but the experience was less than great. The hostess/waitress was rude and seemed to genuinely hate her job. For a San Francisco restaurant, the bread was terrible - did they get it at Safeway? We ordered two appetizers - the crab cakes and the crispy artichoke salad. They didn't give us plates, so we had to use our tiny bread plates. The crab cakes were good, but the arugula and asparagus salad that came with it was not dressed, making it dry and bitter. The crispy asparagus was good, but the dressing seemed to be olive oil and Kraft Parmesan cheese. I could have made it at home. We had the salmon and the burger - burger was alright, as was the salmon, but wasn't memorable. Overall, not worth it.

I was hesitant based on some of the reviews but we were hungry and staying at the Hilton across the street so we took the chance.  We both enjoyed it very much. Small, quaint and the staff was very attentive. The menu is short but the choices were spot on. I had the fish and chips, my wife had the salmon. Both were excellent, as was the wine selection. We were seated at 6PM and it was full by seven. So have a reservation unless you are a late diner. I have already recommended it to a friend who is attending the same conference.

Let me start by saying I liked the food. Like many other reviewers, I was not blown away by it, nor was I disappointed. The cioppino was totally decent; good portions of fish, shrimp, clams, mussels and scallops in an oddly creamy but tasty tomato broth. The portion was fine and the price was nothing unheard of ($29).
Food was good, but a bit pricey for what it is.  Good beer selection.  I wouldn't go out of my way to go to this place.

We ate at Fish & Farm before a Thursday evening concert at the Warfield.  The place was nearly empty, the room small and pleasant, seating immediate, service quite good. But the previous Yelp comments about price vs quality were spot on.  My wife's salmon was quite good, my burger also good...but at these prices, you should get knock-your-socks-off terrific.

I ate here a few years ago and have been planning to go back. I made a reservation 2-3 weeks ago. When we got there, they sat us at the table closest to the door - and it was freezing inside (they had 3 ceiling fans on and there was quick a gust of wind when the door opened). We were the second people to complain and finally they turned off the fans. They would not re-seat us to a warmer table even though the restaurant was basically empty and another party didn't come in to some to some of 4 top tables (we were 4) until we were sitting at the table for an hour. Walking out I saw there was a space heater - but they didn't turn it on - even when we threatened to leave because it was so cold. This was not an oddly cold day in San Francisco - basically like every other cool summer night.

Not bad, but just not that good. The decor is nice, and staff friendly, but the food was a big disappointment. Three of us had fish that was way overcooked, and my ciopino (spelling?) was terrible. Small clams many of which didn't open, and only one pitiful shrimp. There was plenty of fish and some mussels but for $29 it could have been much better.

Stayed at the Hilton, right around the corner. I was alone and wanted somewhere close for dinner as it was about 9pm. Did a quick yelp search to see what was nearby. Restaurant is small, within the Mark Twain hotel. Menu was simple, and there were a few nightly specials. I went for the salmon with lobster sauce and mint on quinoa ($30).  Food was excellent and service was pretty good.
Only 3.5 half stars for this joint? What is going on!?!
Amazing food and service!

The restaurant was a little dark and the menu was rather limited and pricey.  I was disappointed in the fried chicken entree which was served with mashed potatoes that needed seasoning.  A small cup of hot sauce accompanied the dish rather than a tasty light gravy.  On the plus side, the artichoke salad was very nice along with the basket of sour dough bread and butter.  The staff was friendly and just attentive enough.

Well....we have been here twice now. The first time was much better than this past Saturday. When we arrived, there was one server for the whole restaurant. Now, given that the restaurant isn't that big and they weren't full, it was not off putting at first. But when it took 25 minutes to get our drinks (one of which was a beer from a bottle), then we got irritated. That being said, the bartender knows how to make a drink....I will say that. There is no question on whether there was alcohol in my drink! Our starter was the artichoke salad, which was delicious! My husband had the cod, which he said was great. I had the steak, which I ordered medium, but was fairly bloody still. I would have said closer to rare...The marrow sauce was well done. For our dessert, we ordered the seasonal ricotta cheesecake (pineapple), which is served in a mason jar. It was okay.
If you're a tourist, you'll love this place! If not, you won't!
It was early in the week. A Tuesday night. Rain was lightly falling, and parking was tough in the neighborhood.

Don't believe the hype. Came here from So Cal for my man's bday dinner since it's conveniently located around the corner from the SF Hilton Union Square where we stayed and we won't be coming here again. Ordered crab cakes and calamari for appetizers and they were not worth it. The 2 crab cakes were small and were fishy. The calamari was the equivalent of 3 small squid and that too was game-ish. No flavor at all. He'd ordered the steak and it wasn't that stellar as well. Good definitely ruined our F&F experience. If we do come here again, we may order the burger since that's all anyone raves about it. Blah.

Fish and Farm was the perfect setting for a very special night.  It was quiet, intimate and the staff was so friendly.  The owner even came to our table twice to see how we were doing.  I really wanted to love their food and some things I did love but I was really disappointed in their appetizers.  We had the Lobster Bisque, Crab Cakes and Baked Brie.

GHASTLY food, My girlfriend brought me here her treat, sounded great. The experience started out nice, comfortable room, great service then the food came. She ordered the scallops, I ordered the fried chicken. The scallops were great except they forgot to rinse the grit off of them so every bite there was sand crunching in your teeth, then the potatoes that came with the scallops, raw, completely uncooked. My poor girlfriend took a mouth full of them and being the polite sweet woman she is she swallowed it. The look on her face said it all. Now what could have gone wrong with my fried chicken? Undercooked. Most of it was fine but when I got to the thigh near the bone pink red with blood. The sad thing is the ingredients were great and wasted by a chef that gave up it seems. Such a shame our date night turned into a restaurant nightmare. Worse was the night of purging in the restroom at home until the sun came up. I'm afraid we both suffered from a digestive issue that wrecked our weekend. So, will I return to drop $150 on dinner here again? Hell no!
Had a really good meal here.  You may miss it since it is inside the Mark Twain hotel.  Small dining room here with tables on each side.  We had cioppino and a hamburger.  Both were very good!
Had dinner here last Sunday and was pleasantly surprised. I don't usually expect much from Hotel restaurants. I had given up meat for Lent and was looking for something vegetarian.

I've been a fan of The Farm as i affectionate call it, since i first ate there 3 years ago and had the fried chicken. It was, hands down, the best I've had in this city. I continue to eat here as often as i can although my new fav dish is the fish n chips! lightly battered, crispy delicate juicy pieces of white fish on a mound of perfectly cooked potatoes--as good as it gets. Last Saturday i tried the pan seared cod on a bed of lentils , while it was quite simple in presentation, the flavors in the sauce were divine. The only reason i'm giving 4 rather than 5 stars is there is no CAKE on the dessert menu---who doesn't love cake ;)   keep up the good work, and bake some cake!
Food = 4 stars, all very good!
The taste was amazing. The service was fine. The portions to cost were a little out of whack... really 4 scallops for $30? Really?

I went here over a year ago, with one of my close friends after we were at the Spanish embassy to get our Visa's. The burgers we had were great! Yumminess! And even better you get to pick an choose your own condiments, no one messing up what you do or don't want and having to pick anything off.

I'm a dummy and didn't eat dinner prior to a concert at the Regency Ballroom. It was only fitting that my stomach was growling after the show (woo Nick Carter!). Just like how Steve has his handy dandy notebook on Blue's Clues, I have my handy dandy Yelp app on my cell phone to look up food destinations. Praise the Yelp God because Slider's Diner was only a block away from the Regency Ballroom.

Watching a 49er game at a close by bar that doesn't serve food but recommend the best of the best close by and they were not wrong!!!  Sliders Diner slap on fresh meat patties on a revolving broiler and you can customize your burger.  I brought it back to the bar and enjoyed it with an IPA!!! Bravo!!

Last night was the first time me and my Daughter's dined at Slider's Diner on the corner of Sutter and Polk Streets.  We found parking on Van Ness and walked the block around to Sutter.  This particular Slider's Diner was on a very busy block full of bars and  eateries.  The cashier was very friendly, personable and made us feel at home.   The Diner was clean and bright and shiny with chrome accents.  The rotating fire Grill was in front for pedestrians walking by to see the burgers spinning on top of the flames. A big screen TV was on the Giant's vs Padres game.  We ordered Oreo, Vanilla and Strawberry Shakes, Avocado Burger, Mushroom Cheeseburger, Hot dog, Onion Rings and their new Garlic Fries.  Gee Willikers the Burgers and Hot dog were fat and tasty!  The unlimited extensive condiments from fresh crispy lettuce to fresh mushrooms to Cucumbers and a yiriad of other condiments  to plenty to remember except that I took a pic of the condiment bar made for a great and wholesome selection....All I needed was some dressing and I had my salad for the evening! The Garlic fries were absolutely to die for!  I've had garlic fries at the stadium during games but Slider's Garlic fries add what seems and tastes like shredded fresh parmesan cheese!  They use Dreyer's ice cream for their shakes and those were tasty as well.  I gave them 5 Stars for tasty food, an awesome condiment selection, good customer service and old fashioned wholesome San Francisco diner charm!

Just wanted a quick and reasonably prices bite a few blocks from home, and here I found it! Had a great beef hot dog (a much bigger link than expected!) and some delicious chili cheese fries for 10 dollars!. I will definitely be returning
Great grilled burgers! Fresh, nice staff and I like that you can dress your burger as you wish.

Direly GREASY, I was mortified by Sliders & the food they dish out!  - came here for a burger and chips & when I picked up my order & started piling pickles & olives on to my chips just cos I happen to like veg on 'em & the Asian lady behind the Counter stopped me & then shouted at me 'THIS NOT SALAD BARRR!' After nearly shrieking at me she slammed a tray of somethink on the counter making a very loud noise! BEWARE!
Awsome Burgers!!!!

Depending on who's working the front counter can determine the customer service. On good days, service and good is yummy. Usually get the cheese fries (nacho cheese style) and the sliders or chicken wings. Tony is also friendly and awesome!

My family and I went to Slider's before entering Pride 2014.  We went based on proximity and cravings - it was close and housemate wanted burgers.  Our orders were taken quickly and the portions were huge for the pricing.  The self-serve condiments and burger dressings gave us more options for customization after the order.  We sat by the open windows and devoured the burgers.

Sometime between my first review and now, Slider's stepped up its game. Their burgers are amazing now! Huge and juicy, with a toasty buttered bun. Combined with their condiment bar, it's damn near the perfect burger experience. My only complaint is that the bottom bun can't handle the juice. I need to remember to ask them to put the meat on the very bottom next time, and assemble at home.

If you're in Polk gulch and need a quick bite, you'd be hard pressed to find a better spot than Sliders. The food is great and the customer service is just as good. Lilly, and the good man behind the grill, will make sure to take care of you. Stop by today and tell 'em Barber Walter's(dot com) sent ya!
I love Sliders! Burgers are tender and delicious! Staff is super awesome and it's a great neighborhood staple.
Terrible customer service! They sell ice cream milk shakes,  asked for a scoop of ice cream and the gentleman refused by saying they don't sell ice cream. ..okay? That makes sense.

Great burgers! I had an avocado burger with spicy jack cheese, sweet potato fries and drink for $15.23. The burger was made to order- served hot and fresh. I love the "help yourself" condiment bar, everything was fresh, clean and plentiful. Sweet potato fries are a must have! I guess I got lucky, I arrived just ahead of the dinner rush; 2 others here when I arrived, now 20+...I'll most definitely be back
The veggie burgers had no flavor. However, the avocado and the toppings were fresh.

BEST BURGERS IN THE AREA. Service there is great, with lots of good food and a nice atmosphere. The "Build your own burger" is a great idea, and it's nice to see a good classic burger place actually still is around. Yum! Can't wait to return.
Great food for when your in the mood for a  classic American burger!
Love this place. Very nice burgers and a great condiment bar.  Try the steak, its delicious.

We were on our way to the James Vincent McMorrow concert at the Great American Music Hall and needed a quick bite to eat. After strolling the neighborhood a bit, and pressing for time, we came across Slider's Diner. It looked cute and hip, so we decided to give it a shot.
Slider's has the best turkey burgers I have ever had. Plus the two cooks always remember me!

I've been coming to Sliders since I was in second grade. I am now 30 years old. Looks like this place has a change of ownership.  My boyfriend and I went here after the gym for some hot links and protein burgers. There's a sign that saids  "self service " condiment bar. "Build your burger any way you like!" My boyfriend began to grab some onions and mushrooms. The asian lady who claim to be the owner of the place came over to him and said, "stop, you can't take too much of it. This is a condiment bar. If you want more you have to order a salad." I told her it said self service and I can have the burger any way I like. So I don't get what's the big deal. She reply. " then you have to order a salad if you want more, it's condiment only." And the cook stared me down like a dog, and I must add. My hot link. Is burn. I got picture to proof if you don't believe me. It's sad for me to say good bye to Sliders, because it has always been the center of my heart for sad days, happy days, rainy days, and warm days.... :(

This place is tasty and the staff is so friendly I lived down the street from here and Pearl's  for years and would always choose here. The vegi-bar is always fresh and burgers are perfect! Very cheap and you can catch a game on the big screen!
Both me and my husband agrees this is the best burger we have in the last three years~
Delicious burgers and great customer service!

If I could give 0 stars I would. We called on a Saturday and and they said they closed at 11. Their website says they close at 11. Their front door says thy close at 11. But when you try to walk in at 10:40 the doors are locked and multiple employees say, "we're closed." Not cool.
Lots of bang for your buck!

My plain burger was super juicy and had lots of flavor (you know it's a great burger done right when you don't have to pile on loads of condiments for taste). The bun was fresh and perfectly toasted. It was one of the best burgers I've had in San Fran.
I ordered the mushroom burger, it was decent but I was expecting better. Onion rings were excellent.  Overall the foods not bad it's just not great either.

As soon as I walked in, it felt like I was an old friend they hadn't seen in awhile. The cashier was so friendly and cheerful. The cook was great too, personable and playful (he joked about me ordering potato chips, because I'd asked for extra crispy fries). Yes, the food did take a bit of time, but good food should.

I was drawn in by the guy grilling burgers in the window.  My burger was cooked perfectly (MR) and presented on an excellent lightly buttered and grilled bun.  As others have mentioned, the condiments bar is huge.  First time I've seen kidney beans and beets (both which I love) as burger condiments.  I guess I ought to take off a couple of stars because some pond scum sucking bottom feeding lowlife stole my phone, but I don't blame the restaurant.  Don't leave your phone out.  It's still the Tenderloin.
I read some of the reviews about the staff being rude and whatnot, and I must completely disagree. They were all extremely nice, and not to mention delivered a killer burger. Will def come back.

So..if your order comes out right...awesome! My 2 star rating comes down to service an sanitary issues. Otherwise the food is ok. If the lifeless and monotone zombie of a cashier gets your order right, then your welcome to add all the uncovered,  scraped to the bottom, warm condiments you like!  And if your order is wrong - don't worry. The money handling cashier will hand put your cheese on the burger himself with no gloves.  I coulda screamed when I saw him do that, then have the nerve to have an attitude with me...wtf...but anyway The food has always been ok...and like other reviews , I'm surprised I haven't got really sick from that place...it's bound to happen though, no doubt.
The Burgers are so fragrant and delicious!  Love the condiments bar at this location!

Ok, I'm going to chalk it up to someone having a bad week. I tried going again a couple of times to give them another chance. Thought, the burgers and bacon were quite bland and the avocado not ripe (honestly, who likes hard avocado that shoots out of your buns like a torpedo? o_O). I was satisfied that it didn't make me sick or have to run home at 90 miles an hour with my knees locked. Nothing ruins your day faster than having to shuffle home at the speed of light in hopes of not leaving a cookie trail behind you!
I came here with a group of colleagues mainly due to the proximity in location. So it consists of ordering either a full burger, a couple of sliders, or even a hotdog with sides. Seems simple enough.
Very bad experience & customer service

You have to get the onion rings instead of the fries here.  Love their burgers and dogs some of the best I've had in the city so far.  The people who work their are great and the fresh condiment bar is pretty awesome.

Came in on Saturday June 29th, 2013 around 8:45 PM to a short line. I ordered the #1 Combo --- Cheeseburger, Fries and a Drink for $10.06 but asked for a veggie burger instead of the meat patty. Both burgers individually are sold for $6.75.
THE SHAKES ARE AWSOME!
Rude and unprofessional and they lie.
3.5 Stars

I ordered (delivery) a calzone and I got a pizza instead. No big deal. The only thing is the pizza wasn't very good (compared to other pizza places in the same area). Also, the pizza is making me feel sick. The garlic topping did not taste very good.
Love this place their pizza is always fresh They have delicious salads and the best dessert  Highly recommended
They got unique rectangular pizzas and they are tasty. Also Alex is a cool guy, kind and easy to talk with. Mustafio's pizza is awesome!
solid pizza overall.  It is my go to place for delivery in SF.
Don't do it. If it's late and you're craving pizza just go to bed. Horrible delivery service.

You won't come here to find spectacular, off the charts pizza, but just a good old plain pizza, especially if you have a case of the drunchies (drunk munchies). They are very generous with their pizza slices and gave us real large slices (not those dinky triangle slices). Not too much sauce, crust was crispy and there was sufficient cheese and toppings (got a hawaiian pizza) on my slice. For about $3, you satisfy your drunchies and you get a decent slice of pizza.
This is one of the few times I was let down by the reviews from fellow yelpers!
They pulled a slice (square?) of pizza from the window and put it in the little oven. God knows how long that pizza had been sitting there. I can't even.
When I want delivery and I don't want to wait for Patxi's, I order Mustafio's.  Mustafio's pizza is square - not bad at all.  Buffalo wings are juicy too.
Perhaps it was just a bad delivery day, but as I experienced each layer of mixups, I became increasingly unforgiving.
After a night on Polk street this is what you need! Service is amazing and the pizza is yummy!
Loveeeee mustafios!  Perfect late night bite in Russian Hill! Stop by, you won't regret it!

This is my go to spot for pizza. Any day any night, I can always trust mustafios pizza to have THE freshest, cheesiest, pepperoniest pizza ever. Always great customer service. You can't beat great food and great service. I would give it 10 stars if I could.

The pizza here is delicious! I have a simple taste in pizza, so I ordered a pepperoni slice, and wasn't disappointed. The crust had a fluffy texture, with a healthy amount of marinara sauce and fresh cheese. The pepperoni itself was crispy and tasty.
Went in to this place once and wished I never did.

Have used their online ordering for couple of times now. Pizza is always on time and the best I have had in my stay in SF. I'm a fan off adding extra toppings to my pizzas and they have still always got it right. Toppings are plentiful too. No complaints from me.

Was in the area on a late Friday night looking for a place to eat and I stumbled upon Mustafio's Pizza on Polk. Walked into a small busy shop and decided to get a slice of Barbecue Chicken. The staff quickly warmed up my slice and was hot and ready within minutes. Their pizza was very good with a soft and chewy crust. Mustafio's gets the job done when it comes to satisfying my pizza cravings. The service is quick, fast, and friendly. I look forward in coming back to try their other pizza options on their menu.
I haven't had the pizza, but man--that gyro sandwich is bomb! I don't care if it doesn't even come off the twirling stick, there is plenty of meat here and it was cooked to perfection.
I had this review drafted and forgot about it!

Friday around 11pm I ordered a Calzone as I wanted to try something new even though the pizza is great here. Usually the food arrives in 60 mins but I was fortunate and it arrived in 40 mins on a Friday night!!! I was so happy. Plus, the Calzone was really yummy and done well! Also the chocolate cake was a delicious dessert. This is my go to pizza place!

The most important thing that any pizza place must do is to serve you good pizza. Unfortunately, this place doesn't do that, or at least the one time I visited this place, the pizza slices were stale, bland and hardly palatable. Given that this place is close to a bunch of bars and open late night, it might be the go-to place to grab something to eat when you are drunk and hungry. But if you are sober, don't do yourself the injustice of eating here. I really hope (for the sake of this business) that they up their quality of food.
terrible pizza. an hour to bring doughy soggy sloppy flavorless pie to my door 4 blocks away?  avoid.

Mustafio's is close to home (1.3 blocks to be exact) but not as close as a couple other pizza places less than a block from my place.  I had the Mustafio's Special which has a little bit of everything since I couldn't decide.  The online menu has descriptions and prices for each of their pizzas making it hard to choose.  It is definitely worth the extra block to go to Mustafio's, besides the fact that the pizza is always hot and fresh Mustafio's is cleaner than most of the other pizza joints on or near Polk street.  Plus if I'm feeling really lazy Mustafio's delivers!!  lol
I came here on my friend's recommendation after we were craving some late night bites after going clubbing.
The pizza took forever to get here and it wasn't very good at all.
I've ordered pizza from here 3 times through

I ordered for delivery around at 11pm the guy on the phone wasn't very helpful infact when i called he asked for my number and address then disappeared on the phone after talking to someone while i was mid sentence. After saying hello to silence for a bit he came back on the phone, No "please hold".No "Sorry about that". Regardless, I ordered The veggie special and gave him my card number, He said "ok bye" I had to call back to see how long it would take, Which he then said 45 minutes, He didn't even tell me the total over the phone. So about an 1 hr and 15 minutes later the pizza arrived with literally 1 mushroom on it. Mushrooms where the first on the list of veggies. I almost called to complain but at this point we were past starving. We couldn't even finish the pizza, Even though our tummies weren't satisfied. The only thing I can say was the delivery guy was really nice although he didn't apologize for being late.
The pizza that I just ate here is some of the best pizza I've had in sf. I love chicken pesto.

Ordered this AWESOME pizza from this wonderful lady name Shana? She gave us her suggestions and was very helpful. Hopefully we get our pizzas soon because the party is hungry! great customer service, love this place already!

Great place for some pizza or other food.  Customer service is great and they really do a lot to contribute to the Polk street vibe here.  I absolutely recommend this joint for lunch or dinner and really appreciate that they are almost always open, even late night!

Not great. They told us it would be 30-45 minute delivery. It took an hour and 10 minutes. And they got our order wrong. The crust is thick (I prefer thin). This was our first try with this place - won't be trying again.
Ordered delivery and it took an hour so that was unfortunate but the food was still great
Got delivery from here. Chicken pesto pizza was awesome. They definitely don't skimp in the toppings!! Wings were so-so. Definitely recommend this place!

Great spot to grab a slice before or after going out on Polk Street... I would know 'cause my friends and I came here twice in the same night. Loved the pizza,  it's actually good and not just' drunchies' food.  They toast the pizza before giving it to you so the crust is crispy. Highly recommend the chicken and pesto pizza. The price can seem steep for just a slice but it's a pretty large slice.
Yep. Delicious. Get the sausage. Why is square pizza so much more deliciouser?
If you're in the mood for pizza. Look no further. Mustafio's is the place to eat! Excellent pizza and good service! Check them out!

The service was excellent. The pizza was fresh and unique to the other quick pizza places I've been to in the area. I tried the combo and it was great. It had sweet yellow pepper that was a nice touch to the overall taste and flavor.

I just moved to the neighborhood and needed pizza delivery after a long day of unpacking. I chose Mustafio's because of their good reviews. I was not disappointed. Great pizza. The sauce is very well balanced and the ingredients were fresh. Delivery was fast.
This place was great!

What you see is what you get but that said, when you're in the mood for this kind of food you can't beat the price, service or satisfaction. Awesome hashbrowns. Perfect pancakes. I've even tried the burger and it was very decent. But the diner type food mixed with the wonderful service oriented staff makes this one of my favorite go to breakfast spots in SF.

Ate here yesterday for the first time and oh wow it's amazing! Looks like a major No Go zone but dont judge a book by it's cover! Service excellent, food is delicious and the price is so so cheap it's scary!
Keep up the good work guys! The food is tasty, the joint is cozy  and you will not find a cheaper breakfast in the city. Golden coffee is the gem of the tendernob
When I travel my yelp app rarely leads me astray; this was one of the times it did.
awesome little hole in the wall. Delicious food and nice people
Happy to find & tried this affordable hole-in-the-wall diner! Love the price and food was actually not bad. This place offers good old/simple comfort food. I enjoyed my breakfast.
Going into Golden Coffee Shop, it won't take long to realize what type of breakfast you are going to get. It is going to be buttery, unhealthy, and solve your hunger problem.
We love this place!! The food is delicious and the people

This Midwestern girl is in love with a greasy spoon breakfast bar with a side-by-side Chinese lunch menu. That's probably par for the course here on the west coast, but it's new to me and I almost want to stay for lunch if I didn't have a million other places to try within walking distance.

I understand the temptation to like this place  as evidenced by the many 4-star yelpers before me. This is the epitome of a hole in the wall diner; slinging cheap greasy diner fare. The problem is that the cost can't make up for slow, dispassionate service, below average food, and marginal coffee.
no frills all thrills

Why five stars? Cheap food, but it's good and you get what you paid for. The semi-unfriendly waitress and cramped quarters somehow make the eating experience more charming and authentic. I'd go again if I were hungover or in a hurry.

Cheap and yummy breakfast around union square area! When we were there, the shop was full of people, but the service was still very fast. We will definitely go back for breakfast when we visit San Francisco next time.
Om nom nom. This is my and my roommates go to spot for hungover breakfast. A great, fast, tasty diner. I really like their omelets and French toast.

Don't let the rusty spoon look scare you. This is the most delicious inexpensive brunch place ever created. I used to live right around the corner and would come here every weekend for almost 2 years. Even though I've moved from Oakland to Berkeley to Pacifica, I've still made a point to stop here whenever possible.

I didn't eat here and here's why.  On my trip SF was experiencing a heat wave.  We pop in here based on Yelp reviews to find there is no AC.  We get water with one ice cube each.  The place is dirty, but the bathroom was disgusting.  It was covered in rust and water.  The soap was stuck in rust and there was no dryer or towels. I hope the staff washes their hands somewhere else.  Luckily they only take cash so we were able to bolt.
One of the cheapest, yet tasty breakfasts in SF. Go here early in the morning to beat the noon crowd and you shall enjoy a breakfast with a quaint atmosphere.

I have been so used to being surrounded by these iPad cash resister and hipster waiters. but my husband and I enjoyed this spot because this place is still using paper and wooden ruller and pencil to get orders. one simple open kitchen and U shaped bar front is fun because you can see other customers too. this place's food isn't fancy but it's something you can expect from home.
Awesome hot chocolate, coffee, and hash browns. Bacon and eggs are the bomb! I give this hole on the wall five stars for it's quick service, affordable prices, and yummy breakfast!!
Just checked out of our hotel room and we were hungry, so we came to Golden Coffee Shop. We ordered bacon, eggs, and waffles. Waffles are bomb!

This is my favorite breakfast place in the city.  At a glance it doesn't look like much, which is great for keeping tourist and tech kids out.  There chef is incredible to watch.  And have never had a bad item on the menu.  Also the price makes it easy to leave a big tip! ( after watching the chef u will see why it's well deserved )

One of those old school diners that just gets to the point. Ya sit down, shut up and order a meal that seems too good to be true. An omelette with toast and hash browns for 5.50. And a happy Sunday to you too.
This is one of those places that will make your trip to San Francisco great!

I would say this breakfast joint was actually not that bad. They served us quickly and made us delicious american breakfast. You can tell its a family owned joint in the TL. I had the egg scramble and it was not bad. I definitely had to add some pepper and hot sauce.
good diner place.. nothing more

I eat here every weekend. Prices are awesome. It's not out of this world, but the food is pretty good. Biggest complaint is that it's always busy. Can be hard to get a seat if you're with a few friends.
Such a cool mom and pop shop. For breakfast, the prices can't be beat. The pancakes weren't amazing but it's your standard eggs, bacon, hash browns, etc. Just as good or better than Dennys.

This place is my favorite breakfast place in the city, hands down. Simple food, done right, done quickly, to perfection. May not look like much on the outside, but it's worth it. On the occasional early Saturday that I have to work, I love having my breakfast here amongst all the old men who are early risers. Note: on peak hours, this place may be tough to get into.
Fast fresh cheap. What else do you want? Waffles. Pancakes. Eggs. Bacon. Sausage. All menu items are around $6-8
I stopped by here for the first time to grab a bite to eat as I was so craving a Cheeseburger.  I've tried out Han's across the street but wanted to give this spot a try.
Cash only. Very very limited seating. Do not be in a hurry if you come here.
We visit every time we are in SF. An awesome breakfast for two under $20. The comradarie at the counter is all part of the experience. Just love this place. It is a MUST.
Star-worthy because price and food go down easily.
Okay, very affordable breakfast--major plus.  This place is ZERO frills, extremely basic breakfast menu.

My husband and I stopped here on our way to work for a quick breakfast. I got pancakes with over easy eggs and bacon. He got a berry waffle with the same eggs and bacon. Everything was cooked well and delicious - not to mention Cheap! Great breakfast for such a great price. We'll be back for sure. Just remember - cash only!
Lots of memories from my breakfasts here with friends in the city before I moved to San Francisco. There's a reason we kept going back, and I still make my way over from time to time.

I love this mom & pop shop, nothing fancy or fussy. The food is good for the price. I usually get the french toast or waffle, depending on my mood. My boyfriend always gets the corned beef hash. The seating is stools wrapped around the counter so you get cozy with fellow dinners. I just like this place because it feels old school. My only complaint is that they have an exhaust fan moving outside air, and when it is turned on, it has a low hum that makes me feel dizzy. That's probably just my issue, but it can be disorienting.
Cash Only

This is by all means a hole in the wall and not a very good one.  The interior is cold and unwelcoming.  The waffle I ordered was super hard and dry.  They charged me $1.75 for a scoop of blueberries and the orange juice is straight out of a generic box.  Yeah it's cheap but I rather pay more and get food made with quality ingredients.  Cash only!
Omg. this place will completely surprise you given its unassuming location and the fact that it's located where turtle tower used to be.

I am a regular at Golden Lotus because they have the best pho ever and I always seem to be craving pho. I always get the number 22 and spring rolls. I like their pho way better than any other place I've had. The beef just tastes better to me and I love the wider noodles. The service is excellent- everyone who works there is so friendly. If you are a pho person you will love Golden Lotus.
Great service, non greasy delicious pho and stew.  Their garlic noodles are the best!!!

Had the vegetarian tofu bun.  The tofu was really good. Plenty of veggies and a big bowl of noodles.  Food came out quickly and efficiently.  Service was good.  I heard their pho is tasty too.  A place to go for some yummy Vietnamese food.

Go here instead of Turtle Tower. My friends and I went to Turtle tower but after seeing how long the line was we decided to go to Golden Lotus. There's no wait and their chicken pho is delicious. I am usually not a pho person...but I tried their chicken pho and it was really good.

Had some pho in the morning after a night out. It wasn't the best pho, but my standards were pretty low at that moment, so whatevs. Def probably better elsewhere. They also used a wider noodle, as opposed to thin one that I'm used to always getting in my pho tai. I don't know if you can request it, but FYI default noodles are not the normals!

A great Vietnamese restaurant that opens for dinner and accepts credit card. The broth for their phos is very delicious. We ordered the chicken pho and beef pho. I think their clients are geared toward Americans and Vietnamese, as there is no Chinese on their menus. It cost $1 more for a large bowl of pho. Ranges from $7 to $8 something per bowl.
Better than expected.  Pho noodle is not what you expect - it's more like a slimmer 'fun' rice noodle, which was a pleasant surprise for hubby.

After a crazy weekend all we wanted to do was put on pjs and watch football on the couch with some pho. After searching yelp we stumbled upon this place and decided to try it out & get take out... And I'm so mad right now.
The area is kinda of dodgy...BUT this place is a gem :D.
i love this place. it's pretty authentic and has dishes that are hard to find elsewhere.
The food is legit.  Try the spring rolls, imperial rolls, all of their phos are delicious.  Also try the garlic Bok Choy!
I mean love this place. Since moved to SF I've been coming back here at least twice a week ! This place is the only reason I come over such a messy area in tenderloin.
I was very saddened that I never had that opportunity to eat at the old Turtle Tower location.

Pretty reasonably priced Vietnamese noodle dishes. Not sure why but I feel lighter and cleaner after eating here than I do at other pho places in the neighborhood. I usually order bun thit nuong cha gio anywhere I go and Golden Lotus does a good job. Their imperial rolls are crispy and crunchy. I also like how the vegetables are sliced small enough to fit easily into a bite.

this place is hella close to my house. I get food from here all the time. super good, super cheap, super fast. all the dudes who work there know me now. I always get the vegetarian vermicelli with extra mushrooms and tofu or the vegetarian spring rolls. hella good.

Upon walking in, we were greeted by a really welcoming staff! They were very kind about us just wanting a take out order and immediately took it and put it through. It wasn't super busy for the time we were there, but the order came out in less than 10 minutes which is impressive regardless. The food absolutely hit the spot!
I used to work in the Civic Center area and Golden Lotus was always in the running for lunch. It's also a post-happy hour go-to spot - clean, bright, tasty, and consistent.

Omg turtle tower so over rated and screw the wait because right next door is Golden Lotus! Way better service and tastier too! My fave is the chicken giblets with thick/fat noodle and they put the yolk or egg in it too! Love it!!! Rather eat here then turtle tower anyday.
Meh pho!  I had the five spice chicken, bad slimey skin.  Five spice chicken should have crispy not slimey skin.
My daughter and I always went there. The food was so good. They had all of different kinds Vietnamese food. Very good!
On my way to a meeting on this laid back Sunday afternoon I  stopped in Golden Lotus for some great food! My friends and I have been here several times over the last month and the food is excellent.

One of the best beef I have ever eaten. The beef pho is a must try at Golden Lotus.  I live in San Jose and tried many Pho places but the quality of beef can never be compare with Golden Lotus quality.  The beef they used is so good that it's like butter that melts in your mouth.  The price was average like other pho place even though their quality of meats are way finer than other pho places.  The service i thought was better than other pho place.  Friendly smile and check up on water was on point.  Will definitely come back again.
It's more like 3.5 stars.  Cheap pho place with pretty big portions.

Golden Lotus is a no-frills hole in the wall Vietnamese noodle shop that is packed to the gills with MSG-laden flavor.  Seriously, the sodium content in their broth left our hero's tongue feeling pickled until the next morning.  The service is fast and speaks English well, and their clientele is fairly diverse.  A lot of single diners seem to come here for a basic cheap meal and they really do deliver on value here.  One odd part about their pho is that they use flat rice noodles in the pho instead of traditional noodles.
Great chicken and garlic noodles.
It's the shop that would be Turtle Tower...or so it seems would be their aspiration (photo:
Good food, Friendly service, I am adding it to my personal list of quiet, well lighted eateries.  The atmosphere is quite good considering the neighborhood.

my first time here and i tried the rare steak and beef ball pho. it was really good! broth and meats had a nice hearty flavor to them. the rare steak was probably the softest (texture wise) i've ever had in pho before! will definitely be back if i am ever in the area.
Still a fan - but now they have a $10 minimum for card :'(
People were friendly.Food lacked flavor. Portion size was small - except for rice. Not going back
Very nice place ate the special pho.  Clean fresh meat.  Broth great with a hint of cinnamon. Flat rice noodles.  They way I like it.

perfect addition on Vietnamese food row -  golden lotus has more variety: pho, rice plates, other kinds of noodle soups like bun bo hue and bun rieu, dessert drinks, etc.  I especially like the vegetarian offerings - the veggie spring rolls has sautéed mushrooms and tofu in it, instead of spring rolls without shrimp and pork.   thanks!

Great improvement over the previous joint in this location. The service is 5 stars, attentive and polite (kinda funny to have to point this out). At the table some VN staples Banh Uot, Com Tam, Beef Bun (noodles). All were good,  observations: beef was scarce in the beef & noodle but was tasty, the pork in the (don't know the VN name of this) but it is the shredded pork skin & meat - was heavy on the skin, light on the pork.  Must be a meat shortage @ Golden Lotus, which would make the perfect name for a vegetarian restaurant, which they might become if they reduce meat content of some of the dishes any further.
The old turtle tower location has been replaced by a new Vietnamese restaurant. Our curiosity got the best of us.
Decent pho, gives a good amount of meat. They use the chicken pho noodles in their beef pho (I prefer the other noodles in my beef bowl).

My new favorite Pho ga place thanks to my co-worker's recommendation. Love the rice rolls with grilled lemongrass pork and generous side order of stir fry baby bok choy. The hubby recommends the special beef combo pho.
So happy I decided to come here!
N.style Vietnamese style beef pho - that's something you can't find anywhere in SF. If you're ok with MSG, there is tons of it in the broth, but it's good and heartwarming nonetheless.
Great lunch at Ar Roi. Excellent service to boot. Delicious authentic Thai food, reasonably priced. Will return!

Wonderful atmosphere and environment.  The food is delicious. The yellow curry this flavorful and delicious.  The Thai iced tea was great. Clean place . Staff are personable and friendly. Great service. Enjoyed my lunch.

My favorite Thai restaurant in nob hill. Great presentation, service and quality of Thai food. This is a great spot for a nice dinner or lunch, definitely my pic out of all Thai restaurants. Price is good for the quality of food and service.

I've been to Thailand, and although I have yet to find any San Francisco restaurant that even comes close to the flavors I experienced there, this place is a little closer than the others, which all taste the same to me.  Bonus for great service.
3.5 stars. Thai iced tea ($3.5) and Tom Yum Chicken Soup - individual size ($6) were on the sweet side.

There are many wonderful Thai restaurants in San Francisco and this is certainly one of them and one of the best in the Union Square / Theater area.   It's décor is quite upscale but prices manageable.

Excellent food, great friendly service. All in all, LOVED IT!!! We entered at 10 and were pleasantly surprised the waitresses patiently waited for us past 11 for us to finish eating. I highly recommend this for a nice late dinner.
The food was excellent. The service and presentation was superb. Price was median. I highly recommend this place should you visit San Fran.
BUG IN MY FOOD!!!!!

Came here for dinner on a Friday night. Made a reservation for 7pm but the restaurant was rather empty then. Service was rather unpleasant. Waitress was rude and impatient and kept making us order more/ finish our food/ get the check.
Ordered:
We had Spring roll, Tom Ka, Yellow Curry, and Pad Rar Thai.

Mediocre Thai food, sorry. The Pad Ar Roi had no discernable flavor. Same for the Pad Thai.. just sweet but no other flavor. We live close and was excited to try it.. disappointed. Oh well. Lost of better Thai places in SF. Meh.
Our meal was the absolute best dinner we had in SF.  The Winter pumpkin curry with Prawn and Chicken was spectacular!  You must experience this dish.  An incredible

We stumbled upon this place when the original sushi joint we tried to go to didn't have an open table for over an hour. I'm glad for the random drop in because it turned into one of the best meals I had during my SF visit. Food was served fast, unbelievably fast. We were four and each ordered a different pad dish. I swear the food came out in 10 minutes, piping hot and in a generous quantity. I gobbled up the Pad Khee Mao: wide rice noodles, chicken, onions and tomatoes in a SPICY chili sauce. For those sensitive to spice, be careful with this dish. It's definitely not overbearing but on the menu it did not indicate that this is leaning on the truly spicy side. I also sipped on a glass of the house red. For $7 I got a very healthy pour so naturally I was elated. What a great find!

BEST THAI FOOD IN SAN FRANCISCO!!! The thing that separates this Thai from the others is their family recipe for Pad Thai that they call Pad Ar Roi! So delicious!! Oh and of course the other factors that separate them is the quality of the food and the service. The food is not over salted like many Thai Food places in San Francisco. They make sure to ask your level of spicy and warn you how spicy Thai spicy really is. The food always tastes fresh! My water cup never went empty, they always made sure my glass stayed more than half full. If I needed more information on a dish they were very helpful.
Good food but it doesn't come with rice?  Asked why and couldn't get a clear answer, .

Some of the rudest servers you'll ever encounter outside of France.  Don't ask for the fried banana and ice cream dessert, because they'll say they don't have any bananas and be rude about it.  Their food is great, but I don't go there.
Ordered the:
