We came here for a birthday and it was $22 a person (including tax, tip, and the birthday girl).   We had curry fried rice, green curry beef, red curry and another dish I can't remember.  The green curry beef was pretty good.  The service was not great, but expected.  Corkage fee was $15.
I've been meaning to go here for a while now seeing as that is literally across the street from my building. I left this place so full, so happy and so ready to come back.
Food ok. Pad see ew oily. Green curry good. I appreciated that they had brown rice. Overall ok and place clean.

Tom Ka soup with prawns, best I have had in a good while.  I got a Thai iced tea for my tasty beverage and it was a perfectly layered masterpiece with just the right amount of sweetness and milkyness.  For an entree I teetered between a spicy curry and something from the sea.  I decided on the spicy salmon special.  It's basically a panfried salmon fillet with an amazing garlic chili sauce on top, comes with steamed veggies, but rice is extra(?!).   The salmon was cooked nicely and the garlic sauce was sooooo good.  I wish it was spicier, as that's what I was expecting.  It's actually on the mild side, but very savory.   I would definitely go back.

I eat here all the time! The spring rolls, beef Panang curry, pumpkin curry with chicken, and the Thai fried rice are my faves. The ladies that work there are so sweet and accommodating - they are the best part!
UPDATE: Still delicious :P

We were in town and staying one street over and decided to get Thai take out one night.  We ordered several main dishes and a couple of appetizers for our family.  The food was delicious and presented nicely, even in the to-go box.

I got take-out from Ar Roi on a recent trip to the west coast. It was late and my wife wasn't feeling well so I found a restaurant nearest to my hotel. Got the pad thai and brought it back to my room. Delicious. Inside the ambiance was very nice and clean.
One of the best thai restaurants.  Excellent egg rolls.  Pad Sae Yoo and Pad Woon Sen are just packed with flavor and not overly oily.  Very good experience.
Great food, very reasonable prices, very crowded restaurant.

Appalling! How can this place have such good reviews? Do Americans even go to Thailand? Because this is not a true reflection of Thai Cuisine. To start with I was served a flat coke, and when I sent it back I was brought another flat one. For entrée I ordered the speciality Angel Wings which are actually some shallow fried bones with a jar of minced garlic tipped over the top. Appetising. Next was the Massaman which was perhaps the weirdest version I've tasted the world over. So, so bad. Never again.

This place is a great Thai joint. Whatever Thai food you're craving, they will satisfy with their food. I live really close and it's my go-to thai restaurant, even with a billion others within 2 blocks of it.

Skip the lines at the nearby hot spots in Union Square and try this cozy place out. Clean, friendly, and a nice step above your average Thai restaurant atmosphere, this restaurant was a pleasant surprise. The service was a bit quirky but very friendly. When we entered, they asked us if we wanted to sit "inside" or "outside". Clearly there's no outside seating; what they meant was did we want to sit by the window. Our rice came five full minutes before the rest of our dinner, but when the food did come, it was delicious. The pad thai was very solid, a little sweet, but good. The chicken panang was delicious, cooked perfectly, not over cooked like at a lot of Thai restaurants.

I came here with my dad two weeks ago on a Saturday, and was pleasantly surprised.  There's no shortage of Thai restaurants in this area, but having poked around at a couple Ar Roi distinguishes itself on flavor and ambience -- without charging and arm and a leg.

Sorry to rave against the Yelp machine here but, I wasn't impressed with Ar Roi Restaurant.  Maybe it's because we arrived about an hour before close and the kitchen had already given up... maybe not.  Who knows?  What I do know is that the only thing I liked was the decor and the Thai Iced Tea.

Great food and drinks. I ordered a lemon twist, which had sake, blueberries, lemon, and tea. It was delicious. For our meal we ordered the pad ped (which is chicken with bamboo shoots, chili, and basil) and the pad kee mao. Both were really great and came in good portions. I definitely would come here again and recommend it to anyone who loves Thai food and wants to check out a new place.
I stopped in at Ar Roi late last week for lunch and found a hidden gem. I'll give credit where credit it due, my Yelp app informed me of this place nearby.
Duck curry YUUMMMMYYYYY one of the best dishes I had while in San Fran lessthanthree

Simple and straight-forward yet romantic, alluring, and engaging Thai restaurant in the heart of SF's theatre/south Nob Hill district. Though small, the interior makes good use of its high ceilings and, at night, low light, fostering a perfectly enchanting atmosphere. While the bright yellow paint-job outside may seem a bit much, the touches of turquoise inside make up for that. The environment, location, and price-point make it appropriate for dinner with friends as much as a date spot: when I lived on Pine Street, my room-mate would often wind up here for dinner.

I love this restaurant. Location is easy to find. Food is delicious and service is excellent. I feel comfortable and happy with food, especially BBQ Chicken, Fresh Roll, Pad Thai and etc. My friends will have birth day party next week in here. So don't miss this place your guys will like it!

Had lunch here.  The Tom Yom soup is superb.  Has the real stuff like galangal slices and Kaffir lime leaves.  The soup is the right sour taste.  The pad Thai, a staple of any Thai restaurant was a bit soft and not enough tamarind, but pretty good. Not as good as some of the best Thai restaurants.  The lunch special was $15.

Came on Sunday at 11am, right at the start of the "best brunch in SF" (says the voicemail) after a solid Friday night experience here. When we got to the huge closed wooden doors right at opening time and saw no movement inside, we called in AND checked the Yelp page multiple times. Yep, says open at 11am... so where are the people?  My friends even went so far as to peek through the door and walk down the walkway-- not a single person in sight.
Info: cash bar, so bring your cash.

I've been here a couple times now, and I'm still very impressed with this bar. Usually bars in SF are small, stuffy and packed..but this one is the complete opposite. It's got a great rooftop lounge along with a  big seating space inside. I've never had the food from here, so can't comment on that, but the atmosphere is great. It's not sleazy, but rather classy. Actually the last time I was here it was extremely cold out, so I was concerned it would get uncomfortable being outside, but they do a good job with the heat lamps.
I cannot understand how this place is so highly rated.

Unfortunately I didn't get a chance to tried the food here since we just came here after dinner to grab a couple drinks. The ambiance and crowd for a Friday night was great - outdoor seating, no long lines at the bars, and not overly crowded or time consuming to get in and snag a table.

I would have never expected a roof top-like place in the tenderloin. It has a great outdoor seating area, a separate bar area, and a cozy restaurant area. They had good happy hour drinks (beers for $3 and sangria for $4) and tasty appetizers. Dinner can be a bit on the pricey side, though. This is a good place to meet up with friends or a date for some drinks after work.
DONT EAT DINNER HERE!  Total waste of money.  My boyfriend and I had been here for brunch once before and it was ok (how do u mess up eggs, right?), and we stopped in to have dinner last night.

Jones is a cool spot. It's HUGE! It has a nice, swanky feel on the inside with a really large outside area with tons of tables and plants and a view into the lovely Tenderloin (bahaha, just kidding; the TL is terrible). But you may just see some tranny hookers strolling on by down below as you sip your vastly overpriced and tiny adult beverage.
Been here many times before and enjoyed it until last time. Once again a lovely spot. I'll take it as a rare exception.
This place is very nice. I really enjoy the atmosphere but the service was not fast.

Saturday, Oct 4th, I had a dinner at Jones with other 15 friends. The food seemed ok, the service bad (super slow and messed up, but it was Sat night, so I guess it's fine). After the dinner we went to the patio to drink some cocktails. After few minutes a girl that was with us started to feel very bad. When the staff arrived, they started to act like if she was drunk and they did not let her to lay down anywhere. They even became aggressive when she sat on a couch that was empty but reserved for a private party.
This place is fabulous! We had an amazing g dinner and cocktails. Loved the vibe and style throughout. The patio was perfect to relax at after our meal. Check this place out!

Absolutely love the atmosphere of Jones'. Incredibly attentive staff, amazing selection of cocktails, and the chef is truly gifted with flavors and presentation. My experience here was awesome, from the decor to the specially made cocktails,  it was an all around 10.
Jones is a cool spot. I've been here twice and so far, it hasn't let me down.

Cocktails, atmosphere, exquisite design, brunch, nightlife, and the coolest bathrooms in the city hands down; Just a few reasons I come to Jones when I'm in SF.  If for nothing else, it's worth walking down the corridor, grabbing a drink and admiring the street below while wondering how the hell they fit a large semi-hidden lounge/restaurant in the middle of the Tenderloin?! Must see if you're visiting or live in the city.
Outdoor rooftop bar? Check!
Cool Outdoor Patio. This place has a NYC vibe which I loved.  The outdoor area is first come, first serve but you can get seated inside by going to the front hostess.

You wouldn't be able to tell from the outside but Jones is actually a huge sprawling bar and patio area once you get past those black gates. At least they put up something that looks like signage recently so you can actually find it. Seriously if there isn't a bouncer or line outside you might walk right past it.
Although my first visit to Jones was relatively quick (in and out in about an hour), I enjoyed it!

I rarely write reviews unless the service/food is really good or really bad. I came here with a friend the other night and the bartender directed us to sit outside at a table to order food. The rooftop wasn't even that busy, but we continued to sit at a table for an hour  and wait for service that never came. Not impressed with this place one bit. Cool ambience, but when your service sucks (or never shows), it's not worth it.
Hella cool.

The ambiance is elegant and the patio had great potential. Which is why I was surprised to find out the high school student in jeans and sneakers, standing at the front of the entrance, was actually the hostess. The service was poor. I went with a group of 6 and we were not checked up on and had to constantly flag down the waiter...which was also difficult because the waiters are hard to identify as they are all dressed in street clothes. Again, why have a fancy, elegant restaurant if your staff is going to wear jeans, tshirts, and sneakers? Totally killed the vibes. Also, for outdoor seating in the city, especially during the fall, heaters at the tables would be nice. Menu looked basic. Sangria was horrible. Only good thing was the $3 beers.

Jones is a great place to grab a drink with friends when the weather is nice. I came here for happy hour on a Friday and it was packed. It was still clear and (relatively) warm, so the patio area was filled with people. I ordered the eggplant parmesan panini - not great, but not bad either. The drink and food prices are reasonable. Service can be a bit slow when it's crowded.

Slow service on a Saturday night. Looked like there was only one waitress in the outdoor seating area. Waitress did not smile, was not friendly, and not welcoming. We ordered drinks and food and before leaving, I wanted a martinellis which was on the drink menu. Waitress said uhhhh we don't have that. I said it's on the menu. She said it was not. I said nevermind because I didn't want  to waste my breath. Drinks were okay. Food was okay. Maybe if they got more help on a Saturday night I would think about coming back. Cool decor though.

I came here with my friends a couple months ago. The bartender did not have good service. So, I told one of the bouncers, and he said he will tell his superior. So, some guy in black came up to me and asked me what's wrong. I told him that the person at the bar gave me horrible service. He said "I'm really sorry about that" and do you know what he did???? He started serving me and my friends! How thoughtful was that! He said he just wanted to make his customers happy. He said he is there on weekends, but that he was going to the Philippines. I thought he was from Africa, but he said he is full blooded Filipino. I am giving this place a 5 star because of the nice guy, not because of service, service sucked, but he is so sweet for putting stuff to the side to entertain and service me and my friends. THANKS MR.!  =)
Great outdoor bar
The security said "you're not a good look for this place" and said "you people aren't welcome here". I'm not really sure what happened? But, as a regular, I'm confused.

This place needs to get their sh*t together. Service was beyond slow-- just to get water took 20 minutes. We had a corporate party of 8 and needless to say we were embarrassed that this was the restaurant  we took them to. Additionally we tried to follow up from dinner and move to the bar and it was cash only and they would not accommodate us paying with the same card we had just used for our dinner party. The only positive is the place is aesthetically very cool. Too bad we will never be back.
Not cool! Horrible service! Waiter was a clueless! Salmon was tasteless. So disappointing!!! Never bring a company group here! They don't give a sH@%5!!
It has a cool rooftop bar vibe without technically being one.  It's just one story off Geary, but there's a street level entrance on both Jones and Geary.
This is a review for the BAR only.

This is a great place for drinks in one of those rare summer SF days. However, drinks are expensive and the cash only policy is a hassle considering that this is the Bay Area where multiple technological solutions are available for the situation. I would probably wouldn't mind if it was a small sports bar. But this place is huge and again, expensive.

I originally wanted to have brunch here, but ended up saving this spot for default go to bar at night. I tried to gather a bunch of the yelpers to come here after our epic 10 year anniversary yelp event, but that didn't work out as good as I had hoped. Let's just say that I hate baby sitting people.

This was my first time here and I loved the experience. I went with a bachelorette party and we were a pretty large group. Service was good (I know how difficult serving a large party of girls can be). I like the decor and vibe of the place. They also have a large outdoor seating area.

I discovered world's worst whisky sours at the bar outside, made by a sulking bartender with a chip on his shoulder. The crowd is an amusing mix of college bridge-and-tunnel, basic training bros and their unfortunate women hang-arounders, a Marina under-under-class of wannabes.

Jones is a very nice place to have a drink on the terrace, not too expensive with a pleasant environment above the street.. I recommend it if you're looking for a trendy quiet place. Didn't taste the food but looked great !

Hands down one of my favorite bars in the city. Great spot for a happy hour meetup especially when the weather is nice. Only downside is that it is cash only so make sure to hit the ATM before you go there. Otherwise this place is a party!

They have the most rudest bouncers who don't hesitate to use f word with customers who come and buy pricy food. There is a reason why you go to nice places and pay a lot. I never expected that kinda behavior.

It turned out to be an awful night when we decided to go to Jones. Apart from the fact that I actually saw the bartender put nothing more than 2 drops of vodka in my drink, the bouncers were all on power trips that night. One of then came to tell us that we can't be sitting where we were sitting and he turned it into a whole interrogation and character bashing session. I was so shocked. It was pathetic and humiliating, both for us and him who had people observing his power trip. And the ones who came around to tell us the bar is closing were no better. He said its time to leave and we said ok thank you. Then he decides to say: "no that mean you f****g get up and leave right now. Don't be f****g thanking me." We were a group of engineers out for drinks and we each had one drink. Imagine that.
620 Jones is one of the few places in SF where you can sit outdoors without essentially sitting on the street. This is an incredibly opportunity, but unfortunately, it's kind of given away.

I placed a delivery order and got the Cheeseburger, which sucked. The patty was like a rubbery dog chew toy. My buddy ordered the meat ravioli which was supposed to come with buttered bread... bomb right? Well we get the saddest, limpest looking slab of hot dog bun ever. Not even toasted, soaked in butter. And sorry for the details, but when I unwrapped the bun it smelled like farts. So gross. P.s. we were drinking earlier and this food was still crappy. Try somewhere else, save yo $krill.

We were staying in Frisco for the night and decided to get some food for the room. There were 2 choices and it was slightly after midnight so we called the other choice first and there was no answer after a couple of calls so we defaulted to this spot. After a couple of tries they finally answered the phone. They took my order and told me that they would deliver in about an hour. I was fine with that since it is usually 45 to an hour with most delivery spots anyways.

Came here around past midnight with my friends after a concert on Halloween night. This was one of a few places that were open at the time and when we got there, there was a long line.  The location is pretty sketchy however the ambiance of the restaurant made me forget that I was in the Tenderloin. The place was super packed and busy but the service was fast and easy! Ordered individual slices for me and my friend, I got a combo pizza and my friend ordered the greek. When we got our order, both pizzas were attached next to each other and I was surprised that they made each slice individually and I thought that was pretty special and unique! Kinda wish I ordered a whole pizza because of how good it was, so I do plan on coming here again.

Can't really go wrong with $4 for a slice of pizza when you got the drunchies going on. Both the Combo and San Francisco were not bad - they definitely don't skimp on the toppings. They were even nice enough to add extra olives for no extra charge when we asked. :)

Came here for late night pizza with a friend after a night out on Polk Street in Mayes. I'm actually kind of surprised that not a lot of places were open after 11PM...c'mon, isn't the city supposed to be alive with the smells of drunchies?
The pizza was a little chewy, but good. Good because I had been drinking.

Avoid like the plague! They say they take credit cards, and do not! Plus dont expect delivery under an hour even if a few blocks away. They are open late not because they are good, but because they have to be to turn a dime.
Chef didn't care, pizza was gross after three slices. Not enough cheese and dough was only thing tasty.

Maybe we were slightly intoxicated after grabbing a couple slices to go at the recommendation of our Sidecar driver (he literally pulled over on our way home so the bf could run out and get some late night grub), but this is some pretty good pizza.

Unfortunately I ordered pizza today using the online sight through this yelp page. After charging my card and an hour and half goes by...No pizza. I called the store and confronted the manager and he got very aggressive with me over the phone. Stating that he is not responsible for any online orders. I asked for my money refunded and he began yelling at me that I don't listen to him.  It was a sad experience. I wont get pizza there if it were free! Customer service is hard to come by these days...
Sitting at work and can't leave the store but we still needed to get a bit to eat. We used their online ordering service through

One of the top three pizza places I've ever eaten at. Kind of a hole in the wall, but damn dat pizza. Good sauce, delicious cheese melted on top of whatever you get, and the crust is crispy to perfection and never burned on the bottom. Not thick, but not thin, a good regular crust size. One slice can fill me up, and at a great price.
We ordered pizza for 14 people at 8pm at night on a Wednesday and were told it would arrive in 30-45 minutes.

I needed a late night delivery place and they delivered within 30mins. I've had a lot of different pizza's from different places and this place is definitely not the best, a tad salty, but satisfies a late night/early am pizza craving. They deliver until 3am and the pizza delivery guy was nice and the pizza was very hot.
We were looking for a good late night pizza place and our hotel recommend this one. It was yummy and perfect for a late night pizza fix( 11:30pm) -- delivered in great trimming too.
Napoli's is the best when you're drunk from the bars on Polk and starving on your way home. This is me almost every other weekend so you could say I'm a regular.
Very good pizza, esp. after a night out on Polk St. My favorite in the area.
I use to be a fan. Operative word: Use to.

For a CHEAP,quick late nite slice. You can't ask for too much. Cheese is oily,ingredients seem okay. If you "only" can stomach high end pizza. This isnt the spot for you. With that said... I have tried the seafood pizza with clams and garlic. It was good. Never hand clams on a pizza. So I thought what the heck!  Hey what can you expect from a semi grab and go spot. Not your trendy pizzeria. So if your looking to impress yourself or others :) might want to check another spot. Even though some have mixed feelings about the location being in the Tenderloin. I can say with all the interesting characters that frequent this joint. The gentlemen that runs it is always cool with me. And as for the youngsters running the till. Some may have mixed feelings about this,but I dont have a problem with this! Cause in some countries, people have the silver spoon not just in there mouth but some where else. And could probably learn a little something. Haha! Service is pretty quick too. Consistent in their product. Remember you get what you pay for. And yes I gave it 3 stars, cause as pizza conissuier. I have to keep it real!

Why did a group of children (there were 3 kids around the age of 12) serve me pizza late at night? Also, why did I buy pizza from a group of children? I'm guessing it's their dad's/family's restaurant because I saw an adult there that may have been their dad or uncle. Um, anyway, the pizza was alright. It hit the spot after a late night of drinking.
This place deserves ZERO stars.
Tried to have a pizza delivered to my hotel room, but no show. Three hours later and no pizza?  At 4 hours I called it quits.
First time was good, second time was just ok, third time was not a charm AT ALL. The dough was raw and they said they would comp is for our next order. Their idea of comping was $5 off. NOT COOL!

I used to work in the financial district and we would go on staff nights on Friday nights. One time about ten years ago we stumbled into the TL and into this joint around 1AM. The place was tiny, but had a good vibe (although, the floor and wall designs caused some dizziness after drinking). We ordered some za and OMG it was fantastic! Since then, we would order them for delivery on a very regular basis. to make this place even greater, they deliver city wide and up until like 3am. if you like za and are in SF, check them out,. if you aren't brave enough to venture into the tenderloin, they will gladly come to you.

Not the best pizza but it does the spot after you've been drinking on Polk.  The pizza here is more doughy than I like and not as browned but still decent.  Got a huge combo slice.  Also seems that things are made to order on this popular stop post bar hopping.  75 cent transaction fee for card.  Two slices of pizzas...$7 cash.  The amusement of looking at the drunken hot messes waiting for their pizza & eating..PRICELESS.

First night in SF... got in very late and this was one of the only places open... interesting scene to say the least at nearly closing time lol. Pizza actually wasn't bad though. Was made fresh when I got there and wasn't too greasy. Perhaps it was just ok because it was late and I only had tacos earlier in the day. If you need a late night fix stop by and give it a try.

This place is a total hole in the wall and in a bad part of town, but has one of the best slices in the city, hands down.  The crust is fairly bready, but delicious, so if you are more into thin crust you won't like it.  I like it better than Escape from NY, Extreme, and Victors (up the street).  There are always pretty shady characters hanging around this place and I'm pretty sure there's a crack house across the street, so I would not advise women to go here alone late at night.  You can order delivery through Eat 24.

I applaud the staff from last Saturday. I was there among the crowds watching the waiters handle the dinner rush. There will always be some folks who don't understand that sometimes really good restaurants get slammed. You are there because the food is worth waiting for, so getting angry at the staff doesn't make the food come out faster. This place hands down has the best meatballs & sausage pizza I've ever tasted in the east bay.  I have eaten at Piccalo several times now and they are always honest about how long it will take.  Bravo you guys on consistently putting out excellent quality pizza!! Don't let the haters get you down.

it's been a few years (I'm SOWWY) since I ordered from Napoli simply because I haven't worked in the Tenderloin since 2008, but tonight at work, I was already starving so when my direct deposit hit my bank account, I was like YAY PIZZA! Let me tell you, Napoli's NEVER disappoints me with their food, I ordered a Medium Chicken, Garlic & Mushroom of course with jalapenos and pineapple added, I also ordered the Greek Salad which was quite yummy (needed more tomatoes though) I shared the pizza with my coworker and he agreed wholeheartedly, THEIR PIZZA is BOMB!!!! SO FREAKING GOOD! SOURDOUGH CRUST...sauce was yummy, just the right amount of garlic...I LOVE YOU GUYS!!!! Delivery guy was very polite!

Without a doubt the WORST pizza I've ever consumed. Domino's, Pizza Hut and even Papa John's are better. All of their specialities are just a bunch of crap thrown on top of a standard cheese pizza. It's not even good drunk food. Avoid at all costs.
I was extremely drunk when I consumed this pizza.

Looking back at my old yelp reviews I have to ask myself, why did I ever give this place 5 stars? The pizza is okay. The atmosphere is bad. There are frequently weird people hanging out here. The staff is barely friendly.

Wow this is the worst pizza I have eaten (or did not eat). Terrible service they are happy to mislead the delivery guy did not even come to the door (that's a first) and the food was cold.  Disappointed by the positive reviews as that's why I chose this place. I took mine back and asked for a refund, not sure I can say more.

First impression: the cheese looks weird and the meats taste weird, implying the ingredients are not the finest, but I didn't mind because at 2am, I wasn't expecting anything fancy.  I ate one slice and had to get up in the middle of the night to throw up. Bad pizza is okay, but bad pizza that offends your stomach that much is not so cool.
Scenery-5.5
Great late night, awesome price point pizza !   We usually get the "San Franciscan"  [Pepperoni, bacon, olives, beef and Feta cheese.]

Ordered delivery on a rainy Saturday night in and gave this place a try based on reviews. Used Eat24 to order a large half and half pizza - one half peppers and sausage, and the other half peppers, onions & mushrooms. It came in only 45 minutes (+1 star), but we were disappointed to open the box find it was an unevenly distributed 100% POM pizza - no sausage (-1 star). And we paid extra for each topping (-1). The extra sauce we'd requested was also missing (-1). But we were starving and didn't want to deal with it, so whatever. Unfortunately, it turned out to be pretty mediocre pizza (-1). The crust was doughy and heavy, the sauce was pasty and the cheese was chewy. Didn't even want the leftovers the next day.

Ok you guys aren't too bad, but the location scares the crap out of me. Cant expect too much and its great that this place opens until 4am. After our night out we were looking for places to eat. This place was about a block down the place we stayed and we were starving!

Gave this place a chance based other reviews, and had them deliver me some 'zza.  The pizza was "OK" but not the best I've had.  Dough was thick and tasted a little "doughy" - I was born and raised in the Northeast, and favor thinner pizza ("New York Style") so I am a little biased.  But the delivery was quick and the pizza was hot, so overall a good experience.  Still, I think there is better pizza to be had in this neighborhood.  On a scale of Yuck to Great, I'd give it a "meh."
The pizza I had from here was absolutely disgusting.
Asked "how much is a bagel with JUST hummus", it's $4.99 so I said "OK just give me the complete hummus bagel with all the veggies". What do I get, a $5 bagel with just hummus. SMH.

Large homemade dolmas are the best!  The family that owns the place is friendly.  Good service.  There is a lot to choose from my favorites are the dolmas, baklava, chai iced tea, and the spinach triangle pie thing.

Love this place! Family owned business that radiates excellent customer service and quality coffee drinks with a variety of food options (bagels, cookies, deserts, dolmas, salads, wraps, sandwiches, etc.). I've been to this place many many times and am never disappointed.

I came here after reading the reviews, and once again yelpers you did not disappoint me. The gentleman working was so friendly, and it was 6:45 am! The breakfast bagel I ordered was delicious and their coffee is strong, not watered down. Plus they offer Krispy Kreme donuts. What more could you ask for?

Stopped in for lunch and must say I was impressed by cleanliness and the very tasty looking food on display. I had the Hot club sandwich and it was delicious the meat tasted fresh and veggies were crisp. A very polite staff and great food! Located in the heart of the Tenderlion it is one of S.F.'s hidden gems!!
I adore this little spot with my entire heart.

This was my second time here for lunch in four days and I am only in SF for five! The falafel is amazing! The falafel pita is a flavor explosion in your mouth and you can request it to be as spicy as you like. The owners are extremely friendly which I greatly appreciate. It is nice to be greeted by a smiling face and that along with great food turns me into a repeat customer.

Been there twice since my last review. First time I bought and paid for a cert breakfast sando. They ran out of what I wanted but charged me for it. Then gave me doughnuts to equal the charge. Which I didn't want!!! Now I ordered 3 breakfast sandos again and didn't get what I asked for? When I stated the order was wrong they told me I must have made a mistake? I will never be back. They are a train wreck waiting to happen!!!!!
Service: 5/5

Iced chai here is amazing! They have all sorts of pastries and sandwiches. They also have pasta, deviled eggs, different types of Mediterranean snacks. Very friendly staff, they have relaxing music that plays though the cafe. Located outside are some chairs and tables if you can't find seating inside. Best chai I've had so far.

This is a family owned business and the owner has reached out to fix my previous complaint. Which you don't see too often. As long as he is making the chai lattes we will be back, I think they are the best I've had.

This coffee is shop is about a block away from my apartment, so not only is it super convenient, but they have the best service! Nagam runs his shop like it's his baby, and he treats every customer like family! He always greets us with a hug or a smile. I believe it's his sister and father that work alongside him. The sweet lady behind the counter always makes our sandwiches to perfection and she's super fast!

The people working here are lovely and very attentive. Baked goods are delicious, great homemade Mediterranean fare (falafel wrap was delicious) aaaaand they have matte lattes! Best one (only one) I've had.

I love this place! Fresh, inexpensive food. Clean and comfortable. Excellent friendly staff. Quick service, usually. Large, clean bathroom. I usually go in the off hours, get a sandwich and tea, read and relax.
14.03.29.       First visit   ... quick recap ... will update
Chicken Shwarma and Turkey Pesto were both delicious! The service is friendly and their desserts look incredible!

Hours are wrong. This was the 3rd location where the hours were wrong. I usually would not be upset. But when I am "guiding" people around and this is the 3rd spot where the place is closed, then I'm pissed. And especially pissed since we only tried to open the door after seeing someone come out. The door was immediately locked and then a guy came out to tell us "can't you see door locked, we're closed". This star is for the incorrect info. Their desserts might be good, but you can judge since we couldn't...

Putting a case of cheesecake, tiramisu, pie and the plethora of other dessert options at the front of your store is likely to get me in your door.  I was half expecting a witch to shove me in an oven after being lured in but no...I just ate a crap load of dessert.   Well played Angel, well played.

First off, customer service here is pretty good. Most of them are nice and aside from an occasional language barrier things run smoothly when you interact with the person behind the counter. That being said, I have had mixed experiences with their food and drinks. The Yerba Mate Latte they advertise in their window is 4.25 and made with a syrup rather than the real thing. It's mostly foam and the espresso tastes oily. I've given the drink a few tries in the hopes that it was a fluke but each time I've been disappointed. The pre made food is old and their sandwiches are just okay. They don't hesitate to mark up their prices though. I live around the corner and stop by here when I'm in a hurry but the cash only policy pared with the less than average food has really turned me off. Again they're nice people but this won't become my go to cafe in my neighborhood unless it drastically changes.

Came here because it was near our hotel and we were on the way to the airport. Had a couple of sandwiches (Reuben and Pesto turkey) along with some coffees, a dolmeh, and a bit of the highly recommended tiramisu (sp?) cake. All was very home-y tasting and not the one bit bad. Seating is sort of weird, and homeless people were around, but overall fine. The cash-only thing was a detractor for me. Particular highlight was the $0.85 dolmeh. Very good.
Its a must try coffee shop in the area. Cannot say it is the best coffee but definitely they have amazing home cooked goodies. Staff is really friendly and willing to help for anything.
This place is still
Angel Cafe has an exhastive offerings: gourmet pastries, krispy kreme doughnuts, pannins, falafels, dolmas, coffees, mediterranean eats, huumus, sammies, the list goes on. ..
Best dolmas ever!

My favorite vegetarian sandwich beyond a falafel can be found in this little, corner deli.  The balance of veggies and fresh mozzarella in the Heavenly Angel allows me to forget how healthy I'm eating - it just tastes that good.  Naturally, I also had to try the dolmas.  They don't look very appetizing and they taste as good as they look.

We are on vacation, and were just looking for a savory snack in place of dinner and we wound up in the Angel Deli. The owner and his staff were exceptionally nice! The owner was simply genuine, in a way rarely seen - especially in  customer service.  The owner even slightly modified the "format" of one of his sandwiches so my friend could have a meat and cheese plate instead.  He took great care in making sure he made the orders just as we requested.
"Great local coffee and bagel place for the morning caffeine fix"

Frist off when you walk into a cafe there shouldn't be a buzzer going off when you enter the place. That's just absurd. I walk in and the barista girl rudely asks if she can help me, basically "what are you doing here?" As I proceed to look around I ask her where the deserts are from, thinking they were prepared on location and she says, "Italy."

I love this place. Very clean and relaxing spot to get coffee and a light lunch. The owner here really takes care of the area near the cafe which also makes this corner a little bright spot here in the Lower Nob/Tenderloin area of Geary. I highly recommend this place. Plus they have free wi-fi!
Situation
Their bagels are the best!

Super friendly owner chatted with me and even gave me a chai latte when I had already paid and wanted to add it to the order. Great fresh sandwiches. Almost makes up for the girl who was grabbed by a homeless guy on the tables outside and then her bf started a fight with him. Classy. Recommendation - take it to go or stay inside!!
Feels like a genuine European Cafe, food and service are both authentic.

This Deli is near my mom's house and she brought me here to have lunch.  The man was very nice and he had a lot of made from scratch food, such as hummus.  He carries a large amount of mouth watering desserts and he makes any kind of sandwich you can dream up, within reason of course.  You feel right at home and the food is great.
Great corner cafe, I had the turkey pesto sandwich... huge fan of pesto and these guys got it good! Tastes like a splash of vinegar is in it... perfect. Bravo!
Very friendly staff with a genuinely caring, sweet, and giving spirit.
One of the best coffees in town. Great sandwiches. Awesome place.

Angel, I love you! Delicious bites, the nicest and most wonderful people own this cafe. When I was thinking of moving to the Loin, I stumbled in here, drenched in rain and frustrated with the stressful search of apartment hunting. The moment I walked in, I was welcomed, warmed and fed. I go here nearly everyday now. Food is inexpensive and wonderful. Coffee is delicious! I love you Angel and I'll be sad if I ever move.

I am just eating the best lox bagel on this planet ! Cheese bagel lox soooo good !! Also ordered a medium latte, very flavorful. I always go to Angel cafe, well whenever i have cash lol The 2 people who work there are super nice, smiling, make great food, smile at me, i mean come on what more can i ask for! Thanks guys, keep up the good work :)
Fantastic service!  The wrap was very good.  The espresso was even better!  Took a canolli home and it was also delicious.
Really cool nice place in a rapidly gentrifying hood (for better or for worse). Cassia is a gem. Cool urban tmosphere.

The Moroccan food here is a solid 3.  Nothing particularly wrong with it, and I actually really enjoyed the kale and beet salad, but nothing to really crave for again.  It was also really overpriced for what it was.

The hall is a great example of the diverse and eclectic mix of foods that make San Francisco a wonderful place to live and to eat!  Excellent quick lunch or happy hour with diverse selection and fun collection of events outside of the food scene.  Don't miss Fine&Rare's grilled cheese if they have it!  Other standouts are roast beef from the Whole Beast and the freshly made Naan from Raj & Singh.

This super cool new place in Mid-Market turned out to be a great place to watch a World Series game after work.  The setup is a big open area, in a building with kind of a reclaimed/open/rustic vibe, with exposed beams and open ceiling, and old doors making up up one wall.  There are booths around the perimeter with different kinds of food.  There is a full bar up front, long tables in the middles, and sidewalk seating out front.

I was invited for lunch with a friend and I always like to try new spots in the hood. I can absolutely not recommend The Hall for lunch. Drinks with friends/coworkers and snacks, yes. The prices were beyond food truck prices and the portions (my lamb wrap which contained lamb and wrap only) go nowhere near representing a full lunch.
After carefully reading the review guidelines, I cannot see any that I "violated."

My fiancé and I came here for drinks and dinner one night, hoping to catch the giants game. Though they did have the game playing on the big screen, it's not ideally set up for watching the game. That being said, that is not what this spot is really about so I can't knock it for that.happy hour is decent, though regular alcohol prices are a bit much. The food was a fun idea and tasty! We shared fish tacos which had a gray sauce on them. We then had the roast beef sandwich and a steak salad-both very tasty! Great casual afterword spot, could use a bit more seating.

Went inside, and it looked like the inside of a mini ferry building with sports on the projector screen and more seating. Just like the ferry building it is a wonder to behold but not enough food choices for vegetarians, thus the -2 stars. Ideally there would be food, booze and sports on the big screen, well I'll settle for 2 out of 3.
This rating is for the food. Now that I've eaten at all but one food stand inside this place (I haven't tried the Vietnamese), I feel qualified to rate it.
This review is for Little Green Cyclo, not The Hall in general, which is a very good concept and nicely done.

This place is fantastic!  Like an upscale food court with a great vibe and a bar.  We loved that we could get lots of choices in one place: Moroccan, indian, vietnamese, greek, etc.  The moroccan food was incredible and so was the indian.  The wine from the bar was great.  And it's just plain fun!
Should we eat outside?...Well how safe do you feel outside?
The Hall is a mini food count on market st. where a striptease place used to be. quality food here. just not much seating, so 3 stars.

The Asian bartender (I think it's Yugene) was awesome. Great hangout place! They could work on their wine selection, but the people are what makes The Hall a nice addition to Mid-Market. The food was good as well, although Moroccan Peruvian is the height of hipsterdom.
Overpriced crap for stupid people. $10 for pho? Measly portion, not even worthy of the name taste-wise. I'm actually rather disgusted.
Checked out The Hall in Mid-Market Sun 10/5/14 for an early dinner.  It's on Market St near 6th.  It's a temporary food court, in 2016 they are going to make it into apartments.
Buzzerkely on tap...awesome!!!

A shining light in the mid market area- chill vibe, great local vendors. The perfect happy hour or lunch spot with food and beer and wine - and a large screen showing the game. Lamb and eggplant curry really tasty at raj and Singh. Ask the vendor about her logo- it's her dad and uncle! Fine and rare has great specials- delicious peach and Brussels sprout side. I would definitely meet friends here after work for drinks and transition into yummy bites.

Six vendors. Meats. Vietnamese. Seafood. Indian. It's awesome. I had the Blt and oysters at fine and rare. The lamb curry and eggplant at rah and Singh and the pork bang mee at the Vietnamese place. All in a good nights work. Good bar. Reasonable prices.
I've stopped by a couple of times during the day. Had tacos from Fine & Rare and pork from Cassia.

An upscale food court featuring; Little Green Cyclo Vietnamese food, Fine & Rare seafood/wines, Raj & Singh Indian food, Dignita local foods, Cassia Moroccan-Peruvian fusion and The Whole Beast animal dishes. Great for event rentals like wedding rehearsal dinners, large birthdays.

A fancy food court stocked with former/current food truck vendors instead of fast food chains - none of which I'd heard of or tried before (but then again who can keep up with the proliferation of food trucks & pop-ups these days?). I'd just had a late breakfast so though was tempted by both the lamb burger (The Whole Beast) and meatballs (Cassia) I ended up getting something lighter.
4.5 STARS

Making the mid-Market area a draw for foodies is no small feat. I pass through this area on the bus every day, and believe me, nobody wants to get off at 6th Street unless they're trying to score some hallucinogenic substance or they're a pack of German tourists looking for Fisherman's Wharf without a map or a clue. But finally, there's a reason to come here for the rest of us, and it's a smart use of space that had remained unoccupied since Hollywood Billiards closed shop over six years ago. It's a communal pop-up, a bit like 331 Cortland in Bernal Heights (where Paulie's Pickling is) only much bigger with tables (photo:
Time: 11:47am/62°F cloudy
Worst hot dog experience ever.  The dog was dry and gross (chicken basil or something) and the bread was so hard it literally cut the roof of my mouth.

After seeing this on Guy Fieri's "Diners, Drive-ins and Dives,"  I wanted to try it when I was in San Francisco this past weekend.  I have to say I liked it but it wasn't as great as the hype I saw on TV.  I had the maple sausage and eggs.  The maple flavor really enhanced the taste of the sausage.
Two words:  Onion Rings
This place is good but $10 for a sandwich with no sides is pretty ridiculous. I won't be back unless they lower their prices.
Borderline sketch due to its mid-Market location, but the food is awesome! We popped in for a pre-theatre meal, since it's steps away from the Golden Gate Theatre.

Showdogs.... What can I say ??? It's really a one trick pony for me since all I have ever eaten was the chicken sandwich . My Gawd! What a sandwich!!! If I never eat another chicken sandwich but Showdogs then I'm a happy girl! !  I LOVE LOVE LOVE that sandwich . The chicken breast is ALWAYS juicy. The bun is always toasted just right . The coleslaw is banging ! I love this place. As a non pork eater I hold back a star for a pork filled menu. If they come up with beef or turkey sausages I'm upping the stars . But really go get the chicken sandwich ! I swear I've had it 10 times and I love it EVERY DAMN TIME! One trick pony for me but oooohhhh what a trick.... The garlic fried are nothing to sneeze at... Stupid good I just wish they would serve up more tasty fries..... GO TO SHOWDOGS! Get the chicken sandwich ( I add Swiss against the chefs warnings... But hey I LOVE CHEESE  so try it that way cheese lovers) and prepare to be in yum yum paradise!!!
WEINER WITH FLAVOR

Get the chicken sandwich.  Trust me.  Went up to SF to visit for the weekend, went for dinner on Saturday.. and I kid you not, we had to come back on Sunday to get another sandwich.  Also got the Sunrise ShowDog and the Maple Pork sausage.. also really good, but the chicken sandwich definitely wins out of those three.  Definitely worth two trips during our short visit.

Legit and yummy. Great service and crispy chicken sandwiches is what this place is all about. Came here on a Sunday and wasn't many people but love the vibe with the seat in the corner of the store. Their number of sauces makes chick fil a jealous. Don't get it twisted try this place out
I give them one star because it was the least I could give them.
great food; awesome staff
THE BEST CHICKEN SANDWICH EVER!!!!
The problem with having cooks out on display in the middle of the restaurant is that if they're lazy, argumentative or incompetent, the whole restaurant gets to see.
Got the Fried Chicken Sandwich. Flavor was good! But good lord it was hella salty!
Our group chose Show Dogs due to its proximity to the Golden Gate Theater. It's very conveniently located about 10 yards from the theater on Market Street.
Came here with a friend as a pitstop before a concert and it was crowded. Luckily the flow was not too bad and by the time we ordered, we were able to find a spot. We ordered the following:

1st yelp and wow...well worth it! My wife and I stopped by after our run, cool setting great staff and most importantly great food (especially the sauces) yummy. Sunrise dog and mahi mahi sandwich was great, 4 barrel coffee to keep me going and water to cool my mouth down...be careful with the hot Sauces ;) be back soon. Cheers Showdogs.

What a waste of time & money.  So disappointing!  When traveling, we like to seek out a restaurant from Triple D.  Do NOT eat at this one!  We waited over 45 minutes for our food.  We got 2 burned corn dogs - I mean they were black!  (I can't believe I forgot to take a picture.)  They cooked new ones for us that were almost as burned.  The cornbread coating was GROSS - spongy and greasy.  They were, by far, the most disgusting corn dogs we had ever tasted.  I'm mean, much worse than one out of the frozen food section.  The owners of Show Dogs should go eat a Fletcher's Corn Dog at the Texas State Fair to learn what a real, freshly dipped, properly cooked corn dog should taste like.  Oh, and our fries took even longer - and they were hard & dry.

I couldn't manage to stuff sausage down my throat after the night I had just had.  I instead opted for their iced coffee and picked up a pastry at the neighboring bakery.  The staff was friendly & didn't have a problem with me bringing in outside food.  Overall service was fine and my girlfriend's food looked appetizing.  3 stars.

Ok let me gripe for one second. (I see your eyes rolling). When a sausage and beer ring up for $17 I kind of want to kick something. Granted said sausage was delicious as was said beer. But like...what has this world come to?

I had the Italian Pork dog here, and with all the different choices, it was the truffle aioli that sold me. I'm a sucker for anything with a hint of truffle in it, and I had to try it. For a quick meal on our walk to an event last weekend, it was just what I needed. I liked that the ratio of meat exceeded the size of the bun, because I'm not trying to have a mouthful of bread when I'm there for some sausage...

The staff here is so chill, the food was so good. The majority of the people there seemed to be regulars, which is telling in itself. I did go with the chicken sandwich, as many other yelpers suggested, and much to my dismay it actually delivered on the hype. It was absolutely delicious. Will report back next time I go to try some sausage.

May have to update my review once I visit again but my first experience was impressive.  I got the Californian breakfast sandwich which was not your typical 'add avocado and call it Californian', though there was of course avo.  It had amazing bacon and a great contrast sweetness with apple chutney.  This place gets the nudge from 4 to 5 stars for me because of their homemade hot sauce which went all over my sandwich and then anything else I could find to consume with it.  My friend also got a milkshake which isn't usually my thing but was also really great.  Can't wait to try a hot dog! Review update coming soon ...
I had the fried chicken sandwich and the garlic & cheese fries. Not very healthy but it's insanely good! The food is excellent and the fried chicken sandwich is a killer.

I love this place! I've only ever ordered the fried chicken sandwich... But why adventure away from PROFECTION! I'm serious, yall it is SOOOOO good. - comes with some kind of aioli, ginger and house made cole slaw. Yummm!!!

Hands down the best chicken sammich we've had. It's day and night compared to the last one I had at Bakesale Betty (yuck). The moist chicken was nicely crusted and never lost its crunchiness. Well paired w/ a flavorful slaw and sweet thin pickles on a lightly toasted bun.

I would not recommend to use the outside tables unless you want to have a conversation  with  the homeless...Otherwise the place is cool. Last time i was there I ordered their garlic fries and a beer. The fries were AWESOME - big portion covered generously with Parmesan and garlic. They played good music too...
The fried chicken sandwich is definitely the way to go here. If you're not TOO hungry, it can probably be enough for two to share (that is, if you're willing to share it...)
Overhyped. $27 for two dogs, old dry fries, and a coke. I'll stick to the $5 street dogs for now on.
Eh....Corn dog 1 star, wild boar sausage 3 stars,  atmosphere is not great as the area is fairly ghetto.

Really great fries and milkshakes and over the top dogs. Moderate prices. A great home made ketchup and interesting art and guitars on the walls to look at.  Nice selection of beer and an even even better barley and beer milkshake!
Chicken sandwich.. Enough said. Location is a lil sketchy but hey that adds to the character. Do yourself a favor and just get the chicken sandwich

Don't come here for lunch.  You'll never get your order.  Brought a friend here we waited and waited and waited, until I asked for my money back, I needed to keep my job.  I wasn't going to wait another 45 min for some freaking hot dog!!!!
Great service, fantastic chicken sandwich.

Best damn fried chicken sandwich EVER. I used to go to Bake Sale Betty's in Oakland because I heard rave reviews from friends, but the sandwich I just had shats on Bake Sale Betty's. It probably shats on most others in the area if not the whole damn city.

I thought this place was mediocre. I had a California croissant sans the bacon. I also ordered a side of potatoes. I paid $1.50 for no more than 15 cubes of potatoes, which I didn't think was that good. It was either refried, or overly crispy. It was really hard, too.
Found this place on yelp one day while I was looking for a quick cheap place to get dinner and I saw everyone raving about their fried chicken sandwich so I decided to give it a shot.

We came here because it was on Triple D.  It is in a VERY sketchy area!  There's nowhere to park, so we parked in a parking garage about 4 blocks away.  The walk to the restaurant is not in a very good area at all.  Just keep moving!  The beers were good!  I loved that they make all their condiments!  The food was pretty good too.  We had the chicken fried sandwich & polish dog.  Both were very good.  I think I was expecting a little more from the sandwich because of all the reviews on here.   We also tried the fries and fries with chili & cheese.  The chili was nothing to jump up & down about.

Milkshakes served in mason jars sums up the interior for this place. Well put together but almost over the top hipster. In sharp juxtaposition to the nice interior is the 6th and Mission exterior, which makes sitting on once of the bar facing the outside windows entertaining at best and disturbing at worst. Prices are definitely in line with its hipster-ness. Count on $15-20 if you get a side of fries and drink with your meal.
It was ok. I was expecting better to be honest. I got the wild boar sausage and the fried chicken sandwich.
Ordered it from home and it was delicious. Super cheat for city prices and took less than an hour to arrive

My late night spot for pizza, and I love it. Health score is good (which you can't say for many alternative places around that area). Open till really late, very good prices for absolutely great slices with superb toppings.
Nice, medium thickness crust pizza with decent toppings. 5* for the price at less than 4$ for a big deluxe slice. But would pale in comparison to higher brow pies.
Had the California pizza, was delicious, would definitely recommend it. Staff was extremely nice.

I have never been to a pizza place that refuses to make a cheese pizza. There were no vegetarian options, and all they could do was shrug about it. I don't recommend coming here there are plenty of other places to get food, without the side of attitude.

The pizza here is OK. Definitely not the best pizza I've eaten but decent if one is out of options in TL late at night. Delivery took 60+ minutes. I've had the Milan special (salami, pepperoni, sausage, bell peppers and onions). It wasn't bad but nothing to rave about.

Like many others have said about Milan Pizza, it's may not be the best pizza in the area, but it definitely hits the spot for after hours eating to after a night on the town. Been here on a couple occasions and they've had some pretty good combo slices.  I've tried their Pepperoni with Jalapenos and their Pepperoni with Mushrooms.  Both were pretty solid slices and are pretty comparable to Nizario's.  Overall, not bad and they're open super late till 3am when dining options around the city are pretty limited.

What do I want after closing down a nearby bar?! That's right! Pizza! After numerous cocktails, a group of us came to Milan. Nothing like a huge slice of pizza to soak up all the alcohol! Since there was a group of us, I was able to try 3 different slices:
Our hotel recommended two places for late-night pizza and this was supposedly the better one. So I read a bunch of these reviews first and thought I'd take the gamble...the house won.

Ordered from the first delivery place that popped up on yelp after me and a couple girlfriends stumbled back to our friends place. Ordering was quick and easy, time estimate for our large pizza was 40 minutes.
The guy in the black hat that works here is really funny, the pizza is hella good and make sure to ask for the online coupon large pizza for $10.99, they don't show it to you up front

The guys that work here are great and the pizza is perfect!  If you are looking to have a full belly and be happy from a delightful experience look no further my friend. There are many places to choose from for your pizza needs in this area, but this is THE union square pizza place. If everyone is hungry and you can't decide where to go, then come and stuff yourself with cheesy delicious goodness. You will not be dissapointed!
Mediocre pizza. Lukewarm when it got here.

Had the pep and sausage pizza, little too hard on the crust for my liking.  If it's cracker thin, hard is fine but you can't have a half an inch crust that hard and enjoy bite after bite.  Toppings were good but can't enjoy it with a sore jaw from chewing.
Disclaimer: This is the first review I've ever done, so bear with me. I signed up for a Yelp account just to start reviewing places I think deserve it. And Milan pizza deserves it.
Good place for a slice late night when you're drunk. I went in my pajamas, flip flops, & no make up. No one cared. Perfect
Best good we had in San Francisco! They delivered to the Hilton and it was hot and good. Shove that designer food for a hundred bucks where Taco Bell would be better! Thanks guys!
Came here because of the reviews but was thoroughly disappointed
Really amazing pizza and also very good at room temperature in the morning. I couldn't have been happier with the way this pizza tasted and felt in my mouth.
Morons bring 3.5 star bs. I'm eating this pizza at Clift and people are giving 5 star envious looks. My mouth says 5 stars. Girlfriend says 5 stars. Peace.
I SHOULD NOT HAVE TO BE AFRAID OF THE PIZZA GUY.

Honestly one of the worst pizza experiences I've ever had. How could you go wrong with pizza?!? Called to get a large pizza with 2 toppings delivered to a friends apartment 1.6 miles away and the guy on the phone told me it would take 45 min to an hour. So an hour goes by and still no pizza. The pizza shows up TWO hours later and it's not even warm!!! Idk wth the guy was doing but a pizza should not take 2 hours andd be lukewarm upon arrival. It took so long my friends and I had given up hope on getting a pizza at all! Did the delivery guy stop by a bar or something? Because that was total bs. Never everrrrr ordering pizza from here again.  I'd give no stars if I could.

Hands down one of the WORST pizza places I have EVEER dealt with. After ordering pizza for what I was told a 35-45 minute wait they came after an hour. When the delivery man called me and said he was downstairs waiting for cash I informed him I already gave my cc info over the phone. By the time I went downstairs to get my food he had left. I called the number back for the pizza guy to inform me they lost my cc number. I was willing to give my cc info again but when u called to confirm they didn't have it the man on the phone was VERY rude and said he never got it. Instead of taking my cc # he told me I was wrong & proceeded to hang up on me. I am a meeting planner and as far as I am concerned I will NEVER recommend them
Good food but shitty service they were speaking Arabic talking shit and I speak Arabic and absolutely hate when people do that! If you want good food grab and go!! Worst service alive
hello,
ok - it was late and i wanted pizza. like most folk i understand after hour pizza is a toss-up - a gamble, but you go for it anyway - and hope for the best

Best pizza around! Open late! Halal! Great customer service. Great people. Awesome awesome delicious pizza. Baked fresh  and have pizza by the slice that's also fresh. Nice clean place. Can't recommend it enough!
I was looking for a pizza place downtown that delivered on Sunday and I didn't want Uncle Vito's because their crust is always really soggy.

If you think Blondie's pizza is good, you'll like this. But Blondies is not good, and neither is this. Doughy flavorless crust, undistinguished though slightly spicy tomato sauce, flavorless lowball-quality cheese blend. 2 stars only because if it were the only thing open after a late night I might conceivably eat it.

Great pizza at a little dive restaurant. We are from NY so we know good pizza and this pizza is good! I had the pepperoni and olive slice and it was delicious.  The crust is good and the dough is thick.  Sauce is perfect. Would definitely recommend this pizza to anyone who wants a good slice without the ambiance.

This review is on customer service.  Pizza is decent-nothing special.  Asked worker named Oscar a question about the pizza to which he insulted me for asking,  then cussed at me in a vulgar manner which was quite embarrasing in front of other customers.   I will never come back and i will never refer customers to this establishment.   1st rule of business... Never insult your customers!!

Great customer service and easy ordering online - they even called to make sure it was good. 45 min delivery, super cheap $ bill but food quality was surprisingly good. Pizza + poppers + garlic bread + x2 deserts + tip = 30 bucks
Great Pizza!!! Get the ranch dipping sauce and walk away without spending too much. Its a small place - if your party is big plan accordingly (4+) - no reservation required - show up order and enjoy.
Stopped in here for a slice after getting drinks up the street. Their crusts were nice and thick and the toppings were fresh and piled high. I was pleasantly surprised at how good it was.

Haha damn!! Its been months since I been here.. well what can I say. It was pizzza at 2 in the morning that I happened to stumble upon while I was walking around drunk in SF.  All I remember is they had tapatio and I got a fat slice of pizza for cheap and it was good!
If you think this is good pizza, you 've been seriously missing out. Its a 25% chance that the pizza has correct proportions (to new york pizza, the best american pizza).

Never received my order claimed other customer error. Other customer gave wrong address. Placed order at 0153 called at 0245 told order was out for delivery. Canceled order at 0405. The order was an hour and ten minutes late before eat 24 canceled it. Two hours from placement of order. Apology from eat 24 but no phone call from Milan pizza. Even though brother in law was manager tonight. Thanks

Delicious homemade crust. Can buy by the slice or order what you wish. Friendly speedy service for this local pizza shop. Would recommend for a casual night out or you can order it and they deliver for free!

They were close to the Hilton and I had a pizza craving. They had several trays of pizza out that tempted me. The pepperoni and jalapeño was really good and was my favorite. I also had the pepperoni and pineapple. The toppings and cheese are really good and the slices are huge. The crust is a little thicker than what I prefer and it was pretty hard on the bottom - still good though. The price is right and the staff is friendly. It's a good choice when you pizza and something quick.
Good pizza flavor and great late night delivery ... right to our hotel room door in less than 30 minutes.
Very good service, quick! Everything delicious! Very Clean! Price just right not overpriced everything fresh!
Tried a burrito and a quesadilla on separate occasions, and walked away happy.

My favorite in my proxy! Never too greasy and the salsas are fresh! Love the service fast and friendly.... Chile verde chicken burrito and the flautas are my go to indulgences. Breakfast burritos are tasty and filling:)
Nice tacos, burritos in tenderloin/union square.
The burritos and tacos are decent. Avoid the nachos as they always come out soggy after they microwave it.

Coming down from the Seattle area, this place was calling to me from the moment I noticed it,  across from our hotel!  For $9.16 I got ALL of the food in the picture!   It's excellent value for all this deliciousness!

This is a small taqueria downtown. It does what I need it to do - it gives me fast, quick, pretty hot burritos for relatively (SF prices) cheap. Obviously it would be better if the ingredients were made-to-order rather than buffet style, but then again that would take away from the "fast" aspect that I so desire. So overall, this place is legit. If they eliminated their minimum for credit card processing so I could get points on my dining rewards I would go there even more often.

Great place, authentic food. Fastly made, lost of choises to make. Whether you want chicken or beef and so on... The tables were clean and the floor was suprisingly clean. The only thing is that they don t have a lot of tables for 4.

Was around the area looking for something to eat and we came across this place. Small location , few tables. The variety of burrito sizes varies from regular to super to baby burrito. Wasn't sure exactly what the size difference was from super to baby because they both had the same contents. The burrito was good, they had a variety of meats like al pastor, asada, chicken. Very good burrito. Their horchata drink was bomb!
Visit Date 06/21/2014

Not a bad place, though not exactly the best burrito I've ever had either. It was flavorful and filling though, so that's above-average food in my book. Considering the place looks like a hole in the wall and is located in a notoriously seedy section of San Francisco, I went in with tempered expectations, but went away without any complaints.
I read lotsa reviews before trying it, and yelpers seemed to like it! I got the vegetarian nachos and here was process: Chips on plate. Shredded cheese on chips. Microwave.

Overall the food was good; nothing to write home about, but good. I had a Flautas dinner. I was a bit taken back when the plate came with black beans, but was a cool mix-up. My only negative comment was in watching them prepare my plate, they had to throw the rice and beans into the microwave; I'm sure plenty of places do this but I can see them doing it. Would be nice if they had the rice and beans on the stove slow cooking and soaking up more flavor.
First I am a little biased. Raised in San Diego and spent a lot of time in Mexico. SD/ LA I have a spoiled pallet.

I read dozens of reviews before getting a vegetarian burrito tonight. Let's keep this in perspective - this is generic Mexican food. You can only do so many things with rice, beans, tortillas, etc. It can't be less than 3 stars if you like Mexican food, nor more than 4 stars unless you haven't eaten for a month. My burrito was $7.64, rather a lot for a RBC burrito, but it was freshly prepared in front of me, large, and as tasty as RBC can be.  I may eat here again, but not worthy of a special trip.  A solid 3.

I have been a big fan of Iguanas in San Jose. Beside the mediocre Chipotle, I hadn't been able to find another good place to get burritos until I found El Sol! Their pollo asado is lean and not cooked greasy. Their regular burrito can fill me up all day. It's $6.95. My favorite burrito is rice, black beans, pollo asado, lettuce, and salsa. Simple and yummy!

I really enjoyed my food but my boyfriend didn't care too much for his. I got a vegetarian burrito with pinto beans and green salsa and without sour cream or cheese. The salsa was really tangy and the burrito was warm and delicious and super filling. He got a beef burrito and said that it wasn't bad but he wasn't impressed. The chips were not good though, stale and bland and kinda squished in a weird little plastic bag. We were really tired and hungry and were ready to eat pretty much whatever, but I actually liked my food and I wouldn't mind going back and eating there again.

I have to say I'm extremely disappointed! This place held me down my first yr of law school living in the TL. The prawns burrito was EVERYTHING - I went last week for Fat Tuesday and it was such a waste of calories, it didn't have its usual freshness to it. It also lacked the unique flavors it once had. Also, they raised the price by ALOT. AND the store was pretty dirty from past patrons.

El Sol is my favorite taqueria in this part of the Tenderloin. I prefer it over El Tesoro and La Rosa, which are both nearby. El Tesoro is decent and I know some folks who go there plenty. As for La Rosa, I'd rather eat whatever I can find strewn about on the streets. So naturally, you'll find me ordering a chicken burrito or some nachos at El Sol Taqueria.

Really great regular burrito! It's huge and the meat/rice is seasoned perfectly. Good price too considering the size. Would be giving five stars but for the disappointing chips and salsa. Chips are just generic mission tortilla chips---not warm or cooked in house. Portion of chips is also really paltry (small sandwich bag). The "hot" salsa is pretty mild as well.
Excellent highly recommend plenty of food we were down on our luck and had to panhandle for our food but this was well spent money the best hear Union Square
Food was okay.  Had the super burrito al pastor.  Truth be told have had better.  Not too much flavor.  The salsa for the chips was good.  . Staff was friendly.

Besides being able to practice my Spanish with the workers, they also have an amazing burrito that was both huge and very affordable (especially in SF). One thing I didn't like was the fact that their salsa wasn't really spicy enough for me. The quesadilla was alright but I'd definitely recommend the burrito any day

Ordered the carnitas and beef tacos from El Sol. The tortillas were so soggy I couldn't pick up the tacos, which were really too huge for tacos. My friend got the nachos, which actually looked much more appetizing. Given the amount of delicious, authentic Mexican food in the Bay Area, I doubt I'll try this place again.
Tasty food and friendly staff. I get my lunch here every couple of days. I'm not a connoisseur, I just like burritos!

This place is less than a block from me and when I was craving Mexican, I decided to give this place a try.  It was good Mexican for decent price!  I ordered the dinner chicken enchiladas and it came with 2 enchiladas, refried beans, rice, lettuce, salsa, guac (didn't charge extra for this), and sour cream.  It ran me around $14 with tax, which is pretty pricey for one person but since the entree was so large, it made sense.  They also give you free chips & salsa which adds a nice touch to things.

I seriously love this place. I have a pepper allergy, but love mexican food, which is a problem. They go out of their way to make sure I can eat what I want. Went in last night for a shrimp burrito, and it was incredible. All it was was shrimp, cilantro, onions, refried beans, guac, sour cream, and cheese and it was unreal. Each ingredient is so flavorful you don't need to get all crazy.

Tired of bridesmaid dress shopping, we almost went to Colibri down the street. Thank GOD we walked out of there before paying $17 for an empanada because El Sol has delicious meat, a variety of it, and I think the four of us payed $17 for all our food. Which left more money for beer....and a dollar for the homeless man that poked his head in.

AMAZING prawn burrito (my husband and I make a point to visit their Dos Amigos location on Brannan every time we're in SF..tried this location for the first time last week - burrito tastes identical).  Kind of pricey ($8) if you can finish one by yourself...but they're big so we always manage to split one.  A handful of small tables inside.  Complimentary chips & salsa (teeny tiny portion).
Once in a while, I'd order their super quesadilla, which I used to love. Well, i still do, but it shrinked in size almost double and this fact I don't really like.

I decided to walk to work today instead of getting the bus and passed by this place. They had a sign outside advertising breakfast burritos, so I decided to give it a try. There was actually no sign of a breakfast burrito on the menu board, but they do have it. I must say it was one of the tastiest breakfast burritos I've had in a long time.
Disappointing. I got the super quesadilla, which was small and not all that tasty. And it was quite expensive.
food is pretty good,

I am not an expert on Mexican food, and know nothing about the standards in San Francisco since I am just a tourist, but I just came back from this place and the  food was great. I had a delicious Super Quesadilla and a very refreshing Horchata. The only reason I am not giving this place 5 stars is because the service wasn't the "friendliest".
Awesome hole in the wall. Only four tables to sit at but we didn't have a problem walking in and snagging one. Truly authentic mexican food. Corona or Modela to choose from.
My cousin let my mom have a bite of her burrito and from then on my mom has been asking me to get her one.
This isn't the taqueria you go out of your way to dine at. El Sol taqueria is small about four tables and there food is edible while the service comes with a smile.
This place has really grown on me.  Consistent and tender, they're always there for me (well, except for before 10 am).
Food poisoning..... Do I need to say more?
How do you soak up a dozen free colonial punches and ginger snaps?  Tacos.
Why Mangosteen has received less than 4 stars is beyond me.

Not half bad! The beef pho I had was pretty good but the beef itself was kinda chewy. Also, my parties food came out at all different times.  Moderate prices and semi-friendly staff for a decent experience, especially for a place like the tenderloin.

Great portions.  Veggie options were good, but it's kind of hard to tell what kind of food you're going to get.  They list the ingredients and a single adjective to describe the sauce, but everything I've gotten from here is good.

Mangosteen is the name of a tropical fruit with a fibrous and tough purple skin, inside are segmented, milky white, sweet, flesh surrounding brown seed per segment.  Mangosteen is the name here of a popular Vietnamese restaurant in the Tenderloin district.  The ingredients are super fresh and the dishes are very affordable.  There are lunch specials and phos, salads, rice dishes, rice noodle dishes and soups.
Best beef cubes, EVER. Friendly service, which is rare to find at Vietnamese restaurants.
The first few times I went here, it was a good experience. Fresh vegetables, good service and a pretty good atmosphere.
Small Vietnamese restaurant along the edge of the loin, some charm and definately worth a visit!
The pan fried noodles are ok, and so so taste.
Had my first experience with bun bo hue today here- it was fantastic!

I always love Pho and try different Vietnamese restaurants everywhere. This is our second time checking in; first time the food was mediocre and so was the service; this time, the food is unsurprisingly mediocre but the service is degraded to Horrible.....seriously.

This place is easily the best Vietnamese food in San Francisco!!!! I have tried many places and none compare to the quality, flavors, and prices at Mangosteen. The owners are always very very nice and professional. I could go on and on about the food but my favorites are the beef garlic noodles with lemon grass and the Bon bo hue! They also do a very nice iced coffee and lemonade.
Their bun bo hue and bun rieu are the only dishes that I order every time I come here. They are always consistent. Their ban xeo is really good too.

Hands down my fave place to go for a quick lunch near the office.  It's cheap, SUPER FAST, and the pho is extremely delicious.  You know noodle soups are the bomb when you just feel it all emanating from your pores when you eat.  I eat and moan and sweat and then go back to work.  Bam.

So far the best bun bo hue in the city. Broth was very nice and did not appear to have as much if any msg. Generous portions and very good pricing as well. Veggies include banana blossom which you won't find often in a lot of Viet restaurants and complimented the soup nicely. I would have given 5 stars if the traditional pig knuckle/feet was included.

My friend brought me here for lunch after trying to explain bun Bo hue to me and I just wasn't getting it. Well ... we got it and now I get it!  Ridiculously flavorful broth, good sized chunks of tasty beef and the best shrimp balls and fish cake I've ever tried. The stuff is awesome and can't wait to get back there.

A place worth craving! Staff is friendly and accommodating. Food is great. I recommend lemongrass chicken, tamarind prawns, and garlic noodles. It may be a little pricier than other Vietnamese places nearby, but the ingredients are very fresh and the preparation is delicious.

Bo luc lac! Say it! Bo... luc... lac... Eat it! With garlic noodle! Now you are plussed. Tip good, the food came fast! Now go home. You don't want to hang around if this is not your neighborhood. But you will be back. Bo luc lac!

Nice interior. It's good to see they don't push around bussing carts and our waitress was nice today. My experience with service in the past left a sour taste in my mouth so I don't come here often. Now that I've tried them out again today, can't say I'm all that impressed with the food either.

Good Vietnamese where you'd expect good Vietnamese.  The soup was good but I especially liked the grilled eggplant - delicious charred flavor and you can put the eggplant in your soup!  Delish!  If you're willing to brave it, this is a little oasis and def worth it.  Open till 10

I have been coming here for years and absolutely love this place!
