Everything here is pretty good but if you had to try only one thing, do yourself a favor and order the Filet Mignon with Garlic Noodles. It's my boyfriend's fave dish as well and he gets excited every time I mention that I'm in the city about to pick up some Mangosteen for dinner. I've pretty much tried everything on the menu (pho, bun rieu, bun bo hue, etc) and really like all the dishes. Can't go wrong with this place!

Had the bo luc lac filet mignon with potatoes, broccoli, and rice. The staff was nice and the food came out quickly. The beef was tender and the potatoes were especially delicious. The broccoli brought good balance to the dish. I could only finish half at the restaurant and had the rest later that night.
Been coming here since my first year of law school!
I love here!
Came here because we were going to the symphony to watch Colors of Christmas and it was located nearby. We were a party 7, so we were ordered a bunch of dishes
Our original plans were not to eat here, but since the place we wanted to eat had a wait we settled to eat here.

A quite saturday night in the a restaurant gives a bad sign of the food, but since it was recommended by a friend had to try it.  The Pho Ga was very good... not much chicken in the soup but the pieces taste not like frozen big chicken but like farm grow or similar. The broth was quite light and authentic flavor of chicken, the noodle was quite smooth and good texture.  There is not an after flavor of dryness that a the msg gives, so I assume they did not put much on it.  I still need to try the garlic noodle and the fillet mignon, I for sure will come again to try that

One of my favorite places for pho. I also really like the cubed filet mignon. Reasonable prices too. The quality of the food here is great. I always like coming here for lunch or dinner. I bring my friends here a lot and everyone always enjoys the food.
What happens when the wait at turtle tower or whatever is too long?  You walk around and you go to the place without a line.

Did something change?  I used to love this place five years ago. Clean, location next to Lee's for after pho snacks...  I've been several times recently to try various soups and it's just not doing it for me anymore.
Really good!
Very fresh and tasty Vietnamese food served in the southern style, tastes just like the food I ate when in Vietnam.
Came here today for the first time with a bunch of friends. Service was good despite us being pretty loud in the restaurant. Can't speak for the Pho, but the Bun Rieu was pretty damn good.

We were in the Tenderloin and decided to try this place.  We always pass by but never came in to eat.  Although I was always curious about this place as it never seemed to have a full house.  Came in and was welcomed by a friendly waitress.  I had the Bbq Pork with Spring Rolls Cold Rice Noodles and my bf had the Bun Bo Hue.  Everything was plated very nicely and was so yummy!!!  I had a taste of the broth from the bun bo hue and it was very tasty!  Wasn't overwhelmed with spiciness at all! Loved it cause I can still taste all the other flavors.  I really liked how they had the spring roll included in the cold noodles. Other places I had to add it on for an extra charge.  Reasonable price, good service, delicious food! Will definitely be back:)
This is another restaurant that is overrated by yelpers.  We came with tons of expectations but left with disappointments.  I would say they serve Americanized Vietnamese food.

Holy crap, the garlic noodles and filet are the best meal I've had in ages. Location isn't the greatest (TL), but it makes up for it with the food. The pho is OK but the noodles are where it's at. New favorite place for a Vietnamese fix.

Go to  lunch spot  right in the heart of Little Saigon on Larkin.  Nothing fancy or pretentious, just good service, fair prices. Spicy beef soup a winner, noodle plates and five spice chicken were all good.Not really a destination, but if you are in the area check it out. The ladies who run the place are very friendly. Saw a lot of Vietnamese there, that is usually a good sign.
The prices! The quality! The filet mignon cubes!

May not be the fanciest restaurant in San Francisco but remember your at a restaurant to eat, not for things to look pretty. Everything else is just a caveat in my opinion. Food is delicious, I had two separate entrees there. Great service and no hassle on how long you need to take to put in a order and they don't rush you to leave like a traditional American business. Check 'em out!

Lots of vietnamese options in this little part of sf, but Mangosteen is a step above most in the quality and presentation.  It's nice that their prices are still very reasonable.  Good size portions, tasty and nice staff.

Yeah, there's a lot of Vietnamese restaurants in this neighborhood.  This is the one at the end that I started looking from.  Unlike most of the Vietnamese restaurants nearer my home, this one's menu is light on the pho, and offers a lot more in other entrees than pork-chop rice plates.  I ordered fish in a clay pot.  Slices of fish with bones, very much in the Asian non-prettied-up style, sauce dark but less spicy than I'd expected.  Not wildly good, but I ate it all and was satisfied.  I was warned it would take 20 minutes, but I had a lot of time, and it certainly took no longer than that.

What a little hidden gem! We love it. Shared the eggs benedict and french toast between two of us, excellent comfort food and value! Not your fine dining establishment of course but cute atmosphere with red checked table cloths and wooden chairs :)

If it hadn't been for my friend who suggested dining here, I'd have walked right by Little Henry's. No doubt back in the last century, while still a starving dilettante at varsity, I'd have been a regular patron. Cheap eats, $40/day, etc., this little restaurant certainly aligns with that theme. This unofficial briefing room of the SFPD is good cheap eats and you will certainly leave with enough for lunch or dinner the following day. This is one of the quirky little places that are becoming more difficult to find, for better or for worse. The chicken parm and carbonara we ordered were both tasty.
Oh my god so terrible. I went with 6 people and all of their dishes were a fail. It's an Italian restaurant owned by an elderly Asian couple.
Yelp review says "Yes" for delivery.  Delivery not actually available
Came here just today and...
TRANSGENDERED DISGUST
OK...so gary danko it ain't!     First time back since the remodel....simple breakfast..
I find that little henry's always gives me more food than I can eat especially considering the prices they are charging for their delicious food.
I can sum up the food here pretty easily...yuck.  It really was lacking in every way.  No flavor to the spaghetti. Not sure what the "meat" was in the sauce.

There's something not right about Asians making Italian food... Because it isn't italian food! Please do not order any seafood from here, it is cheap quality imitation seafood not the real stuff. Chicken Parmesan sandwich was the only thing edible I had ordered. Also- it's cash only and the ATM is outside the restaurant.... Walk across the street and use the atm at the liquor store which is INSIDE.
Worst restaurant I've been to in memory. All of the food is of very poor quality. I couldn't finish my entree it was so bad.

My family and I have been coming to Little Henry's for about 20 years and I can honestly say many good things about this restaurant. Their food is delicious, it always keeps me coming back. Their service is awesome and super kind. The prices are amazing for great portions!
I really like Henry and his wife. They are friendly, put in long hours and are very hard working. Also very funny.
The food is disgusting! Ordered red sauce linguine, and the pasta was slimy, the sauce was full of charred black flakes FROM THE PAN, and the whole dish tasted like IRON... utterly disgusting.

I LOVE LH's. From the first time I got take out to the most recent time where I dined in. Everything about LH's is amazing. I get one thing and one thing only. Spaghetti with meat sauce and mushrooms. Mushrooms and sauce are made to order. The thing about this dish is that it reminds me of my mom's homemade spaghetti. There is something about it, the taste or the spices, that hit close to home. Prices are great for a large portion of food.
My brother turned me on to Henry's many years ago and I will always be grateful.

Good food, huge portions and low prices. The portions of spag Bol are so big, they will leave you a broken man. The eggs Benedict is really good as well. An all round great place if you are on a budget.
They had a fire in the kitchen around November 20th 2013, as of 1/6/2014 they are still closed . They have nothing on the windows to say they will re-open.
***DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME & MONEY HERE***

wait a minute, kapeng napakainit - Little Henry's is definitely NOT a 4 star restaurant.  to most food critics, this might even be a 1 or 2 star restaurant but to me it's a place that serves good food, great portions, and an even greater price.
I really wanted to like this place, especially for the kindly-looking people in the newspaper article.  I like to see small businesses be successful.
I was going the wrong way and ended up here but after eating here, I'm sure I was going the right way.
Little Henry's is a surprisingly chill place--and more professional than I would have thought.

This place is exactly as advertised:  large portions of home cooked italian food for very little money.  I had the spaghetti and meatballs which came with a free side of italian bread for under $9.  Added a glass of red wine for a total bill of $13.25 with tax!  The food is basically what you could make at home, but I don't see that as a negative.  If it is late and you want cheap italian comfort food this is the place!
This place is the bomb, and anyone who says otherwise probably isn't particularly cool ;)

If portion control is an issue for you, yeah, I wouldn't come here. If an artful presentation is important to you, just keep moving on. But if you're looking for no-frills comfort food that probably would have suited Ralph Kramden's palate after Alice kicked him out of their cold water flat for yelling "To the moon, Alice!", then this is the old-school greasy spoon with your name on it. I've passed by Little Henry's hundreds of times never thinking of going in because I figured it was just a soup kitchen for the homeless despite the promise of Italian food on its signage (photo:

These guys are great. We are here tonight for the first time and the service was very friendly and I got  spaghetti with meatballs which I loved.  My friend had a pesto pasta and agreed that it was top shelf.  I highly recommend this place for a tasty, affordable meal.

Bomb ass food! I come here 1-2 times a month. Never ever have I been disappointed. Always friendly services. I guess it makes a difference when it's a family run business. They care about their food and customers!

This place has all the Italian favorites at a great price! The services is quick and so far my order is always made right, they haven't messed one up yet! Plus, they deliver something besides PIZZA! They seem to be kind of protective of their bread though, so ask for more sourdough with caution!

I'm tossing 5 stars to Little Henry's because what I've had there is doggone good and it's truly affordable, in fact, it's a super deal.  It's a hole in the wall kind of place and I love that the menu is American/Italian and cooked and served by a Vietnamese owner and staff, Kudos.  I had the cheeseburger last week and I won't even mention the price, but the price compares to a kids school lunch in the cafeteria.  The burger was good meat cooked the way I like with a melted slice of American cheese.  The bun was a toasted French roll and there was toamto, lettuce and white onion to add to the burger.  There was also a handful of pretty good fries.  I'm going back to keep trying their menu, I love this place.

Wow, glad we found this place. Lots of locals here and with good reason. A cute little dive, very clean, and staff that pays attention to details. The food was awesome, prices unbelievably affordable, and the cooks were really into what they were making. All in all one of the best eating experiences we had in San Fran. Don't expect fancy or pretentious.
Yes, the portion is big, but the taste is so-so.  They do not take a credit card.  The ATM outside charge you fee.  Make sure to bring cash.
how r u goes the lil vietnamese restaurant chef/owner that churns out italian fare
All four of us had excellent dinners, friendly servers and cook, went back a second time. Plenty of food and very accommodating. Loved it.
Came in on Wednesday November 21st, 2012 - and sat down where I was promptly met by the wait staff.

Large portions at a decent price, but if you're looking for an italian restaurant to really satisfy your pasta craving, I wouldn't suggest this place. They start you off with a basket of bread; my friend and I ordered the clams linguine and chicken parmaggiano, both of which were a little on the bland side for me.

BEST italian by a asian dude! Might look weird from the outside but don't let it fool you. Super cheap to, I get the alferdo and it comes with soup or salad plus bread for about 7.50. The pasta comes with so much I have never finished it! Give it a try!

Fantastic homey kind of place to go for a delicious, inexpensive quick meal. The employees are friendly and accommodating as ever! Also they have special meals for Holiday's, for those of us who haven't got that family dinner to go to.

Love their chicken parmigiana, the chicken itself is huge - the size of the plate, comes with a side of steamed vegetables, pasta, soup or salad and bread.  I love their clam chowder and minestrone soup!  All this will cost you a little less than $10 out the door (take out). AWESOME, definitely bang for your buck when coming here.  Don't expect anything fancy and you'll be fine.  The owners/ waitresses are always very friendly, they do have a number of regulars dining here.   Service is also quick too :)  When ordering take out, it takes about 10minutes!
Love this place..its right my my house so i can walk over any time!
You know this place is authentically Japanese right down to the font on its menu. Seriously good ramen for San Francisco. I was in Tokyo last month so my bar is sitting pretty high right now.
this place was surprisingly really nomsies!

The joint is most likely frequented by art students on a budget or lost tourists. We went to Fujiyoshi for a quick bowl of ramen when we were in a pinch. It's nothing to write home about, the ramen choices are standard and the Tonkotsu broth is thin and all broken-up.

I would say this place has one of the most authentic ramen that is pretty close to what you can get in Japan without getting overcharged. Sashimi platter is awesome here and a lot cheaper than other Japanese restaurants around. Overall, it's nice food, decent priced, casual enough to just hop in. Sometimes when they are busy tho, the food is ready at the counter but servers don't pay attention to that, that annoys the heck out of me, if you are expecting hot ramen that is right from the kitchen. The timing of serving ramen is so critical that they should never ever let it sit at the kitchen counter to be served.

Ordered tonkatsu ramen. It was not great--egg was cold, broth was stinkier than it should have been. Other foods people ordered look nicer and tastier so I would come back to try...Really disappointed by the ramen though
I've gotten ramen twice from this place. It's a perfect spot to visit on a cold evening - a short walk from Union Square and my current apartment.

Please find yourself a better ramen restaurant.. So called homemade GYOZAS were under cooked, 1/5 was actually still raw. And serving near raw pork is definitely a health violation. Did not even offer to remake all five but only the undercooked ones..
Salmon teriyaki is pretty gross. Kids liked the pot sticker and chicken katsu.  Rest of combo dishes are not up to par either.

Came here for lunch with 2 other friends.  They had only one server and she could have worked with more of a sense of urgency, but she was kind and refilled our waters whenever they were empty.  The tonkotsu ramen I ordered was excellent - perfect broth, nice texture on the thin noodles, and the egg was delicious.  The gyoza are hand made and I ordered those and they were good too.  I could see how service could improve here, but for food, it was good enough.
Came here with colleagues for lunch break and waited for ridiculously long...even with not many people in the restaurant at all.
Fujiyoshi Ramen is a popular ramen place on the edge of the Tenderloin and Nob Hill neighborhoods which serves traditional-style Japanese ramen.

I started coming here a few months ago, and it has quickly turned into a favorite.  I'm not ashamed to admit to eating here multiple times a week most weeks.  For me, it's the spicy miso ramen that keeps bringing me back, but their other izakaya food is always good too (especially recommended is their tamagoyaki, and also the fried rice.)  The husband/wife owners are incredibly nice and hard working.  I should probably try to keep this place a secret, but what's the fun in that?
This place is not even worthy of 1 star.

I think this is the closest ramen spot to me, so I go here out of convenience more so than anything else. I'd hope that the ramen shines, since it's in the name of the restaurant, but it's average at best. Close to no pork, not many other additions either. The fried rice is a mine field of chopped onions which I've never seen before the thousands of other times I've had fried rice. Gyoza was average as well. A generous 3 stars here.
I think that this is what people mean when they say in their know it all tones that they have the "best" and "most authentic" place to go for... whatever..

We ordered spicy tonkotsu ramen and shio ramen. But it came out as spicy shio and regular tonkotsu ramen.( they mixed up our order) so I told them that they got it wrong. But they told us that their original soup looks different everyday so it is right. .....??? Well, we all are Japanese from Japan and we know what tonkotsu ramen taste like.... they didn't taste it before they serve dishes to us but we tased both and those were  definitely wrong.  They don't even know what they are serving? It was very interesting experience.

Our first eatery on our trip! We were pleasantly surprised overall, the server was nice enough but I think he was new, didn't know about certain ingredients and didn't bother to find out which probably hurt him in the long run because I was willing to order new things! We were the only people in the restaurant too! Otherwise, the food was great! We ordered the shoyu ramen, which was good and huge, I just would have preferred more chicken in it. We also shared a seaweed salad and dragon roll. The dragon roll was absolutely impeccable!
The ramen is very tasty, authentic with typical over salted soup that rises hypertension risk. But who can resist it? The green tee ice cream is a beautiful plus!
I was pleasantly surprised by how good this place was. With ramen becoming so popular, I thought it would be another dud, especially since nothing has measured up since I went to Japan last year.

Ok bottom line. I get very tired of people who write opinions on Yelp that are not qualified. If you dont think this is amazing ramen you dont know Ramen. I am a ramen expert. I have been to Underground, Santa, Kata Ya, Santuka, I lived in Tokyo for 2 yrs and I can tell you this is top level ramen. Spicy miso and or the Tonkasu is amazing. Boiled pork melts in your mouth. Also Underground might be as good  but so hard to get in there at peak times. Fuji is great lower nob hill option.

Immaculate restaurant,  perfect service (and Im really picky about service), great food...all the way around an enjoyable experience. The  owner/manager is awesome, greeting and thanking every customer as they come and go. While my personal experience has been limited to ramen, fried rice and chicken tempura its all been delicious. I havent been able to find one thing about this place I dislike.

Oh my god we went here after getting denied (well..a long long wait-denied) and I don't want too many people to know about it b/c it's SO GOOD.  Delicious Ramen - I asked if they make the broth every day (they do - my papa had a Ramen Shop in Union City) - and the space was huge and charming, super excellent service and the ramen - DELICIOUS!!!

Pretty good that I went twice while on vacation! Nice option to add extras like pork belly (which was sweet and tender) to my Ramen. Ordered extra noodles but felt bloated afterwards. Would definitely recommend.
I love Fujiyoshi!
Tried the miso ramen, i've only tried to bowls of ramen in my life, so i am not an expert. But for first timers it isnt a good experience

Horrible Ramen taste !!! Don't go!!! I came her with my friends and we got the worst ramen taste and experience!!! We don't recommended at all this place and they include the service 20% that's not fair since the food is terrible. We found excessive the amount for the service and the price for the food as well.
I had a Tori-ten that some of my friends recommended, it was soooooooooo good!!! I also had a ramen and rated it was the best ramen in SF!!
Not sure why all the mixed reviews but this place is highly underrated for ramen!

I tried this place for the first time a couple of days ago for a lunch. A friendly staff with a nice smile greeted and I didn't have to wait to be seated. Well, it was a bit before noon, and it seemed that they just opened to start lunch service. Anyhow, I waited for a while to get my order, but it wasn't that long yet to bother me anything. However, when my bowl of ramen was ready and the wait staff with a nice smile was busy with other customers, I thought that noodle will be saggy... Well, it was a good thing that I ordered "KATAME", or Italians say Al Dente.

The world has gone mad when people are willing to wait three hours for an $8 bowl of ramen. That's what happened at the Ramen Yokocho Festival a couple of weekends back. After all, if ramen aficionados are willing to get all Soylent Green about heir noodles and broth, then there's probably room for a place like Fujiyoshi. I think there is sincerity in the approach here, and I give them points for opening on the edge of the Tenderloin where it's more likely competing with the family-run pho houses in the neighborhood. The first impression is good. It's a long galley of a place with roomy booths and bigger tables in the back (photo:
We came because my husband refused to wait an hour for another sushi place. Do not order sushi here or you will be deeply disappointed. For $13/roll I expected more sustenance. Deeply. Disappointed.

On our walk home on our last night in SF after an early meal at State Bird Provisions, we wanted to fit in one more meal before heading back to Canada and saw this gem on our yelp radar for ramen. Checking other reviews out, we thought we'd give it a shot with some takeout(I know, not the best way to sample ramen, but we were tired and just wanted to share one bowl). We ordered the spicy maze-ramen(soupless soba style), decided against a combo because they wouldn't let us pick a special curry as the combo curry). It was about an hour to closing, it was pretty empty with one table being served then and our takeout was ready quickly. Walked over to our friend's place where we were staying nearby and wow we were pleasantly surprised by how addictive it was with the spicy sauce and oil it came with separately. So addictive, we called in 10 min to pick up another one. Sadly they forgot the spicy sauce on the second one but we still enjoyed it. Would love to go back for their traditional miso ramen. Give this gem a shot!

I passed by this place often and finally gave it a try after reading yelp reviews. I had kotteri tonkotsu for lunch. The place was not full and the server was attentive. The soup was thick and rich as warned on the menu. Overall, it was not bad but I was not overwhelmed either.

People need to know this place is awesome. I joined yelp so I could rave about this place. Delicious, affordable ramen with a full Japanese menu. Feels like Japan and you know its as authentic as it gets with the Japanese clientele. A welcome addition to the neighborhood.

My boyfriend and I are always looking for new gems in the city and this is one! We were here over 4th of July weekend, so I think we lucked out with no crowd! My boyfriend had one of the Ramen's, delicious. The noodles were perfect, the broth was so rich and flavorful.  I had the gyoza, which was tasty!
Best ramen I've had in sf so far....no one knows it yet so come before the masses do!

We came here thinking it was the sushi restaurant of days past not knowing the place had changed hands. I was excited to try the ramen while the husband stuck to sushi.  I had the spicy miso pork ramen, which was pretty decent . I completely missed the fact they had a tray of condiments (like fried onions) for the ramen right at the table.  The sushi was fresh and my husband was happy with it.
Really good Tempura chicken, damn good!

I'm really disappointment w/food. When this restaurant used to use a name as KYU. It was really great. Once I have been here last 4days ago. I ordered miso ramen the bowl was like they describe and it made me come back again and order the same one, but they had something which weren't the same as I ordered from last time. So what is the pattern of the food in each order?
It felt like Spicy miso is good but curry rice is pretty bad. Chef may as well have wiggle room.

When I came in for breakfast, the place seemed very clean. The seats were comfortable. The food selection was more than your typical. There were many options to choose from. The service was fast and polite. I asked for some adjustments such as no cheese and to switch some of the sides and there was no problem at all. The ingredients in the food seemed very fresh because they were full of flavor. The fruit was ripe and not frozen. The orange juice was fresh squeezed from ripe flavorful oranges. What can I say? This place is a hidden gem in the Union Square area.

The food here is great and the prices are very reasonable. I had a grilled fish dinner and my friend had 2 pork chops with fresh vegs - very good. It's a great place to go after shopping in Union Square or going to the theatre. They have large booths and a good variety of food on their menu. I have been here before for the crab and shrimp croissant sandwich and it is's fabulous!

I just had a forgettable but okay burger, commodity basic string French fries and ok service.  The place seems perfectly fine in a forgettable sort of way. Next time, I'll try breakfast. Nothing bad about my meal. Nothing great about it either. Thus I come up with three stars.
Riin our server is great !!! Mason burger was delicious. Profiteroles need to be crispier but were good. Play night so there busy. Eaten here before usually good food and service.

Had a shrimp and crab melt. Thought it was average. The croissant was flaky so that's good. We had a huge party 16 people and they were pretty accommodating and wait wasn't long. Price was average. Decent place.

Daniel, THANK YOU for responding to my review by asking what more you could have done to improve my experience- you did it with your attention! I will come in again with your question in mind because right now what I remember is that the soup was lovely and the service pleasant and quick- all my needs were met !  (That said, a small dollop of creme fraiche on the soup would be nice..)

Came in with a party of four at about 11 or 12 p.m. on Sunday night. I had a small appetizer and hot chocolate. Most of you would love the hot chocolate because it's made with Ghirardelli, which is awesome. I had ordered the buffalo wings which had good seasoning and flavor. My guests had the calamari which they thought was mediocre. They've eaten a lot of calamari and said that the flavor and breading of the calamari wasn't very good compared to what they've tried before at other places. I would have given a 3 or 4 star to this place if it weren't for the service. It wasn't that it was bad, I could tell that she appeared to have too many tables and that's what it seemed was slowing her down. There was a busboy but I think the service could have been improved if there was one more person on the floor.
2 and a half stars would be the right rating for this place.
Great breakfast or drinks after spot. Service at the counter is good, dining room so-so
Freshly squeezed orange juice and fresh corned beef hash. Would definitely come back if I ever made it back to San Fran!

We celebrated our daughter's 17th birthday with a wonderful dinner experience at Cafe Mason last night. Our waitress, Riin, was delightful, and the food delicious. I had the Gnocci Au Fungi which was absolutely amazing. And they presented our daughter with a Happy Birthday Tirimisu! We are so glad we stumbled upon this excellent restaurant. We will be back!

The place was completely empty when we went in around 3:30 to get a quick bite to eat. Our waitress was soft spoken, but was very friendly and attentive. The service was great! We ordered quickly and our food came right out.
We went for dinner with friends. Very fair prices for downtown, but nothing fancy.
My wife and I are visiting SF for the weakened and stopped here on the recommendation of our hotel concierge.

This place gets 2 stars because the food appears to be pretty bad. Admittedly it was very late and we had been boozing all night after Oracle Openworld but overall pretty disappointed. I ordered some wine and a plate of fries. The fries were overcooked and really not enjoyable, even after copious amounts of alcohol. I mean, how hard is it to make French fries???
Can't expect too much from late night eating, the food was disgusting !
Fun.

If you want to experience St. Helena, this is an excellent breakfast spot.  It's very cafe style in the middle of downtown St. Helena.  It was clean, quick, tasty and had great service.  I had an egg white omelette with salmon that was delicious.

Café Mason opens at 6 am which was about the time my girlfriend and I got real hungry from our late night activities.  The location was convenient, the food fine, and the service fast.  We were one of the first patrons there though so I assume service would be slower as the crowds grew.  The only downside was perhaps the passing homeless that would stare through the large glass windows.  One friendly bum actually startled my girlfriend by getting too close to the window.  He extended his hand as if we could magically transport 1 of the two salmon eggs benedict through the window into his hands.  Had he stayed around, we'd have given it to him but he was nowhere to be seen once we left.

This place was just a block away from our hotel, so it was the perfect choice to feed our hungry tummies after a really long night of exploring San Francisco. Service was quick and efficient, and the food was good. I had the smoked salmon eggs Benedict which is one of my favorites to order for breakfast, and Cafe Mason did not disappoint. I also thought it was a nice touch that they gave me a whole teapot for my green tea instead of just a single mug of hot water. My companion had some sweet crepes which were presented nicely and tasted good.
I came here at 3 am. The waitress was really nice. The food looked really homemade and it wasnt bad. They even let us stayed for 5 hours!

I do not like getting monster portions of food, so I was happy to see on the posted menu that I could order one pancake, and then add on some meat protein. And, I saw that they sell real maple syrup - worth it, but kind of sad that they don't just offer it as a way to differentiate themselves from all the other breakfast options around them. My waitress, Leah, was cheerful and quick.
Good location- if you are in a hurry, good choice.   Food is average.  Service is good but not great.  Reminds me of a really nice "diner".  I had a salad and it was fine-

I ordered the eggs Benedict with crab meat. Hours later I found myself barfing everything else. The dish was a little fishy and I should had known better than to order anything with seafood as a place like this.

I've been coming here for quite some time, yet I will never return and nether should you. The  manger Rein is rude  and when faced with a problem resorts to looks of disdain and condescension instead of looking for an solution to save a long time customer. Simply put do not go here go to Pinecrest across the street.

Decent quality food, can be quite busy and so you're lucky to get a table for the busiest times of the day. Both times I've been I've sat at the bar - the Irish Eggs Benedict was pretty good, but the tortillas/enchiladas were bland yet filled me up.

We were pleasantly surprised by this very good restaurant. Service is very good and the food we had was great. We liked the burger and Thai salad we had at lunch so much we came back a day later for dinner. We had the chicken piccata  and the chicken Jerusalem tonight and enjoyed the dinner. Service and food were excellent. Portions are good and prices very fair.

Walked in to this place at about 10:15 on a Friday night. I didn't want to sit at the first booth next to the door so I politely asked the hostess if we could please sit at a table in the main part of the room. She said okay but when we finally got to the table she slammed down menus and walked off. Umm...thanks? It should have been the first red flag but for some reason I held on to hope that this place would be a hidden gem.
Came in, couldn't get service, left. Walked two stores down to Lori's. Didn't regret it.

We were staying at the Hilton around the corner and came here twice for breakfast rather than the overpriced hotel food.   Both visits were more than acceptable......seated quickly, pretty good service.  Other posts noted that their staffing isn't great but both times we had the same server and she was pretty attentive.  Coffee right away and the food was good,  I had the Eggs Benedict Florentine the first visit and the second visit an omelette.   Both solid if unspectacular.   Their whole grain toast was good.  The side dish selection was a little confusing.  My friend had the frittata which was excellent.....there are several diners on that block but this one is a good choice.
Coffee Undrinkable
Not the best restaurant in San Francisco but it is a cool restaurant open 24/24 with meals like at home So that cool

The only bummer about this place is that we stayed in town for five days before eating here! Expansive menu, convenient location and open late aside - the food is just plain good. Do yourself a favor and try the gnocchi - it's delicious and better than I've had at any "authentic" Italian restaurant. Chill atmosphere that feels cozy but noticeably clean, with some great artwork an unexpected and pleasant surprise. Highly recommended...at any time of day or night!

I would only dine here after a night out when not many restaurants are open. There's comfy booth seating and many tables so it's good for groups as well as couples. The waitress is friendly, but it took a long time to get our bill. The chicken frittata was mediocre as the chicken was super dry. The home potato fries were decent though. Most other tables ordered fries and sandwiches/burgers which looked appetizing. Think of Denny's diners.

5 stars for their Vegetable Frittata and Swedish Pancakes. 3 star for the service. The waiter wasn't particularly friendly and he kept forgetting to bring things we asked for. But, the food was great so I'd definitely go back when we are back in town.
I was visiting San Francisco and this was next to our hotel.  The fruit on my breakfast plate wasn't fresh and I felt the place is overpriced.
Don't be fooled by the run down exterior- this place is a hidden gem! Our server Hope gave us a very warm and pleasant welcome and was very attentive right through the meal.

Simple casual diner - great option for folks in the Hilton Union Square with families. We had a burger, a sandwich, and pasta. All of it was tasty. Service was good, and the casual atmosphere was great.

Had a great breakfast here on our last day in the city. Service was excellent and the food was great! The wife's Benedict didn't come out with the rest of the food. Our waitress apologized, we said it wasn't a big deal. It came a little bit later. They took it off the bill anyway!
Shrimp and Crab Cakes Lunch entree is to die for! Chorizo Quesadillas were also very good. Great place. Medium ambiance, not too loud, good service.

Ordered the seasonal spicy chai latte. It definitely wasn't lacking in spice...it was almost abrasive. But I needed something warm and hearty and it did the trick. Do I wish I had ordered something else? Yes.

Ordered online from their website, a special latte and a special order breakfast burrito. They got everything right and it was warm and ready when I got there! I just started working up the street and someone told me about the breakfast burritos here at Spiro's (since I made some chorizo egg burritos for the office) these are so authentic with the beans being soft and perfectly mashed but still with enough texture. The rice flavorful and just enough of it to know it is there. Then delicious scrambled eggs with finely (read: precisely) chopped onions, tomato and bell pepper that rivals my moms. Yes, my moms!  I'm super impressed.

Came here for a latte and decided to grab a bite as well.  We had the egg and cheese croissant sandwich which was good as you can ask for.  The croissant was really fresh.  We also had the grilled cheese sandwich. I'd say it was very plain...I've definitely had a lot better.   Latte was good.  If I was in the city again I wouldn't mind coming back for the croissant sandwich.  My main complaint is the service.  It's not that it was bad, but it definitely wasn't good. It's like I was being served by a robot that does not speak.

The espresso and breakfast menu are somewhat creative given the choices that some of the other nearby coffee shops (with espresso choices) have.  However, terrible doesn't even begin to describe the service.  The lady who I assume is the manager, is one of the rudest people I've met in San Francisco.  I've been a number of times thinking it could have just been an off day for her, but it turns out it's just her personality.
Coffee: terrible.
If I could give zero stars, I would.
I am really happy with this place great customer service.

I do work with clinics around this part of town frequently, so Spiro is one of the coffee spots I make sure to stop by on my way. From my perspective, the star of this place is the strawberry muffins! ($2) The best time to come during weekday mornings is right around 845am--that seems to be around the time they pull the muffins out of the oven. When they're fresh, warm, and moist--omg drool!! Pairs so well with their standard quick cup of coffee ($2.50). They serve Sightglass, but depending on the barista, the pour over can be a bit inconsistent in quality.
Great coffee, great service!
I've been to Spiro several times this week for a late breakfast and long working sess on my laptop and I keep coming back for a few reasons:

the location is great, for me at least. The venue is nice and spacious. Music's a little too "pumped up" for my taste but I guess some people like that. The one star is for the poor girl behind the register. Some people hate their job, and I'm terribly sorry for this but I don't believe the discontentment should never be directed at somebody else. Not a single smile and very standoffish when I asked for help to connect to the wifi (which is why I'm here). She didn't let me sit at a booth because "it was closed off" while that was the only seat left in the cafe close to an outlet. Her response to my persistence to sit there: "you can sit there (pointing at an occupied table) if it becomes available." That's pretty obvious. Anyway, this is my first and last time. I enjoy happiness and cooperation.

Is super expensive and the pastries and sandwiches are okay. I think their coffee's are above average as well. But besides that, their interior design is wonderful and works very well for people who want to work on their laptop or just read a book.

Absolutely the rudest most infuriating coffee experience I have ever had. Between the manager and the clerk I don't know who was worse. My roommate and I live 1/2 a block from you guys... we have done literally 100's of $ of business with you... and we didn't "purchase enough" to use the wifi? I got an apple and she got coffee and lunch... that's not "enough"? We drink your insanely expensive coffee 5x a week. I'm talking $5 a cup and we still drink it every week.

My favorite neighborhood coffee place!  Yummy espresso and awesome Veggie Quiche.  They also have tons of house made pastries and good sandwiches.  They have Wifi so it's also a good place to get some work done.
The place is very clean. I liked the sandwich i got
Coffee was great here. I had a white chocolate latte and it was delicious. The service was fast and very friendly.

Today I decided to try a New Coffee place since my favorite coffee place Philz Coffee was crowded and there was no seating. Spiro's a fairly new Coffee Joint on Van Ness. It's about 25 steps away from Philz Coffee. Spiro's always seems to be empty when I walked by it everyday. But I decided to check it out.

Spiro is a spacious cafe in the Tenderloin, serving sightglass coffee, salads, sandwiches, and  breakfast sandwiches. On the plus side, I think the atmosphere is nice, being quiet and fairly spacious. Good spot to get a coffee and scone and sit and talk or get some work done.
Great coffee very nice baristas.
Love this place.

This place has a great setting of a Something one might call a typical san Francisco coffee house. Nice and cozy, with big windows too look at the busy people running down Van Ness, and free wifi to browse Facebook while doing so.
I went here when it first opened and my cappuch was GREAT.
Great vibes for studying or chillin with the homies. Awesome vegetable sandwich and almond milk late. . Going back as soon as I can!

I love working out of cafes on occasion and Spiro ranks up there among my favorite in this part of town. It's coffee is decent and it boasts a good range of food options as well and the staff work hard to keep the place clean.  Usually, one of my biggest pet peeves with working out of cafes is ending up smelling like roasted coffee, but Spiro somehow seems to all that coffee aroma that you love so much in your cup of jo' but not so much on your clothes seems to magically evaporate.  A welcome addition to the neighborhood!
Fast, friendly service. Ordered OJ and the Huevos Rancheros. The food was good. Cafe has a relaxed laid-back atmosphere.
So I ordered an iced tea. The board says it costs $2.50. The gal charged me $3.00. I pointed to the board. She told me they'd have to change the board and rolled her eyes at me.
Updating previous review. Should've been 5 stars. This place is way nice. I now visit it quite frequently.

I am old school and have a dumb phone.  It is truly amazing the patience the owner and staff have when computer geeks take up a table with their lap top and backpacks after buying a drink or $4 snack.  I usually buy a latte, but their regular drip coffee is great!  I get the same service if I buy just coffee or lunch and dessert for 2.  You can't go wrong here!
Had the chipotle turkey- added hot sauce. It was delish! The little salad they give you had a tiny but too much dressing.

The owner of this cafe needs a serious lesson in customer service. You should not allow your employees May and Mila to run this store unsupervised. After reading the other reviews here, it seems like I am not the sole person who has experienced the rude service here.

It was my first time here and I really loved it!  I went there this morning before heading to work.  I bought a cup of tea and bagel.  The bagel was very fresh and staff very nice and welcoming. This place is very bright, cozy, and clean.  Good service and good food.  Thank you!  I would definitely come back!

The fact is, Spiro serves Sightglass coffee and it's done well.  They have a great tea selection as well and use jumbo bags for double concentrate.  Their food options are straight forward and portions are larger.  The grab and go is current with kombuchas, yogurts, coconut waters and fruit cups.  It's a great stop and go coffee shop and it's relatively cleaner than the surrounding establishments.
Review by a non-coffee drinker:
Brown noser.
Slow. Banana bread was too dry and morning bun too late. Coffee really slow.

One star for the amazing savoury biscuits. Another star for always having seats available. Negative one star for the chemical scent the three times I've been there. Negative one star for last time I was served a cold biscuit, heated three times because the middle of the biscuit was COLD. Negative one star for the stale refrigeration taste of the cold biscuit.  I didn't want to write a yelp review but the mobile Spiro website didn't have an email contact.

Slow service. Breakfast sandwich not flavorful. Location has a ton of potential.  As someone who was raised in the restaurant industry, if I owned this restaurant I would start with training the staff to be more personable and achieve better timing on outgoing orders.

Wow, wish I had read the earlier review re: the waffles. Sounded good - goat cheese & jalapeño jelly on waffle. Unfortunately, the waffle is like eating a wet sponge. Although when I think about it, a wet sponge would be firmer and probably taste better.
BREAKING NEWS!!  They make the Caesar dressing from scratch!!  And this is why I am giving them the extra star - the dressing chef even gave me a hug and extra to take home :-)

I'm a fan of this mocha I'm drinking but I'm not a fan of the chicken caesar salad. Their ceasar salad was extremely garlicy in taste and in smell! I had to chew some gum after my salad. :( my breath was kickin
If you need a LARGE amount of food that's pretty good, order here! I tried them though EAT24 and I like the food! I order frequently!
Their Gen Tso Chicken was awful. their egg rolls were vegetarian and good. and their pork dumplings were just ok. prices are good.

We just ordered off Eat 24. The prices are very cheap and they come in pretty big portions. I do agree that the food is a bit bland, we ordered a won ton noodle soup, chow fun, and crab puffs. The order came with a free hot and sour soup, I won't include this in my review as it was free.

I love this place. The Chinese food is good, but today I saw on the menu taped on the window that they had a "salmon club sandwich." Its not on the menu they give you when you dine in, but they let me have it anyway. I was surprised that it came with fries, and that it had fresh avocado in it. And the price was only $6. Places like this keep my hope in SF alive. Not everything is a bougie overrated techie magnet yet.
Food was an hour and a half late, tasteless, mushy, and not completely cooked. At least it was cheap. That's the only reason it deserved the one star it received. Never again.

There was some serious confusion with the delivery of my order - the restaurant claimed they called me but I had my phone with me the entire time and it did not ring. Unclear what went wrong with the phone, but they ultimately left the food with someone in my building and (no surprise) it never got to me.  I couldn't wait any longer and tried to cancel my order altogether, but they insisted on remaking the food. I'm so glad they did, because it was delivered quickly, piping hot, by a really nice man. They turned a problematic situation into a great experience. It's not the best Chinese food ever, but it's a solid delivery option with great service. I will definitely order from them again!

I don't usually review things but I had to here. the most inedible food ever ordered. everything in the beef chow fun was the texture of the luke-warm soggy noodles including the bok choy and beef. gross. I had 1 spongy shrimp and 1 very unripe sliver of mango topped with soggy peanut pieces from the mango salad and deemed it inedible. the food had either been frozen or kept around far too long. my third shrimp dumpling tasted foul so I abandoned that as well. of a $40 meal, 2 shrimp dumplings was all I could swallow. oh and they forgot my diet coke, so nothing to chase it with!
Ken's Kitchen is a decent spot to go to for Chinese food.  The price is reasonable and the food is fairly good.

Food: sub standard. The roast duck wonton noodle soup that i order,  that is. Roast duck, reallu fatty, no meat at all. They should not serve that to a customer. Wonton, not fresh, i can even taste the unfreshness when i bite into it. There is a freezer taste to it. The wonton was extra $1 and there was only two. Meaning 50 cents each. I can order wings for that in some .25 cent wings place...
Pros: accepts credit, delivers
Not the best or satisfying Chinese food. Order the combination noodles and the lettuce wrap. Both were pretty blend. And it took an hour and half to arrive.

We were only visiting for the weekend, so this restaurant was close to our hotel. The food here was so good. We ordered the meal for 2: soup, egg rolls, 2 entrees and rice...all for under $25. Delicious dinner and very filling.

Schetchy neighborhood and awsome chinese food!!!!  It goes together in the City!  I had the walnut prawns and they were not over sauced or over breaded and they were fresh.  Just be careful and bring your ear plugs because the workers who hang out there speak the loudest Chinese i have ever heard.  It was like they were yelling at each other LOL.  But the lunch portion was plentiful, cam with good soup and very reasonable pricing.  I'm going back when i have a hankering for Chinese food for sure.
Do you like satisfying, crispy fried Chinese food that crunches and then melts in your mouth? So do I! Let me know when you find that restaurant.
Decent, cheap and huge portions. If you're  on a budget and need to eat for a couple days, order one of the lunch specials and take it home. Very nice and prompt service as well.

The egg rolls were very oily. Fried things should be drained and patted with paper towels. One of the egg rolls was soggy too. The vegetable fried rice tasted like chicken fat and the veggies in the rice were practically microscopic. They could of been frozen veggies for all I know, but hopefully not. I haven't tried the eggplant Schezwan. It's still sitting on my counter, but it does not look appetizing. On a positive note, the delivery was quick.

On my recent visit to San Francisco, I got stuck working in my hotel one night (@#$% stupid coworkers, but I digress...), so I had some great Chinese food brought to me, because I could not get to it myself.

my family and i often dine at ken's kitchen, our favorite is the combination won ton soup and the beef and shrimp fried  rice, they also make this thai cold tea that is the bomb, the service is great, the people are friendly, and the atmosphere is nice and clean, all the food that i have tried there i have enjoyed but these are our favorites. if you haven't tried them yet i recommend you do if you want some authentic clean chinese food, it's a great place to dine!!!

A surprisingly solid dining experience. I went here on a whim since it was the closest Chinese place to my house that doesn't suck. We shared a 2 person multi-course dinner for $26. Once the food started showing up I thought it was perhaps $26 per person, that's how much food there was, but it was indeed only $13 each.

This place was shame full I had then before and it was awsome but today was crap. Before you start hating on my review please read it. Me my girlfriend and my friend walked in it was kinda busy. We stood the for about 5-10 minutes which is expected because of the busyness if the place we got seated and it took then 20 minutes to take our order.  I ordered the special it was spicy eggplant with chicken and shrimp with fried rice. It was good but kinda crap especially if I'm paying 1 more dollar for fried rice but it jest comes with egg.  My girl friend got the Orange chicken and that was the best Orange chicken I ever had. My friend had the bbq pork he said it was alright. I also ordered there crispy pork which was hot and cold the outside was hot but the center was cold I asked them for a new one that's crispy and hour and they pot it in the microwave. We could all tell it was put there because the plate was hot and it was super oily.  Then we asked for our check and the lady was so impatient to take the money.  This place was so sad.  Yes we r young people that was there but still a customer is a customer and should be treated with respect. We r passing the same money as everyone else so y not?

You get what you pay for.  Ken's Kitchen gives no facade that it's not a place where you just get greasy, cheap Chinese food and I love it.  The portions are generous, the meat they give you in their dishes aren't the tiny pieces of chicken or shrimp but the large slices of beef and jumbo shrimp.  I like their chow mein more than their fried rice.  Their salt and pepper calamari could use a different type of flour but it's still good.  Also, they have the roast pig!  Menu is huge and extensive so you can't go wrong.
6 steamed dumplings and BBQ pork buns were so doughy we could have constructed a loaf of bread out of the surplus.
I cannot believe I haven't written a review yet!
75 minutes for chicken fried rice!!!  FRIED RICE?! 75 MINUTES. Came luke warm, no fork, no spoon, and no napkins.  Best part is....I'm less than 10 blocks away.

I have ordered from Ken's for the simple fact it's cheap, and I got just that last night.  I took them over 85 minutes to deliver my order. I called and they knew the address but not what I ordered...I was starting to ponder if I would even get my actual order. When the food finally arrived everything was bland and cold. The soggy eggroll that was just tossed on top of the terrible sub par fried rice. The sweet n sour pork had such a ridiculously disgusting after taste it was un-edible. The egg flower soup was just cheap egg drop soup. Even the fortune cookies were broken...I pulled out the fortune and to my surprise it said
Ordered via the Eat24 app and order arrived in about 30 minutes.  ONE STAR
Pros - it's cheap and they deliver.

I've only order delivery from them, but the food is usually good. Last night, I ordered delivery via GrubHub from Ken's Kitchen. They actually called me to let me know that there was a delay. I very much appreciated this. They are not the best restaurant in town, but they are good for the price.
Very pleased with our experience. Quick delivery. Great food. Easy to order. I will definitely be coming back.
Solid food, amazing prices.

My go-to Chinese delivery place. Delivery is fast (about 40 mins on a Friday night), food is hot and fresh; only a $10 minimum for delivery and you can get a minor feast for around $30. Currently obsessed with the egg flower soup -- tons of flavor and big chunks of cooked egg.
Good food  and great service.
Reasonably priced for the area, fresh cooked food, tasty. Not too bad parking on weeknights. Had the orange chicken, special fried rice and tofu pork.
I walked by here once on my way to the movies and it was jam packed at 8 p.m. on a Sunday night. Good sign.
Terrible. Everything is bland. No flavor whatsoever. I feel bad for the people that rated this 5 stars, they must not know what good food is.

I've never set foot in the actual restaurant but I do order from here at least once a week.  The shrimp dumpling is some of the best I've ever had. It's a little on the salty side, but I like that. Because of the delivery, the dumplings are not always the prettiest when they arrive, but boy are they delicious. The cha sew bao is also pretty good.
I have only ever ordered from here but always get tasty food.  I can recommend the Saigon noodles, pea sprouts, kung pao chicken and pork buns.

If I can give zero stars I would! I ordered some food from here and when I opened the Chow mien I noticed mold all over the noodles. I called to notify them they didn't even care, what he said was "well the chow mien was free" um so! Like are they seriously trying to get us sick or kill us. My God he couldn't even apologize. Even the beef was old and smelly. They need to have proper training on how to prepare food because this is unacceptable. I also posted pictures.

My company ordered the sesame beef, egg fried rice which came with egg flower soup and won ton crab cake thing. Don't know which was the culprit(s), but for sure got food poisoning from this place. Never ever again. And yes, the sesame beef was over battered and soggy. The articificial crab thingy had mayo in it (?) Rice was ok, alittle on the greasy side. I understand you pay for what you get, but I didnt bargain for waking up sick at 2am.
I got a combo for one: pan-fried string beans, eggroll, chow mein and hot & sour soup.
*** CASH ONLY ***
I had pot roast with mashed potatoes and corn.  Really good!  Good prices too, will definitely go back!
We stopped by here for just a quick snack. We were in a group of 15 and they made arrangements for us to sit together :) just grabbed some classic fries and ice cream
Some standout items at Lafayette Coffee Shop:
The location has a bit to be desired. But if you can see past the rough exterior you will get a fine meal. This is a "greasy spoon" type of restaurant and I like that!

I've wanted to try this place for years.  One of my favorite things about this place is the old neon sign out front.  Looking up at it I am transported to an Old San Francisco when this area was flush with theaters and fedoras.  The Lafayette is a little time capsule currently lodged between two of the roughest Hyde

Good cheap eats.  I enjoyed having breakfast here.  I had the chicken fried steak and eggs.  The steak is good, and the potatoes, wow some serious awesomeness.  I did throw some extra black pepper and hot sauce on it, but that's because it made it perfect.  I enjoyed listening to other people's conversations here.  It is the Tenderloin so its something out of Jerry Springer or Intervention.  It's daytime soap opera at it's finest.
It's like the diner from Seinfeld if Jerry and friends were crackheads living in Brownsville or Hell's Kitchen or something.

Fuckin' love this place. I usually get the prime rib, and its solid.  You get so much food for really, really cheap. Prime rib dinner includes: soup, salad, bread, prime rib with mashed potatoes and a veggie, plus either jello or pudding for $12.65!!!  Ive never even made it to the jello/pudding.  I like to sit in the back and watch the awesomeness that is the Tenderloin unfold in front of me.  Always a show!

What a WONDERFUL little divvy place!! Great spaghetti+meatballs. CHEAP BREAKFAST. AND it tastes GOOD!! HUGE portions!! The ham of the ham+eggs breakfast was a SLAB sliced off of a freshly baked ham!! Is it GRODY? YES!! Are there crazy people outside? YEP. WHO CARES!!!!! The French Dip made with sliced PRIME RIB-- OUT- EFFING- STANDING!! CHEAP---CHEAP--- CHEAP!!! BUT-- So is the Décor. The place hasn't been painted since Mamie Eisenhower's hubby was our president!! The booths are ANCIENT!!!! Listen-- I've been going here since the EARLY eighties-- that's right--EARLY 80's. I've NEVER gotten sick. So, CALM DOWN. NO CREDIT CARDS!! CASH ONLY!! May is the name of the waitress. Oh, she DOES talk. Just gotta' get to know her. People talk back and forth between tables. So-- if you're SHY-- STAY HOME!! We like to mingle!! Say, good morning, good day, SOMETHING!! Come on down and enjoy the food!!
Decent. Good portion. Good service.
didn't have time to taste the food here, just the coffee (1,75).. it's Baddd. not in a good way, too harsh, probably farmer's.
Unlike most of San Francisco, this place seem to be preserved in a time capsule since the 70s.  From the decor, to the prices, it's all a flash back.  We need a disco ball here!

The restaurant offers good value for your money.  The neighborhood ambiance is bad. I do not feel safe walking to the restaurant at night.  The staff is friendly.  I really enjoyed the prime rib dinner.  The servings were generous, and meat was cooked just right.  I also enjoyed their roast turkey dinner during Thanksgiving.  The dinner specials come with desert, salad, and soup.

Your typical dive restaurant, but the food is decent and value oriented. You get a lot for your dollar especially the prime rib, $12.  I would not make a special trip to this place but will always stop by if I am in the area for a hearty meal.

Worth weaving through the drug dealers to get to.  Seats at the bar were uncomfortable, but it was great to watch them craft excellent food on a well-loved stove/griddle setup.  Hash browns, bacon and hotcakes are all excellent, and the Manhattan sandwich (BLT with ham) was also very good.  Prices reasonable.  Bring cash!
Nothing to travel far for, but if you're in the hood it hits the spot.
Very rustic. It's great. You won't be disappointed.
Went here before the giants parade. Def a greasy spoon. Cantonese lady the place is one tough cookie yelling at everyone. It is a slice.
Tucked away in the tenderloin.
If you're ever in the TL (which happens to be my hood) and  happen to be in the need to eat a LOT of food for under $10, go to this place!

This place is your definiteve greasy spoon in every sense. When you're in here you feel every bit of being in downtown/tenderloin. It ain't the prettiest joint, but you feel like you're in your neighborhood café.But what really makes this place nice to be in is the great service from the lady who runs the café.

Do not look at the floor, do not look at the walls, and for sure do not look at the food preparation areas.  This place is so dirty that it should be shut down.  I ventured into it for the first time in 40 years and almost puked.  I could not get past the appearance.  There was dirt everywhere,  The place made me sick.
The pancakes are fluffy and over an inch thick.  Perfectly cooked bacon and great coffee. May is friendly and fast as a waitress. This is a true local diner, nothing fancy and great food.
She had a grilled cheese with a side salad. I had a cheeseburger with clam chowder.

My favorite greasy spoon closed a while ago, and I hadn't found a replacement.  I'd walked past this place, I don't know how many times, and never thought to check it out, considering the neighborhood.  But reviews here were surprisingly good, so I took the dive.

Holy wow. My hubs and I generally trust Yelp pretty confidently when we travel, and often end up at some super-delightful places. This was most definitely NOT one of those times. I am pretty overwhelmed by how incredibly wrong Yelp was on this one. blatantly and utterly wrong. This was the worst breakfast I have ever had. How does this place garner good reviews?

Holy crap. This place ryules. Very simple cheap good food. You can eat 4 for breakfast for like $30. Best thing is that occassionally there is entertainment. We were lucky enough to have the cops making a bust at the table next to us while we were there. I would go here again for sure. Now, I HATE pancakes, but these PANCAKES are AWESOME. I ate my food then my cohort's food because I couldn't see it go to waste. Want a classic american cheap breakfast with decent coffee and no wait. Go HERE. We stumbled upon this place because the line @ Brenda's was so long. THANK YOU BRENDA!

I used to come here years ago before Yelp (or the internet, for that matter), so all I could do was sing the praises of Lafayette Coffee Shop to anybody who would listen.  Went in today for maybe the first time in over a decade, and nothing has changed -- which is a good thing!  If you want to know what lunch was like in, say, 1945 (hint -- it was good!), eat at Lafayette.

The walk to get here was a little treacherous from Market & 7th. When we went in I didn't know if we were supposed to seat ourselves or what. We did & were not brought menus so I had my son go to the bar to get one. Eventually the lady came over w/ waters. She was very nice! We ordered & it didn't take long for the food to arrive. We all had 3 fluffy pancakes & eggs cooked just how we ordered them! 4 orders of pancakes & eggs for $20! This is my kinda place :-) defnately worth the walk! 4 stars because te seats are in horrible condition! No cushion.
Pancakes at night! Breakfast at night! Yaaay! And all for a decent price.

Yes, it is one of the two diner type places I go to for cheap food in the TL, but the other place, Manor House Restaurant on Jones near Turk, gives you much more food for the buck and the prime rib is cheaper too.  The only thing is, they close early, like 4 PM, so that's when I go to Lafayette.

This is the kind of place to where you only come for the food, not the ambiance as it's not impressive at all. However, the food is a different story. The food is just simple and basic American food. My friend and I came here after a long night of drinking. Here is what I got:
I am trying to type and eat the huge cheesburger and un godly amount of fries I just got from this place.
5 out of 5 in the scale of Price to foodage.. The neighborhood, and parking kills it. Don't mind the ambiance, it's what it is: Cheap n good.

This is my favorite place to grab an early breakfast or a late dinner. The food is always cooked warm and hearty. The best thing about the place is the waitress Mei. She is always super friendly and very helpful. When you go there you feel like you are being taken care of like a neighborhood patron.  I personally love the dinners. Prime rib dinner with au jous.....yumm.I highly recommend grabbing a meal if you are in the area.
In theory, I should be reviewing RN74 right now...in reality, I'm reviewing Lafayette Coffee Shop...what happened to me? :)

I grew up in this neighborhood and spent more than 15 years here and for the first 10 even while passing by this place daily, I never tried it until about 5 years ago.  Now is this place the newest, trendiest, brightly lighted place ever?  Not exactly.  However, it has great service, huge portions, and amazing prices.

I looked like a crackhead. I had just stepped off the plane from a Denver - Los Angeles two night adventure in trance, and I was starved. Also sleep deprived. And probably not smelling very good. On second thought, I looked and smelled like a crackhead.
Ohhhh Lafayette Coffee Shop, you hold some funny memories for me.
This was simple but good. The atmosphere is kinda so so but the food wasn't bad. I had half beef half chicken supper burrito. Liked the salsa and chips but some chips were in the main salsa bowl.
I'm in a yelpy mood.
Most recent health score is a 70 out of 100. Thats pretty bad. Check it out for yourself:
First time in San Francisco and let me tell you, I don't think I've ever ate so much Mexican. This was definitely #1 on my list.
Great
Decided to get 3 tacos (steak/carnitas/al pastor)
Waited about 25 minutes for a chicken burrito, the order was messed up had to wait again and took forever, finally the burrito was not too shabby though.

El Super Burrito definitely doesn't get enough credit. My coworkers and I trek up Polk street once every 2 weeks to fill our bodies with carbs, grease, and a whole bunch of salsa. The 4 of us usually order 3 items and share amongst ourselves - perfect amount.
I love this place , good food , fresh , salsa station is good ,  veg tacos are super delicious !!

My friend and I had a hard time finding vegetarian friendly restaurants in San Francisco, but of the few we found this was one of our favourites. The vegetarian taco salad and the quesadillas were both excellent. The salsa bar was a plus. Next time we're in town we'll be back!

I am in town for business training, and my hotel said this place is good. Now I am from Los Angeles, and we have great Mexican food there. I had a regular steak burrito, meat was dry, rice, etc was flavorless. Yes the portions are huge, but who cares if the food doesn't taste good! It was quite busy, and the service is nothing special either. The girl who brought my food didn't even great me or smile or anything. Hate wasting my calories on fattening food that isn't worth it. UGH!!!!
Seriously only three stars. My friends who brought me to this place told me that thats because the other itmes on the menu aren't as good as the California burrito.

Every time we play regency ballroom I eat here at least once sometimes twice.  I don't really get anything other than burritos so I can't say much for the rest of their menu but I think their burritos crush it.
I eat here for lunch all the time and its consistently good. Great veggie tacos. Unlimited chips and salsa with your meal!
Ok, I guess third time's the charm!
Self-service chips and salsa were good, vegetarian burrito was solid.  Will def go back.
Great find next to my new place. Tried this today for lunch with the bf since it was close and convenient and it did not disappoint. We both love good Mexican food and this was great.
I would have loved to give this Mexican fast food chain (they do have another location in Millbrae... wait... does that make it a chain?) a better rating but the food just wasn't great.
Good, inexpensive, fresh Mexican food. The also make fresh juices. Lots of options to choose from.

Not too shabby in an area that is full of pizza, pho, Chinese food & everything in between! The prices are moderate for the area & the chips & salsa are self self. The portions aren't so huge so don't feel bad as long as a Zumba class & walking/ urban hiking is done in the same day. It's also spaceport than other eateries in the area!

I really wanted to like this place, and I even gave them a second chance but still failed to meet expectations. Ok, we ordered chimichanga and a super burrito. Food was very greasy. The agua fresca was delicious though, and a lot of different variety of juices too. Second time I ordered 2 tacos and chicken plate. Both were pretty good, better than the burritos but the meat was still greasy and I came to realize their ingredients were not fresh. The chips are store bought, corn tortillas are not even hand made, salsas are not fresh probably came from a can. And there was something about the guac that just wasn't right it was really watery..The only thing fresh was the juice really.

Kinda bummed....   To the Big Guy who took my order....   Mild means not too hot to eat!!!!!   If I ask multiple times for mild,  that probably means I want mild.   Next time pay less attention to your cell phone and gut the order straight, please.  Other than that,  we love the place.  However I promise you this, the next time I go in and don't see the female employee, who is awesome BTW, I am walking out.
This restaurant was around the corner from my hotel while I was vacationing in San Francisco.

Guys. Guys. My boyfriend and I usually eat burritos at el farolito.  We turn our noses up at taqueria Cancun. Tonight, we tried el super burrito for the first time and it was amazing. Not only is the carnivals juicy and crispy, the cheese is perfectly melted, the burritos are grilled... it was an amazing experience. I am so glad that we discovered this place. Really, try this place out. Super burrito with carnitas, you can't go wrong!

Oh man, no menudo? it's Saturday morning and NO MENUDO! What the hey. That just ain't right especially when I got into a menudo mood. I've driven to Oakland to get good menudo, so I was happy I only had to take the 19 to find it. But they were out, and I'll be damned if I have to take another bus to the Mission to get it. That's how I ended up getting an $8.50 bowl of Caldo de Res, and it just wasn't the same. Sure, there were big chunks of beef shank that have obviously been sitting in a stock pot for quite some time. Carrots and big hunks of potato they didn't bother to make bite-size. They looked like they used zucchini and cabbage rather than chayote. There was plenty of cilantro and chopped onion (photo:
1) Order 3 Carnitas Tacos

After some time abroad in overseaslandia I had a hankering for some real Mexican so I went to this place. This is the real shite. If you want some mango chutney salsa seaweed kale elixircleanser vegan burritos, piss off back to yuppielandia. El Super Burrito is where you can have a massive plate of real food with and amazing view and a smiley, no bullshit service. Viva el Super Burrito cabrones.

I live a few blocks from this place and I  do not know what all the 4 and 5 stars are for. I have eaten here a few times and the only positive thing I can say is I did not get sick. The chicken in the enchilada tasted like it came out of a can. It was mediocre at best. Also you will have to play dodge bum to get in,as that low life factor in and around that place is over 90%. The tables are usually dirty regardless of when you come in.
Came here trashed before a concert at the Regency Ballroom down the street.

Great place to go if you want something big in the mornings they open at 9:00am and ready to serve. Nice big place inside and there is a bus stop in front of building. 19 muni.  The Best thing I like is there  regular burritos and chips.
Average. I would give it three stars, but it didn't quite earn the 3rd, so I have to unfortunately stick with two..
Great food fast! The employees are always friendly!! The burritos, enchiladas, and flautas are great and portioned very well!
The torta was awesome and pretty big. I loved the salsa and chip station in the back, free chips with your meal.

The menu is simple and good. Pretty much everything you need for mexican is up on the menu. The food seems to be well prepared and well put together. The only thing I dislike about this place is the pretty slow turn around time with the food togo. It seems like if your eating there then the food comes out quickly but if it is togo then get ready to wait a little longer.
Overall the place looks terrible and seating is old and broken. However the food is amazing. I come out to San Fran periodically and the this place is always a stop for breakfast

Ive gone to this place about 4 times. They are known for their cheap oregon burritos which has french fries in it. I guess you get what you pay for. My buddy and I bought oregon burritos last night and now are paying the price. The steak was bad and our stomachs are hurting pretty badly; diarhea, etc. God dammit because I love this place, but I will never be back.
We had a specific request from the group -- we needed guacamole -- so we were on a quest to find some late on a Thursday evening.
So...the thing about walking into a hole in the wall without reading yelp reviews is that there's a big chance it's actually a little shit attached to the wall.
Suuuper authentic Mexican food.

Came here for lunch one day with my husband.  We were starving, this was close and our landlord recommended it.  I got the enchiladas, holy moly lots of food.  It came with 3 enchiladas, beans, lettuce, sour cream and rice.  I was only able to finish about half of it, it was so big.  My husband got the super burrito, which he absolutely loved (he fancies himself a burrito connoisseur).  Free chips and salsa.  Perhaps we were just ravenous, but this was very good food.  I'm sure we'll be back.
This pizza place is AMAZING!! I don't know who wouldn't want to go here. Lotfi, Mohamed, Alfredo are the best!

We ordered from Bellissimo for our Halloween party .we got different kind of their combination pizzas  most of my friend like the California special ( Spanish ,feta cheese ,chicken & pesto).i prefer the plain pizza it's  classic New York style pizza.

Too much sauce. ( sauce should not be pre cooked,plum tomatoes ) Bad crust. Corn mill used. Shredded cheese. No fresh mozzarella.  It MIGHT be acceptable if you are wasted. And again i am not comparing it to delfina or flour+ water or ragazza of course. I am comparing it to street pizza. They are super nice guys.

I needed a late night dinner convenient to my hotel (Hotel Vertigo) so went next door to this pizza place.  The paninis sounded good so I got the Chicken Parmesan one as well as the caesar salad and garlic bread.  The caesar salad was okay but I would recommend NOT getting the garlic bread - it was dry and not buttery nor garlicky.  The panini was a decent size but did not have very much flavor.  The Chicken Parmesan was not as such - it was sliced chicken with marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese, not really chicken parmesan in my opinion.

So, not only did the delivery driver straight up ask me for a tip, but the pizza wasn't even sliced.  The pizza itself is fine - whatever recipe they use is fine, but the customer service and quality of product is much to be desired, although, in not surprised.

The pizza here is HELLA Bellisimo! Seriously great stuff the Cali special is amazing with the house made pesto mixed with red sauce. It gets a bit busy late night and post bar so it's a good idea to call in an order. Garlic bread with pesto and cheese is an amazing filler at 4.50
These guys served all the people who came in after me the same menu item before they served me... I think they give blondes preferential treatment!
Decided to not deliver the pizza we ordered, not call, and just ignore us. What a disaster, and a joke.
good pizza but they have great paninis I wish they were less expensive especially that they made their own bread
Way over priced for the quality. 2 slices and a coke was over 10$. You can get better pizza in the neighborhood for a better price.

I stop by this place at least 4 times a week. It's a good, tasty and yummy pizza. My favorite is the grecko, but I recently fall in love with their california slice. I love that they are pork free pizza. It's all beef or turkey meat. I crossed their kitchen few times to use their bathroom. The kitchen looks decent and clean. Too bad they don't deliver to Oakland, since we don't live in the city anymore.
talking about a bad pizza place...this must have the worst service in san francisco.
their california n garlic chicken r pretty dope

This review is way over due, I tend to forget about Yelp, but since I had to rate and review Tortilla Kitchen today, I was looking over my reviews and saw that I hadn't mentioned anything about the hot wings here, since I tried them months ago.  AND HAVE NOT ORDERED THEM AGAIN......LOL  Yeah, they were blah, no flavor, flabby skin, just skip it, don't order them, if you must have pizza and wings, order the pizza here, because it's amazing and order the wings from Double Deckers, hands down the best wings in the city.

To the lady who claims there is hair on the pizza: I tried a new pizza place in the city almost every weekend until I came across this pizzeria. That might be an accident as I always find falling little pieces from the pizza box on the cheese. That happens everywhere. I ve tried Bellissimo pizza few months ago and now I only order from them, with 98 health score trust me I think the odds are realllly slim to find hair on your pizza.
