This place sucks, waited for over two hours for my pizza to be delivered, used it eat 24.  Would never go to them again!

Eat 24 advertised delivery time- 45 minutes. 90 minutes after ordering, I'm still waiting. Contacted Eat24 half an hour ago (at the 60 min mark) and was told it was out for delivery. Either they were lying or their delivery guy took off on a scenic drive.
You want a pizza with hair on it? You want terrible service? Call them. I don't rate like this unless it's legit so trust me.
Don't get some of the good reviews here. This was absolutely bar none the WORST pizza experience I've ever had so far (way worse than my last review of Royalty Pizza).

The pizza here is just alright. It's kind of a dingy place with unfriendly service and  I think $4 for a normal sized slice of pizza and $1.25 for a can of soda is quite pricey. Definitely not amazing; just very very mediocre and meh. Won't be coming back again unless I'm starving and have no other options.
I Love  their whole wheat Cheese pizza! BEST PIZZA IN THE CITY!! :)
Worst pizza I have had.   Each time I have had it, my stomach is in bad shape.  Store smells and it reaches out to street.

My Go to Pizza spot! Right across from my house and they are open till 2am! They have a lot of regulars here, I was short on money once and instead of going back home to get more cash they even let me come back to pay later since they see me all the time there. Great pizza joint and friendly staff!

I love Bellissimo Pizza! When you first walk in you immediately notice how clean and charming the place is, it's very open, spacious and welcoming. I've been coming here for years and have tried pretty much everything on the menu, it's all good. The paninis are delicious, made on homemade focaccia and the pizza is awesome. My favorite is the California special: pesto, spinach, feta cheese and chicken yum!
I juste read other reviews and can't believe I ordered from the same place. I used
Pizza was mediocre at best and the wings were literally inedible. Wet and mushy, they made me want to hurl. Also it was expensive! 0 stars, definitely avoid
Meh.

I like authentic chicago syle pizza. The pizza here was ok, on par with a pizza hut, but not for pizza aficionados. The wings were terrible. Soft, soggy, fatty and bland. The garlic chicken pesto toppings were ok, but the crust was mediocre.
Pizza is just OK, and they don't even heat it up for you.  Staff is borderline rude and you have to ask for your change back.

Whoa. Pretty much the most awful pizza I've ever tasted. The crust was gooey & abysmal; the sauce, flavorless. Delivered the chicken wings in a tinfoil lined container, which yanked most of the skin off each wing, and was then impossible to peel off the foil. Take this off your late-night options...not worth it.

Ordered late night from the westin hotel which is just around the corner. They wouldn't take credit on delivery and said they could only take my card over the phone. They never actually showed up. Im excited to call visa and charge back with extreme bias. Avoid this place.
Good pizza, quick delivery! I'll do it again!

By far the worst experience ever!!! I order their pizza for delivery, and it took 1 hour and 40 mins to get to me when their place is less than 2 miles away. I called two times to ask for the location of my pizza and all the staff said was it is on the way. It finally arrive in a TAXI. How unbelievable!!!! I feel sorry for the taxi driver, he was only doing a favor for his friend. The pizzas were cold, the wings were dissemble and sticking to the foil. I called the pizza place again and try to complain, but the staff show no effort at all to help me resolve the problem, when I ask to speak with the manager on site, he told me management is not available and hung up on me. I called a second time and ask for his name, he said " I DON'T CARE YOU STUPID FUCKING BITCH!!!!" i can not believe I'm getting this kind of service these day.
Late delivery AND wrong pizza. Busy or not... What kind of business is that? Ordered awful chicken pesto... Got pepperoni. I was so hungry I took it. But ... Really?!
Meh, mediocre pizza and it was delivered cold.
We ordered pizza for pick up one night while in town.  Very tasty pizza.  Better than others on the street.   Would recommend eating from here.
Friendly staff, great pizza! So glad it was near our hotel and cheap. Chicken pesto was great. Highly recommend!

It has been an hour and twenty minutes since I placed my order... the estimated delivery time was 40-60 minutes...  When I called to check on my order I got neither an apology nor an explanation.  I will probably not be ordering from this place again, and I will be lucky if I even get the overpriced-but-extremely-late-and-probably-cold pizza that I ordered ages ago at all.
Why is it so hard to find a good slice in San Francisco?

The three star reviews posted here are deserved, the pizza tastes a bit warmed over and isn't a reinvention of the pepperoni-delivery medium, I'm more pleased that they're open late in that part of the Tenderloin. They saved me from starvation, and they get an extra star for that alone. Never close early!

The Husband and wife that own the caffe are very nice and were very informative and patient when I asked questions.  I got my ceaser salad to go and he was nice enough to tape the fork and knife to the container.  The decor was so nice and they have a nice menu with a lot of selections.  I would love to see them increase the salad selection a bit to add some protein to them but besides that I am glad I found this caffe and plan on going there a lot!
I like to get their $5 breakfast burritos once in awhile. I think they're from a company in Sonoma, the ones that are also sold at Philz. But it's cheaper in this cafe.

I haven't tried their coffee yet, but I hear it's great. It's a cozy little cafe run by a husband and wife. Very friendly and welcoming. Their tuna sandwich has wonderful flavor. And the bread was fresh. It's a great place to pop in to grab a sandwich, snack or coffee/tea. They only have 2 tables so I wouldn't bring a group to stay and eat. More of a to-go place. They have a sandwich rewards card and if you buy 9 you get the 10th free. And if you check in you can get 10% off your meal. I will be going back for sure.

Coffee: excellent!  Sandwiches: superb!  And very important: the most sincerely nice folk you'll ever meet!!!  Give this place a try on your way to the office for coffee and a morning snack then return at lunch for a fresh and healthy sandwich or salad.  You'll be glad you did  :-)
New cafe in the neighborhood.   Great lattes, pleasant staff, good looking menu.   Conveniently a few food down from Brenda's, which makes it am excellent spot to wait.

The food and servive are ok, but they sneakily adding 18% tips without informing me is called robbery. Nevertheless, I smiled and left the restaurant knowing that this is a restaurant that i will never come back. Plus there was a bug inside my daughter's water.

Just had the pineapple fried rice that supposedly comes with shrimp and chicken...I searched for the shrimp & found just one. The dish was a bit tasteless and chewed on something that might have been an egg shell. Price is a bit ridiculous for the dish. $14 for a tasteless and meatless dish, not cool.

This restaurant is serving fucking bullshit food plus bad service. I ordered pipapple fried rice tonight. The taste was horrible. It was too plain and I didn't taste curry or anything at all. I was eating like a just plain rice. When I came here for the first rime, they charged18% gratuity for only two people. Second time I orderd vege fried rice and they put too much pepper and I didn't taste anything except pepper. WTF.
In San Francisco last week again ate three times while there with friends, always great food and friends are just amazed how good this place is. Thanks again for great food!
The worst pad thai I've ever had :-（Rice noodles are very dry and tasteless. Too few shrimps! Only 3 shrimps in my order. The good thing about this place is that it takes online orders.
Just ordered simple chicken fried rice and pad Thai. Stunned by both flavor and simplicity. Wondeful dining experience
First of all food, is just decent. Nothing spectacular but nothing bad.
Mediocre service and mediocre food. Ordered the pad Thai and I have to say it was the most flavorless pad Thai I have ever had.
Up for the world series and first we went to a super yuppie bar with 27 dollar hamburgers.  Not our style.  We wandered down the street, saw that the game was on and thought, what the heck!

I liked the pad see ew, thai fried rice is good too. Portion is small in the price. Restaurant is clean only the waiter comes too often to disturb us, taking our plate away even we are not finished...the restaurant is 80% empty on 1pm Thursday. What's the hurry??

If you are in the area for conference or work this is a good spot for Tasty freshly cooked Thai..its not a fancy place but doesn't need to be food is excellent. Prices really good. Spice levels on 1-10 for any dish so you can have it as mild or spicy as you like.. I did a 6 and was as spicy as I would go whilst still retaining taste.. Fresh rolls, softshell crab and the curries are great..  I'm sure there are fancy places in SF.. But my feet were killing me after DF14 and it was opposite my hotel . Staff really polite. Food excellent. Good value for money.

Yum!  Just got done eating this here at my office by City Hall!  Panang Curry, Thai Iced Coffee and fried banana ice cream.  The best part was that they actually deliver.  I love them! Most definitely one of my most favorite places in SF!!  =)
Owner was nice enough to open late on new years! Ordered pad thai and pad see ew. Both dishes were well spiced and delicious. The meal was the crown jewel of the night.
Don't order from this place.  Food was bad and service left a lot to be desired.

A calm cool refreshing experience in the Financial District.  After the server brought us drinks she brought each of our group of 7 warm moist hand towellets to wipe off the grime of the city.  All of the food was excellent and served warm in a timely manner. It was not all served at the exact same time, the food is prepared and a relatively small open visible kitchen, which I like.

Hubby and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco and walked here to eat at 9ish. Small place but attentive staff. Food was good. I ordered the soft shell crab basil and it was yummy! Great place to eat if you just want to have a quick late dinner.
Great place. Had a Curry and soft shell crabs. Both very delicious. Water was for free. The place is clean and has a nice atmosphere. The waitress was also very friendly. I immediately felt welcome.
Very overpriced food for the small size of kao gao tiam. Very little meat Nd the beef was tough as hell!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
My husband and I split the green curry with chicken and it was really good! It was one of our favorite meals in San Francisco. Very tasty. #nailedit!

First  time I had eaten at this restaurant, its very small but the people seems friendly, I ordered the Red curry seafood dish and Thai iced tea, the tea was good,but the seafood Red Curry was total garbage food, this is what the seafood had inside a small bowl, one shrimp, 2 small fish balls cut in half, one artificial crab leg 2 small pieces, one small slice of squid ! Worst seafood dish in the world !!! It came with tofu but there was no salt on the tofu just a red sour peppered sauce ! I will never eat there again for sure !! The bill was around $17.80 ! Maybe the other dishes might be better but I have lost interest in returning to this place !

So far this is one of my favorite places to go for curry. I had the yellow curry, my friend the pumpkin curry, and another the roasted duck soup... All the dishes were great! The curry flavors are well developed, the duck broth was amazing! Also the staff is super nice and super friendly. I totally recommend  this place!! Oh and their Thai tea is awesome, hot or cold!
Was in SF on business and decided to try someplace new. Wasn't dissappointed, exactly, but not sure I'll do it again next time I'm there.
I make it a point to eat here every time I visit the Bay Area.  Among my favorite green curry anywhere on the planet.  A five-star  Thai dive find. A winner every time...
I really like this place. Good pad see ew and cashew but chicken. Our waitresses were really kind and the back looks just like mom's kitchen the way you remember it.

I've eaten here a couple of times in the week I've been here and it's incredible!!! Authentic Thai cooked impeccably!! Everything is so delicious and complex. And if you're looking for standard staples, they have that too. I would eat here on a weekly basis if I lived here!!

Food was great. Well cooked and spicy level as requested. Out waitress was very helpful and nice. We just came here for dinner after a very long day of SF tour, though the ambience was not very great, we were happy about the people!
This was some damned good Thai food!

When I did a search for Million Thai in order to jot down my review, I came across 3 business profiles.  Are they a chain, or did they move around a lot?  No idea, but I'm no local, so take that as you will.
The duck soup was really good and the service was quick.
Tried a new dish and the Guay Tiaw Lord is amazing! Glad to know last time was just an off day. Great food and service!
Be careful with this restaurant they try to robe you. Pay attention carefully with your receipt.!!!!!!!!!!!!!

We happened to be staying right down the street from this restaurant, so by the end of our trip, we had dinner here. What stood out most was their presentation. When you order a Thai iced coffee, they present it to you with a rose made out of the straw's wrapper. When you order pineapple fried rice, half a pineapple is hollowed out to act as your bowl! It is a very enjoyable experience!

Do NOT double tip:  We have a party of 3 but automatically being charged for "service fee" of 18% on the check!   Also, the restaurant may think that is not enough, they wanted me to fill out section called "gratuity" again!!  They think I am stupid/careless that do not proof read the check ?!

Wow! I love Thai and this one of the best you will ever get. Living in LA you get spoiled with weather. In SF you get spoiled with real cooking. Everything was fresh and will not go wrong what you ordered.
Had appetizer platter, green curry, and fried banana and ice cream.  It was great. Go.

Had the pad Kee Mao. It was amazing. Nice large portion. Had the mango sticky rice, always one of my favorites. Right next to the Serrano hotel. I would recommend this to anyone wanting good thai food in the area

Ok but not great Thai. The pumpkin sauce was good but don't get the sea blend as the meat with it - it has fake crab and even fake scallops (fish meal). The Angel wings appetizers were really bad. Every Thai restaurant I have had that they are a chicken stuffing fried mix on a bone, here they are plain old Buffalo wings cooked badly (like rubber) with a thai bbq sauce on them. I have better Thai all around me back home in Monrovia/Pasadena.
I ordered papaya salad the best.   Pad thai and pad see ew better than the last time close by my home. Price is not bad in down town San francisco.   They are so friendly

wow & holy shit. super good! first time in a long time i've had tasty thai food. ploy II, osha, etc. - all fine. but this place? damn good, and at a reasonable price. i walked out thinking "5 stars easy". we ordered pumpkin curry (best tasted to-date), panang, basil beef, and mango sticky rice. while all the food was kick-ass, and the service fine, there were little unexpected touches that ramped-up the experience - e.g., creative food presentation (creative with regard to what's expected when you approach the restaurant from its tenderloin location), quality dishes and stemware. totally great experience eating at Million Thai.
Pad Thai was flavorful and delicious, I went for lunch and sat at the bar chatting with the staff, so that may have helped.
I really like to order the bento box . My favorite are California rolls and teriyaki salmon . They r good . Also, I love the salad too . The service is really fast and they are really friendly . :)
Long wait...took my orders for over 25 min to get it ready. And no tea or service from the waitress.
Ordered delivery. After an entire hour, they emailed me saying they had outright CANCELLED MY ORDER with the note "partner not available until 5PM".
Great food, good price and selection. Nice small eating area. Eat here 3 times a week and it's always good.

Quick service, decently priced sake, and tasty rolls. I think the actual restaurant could look a little bit cleaner, but I can't complain too much since it's reasonably priced and in walking distance from our home!
The sushi here is wonderful (definitely get the $1000 roll), and they have so many options of inventive rolls it can be hard to choose.
We got the edamame and the giants roll. Everything was good. Decent music and good service.

I was quite surprised how shitty their sushi rolls were. The rolls were sloppy and carelessly made. Almost every piece fell apart when I lifted it off the plate ( I even tried to use my hand  and with great caution, it still fell apart) The 49'er roll was just a big blob of rice with a tiny piece of avocado and countable dots of tobiko, the salmon on top was absolute tiny and extremely thin. I had another roll that also had salmon on top and it was the same size. The quality of the fish was also shitty, not bad to cause food poisoning (yet), but like scrap pieces that were cut off along the edge.
pro- fast delivery. will make the rolls to your custom/request .
Really fantastic place. After reading some of the one and two star reviews I was really quite shocked. Not only is the wait staff super friendly and kind the food is fabulous.
One of the best places for fresh sushi in town. clean, cheap, and delicous.

I ate many sushi's in my life, and this one in particular was really bad. I decided to go here because it was close to home and my friend and I was lazy (yes, we deserve it) Before this experience, I had horrible sushi cravings that was thinning out my wallet, but thanks to Sushi Hana, my cravings have been completely destroyed by being served really bad sushi and udon. Just to warn you if you don't want to be bored from long reviews, read below if you want to hear my complaints.

I was not impressed by this sushi place. The service was good and menu was huge, but sushi didn't feel very fresh. We ordered a sushi boat so we tried at least 10 different sushis, and most of them felt that way.

went here for lunch after I got excused from jury duty since it was on the way back from work. I got the sashimi lunch plate along with an order of unagi. Also I opted for salad istead of rice which they accomodated. Sashimi was nice big slices and for the price paid it was worth it. It also came with Miso soup as well. Salad was the standard lettuce salad. I also got a coworker one of the bento box trios - I got him chicken teriyaki, sashimi, and gyoza. For like $13, you get a ton of food and they def do not skimp out on serving size. Very fresh sashimi as well and tasty.

After reading so many negative reviews, I had to stand up for my favorite delivery sushi.  Granted, I've only eaten in the restaurant a couple times and yes, it is by no means the best sushi in the city. But, as far as delivery is concerned it is my go to place.

Excellent food. Excellent service. I haven't posted a lot of reviews in yelp, but I have to say this place made me start. I'm new to San Francisco and I love the fact that you can eat out every night and not go to the same restaurant twice. Sushi Hana is one of those places I wish I had found sooner. Great food. Fast, fresh, and financially good for any night out. Very relaxed atmosphere. Highly recommended.

Chicken curry was pretty good. The service was friendly and the serving size was huge. They also made the curry extra spicy on my request, and served me tea while I waited. Definitely would hit it up again for a low key lunch.

This is my favorite sushi restaurant. Sushi can get really expensive. Their prices are easy on my wallet for frequent sushi cravings and the staff is darn friendly. Sometimes the owner makes surprise desserts for his customers and i think that's darn sweet. Pun intended. The portion sizes are also pretty large for the non-sushi items. I ordered a teriyaki bowl and dang, i had dinner for two days. I will be back!

Whole idea of going here was to get a quick bite before seeing "Cloud Atlas" last year at the AMC up the street. The place was not even crowded, so it should have been no problem at all to get a simple dish quickly. And so, we were seated. Nearly forty-five minutes later (!), we were finally served. I don't care what it was at this point, we were nearly late for the film. Not worth the wait -- should've just gone to Tommy's Joynt instead.
The Best sushi delivery in SF!!!
11/11/13. Dinner

The service was really friendly and attentive, even though we came in 30 mims before closing. The sushi was good. It wasn't the best I've ever had but it was fine. They have a huge selection of rolls and a pretty big menu for the size of the restaurant. Not a bad choice for after a movie at AMC.

the worst slop i've ever had delivered, e-v-e-r!!!!!! i hate to even give them one star!! 1.) waited 11/2 hours for delivery. 2.) cold--brrrrrrrrrrrr. 3.) the soda was hot!!!!! 4.) the beef teriyaki: t-o-u-g-h--cold-- old!!!!!!! tasted soooo bad: i spit it out. 5.) instead of sesame dressing on salad: thousand island!!! (bottled, at that!!) 6.) rice- mushy--bland. 7.) sushi- can we spell: g-r-o-s-s? can we also spell: r-o-t-t-o-n  f-i-s-h  o-d-o-r? the seaweed wrapping was old-tough. the vegetables; cucumber/mushrooms were soooooo old and rotton they were rancid and moist from rot!!  don't eat/order from here!!! i beg you!!!  and all for 34.00$ !!!!!!!  highway robbery!!!! yuck.

There is not sushi buffet here. It is wrong. Otherwise I admit it was pretty great. Half the menu is overpriced in my opinion but some is good. They were fast, everything came quickly and was delicious. Not was I was expecting but pretty nice all the same.
Came here for lunch with my wife. The lunch was decent. Nothing to get all excited about. I do like how this place makes use of their extra ice. They put it inside the men's room urinal.
We we staying up the street, walked by and my wife was craving Sushi.  I did a quick yelp search and saw mixed reviews but went ahead and ordered for takeout.

If it were possible to give no stars I would. The food at this restaurant is extremely poor quality. The food tastes horrible. Not only does the food taste horrible, but it seems spoiled/stale and reheated for when the orders come in. Gross!

Came here a few years ago and swore I wouldn't go back because the food was bad.  Luckily, some friends insisted and the food really have improved.  The Happy Hour is very affordable with 30% off all appetizers.  Bring a whole bunch to try all the assortments.  The Hamachi and soft shell crab looked good.  Their cold Soba was on top of a block of ice (nice fine touch).  The tempura was nice and light and not very greasy and had a good assortment of vegetables.

I have been eating here for 2 years, and now they switched the people working there. They wouldn't give me spinach instead of lettuce, and I have been ordering like that for over 2 years.The girl Min said, she has no power to change whats on the menu, I mean seriously?? You just lost yourself a regular customer. What a shame they got horrible workers now. Just very saddened by this fact.

I was taking the 31 bus after work one day and while waiting, I decided to stop in for a quick bite (I was really hungry and wanted to get out of the cold too).  I asked the waitress what would be the fastest roll to make and she suggested the maki rolls.  I ordered the salmon and tuna one.  They both tasted great.  I like their clean and fast customer service!  Their special rolls are great, tried a few of them.  Oh, the only thing I didn't like about it was it didn't seem as clean as other sushi restaurant.  It could just be me but it seemed a bit... grungy.  But they do do delivery!!
I stopped by Sushi Hana with a friend before we saw a movie at the near by AMC Movie Theater. It was evening time on a Friday, but there was plenty of room to be seated immediately.
We went there for the " all you can eat sushi." Got there and asked for the details and they said that they don't do that anymore.

They have excellent happy hour prices on all the appetizers, including the sushi ones. My favorite was the sunrise, which is a quail egg on tobiko with a lemon slice on the side. I also recommend the enoki beef for some savoryness.
Rent must be high on Van Ness because I think the prices are high for what it's worth.

When I was living in SF I ordered delivery from here for the first year so the sushi is excellent. Now I live in Walnut Creek and still frequent this place whenever I'm in SF and have a sushi craving.
Allow me to share a few lessons gleaned from over a dozen takeout and dine-in orders from Sushi Hana:

I may have written a review a while back praising the service and food here, but tonight is the second time I have had sub par food from Sushi Hana.  I will preface this by saying I've mostly received great food from here, through delivery.  But these last two times (I ordered the same thing both times hoping that it was a fluke) the shrimp was rock hard in the sushi roll that I ordered and the skin was on the eel, which was inedible.  Not sure if there is a new chef or sou chef, but please please please, start providing the same great quality of food I have come to love from this restaurant.
Everything was perfect!

Craving sushi for lunch, we thought we'd try Hana based on reviews, fully expecting a mediocre level at best. Bad mistake. Since we grew up in Japan, my husband and I are picky, but there were too many things that were just wrong.

I typically come here for lunch break when I'm in school, so sometimes I show up and they're closed. But besides not being open when I want them to be, they have good sushi for a pretty average price and I always get full, sometimes I underestimate how filling sushi is!

Huge portions, fast FAST service!!! Good diner breakfast... Not the best decor, but don't let that stop you. Restaurant not labeled very well, I had a hard time locating it, but it's right on the corner of Sutter hiding in plain sight... I walked 6 blocks in the rain... I'll do it again!!
Had a rough night? Want a simple diner breakfast?

Great little place for breakfast and lunch. Huge portions and very affordable!  I always get the breakfast special because the pancakes, bacon, and potatoes are so great. My friend got the Kim chi omelet,  it was huge and delicious.  I will be coming back to try more of their menu. The service is very fast and polite. All around great spot!
Great neighborhood breakfast place
Food is good and the prices are very reasonable.  A quick breakfast or a easy-going sit down meal.  You won't get the extras but the prices are very good.
WARNING: The place is haunted by the ghosts of Old China. And the hamburgers are very bad.
Best for breakfast! No fuss, no thrills, solid, good breakfast. Two eggs, bacon or sausage, hashbrowns and toast $5.99!!!! Cant beat that price in sf.

I have been going to Hans for 5 years. They are extremely reliable and nice people. They have good classic American breakfast food. Their banana shake and fresh OJ is to die for. They're very fast and consistent.

Normally l would give Han's coffee shop a five star review, but due to recent visits l feel a two star review is necessary. I have been going to Han's for over ten years and have always enjoyed the food, the service, and the easy comfortable atmosphere which is a delight on a Sunday morning.  Recently I referred Han's to a producer from Kron4, when we first went it was as always and l was proud to have recommended. Then she and her husband went on their own and had an equally wonderful  experience. We decided to all go together a week ago and we were looking forward to it, unfortunately....Things had suddenly changed, there were more staff than need be, they seemed to get in each others way, forgetting orders, not cleaning spills, some customers did not recieve their order at all, and when it did come....it was stone cold.  From what we observed, it all hinged on the actions or rather inactions of a new waitress wearing black. Now to be fair, l chose to go back on my own this morning....l walked in, the tension was still in the air even though there were only four tables occupied with no orders delivered, one person eating. Then l saw the culprit...the waitress in black barely able to balance the food she was delivering.
No kidding! When I ate the handmade sandwich in the first time, I couldn't stop to eat it.

I wouldn't think about it twice before coming here. Honestly it came through with the teriyaki chicken/ rice. It taste sooo yummy. Not going to lie I wanted to eat elsewhere cause i thought this was just a "sub" place but it isn't. I was greeted as soon as I walked in, I was given the menu, and my orange juice was served right after. This place is great for comfy breakfast/lunch and sleepy mornings. It's nice and quiet and it's not over priced. Also the ambiance is not "hipster" or pretentious.

Think about all the characteristics of San Francisco brunch........in case you are new, here it is: long lines, over priced, unfriendly staff, hipsters and douchebaggery.........Now picture the exact opposite of that, that is Han's coffee shop. Yes, I know, the eggs aren't farm to table but they also aren't $25. If you want to come in for a chill breakfast, super nice staff who wait on you hand and foot with massive portions at a reasonable price...this is the place.

Delicious food and nice people. The food is extremely low-priced for its taste. The pancakes are a must. Breakfast items include a wide variety, along with sandwiches. There are also many options for lunch/dinner. Overall I really liked it!

I love Hans. I'm a regular customer. Their portions are large and their prices are extremely affordable! My boyfriend and I love the Han's Original Omelet, their French Toast, and their Eggs Benedict. If you order take out, your order will be ready for pick-up in 10 minutes! Quick service, hearty breakfast food, and cheap prices? What's not to love!
This place was amazing! The server was awesome! And the food was Good:) thank you Hans:)

Right above the tenderloin district lies this little coffee shop amazing service great food low prices what else can you ask for if you love trying breakfast is at a reasonable price definitely check this place out I would highly recommend it.
This place has become my go-to cafe. Nothing about it blew me away but there are several reasons I've decided I like it.
Vegetarian omelette :)
Cool spot.  Great small diner and I recommend their bulgogi omelette.  Pretty awesome!

Hard to go wrong with Han's.  Dirt cheap, big slices of cheese on the omelets, and the grubbiness that you'd expect for a place like Han's.  You get what you pay for, and it you want to pay for a medium brunch, that's what you'll get!  Great for the morning after...
Han's is my go-to spot for a quick, cheap, and delicious breakfast.  The breakfast special is great, $6 for 2 pancakes, hash browns, bacon, and eggs

So I've come to this spot more than a handful of times since I live in the neighborhood.  Today they charged me double what they have for years and I asked if they increased their prices.  The girl working there said "Yes, a little".  I'm sorry - but double is not a little.
I enjoyed the food here..the place is simple
Great and cheap breakfast! U can't go wrong w/ the breakfast sandwich or French toast! Good coffee too!

Great service but the food is from Costco. Very processed cheeses and meats. There was a Velveta or CheeseWhiz type cheese all over my omelette and i could not eat it. All of the food comes out of a freezer in the cafe floor. Just not up to SF standards.
Walking back from an appointment back to my satellite office in Nob Hill, I needed to grab a bite to eat so I figured I'd try out Han's.

Can't understand the rave reviews from this place. I'm a fan of the "greasy spoon" breakfast places but I definitely had the worst omlette here I've ever eaten in my life. And at $8.15, it's not cheap, either.

4 stars simply because it is a hole in the wall with a bit of worn out feel. That aside, your immediate eating area is well kept and very clean. And thank goodness for that because the food is so spot on. Nothing fancy but DAMN, perfect flavor for my omelette. I got the Popeyes favorite with spinach, tomatoes, onion, mushroom and cheese. Great blend. Ingredients were fresh and a nice egg to filling ratio ( didn't have to add hot sauce for flavor)...toast was made with the best crunch and softness in the center. Again, not fancy but really on the mark for satisfying your breakfast appetite. Also - price is crazy cheap. Two very filling and hearty meals for $19.50.

Best fucking bacon ever. I've been sleeping on Han's bacon. Stupid me has been ordering the 'breakfast sandwich' lately and it gets a little hidden amongst the egg and cheese. Still delicious, but the simple 2x eggs, 3x bacon, 1x hash browns and 2x toast bkfst is whats up. The bacon i normally grub on is burnt to a crisp. Why? Because thats what i grew up on and thats how i like it. However...Hans nails it with the 'uninterrupted' bacon. Its thick. Its peppered. Its cooked through. It looks phenomenal. Its crispy. Its chewy. You cannot go wrong. You must try Hans again and go back to basics. You will be glad. Beyond my bacon obsession at Hans, the whole menu is good. The burgers, the cheap steak (with A1, don't ask, but somehow it just works on this 'steak'),  the club sandwich and even the bibimbap are all winners. The only thing i've ever ordered that was bunk, was the CHX teriyaki. It was bland and not very saucy. When in doubt, go saucy. If they grilled it, i'd try it again.
Quick, tasty, and cheap. This place is a classic greasy spoon diner with a dash of Korean.  Try the kimchi omelette.

My husband and I stumbled on this little cafe and thought we give it a try. Their prices were awesome considering it was San Francisco. The food was great and it was a cute little hole in the wall cafe. The owners and workers there were very friendly.
Great value, good food served fast in this friendly family spot!  Nothing fancy about it, but don't miss out on the great value based on the looks of the place!
Han's isn't pretty, but it's got a greasy spoon vibe going for it that I liked. The BFast chow? Meh

You can NEVER tell a book by its cover, therefore, do not pass this place by simply because it has a 2-star exterior.  This is a hole in the wall, homestyle diner that has great service and great food.

I like this place much better than the coffee shop across the street. Fast and friendly and very seldom is there a crowd.  I enjoy the bul-go-gi omelet and the breakfast special for a traditional start.
Friendly place. Ordered eggs florentine and they didn't balk when I asked for avocado instead of spinach. It came out of the kitchen in what seemed like eight seconds. No complaints.

Pretty happy to live across the street from Han's Coffee Shop!  Don't be put off by the decor. It looks every bit greasy spoon but it's the total opposite. From early breakfast to late lunch, Han's Coffee Shop doesn't pretend to be anything but a neighborhood diner serving basic, filling meals with a few Korean offerings mixed in.

Kind of your typical greasy spoon diner, except perhaps for the unique selection of Asian take on omelettes, of which I ordered the Kimchi omelette. The first thing I noticed was that it was huge. It also wasn't as spicy as I'd hoped. Also, very busy- the place filled up fast.
Weiiird....
Fine for a quick, standard, greasy breakfast. Nothing too special here, just a good ole American breakfast menu. Service was fine and quick
Where do I begin...well for starters I dined here on Sunday and frankly haven't had the energy to write this review--it was that BAD!

Food was evolving good a few months ago and now it sucks again when I was there the other day. You can not get a real dinner. I will not try again. They can not make up their minds on what to serve. Sine I live close by I stop in for a beer and burger once and a while. Burger is good that is about it. To many good places to eat nearby to waste your time there.

Just left from a delicious lunch consisting of a veggie burger, a grilled cheese & a grilled chicken Caesar salad wrap. Everything was delicious and cost effective. The service was also excellent, even though they close from 2:00-5:00, they happily sat us at 1:40. Must stop if you're in the area!

We were nervous when we came here, the place was completely empty on a saturday night at 5:30. The food did not dissapoint, i was able to substitute chicken on the burger and their special sauce on the bun was great. My husband had the lamb burger and enjoyed it too. Restaurant is fairly new, and needs more advertising. Great service!
I dont understand why this place was totally empty on a Saturday at 12:00, but the  chicken and waffles and burgers are were bomb. Would def come here again. Bottomless mimosas!
Service is typically slow. I had my food but no silverware for about 5 minutes and no beverage either. Food is subpar on a good day. Skip this place and eat somewhere else
We stopped in for a quick bite, one of us ordered the sliders and the other the burger and it was best burger I've had in a very long time!

We visited on a Saturday. The service was great. The server was very friend and answered questions and gave recommendations. I ordered the Mac and cheese(added broccoli and bacon) it was very rich and had a balanced taste. It was not too sharp and definitely not bland. The pasta was cooked perfectly still had some bite not mushy or over cooked. Overall I was very glad I decided on the Mac and cheese. My boyfriend had the mr crave burger. I sampled it it had very good flavor and was not dry. The fries were definitely my favorite. Great flavor and not overly greasy. In short next time I go to San Francisco I will definitely visit again.
Great place for a casual, inexpensive brunch with a bit of flair in the Tenderloin. All American breakfast is a good deal. Great service and eggs cooked perfectly.

After receiving an e-mail from a marketing blitz about mrCrave bistro, I thought it would be a good idea to go check it out on a Friday night. No sooner did we settle in at the bar we were nicely greeted by Amanda.  As we were cruising the food and drink menu, along came Duilio who guided us through the menu and gave us a few suggestions.

Maria was great. No wait. Chicken and waffles were very good. Crunchy chicken and very fluffy waffles. Burger was great with egg and chedder. Coffee is decent. Very clean new interior. Beer and wine bar looked well stocked. Get your 15 percent yelp deal.

very limited menu. if there's something on there you're feeling, its an ok place to eat. i don't think the food was worth the price, and i hate serving fries in a metal pail. it looks cute, but not the best to keep the fries crisp and ready.

We wandered in for a Sunday brunch and were the only diners here besides 1-2 other couples, so we got excellent service. :)  Quiet, relaxing, and spacious.  I loved my French toast.  Don't forget to check in via Yelp to get 15% off your bill!  They also served a Jolly Rancher with our check.  Candy girl forever!
You get 15% off your bill with a yelp check-in, fyi!

I came here with a rather large group (around 10 people) for dinner, and it was awesome! The food was delicious-- I had the burger with a side salad, and the burger was extremely flavorful. I forgot what the rest of my group had, but we all walked out of there with pretty much the same sentiments-- the food was good, the environment was perfect for our needs, and the drinks were delicious. The manager came over to check on how we were, which was a really nice added touch. I know there are some not-so-great reviews below, but I would definitely check this place out again. There's also free validated parking for up to 2 hours if you spend at least $20.

My co-worker brought me here for lunch, her third visit, my first. I ordered an omelet with spinach, mushrooms, and tomatoes while she had a burger with the rosemary frites. When my food arrived, I thought that the portion was too small, but as soon as I took a bite....wow! I know some might say it's just an omelet, how can you mess that up but...this was the BEST omelet I've ever had! And the portion wasn't small at all, I barely finished it! The owner also sent us a sample of their latest roasted veggies which was delicious. They also sent us a sample of their latest dessert to try...a combination cheesecake + gelato + orange topping. Sooo good! The staff is great, the owner is super nice, the place is super clean, the food is delicious and priced right...will definitely be back. Highly recommend this place! I wish them all the best!

My boyfriend and I paid a visit to Mrcrave last Saturday morning and at a cursory judgment; we both were concerned. It was past 10 and the place was completely empty. Not a good sign.. or so we thought.

How do you screw up a order of eggs and bacon, with toast? Come here and find out! Frozen breakfast potatoes, eggs cooked incorrectly, bacon brought out still drowning in grease. Service didn't ask what we wanted to drink; didn't know what they had. Everytime I asked if they had something, they had to leave and go ask the kitchen; this was simple requests such as hot sauce and what type of juices they had. I am glad I find the 15% discount on Yelp while sitting here....

This place was terrible. We were in town for the Nike's Women's Marathon and this was about all that would take a reservation Saturday night. We walked into a weird atmosphere of guys playing boards games and dressed up like a Halloween party. We were seated but it took the waitress about 20 minutes to greet us and then take our order. I ordered the chicken and when it came, half was cooked and half was under cooked and bloody red. Four of our chicken dishes were not cooked. The waitress never came back to check on us and I had to get the manager over. She managed to take off four of the meals but should have taken the whole bill. It was a disaster of a meal and I would never recommend this place. They need better waitstaff and a better menu.
Such high ratings...so I went.  Ordered chicken and waffles.

I had lunch here today for the first time. My hamburger was excellent and the service was quick and friendly. The interior was very nice and not what you would expect for the area. This place is a gem in the Tenderloin. My server said the restaurant has been open only two months. I hope it catches on because this place deserves business.
what they dont know if that im a FC for san francisco I have gone to this place now three times.   My burger is never well done like i ask for it.  I have had to go back 3 times today. :(
THE BEST BURGER EVER!! That's all you need to know, just go!

Came in a week ago for beer and a meeting! Great spot! Not loud and great food. The staff is friendly too! Defiantly coming back next time I'm in SF!  Gotta try some more of the heavenly foods! Defiantly wanna try breakfast next time around the area.

Connected to the Cova Hotel in the Tenderloin is a one off called Mrcrave. The layout is modern, much of IKEA greens yellows and purples in the interior. The wine menu looks delicious and so does the layout, but the wine menu does not state where the vineyards are located. When I asked the waiter, he unfortunately, too, did not know where the vineyards were located.
Boat noodles !!!! So delicious & it has so much flavor. Awesome thai place with reasonable price and bYOB! ;)

Was not impressed. Ordered delivery so maybe that was the issue. Had the pineapple friend rice and it was soggy and bland, the chicken curry was flavored ok but seemed to use the cheap parts of the chicken you wouldn't want. Won't go back, Modern Thai was better and cheaper.
Tried delivery tonight and although it took an hour- it was worth the wait. So tasty, fresh, flavorful, and piping hot. I like that there is online ordering too. Good portions and reasonable prices.
Their pad Thai is amazing! But they are best known for their noodle soup. Large portions of good food for a low price (by SF standards), what is there to complain about?

They have a menu on the wall just in Thai but it is seriously delicious noodle soup.  I have no idea what it is, my Thai friend told me just to order it.  The other favorite is the Fresh rolls.  Rice noodle sheet wrapped around spring roll contents is a world of deliciousness...good riddance rice paper.
This review is based on delivery; 2 hrs anytime is ridiculous. Pineapple fried rice was great and the Pad See Ew was good but quite dry.

Ordered Tom yum soup, asked for spicy and also an eggplant chicken dish. Soup was sweet and the tasted unlike the tom yum I've had anywhere else in SF (and Thailand). The chicken dish was unnecessarily oily and over salted. Tried this place in hopes of finding a new thai delivery option but won't be ordering again.

It was my first time going to this place by my SF friend's recommendation. He told me that Thai style boat noodle is really famous here and I never heard of it and tried it before. So I was worried and nervous to try this food, so I ordered small bowl which is like only $3! When the food came out and tried, it had a new taste that I never tried it before. I recommend that you try it, if you never tried it before. Get the small one first because you might not like it.

The boyfriend and I were trying really hard not to melt, so we decided to not go outside for dinner. This meant it was the perfect time to try out a new delivery place. I vetoed his usual Thai place (since their prices rose substantially and they had a $3 delivery fee) and voted for Zen Yai since it came up on my Eat24 with some pretty excellent ratings and free delivery.
Very tasty yellow curry paired with some yummy spicy noodles and tofu! Definitely will be coming here again.
This place is soooo good. When you walk into a thai place and only see thai on the wall, you know you are in good hands.

They called after i submitted my order and said it will take 1.5hrs for delivery. I said that's ok, just get here as quick as you can. 1:45minutes pass and I call them and they said my order was canceled.  They did apology but did not offer to remedy the problem.
when walked in it was like a hole in the wall kind of place.

Now I know where to go for my boat noodle fix. I love how they have the small size bowl option and you can order as many small sizes of different varieties as you want till you're full. Just like in Thailand. Next time I'll have to let them know to make my orders less sweet. Everything I got came out on the sweeter side.

My friend suggested Zen Yai for a Wednesday dinner after reading about it in SF Weekly. Zen Yai is your stereotypical Tenderloin Asian restaurant, straddling the border of sanitary and dirty. The menu is pretty extensive and includes the usual staple Thai dishes (Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, etc).

A-OK, so the 3 star rating goes, about sums it up.  We ordered delivery on a Thursday night.  It arrived super fast and piping hot, but I just wasn't that impressed with the quality of the food.  We tried the pad thai and one the chicken with black bean/garlic sauce and veggies.  Both were just OK, I've had far better in the area for about the same price.

Wow.. This place is pretty damn good. I've stopped by on several occasions for the duck noodle soup, which is pretty spot on authentic and amazingly good. The papaya salad was alright, but could have been better if I had ordered it spicy. They serve late night rice porridge that I hope to be back for at some point.

Service is great. The food is delicious. There's not an over powering smell or flavor of fish sauce like many of the restaurants. Curries, soups and rice dishes are all very well prepared. The prices can't be beat either.

This place is as authentic as it gets. The food is very tasty and the service is phenomenal. I ordered a Pad Thai which by the way came with tofu, egg, chicken and shrimp with no extra weird charge, Fresh Spring Rolls and BBQ chicken. After receiving the bill and almost leaving I told the waitress that I couldn't leave without trying their sticky rice with mango, which was a fantastic decision because it was scrumptious. I am definitely going back, especially because my wallet loved them just as much as I did.
Note: this is a review of delivery service/delivery thru
Great authentic boat noodle. Worth a visit.

Awful. Ordered delivery that was supposed to take between 30-45 mins and it took an hour 45. Food was cold and tasted awful. The pad thai had only 2 small pieces of chicken and it lacked any kind of flavor. The fried chicken wontons were gross. I will never eat here again.
the best boat noodle in san francisco
Great mango & sticky rice!

Don't get me wrong. I just don't get t why people like it here. Authentic Thai food? Ehh..maybe because all of people working there are Thais. Ehh..maybe they have so many choice of Thai menus. But listen up..I've had it better. This place is not really clean, like the hole in the wall.
legit thai  food when you can't go straight to thailand
Had the glass noodle salad, boat noodle, duck noodle... All really good! Pretty close to what we had in Thailand

Amazingly authentic Thai food, but very reasonable prices. Most of the customers were Thai when I was there, always a good sign (I think I was the only farang in the place)! Style is more like street food, but everything we had was excellent--and service was really great, fast and friendly. This is now our go-to Thai restaurant in SF.

It's only okay. Been here twice for lunch and order the Combo #2 each time. The pad thai is good, but there is something lacking with the curry. It's plenty of food, including a baseball-sized round of rice, two fried wontons, a little salad, a small portion of pad thai with two shrimp (which they do not devein very well... I had to clean shrimp poop from my shrimp both times I was there... not ideal), and a small bowl of curry with potatoes and I guess what passes for chicken these days.

LOVE LOVE LOVE. After returning from my trip to Thailand since December, I have yet to find a place that has boat noodles. What are boat noodles? Amazing broth made of pork blood for the most part.. The flavors sit extremely well in the noodles itself. It is served with a bit of morning glory veggie, fried pork skins, and some pork meat balls. As you can tell, I ordered the pork rendition of this dish. You can also ask for it in beef. The traditional way is pork; i like tradition. ***It also comes with dried chili so make sure you ask for it without if you can't handle the heat.
this review is based entirely on their Thai boat noodle soup dish:
I love this place! It was the only Thai restaurant that I could stomach 3 months after coming back from Thailand.

I really like this place.  Over the years the food became better, then went through a bit of a slump, and now has came back with a vengeance.  The best part is, it is family owned.  The owner is one of the nicest guys you could meet and still makes deliveries as well as manages his business.  He and his wife make sure everyone feels welcomed and the staff's inviting smiles makes eating here a pleasurable experience from the start.  But the food, the food will have you coming back time and time again.  My tip of the day: try the boat noodle bowl. The small is under 3 bucks and is well worth the try.

I went there today with my wife. We order our usual dishes (beef noodles). It is one of their best dish at Zen Yai. It is well known among the Thai community in the Bay Area that if you want beef noodles, it is the place to go. I got to say on this visit, Zen Yai did not disappoint, the noodles was so good and the portion is just right for a large. The small portion is a bit small although, the small size portion is the size that most food stall in Bangkok will serve you. I wished Zen Yai was located in a nicer neighborhood.

I was a little overwhelmed with the questions that came with ordering the off-menu boat noodles.  Small for $2.50, or a full order for $6.95?  Pork or beef? Choice of 4 types of noodles (ho fun, thin rice noodle, clear noodle, some that sounds like "special" noodle)?  Spiciness level?  The waitress said it so fast, my friend just sat in a daze and had to ask again.  The noodles are great, though.  Really rich and flavorful.

We came here for the boat noodles and were not disappointed! We ordered it with beef and wide noodles. I asked to have it made WITHOUT blood. Important to call this out so that there are no surprises when you get your order. It was so delicious!!! $2.50 for the small bowl was perfect to get a taste of the boat noodles. It was 5 bites. I wish I had ordered a large bowl as a meal though. There were different chilis and the broth was tasty - spicy and flavorful. Felt like comfort food!

I came here because I wanted to try to boat noodle! my boyfriend is Thai and he's been to different thai restaurants that serve boat noodle, but none of them are as authentic as this place! for only $2.50 you're able to get a small bowl!
I suppose it's best to stick to the dishes that came highly recommended by others yelpers unless you want to do the hit and miss method.
As mentioned in my tip, here are the must-order items:

Wow very surprised by all the negative service reviews, but despite people's warnings, I decided to be my own judge. Found free time to come by with my boyfriend after seeing a friend's instagram picture. I love to eat thai food and was pleasantly surprised that I haven't seen all there is to offer. I've never heard of boat noodles until I saw the post.
hey, this pizza is pretty good, and then you can bring it into edinburgh next door.

Seriously delicious drunk munchy pizza. Loacted right next to my crews regular bar Eddinburg Castle, Irving Pizza offers fresh (and sometimes not so fresh) slices for the drunken messes we become after too many shots and too many beers spilled down our nice blouses.
Slow service.  Dirty store front. Pizza was a little worse than I expected even given these circumstances.
the pepperoni pizza is great - the pepperoni is a little charred and it curls up.  the buffalo wings are also tasty - it had panko like breading and spicy.

The pizza by the side selection is good: they had the basic cheese, pepperoni, and supreme, but also a veggie-pesto, Hawaiian, and mushroom. The service however was appalling, even for an order at the counter pizza by the slice place. Maybe after the world cup ends the cashier will not need to be asked for the pizza that's already paid for twice before it's then over cooked, forgotten about one more time and delivered.

Whenever I've had enough of my clean eating plans and want to cheat, I always default to ordering a cheese pizza from Irving. Sometimes when I'm feeling extra naughty, I'll even get the deep-fried oreos (and spend the next three days feeling guilty about it). I have so many good memories of ordering from here when everything else was closed. Without exception, my pizza have always arrived on time, and the delivery guys have always been polite. The pizza itself is tasty and well-cooked. It's pizza, what more is there to say about it? I like the tomato sauce they use, and you can also customize a pizza.
Irving is the best pizza in the Tenderloin, without a doubt.
what i ordered.... slice of pepperoni

I like the pizza---tastes wonderful! But NOW y'all are skimping on the toppings.  Come on now....if you need to tack on a quarter or whatever to the $1 per topping price, THEN DO SO, but PLEASE don't deliver a pizza with barely nothing on it! When I order five toppings, I don't want to see the sauce or crust, just saying....step it up Irving!

We have so much love for Irving Pizza. It's everything a solid pizza joint is supposed to be. Those of you who are coming here and expecting like, gourmet and high-end food are frankly just being whiny and spoiled. This is a place that's open until 2am, hot and almost always fresh. You can't complain about that!
The gist: Your typical but delicious pizza, fried oreos, great service.

To paraphrase Homer Simpson "the two sweetest words in the English language are De Fault!" That is exactly what this is late at night in the Sunset.  You will be impressed with the volume of different slices that have sausage on them.  Their pesto is a greasy masterpiece.  Enjoy any time but late night always seems better.
Being bothered.
Not the best, but good for satiating late night hunger pangs.  Slices are decently priced for what it is.
I've given this place so many opportunities to impress me over the years, But it just doesn't cut it.

This isn't the best pizza on earth, but it's good and really welcome after spending a few hours at one of the nearby bars and needing decent sustenance to soak up some of that alcohol. A wide variety of slices are almost always available right away, the appetizers are tasty and the prices are good. Personally, I like to keep it basic with the pepperoni but the combo and pesto pizzas are good too. The servers are also friendly and accommodating to the masses of intoxicated customers that pour in after midnight.
A great place to grab a burger, pizza or a salad.  My new back-up lunch place for when I forget to bring mine, or when i purposefully forget.

You know, it's not bad pizza. They make the dough fresh, always a few pies ready to order by the slice, staff is friendly, and there's usually a soccer game on the TV. But it's still a basic street pizza place, last time I was there the crust was undercooked and doughey, condiments were whatever happened to be on the counter, and best you sop it off with a pile of napkins before eating. I wouldn't go out of my way to order this, but if you need a slice and you're on the block by all means.
Ordered :

I order delivery from this location frequently, and I'm not sure why I still do. My first two pizzas were AMAZING and it has consistently gone downhill from there. The toppings have become fewer and fewer - even when I order and pay for extra. The delivery times are very inconsistent, even when ordered during a slow time of day. I've received delivery on two separate occasions where the pizza has been barely above room temperature.

I order from Irving pizza quite a lot. I love that they give you the choice between tomato, pesto or ranch sauce for every pizza you order. The ranch ones are absolutely amazing! Yes, sometimes they mess up your order, but whenever it happens, they are always ready to make it up to you. Oh and they have friendly staff too!

Went there around 1AM, only one person working behind counter as cashier, taking phone orders and heating up slices. He forgot about my friends & mine pizza slices as he wasn't multi-tasking very effectively. So after 5-6 minutes of reheating slices he finally takes them out and they were way over-cooked. He sticks 'em on one paper plate like nothing's wrong. Asked to have new slices and guy had an attitude problem about it, stating he didn't over-cook them at all (nearly black on the bottom) and has been cooking slices like this for 20-something years. Yeah, it shows! No apologies for making us wait so long either. I've never been to this pizza joint, I usually ALWAYS go to Milan up the street (who are less pricey and WAY more friendly plus their pizza tastes better) but my friend insisted we go there and try a new place. BIG mistake, lesson learned. 1.5 stars.

When you just got kicked out of Edinburgh castle next door, you can always hit this place up. They actually have a sick burger, it's surprisingly good. Decent prices, fast service. What more do you want from a pizza spot.

I don't know why I keep coming here. Actually, I do - it's en route from Van Ness to my apartment, and if it's late at night and I've just gotten off the bus on my way home and I'm hungry, it has fries. But that's honestly the best thing I can say about it.
Good for a quick bite to hold you over until you can eat something else. Had a slice of the Pesto feta, which was good but not at Pieces in midtown Sacramento's level of deliciousness.
I tried a lot of Different pizza's but when I went to try Irving pizza on Geary it was really good and fresh I highly recommend. Very good service also.

At 6:55PM I had placed my order through Grubhub. As usual, an e-mail confirmation, and two text messages were sent to keep me in track of the ETA. 7:40PM - 7:50PM, it said. Silly to take that long for a burger and fries. But as with my (pleasanter) experiences with Grubhub orders, especially if it's a smaller order, and the restaurant closer to my apartment, more often than not, the wait is shorter. Sillier too, perhaps for me, that I didn't just pick up the order, since they're only a couple of blocks away. But it's cold out, and I'm exhausted, and all I really want to do is pig out on some grease slop. So much so I felt warped in fevered delirium, and thinking generously, that when my order comes, I've got a big fat tip to whoever brings my food. 7:40PM came and went. I'm growing more impatient. And then 7:50PM: by now I'm chain-smoking in hopes of alleviating the hunger, and the simmering temper that arises from a combination of hunger, work exhaustion, tardiness of others, and incompetence.
Blot your pie, fold, and enjoy. Pizza with a New York attitude, can't beat that! I especially liked their pesto and cheese pizza.

Ordered  margarita pizza which comes with tomatos and basil and in hour and a half im getting pizza from rude and stoned delivery person who has no change... but this is not it. its cold and has NO basil!!!! When i called back they to ask WTF they said that they actually out of basil just forgot to tell me.... the WORSE service experiense ever!!!
Some of the better slices in the tenderloin..chicken parm sandwiches are pretty good
Most crisp and fluffy pizza I've had in the City. I consider myself a pizza connoisseur and this is a pizza (when fresh) is definitely worth buying!
Used to give this place great reviews, but curbside manner of delivery and poor standards have really dropped the quality of this establishment which started off in the Sunset, where I used to live.

I barely remember this place as it came on the tail end of a great bar hoppin' trip through the area, but definitely recall the pizza as being a great nightcap. The owners must love all the hungry drunkards that stumble through the door... The place is kinda small but has a very high ceiling.
Ordered Delivery:

I ordered a bacon cheeseburger tonight with "supposedly" garlic fries and a side order of jalapeno poppers. The Garlic wasnt even cooked on my garlic fries it was raw and nasty YUCK! The burger was delicious cooked well done just the way I like it. The poppers was crispy and hot when it came to me a lil spicy. I spend about $16 on the food not too bad. I was gonna call to complain about it but I decided to just throw it away oh well

Pizza is decent, but dealing with the employees at this location isn't worth it. They won't get any more of my money until they get rid of the current staff behind the counter and also doing deliveries.
I have eaten ALOT of pizza in this city and this is by far one of my faves, and I randomly found it by using
Irving pizza is one of those few places I like to frequent whether I'm drunk or not. huge slice of combo pizza for $4. hell yes.
The pineapple-ham and cheese slices are nice-- especially when you've got the late-night munchies, but these fools-- with the exception of one employee-- are incompetent, careless, assholes.
Greasy! But they are open late... way too greasy for me though even when drunk...
Breakfast all day.  Fast service for a sit down restaurant.  Steady quality.  Good for late night.

Terrible. I have nothing great to say about this place. Bad food, service, and staff. The guy at the front was on the phone the entire time. We walked in and he pointed where he wanted us to sit. He then proceeded to be on the phone for the next 40 minutes. Meanwhile, no one else was greeting or seating guests. The food was beyond terrible. Greasy. The bad kind. Like there was a new chef or something. Not coming back here. Don't waste your time.
Came 2 days in a row for food. Service was good and food was great! Plus Bloomingdales is across the street...woohoo!

We came here because our (crappy) hotel was very nearby.  This is NOT a good neighborhood... a few blocks down the hill is quite sketchy, but we enjoyed our dessert here after a long day of touristy walking.  We got apple pie a la mode and it was delightful.  I liked choosing a song on the jukebox.  If you want to feel like you are in the 60's, head here!

When did this place get so rundown.  The staff is arguing, pushed to the limit, and it is just so wrong.  It took over ten minutes to get water because they had no clean glasses.  My server was not interested in serving me, nor was anyone else there.

This is a typical diner. Came here for breakfast and it was pretty underwhelming. Ordered french toast and diced ham and eggs. The food was pretty good as far as diner breakfasts go, but the service was a bit slow and the food took forever to come out - people who came in after us were getting their food before us.
I usually love Mel's Diner when I'm looking for some good ol' diner food.

10 dollars for a turkey burger, 5 dollars for a "cup" of chili. Throughly unimpressed. The coleslaw was god awful. I ate my two items and walked away feeling like I ate a 7 dollar meal, not a 20 dollar one...
The chicken pot pie is very satisfying.

Have any eaten at Mel's Diner once before (the one on Lombard). We decided to eat there because it was attached to The Opal hotel. My husband went down and got the food as I had just had surgery. Big negative is that they don't deliver. They have Waiter on Wheels which delivers through their website, but I could find everything on their menu to order that way. The second negative was the food was very expensive. The food was only ok, but I wouldn't go their again.

This place used to be so good when I was a kid. Now it's awful and my friend and I were totally disappointed! We went here cause we were seeing the movie Annabelle at the amc 14. We waited a long time for our food and what we got was mediocre. The spaghetti and meatballs were water sauce and 2 tiny meatballs. That for $13.25 oh no! My friend got the platter and was pissed only 2 onion rings!
Had lunch here today with a group of 12 for a going away party.

Waited 10-15 to place an order and food sat for 15-20 before it was brought to us. Not to mention they charge for everything, I learned they charged for ranch when the bill came. I could have did without. Took forever to refill my water, I understand it was backed up but, damn. Don't wanna come back.
worst tuna salad ever, and to make matters worst the price.
Eh. food was ok. Got the usual potato skins and San Francisco Hot Dog, they were the same. Nothing Special.

Been here a few times, and I love how many options there are and that they have a mini jukebox at the tables. This place is pretty much like a dennys/rubys combined. The food is good and the portions are big. Not a bad choice for a late night snack.

This place is amazing the food is great. The prices are really good. It is a fun place to hangout, I will come back again. There is nothing wrong with this place at all. The food comes out very quickly.  The drinks are tasty. I recommend the cafe mocha!
Came here after the bars because it was close and open. I made a huge mistake.

While the food and atmosphere here are decent, the service left something to be desired. As we were staying at the Monarch Hotel down the street, we went to Mel's for several meals - aside from the very first we had there, we spent minutes watching our orders grow cold under the heat lamps in the kitchen. The staff was uninformed of what the kitchen was missing, forcing us to reorder and create a longer delay in service.
The High Protein Breakfast was hot and fresh. The asparagus was tough at the one end. Friendly service.
Service was busy but that's what I expected for 2am.
This place is the perfect place to eat after partying.  Good food, clean and quick. I've been coming here for about 15 years and it never disappoints.

I used to be a fan of Mel's -- either this location or the one on Geary -- but haven't visited in a while, having moved to another neighborhood a few years ago. But some errands in the vicinity prompted me to pop in for a late breakfast -- and a serious disappointment. I ordered the top sirloin steak and eggs, having had similar dishes at Mel's in years past with happy results. Alas, things seem to have changed.
Rip off. Orange juice $5 dollars with no refills and my wedge of orange that came on my entrée looked rotten. Standards people please.
Rude and really nasty female answers the phone on 07/17/214 around 9:00 PM...sounded high on meth...hung up on us when inquiring on hours. Avoid!

Went for breakfast jones ing for corned beef hash and eggs and was disappointed;  didn't want to form an opinion based on one visit; went back for chili and was very disappointed. Service is just OK, prices high, food sucks

This place isn't bad, it's just not special. A regular diner experience. It was brunch so we got some French toast and it was pretty good. The food is average with the exception of the milkshakes which are absolutely fantastic. They are what I suppose made the trip worth it. Overall, it isn't great but you'll get your money's worth.
Average food.  Slightly below average service.  Don't waste your time here.

This place is terrible. I don't even want to leave 1 star but don't have an option. The waiters and waitresses are morons and the manager doesn't seem to be any better. I found melted plastic in my food, they forgot my sodas, brought me pancakes instead of biscuits and gravy(wtf, really?), forgot my fries and what I did get tasted like poop and gave me the worst stomach ailments after. Jeesh I felt bad for leaving no tip because my waiter seemed new and he was trying to be polite but come on! I deserve a tip after THAT experience. It's like he couldn't understand me. Ugh

Good for late night and post movie food or to cure a wretched hangover. This is standard diner food so don't expect the Ritz but great for a filling comfort food meal. Standard all day breakfast, burgers and fries and coffee and pie. Try the sundaes they're great.
Back in the day of real food, the open faced hot turkey sandwich was good.

Ok place for late night food. The service was quicker than I thought it would be. I ordered the fish and chips and a side of sweet potato fries. The fish was average but the tartar sauce didn't look fresh and it tasted sour.
Food was okay.  Service was about the same.  Not a place I would recommend but not terrible.
Typical American food. Went here for lunch, and I got pancakes, because I love pancakes!
I went back because it is a sketchy neighborhood and the place across the street smelled of meat so this was really the only option.
It's a great, typical American drive in. The food is very nice and the place comfortable and relaxing. Recommended especially for tourists who want to try something typical.
Been in there twice at night. The first time was a disappointment so I gave it another chance. Same result.
Standard diner fare.  Close to work.  Prompt service and take out.

Very cooperate and gimmicky with average food. The experience is kind of fun, but it gets a little old. The prices are way over the top especially for the drinks. The milkshakes are the best thing about this place, but still nowhere near the best. A few times there is enough. There's nothing new or exciting about it after a while. No signature flavor or item making me want to come back.

Was not greeted and it took about 3 minutes to be seated in a very sparsely populated diner. It was over 4 minutes before we had a menu.  The food (breakfast) showed up quickly but was very disappointing.  The hash browns were neither brown or hot - we asked for and received  - the same and they were better but not. I did not ask for onions in my omelette but they were there - I guess that was instead of the cheese.
Got some pizza delivered from here. It was good, I would give the edge to Escape from NY.

I was about to order from here, but i tried to call and apparently they cant be bothered to answer their phone, so I will spend my money elsewhere. Blows my mind how many businesses can't get te basics right. How hard is it to answer your phone. You're a business....

This place is a bit unconventional for you SF snobs but it does the job.  The price point is lower than most pizza places.  We were able to serve 15 people dinner with two of the giant pizzas (Pepperoni and Hawaiian - he said he ran out of chicken) and a dozen wings for less than $55.  What a steal!    With the leftover money, we bought soda and cups from the next door liquor store and even had $15 to donate to the Homeless Church of San Francisco.

If you've ever been to NYC for a slice of pizza, you're NEVER going to find a comparable piece in SF for less than $3. The more ritzy places in SF will offer a pizza similar to NYC, but you're going to pay a premium. With that being said, enjoy your pizza and just move on with your life.

Real easy.  If you think Papa John's is good pizza, then this place has good pizza.  If you actually know what good pizza tastes like, this is not the place for you.  How it came up as No. 1 on Yelp for the Union Square area is beyond me.  Gotta go, gonna have one more slice of this all bread pizza.
Heck no!!! Don't do it!!!!! I asked about when the pizza was made he told me yesterday then asked me to leave. Lol rude!

When I'm sober, this place deserves 3 stars. It doesn't taste anything like New York pizza. It's in one of SF's most ghettoist neighborhoods and those homeless people lingering around outside of this place at night is just plain scary (esp when we were in our hootchie dresses - seriously, what were we thinking??)
This is the epitome of the little divey pizza place.
New York pizza this is NOT, says this New Yorker!
Just get two slices of Cheese for $5-that's the extent of this review,plus,it's open late!
Open late.  Crispy crust.  Piping hot.  Gooey and greasy.

This is not New York pizza. That said, it's not terrible. It's just the opposite of what you'd expect, given the name. The crust is crispy and thick. The cheese is fine, nothing memorable, and I honestly can't recall what the sauce tasted like. It's just basically the minimum requirements for calling something pizza. We also ordered wings which were, again, just ok and came with an odd tasting ranch.

What a disappointment! They tried to rip me off on the phone and then the pizza tastes like chewy cardboard. The cheesecake is half frozen and tastes very old. I was really hoping for a good pizza tonight but this is just disappointing.
The two guys who run the place are so nice and friendly! They always welcome you and are prompt.
One of the great thing of buying local is eating from these fantastic pizza shop.

I used to order here a lot but the service all of a sudden became HORRIBLE! I feel so upset because I used to be a loyal customer and now they treat LOYAL CUSTOMERS like SHIT. ONE STAR ONLY FOR THE PIZZA. Other than that don't trust ordering from a pizza place that is run by a shitty mouth manager. =) Just a heads up.
I ordered and paid for my food. To find out an hour later they told me to call eat 24 hours get a refund they are closed. This place is a bunch of jerks.
BEST part is they delivers to your HOTEL!
Was confronted with older gentleman delivery driver who was belligerent with me after
Meh.  Nothing special and definitely nothing NY about it.  Acceptable cheese slices and they take credit cards.  The crust is way too thick to be New York style.
Is it gourmet? No.
This is a booming place! Delivered right to our hotel & in half the time they said. Pizza was yummy & soda was ice cold!

This is not new York pizza! Crust is too thick. And delivery was about 2 hours after we called for an order the pizza. The pizza came to our hotel cold. Had an awful experience at this place. If I wanted a cold pizza, I would of gotten Tombstone Pizza at a supermarket and leave it out in the sun for an hour. I still would of had my pizza faster than their delivery service. Oh yeah, they're skimpy on the peppers and cheese too.
Placed an order for a large pizza, wings, salad and pop to be delivered.  We were promised that the pizza would arrive in 40 minutes and it came promptly before.

Love this place! Whenever in San Francisco for the evening, we come here! The pizza is awesome! Better by the slice than the whole pizza. Veggie and Combo are the best. And price is very reasonable. The guy remembers me too even though not a true regular.

I had just moved back to the city in April and found one of there menus on my building door. I looked at there prices and they seemed reasonable. I had been a loyal customer for five months and ordered from them at least once a week. Pizza was pretty good. Here's why I'm giving them 1 star now...One night I had the flu and ordered up a pizza...unfortunately my medication kicked in and I fell asleep a half hour later. I didn't hear my phone as they tried to deliver. I felt bad and tried to call the delivery guy the next day...he didn't answer. A week later I called for a pizza...the usual guy that answers the phone said the manager was refusing service. I asked for the manager to explain what happened and he refused to come to the phone. Wow..that's it?! I give you business once a week! I guess they don't need my business or apology. If there menus ARE EVER on my bldg. they will be thrown away!

It's pizza so it's hard to go wrong.  I enjoyed it but found it a bit too soggy.  I tried the cheese at $2.70 a slice.  It was thin but not as thin as would have expected from a place with New York in the name.
very good well cooked thin crust style pizza and the price is very decent compared to the other places. so yeah great pizza at a great price hard to beat.
Had the meat-atarian pizza delivered to the hotel.. Can't remember the name of the pizza, though.

Funny story:  I went on a Pizza RAMPAGE.  My man said Blondie's pizza was hella good and I was all like HELLA NAH so I drove down (yes, in Sunday Traffic, DOWNTOWN) and found a parking space (godd*mn I am teh Parking GOD) and grabbed a Slice of some-fancy-name slice of Pizza at Blondies.  Wow.  The crust tasted like bread.  Not pizza bread, just baked crispy bread.  Big disappointment.
close to the hotel, piping hot and dripping with grease. was the perfect hangover pizza.
Every now and then I branch out from my usual Victor's Pizza and try something new.
