Ok, so it probably isnt the best pizza out there but it sure seemed like it to me at 3am after a long night of drinking. My slice of cheese pizza had just the right amount of cheese and tasty sauce.

If I can give this place NO stars that would be awesome.  I had to make a drive back to this area after 4 months to yelp the a-holes here.  A few months back we came in to get some pizza after drinking at 181...now that is another story to tell.  My gfs and I walk in and order and we paid these a-holes.  So we were sitting there waiting and waiting and waiting....we go up to the guy and ask.
The neighborhood is sketchy but only a couple blocks from the Westfield shopping center. The pizza is not great nor bad. It tasted good, was hot and priced fairly.
4 Stars
Thanks for absolutely nothing, New York Pizza Kitchen.

For delivery pizza this place is pretty great.  I'm not sure what crack the people are smoking that gave NYPK 2 stars or below.  They blow the doors off cable car, mr. pizza man and several others.  The pizza is always hot when it arrives and it's thin crust, not too much cheese, and a perfect amount of sauce is perfect.  I really like their hawaiian.  4 big stars for NYPK!
2.5 stars.  Pure mediocrity...sauce tasted like it was fresh from a can.  Crust was too chewy for my taste and the toppings were rather sparse.  Price wasn't too bad and delivery was fast.

Mushroom and Sausage pizza: the pizza seemed to lack toppings and the sauce was a little heavier than I usually like on a pizza. The crust was kind of stale, but maybe it was just an off day for them.
Love this Cafe!  Chester is the man with the magic touch on the expresso machine!!  My fav is the white mocha.  The food is great too!

I'm updating my review to grant Cafe Bean three stars instead of the one star I gave them in 2007 in a pique of annoyance that they wouldn't let me plug my laptop into the wall. That was seven years ago, this is now, the owner has reconsidered and asked me to do the same. I think it's a perfectly nice little cafe, very humble and comfy, the window pillow seat is a nice place to lounge as others have said.

Perfect example of a great local SF find! The service is fantastic - down to earth, humble owners. Even though the space is small, the cafe has a comfy homey feel with the mixture of nook seating and communal seating areas.

Great java for the morning and good beer on tap for the late afternoon, with a creative food menu to boot. If you're a coffeeshop aficionado like me and avoid Starbucks like the plague, this is the alternative. Chester, the owner, is a great guy if you get to know him. Outdoor seating too. It's my neighborhood coffee shop for a reason.

I was walking around the area looking for a good inexpensive breakfast. I order a croissant ham, egg, & cheese with a small hot chocolate only for $10.28 Not bad for the city. Keep in mind you will be leaving with a happy tummy. =p

Awesome spot. Don't go if you're in a rush because there are only two employees, but if you have time to sit outside on a sunny day, then Chester will hook you up. My favorite breakfast is the "dog in heat" burrito and iced coffee. The brie and veggie sandwich is prefect for lunch.

Quaint, decent food (veggie burrito was much more delicious than I expected when it showed up to my table naked) and coffee is above average. Perks; non dairy milk, staff are helpful and the front porch is a beautiful place to read a newspaper.

Sad little place that evidently survives by local clientele. Saw no smiles from wait staff (1).  You definitely have to be a regular to understand this place. Terrible seating, average food (we ordered egg sandwich on wheat--the one at my home was better).  Will not revisit

Nice quaint spot. I have ordered the earl grey tea with steamed milk, I like that they have honey out on the counter. Their double vanilla latte was delicious, strong and got me buzzing through my studies !

I had a good cafè au lait but the owner is unfriendly and there are no plugs for anybody to charge their computers. This place is bad if you want to stay there and use your computer, but it's ok if you have to get a coffee to go.

Walked in with a friend randomly since we wanted brunch and didn't want to wait out the door and down the street like we would have elsewhere.  It looks more like a take-away coffee shop but we ordered anyways sitting at a table for 8?  We both had omelets which were surprisingly better than I would have thought.  It's reasonably priced with decent Saturday midday brunch fare.  I'd recommend if already in the area and are looking for a brunch spot that bypasses waiting in a line.
This place is a mess. I've gone here a few times, just because it is close to where I work. I feel like its asking for health and consumer code violations.
(First off, I really wish there was a better/more detailed rating system on yelp* as this was easily a 3.5-3.75 star rating, just not quite a 4 star.)
Great for getting some work done, good wifi. The sun in this weather makes the spot in the right corner very agreeable.

Really love coming here for the breakfast. I've eaten here about once every couple days for the past 3 months and have no complaints about the food. Chester's Chai Tea is something I constantly crave and have gotten friends hooked on. The family can have their on and off days when it comes to good customer service, but I figure I would too if I worked in that shop every day. It's nice to go somewhere where the owner knows my name and what I like to order; reminds me of my small town home.
Woo! I'm talking about a WILD ride here folks. Great Yelp!

It took us some days to find THE cafe in San Francisco. We had a week of holidays, walked our feet off and took breakfast in different places every day. Then we went back one evening on Sutter street and saw the Bean - we decided to take breakfast there the next day. After the first visit we always came back, until the holidays were over.

Comfortable, relaxing cafe with a welcoming ambience. It quickly came to feel like an extension of my living room, but with much better food and beverage service. Great place to linger with something to read -- on or offline -- though you may end up eating/drinking more than you intended.
Green tea latte is amazing!
Love this place!!! Food is really good and they are also willing to customize things for people. The coffee is good too and inexpensive. :)

I was in Amsterdam a while ago and loved their pancakes. I had a craving for Dutch pancakes and discovered that Coffee Bean serves them. Their pancake is more like a crepe; thin and light. I ordered the pancake with strawberries. They sprinkled powder sugar and cut the strawberries thin and arranged them nicely on my pancake. Add a little syrup and it was delicious. The cafe has a European flavor and their cappuccino was great. I talked to Chester, the owner of the cafe and he was really nice. I work downtown so it's a bit of a walk, but I will make an effort to go again and try their other pancakes! eet smakelijk!
I have been coming here for quite awhile, since it is my neighborhood coffee shop.
Chester is the best!
Dog in heat breakfast burrito and spinach and Brie on croissant to go with coffee under $15, close to my hotel. Walking distance. It took them a minute to get everything ready but it was yummy.
Great little neighborhood cafe and dinner. Has a range of typical American fare, as well as excellent european style pancakes (aka Crepes).

These guys are great, really. The owner/manager makes an effort to learn the names of his regulars (i am one of them!) and is always super friendly. It's a small cafe but there's a lot of seating and they have two great tables next to their big corner window so it's always sunny and warm! Plus, there are three or four sidewalk tables for when the weather is REALLY nice.

Not sure when their last health inspection was. I ordered a vanilla latte and watched as the barista steamed my milk with an old milk coated steaming wand then stirred it all together with a spoon he pulled out of an opaque cup of water. I don't even want to know how long it had been since that was changed. I'm all for hole in the walls and local businesses, but it's not that difficult to keep a small place clean. In other news, my blueberry muffin was tasty.
I feel like a grandma saying this, but the bread is so soft! I love how you don't have to bite down super hard to get to the delicious Turkey Club. I'd do it again, so do it.

This coffee shop with Wifi is right below my friend's place where I cat sit. The coffee is good and strong, the CAT (Cream Cheese, Avocado, Tomato) bagels are yummy and the guy who has the same last name as me is real nice. The place is clean well lit and cozy inside with a few tables in the sun outside. I need to try a dutch pancake soon, looks good!
cozy,  chairs doesn't match, vegie sandwich was ok but only 3 different kinds of chips, price was moderate. This place was just ok.
Cafe Bean is european in it's breakfast presentations.  there's a choice of omlettes, eggs, dutch pancakes, granola, yogurt, etc.

Hubby said best cup of coffee...he likes it very strong.  Had a cappuccino and split egg & ham croissant sandwich...very good!  They need to update decor so it's more inviting but maybe they don't want people hangin round too long.  Spent $13 with tip.  Service was good...not busy sun am.  Will definitely visit again!

I stopped by here before heading to BART to the airport, and I sure was pleasantly surprised. The owner, Chester, is an extremely nice person and genuinely makes u feel at home in his store. I got the green tea latte n that is a very unusual n tasty concoction. I will definitely be back next time I come to SF
Cozy Coffee Nook in the Hood...
Quite an interesting Monday:
I have a high tolerance for bad things when they are convenient (for example, see my review for Tao Yin Restaurant).  In this case, Bean is near work and it isn't cash only.
kinda made this my normal morning spot... close by and great light. cool place to sit outdoors or in the window if the seats aren't taken. chill place and good expresso.

One of the best cafe mochas i have ever had! (and i am coffee snob)  my husband used to live in San Francisco and when I went to SF for a visit, one of the first places he took me to was here.  I had no idea what to get so he ordered his favorite: large cafe mocha and an "everything" bagel sandwich with creme cheese, tomato, avocado and onion.  And. I. Was. Hooked.  it was super deelish!  Every time I went to San Francisco, i made it a point to stop here for my coffee fix at least a few times!  The coffee was delicious every time i went - especially when it is made by Chester!

The only drink I order from here is the green tea latte but it is AMAZING!  Pretty much the best I've ever had.  Cafe Bean is just down the street from me and gets my vote for favorite coffee shop on the block.

love, love, love cafe bean! I have been coming here since I moved to SF 2 years ago. Chester is a sweetheart! They have free wifi but you'll have to charge your computer somewhere else---there's no place to plug it into. I love their smoked salmon omelette and if you have a sweet tooth, you absolutely must try their dutch pancakes---nutella and banana, to be exact. (you can always ask for extra bananas). Most of the people in the cafe are students and the occasional tourist. It's a great place to people watch on a warm summer day.

Cash only mom n pop shop that makes hearty sandwiches and offers plenty of sides to complete your meal. Sandwiches and combinations  are beyond affordable. The restaurant has been there forever, so you'll see a lot of regulars in and out.
This place will always hold a special spot in my heart, and my stomach.
The Turk & Larkin Deli , is on a sketchy block but the steady stream of customers are mostly via Larkin from the various government offices.
What a pleasant lunch experience. Everything was so fresh and delicious - I will definitely be returning soon.

Big fan of their avocado salad.  Their brocolli salad was tasty as well.  I haven't been able to try their sandwiches, but have only heard compliments.  Enjoyed their meatloaf (probably wouldn't try it solely with their hot sauce next though...felt it was a bit lacking there).  CASH ONLY.
Turkey Sandwich very FRESH and awesome. Kale salad a little to saucy, but very friendly owners. :)

All things being considered, this is probably the best sandwich shop in the Bay Area. First of all, props to the husband and wife owners/operators of this modest shop. They must wake up at the wee hours of the morning just to create their lineup of salads and soups. And what a spread it is.

It's a blast from the past, except that in the past, everything didn't look so old.  I know, I know:  Things from the '50s did look dated even in the '50s, but plastic and vinyl and brown brown brown were at least brighter then.  Or people were hopeful because the war was over, the economy was booming, and they could afford their own little slice of heaven?  I don't know.

Hey It's a Fantastic Cafe my Friend Mike And Jean are the Owner's and have been so for about 30 year's and they gave me permission to advertise their cafe it's a Classic and very inexpensive if you happen to be by the Harrington pub check em out across the street right next to the Tenderloin Housing Clinic .and here is another Classy spot folk's a must stop by.
Very good selection of salads at a reasonable price. Salads are fresh and full of flavors. Quality of food is very good. It is a mom and pop, hole in the wall restaurant with a big menu.

Dollar for dollar, Turk and Larkin Deli is really hard to beat. Good sandwiches, tons of delicious salads, and usually two soups a day to pick from, this is one of my favorite go to lunch spot in the area. Portion sizes are excellent and everything I've had has been tasty. My favorites include the grilled chicken breast (they'll heat it but it's much better cold), chicken noodle soup, dolmas and the avocado salad. Mom and pop owned and operated, if you're in the Tenderloin and hungry for lunch, Turk and Larkin is worthy of a stop.
Nice little mom and pop shop in the tenderloin. The only problem is they only accept cash.... Who carries cash these days??

I've been to Turk larkin deli many times. Love the salad, soups and sandwich choices. Favorite menu item is the combo half sandwich and two salads. This place gets packed at noon.  So head in early or plan on waiting in line. :)
Meatloaf, lasagna, falafel, salads...all super fresh and super yummy!
I was always curious how it felt to live in the 60s - 70s. This place, without trying definitely has the aura of the past.
Well...I finally got over to this place and I am happy I tried it..BUT I have a big BUT (lots of people have a big BUT Dolly... thanks Pee-Wee:-)

This place is great!  Especially for us folks that have the wonderful misfortune of working in the Tenderloin.  The owners are super sweet and friendly and the food is good.  I love the half sandwich and two salads special!!  The rice with the veggie topping and hot sauce is YUMMY!!!  Cash only but still great!

WTF?  Now this is a series of reviews I *really* don't get.  I've recently started working at the Federal Building just down the street.   On basis of these reviews, my coworker and I 'suspended disbelief' and had lunch here against my 'foo-dar'.  At least the window seemed really clean I told myself, so I figured we weren't  likely to get sick.  And we didn't.  That is about as much as I can say about this place.  Had the half chicken.  Dry and tired, way worse than at the Federal Building cafeteria steam table...and that is a low bar indeed.  That hot sauce?  I'd really rather have the option of a bottle of Cholula.  Those salads (had the Greek and the Tabbouleh)?  One was limp and the other dry - from having been hanging around too long....My co-worker's falafel?  I hope they compost. The ambiance?  A (small) step up from St. Anthony's dining room.  If you are looking for a sandwich or a salad and you are in any way a 'foodie' - as in have a sense that you like to eat food that tastes good and is fresh - do yourself a favor:  go a block and a half, and eat at Acre in the SFPUC lobby.

I highly recommend this deli if you're looking for healthier options for lunch, or some variety or both!  I came here with a coworker and he got the meatloaf while I just got beet salad and greek salad.  Both salads were very good and my coworker loved the meatloaf.  I think next time I come in I should try their pastries or a sandwich.  Everything looked so good it was hard to decide.
I love their avocado salad!  It's has a ceviche feel to it, and is very fresh.  I always get it with a turkey sandwich.  The quality, portions and prices are great!

They are an institution. I see regulars in the deli from the courthouse and from the street and the owners treat them like friends. Very friendly owners and they remember you even if you just visit once! Good honest food.
I've been to Turk & Larkin Deli about a dozen times in the last 10 years and always found it to be a dependable, inexpensive place to have a simple lunch.

What can I say the Turk & Larkin Deli hits the spot every time. I love all there salads and there fresh roasted chicken is to die for but don't forget about the clam chowder on Fridays. Overall I highly recommend you stop buy for a bite to eat Mike and Jean run a great deli.
Good food

i like options, but not too many. this place has got something for everyone. for the ones on the atkin's diet there's meats and cheeses, for the ones carb loading there's pasta salads, for the ones who just want a decent meal at a decent price there's just that here. comfy, spacious dining area to eat and gossip. portions are generous and definitely delicious!
The sandwiches are great. Their special hot sauce is HOT!! I love it.
Papa loves Mama.

Love the avocado and the broccoli salads are fantastic!!!  The avocado salad has some lettuce, tomatos and a tangy dressing.  Very rich and fresh tasting.  The broccoli salad has a wonderful white dressing, rich and I love the slices of red onion.

Came here for their half chicken/2 sides combo yesterday.  By the time I got there, at around 1:30, most of their salads were gone but I found 2 that looked good to me, the tabbouleh and 3 beans salad.  The couple who run the place were very accommodating.  When I asked for both chicken pieces to be dark meat, the woman said it doesn't matter to them if I like all white or dark, I still got charged the same ($8).  So I will definitely keep that in mind since many other places do.  The chicken skin was seasoned with a lot of cayenne pepper and it became somewhat overpowering after the 2nd bite and I had to discard the rest of the skin.  The meat, however,was so moist and so tender, I wish there was more.  The salads were also tasty and satisfying.
I'm glad my mom stumbled into this place one day and found out about it.
Looking for adventure? Danger? An awesome old school deli? Turk and Larkin is the place to find all 3!
Amazing!  Lots of delicious homemade salads and sandwiches served up with a warm family atmosphere with GREAT prices!

Turk and Larkin is my go-to place when I don't feel like venturing too far into the TL on my lunch break.  But it's all good because TLD probably offers some of the freshest, healthiest lunch fare in that 'hood.

Consistently good quality 'deli' food with great prices and helpful staff.   Usually have the half chicken special w/two sides (only $7.50!) or the pastrami (in pita) special.   Lots of healthy options with freshly made salads and no-so-healthy like the ambroisia salad but where else in the city can you get something like this?!
Solid food at decent prices near my school! Yes!
Incredible lunch spot!  Amazingly fast, amazingly friendly, and consistently fresh and delicious food.  Chicken noodle soup a real treat!

I got half a veg pita with 2 salads, and I picked hummus and tahini. The lady asked me if I wanted hot sauce. I was like, is it good? And she's like-yeah you want hot sauce. Omg I so wanted that hot sauce. It looked like regular tobasco and it tasted like heaven.

I find this deli kind of interesting, because it's neither some incredibly classic, retro deli, nor a current, innovative, dirty/geek/whatever-sauce slathered place. Instead, it has a lot of solid offerings at a decent price, and it's hard to argue with that. Also, the employees are astonishingly friendly.

Oh...my....knees and whiskers!  I've truly given up the cupcake habit.  I swear to god this time, it'll stick.  This past weekend, I went on a bit of a bender.  I guess you could say that if cupcakes could be analogized to a bachelorette party, my cupcakes would have stayed in vegas.  Or something.  The point is: too much confection.  Now, too much hip.

The surrounding area is not the best of SF, but the restaurant is cute! Has a cute logo and the interior decor is really bakery like, but I didn't see any baked goods. The menu was simple, but weren't the only options. Some menu items were also written on the mirror. I had the pork and shrimp, glass noodle pho. The sprouts were already added and the broth was really tasty! I do recommend this restaurant! The pho also included a shrimp pancake, but it still had the tail, the moment I bit into it, I bit the sharp part and stabbed me in the cheek, I recommend they remove the tail for the pancake.

The restaurant is a little gem in the TL. Id imagine a cafe shop in Vietnam would look exactly like this. There's only six tables inside and it's a very clean shop. The menu is has a handful of choices but they focus on what they do best. My favorite is the bun mam which is never on the menu unless you're in Orange County and there's a higher chance of finding this dish. Its pretty authentic in flavor since it's such a pungent dish.

I've had almost everything on their menu and I have never been disappointed. Fresh, fast and authentic. Best chao long I have ever eaten! My mouth is watering thinking out it right now. This place is the bomb dot com! Don't mind the sketchy people standing on the corner.
A Hidden Gem.  If your in the TL area and want to try some authentic Vietnamese good, Mong Thu is the place.  Thumbs up for the cleanliness.  We had the:
Woke up slightly hungover with a strong desire for a bowl of chao long. Did some yelping and this was the only place that came up in SF, so off I went.

Tried the bun man today for lunch.  When my friends and I got there, we sat down and soon enough a lady came and asked what we wanted.  I asked for a menu and I found it strange that she looked surprised to see we wanted to take a look at their menu.  I guess they have a lot regular customers who don't need to see their menu anymore.  The bun man was delicious but a little too salty for my taste.  I did finish it to the very last drop of broth, however.  The price was cheap.  It was $8, tax already included.  I would go back to this place for sure.  But the location is kinda tricky since it's right where the Tenderloin just starts so there were a lot of strange and sketchy people right outside the noodle shop when we were there.  It made me and my friends a little uncomfortable.  Oh and they take cash only - not good.  Other than that, my eating experience at this place was quite pleasant.
I absolute love this small hidden cafe. Probably the best vietnamese place in Tenderloin!
I love supporting local mom n pop shops. especially when they serve good food! I have seen this place for years, but I thought they were your typical coffee ( and occasional sandwich) shops.

Three because it is clean and hu tieu nam vang is good as home made but the bun Bo hue is no good, they use small rice noodles in stead of big ( authentic bun Bo hue is big rice noodles).  And they loosing two star because the kitchen is right at the front not cover or it supposes to be in the back and when they cook , grill, DAME it smells really bad, the oil, the smoke all over my clothes, my hair which I hate the most.

I've been on the hunt in SF for quality Vietnamese food and this is the best I've had. The menu is simple with a selection of banh mi and noodle soups. There is also a select few specials written on the wall that's usually

BEST VIETNAMESE FOOD IN SF!! This place is amazing! You have to try the Bahn Mi Ca  (sweet sardine sandwich). It is my favorite!!!!  I get it all the time. I probably should try something different but that's how good it is. And even more delightful is the jasmine tea:)

Awesome home cooked Vietnamese food! This woman is amazing she's cranking fresh served authentic home cooked food out of her tiny make-shift kitchen.  The place was packed out for lunch w/ all local vietnamese crowd, already knew I was in for a treat.
Had a fun night of drinking with my friend Michelle, and needed food that would bring me back to life the next day. This is the place for that, (although the food here is amazing, hangover or not.)

From the few reviews I read, it seemed Mong Thu was some gross hole in the wall - I imagined Tu Lan pre-reno (*shudders*). It turns out, Mong Thu is quite clean and tidy, with about 6 small tables and TV playing random Vietnamese things like flowing waterfalls and local ads.
I live my life one Banh Mi Xiu Mai at a time!
This is one my favorite Vietnamese restaurants as they offer some of my favorite Vietnamese dishes. All of which have been done pretty well.
Very good banh mi!!

Went back again, this time ordered Bun Mam, "Fish based soup with boiled pork, shrimp, and fish served with thin rice noodles." Guy got a little nervous and asked if I ever had it before (I am a white lady). I said no and he said I might want to order something else. He said it was smelly, and tastes like anchovy. I then got all excited and like, BRING IT ON! Because I am the only member of Team Tailypo who likes anchovies.

What an odd place. Not bad, just odd. It looks like no other Vietnamese restaurant in Little Saigon. In fact, I would scarcely call it a restaurant. It's a small cafe painted in light pastels as if the owner had a Laura Ashley decorating obsession...where are the paisley-print throw pillows? (photo:
If you believe that a good Vietnamese restaurant is a place where you see Vietnamese customers go to then this is your place.

Desperate for some cheap food to eat during Pride, me and my 8 friends came here for some Viet goodness. Service here is average for a Viet restaurant. However this place is small. I think there were only about 5 tables that could seat 4-5 people each.

agree with lolia, there is a woman who calls everyone honey who is awesome! i ordered a sandwich because i absolutely love vietnamese sandwiches. i kind of ordered the wrong sandwich, she didn't really understand me when i asked her which sandwich doesn't have the red bbq pork thing going on. [red bbq pork scares me.] btw this woman also has bedazzled nails which were amusing.
Riding past here at 8:25 AM Sunday, it was open and they was welcoming.
ANOTHER ONE OF TL'S BEST KEPT SECRETS!

I'm definitely a fan of Mong Thu Cafe, for sure! I stopped in the other day with a friend and as others have said, it's definitely easy to overlook but the food is not to be missed! The inside is quite small ( I think there are about 5 tables) but it makes sense because it's a one woman operation. I wouldn't recommend coming alone because the area can be quite dodgy so it's better to err on the side of caution and bring a buddy.

This place is almost literally a hole in the wall hahaha. It's in the Tenderloin, and yes can look dangerous and scary. Living just on the border of Nob Hill and the TL, I know that looks can be deceiving. I actually love the TL! Especially when it comes to good food.. such as this little discovery.
Sandwich's are so good haven't tried anything else yet...
Price: $7-10 per item. There's pho, soups, sandwiches, meatballs, etc. very diverse menu and good! No broken rice dishes or buns though.

Little restaurant that I've definitely cruised by many times without thinking that it served anything beyond banh mi. Smaller menu than the other Tenderloin Vietnamese joints, but this meant that they had dishes I haven't seen elsewhere, like the bun mam I got. Fermented fishy broth that went nicely with the rice noodles and side herbs/bean sprouts. Portion size is on the smaller side, but it was mighty tasty.

Went to this place specifically for the Bun Mam, which I've acquired a tasted for thanks to Bun Mam Soc Trang in Oakland.    As far as I can tell this is the only place in SF with this fermented fish soup.     It was excellent.  The broth was pungent, but not overbearing.  (Actual Vietnamese folk will put Shrimp paste in it to make it more funky, but the unadulterated funk is the perfect amount for me.)    The pork was like Chinese bbq pork (pork belly in Oakland), the fish was probably cod or some other white-fish, and they gave 5 shrimps... . one of which was a bit soft, the others great.
A very homey environment...  My boyfriend and I have been there twice.   The food was great both times.  My only issue is that I've wanted a chicken sandwich both times and they were out!
To sum it up: Homey Vietnamese style meals like Aunty (if I had a Vietnamese aunty) used to make

It's a strange but interesting restaurant, not filled with gamblers like some of the other Vietnamese hole in the walls in the area, but more feminine in feel. One woman, who calls everyone honey, takes orders and the other does the cooking. The printed, laminated menu has pictures of the dishes. One side has 7 kinds of banh mi ($3 and up). The other has dishes like pho ga, beef stew, duck bamboo noodle soup (bun mang vit), etc. The interior is filled with small tables and flies. They seem to cook the food on portable burners in the back storage room/closet.

Hole in the wall Vietnamese restaurant. I have to admit that when you enter, it doesn't seem too appealing...that is until you try their food. Their soups are absolutely delicious and it's not even Pho!
From the lady (Wendy N.) who introduced me to  Ha Nam Ninh, the infamous 25 dry, She has found another treasure in the Tenderloin.

Seriously an overlooked treasure in a not so holy neighborhood. I've been to this spot for years and tried almost everything on the menu. No question the best homemade vietnamese cuisine! And it's crazy cheap too.

Must say, the neighborhood is dangerous and it's a hole in the wall but the food is great and well worth the trek into TL where people peek and peer into your car for valuables while you're sitting right there eating.
Awesome place to grab lunch.  Friendly service.  GREAT food.  Gotta try the Pork Xiu Mai with bread.  It's soo tasty.

This place was FANTASTIC!!! I am usually very picky with my vietnamese sandwiches, but mong thu's sandwiches were soo good. they use their own sauce for their sandiwches so it made it very different from other places. there is a place nearby called SAIGON sandwiches, although that place is more popular, but I think its because people have not tried mong thu.

Note: they don't grill meat kabobs on top of coals before your eyes, contrary to the Yelp photo. The grilling is all done in the back. Was a little disappointed about this, but if you set your expectations right, the food is quite good!
I heard their burgers are really good

Wow. Sat on the street, homeless asked for some money and gave them food and money just like Karachi.  The bun kababs were outstanding both beef and potato.  The seekh kebab was good and the chargha was fantastic.

Great reviews but it seemed ok. Food was 3 star. I tried the karachi burger.... semed mushy and a mix of flavors with no direction or sense. Presentation of food was nothing like the other pictures on yelp (no big deal) its the taste that counts.  Service was outstanding the person at counter was respectfull and courteous helped with food selection.  Try the falooda that was the best thing we had.
First we ordered delivery; Karachi bun Kabab, chicken tikka masala, basmati rice & falooda. We loved all of these; especially the bun Kabab yummmy !!!

The beef seekh kabob was delicious, as was the fresh naan. Although the menu selection is narrow, the quality of the food is great. My only complaint was that the dining space was a bit small and there isn't enough room for moderately large groups (4-8 people). Other than that, the service was reasonably quick (the food is made fresh!) and the people were nice.
I absolutely love halal food! Spicies... curries... oh my!!!
This is my first yelp review. This place was so good that I had to fight off my non-reviewing inertia to support this business.

Friendly staff and above average decor for the tenderloin.  Comfortable chairs.  Low prices  It's a relatively new place and my first time trying it. The chicken tikka masala and thick mango lassi were good. The naan was especially nice--light and fluffy, not oily, and not burnt.
Great food!! Very close to being authentic Karachi street food...

My most favorite restaurant in San Francisco. You will not find better Chicken Tikka Masala anywhere in the world. The chicken is always cooked to perfection. Tonight, we also ordered the Samosa Chaat and it was just screaming with flavors of cilantro, tomatoes and spice. I also ordered the beef kebab. Always a great add on. As well as the Began Bertha. I wish these chefs were my Mom growing up.
Excellent food amazing value for money refreshing complimentary tea, will stop by whenever i get a chance
I am never going to eat here again. The only good part about my experience at Karachi Classics was leaving the restaurant.

These guys make it so easy to hate them. The first time I ordered online from these guys, the food was sub par except for the lahori charga. The tandoori chicken was tough and over cooked, the bun kabab was a soggy mess of cardboard flavored meat swimming in egg coating. The charga was good but they took over two hours to deliver the meal. The second time they didn't have half the things on the menu that we ordered (by phone), so the guy on the phone tried to sell us a bunch of things we didn't want. Food was quick because we went over to pick up that order. Today I ordered online again (Eat24 - horrible customer service) and waited two hours before calling to find out where the hell our food was. The guy on the phone apologized and said that the driver was on the way. I pressed him to find out when the food was coming and he took my number saying he would call back. Surprise - No call back. We called again and this time he said he never received my order!!! Mind you, I had received a confirmation email from Eat24. If the customer service was okay I still wouldn't come here. The food quality (except for the lahori charga) is so shitty you couldn't pay me to eat here. With way better options in the TL for your indo-pak foodie fix, like Chutney, Shalimar, and Naan n Curry, why would anyone willingly give their money and business to a bunch of paindoos in a greasetrap kitchen who can't even cook, much less deliver it fast with a smile? This place would get zero stars if I could give that rating.
The best food ever the food is soo delicious. The place is very clean. My favor food is chicken thikka masala wrap and Chaplin kabobs .Also they service is awesome.
I ordered food from here through Grubhub!  Overall the food was okay but not great.
I eat here at LEAST once a week. The food is so good here that my bachellor Pakistani friendly buys a whole week worth of food and re-heats it at home. IT's legit.

Tried this place for the first time last week. I was excited to see some if the favorite street foods from Karachi. We ordered a piece of Chicken Tikka, 2 Seekh Kababs, and a Bun Kabab. I thought it would be good to eat the BBQ with a paratha, so I ordered 4. Food was good and we got our 4 parathas. 10 min later, 4 more came to our table. Why? Turns out each order comes with two. So that made it 8 parathas for just a few pieces of meat. Would have been nice to inform us while ordering. We were offered peach soda or naan in exchange. No, thanks.
As someone whose moved from New York after almost 25 years, this place tops the list of Pakistani restaurants in the area over Shalimar, Chutney, and Pakwan.
best of the food spots in the area!
This is a great place to eat, there are many excellent dishes to try, and they are halal!

Bought a living social coupon. Upon arrival the front counter cashier said he will accept the living social food coupon, but when we finished the food, he refuse to accept because his manager was not present at the moment. Lost all the money in the coupon.

Love this Pakistani place!!!  Service is great and the parantha wraps are wonderful.  The smells waft through the Tenderloin improving the other not so nice Tenderloin scents. Hubby loves the lamb kabobs.
No takers.

This was my first time ordering lunch here. Regrettably not the best way I could have spent $8.56! I got the Chicken Boti. All it was was some smokey, dry chicken cubes that clearly came off a skewer. While I can appreciate smokey meat, the flavor of the marinade didn't quite mix well with the smokey taste. Aside from that, the dry chicken was served alone on a little bed of lonely, raw sliced onions. Of course, this could have been a fluke as it was a 1x experience. Or perhaps I ordered a dish that just wasnt for me. Regardless, I wont be going back any time soon, at least not willingly.

one of the best Pakistani place in SF, Really good food. recently they added quesadilla on their menu, just too good. all the items in their menu is totally worth the money you spend. love their Bun kabab and shawerma !! off the hook.

During our vacation in San Francisco we got a craving for Indian Food and ended up at this place. Wow, I couldn't believe how delicious this place was. I had the chicken curry and still dream about it till this day!  I will definitely be coming to this place every  time I'm in San Francisco. We actually came here twice during our vacation because it was so good. They also give you free tea, careful it's hot!
I made an order through

The best Pakistani food I've had in the city in a while.  I made an exception to my no-wheat diet just to try Karachi bun kabab; totally worth it!  Also ordered Lahori Chargha (chicken) and Chapli Kabab (beef), offerings you don't commonly find, plus Lamb Biryani.  Everything was super yummy (tho chicken could be juicier / less dry).  And they even delivered on my no-onions request for Chapli Kabab, against all odds.  Portions were very generous and prices low.

Really friendly staff and awesome food. I stumbled across this place a few days ago after a 12 hour shift. This is some of the best indian food I've had in a while. You must try the tandoori chicken quesadilla. It was interesting and fantastic!
Whenever I'm in the mood for Pakistani food this is where I go, I don't know much about the cuisine, but everything that I've tried on their menu is golden.
Excellent food! We ordered 5 different things and each one was Delish! Will be back over and over!
Very good food with great customer service. Very pakistani style burger which is a plus. Ohhh and their chicken wings! Can't leave Karachi classics without that. They're the best!
We were looking for a Pakistani Restaurant that had good munchies, these guys have really good roll parathas and the beef Chapli Kababs are as close as they get to the ones back home.

I really liked this place for the chicken tikka masala wrap but out of the 10 times I have eaten there they have messed up on my order 9 of those 10 times. It's a shame because I will never go there again, I do not have the patience for people who consistently make the same mistake. I order a chicken tikka masala wrap every time and they ask if I want salad or fries, I like and order fries but have never gotten them with my order the first time and when I tell them I ordered fries, they tell me that they do not give fries with the wrap. Why would you offer me fries then and look at me as if I made the mistake??? The salad is more than horrible and they should not even have it on the menu in my opinion. I wonder if the business will survive because they mess up on my friends order too and they refuse to go back like me.

The menu is very limited- which is deliberate. To distinguish themselves from the hoards of Indo/Pak restaurants in the Tenderloin, they've decided to focus on 'street food' or snacks, with a sprinkling of curries.
Best Tandoori in the neighborhood. Chicken Boti is tasty, saag chicken, daal...all delicious. Nice staff, outdoor seating.
Great chicken shawarma and traditional tea.  Definitely glad we stopped in here for lunch.
Great sandwiches. I was also surprised to see kebabs being bar b cued on an authentic coal stand rather than in an electric oven.
Awesome food. Great service. Try the karachi bun kabob and charga best I have had. Has a good selection of "karachi street food"
Overpriced for a lousy burger I could have pulled out of my freezer

I got the aloha burger combo. The burger was mediocre and small. The fries were out of a 99 cent store bag of crinkle cut fries. The soda was a warm can of coke. My friend got the chicken chow mein. It was not chow mein. It had three pieces of chicken. It came with no vegetables. THE WORST PART IS how insanely overpriced it was. The weak ass combo was 12.50 and the not chow mein was 8 bucks plus 2 extra for vegetables. And the scam artist of a server/owner tried to charge us for another warm can of coke. It is such a rip-off, you guys. The service isn't even good. I explicitly told the guy I wasn't done with the plate but he snatched it away anyway. And the chick who took my order "suggested" aka tried to manipulate me into getting 3 other unrelated dishes. They had us seriously considering dine and dash.
Tasteless Costco patty burger with a side of your cheap aunt's soggy French fries and a can of Coke - 12.99 (WAY too overpriced).
This is a great hamburger joint in my neighborhood that has relatively inexpensive food.  I really like the couple that own the place.  They have had this restaurant for many years.

I feel kinda sad writing a bad review for this place. Their customer service was good (we were the only ones there along with a lady who was finishing up her food), BUT.. When the bf was served his order of burger and fries, the lady dropped a few fries on the table and decided to pick it up and dump it back on the bf's plate.. I ordered a Mongolian beef with rice.. It tasted more like it should've been called sweet and sour beef with rice.. It was very sour... Don't think I'll be back.

This place is constantly good. The food is tasty and perfectly simple. Always yummy. The burgers are very tasty... ( the patty is kinda thin but always very very good) breakfast is great here as well.
I love this damn place.
I was interested by this place's name, and it's combination of two of my favorite types of food. Diner and Chinese.
Time to surrender.

This rating is for the breakfast. Its setting feels like a mesh of American Diner + Chinese diner. It's very charming and has been there for 25 years. It was a spotless type of clean. The breakfast was straight up American. I had a regular cup of coffee, with blueberry pancakes with generous amounts of blueberries, eggs and sausages that were  terrific. Really recommend for feel and American style breakfast although they also have regular Chinese food too!
My father and I ducked in here, trying to escape an overly aggressive homeless man who was scaring the crap out of us.  Bad mistake, we should have taken our chances outside.
Decent food. Nice couple who run the place

Had a wonderful lunch at this place.  Has an authentic it feel to this place where it adds to the taste of the food. Don't have many places like these anymore the burger it was great and the French fries was to die for. Highly recommend you check out this place especially during lunch time also had the freshly squeezed organic orange juice check it out.
If you like chinese and american food, and literally anything this little couple can whip up in their small kitchen, you're in luck, and boy is Perfect Hamburger for you!

How can you begrudge a couple who would call their place The Original Perfect Hamburger? I mean, who would bother charging them with plagiarism? We're talking about a greasy spoon in the Tenderloin, not the $60 Rossini Burger at Hubert Keller's Burger Bar for Pete's sake. In fact, I would demand that Keller's burger be perfect to justify that absurdly exorbitant price. Fortunately, the Double Cheeseburger here is only $6.50, and there were even sauteed mushrooms on top (photo:

I am baffled that this place is still in business.  Who would patronize this place more than once and why hasn't the health department shut it down?  I've eaten street food in Mexico, Panama and Thailand but I would not eat here again.  In the short time I was there, I saw the waiter/owner pour milk/creamer that had been left (and mostly used) on a customer's table back into the carton, pick debris up off the filthy floor and place it on a tablecloth (later to throw away but definitely didn't change or clean the tablecloth afterwards).  While I ate, the waiter coughed up phlegm for about 15 minutes less than 5 feet away from me.  The food didn't taste horrible but it wasn't good and the prices were merely ok.  The waiter will try to upsell you no matter what you order and they charge for refills on 6 ounce mugs of coffee.  They'll tack on an extra $1.75 if you get a refill on the tiny cup of coffee.  There are so many great diners in SF, I can't believe this place is still around... I suppose rent control creates cheap overhead for them.

We got exactly what we paid for.  Thin, freezer burned patties, well done, although I asked for medium rare.  The coffee was decent and I'm glad I went with something that would at least scald the bacteria.  My friend's soda came with a string of floss hanging out of it.  When she pulled on the thread, out came the ice it was frozen in.

I have to disagree with my friend Phil, we went there together with his girlfriend, and not only did he devour his burger, he ate half of hers as well. They also serve breakfast as well, try their cheese omelet it's delish.

Great little Burger slash Chinese Food joint. It actually caught me off guard how good the food was and how quickly it was prepared. The entire environment here totally reminds me of a 1950's run-of-the-mill diner. The husband and wife that run this place are both extremely polite and it was just a genuinely good experience. Will most definitely be returning here as it was also extremely cheap!

Depending on his mood, the owner can be apathetic or rude. The first time I dined here I did so out of curiosity. Menu items are handwritten on paper plates tacked onto the wall. It doesn't get much tackier than that. It wasn't that bad but I didn't intend to return.
Below avg food and the owners are super rude !! They wanna nikel and dime you ..

I just ate here and got a Jack In the Box quality meal for twice as much money. And their "large" onion rings ($3) were the size of a small at any fast food place. Total rip off. I'm never going back.
Seriously? Do you reallllly expect to have "TPB" here? Come on. Naturally I was intrigued anyway.
Great old fashioned burger!  Prices are not too bad and the portions are good sized.
Exactly what I needed after last night at the Slide.
Was definitely intrigued by the name of the place. "How perfect and original?", I wondered.

Love this place for what it is - a diner in the TL.  Henry and his wife have been there a long time, and when I worked in the area, would go quite often.  I changed jobs, and hadn't been back in over 2 years. When I returned, Henry remembered me by name, and his wife started cooking what I wanted, from memory, before I even ordered.  They make good greasy burgers, hot dogs, and fries.

Burger was ok, definitely not the best by any standards. This place is more like a Chinese restaurant/diner. The prices are fair for what you get. You just have to see for yourself about the atmosphere once you go there you will know what I mean. Strange indeed!

we just got done eating our cheesburgers, it was good. Why is it that no place around here serves fries with your burger? Service was good, food good not great and place is small. we ordered take out so i dnt have much to say, sry

Hands down the greatest burger I have ever ate.  It was awesome.  Well worth the money.  I've ate Herfer Mayo burgers in Oregon that can't hold a candle to one of Mr Coy's finest.  If you want to impress your lady friend, take her for a double cheeseburger and a side of fries from this place.  The sign isn't lying, it is the perfect burger made by the perfect ninja.  Mr. Coy can play a mean game of stick to.  If you beat him you'll likely be hit with 50 throwing stars, so sit back, take the loss and eat another one of his scrumpious burgers.  Hit it ol' G's.

I had breakfast here on a lonely Sunday before leaving back to LA. Sitting in the still diner, watching cars pass, hearing my meal fry, admiring the quaint decor, the dated ansel adams photo, balloons in the corner losing helium, locals coming in for their morning brew, the napkin dispenser still unchanged since the 70's, gingham table cloth---I've fallen in love with SF.  I'll never forget the asian man and lady preparing my meal with as much love as if I were family. It was the most surreal breakfast of my life. View photos.
used to live in the same building, apartment upstairs. great chocolate shakes. good fries. grilled cheese when im hungry and lazy. otherwise, never tried much else. nice owners. asian couple. cheers.
The hamburger was far from perfect. But this goes along nicely with the fact that I got a fortune cookie with my check.

Double Bacon Cheese! The Lord Raptor sometimes indulges in such worldly things and hamburgers are a little sin that only I can forgive myself for. I died for UR sins so cut me some slack! To review in a few words, It tastes like a burger that ur Vietnamese grandma makes.  Kneel B4 me and ask for forgiveness!  LOL

I have to disagree with my friend Phil, we went there together with his girlfriend, and not only did he devour his burger, he ate half of hers as well. They also serve breakfast as well, try their cheese omelet it's delish.
Was not really the perfect hamburger but it was good...
I love greasy, cheesy, dirty, grimy diners.  I am happy to overlook a bit of dirty for the good of the food.  That being said, this place is decent.  But not great.
Warning:  Do NOT eat here when you're sober

Skipped going into a Carl's Jr. and wandered around until I found this place.  Ordered a bacon cheeseburger with fries/onion rings.  Got a perfectly good cheeseburger with two neatly cooked strips of bacon on top with lettuce, tomatoes and onions.  Added some ketchup and mustard to the mayo they added to the buns, and viola!  Gobbled the burger down happily.

When I do eat out for breakfast, I always go here. I love that it's not too noisy or crowded. I love that the prices are decent. I love that there is a variety of different types of foods you can eat. I don't know what the rest of the reviewers are referring to, because this place always looks clean to me. I mean, to be real, the decor is from the 70s. It's dated. But I've never seen flies buzzing around, the dirty plates are cleared from the table before the restaurant patrons even leave, the tables are spotless, the paint isn't chipping from the walls, there aren't passed out drunks at the counter. The place has the feel of a small town diner, except it's in the TL.
Great burritos and tacos. Very simple place with friendly staff.  The prawn burrito is my favorite.

Went here with some friends during pride.  We were super hungry and decided to stop in.  I had no idea this place existed even though it's near my work.  The service was very friendly and efficient.  I appreciate that when a bunch of drunken pride partiers come and bombard the establishment.  I got the super vegetarian burrito and my boyfriend got a carnitas taco.  We both loved our food.  I will definitely be back next time I'm craving Mexican at work.  The prices are reasonable too!
Their carnitas is always crispy and shredded. I appreciate that. Cheers for Mexi in the 'loin!

I never had a rice chimichanga before.  It was supposed to be a chicken chimichanga, but I couldn't find any chicken among the rice and beans.   I saw the chef put salsa on it, but the rice was so bone dry that the salsa instantly vanished.  Could there be a worse chimichanga?

I dont think this is a fair review, considering I haven't eaten here in almost 7 years, and am also living halfway around the world in China where mexican food is non-existant.  However, as I'm sitting here at 1am in the morning, a burrito has manifested in the deepest chasms of my brain, and triggered fond memories of when I used to live right down the block, wearing oversized hoodies and spewing dirty vocabulary, while consuming the most badass burrito for under $5, tax included.
I used to come here all the time with my niece... We would always split a super burrito! We called this place 'The Burrito Store' haha :]

Just about the most delicious quesadilla I have ever had. It's pretty much a burrito minus the rice and beans...my kind of burrito. People in my office get this quesadilla and the smell wafts through the rest of the office making as all run for Taqueria La Paz. Definitely a great place to hit up in the TL.

I've kept this spot on the lo-lo (along with Manor House) cuz I don't want all of the "hipsters" (HA!!!) trying to turn this into the next cool spot.  This spot IS in the hood & is not for the weak-at-heart...if you venture out after dark, get your "I will cut a thug" mug ready...
3.5 Stars if I could.

This place is my all time favorite for mexican food!! I've tried a whole lot of stuff on their menu, and at the moment the tastiest things in my opinion are the enchiladas and the super burrito. Sure sometimes the burrito isn't evenly heated or the food looks like it's been out all day, believe me I've experienced both, but the food has always been tasty when I sat down to eat at home. If you want your food a certain way, just tell them, they have no problem heating your food another minute or adding some more cheese or extra rice, anything....And come on now people, this is the Tenderloin, not a 5 star restaurant in the most wealthy and influential part of town...so if you get all nervous and feel threatened looking for the location and "Finding this place wasn't so easy because it wasn't lit up well. This is NOT a place to go after dark, I thought I was going to be jumped. The set up looked terrible..." Well then Jenna, the TL isn't for you. Not sure what you were expecting there...

I went to this place based on the previous reviews. Finding this place wasn't so easy because it wasn't lit up well. This is NOT a place to go after dark, I thought I was going to be jumped. The set up looked terrible. I will say that I went about 1 hour before they were closing, but everything looked crusty and dried up. Unappetizing.
This place continues to amaze me. A great downtown taqueria option for sure.

Big portions are a plus because I feel like I'm getting more bang for the buck. I love spicy but their hot salsa is very hot and I couldn't even finish my burrito. Other that that the burrito tasted OK.
i work right around the corner from this place and the parmesan cheese and extra -oily rice always make me want to come back, as bad as that sounds.  plus the folks that work there are really sweet.

I feel bad giving this place such a bad review because the people who work there seem nice. That's why I'm giving it two stars instead of one star. Everything about the place beside my burrito was just fine.

Excellent food, they make a killer chimichanga, which is something some of the other taquerias in the area do not even offer on their menu. The service is great, always friendly.  I love this place-it is one of those great tenderloin jewels!   The portions are huge and the prices are great!

This hole in the wall makes up a pretty good burrito. Almost five stars worthy - no charge for extra black beans, lettuce and a spinach tortilla (missing whole wheat, at least today). Chicken is also grilled up fresh, though could have done without the excess oil. Service was friendly enough that I have no doubt they would have left that out had I known and asked. All for $5.

Call me boring but during the school year when I'm working in this area I eat lunch here every single week day. That's right, Monday through Friday I order the exact same thing, super burrito with rice, pinto beans, avocado, hot salsa and a couple jalapenos just for kicks! The food here is always fresh, flavorful and healthy and I love to support the friendly, hard working people that own it.

Being a vegan means I can only eat a couple of things at this restaurant, my favorite being the vegetarian burrito. You have to ask for the sour cream and cheese to be left off, but you end up with a burrito, which if taken home and slathered with Tofutti Better Than Sour Cream, will satisfy and leave you too full to want more... until tomorrow.

Definitely not the place if you want to soak in the ambiance.  Ya go here for the portions which are huge and surprisingly tasty.  The super tacos were good and the carnitas tortas couldn't have been tastier.  Service is fantastic, and for those who are afraid to carry cash in this part of the hood...they accept credit cards!  Not much room to eat inside...

One of the few places I feel comfortable getting food when I'm at the rehearsal studio in the Tenderloin, and the only place I've seen with burritos bigger than Happy Burrito's (one friend refers to this place at "F*cking Ecstatic Burrito!").  I give it three stars because another friend of mine recurrently gets ill after eating their food, but I've eaten here literally dozens of times and never had a problem.  We figure it must be either the meat or the sour cream since I never have either and he always gets both.  Anyway, I think their vittles are pretty nifty, including fresh hand-made tortillas and a tasty pico de gallo.  Incidentally, there's one guy working here who also happens to be the fastest burrito-making machine I've ever witnessed--it's worth the price of admission just to watch him handle a long line of hungry customers with elan, moxie, and aplomb.  Wow...

Not the typical Mexican food you fond elsewhere - you won't find things like burritos here.  Much more of an indigenous influence and I've taken Mexicans here before and they hadn't even heard of half the things on the menu. Expect more subtle flavors that you're not used to in Mexican cuisine.    The pibe was a giant corn dough (think tamales) filled with a delicious chicken - pumpkin - tomato stew all wrapped in a banana leaf.  It was delicious.
I ordered through Eat24 and they took TWO HOURS and missed an item from my order. The food showed up cold and it was bland. Go in a different direction, not worth it.
DELIVERY! Found this place on Eat24Hours...really great! Loved their super taco (mmmm) price is also decent.
The food from this restaurant is very much in the eye of the beholder.    I can see how some people would love it and others might not.
Terrible delivery experience. Disgusting food with no taste.
We ordered burritos for delivery and they were so bad we ended up throwing them out.  (I've never thrown out a burrito before.)
Very good, and unique, food!  Ordered via GrubHub and received quality food promptly.  Try the pork!

Wow. Being from out of town, I went by yelp reviews for this place and was not disappointed. Tacos, pupusa, empanadas...all exceeded my expectations. The corn tortillas were small and fresh. Delivery was less than 45 minutes. We will order here again!
Been ordering from this place occasionally for the past year. I'm from Mexico City originally. Been here since I was 9, I'm now 41.
So Delicious!
So this is pretty much one of the only options for a delivered burrito, and I guess its a serviceable one although not optimal by any means.

This place is pretty bomb. Of course I do live right across the street from it, but how picky can you get? The few that work there are always very nice. I've been in twice so far and I feel they already know who I am. I have tried a few of there items including the tacos, tamales and burritos, and I must say the burritos are the winner. They're huge and delicious. Full of rice, beans, chicken, beef, or pork, lettuce, sour cream, avo, cheese, and only around 5 bucks. Can't beat that. The tacos are killer too, very authentic, just the tortilla, meat and and some spices, cilantro, you know the deal. They have this killer green salsa that I seem to never get enough of, but its so good. I must say the tamales are a little lacking. just not to my preference, but that could've been a fluke that night.
This place was disappointing. The delivery was fast but the food was hardly palatable.

The guys here have always been super friendly, I'll order something, go to liquor store for groceries, then food is ready to go when I walk back. Their burgers are pretty awesome, and the pizza is delicious! And, if I'm a couple cents short or if I have no change and only bills to pay, they've told me it's all good on many occasions (nice compared to some places that will either insist on giving you a handful of change after you pay or wont let you order if you are 2 cents short...) Great place, not a whole lot of businesses now look after their regulars, but this place does, I'm always happy to go here and spend money. Definitely recommend it if you live locally or are passing through.

Tacos are huge and cheap.  They deliver.  You can order online.  I'm on my way to being a hermit.  With great food delivery option like this, I not only never have to step out of the apartment, I don't even need to talk to anyone (thanks to online ordering!).
It's a trick and trap kind of place.

It's in the middle of the TL, everything is cheap and actually delicious and they even have things most take-out Mexican joints in the city don't have, like panuchos and empanadas. I was seriously fooled by the abandoned look of the restaurant and the kitchen, but somehow they turn out pretty great stuff. Oh and, who in their right mind would get pizza and burgers here? They're not even factoring into my rating here!
Oh comida yucatan, how many times have you saved the lives of me and my starved san francisco roommates on a hungover lazy Sunday afternoon??

Obviously, for $2.75 a piece, I ordered everything on the menu.  They seem famous for the yucatan pork so I was really excited by that, but it was actually the most disappointing meat of the meal.  Still, good, but not the best part.
You're brave, right?
I made the mistake of ordering 2 chicken super tacos from here. The tacos gave me food poisoning. I even had to take two days off from work. I'll never eat here again.
This is a review of food delivered from Comida Yucatan.
awesomeeeee pork panuchos on homemade corn tortillas and handmade empanadas.

it's funny how all of the bad reviewers ate the american or americanized mexican food.  Why anyone would go to a place with the name Yucatan in the name and order pizza is beyond me and shows their lack of critical thinking skills (to say the very least). I can only assume these are the same kids who made non-ironic fart jokes when they were in school and order jager bombs chased with long island ice teas at bars *shudder*.

NO! This just goes to show that you NEED to see how many people have reviewed a restaurant.  I went with a group of friends to this place because it had a good rating.  A bunch of us shared pizza, fish sticks, and tacos.  It was all mediocre.

Yucatecan food is its own unique style and is very different from what most people would consider "Mexican" food. It includes influences from the local Mayan culture, as well as Caribbean, Mexican, European (French) and Middle Eastern cultures. So, with that out in the open I have now removed any misconceptions and can go on with my review.

this place is right down the street from my job so i frequent it pretty often. it's soooo cheap!! a turkey burger (yummy) a decent serving of some good fries and a soda for 6 bucks!! it's a deal!! you gotta give it a try!! what do you want inthe middle of the tenderloin people?!

What a surprise!!  $2 TACOS TO MURDER FOR!!  (And this is the neighborhood to do it.)  Drive by this all the time, and just the whole Yucatan AND Pizza AND Burgers (immediately makes me think they don't do anything well).  But they are just a restaurant stayin alive in the city - they're main pull is the Yucatan food - in the whole we were there we saw not one burger or one pizza.

Its definitely in a sketchy neighborhood and scary looking folks loiter outside, but the food is worth it. I had an amazing shredded beef taco and a crispy empanada. Delicious. The tortas were also superb. Its clean, cheap, and has amazing spicy green salsa. Definitely a place to return to. Just a note- there is one cook who makes everything to order, so expect a short wait.
This small restaurant in a very dicey neighborhood sells pizza, burgers, burritos, fish and chips and Mexican dishes from the Yucatan.

Whike i was looking for s new place to kill my hunger i came a cross la perla pizza they have a variety of foods from burver to whole chikens to pizza theg make it all happen i wansnt expecfing much from thus olace bht know i dont go no where else to get a fat juicy philly strak sandwich ask about them they mske it infront of your eyes if you are hungry la perla is the place to go

If you want good, consistent food at unbeatable prices then choose Perla Pizza. This a little hidden pearl deep in the tenderloin so one might not expect to get such delicious pizza from such a place but let me tell you, they beat some of the best known pizza in my neighborhood and I can't turn back.
Good pizza and reasonable prices in an interesting neighborhood (read: urine smell walking to restaurant). Pizza was good cold the next day as well.

Recently this business put an effort to make their food better. Now, this is the best deal on delivery food in downtown SF. The burger and onion rings is the best deal I've found in the city. Their delivery people are awesome.
While I was sitting, waiting for my slice, I was formulating my Yelp review in my head, and I was especially going to point out how long it was taking.
Fast delivery nice costumer service and the pizza is always at a good taste miamyamyam :) :*
It looks like a dive, but the pizza and sandwiches always come at a reasonable price. If you're gonna be in the Tenderloin, you can call your order in ahead or order on foodler.
*This is a review as of October 1, 2013.
MARCH 2, 2013

I'm still not entirely sold on the pizza.  The crust tasted a bit different this time and the sausage is disgusting.  There are enough other options to keep me coming back though.  The Philly is still awesome with a cheesy, gooey, meaty interior.
Only had the chocolate mousse cake and cheesecake.  Both were tasty, nothing spectacular but very nice.  Delivery wait wasn't too long.
Really friendly, really fast and yummy for the price. If u r stuck late night in the TL these are your friends!

The cheese can be quite runny.  I should have looked at the pictures before I ordered, but I'm pretty averse to Yelp photos of food because I normally look at Yelp photos to identify actual places, and how many photos of the same thing do I need?  But I should have looked at these photos, because the cheese is consistently runny.

CHill out people, this place is solid. Cheap delivery minimum... and open like all the time. I can't speak for their pizza because I love good pizza way too much to waste time and energy on bad pizza. The OVEN BAKED sandwiches however are comparable to Subway but waaay cheaper (and you're supporting a local business!).

This place is mediocre on a good day, disgusting on occasion, pretty typical for a fast and dirty pizza joint with Mexicans opening cans and defrosting chicken wings out back. It's the kind of place you go after a long pub crawl, knowing you're going to be blowing mud anyway the next day, so why not?
Service: On-time, both boxes of pizza came crushed, 2 liter coke came warm
I'm usually not the type who writes reviews (because honestly, who knows if these reviews are real anyway?) but I want to personally write about my experience with this place.
Usually, I would write this in a comedic kind of way, but I am too grumpy to bother right now, so I'll just get to it.
Great pizza, and super-friendly folks!
Ordered delivery because it was cheap:
I've ordered from here twice now and both times have been great.
Talk about disgusting!! I usually order pizza from Pasquale's or Seniore's, but I thought I'd try this place out.

I needed some pizza. It was midnight. Room service pizzza? $32! No thanks. Used GrubHub. Had the pizza at my hotel room door in about 45 minutes. Tasted great! The delivery man was seriously stoned, but hey, at 1 am, in The City, what do you expect :-)
I was impressed.  We live in North Beach and are surrounded by a variety of pizza places of varying quality.  We rang with a 2 mediums for $20 (I think) home delivery voucher.
The rotiserrie chicken is pretty damn good here, so tender and juicy, and the rice on the bottom is like a bonus findt once you uncover it from all that chicken.
This is a review of late night delivery from La Perla Pizza, Kebab & Rotisserie.

The kabobs were not good. No flavor.  I think the best part of my combo was the actual hamburger meat.  Rice was just ok. Won't be back. The other reviews were for the chicken and pizza which I have not had. But why put something on the menu that is not good?
Their rotiserrie chicken is THE BOMB. I ordered delivery through

Awesome food. Great Pizza! I go there very often, their pizza is one of the best in town, not to mention their mediterranean specialties like the kebabs and I also love their roast chicken, it's very moist and succulently spiced. I Highly recommend this place!

I've been in dire need of an awesome pepperoni (beef pepperoni that is) pizza and have had the hardest time having it delivered to SOMA; that is, until I came across La Perla Pizza (thank you GrubHub for helping me discover this gem).  In addition to the fact that they have beef pepperoni (zabiha/halal salami too if you're interested) and deliver to SOMA, they are ridiculously polite and friendly.  Oh and did I mention the pizza is OFF THE HOOK?!

name: La Perla Pizza Kabob and Rotisserie

reviews.text: $4 for the best meatball sandwiches I've ever had.  Amazing price, amazing quality; don't think about it, just get it!
Authentic banh mi. This place is all about the meatballs and they deserve all the hype they get. Great service. Simple no-frills coffee shop. Limited hours
I love my viet sammies!! I would drive FAR just to savor in viet sammies!!!
This hole-in-the-wall Vietnamese cafe does it right. I ordered the combo banh mi and meatball soup on the recommendation of a friend.
very good sandwiches here, especially the combination banh mi. wish they added more meat though. goid place if you dont mind a shit load of guys smoking right outside the store.
do NOT. EVER. go here. seriously terrible.

Random hole in the wall with authentic street side Viet Bahn Mi.  They also serve soda egg drink - sounds gross but it was pretty good!  The meat ball + soup is definitely first I've seen in the city.  Packed with ingredients and taste.  The bill was dirt cheap too!
Came here with my boyfriend to try the bahn mi and meatball soup. A no-nonsense place where lots of Asian men come to hang out, drink coffee and watch TV.
Rating 4: Great, I want to and probably will come back again!

This is one of the only places I will get a combination sandwich at.  I usually hate pate and headcheese, but I actually like it here.  The meatball is really good too.  The bread is always perfectly toasted and they even scoop out some of the insides so that there is a good balance between meat and bread.  Only thing is I wish this place was located in a better neighborhood.  Kinda scary sometimes.

My friend raves about their sandwiches and I just had to try it for myself. Got the combo and the meatball to split with another friend. Umm..dry bread, no flavor, can't taste the pate at all. best part was the meatball, it was tasty and moist. Bleh, I don't get it.

Been eating vietnamese sandwiches for a long time. Been to Saigon sandwiches, Sing Sing and many other places. This place is better than Sing Sing, that's for sure. Only thing that would make this an even better sandwich is that the sandwiches were warmer when served. I usually have to put them in a toaster oven when I bring it home.

this place is the shit. i've been settling with mediocre banh mi out of convenience whenever i miss super good ass banh mi from VN, and i'm so glad i can come here within walking distance after meetings now! definitely a hangout spot for older generation folks - which makes it kinda nice and homey.

Pretty good sandwich and super cheap, but did not leave me wanting more. You know a place is legit when there are tons of old Vietnamese dudes sitting around on a weekday just hanging out and drinking iced coffee. There are about 5 sandwiches to choose from, and a few items like meatball soup. The cashier was an old Asian man who I assume was the owner, and was very pleasantly surprised when he washed his hands after handling money and before making my sandwich. Small wins...

this place looks a little intimidating and sketchy from the outside.  There's always that one guy that looks a little seedy and smoking a cigarette outside and eyeballs you as you enter the establishment.  That said, once you walk in, you'll find that this place is very no frills - just a few tables and a few chairs.  Wlk up to the counter and place your order with the owner.  I usually get the fancy pork and it's always awesome and only $3.50.  It takes a little bit longer than other banh mi places, but it is well worth it.  The guy will toast your bread there and then delicately build your sandwich.  When you get it, you'll find you have the perfect ratio of pickled veggies to meat to sauce.  I'd go every day, if this place were closer to work.

One of my TL go-to Banh Mi spots. I must say the Banh Mi Dac Biet they serve has the perfect ratio of meat/bread/veg. Rich and bright at the same time. The quintessential snack in my mind. All for $3.50. Friendly sandwich maker to boot.

My first try was ok but it's hard to improve on Saigon Sandwich Shop down the street. The combination had an interesting combination of meat that I'm not completely sure what it was. Just lacked the great flavors of Saigon Sandwich. I did like the jalapeño peppers added and the fresh crisp vegi's. I'll try the pork next time and review with hopefully one more star.
It's all about the combo banh mi 'cause I'm in love wit a sandwich!

Second stop in bahn mi haul. I got both the combination and fancy pork bahn mi. The sandwich is a little bigger than Sing Sing's and they really pack it with meat! The carrot and radish salad is a little more flavorful than other places. They also put a sauce on the sandwich that I haven't seen before. The bahn mi was greasier than what I'm used to. And by greasy, I don't mean in a bad way. It made the crusty baguette easier to bite into and chew. Definitely a must have if you're a bahn mi lover!

The best Vietnamese sandwich I've had in sf so far! I'm from Socal/Westminster where Vietnamese sandwiches are made in a manufacturing line and tossed together in two seconds. i was extremely (and pleasantly) surprised when it took several minutes to make each sandwich, they toasted and wrapped them with care! it was awesome.
Stopped by for the xiu mai nuoc (which I still think should be called banh mi xiu mai) and was pleasantly surprised.
One of the best banh mis I've ever had!
Success! After some disappointing banh mi's of late (ahem Saigon Sandwich), it was a lucky day to find Hoang Dat after yelping to find a new sandwich place in Little Saigon.
Quest for the yummiest Bahn Mi sandwich in SF
One of my favorite places for lunch. The meatball sandwich is fantastic, and only $3.75.
Meatball Banh Mi!  Very generous with the meat and priced well.

This Vietnamese eatery is appropriately adorned for its life in the Tenderloin. It's a no-nonsense establishment that carries your $3+ banh mi sandwich. I got the pork banh mi, and it tasted about what I would expect a good banh-mi would taste: warmed/toasted fresh bread, non-dry pork meat, good pickled veggies with just the right amount of snap. The service is so fast, that you can have enough time to stroll around the Tenderloin...or not.

Hoang Dat is a storefront selling vietnamese coffee(3), superior coffee (?), and banh mi. the few tables are occupied by elderly vietnamese. many seem surprised at outsiders coming in to patronize this coffee shop

My favorite Viet sandwich shop in SF. I love the meatball sandwich. Not dry even without mayo (does it come with mayo i don't know cause i hate mayo). The meatballs i assume sit in a nice broth stewing in its juices till you order it. Then its places in french bread with all the normal viet sandwich fixins. The combination sandwich is as good as the ones from San Jose. If you are not in the mood for a sandwich they also have meatball soup. Which is meatballs in broth served with a side of french bread for dipping.
My continued search for authentic banh mi led me to Hoang Dat Coffee Shop following good reviews but alas it failed to measure up against its great contemporaries around.

Tastiest Vietnamese sandwiches I've found in the city so far. Veges and pate' on the sandwiches are fresh. No slimyness or cat food taste! That counts for a lot. Great cheap lunch and the buns are good.
My combination sandwich was made by a really nice man behind the counter. The ingredients are very fresh and a great deal for $3.50. The bread is buttered instead of slathered with mayonnaise.

$3 delicious bahn mi. Like, seriously delicious. I've only had the combination but it was ahmayzing. The menu was sort of confusing-basically it's in vietnamese and in english, but I have no shame so I just asked the lady at the counter what I should eat. She MIGHT have looked at me like I was an idiot but I'm ok with it. The sandwich was worth it.
Hoang Dat is great. I love this place.

some friends were in town and we wanted to check out something new.  small little mom pop in the tenderloin.  a bunch of og vietnamese guys just chillin.  friendly owner.  $3 for a good sized sandwich!  only 4 types of sandwiches: meatball, fanci pork, cure pork, and combo pork (mixed fanci and cured).
Oh Shit.
"Smack that, all on the floor"
