So ever since Sing Sing's owner let his wife make the sandwiches, the quality and quantity of meat has change for the worst so I decided to give Sing Sing's brother's sandwich shop a try and to my surprise, it tasted just like Sing Sing and they also have different kinds of sandwiches also.  The combination sandwich is awesome and I also love the meatball sandwich with the meatballs on the side.  Just make sure you call them in advance to make the sandwiches so you can pick them right up so you don't have to look for parking.  This is now my Vietnamese sandwich shop.
I've been in search of a cheap banh mi place ever since Little Paris closed down in Chinatown. After searching high and low I've finally found a place tucked in the Tenderloin.

Yum! best friggin vietnamese sandwich place in town. Decent price, exceptionally yummy, I am totally craving the sandwich as I am writing this. I can't wait to go back. I cannot believe I did not discover this place earlier. If you have not tried this place, this is the BOMB. The ambience is kinda cool too. There is a whole bunch of older vietnamese men gathered watching tv and exploring their high tech phones. Love it!
Great decor, good location for a few drinks, but crazy expensive. The beer was fantastic and attentive bartenders. The atmosphere is full of dark wood.
This business is closed. I have heard that all the waiters and employees were stiffed on their pay for the last couple nights they worked. Boo.

We went here on a Friday night around 8pm. The place was pretty empty, but as we were leaving around 10pm it was starting to fill up. The food was pretty good, not a huge selection. Expensive though!!!!!!!!!!!!

I tried this place with a group of friends on Friday and have mixed reviews.  This place is a bar/restaurant before 10PM and a live DJ comes on at 10PM and they clear the tables away to turn the place into a dance/club.  We were there for dinner and we all enjoyed our food.  The Squash Salad and Sonoma Mixed Salad were done very well - simple and the dressing was not over done.  The Quail small plate was excellent - must try!  The Scallop large plate was delicious and there was plenty of food.  The owner, Ali, and waiter, Josh, were both very attentive.  If you are out on the town for drinks and some food, this is a good place to hang with friends.

I give this place high marks for the decor alone. I haven't sat down for a full meal yet, but went for drinks with a group of friends Krav Maga around the corner. The beer taps still taste of glycol, even after being recently flushed, but the bartender can muddle up a nice Old Fashioned.

First Times a charm! I went here on a Friday night with friends. I was impressed and will definitely go back to eat here. Loved the atmosphere in the place and the lighting was perfect. I had three appetizers that I shared mussels in wine garlic broth, seared ahi tuna, and the baby back ribs. All of the items were well prepared and left my taste buds satisfied. I probably would give this place the 5th star, just want to go back there a few more times. Pretty awesome first impressions ;)!

We had a nice girls evening out here at midpoint. It was slow so we got a lot of attention from the hilarious waiter.. Food was very good - nothing too creative but very solid.. Scallops, salmon, all on point. Water glass was never empty. All in all it was nice food with friendly service in a nice ambiance. I'd go back!
Great decor, good location for a few drinks, but crazy expensive.

Midpoint, as its name suggests, is right in the middle of crazy crack-ass TL and fru fru Russian Hill, give or take a couple blocks. But other than being in the most exciting area on Polk st., Midpoint adds a touch of sophistication that the Gulch has been lacking.
you'd think the new spot in the neighborhood would be trying a little harder to please especially when its half empty and McTeague's (next door) is packed.

I will admit that this place will always be O'Reilly's Holy Grail and Midpoint keeps the decor as is, which is great. We came here for drinks and was seated at a table. The waiter was attentive (close to overly attentive, but not quite) and very nice. The atmosphere is full of dark wood, warmth and classy people. It's not pretentious and suits the Polk Street scene well. It's nice here and I have no complaints.

When did Midpoint open?? Just walked past it tonight on the way home from an event, peeked in and took a picture of the outside. The atmosphere is dark, sultry, classy, comfortable and spacious. Am very much looking forward to coming back on a Friday or Saturday night to see what the crowd is like. Midpoint looks like a winner!

The Ribs are pretty pretty on point! Watch your back Oola! Midpoint is gunning for you. They comped us dessert, but did it in a pretty awkward way, by bringing by plates and spoons, but then taking until even after we had asked for the bill to actually bring the dessert out. Luckily, the dessert ended up being warm chocolate cake, often called lava flow cake by our Hawaiian neighbors to the West. They also seemed bemused by the antics of my friend's excitable Russian girlfriend who may start yelping herself after I told her about Elite. Be on the look out for a review that says "I liken thee Buurgen King"
This place is housed in Mayes Oyster House, which has gone through several different incarnations in the last few years.

Came here tonight and was pretty excited to check out the new bar. As I walked further and further down Polk, I began to doubt whether this place was going to be any good, but as I stepped in, I was pleasantly surprised.

It's a club of old dudes. The building and facilities are nice..not as nice as the Olympic club by any shot of the imagination. Food is okay but you wanna come here when they have the all you can eat crab...its good ...and really the only reason to come.
HOUSE OF WALKER

I only go here for the pool and the pool is awesome! The pool is a beautiful indoor pool and the roof has clouds painted on it and it has a huge hot tub. Above the pool is a basketball court and it's awesome.

This is a wonderful place! The service is very good; the interior is very elegant. The gym and pool are very nice and well maintained. My favorite part is the buffet on Wednesday and Sundays evenings. The food is absolutely delicious! I would give it six stars if I could! Chef Lee has done an amazing job!

This is a really nice place. I was invited here for a lunch meeting and was not expecting to find how elegant it was. When the club member toured me around we came to the indoor pool and it reminded me of the original photos of the cliff house. When we went to the dining room, the tables were dressed for fine dining. The wait staff were equally polished in their suits and manners. I had the braised short ribs and the taste and texture were spot on.
It's a nice private club. The event space is great! And, the food and service are solid. Pretty older space reminiscent of bygone days (that I never lived through.)

This review is strictly based on my interaction with Benny Catacutan, the Clubhouse Manager.  I set up an appointment with him to view the ballroom at the Concordia Argonaut, which I was considering as a possible venue for my wedding reception.  Benny had emailed me documents regarding renting out the ballroom;  I reviewed them but I still had some questions that needed answering since they were not clear to me.  Anyhow, when I arrived at the Concordia Argonaut, the security guard handed me a folder with all the same documents that Benny had already emailed me and told me to meet him on the 3rd floor.  Benny met me in the ballroom and and showed me around.  I told him that I had some questions for him and he seemed stunned.  I asked him if there was a place we could sit down and so we sat in the ballroom.  He seemed annoyed by the questions that I was asking him, telling me that all the information was already listed in the packet.  I continued to ask him questions, and he said that all this can be discussed when I decide to have my reception at the Concordia Argonaut.  I couldn't believe it!  Why in the world would I want to host my wedding reception at a place when the manager wasn't even willing to meet with me for more than 5 minutes?  Not only that, I felt like he was totally materialistic and judgmental.  He complemented me on my Mont Blanc pen and my diamond engagement ring.  I was using my UC Berkeley padfolio from undergrad to take notes and he asked me what school I  went to.  When I told him I went to Berkeley, he seemed to be unimpressed and told me about another bride who was getting married there, but she goes to Stanford.  Anyhow, since Benny was so rude and unprofessional, I will be taking my business elsewhere!
Concordia Argonaut was one of the stops for our wedding venue tour.

besides from the price , everything is amazing, the facilites, workout room, pool, tv room, gym are never being used so it is never crowded, the buffets are excellent with so many options, i highly recommend eating there or joining, plus it is kids friendly with bingo night once a year which is a great time

Definitely a private club. Initiation fee is about $2000 and you're expected to spend $1000 annually on food (you have to eat there) with a monthly fee of $250. You ring a buzzer to get admitted into the building, which reminisces of the old hotels with small elevators and stairs.  This club has been in existence since the 1860's!  If you have $$ to burn nowadays, you could consider signing up as a member.
This is gonna be a tough one to write about. Been coming here for years for dinners as a guest who's a member.

Had dinner on Polk and needed something sweet to end the night. Found this place on Yelp and at first appearance didn't think it would be that good. The sweet crepe we had, the King Lias, was AMAZING! Banana, Nutella, coconut, chocolate and whip cream.  Definitely big enough for two people. One star off for not having ice cream as a topping choice.

I love how convenient their hours are for late munchies after either drinking and dancing all night. So a win win situation haha, good business for them and we get to eat late. The crepes are pretty friggin good, but a little crunchy in my book however maybe that's their signature mark, I think maybe coz they wrap 'em up to go so it's gotta be a bit durable for travel. So I'm good with that, still tastes awesome. :) I went back a couple of times and the owner is really welcoming. He loves to chat with his customers.

I prefer this place over the food truck on 11th st.  Good, honest food.  Nice variety and good choices for non meat eaters.  Really nice cook and you get to watch while he makes your creation.  Recommend.

Easy to miss this little place if you don't know the neighborhood! The name has changed, too - it is now Crepes Oh La La or something of that variety (still at 1220 Polk though). Service was great but we were disappointed in the crepes (nutella for me, lemon and sugar for my friend) which were too thick and undercooked. Oh well, it can be hard to get  quality crepes outside of France, but I probably won't come back to this place.

My first time in San Fran an it's around midnight. Me an the boyfriend have the munchies so I yelp local places an here comes Crepes A Go Go. Yes it's a very small place an easy to miss decor is an old school Paris feel but that is all thrown out the window once you take that first bite!

The local drunk munchie spot after a night out on Polk. Not usually a fan of crepes and I'm usually the drunk stumbler searching for bacon pizza, but these ones are superb! And a wide selection to choose from, haven't had one yet I don't like. The staff handles the crowd seamlessly and I'm always grinning when I'm handed my warm crispy soft crepe of goodness.

During my last visit to SF, I stumbled across this just walking down the street. I went with my usual crepe order of bananas and chocolate and it was large, fresh, and well put together. The simplicity you ask for in a crepe and nothing more. It was mid-day on a weekend, so not really packed and I didn't wait long at all to devour my daytime delight.

In a happy hour haze from $1 oysters and Stella from Mayes Oyster House, I drunkenly searched for "dessert" in my Yelp search and screamed when I saw "Crepes A Go Go - .002 miles." I used to be a regular at the Crepes A Go Go on 11th St at 2am on Saturday, and I had no idea there was one on Polk!

I've been here twice. The first time was after a night out and it was crowded. I wasn't exactly in the mood for some light French cuisine after drinking and dancing (greasy Mex would have been way more appealing) but this place seemed to be the only option in the area. The crepe was good, not amazing but you could tell the ingredients were fresh and put together well so I was happy (the crepes could have been filled a little more). The second time I went there was in the middle of a night out when I decided I just needed to eat something. This experience was better because the place was empty and the owner (or manager?) kept asking us how everything was. Also, my friend and I were chatting with the guy who makes the crepes and our meals were magically much larger than our previous visit...
I used to come here 4 years ago to get some crepes for breakfast and it never seemed crowded despite the fact the crepes are good!!!

First of all if you're looking for delicious fresh crepes look elsewhere.  Went there after dinner for the first time with the best friend and we were disappointed. We went for desert crepes and later realized that the crepes are pre made then reheated and filled with stuffings upon ordering. He has a stack of pre made crepes on the shelf in the cook area.
Relative to French restaurants, this is a one-star experience.  The grungy little restaurant has limited seating, often obnoxious music playing, and the food is only so-so.
My experience here was strongly affected by emotion. I'd just had my first bar fight (cross that off the bucket list) and was running purely on adrenaline for the next few hours.

I walked past this place after leaving one of the bars and decided to try it. They made my crepe into a hand-help crepe, which was useful because I took it to-go. The crepe was delicious! I am somewhat picky about my crepes, but this place got it right. I got my usual strawberry Nutella crepe with whipped cream.
Good and not just desert. I got a cheese tomato avocado, very tasty.

OK, this is where the Polk Gulch clubsters go for their late-night eats stampeding in packs like water buffaloes in heat. But the crepe maker stands his ground really well considering the loud-mouthed, alcohol-fueled shenanigans he must have to tolerate. He stands guard a solitary figure over his crepe iron in front of the window. It's really compact in here with only three tables of which Jamie W. and I were able to grab one. The bright yellow walls will keep you awake, and you can focus your concentration on the torn world map next to the cooking area.
Wow! Really good crepes! So perfect after a night out

This place is just ok. There's never anyone in this store, for a good reason. Maybe I've just been spoiled rotten by the Japanese crepes with their crispy skins... but this place just doesn't really compare... It's ok if you're desperate for a crepe and can't make it out to Japantown or Sunset for a crepe... but honestly, I'd rather save my calories for something else that's more yummy for the tummy.
yummy crepes. i went pretty late at night so they didn't have raspberries like i wanted, so i got bananas and strawberries and nutella.

My friend and I had the nutella and banana crepe. It was delicious. The service was fast. Very friendly. We sat down he brought the food right to our table. Definatly going back for seconds! AHMAYZING!!!!!
the guy here is so sweet.
Yummy.. crepes.. Crispy yet soft, tons tons tons of filling, lots of choices on the menu. I like how they fold it up in a pizza slice type thing, so you can pick up the whole thing and bite into it.
boo...i was excited to check out this location...i am a regular over at the crepes a go go trailer/truck over on 11th street.
Late night craving... why not get a crepe?!
I like it but they are close monday!!!
Wonderful little hole in the wall for crepes. Open super late and has TONS of crepes options.

omg i love this place.. ive been coming here 3 times a week for the past 4months.. me and my bf would come in the afternoon,midnight or early mornings.. i swear the crepe guy is up till 2 am maken crepes he even serves free cups of water even when you dont ask.. how azmazing.. $6.50-$7.50 crepes it may sound expensive but it sooooo worth it.. especially nutella, strawberry and banana is the best of the best!!!!!!
Original review written on March 12, 2009. Couldn't post it until I got a new Mac!

I wandered in here after having a huge dinner at the Mosque on the next block, so I wasn't terribly hungry. But I walked by at first, and then the smell... the SMELL. I did a 180 and walked back in search of said smell. I found it coming from here, and I had to order one of "whatever the hell you have there" (exact words). It was $4.00 and so definitely worth it. Maybe I'm just a sucker for anything that tastes remotely good, but it was a nice turkey crepe for the go go. Only thing that was annoying were the group of drunk girls who kept patting my hair and saying it was 'so cuuuuuuute', but that's not really the restaurant's fault.
Bomb. Especially 2am drunk! 11th n Folsom too. Same owner

I went here to grab a quick bite. The guy was really helpful, quick, and nice. Granted there weren't any other people there at the time. However, I was most impressed with the fact that he didn't skimp on ingredients. At least they fill the crepe and the ingredients were fresh.

From savory crepes in the morning to something sweeter for the 2am post-bar snack, Crepes A Go-Go is definitely a solid treat any time of the day.  A bit expensive for some of the crepes ($6 for Nutella and strawberries, for instance), but the quality is definitely good.  Service is good.
ahhhh crepes...i could eat you all day long.
$6 house special crepe with Monterey Jack cheese. Can't complain. Love the smooth and soft crepe this place makes. Great savory crepe budget buy! I'll be back.

It has been many a moon since I've gone to Crepes A Go Go. But four years ago when I was new to the city, I was actually introduced to the deliciousness that is Nutella here. (sidenote: i LOVE nutella).I was working in the area on Van Ness and Polk and got off work around 10ish and some coworkers were heading over and so i tagged along. and GOOD THING i did! crepes a go go is open late, its tasty and its not expensive..mmmmm I would recommend any crepe with nutella but i'm a bit bias:]
These crepes are made at a station right in the front window, nice touch.

Their crepes are out of this world. I always end up in some type of food coma after having their sugar butter apple crepes. No complaints here. Yum! Isn't this place now called "Crepe Oh La La"? Eh, who cares! Their crepes are still awesome!
Both their sandwhich, and dessert crepes are out of this world! There just as good as the ones I have in Greece, and I thought that was impossible. This is def a great crepery!

I think i've been spoiled with crepes from this amazing place in Downtown Denver... but this place was okay. The crepes were thicker than I've had before and just didn't have flavor. Plus they're much more expensive than I've ever paid for crepes. But not bad... just not amazing.
I love love love crepes and I like Genki Crepes in the Inner Richmond, but going to this place even made my love for crepes even deeper.

This place is an odd duck. It seems to serve primarily as a hangout for older Vietnamese dudes who sit for hours without actually ordering food. So when you walk in, unless you're an old Vietnamese dude, their reaction is to ask if you somehow got lost, perhaps looking for a dealer or hooker.
Tu Kim doesn't have a menu(didn't see one anywheres) seems they sell coffee( scooped from a "kirklands" can), bahn mi, and noodles soup.
The best Vietnamese coffee around in SF:)
5 stars for their crackin porridge!!! Do eat it with what they serve! Some bean sprouts, squeeze of lemon, and dab of hot sauce. Mm mm good. This is authentic, just like mama makes it

We went to Tu Kim for lunch because a co-worker was raving about the noodle soup. The menu is very minimalistic and consisted of congee, sanwhiches and noddle soup. I had the congee with pork blood and liver. The porridge was very tasty and pretty filling. The porridge was made with broken rice. A co-worker mentioned that the rice was stirred fryed beforehand in order to bring out the flavor.

In search of a good banh mi and decided to give this place a try.  Like other shops in the neighborhood, it's a hole in the wall with a simple counter.  They also serve noodles and a hang-out with some locals.

A mysterious shop in the Tenderloin area that doesn't seem to have a menu and only has one type of sandwich.  The sign out front says coffee, sandwiches and ice cream. I didn't see any ice cream but I did see many cans of condensed milk (for Vietnamese coffee I presume). It looked like the ice cream freezer was being used for other purposes. The inside is cluttered, they have multiple TVs, and a few small tables. The restroom was out of order.

Yes! After my last experience with Banh Mi (see my Bien Hoa review), I needed a good one! I was tempted to go to the spots I'm familiar with (the spots I knew wouldn't disappoint), but I'm a woman on a mission here! I'm moving across country soon and I need to fill up my "Tender Banh Mi" list. I've walked by this place several times before while heading towards Sing Sing. There's always a crowd of smokers outside. That should be a good sign. When I went in today, it was filled with people inside too. The shop is narrow with seating along the walls and about  of the seats were filled. I ordered my "One sandwich to go!" I was not disappointed. No two Banh Mi are the same, but the combo should have the basics...and this one did. The pate was just right, the pork roll was piled on thick, the carrots were pickled properly (no daikon or onions), the jalapeño was generous, and the seasonings were all there. Still can't touch my fave spot (Hoang Dat), but I was very satisfied with my $3 meal!
I love the combination bread with fried egg.  This is a little bit different from other Vietnamese sandwich since it has fried eggs inside.  But you got to try it, it is awesome.

They have one of the best chicken sandwiches I've ever eaten, if not the best at the present moment.  I normally go to Saigon Sandwich which has a huge following, but this store's sandwich is even better (which is hard to believe when I told that to my friends).  I've only tried their BBQ chicken sandwich without any modification, so not sure if the other sandwiches are good.

If it weren't for the English issues, this place would have 5 stars by my book!!  Crisp-yet-chewy fresh baguette rolls, pickled veggies, and the most savory cuts of jambon (that's ham for ya Americans) came together to make the most delicious bites.
Pretty good bahn mi sandwiches. I've tried pork and fancy pork, BBQ pork and most recently tofu and pork. All were good, not excellent (3.5 stars).

Who needs eyelid surgery when you can drink this amazing Vietnamese coffee... After one sip my eyes opened up BIG... "I can see clearly now the rain is gone". It was so refreshing, the first sip already had me wired so that was a plus. The perfect taste of bitter  with a touch of sweetness from the condensed milk.
Simply Delight Cafe offers bahn mi, spring rolls, drinks. limited seating.
Time: 2:17pm/74°F partly sunny
Fantastic fresh and cheap bahn mi! Only 4 dollars for a combination sandwich! Veggies were fresh and juicy, bread was delicious. Great place to grab a tasty inexpensive lunch.
This place is good :) good cheap sandwich. try there vietnamese coffee  way better than starbucks or petes. the owner is very nice.

Best Vietnamese sandwiches in Nob Hill-TL area!! Fresh delicious veggies with a little spice to give it a nice kick. And it was about an 8 inch hoagie for only $4. Can't beat that price. Most sandwiches in SF are $8-$10 these days.

Had beef soup and veggie fresh rolls. Not the best I've ever had, but very very close. Probably the 2nd best. I eat a lot of pho and spring rolls! Great little place with friendly staff. I saw the table next to me doing the beef 7ways, can't wait to try that when I'm in town next.
7 course beef - Pagolac such a fail.
I went here since a friend of a friend chose this place as his restaurant on Check Please Bay Area.
Worst food I've had in a while.
Meh. I usually avoid mediocre reviews but I'm on the search for the best hot pot in the nabe (the bar has been set).

Where do i begin?? Went there when i was in Sfo for a bit and no place in Nyc matches up to it. Their pho with five spice chicken is so good, i could eat it every day for the rest of my life. Such incredibly simple flavors put together. I cannot wait till the next time i get to go back.

Finally made it here for the 7 flavors of beef. One dining companion said it was a lot of food so we split 2 orders of the beef between 5 people and ordered some side dishes. I was pretty full by the end. We got:
Me thinks not. Not for San Francisco and still not for the Bay area. The carpaccio style beef was too sweet and the grilled seafood dish was missing the seafood. Not necessary in San Francisco.
Mmmm, I love their 7 Flavors of Beef. For $19 a person, this is a bargain/good value.
Don't call, their phone number listed doesn't work, I didn't even want to give them a star.

everybody seems to be talking about the food here but can we take a moment and talk about the ambiance? it's really strange up in there. i wasn't sure why i felt weird the moment i stepped in but as i sat around i realized that the walls are harsh and almost cave-like with no decorations adorning the walls. next i realized that you can't see the kitchen at all. and on top of that there's no cashier area, host table, bar or anything else. the place is super bare and literally houses only tables and chairs. weird, right? right. after i got over the fact that i was eating in a cave in the tenderloin, i focused on the food.

It's been a while since we've been to Pagolac, but it still has the same quaint atmosphere that we remember from many years back.  Chef David is now at the helm, but he definitely follows after his mom's footsteps with the flavor and quality of the dishes that he prepares.

I had great hopes for this place,  but they were dashed with the spring rolls.   Yes they were huge, but they had no flavor, and the peanut sauce was horribly disappointing.   It was so watered down that it had no flavor at all.   How is that even possible?
had a long nicely paced dinner there. the wrap your own spring rolls are great fun and the seven course beef is a nice activity. will definitely  try it again.

7 beef. It was ok. Party of 5, simply skimpy with their portions. Now, we have to search for another destination to feel more complete.  1 person gets 3 pieces of beef of paper thin 2" diameter.  We got only 1 plate of veggies with only a pinch of pickles.  We constantly had to ask for more.  Go to Anh hong for more a better deal and better taste.  This place is totally for the innocent virgins of true Vietnamese food!
Love love love the 7 courses of beef at Pagolac. I've had 7 courses of beef at another place once because Pagolac was closed but it came nowhere close to Pagolac.
The best seven course entree you can have in San Francisco! Awesome vietnamese cuisine! Definitely coming back again for their seven course beef.

Yes, they only have one server, yes, she's slow, yes, she forgets things but food is really good... we had the crispy rolls, then the lotus root salad, the seafood to boil at the table and wrap-it-yourself (this was fun) but the favorite (specially my boyfriend's favorite) was #34: marinated pork sliced and then charbroiled... so good I can eat 3 of those! Their dessert is simple but oh so good!

My favorite Vietnamese spot in town. Seven different types of beef dish is great. Cant go wrong with the 6.50 pork vermicelli. Quality is close to Slanted door, imo for a fraction of the price. They have strange hours so check before you go.

Came here specifically to try the 7 course beef. We walked in and it was so cold. There was no heater that I had to leave my jacket on to eat the entire time. They did bring us a little fire from burning of the gel they usually use to keep food warm but they brought it out for us after so long. The food came out one after another pretty quickly and the service was just okay. The food was pretty good. All the meats were tasty and marinated well.

I would never come back to this place again. The service was terrible. You will be waiting at least 2 hours for your food after ordering on an empty day. The meat is not fresh - probably a couple days old.
Food:  3-4 Stars
My friend wanted to come here for the 7 course beef meal. He said it was super good, and I was quite skeptical how you can eat 7 meals with beef.

I don't understand all the negative reviews for this place, or the animosity.  I find the food here to be comforting, flavorful and fresh and every person I've brought here has left with their taste buds stimulated and their bellies full.

Loved the seven flavor beef meal. My favorites were the thin slices that we boiled and the ones we bbq-ed. I also enjoy the minimal no frills decor. My only complaint is that it took a long time to be served yet it didn't impact the experience too much. The price is also quite fair.
HOW DO YOU FXXK UP A BUN HOI CHAO TOM?! It was 3 whole ones cut in half and pan fried. Not worth coming here since I felt super ripped off. FXXK THIS PLACE. ARE YOU FXXKN FOR REAL?
First off, when I came in there was ONLY 4 tables.

This place is completely overrated, I'm officially running out of good options for Viet in the city, you guys are going to make me drive to Oakland for it, won't you? I'm pretty picky, but the Pho broth was just okay and the Bun Cha Gio Thit was nothing to write home about. And why are they skimping on the vegetables? It's completely unforgivable. Even at the prices they are charging which some would consider a "deal" is pretty standard across Viet restaurants in the city. And the freshness of the vegetables is average here.
Dear god, for a four star rating place. This place is a joke. Maybe its just catering towards those who consider presentation over texture and taste....
Decent pho. Nothing to write home about and nothing to complain about. Supposedly this place is known for their beef course so i'll have to come back for that.
Rating 4: I'd come here again, pretty solid choice.
Ordered pho with rare beef and meatballs.  The broth was tasty and not too salty.
No idea why this place gets as many positive reviews as it does.  I dined for the first time recently based on yelp reviews and it was an utter and complete let down.

i LOVE bo 7 mon aka 7 courses of beef.  It's as meaty as you can get when eating with Viet people.  It is literally 7 courses of beef, where you can cook the meat at your table, and wrap it up in a spring roll to dip into your sauce and eat.
So many, so young, who want their food served quick, like at McDonalds or a Chinese restaurant.
Delicious bun cha and great service! I really want to try the pho next time. Service was great too and prices were very reasonable considering the portion sizes.

My boyfriend saw this place on Check Please and wanted to check it out. We had heard the wait can be long, but we were fortunate only to have a few parties in front of us. We ordered the seven courses of beef, which was pretty great. Of course, some dishes were better than others and it did get a little repetitive towards the end, but we were both still definitely satisfied. I would recommend this place for a cheap and casual date night or just to try something different. The food was good and it was a fun experience.
Ordered:

Okay good Bo 7 Mon (7 courses of beef).  If I had never had it before I'd say it was very good, but the whole time, my uncle and I were observing that the 7 courses of beef at Anh Hong is just a bit more tasteful.  Specifically, the meatballs here seemed to have a bit less kick and variety of flavors than what I was expecting.  Given the meatball roll dishes make up course number 4 to 6, that's a pretty important component of the meal.

No shortage of Vietnamese restaurants in Little Saigon -- but Pagolac stands out. The place is very unassuming. Quiet but friendly staff, modest decor... But the food is delicious. If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese, look no further! We had the veggie spring rolls, the beef soup, and one of the pork a la carte dishes. Spring rolls were fresh and tasty, the broth in the soup was amazing, and both the beef and pork had a delicious BBQ flavor to them. Great food --- and they're open until 10pm most days. Some notes --- they don't take reservations, which is no big deal because they don't get too busy, and they're cash-only.
Excellent Thai food, reasonable prices, great/quick service, unique decor, easy to park (for SF...)

I ordered one of the 2 'Tom' soups and then the supposedly highly rated pineapple fried rice. The soup was good -- more veggies than broth. The pineapple rice dish was very, very weird. The faux meat (tofu protein based, I assume) is just odd.....There were like 3-4 mystery 'meats', all with different processed textures and flavors, none of which was particularly memorable or appetizing. I've had better faux meat in NYC at other vegan restaurants....The garnish on the entree was pretty with the orchid, but the bed of shredded beets and cut cucumbers were dry, as if prepared days in advance....
One of the best Thai food I have ever tasted. Service was excellent. The food was beautifully presented. Would definitely recommend this place to anyone who visits or lives in SF!
Really good and reasonably priced. I'm a fan!

Mmmm, you know I don't really make a lot of trips to the Tenderloin anymore. Golden Era still hasn't reopened so I thought, "Eh. I can do without. Anything with a kinda sketchy experience I want I can get in Oakland." But now I have a really good reason for venturing out here.
I am not a vegetarian. However, I must admit that here the food is really good. So tastie. I d definitely recommend this place
Thai Idea is very good, far better than any of the numerous Thai restaurants I've tried in the Bay Area.
Very nice dining area, friendly staff, and excellent service.  The food was great just the right amount of spice and enjoyed the soy Thai ice tea.
Amazing food!! Not only is this the best Vegetarian Thai restaurant it is the best Thai restaurant I have ever been to!
This is one of the best vegetarian restaurant! All the dishes are full of vegetables and bursting full of flavors.
This place was awesome! Interesting and delicious dishes. Healthy and fresh. Easy to share. Presented beautifully.
I really liked their wings bomb!  It was piping hot, crisp and zestily sauced with basil and chopped carrots.
Where do I start with this? Total awesomeness in my mouth!
1. Amazing service
Great meal!! Very Tasty and great presentation. Would highly recommend. All the dishes were served hot and tasty.

I am a vegetarian who lives in the TL, and I do most of my cooking and a *lot* of my shopping locally at the markets in Little Saigon. That is why I was very disappointed today -- on a day when I am recovering from a bad flu and just needed my partner to pick me up some simple, healthy food to-go -- that Thai Idea put old tofu that had gone off and fermented, into my soup.

Healthy, non-greasy, super tasty vegan dream with the perfect amount of service.  I wish they delivered, so we wouldn't have to rely on Los Ros, which is also not a bad place, but a tad bit less vegan friendly, this place with slightly better food overall.   They have creamy peanut dripping satay sticks and meat substitutes like the carnivorous-consistency Wing Bomb.  Sometimes you miss the carnal-ness of flesh eating even with your enlightened Vegan dietary choice.  If you are going down that route, down the route of concentrated and processed meat substitutes, it's always good to start the pallet out with the healthy papaya stuff - called the Som Tum Salad to balance everything out in an aggregate sense.  Their Pad Thai is amazing too, biting into its thick noodle, a consistency that also ranks up there for those who like that kinda stuff.    It's all mouth watering.  Umm, except for their Green Curry, but that's probably just my own taste buds or maybe it's the fact that the only time I got it, I felt that the eggplant wasn't cooked to it's proper "meltedness", a proper tenderness so fragile that the eggplant's skin and pulp slices upon forktouch, then taking some of that seasoned eggplant skin and pulp, mixing it into the forkful of rice before dropping off that whole multidimensional admixture into the mouth, the spices, pulp, skin, oils penetrating the rice, activating your tastebudes in a far eastern fugue.  This is good karma.  Their Red Curry rocks, and they can make it all mild, like we need to do it, us with young kids and all.  Their pumpkin curry doesn't disappoint either, now finding ourselves ordering it a bunch now in October and all.
Hidden in the inside of an -under  construction- building, Thai Idea Vegetarian is a little treasure gem, for those who "dare" to walk through San Francisco's "worst neighborhood"...

Best vegetarian/vegan Thai food in the country! I travel a lot and this place is the best. The location isn't great and I don't recommend walking there on your own, due to it being right smack in the Tenderloin. But the food is AMAZING. Huge portions, friendly and helpful staff. GREAT PRICES! My husband and I come here every time we're in San Fran. The Tom Yum soup is fantastic. So is the Cashew "chicken". Definitely a must if you like Thai food.
Hidden Gem :)

Glad we chose to walk into Tenderloin to find this place. Worth it!  As an almost vegan, it was a relief and joy to look at a menu and be able to have more than one vegan option on the menu!  What a treat!!!

It's good for being vegan but I wouldn't come back. Ordered the drunken noodles, cashew but tofu...it was all ok. The chicken in the cashew nut tofu was a bit much. Excellent service and flexibility esp with our two kids under the age of 3. Probably not coming back.
So many options for vegetarians. Taste and presentation are so good. Superior quality food with very reasonable prices!

I enjoy a good vegetarian meal every now and then but my only qualm is that I often leave still feeling hungry. Well at Thai Idea, not only do I leave full and satisfied, I sometimes even have a to go box to boot.

Small restaurant, nice ambience, friendly people and great food. Had the Pad Kee Mow, simply brilliant display of the cuisine and just tastes wonderful! And they served it in no time. Great place for a family dinner and even for having a good time with friends!

Everything we have ordered on the menu is amazing!  The staff is really friendly, the place is really clean, and the prices are reasonable.  The variety of fake meats used is great, and the hardcore meat eaters we've brought along have been pleasantly surprised. The curry is fantastic!

This is a great spot for vegetarians! The veggie meat is delicious, particularly the Peking duck. I also enjoyed the wing bombs, crab cakes, and cashew nuts with tofu and vegetables. One thing to look out for is that an 18% gratuity is included for large parties so be careful not to pay twice as it doesn't show up on the final bill.

This is honestly the best vegan food I've ever had. Their imitation meat is phenomenal! The service was quick and the food was amazing. I would have given them more stars if I could. I'm pretty much speechless

I eat meat and this was by far some of the best vegetarian Thai food I've had. The pumpkin curry is amazing! It's a very relaxing place to take friends or loved ones. Good Thai beer and amazing customer service. The nicest people work there! Lots of warm positive vibes! Order the brown rice too! It's wonderful!
Food was great and reasonably priced.  There are lots of different options, some more healthy than others.  And portions are very generous.
Talk about a hidden gem... just a hop (over some pee puddles), skip (around an open manhole) and jump (over some weave in the street) from Market street.

Delicious and amazing vegetarian Thai food. I will definitely come back here again. This service is amazing and the atmosphere is great. I tried the pad thai nd coconut juice and I will most definitely recommend coming back here.

I have been to many vegan places in the past and I found this place pretty ordinary in terms of taste. The portions are very small and I couldn't find the real value to the money you pay. Most of the "supposed to be crispy items are soft and saggy. The service is not prompt as I observed only 2 servers serving for the entire crowd.

I've  enjoyed dining here at least a half dozen times and can truly say, it's a treat to eat there. While the area is sketchy,walk in and you're in another world. It is clean with a nicely finished walls and lighting. The real star of this place is the outstanding food. I'm hooked on the the Bangkok duck. It is my favorite dish of all the many choices listed.
We went here as a group of 5 and was impressed with the decor, service, and food presentation.

What a find!!!!  It is so delicious and so beautiful and the prices are quite reasonable.  The decor is great.  The waiter was helpful and super nice.  The fact that it is vegetarian is a huge plus for me, but I believe non-vegetarians will find it delicious as well.   I'll be back often.

Very good asian food. Vegetarian duck. If you can make this into the best tasty duck, all is possible. We all had different dishes and each dish was good (2 thai dishes, one indian curry, and one Chinese dish). And the wine (Cabernet Sauvignon) was also very good and accomodating. Service excellent.

This is my favorite restaurant in the Tenderloin, possibly all of SF. It's also the best Thai cuisine I've been to, vegetarian or not. Omnivores, don't be afraid of the fake meats! They are delicious!
I generally stay away from vegetarian places, but the high rating drew me in.

So, I'm a vegetarian/vegan-on-good-days foodie...but definitely *not* one of those "hipster locavores" who dominate the yelp scene by their vocalism. Just someone who knows good food, and appreciates a dish for taste rather than for where it's from or what it stands for.
If I could give them a half star, I would. They doubled the given delivery time with no explanation. They all of a sudden they had my delivery once I called. NEVER ORDER FROM SEAMLESS.

The food is good and we liked this place but today we haven't had dinner because it's been two hours and a half since we placed the order and food is still not here. Worst experience ordering food ever. We finally cancelled the order.
My office catered lunch from here and I absolutely loved it.
Review of delivery service only.

If you like to eat small cock roaches then you can eat here. This place has many roaches in the kitchen area, so nasty. Don't say I didn't worn you. The staff is so nice though but the owner is cheap in cleaning up the infestation.
I've had Thai 4 you on three separate occasions using their delivery service each time and it has always been excellent. Pipping hot and well packaged!
This is a review of delivery only, as I've never eaten in.

This is THE WORST Thai food I have ever had. It might even be the worst food I've ever had. I ordered the mango shrimp which tasted like nothing but soy sauce, and the shrimp tasted like something frozen that I would buy at Safeway.
I second the other reviewer who said to NOT order this restaurant on Grubhub.

Maybe it's good in person, but I don't recommend ordering here on Grubhub. Owner was unwilling to refund the meal even though it arrived 40 min late (took almost 2 hours in total.. to deliver it a whole.. 2 miles.) and was cold. Food wasn't very good, either.
this place is great. I never had a bad meal here, from this owner or the last. Thought I think the new owner is doing a better job then the last.

So I took a late nap, woke up around 8:50 and make my way out to the streets, I walk past the Vietnamese place I ate for lunch the other day and they were closing up as were all the other ones in the area, I schlep down to this street and literally stumble over this little gem.  The decor is very inviting and they actually put some thought into the ambience.  The place was empty, so I dived right in.  I ordered three appetizers and some Brown rice and a Thai beer.   The tofu squares were pretty good, the Calamari was crispy and tasty and the Brown rice was excellent and the fried Shrimp rolls were very good too.   They had a special on the appetizers and even so, I tend to order just appetizers whenever I eat Thai, for some reason a lot of Thai places tend to over cook their meat in their main dishes.  The service was friendly and being a family run business of course it was very homey.  The place ended up being one of two high points on my very short, but sweet trip to this town!!!
Ordered eggplant with shrimp  on eat24 and my order had NO EGGPLANT only green beans, onions, and peppers.  Flavor is good but NOT AT ALL WHAT I ORDERED

Food is sooooo good! Very friendly server lady and attentive. Made sure our food was what we wanted. Clean and nice inside. I had the Red beef curry and it was excellent! The Tom Yum soup is some of the best I have ever tasted. My buddy got the catfish meal and he said it was awesome. Great place!

Not good. Food is so so. Angel wings  flavoring was good. Po Tak soup was too sweet and want enough spicy and sour. The chicken in cashew chicken was over cooked. Spicy beef wasn't that spicy. Panang fish was ok. Disappointed and won't be back.
Awesome and interesting food.  Everything we ordered was great, but the salmon mango salad deserves particular mention.  It's a delightfully spicy cross between a stir fry and a salad.

Great new Thai restaurant opening up in the area.  I specifically recommend the spicy catfish, roti appetizer and pumpkin curry.  I agree with some of the other reviews that the meat quality is really good, compared to other Thai restaurants.  Also, the service is great and the waitress is always smiling!
Went here for lunch and had some delicious yellow curry. My guy got the Spicy Beef.

I like this place.  Good food, excellent service and reasonable price.  I usually order the small po tak seafood soup for $5 and a crispy chicken rice plate.  The restaurant is very clean, and off-street parking is always available.

This restaurant, formerly Jarin Thai, has got some interesting dishes - including Spicy Catfish. The previous owner is helping train the current chef with his old recipes, so that's promising. The catfish was tasty, though not much fish at all and a whole lot of tasty batter. If you're pescatarian craving pork crackling (without the meat), that's the dish for you (get it extra crispy). Pad thai will be my next foray into their menu. Brown rice is available. Note about prices: pretty much doubled since the takeover of Jarin. Expect $18-21 per person. Service was quietly pleasant.

King Ling has pretty generic, americanized Chinese food. Ordered the steamed dumplings which were essentially flavorless with a dry pork filling and a sauce that didn't taste right at all, kind of like beef stock. The chicken in black bean sauce was okay; the sauce was good but the chicken and vegetables felt overly oily. I will give them credit for being quick (they estimated 10 mins and it was there when I showed up) and my food was there.
Food is excellent,  fast delivery but no utensils and im at work. Gurr. Called and I got hung up on. Very hungry and disappointed.

I feel lucky to have found a great Chinese food delivery like King Ling. It's always tasty and super hot upon delivery. Also really fast!  I love their hot and sour soup, chicken corn egg flower soup and their chicken mu shu . Their chow mein is just the right amount of greasy. Soo good!! But heads up, they are closed on Sundays.

I'm not even a Chinese food fan, but when I am sick and cannot taste anything else? This is my joint!! Full of flavor and fast. I get mu shu chicken and it's white meat which is my favorite and wonton soup. I survive on it for days and I swear by this cold remedy. Add lots of siracha :-)
Generic Chinese loaded with msg. Ordered lunch here and ended up with a massive migraine. Don't eat here.
This place may not look good from the outside but hands on one of the best shawmain and general chicken i have tried!

Very disappointing. Ordered schezuan chicken & Mongolian beef lunch specials & mu shu pork.  There was no schezuan spices in the chicken, just sweet sauce with a bit of pepper added.  Should have been called spicy fried chicken.  That was the best item.  Mongolian beef was dry and lacked any kind of sauce.  It looked like it was cooked with some onions briefly and put on the container.  And the mu shu pork might have been OK if they didn't send me 4 cracked and broken pancakes.  I couldn't wrap one up without it falling into a dozen pieces and making the largest mess.  I'm guessing they were frozen and thawed many times to end up like that.  They also did not provide me with any napkins (or sauces) and I was forced to wipe my hands on my gym shirt (being at my office).  All this after a $2 delivery charge too.
GRUB HUB ORDERS BEWARE!  Waited two hours for food to arrive. They cancelled my order for an unknown reason. Tried to call and got a generic recording.  BOOOOO!!!
Was walking around looking for something different to eat and I came across this little restaurant. I stood outside reading their menu stuck to the window and the prices were great.

Fresh scallops and vegetables with chicken and fresh green beans over white rice was amazing!! We never expected the food to be this good and the service was phenomenal. Very fast and super delicious!!

In a hotel room coming down with the flu: chills, fever, sore throat. The only cure is hot and sour soup! I ordered online and delivery was prompt. The soup was hot and delicious. Proper h&s soup. The cashew nut chicken was good and the veggies fresh.

They get 4 stars for the surprise factor alone LOL.. the outside looks very um let's say questionable. I live like next door and have passed by here for about a year now and always thinking to myself, man I feel sorry for the people who are eating in there! But joke's on me.. the food here is very good. I ordered the hot an sour soup.. for $5.50 it's HUGE. You can prob make a meal out of it or share with a buddy. It was good! I also ordered the Hunan General Tsuo's Chicken for $8.50 (I think they charged $1.25 for rice). It was crispy on the outside and tender chicken on the inside, and very good taste. It was also huge and almost did not finish it... almost. Needless to say, I'll be calling in pick up again!

With a hunkering for Chinese food during my stay in San Fran (between Tenderloin and Union Square), I, like any other tourist, assumed Chinatown was the place to go. Boy was I wrong. Apparently Tenderloin is the go-to for Chinese food. I had a short list of requirements for my restaurant:
Fried rice, broccoli with cashews and crab rangoon were hot and delicious. Fast delivery too.

One of the things about living in Thailand is that I miss good ol', stick to your ribs, savory Chinese food. This is a good place for it. On a cold February night, staying in the neighborhood, I ordered pickup from here. I got Hot and Sour Soup and Beef Chow Fun. Good comfort food choices.
This place is literally a hole in a wall, but it's a good one and spotlessly clean inside its tiny space.  I walked through the kitchen and it was immaculate with fresh vegetables in nice neat piles.

Quite a surprise and super cheap too! You know how you go to a Chinese restaurant and you really don't want to order a whole order of, say, Moo Shu Pork or spicy green beans because you don't want all that food and certainly don't want to pay $10-12 for an entrée? King Ling is the answer. Get this: they do the same quality of food as a sit down place, of which there are many in SF of course. You can order noodle or rice plates.
Only been here a few times, but I absolutely love the curry chicken chow mein! You get so much food for the amount paid. Incredibly affordable
So so chinese in the tenderloin. Quick cheap lunch.

This is a sweet little lunch spot. They have well priced lunch combos, which are even better if you eat there, cause you get some delicious soup. So far, I've had the sesame chicken, sweet and sour pork, and their egg rolls. Portions so large, you may have a bit left over. Only downside is they don't do the brown rice. Oh we'll, for the price and convenience of the location, I can forgo it!
Just got food poisoning from this place.
This tiny little hole in the wall

Pretty good little Chinese place. Certainly nothing fantastic but it's quite a good spot if you are looking for something fast or close by. The food is pretty good but it certainly didn't blow me away. I went in, made an order, and was probably out of the door in the next 10 minutes. There's some space if you wanted to go in and sit down, but I'd probably say this is a better place for getting deliver or picking up the food for a comfortable night in.
I liked it. Doesn't look like much on the outside, but the service Ifor take-out) was fast, friendly and efficient. The food was plentiful, hot and good. No complaints.

King Ling is small and doesn't have a nice looking doorstep. However when I got in I found the place pretty clean. I ordered curry chicken chow-mein and, as a very picky Chinese foodie, I can say that it is FANTASTIC! It's not those Americanized take-out with low food quality at all. Worth coming back.

Their orange chicken is crispy! 5 stars. Veggie chow mein is a little bland. Minus 1 star. Nice and friendly service. Solid 4.5 stars. Totally made my sad stay at home on a saturday and watch a movie and eat chinese food night even more awesome.
I have been eating here for about 8 years, mostly combination won-ton soup.  They used to make it like all the other Chinese restaurants, with chicken, beef, pork and shrimp.
I've avoided this place for years because of the shabby storefront, but don't judge a book by its cover.  Or more accurately don't judge the flavor of chinese food by its grungy restaurant.

Okay so in actuality this place probably deserves 4 stars or maybe 4.5, BUT I personally passed it up for a few weeks because it was at a 3.5er and I'm trying to boost the overall score here. The food here is bomb. You can't really eat inside because it's super cramped so I typically take it back to the apt. For those of you who aren't Chinese food purists, you know who you are. When asked what you're favorite Chinese dish you've been known to say things like "panda beef" or "sweet and sour (insert meat here)" or the dreaded "orange chicken!" No disrespect, I'm a white boy from the suburbs myself, and I've said all those things at one point or another, and that's why I LOVE this place. There food is crispy, saucy, and my god, is it ever good. So basically, if you're looking for a quick, relatively cheap, Chinese place that will fulfill your craving for crispy saucy meat (or tofu if that's your thing), then this is your place, it's one of, if not the best Chinese restaurants in the neighborhood. DON'T LET THE SO-SO YELP SCORE FOOL YOU!!!!

Gtsao Chicken is as good as always, the chicken fried rice is great- however the potstickers i got today were totally different then the ones i got when i ordered them the last time i was here. Still great but smaller- not that that was a bad thing they were perfectly proportionate. However the outside and insides were totally different then before, still good but makes me wonder why they were completely different *perhaps they get them from a vendor somewhere else?* their soysauce is also different, it's sweeter than normal. Everything was great. Fast and friendly service just like before ^.^ they say your food is ready in 10-20min but they're speedy and do it in half the time
King Ling! King Ling! Me like King Ling Restaurant!
This food was so ick - very fatty and salty, super tasteless, not good at all. A few hours after I choked down part of this dinner, I violently vomited.
I wanted to expand my review, considering that I eat here once a week. These guys knock it out of the park - easily the best chinese in the city.

I feel like I just got ripped off. I spent $12 on the Walnut Prawn entree and steamed rice. In all, it came with about seven prawns. It was incredibly tiny and it left me starving afterward. There was barely any sauce either. If this had been a nice dine-in restaurant, that would be one thing. But this is a hole-in-the-wall take-out joint. What are they thinking? I'm not going back.

The restaurant is only one block away from my place and I was craving a decent Chinese dish the other day, so I gave it a try. I ordered Chicken Fried Rice and was happy at first because it was prized fairly cheap. However, based on the food you get it is still overpriced:

This little joint is easy to miss if you don't look closely because of the small doorway/window they have but it's a nice, cheap Chinese joint. I have only ordered one thing religiously for about a year, the beef and tomato chow mein. It's not the cheapest food in the area but its about 7bucks with tax and they give a decent portion. I haven't been there for about year since I was away for a while but I will definitely go back there for some more yummy Americanized Chinese food.
Located on my block, this place has become a go-to for lunch because of their quality - if not very authentic - food and because it's cheap as a mofo, always a plus for a T-loin'er.

Tiny Chinese food restaurant with polished wood veneer tables and counter. The woman who minds the register is no-nonsense with her staff but a little less so with customers. Decent lunch special (food and price). I like the window seating for people-watching, but it can get sort of tight in the space when busy.
Review of delivery from King Ling Restaurant via

After a couple of Yelp fails on a couple of  Chinese places.  The Yelp recommended following of , Sesame Chicken and Pot Stickers  as being good, proved spot on!   Actually the Pot Stickers are worth it.  These Meat filled Pockets of delight Made the meal.  The Sesame Chicken was Very Good.  It would have been better to eat it there.  It's also different in that this one Sesame chicken has a spicy finish at the end!
Food Items Ordered:
Best BBQ Pork Banh Mi's in the Tenderloin! Also they're chicken wings and assortment of egg rolls is great.  Try the Taro, Pork and Crab Egg Rolls.
For something in the tenderloin this place isn't that sketchy. But it's still kind of dirty and not very visually appealing. Their servers are quite inconsiderate and don't pay much attention to you.

Lee's is one of my places to grab a bite in San Francisco. When I was there the hostel I stayed at was just across the road and I stumbled across Lee's when as I'd been told not to travel too far out for food at night.

Decent food. Decent sandwiches although the fried fish roll sandwich #19 i believe is the best of the lot. They have a wide variety and selecton of snack foods and drinks plus their baguette are cheap and warm freshly baked every 30 min. The service is okay, not good nor bad. Viet ladies speak the okay English but seriously super convenient and close and they open early. So stop by for your morning coffee or whatever.

Food snobs will insist that you head over to Saigon Sandwich instead of Lee's; they're missing the point. The bahn mi at Lee's isn't much worse than Saigon but you don't have to wait in some crazy line either but perhaps what makes Lee's Sandwiches even more unique is that it's a big emporium of Vietnamese foodstuff.

So Lee's is a huge chain as we all know and i've been to it a lot in SoCal but not in NorCal. I am gluten intolerant so can't speak for their bread rolls but their spring rolls are alright, the sauce is not so great but they are good on-the-go foods. Their bobas and smoothies are good and they have a lot of snacks available. I bought banana fritters and they were out of it but were able to make it fresh for me in 15 minutes which was great!

It was lunchtime and I wanted a quick bite before going back to work. I grab a rice pudding from refrigerated section. Line up at cash register. When its my turn, cashier indicates I need to pay at the other register.

Stopped in here for a few snacks since it was near our hotel.  The place has tons of Vietnamese goodies.  We ended up with spring rolls, nam, and fresh spring rolls.  They offered a variety of spring rolls like chicken & vegetable, shrimp & taro, and vegetable.  The shrimp and taro spring rolls were tiny.  There were small shrimp in it, but I did not find any taro.

Usually I leave good reviews for this place however today my sandwich had rotten avocados and lettuce was yellow in color . The place was empty when I came in and still they could not make one sandwich properly . 2 years ago this place was super awesome !!!

I stopped here twice on my stay in SF.  I got sandwiches each morning and they were excellent.  The fresh French baguette in the morning was amazing.  Picked up a steam bun, and some other baked goods to.  All were good and real cheap.  Sandwich for 4 bucks in the city, that's awesome.  If you don't know Lees Sandwich franchise is kind of the McDonalds of Bahn Mi Sandwiches.  You could probably get a more artisan meal at a mom n pop places but for the price you can't go wrong.

Spending a couple of days in SF for a seminar at the Administrative Office of the Courts. Walked by Lees on the way back to my hotel and saw a sign saying sandwiches for $3.75. Seriously? Just paid $5 for a bagel. Had to see what you get for this price. What I got was a 10" crusty baquette with crisp veggies and very flavorful grilled pork. Not to mention the place was clean and my order came pretty quickly. Definitely my go to when I'm in the area.

Stopped by here specifically for a pastry called banh bo nuong. It's slightly similar to a cassava cake but it's green, chewy soft inside with coconut flavor. Since I was already there, I was curious to try their vegetarian sandwich and a pandan waffle. The pandan waffle was bleh, the vegetarian sandwich was ok, I've had better, and the pastry also could have been better if it was warm and fresh. I have yet to find a good vietnamese sandwich shop in SF to satisfy my palette, but nothing can beat the ones in San Jose! Sorry, I am a vietnamese food snob that's spoiled.

I seriously had this window open half an hour now. I hover on three stars because, at the end of the day, I really have had better banh mi. I mean, commonly. It's not hard to find little independent shops.

I love this spot.   employees are a bit rude but the sandwiches make up for any foolishness.... my 8yr old loves their potstickers, 12 yr old their shrimp rolls, I love their flan, bbq pork sandwiches, their vietnamese coffee.    love all their treats!

Not good. I'm not a fan of how they make their sandwiches using the long skinny baguette. I prefer my sandwiches in a roll. They also skimp on the meat so you're just eating lots of bread throughout. I found a place across the street that's much more amazing.
After trying Saigon Sandwiches I slowly make my way around the neighborhood - easy with some many Vietnamese sandwiches places to chose from.
Cheap, quick, and tasty .. what else is there?? This place is amazing.

I had to make a stop here since we were traveling in the area.  I've been here before for the banh mi and i remember that it was quite satisfying.  We came here this time for a vietnamese iced coffee and plane snacks.  Their coffee was on the sweeter side.  The shrimp summer roll was priced at $5.75 and you get 3.  I'm used to the peanut/hoisin sauce and not the nuc mom (fish sauce) which came with the rolls.  I thought that was weird.  Nevertheless, i love nuc mom anyway.  I recommend stopping here for their fresh bread and ready made food.  The cashier had to school us on the plastic bag rules.

You know, this isn't the classiest place.  Not is it the worst.  It is located in the Tender/Twitter-loin district, specifically in Little Saigon.  The customer service is above average, in my opinion.  And the traditional foods are unique. So I have nothing bad to say about Lee's.
Best baguettes around!

Compared to the other locations this Lee Sandwich was just okay. It wasn't great but wasn't bad either. The sandwiches were skimpier than what I'm used to. The sandwich consisted of a very thin slice of cucumber, two sad looking cilantro stems, a sliver of jalapeño, and not so crunchy pickled daikon. What saved it for me was the grilled pork and bread. At least the meat was flavorful and juicy and the bread was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.
I'm really surprised at the ratings. This place is great and offers tremendous variety.

I like the fact that I can still get a Vietnamese Sandwich for under 4 bucks.  When I'm in the neighborhood, I always get a couple of these sandwiches for the next couple days.  Sure, the actual taste of it isn't as good as Saigon's half a block down, but it serves it's purpose.

Ok, I'm not much of a sandwich person. I crave my midday carb and protein in anything but sandwich form. When I was growing up a cold sandwich was the only lunch option. I used up my lifetime quota for sandwiches by the time I hit college.
Lee's just saved us from my grumpy "need to wait in line for mediocre soul food brunch" meltdown. Great sandwich and coffee for just a few bucks. I couldn't be happier.

What a travesty! I've never had such disappointing bánh mì in my life (with the exception of the time I went to Cafe Bunn Mi on Clement and found a hair in my sandwich ... never again). There wasn't anything WRONG with it ... it just wasn't good. I scarfed my vegetarian sandwich down out of hunger, but didn't feel particularly satisfied after.

this place cant compete against other banh mi shops in the good ole TL. the coffee here just plain sucks, way toooo sweet. banh mi is tiny with marginal amounts of meat. go to saigon down the block instead.
Bi-Chay.... yes it's the vegetarian sandwich with fried tofu and it's fab!!!! Yummmmm... I will go back ... Maybe I will go back today....
It was good, had grilled pork, not as good as Saigon Sandwiches, but big, filling, cheap, and good. Went to the tenderloin one on Larkin.

The prices went up by about a dollar across the board :( they still make great baguettes and the coffee with condensed milk is really good but they used to be a cheap alternative and now the value isn't really worth it. Breakfast sandwiches are good too but again the prices are just too high for a "fast food" place!

I've gone to a few of the Lee's in San Jose and they are way better run that this one in the Tenderloin! This one is hella dirty (saw cockroaches in the bathroom!), the food is tasteless and old and the service stinks! Pass this location and visit the ones in San Jose if you really wanna see what a good Lee's is all about!
It was pretty good. They have lots of choices and they take credit card and anywhere else but a few blocks from Saigon Sandwich they would have gotten five stars.

They will not help you and workers will ignore you, Or that's what it feels like to me, And what I've recorded for youtube viewers to see. Well food sometimes great but -every time- I go in I can see that if you don't look or speak there language they will not help you, they will look the other way and make you waite. I sent my friends in to see the difference and recorded everything in a hidden cam. Well I sent in a black friend and a Indian friend.. They were ignored and never got eye contacted with anyone... Ok then I send my japanese friend with a camera and he was in good hands, they were all there at same time. It's all recorded on what type of people will get serve,  all uploaded on youtube, and my japanese friend gets attention very fast while my other friends with there hidden camera are still waiting to order after 8min inside. Im doing a project For class, All on youtube about how workers act.

I love Lee's!  It is the perfect spot for an inexpensive lunch and walking distance form work.  They have some dim sum selections, like sesame balls, and also sell both hot and cold Vietnamese coffee.  I always find myself drooling over the snacks they have out throughout their store.

I walk in here all the time, drawn in by the bread smell or perhaps yearning for something---banh cuon, or some pickled mango, or some dessert I used to fight over with a cousin. And then reality sets in. The stuff just isn't very good here. Well, the stuff in the cold case on the left is generally ok, but go buy your sandwiches someplace else. Like Saigon Sandwich--which doesn't really float my boat but makes a much better sandwich.
Excellent place. Great food great prices and the management and the owners are fantastic people. My wife and I stop here whenever we r in the neighborhood.
It's even worse than I remembered it. The only thing close to good is the bread. Service is still rude.  Place is still dirty.  Pate is still a grimy texture. Not like the Lee's from down south.

Water, water, 50 cents! Are you kidding me? They don't offer free water with a purchase of a sandwich!?  This place is too much. Go to Saigon Sandwich and get something good. It is just down the street a couple of blocks. Alas, they do take debit cards.  Damn it.  Saigon Sandwich is only half a block away.  Bring cash and be happier.  I would give three stars if they didn't charge for tap water.

Great place for pho in the Tenderloin! Ate an early (11 am) lunch there today with my so. Ordered the pork roll as an appetizer; I had a bowl of pho with sliced steak. My so had a grilled chicken bun.

I had to go check out this "dry pho" after hearing so much about it. When I first heard about dry pho, I figured that they were just talking about bún, which is pretty common - but "dry pho" is totally different.
I mean.... eh.. you ask for lemons and the waiter delivers with his bare hands.

i really need to eat in the tenderloin more often because i stumble upon places like this and am just totally blown away. can't be driving to san jose all the time for good vietnamese food so i'm happy to find good stuff here in SF where i actually live and work.

Hmm. Very mixed review of this place. On one hand, my Vietnamese friend swears that it's a highly regarded place by the Vietnamese community, so who am I to judge. On the other hand, I've been to 500+ Vietnamese restaurants on the west coast, so I'm just gonna go ahead and judge.
Corner of Larkin and Ellis.  Good ol' Tenderloin.
#25 here is the best.
Ha Nam Ninh has moved to a bigger location but their delicious infamous hu tieu nam vang dish remains the same.

I didn't even know that this dish existed. Coming from London, my local friends told me not to bother with the menu. Just order no. 25 with fried egg. It didn't disappoint. Broth and seasoning sauce is served on the side for you to add as little or as much as you like.
Saturday at lunch.

Comments : it's very bad, not prepare. About 6 pm i asked to order food. They said (don't have) but the sign opens until 9 pm. That's unexceptable ( not excuse.) look like big restaurant, the owner in charger doesn't know what to do serve customer walk in. :(
I used to bitch about this place being hella slow so I created a KISS system
Well, the masses have spoken; the dry pho is the move here.

This place is definitely not what it use to be. Their dry pho was okay... Nothing close to when they were at their old location. Not sure if owners changed, but I def. wouldn't recommend anyone to come here. The food is the least of the problem... The restaurant itself is horrible. I walked in for lunch and sat down at what seemed like the only clean table in the restaurant. There was an old grandma going around cleaning the other 12+ tables. The other tables were ridden with left over food, bowls, and garbage. Also, for the entire beginning of my time here the owner was yelling at other workers with a pissed off look on her face. Literally, yelling at a worker across the room. She was also yelling on the phone for a good 10 minutes. This made my experience 10x worse. And trust me, I'm Asian, I know sometimes when we talk we are perceived to be yelling so I know how to tell the difference. This lady was yelling, period.
Disclaimer: I admit to generally hating Yelp reviews that ding restaurants for service, so I hope I don't come off as a huge hypocrite after writing this review...maybe just a small one.
Nothing like expecting one thing and getting another.
Their dry noodles are sooo good! I can eat ten bowls of that stuff. I was so sad when i thought they had closed. So happy they were able to open in much nicer and bigger space.

Gee, I liked Ha Nam Ninh when it was a much quieter place for a simple bowl of pho on Jones, so I was happy to see they relocated to bigger digs in the former Sao Bien space on the corner of Larkin and Ellis. At least it's a little less scary stretch in the Tenderloin with all the other places to eat in Little Saigon. However, it didn't take too long for my elation to turn into disappointment when I entered the chaos. It was bustling with business for sure, but it was none too inviting with tables piled with dirty dishes and the volume control stuck on high. This was not an ideal place for a solitary diner in search of some pho. I sat myself down at the only empty table which was right next to the front door.

There's only one thing you should order and its the #25 add an egg. There's also this other thing you should try... I think it's the #25 add an egg. Did I mention you should order the #25? Have you tried it with an egg? It's pretty amazing.

I made a mistake this afternoon suggesting stopping here for lunch before going to a work training nearly.  The place was half full at most, yet the service was very challenged (to put it nicely).  Nobody came by for a long time to take our order after we sat down, and in fact we had to flag the down down to get him to take our order.  More perplexing is that the lady owner (who I assume is the owner or manager) could've helped out more in my opinion, but instead mainly just stayed behjnd the register.
Best Pho and dry noodles in the Bay. Service was slow when they first open but now they got more workers service is was more faster than their old location

I normally hit Hai Ky for my noodle fix whenever I am in the Tenderloin area.  The grand opening got my attention so immediately hopped in for a try.  Of course, I yelped quickly for recs.  Ordered #25 Hu Tieu Nam Vang KHO, Bun tom thit nuong and cha gio; and pho tai.  FUNNY if I must say, the pho was quite decent.  The rest failed.

Service is pathetic. Friendly people. I like them which is why there's 3 stars. But service is just not there. Dirty tables everywhere, waiters take forever to even come by to seat you or hand out menus. Prepare for a long wait.

#25 dry, aka "hu tieu nam vang kho"! As a vietnamese person from San Jose, I can say with confidence that this place makes it the best. It's better than my formerly favorite place in san Jose. Not only is the sauce good, but the shrimp and the squid are cooked to perfection! Amazing. Don't come expecting good service or ambiance, or you'll just be a grump. Vietnamese restaurants aren't really known for their service or decor anyway.

Well, first off let me say that yeah it's probably been a long day for you. But suck it up, that's why you're getting paid. I went with my mom, lil bro and sis at around just an hour before closing times. We were seated relatively quickly, but the service was well...hmm how should I put this? Terrible. Not only did the lady mess up my order, she denied that she did. My mom actually ended up taking the wrong order and they went to make a new one, charging both on to the bill. When my sister's dish came out, she ordered the Bun chai gio and there was like no nooodles, her dish was the most expensive the least you can do is give some freaking noodles. My dish came out, it was...okay. Not exceptionally tasty but not god awful either, like paying this much for some small portions and mediocre food. Totally NOT WORTH IT. If you're in the Tenderloin, there's so much better Vietnamese food right around the corner.
This place absolutely sucks. The attitude of the waiter is just pitiful. This is the epitome terrible service. Even if the food is good.  I wouldn't eat here. So bad.
Like another Yelper mentioned... get ready to be HANGRY and BELLIGERENT.
- if you go to Ha Nam Ninh and you order bun, pho or com dia, you're a fcking pleb
Slow. Over 30 minutes to take out and it wasn't busy. Pho was standard, as were the shrimp rolls.  Speed it up guys!

Wow. You guys are right on...#25 DRY it is. First time here. I had wanted to come here so bad last couple times but they were closed each time. Now that they've opened a new location and it's bigger, we want to come check it out.

This review is solely on their service.  I thought their old location has slow service and always get wrong orders but this new location is double the wait time and also do wrong orders.  The waitresses are absentminded, no difference from zombies, walking around without a working brain.  They go back and forth doing ONE thing at a time instead of multitasking like all professional waiters/waitresses.  Example: she placed waters out for us and just walked away when we are all ready to order.  Usually at a Vietnamese restaurant they want to get their orders ASAP, sometimes too soon for the customers to decide.  In conclusion, don't expect good service but if you have time to sit down and eat for 1.5 hrs, go ahead and try their pho because they got good pho.  Good luck!

People who had come in after us ordered, ate, paid, and left before we even got our food, which was over an hour after we put in our order despite our asking after it several times. We noticed other customers having similar experiences.

25 dry is back and bigger! They have moved to a larger location and *ahem* better location. Yes, this location is much better than the previous location they were in. The TL is not the best location in the city, but location in the TL can also be categorized! Hence, they have moved to a BETTER location. :)

Went here to try it out for the very first time.  Ordered #25 dry.  We discovered that this restaurant served the most teeny tiny baby portion I've ever seen.  My coworkers and I finished our lunch and we were still hungry!!!  And we're not even big eaters.  We are those petite Asian people.
The former occupant, Vietnamese resto Sao Bien, has been replaced by new contender, Ha Nam Ninh. The differences:
