Been to the old locations many times and this is my first time at this location and it is just as good! I always order #25 dry noodles and their fresh coconut drink. Service is fast and friendly. Can't wait to go back.

After writing my review of ABC restaurant in Foster City, I know where I belong:  in the Tenderloin.  First of, yes they do have "not-so-good service", but one particular guy waiter was wonderful!  This place treats EVERYONE badly, whether you are rich or poor, have IPHone 6 or not.  My friends love to "pretend" to use the restroom, what the friend is really trying to do is to check out what everybody else is ordering!  Such a funny friend.  The friend spotted the gigantic fried chicken wings. Another dish, we ordered was dried seafood noodle-deluxe.  The jasmine tea was wonderful and very fragrant.  There were 4 gigantic chicken full wings.  This is for people who likes to get down and dirty their hands.  Very crunchy skin.  We had no idea what to do with the noodles.  It just sat there while we enjoyed our chicken wings.  Once we had to tackle the noodle, the clump of noodle was solid.  We poored the chicken broth to loosen iupup.  The waiter guy came and said we should have poured the bowl of soy sauce, not the broth.  Oh well.  I'm not sure why it is so popular.  We were super happy and full when we left.  Tip:  Be patient, there is probably one cook inside the kitchen cooking for 100 people.  Do not move to a different table.  They identify you by which table you sit.  If you move, they can't track you down.  Then, you will never get your order.  One table, everyone got the coconut drink $4.  CASH only.
I don't actually how good the food is. However, after waiting for 40 minutes and my pho was no where in insight, I stormed out.

This place is awesome. Best pho in the Bay Area... Better pho than in Vietnam.. Can't beat the prices. The place is well lit and clean. All the food is fresh and tasty. The service is super friendly. I love eating here.

Do you know how sad I was to see the remodeling sign on the old location and how many people said, let's go to ha nam ninh! And I had to tell them, they were closed because they were moving. Well, they are finally open!

I went in for the first time but didn't get pizza actually. The sandwiches looked appetizing so I garabbed the Chicken sandwich. It was tasty and filling. The chicken wasn't dry either! The price was about 6-7$ but it was big. It's a great place for fast food I feel!
Good pizza and open late. However, the staff frequently keep change and overcharge drunk people, which is unconscionable.
They take over an hour to deliver and then they give us burned pizza. Really not acceptable. I would never order from them again.
1 hour and 25 minutes for a pizza delivery at 10pm on a Sunday night is far from Pronto.
Judging by the pizza alone this place would be a 2 star. The pizza was pretty meh. My friend got a slice n i wasnt impressed. Im sure you can find way better.
Take the "L" out of Lover and it's OVER!  Pronto, you did me wrong for the last time!!!

First time ordering takeout, and I was impressed. First off, I had coupon to use but was placing an online order, and they honored it. Didn't order anything fancy, just a plain cheese Thin crust pizza and a veg. sub. Both were done perfectly. The pizza was very very tasty (good/appropriate amount of cheese) and made thin (the slice could be folded as it should be ... as thin as Escape from NY pizza and other more popular thin crust locations). Asking for thin crust from other local/nearby areas doesn't get you a true thin crust that tastes good. -- Here, they did the pizza perfectly, per my request. And, the sub was very tasty as well and made extra spicy.
They forgot our order and were rude when I called them about. Don't order unless you like being disappointed...they charge you for thing you don't get..

I ordered slice of chicken pesto and I liked it. Ordering pizza by the slice makes it so easier for individuals. I cant expect a very clean restaurant at tenderlion. But still I was disappointed with their rest room. It was horrible. The food department should have that fixed. How can I expect that employees have proper hygiene with the rest room.
Pronto Pizza is a neighborhood staple. They have a variety of menu items and they are all tasty. I will admit, this place is not phenomenal, but it covers all the basis.

I've been a loyal customer of this place for at least 5 years ordering pizza and apps for delivery at least twice a month.  I'm now officially done and it's all based on their repeated delivery incompetence.  Two weeks ago I waited 3 hours and had to make 3 calls to follow up on my order (a small pizza and some mozzarella sticks) .  I was repeatedly told it was on the way.  I told them just to cancel the whole thing and not charge my card, but they wouldn't.  When it did show up, it was cold.  The manager actually called me to apologize and said the next order would be on him.  So I tried again last weekend and 90 minutes later only have my order arrived (a small pizza).  The guy said he'd go straight back, get the mozzarella sticks and soda and be back in 15 minutes.  It took an hour.  To add insult to injury,  the pizza was wrong.  Wrong kind of crust and not all the toppings I paid for were there.  Checked my account today, and I was charged... they didn't comp anything.  Prior to this I received hit or miss service over the years.  Sometimes the food was fast, hot, and good.  Other times it was a mess (undercooked/raw dough).  No consistency.  Order for delivery at your own risk.
So terrible!! Old pizza!! I would not eat here ever again!! I would rather eat shit on the street!!

Spaghetti and meatballs tastes like fish.  Really guys, with marinara and noodles this bad it's a chore to choke it down.  I have a hard time throwing money away so I'm slogging through it but I'm giving myself permission to not eat more than half.  It is absolutely awful.  The pizza is worth three stars for the price but man is everything else nasty.  would do 2.5 stars over-all but as that is not an option I'll keep the charitable half star to myself.  Maybe I won't eat anymore after all.  Corn flakes is looking a lot better than fishy noodles.

FOOD POISONING. Ordered the chicken tenders and a burger. The chicken tenders looked great and were crispy so I saved them for leftovers and ate the burger. Within a few hours I had horrible food poisoning that had me laid out for two days and caused me to miss my family's Easter party. Needless to say I tossed the chicken since I didn't trust anything from that place after getting sick.
Super fast delivery & my pizza was fresh & hot!

Tonight was feeling badly (tooth sensitivity) but was hungry as hell ... thought of Pronto Pizza and their meatball and mozzarella cheese foot long sandwich but was afraid of tooth ouch so asked the cook to throw extra sauce on the sandwich.  That was the trick.

came here around 10:00 pm with 2 other people. we were just around the area and wanted some pizza and saw this place.  place looked trashy and I was reluctant to sit down and eat there. we ordered a large margherita pizza to eat there (even though I didt want to). pizza was just okay but was better then i thought it was gonna be.

Came here for a slice and a Caesar salad and both were solid! Floppy cheesy greasy oversized slice (just how I like it), and yummy salad with lots of Parmesan and croutons. I live near here and will come back for sure; however, draws a sketchy clientele as hang out spot at times.
just OK, the crust was OK, the Mexican toppings were OK. maybe it just needed some salt?
I always get the chicken sandwhich, it's really good, delivery is always on time! Thanks!
Slices, 'spresso and sandwiches.
Yuck this place is nasty I now have heartburn and the people were very rude to me on the phone plus they don't know how to take directions horrible I will never order from this nasty place again

Ok, the worst pizza I've ever had - - I'm a 50 year old big guy who loves pizza and buffets, so I 'm not really that picky - but honestly had a pizza from Pronto last night that was  the the worst pizza I've ever had - onions were raw, dough was soggy and stuck to the bottom of the box.  Believe it or not, I had to add salt - to a pizza  - never before in my life.  The sauce was like they opened a can of tomato sauce and poured it on the pizza.

Big hole in a wall kinda place. Not the best locale but if you're looking for cheap and good food, you won't go wrong with Pronto! I had the pizza sub with fries and a can of soda for $8.40 after tax. I was amazed with how delicious the sub was - 10" french roll with pepperoni, salami, pizza sauce, and a generous helping of shredded parma cheese. Great for a quick lunch and great value!

If you're looking for healthy food, go elsewhere.  That being said, this is a great place for a slice of pizza when you've got that insatiable craving for one.  I've come here for years, and today did not disappoint.   I got the special:  one-topping (very generous pieces of pepperoni) with a giant salad, that included very fresh greens, cucumbers, & tomatoes, and a small drink.  All for $4.98!  My companion got the same, with a Ceasar salad.  I added the olives and Parmesan shavings from that salad to mine.   Sooo delicious.  The pizza is just right; not too thin, & not overly doughy either.  It is indeed a hole-in-the-wall, but I love this place.  I've never gotten take-out or delivery, so I can't comment on that.  Yes, it's not in the best area, but hey...it is the tl.  My experiences have been great, overall.
This is an okay place to grab some pizza.  It's good and hot.  As others have mentioned, just be careful late at night.
This is a great place to get a slice at 2am.
Took forever to get delivered (90 minutes). Decent pizza for a late night snack, but not anything over the top amazing.
Hole-in-wall pizza and sandwiches for your after party hunger pangs, close to Bill Graham.

I'm heartbroken !  This was my favorite pizza place in SF but the last few deliveries have been cold or burnt or missing items or crushed.  Just to many other places that I can order from to put up with crappy food.  Pronto is of my Fav list.  We had a good run but its over now.

I just ordered a cheese burger and some hot wings at 11:35 pm for delivery.  The cheese burger patty looked and tasted like it was someone's order that was never paid for and they just heated it up and sent it to me.  The cheese was not fresh but was hard like it has been cooked but sat around for awhile already.  The lettuce in the cheese burger was just a few small 1x1 and 1x2 inches of lettuce that looked as if they just took maybe 4-5 pieces from their salad dishes.  worst burger I ever had.  Even fast food burgers never tasted this bad.
This spot has some great affordable pizzas. Delivery for anything over $12 makes late night eats an option. They're on seamless so we order from here on the regular.

i have never ordered delivery from these guys i have only walked in and bought slices and ate them there.  i love the size of the slices and the thin crust.  they are more reasonable per slice than many other pizza places.

best food place in the city for delivery. We have had some really crappy delivery experiences in this city. Prontos is our go to place, the pizza is good deals are good and they are very friendly. the delivery guy is quick. I would recommend Prontos to anyone.

I've gotten decent delivery pizza from Pronto on a few occasions. But the other night it took nearly an hour and a half (they promise 35-45 minutes) to get a pizza that turned out not to be the one I ordered. I called once to follow up and they said "He'll be here any minute." Another half an hour later, when I was furious and ravenous, the delivery guy finally showed up. I said "I don't mean to be crabby with YOU, but..." and described the delay. He shrugged "Do whatever you want" (presumably re: tip), and when I asked "Wait...is this a large?" because that's what I'd ordered, he said "No, it's a medium" and just ran back to his car. I emailed Pronto to complain, but they haven't responded yet. Last pizza I'll be ordering from them.
Decent cheese pizza slice. Good value at only $2.50 which included tax, for a large slice. Service was efficient, not really friendly but ok.
Not so pronto.
Delivery man ripped me off.

i wouldnt order from these sons of goats if they fed the homeless for free every night......how many fliers do they think it is necessary to hang on your door handle, door knocker,gate post, walkway railings, trash can and garage door every time they PAPER a hood? seven pamphlets on one house means they are wretched pizzas because they have been called and inform bout all the paperhanging in an attempt to let them know...hey!!! maybe your leaflet people are screwing you by throwing them away even! you should check on it! to be met with a litany of curses...the ONE time I ate here it was horrible...chicken wings practically raw, then the replacement ones were BURNED, the crust was soggy and the chemical taste coming from the black olives..MEH!!!!

The pizza here was pretty good. I ordered large 2 topping pizza and mozzarella sticks. The cheese sticks were pretty good, would have been better fresh I'm sure. The pizza took about 40 minutes to be delivered and we live a few blocks away, so not sure if that is normal for pizza delivery. Anyway, we enjoyed the pizza with extra to spare for the next day and it was still yummy. We will be ordering from here again.
I ordered food with a friend for delivery. We got a lot of items and none of them tasted good.
Delivery took just under two hours and food was bland. I know good Chinese food and this is not it. My friend threw his food away rather than eat it.

Very tasty Chinese food.  Probably one of the best I've had in the city so far.  I have been going through what has been one of the worst hangovers of my life and been miserable all day and was hoping this would help.  It is literally a hangover cure!  The Hot and Sour soup is good, so are the green onion pancakes and the 6 fried crab meat rangoon.  I havent started on my barbecue pork fried rice yet but it looks awesome.  They really do have a great selection and good prices.  Since it's in the TL, I will continue to order from grub hub.  They also came very fast which I appreciated.
Now I know why there are not many reviews from this Chinese restaurant.

I can't really tell you about the food because it never arrived.  I placed the order at 7:30.  When I contacted Grubhub at 10:00, I was told the food was on its way and would be there by 10:18.  At 10:25, I got an email from Grubhub stating that when they contacted the restaurant again, they admitted they never made my order.  So my order was canceled.  So my hubby and I are starving and have to figure something else out.  I won't be ordering from this place ever again.  New Star Cafe would have zero stars if yelp would allow it.
the place looks a little eh!!!! but man!!!! they have the best chinese food ever and its cheap...
This restaurant is a hidden gem in SF ! It is in a bad area but the food is good . The fried rice and noodles here are both very tasty . Must try !
FRIED RICE!!! CHOW MEIN!!!
They don't serve alcohol but said it wouldn't be a problem if we brought our own cervesas.  I need something to wash down the goodness while I make my way through their menu:
A sweeping generalization about Mexican food is that even though there's 100 menu items, they're just the same ingredients shaped differently.
Time: 7:43am/62°F cloudy

This is a great cafe right outside my place. A lot of people were bummed when Bill sold it, but the  new owners are fantastic. Uugi is super cute and super sweet and the perfect compliment to my morning coffee. Plus, she puts up with my annoying inquiries into Mongolian culture.  Besides tasty coffee and great food (I'm told there is even a secret Mongolian menu I need to order from. If it tastes half as good as it looks and smells, I suspect I will become addicted), the prices are reasonable and the atmosphere is as welcoming as the great people running it. I hope they are around for many years to come.
What a nice cafe with a geniune nice service. This is the only cafe or place that you can find Mongolian food in San Francisco!!!
iiiiiii got dressed
On the name alone...I'm sure you always "come" here..right? amirite though?
Horrible service. Pho was very mediocre and the 90's Viet music augmented the experience to perfection.  I recommended trying other thing on the menu like the bun rieu.

I have come here on several occasions when my to-go Pho joint is closed. This place is 24/7 which is a good thing, but I usually don't come here for the Pho, but the braised pork chops instead. I have had the pho, and Pho Kim Long doesn't satisfy the Pho craving like Pho So 1, or Pho Saigon 8 in my opinion, the combination soup doesn't even include Tripe or tendon. I always have to order side orders of tendon and tripe, which ends up becoming almost $8 paid for my pho.
I come here for the bún riêu (Vietnamese crab soup) because 95% of all phô places DON'T serve it (why, oh, why?! I just can't figure it out).

my collegue loves the chicken pho here especially when she's hungover, but to me its nothing too fancy smancy...the pho here isnt overwelmingly great, but just on the average...cheap and decent that is.

The bf and I eat here at least once a week.  my bf's from Houston and they have pho joints galore and this place is the only comparable one not in san jose. I can honestly say i love the food because its cheap and fresh, don't drink the ice water(fr a severely bad tap), and the lady that's there almost everyday is so nice, we're inviting her to our wedding. well she invited herself, but its all good, she can come anyway.
i just like the name of this place

An honest Vietnamese pho dive in the outer Tenderloin.  The pho is standard, it served to be the perfect warm soup lunch needed for a gray, wet and cold day.  The owner serves the tables with a sincere and charming candor.  I ordered a medium bowl of the mixed beef pho special, for only $4.75.  He apologized for running out of tripe, but assured me that when I come back next time, he'll serve me lots.

I'm looking at the low rating reviews and yes, perhaps the shop isn't immaculately clean and may need a face lift inside but the pho soup is by the best I've had in SF and having to compare pho soup to infested pho restaurants in San Jose, my friends and I were very surprised.  Beef onion rolls for a starter was really good and beef pho (medium bowl for 4.75) was most satisfying, especially after a day of heavy drinking and late night partying =D
Why would I review your runofthemill Viet place?

BOOOOOOO!!!!! Here's some advice: it's a lot easier to clean a bathroom than a kitchen....so if the bathroom is infested with flies and there's pee all over the ground....you've been warned and I'll leave it at that...
the proximity of this noodle house makes it earn one star right off that bat. literally, around the corner from the JT fortress of solitude.
This is a south Mexican place now.  The food is only meh and everything but the sandwiches are deep fried.  Try the sampler platter if you want to experience some Yucatan cuisine.

I got the Philly cheese steak and was pleasantly surprised. It's not a busters CS but for 5 bucks it blew my mind. No cheese whizz but gooey enough to be stoked. Plus their habanero salsa on the tables, which they make there, is brutally ultimate.

Wandering away from the touristy piers and searching for a decent place to eat we stumbled across this little pizza shop.  I usually rely on Yelp for a good neighborhood place, but each one we went to was either closed or didn't exist anymore -  thankfully this place was open!
Brooklyn Pizza does not serve pizza...what they DO serve is amazing, authentic, fresh and delicious.  If your brave enough to enter, you will exit pleasantly surprised.
a pizza place that does NOT serve pizza.

Put in an order, and they didn't even bother to call me and tell me they didn't have what I wanted. Waited for my food for an hour, and they hadn't even started on it. That's the last time I order food from anywhere without looking at the restaurant on yelp.
A friend of mine ordered us a pizza from here via
Never bothered delivering our order.
This is a review for delivery.
Review of Delivery from Brooklyn Pizza

so i was starving walking around looking for a place to eat so i saw this place and said hey ill try this, so i walk in and the guy ignores me for a minute before greeting me. so i order a pepporini pizza. and come to find out that it tasted horibble.. it was dripping with oil, tasted like cheap sauce and the bread had a weird taste to it. im usually not the complainer but it was not something i wouldnt eat again and i was starving. to make it worse the guy at the register wasnt friendly nor gave good service

One of the handful of revolving pizza places in the tenderloin.  $2.50 for a cheese slice.  Not thin, it tasted good but it was nothing special.  I wouldn't hesitate to drop in again as the service was friendly.  For my quest though...
re: the pizza boxes smell like raid or some other bug spray and the pizza is just a little better then dominoes for you who like ny style don't bother as you wont like the crust.

Terrible service, never even showed up even though I called twice to verify the order.  Do not order from these people. they suck.  Do not give them business, do not waste your time.  They suck.  Go to domino;s.  Go to pizza hut. Go anywhere but here.
The pizza is nothing special, but it's not bad and the value is the selling point at Brooklyn Pizza.

The pizza was mediocre at best, and this is coming from two hungry people.  My boyfriend wanted some good old fashioned NY style pizza. Going off of the name, we took a chance with this place.  I ordered a cheese pizza and wanted anchovies on just a couple slices (don't judge me, I was having a weird craving),  but instead they put artichokes.  The only good thing is that the delivery came in a timely manner, but otherwise I would not recommend this place considering how many other options are out there.
Came home one day with flyers posted everywhere on the mail boxes and just left the flyer on my kitchen counter.

Really good place. The owner is a cool dude and always gives out hookups of good Pizza. Customer service is always number one whenever I'm here at the joint. Got to give the place props as well, they have to deal with all the crap from the business across the street.
Strange-tasting but tasty nonetheless cheese steak with untoasted bread. I am sure I'll come back here, but it won't be for a cheese steak. This was bordering on two stars.
Yet another ultra mediocre pizza, but I have to give them credit: at 11:30pm I told the guy he needed to make it a rush job and he had the pie at my shop in 15 minutes.

I just ordered some pizza from here on the recommendation of a friend! Luckily for him, this place is pretty good. The crust is nice and crisp, and the sauce was also good. The pizza was delivered pretty quickly, too, which is a plus. Too bad their credit card machine was down, though.

Brooklyn Pizza has become our go-to delivery place for good, filling food both after work and on weekends.  It's not the best or healthiest food, but it hits the spot.  Even after raising the price from the original menu that was sent out, it is still surprisingly cheap.  Delivery has been dependable so far.

This guy is the real deal.  This litte pizza joint is tucked away in the shadiest of shady neighborhoods.  It's just around the corner from the Warfield.   But it is really worth checking out.  I can't believe no one has reviewed it yet.
Great people and great atmosphere. I walk past 1- shops to go there. Ask for David. He is awesome. Tell him I sent you. You might get a free sweet & low on the house. j/k
loved the environment , chill, modern, and fun!

The place looks like a run-down hangout of old Vietnamese watching TV.  I never found a menu; just some woman who was sitting in the corner asking me what I wanted.  I said sandwich, she said she just had pork, so I ordered it.  Took forever for her to make ti.  Some big guy came in with what appeared to be stolen phones and was trying to sell them to the guys watching TV.  They knew each other based on the conversation, and it looked as if the guy watching TV was a fence of sorts.  Got the sandwich for $3.50 - after she asked if I drove a Taxi (i don't).  The insides were disgusting and had to be tossed.  Was like pork head cheese - little meat in gelatinous fat or something.  I tossed the meat and ate the bread and veggies.   Pretty nasty place.

Walked in for a quick Banh Mi to go. Inside about 15 Vietnamese watching an NBA game while placing bets and talking way over 70 decibles. Classic. Lady scraped together a Banh Mi Dac Biet of sorts for me with what looked like leftover toasted cha and thit sitting on a metal pan. Toasted bread, standard fillings plus shredded scallion. Decent enough, although left a funky taste in my mouth. Coulda been from watching two hobos lock lips and fondle each other on the corner tho.

It's call ken ken cafe now. I really wanted a Vietnamese sandwich but waiving sandwich is closed, so I end up finding my way here. It's three dollars for a sandwich which taste really Yummi.  The guy who works here is nice and told me they been open for only a month.  There are a few tables where you can sit down and eat tour sandwich.  They also have fresh Orange juice, lemonade or viet coffee for $3.  I do like the place as a snack stop to order a drink or sandwich and chill for a bit.
Dropped in spur of the moment to grab a couple of banh mi to go. The guy was nice and the sandwiches were decent. Typical banh mi place in the tenderloin area.
Nhu Y Coffee Shop serves up good Banh Mi [Vietnamese sandwiches], Ca Phe Sua Da [Vietnamese coffee], and Bun Thit Nuong & Thom [cold vermicelli noodles with bbq pork and shrimp].
Came for drinks Sat nite. This place really surprised me in a good way. I had never heard of this place. Place
It's funny this place is called Mayes Oyster House and I've never had any. This review is about the bar/club though so onto it!

Fun bar, until you get your newly purchased IPhone 6 stolen with all your NYC trip pictures. Ugh bummer! Tried calling this place countless of time hoping to see if someone was kind enough to return it. No one  answered

This place needs some better organization, Takes 30 min for an order of guacamole. It's pretty unclear if waiter is high or just really confused. It says happy hour is 3-7 on the Internet and on their menu. On the chalkboard it says 5-7. It is very unclear even when talking to the waiter what is included in happy hour. But on the bill, none of it was.
Got my phones stolen here. TWICE.
5 stars for Nicole for being honest and correcting our bill

I don't understand this place at all. Was meeting a few friends of my here, waited in line for about 5-10 minutes and when I got to the front the guy looked at my shoes and said what kind of shoes are those? I said nike. And then he proceeded to tell me no Jordan's or Jordan like shoes. I was confused because a guy in front of me had black nike Roshes on. I pointed that out to the guy and he said sorry. I was really baffled because he said it was house rules and told me to get out of line. I wore almost the exact same thing as the guy in front of my except mine were high tops. My shoes were all black. Are you fucking kidding me? I got out of line and waited for my friends outside. For the next 15 mins I was just watching all the guys coming out of the bar wearing running shoes, dirty chucks, toms, and other low end shoes. I also watched as the security team escort their friends in with Jordan's that didn't pay. Here I am with $400 nikes on that's willing to pay getting denied. I don't understand why this place has a dress code. Really, what's the point. The security team looks like shit and so does the doorman with his 1 size too big suit from Burlington coat factory.

This was a solid place for me and my cousins to experience bar hopping on Polk St. Most of us are from SoCal, visiting another cousin who recently moved up north  and this was one of the places she took us to. The dancing was so fun, we actually ended up going back the next night (which was equally fun, but we ran into a group of disgusting men on the dance floor :[ ). I would definitely come back next time I'm in SF!
Edit: This review is solely in reference to Mayes during ratchet hours (Friday/Saturday 10pm-2am)

SHADY BAR! If you are sick of having a cell phone and need a place to get it stolen, this is the bar for you! After paying $10 to get in on Halloween less than an hour into being at Mayes my friends phone got STOLEN out of her purse on the dance floor. After reading some reviews apparently getting your phone or purse stolen is more common than not here.

Update, I wrote back to Courtney twice and she had no response.  There hasn't been an actual follow-up or any attempt to address the situation, the Yelp response they provide is standard and meaningless.

I don't know how fair my review is of the place itself as I went for a game night.  I will say that the bartenders were super sweet, and the Moscow Mules were ahhmayzing.  (And I normally don't spell it that way so you know it was good).  I hear this place is a dance club which explains a lot. The fries that I stole off a stranger's plate were pretty good, and pretty overpriced.  Again, dance club.  The oysters that passed by did look tantalizing but I was saving myself for a burger later that night.
Solid bar! This is a great place to start off your night of bar hopping around Polk. A pretty place, nice bouncers, and good music!
**This is a review about Mayes the NIGHTTIME CLUB/BAR SCENE (not the daytime oyster scene)**
Oyster happy hour (among "normal" happy hour fare and drinks) are weekdays 5-7pm. You can get a dozen oysters for $15

Had a problem with rude customer service on Saturday night (10/25 11pm) at the main bar on the left side of the entrance. Asked one of the bartenders (long dark hair, Asian, female) if they serve Ciroc and she said no, immediately took a step away from me, and shouted "Who needs a drink?!" literally serving everyone else around me. I was so offended and clueless why she did not want to serve me. Left a bad taste in my mouth, especially since it was my first time here.

If I could give this place zero stars, I would.  They basically just committed credit card fraud.  I was here to watch the World Series and celebrate a friends 40th birthday.  We had to put down our cards - at the change of shit, I went to close out.  The waitress tried to give me someone else's card, then she came back and said I already closed out.  I knew I had not closed out and she actually had the nerve to ask me to look for my card.  Then she came back with a signed receipt and said - look you already closed out - someone else had signed the receipt whose name was not even close to mine and is now roaming the streets of San Francisco with my card.  I had to leave the party and go home to cancel my card and now I have to update all the vendors I had automatically signed up for this account.  It would have been a lot better if I was not "accused" of signing out my account.  Needless to say, I will not go back to this establishment.

I came here for the nightlife and it was fun! This place gets hella packed on Saturdays, not sure of Fridays because I've never been. Cool bouncers and cashier outside. Nice, attentive bartenders. Be warned : the dance floor gets TOO packed cause everybody is just standing on the dance floor instead of dancing.

Too crowded for my liking but we did go on a Saturday night so I shouldn't have expected anything less.  Music seemed on target but I just wasn't feeling it.  My first drink was significantly better than my second despite ordering a Moscow Mule both times.  Maybe I'd rate this place higher had I gone at a different time.

We were recommend by a driver on Uber to visit Polk street during our visit, so we came across this location around 12:30-1am last Saturday night. It was very crowded with sweaty people, but most looked like they were having a good time so we squeezed our way up to the bar and ordered some Moscow Mules. The drinks were good at first, but my boyfriend complained of his second order not being made properly by a different bartender. The music was mostly hip hop and R&B, and the place had a very casual atmosphere. I felt a bit over-dressed in my pencil skirt and heels. Overall this place was okay, but probably not one I would return to late at night.

My friends and I come here for the nightlife. I love this place because #1 the place is spacious, it has a dance floor & they play all sorts of music, #2 the bartenders are nice and attentive to your needs. The owner Matt is awesome, he always takes care of us. He makes the best kamikazes! Must try! This place is usually more crowded Friday & Saturday! That's why we always come out and play on Thursdays instead ;)
It's the second oldest bar in San Francisco. I went there with colleagues from work and since someone knew management we were getting the special treatment. It turned out to not be so special.
We didn't get to try the oysters because they ran out! An oyster house that runs out of oysters at 7pm-ish on a Friday night?!?! :(
This review is just for the bar/club experience.
I love the music but the crowd likes to spill drinks on ppl. So don't wear your nice clothes
This review is for the nightclub:

Thomas is an awesome server! Very attentive and knowledgable about the menu. He was consistent on checking up on our table. He was also very cleanly. I highly recommend this place and ask for Thomas :)
Only been here at night-time on weekends. Music, crowd, everything is fine.
Just stopped by spontaneously and all plus I saw dollar oysters so my legs took me there automatically.

Went for Polk for my first time. Ordered my first drink on Polk, and Matt was the NICEST bartender I've met. Although I was talking to my friends, he waited to ask me for my order once I was done so I could order my drink. I've been in the city for 3 years and I have never met a bartender as kind as Matt. I most definitely am coming back. Even on a Saturday night, he was sooooooo kind. I appreciate all that you do, and can't thank you enough for making my first night on Polk such a fun one!

Well I decided to gives Mates another last night.   Of course I made it through the door before 10 pm to avoid paying the cover.   I find it odd that is the only bar/nightclub on Polk Street that even charges a cover,  but whatever.  Also,  I didn't see their dress code enforced because I have seen guys in there wearing t-shirts. You guys need to be consistent with this.   Either enforce it with everyone or else drop it.

We were originally hopping around on Polk and finally made it here. Cover for us was only $3 because we had a decent group of girls. There were a handful of security walking about, so that made everything a bit better.

I went here on a Friday night to celebrate my friends 21st birthday party a while ago, and I was with a large group of friends. The bouncers let my friend enter for free because it was her birthday, which was nice, but the rest of us had to pay a cover. Even though the bouncers negotiated the price down for us, they were letting some people in for free. I didn't quite think that was fair especially because we came with a large group and were all going to buy drinks.
This is a review for the bar experience I recently had.
SO I'm not an oyster fan, but my fiancé is and we saw the happy hour $1.25 oysters. Went in and were the only people in thus bar/oyster house which becomes a nightclub after 9PM.

Had the worst oysters here at happy hour on Friday...(Not $1 oysters anymore, they put up their prices) Totally disgusting and off. Myself and my wife ate 2 each of 30 oysters, paid the bill and left..I remember there used to be long lines out the door of this place for happy hour oysters, now i know why it dosen't anymore..The barman had no idea about the menu and chewed a mouthful of gum while taking my order..I think this place is more for a night time drinking crew than a restaurant....Anyway, wont be going here again.

I've had one really fun night here, and multiple very mediocre to sub-par nights. The cover on Friday / Sat nights is pretty annoying (though only $10, i suppose). It would make sense if it was really more clubby, but it's pretty much just a bar with slow service until 12:30, which in SF means you only get an hour that it's actually packed and has dancing. Would generally just recommend going nextdoor to Lush
Went to this place twice already and I liked both experiences. Free entrance until 11pm. Security is a bit tight here and that's good. One big bar near the entrance and one small bar on the far end.

This review is 85% for the owner, Matt, and a couple of the bouncers that are there regularly. I would say I've been to a good number of different bars, some multiple times, but I have never been to a bar where the people who work there are so involved with the people who come there regularly.
This review is for late-night Saturday dancing:
Not too good food in here. Too slow service and you food is cold. Owner is so cheap. Not worth it restaurant.
Nice spot near the Nob Hill/Downtown area to grab a late breakfast or some awesome bi bim bap. The service was friendly and the food was good. Great little diner.
Good place to grab breakfast. They serve until 4 pm! Waitstaff was very friendly.
This is a super sketchy area of town.  While we were eating here a guy got chased out of the grocery store with a broom handle.
Best burrito I've ever had!

I had the grilled veggie burrito and it tasted like asian stir fry wrapped up into a tortilla. Fair prices for burritos but next time if I can't make it to the Mission I'm going to their other location for the California burrito, which is really good.
Just grabbed some chicken super nachos here, and all is well with the world. Friendly staff too!
Best burrito I've had in this neighborhood, close to the best Mexican food I've had in SF since moving here from S. California a few months ago.

Staff was very nice, got a vegetarian super burrito for my girlfriend and a chicken torta for myself and we were not disappointed at all. Its also located inside of a market so if you're just picking up some food on the way home you can also pick up some snacks for later.

Was not expecting much when I first walked in as it is in a market in a crappy part of town, but this place blew my socks off.  The veggie burrito was soooo good.  Perfect ratio of rice to veggies, beans, and cheese.  The girl at the register and the dude making the burrito were nice and after an irritating day at work a cold corona was calling my name.  Sat at the little tables inside and enjoyed a beer while I waited for my burrito.   They were super speedy with the order too.
Now that SF's Best Burritos has shut down, may Juan be forever successful, this is the next best thing.

It's been two years since I came here for a first (or second?) date! After a rough day at work, we met up for drinks at a pub nearby and then headed over to the taqueria for dinner. Normally I don't update reviews but I wanted to add that I had the quesadillas this time around and they were definitely the best I'd ever had in a long time. Full of cheese and mushrooms and just insanely delicious, I would love to go back for more!

Good food, great service at a fair price! This taqueria is located in a grocery call mid-city so it's really convenient to grab lunch/dinner while picking up other things. I love that they take credit cards! The food is cooked to order and flavorful. I've only tried the tacos but they were really tasty and had fresh veggies and well-seasoned meat. Portions are generous too. I've always had great service here. It's a small place but there are tables if you want to eat in. Nice neighborhood place that will continue to have my business.

I would never recommend this place to anyone. It's a small dirty take out restaurant inside of a small market.  My experience here was very bad. I had purchased a groupon for this place due to its close proximity to my apartment. The staff at El Tesoro clearly does not like accepting groupons because I was told "I'm not supposed to let you use that for more than one person." I ordered for 4 people and was going to use one groupon for $10. It made no sense that they did not want to take the groupon for a $40 order. Also they did not have fish for the multiple fish items on their menu, which does not help if you are pescetarian. Lastly, after finally trying their food, it was very mediocre and the tortilla chips were stale. You should be able to easily find better mexican food somewhere else with better customer service.
I won't recomment anybody to try It. First, It is not a restaurent . It is a supermaket. The food is not very tasty.The restaurent is in a wacky neighborhood.holy moly!!
not the  best burrito , but 3 stars for being creative and putting fries in their california burrito ,gotta love the idea...

I love this place.  They have good breakfast items and great tacos.  I like getting their meals.  Unless you're a sumo wrestler or linebacker I suggest sharing a plate with someone.  You can always order a couple of tacos to go with it.

El Tesoro is kind of like my designated late night burrito destination when I am starving. They whip up a very tasty burrito. I have had the super burrito with pollo en salsa and al pastor. Eating one of these burritos isn't a life changing moment by any stretch of the imagination, but I think it's worth a try. On some nights it's brilliant and on others not so much; that's part of why I am giving it only 3 stars.
I live around the corner from this place and I would go there 3 times a week if they would get their shit together.
woo hoo! best mexican i've had in the tl! i recommend the carne asada chimichanga.
Located inside Mid City Market, this is one of two El Tesoro's - the other is a free standing one on the corner of O'Farrell and Leavenworth.

I live in Nob Hill and while we don't have a lot of great options for authentic mexican food, Tesoro fills my burrito needs.  They have really good carnitas and pork in chile verde.  Their pastor meat is just ok.  They offer California burritos which I think is pretty damn cool and they have a bunch of tortilla options like spinach, tomato, garlic... pretty crazy for a random corner mexican place.  The prawn burrito is pretty awesome too.  They have a big screen TV in the back where they play soccer games and they sell beer so it definitely makes for a nice lunch spot in the TL.  Side note- their hamburgers are actually really good.  I have a friend that swears by hamburgers made at mexican places and they make a delicious cheesy fried burger.

After leaving a bar with a buddy of mine I got the hunger pains that only a burrito can satisfy but a lass I'm in the Tenderloin. But wait I walk out and what do I see? A grocery store? Wait no, yes, kinda it's also a taqueria. Hmmm. It's midweek and it's empty so I walk up order a super carnitas burrito. I impulse buy what I thought was a bag of chips for a buck. Turned out to be cinnamon sugar chips mmmm.

I traveled for a taste of this burrito, I heard about it from Ben the Bachelor, he said it was his favorite burrito spot in SF, yeah i believed him. So I went all out and got the wet super grilled chicken burrito and I was a bummed. The meat was diced to the point on minced chicken no chunks, and it was dry. Service was blah and atmosphere, well it was a supermarket. I was not amused, that's what i get for listening to the Bachelor.
This is the best taqueria near me, so I'm biased, but I believe it to be one of the best if not the top in the Tenderloin / Tendernob area. Why?

If you are too hungover or too hungry to get all the way to the mission for a bomb authentic burrito this is the place to go. Everything on the menu is amazing (real talk). The burritos are huge, the chicken is amazing, the salsa bar is diverse. No complaints, so glad I found you El Tesoro! Its a hidden gem within a grocery store, which also means you know its fresh.
I hate the word "discovered" for restaurants--maybe uncovered is better?--but this is the kind of unobtrusive place in an unexpected location that you do have to discover.
eh skip this taqueria. cold burrito after a 20 minute wait. no thanks
Didn't know they had a Mexican spot open this late in any place outside of the Mission.

Great burritos and tacos, among other things. The prices are definitely reasonable and they have a great selection of Mexican beer, most being only $2. Good people watching as well. And yes, this little place is inside a market, no biggie. Oh and there is a daily Happy Hour from 3-5 or so, with deals on drinks as well as food.

This place is amazing and I don't get hyperbolic often. I ate here for the first time about a week ago and, I kid you not, I have eaten here every day since. It really feels like what a taqueria should. It is a little weird that it is house in a convenience store, but don't let that detract from the fantastic. The food is great. I can say with out hesitation that this is literally my favorite place to get a burrito. Even the complimentary salsa is exquisite. Stop reading this and just go give it a try already!

The food is pretty good, but it is insanely expensive... 3 dollars for a little taco is rediculous. Burritos are the industry standard 7 bucks or so but damn 3 tacos usually costs like 6 bucks not 10.
I have absolutely no idea how on earth this place has such a high rating.  I will give it the benefit of the doubt with the 2 stars.
I'm inspired by all the nooks and crannies that people manage to find to express their culinary visions.  This obscure spot for a Taqueria is in a liquor store!
This place was delicious. The burrito was full of flavor. One the best burritos I've ever eaten. Perfect balance of meat, beans, and salsa. Only four stars because the Horchata was not the best
Good neighborhood taqueria with friendly service. Burritos never disappoint and they have a good salsa selection. Not quite the mission though!
I started to come here more and more because I live in the area. The food is always amazing and very authentic, and they give you a lot for not a lot of money.
This is for the 1am food on Saturday night.  I had a really good regular burrito but it took FOREVER for them to make despite having very few orders.
Ordered the Chile-Verde Super Burrito and man it was YUMMO!! I will be returning back.
This place is the real deal, serving up tasty, authentic Mexican food.  You won't find any Americanized Mexican food here!

Man, I wanted to like this place since both of their TL locations are so close but the food's just gross. I got fries and they tasted really rancid - like they were made with super old oil. Then I tried their nachos and it was 98% soggy toppings and three corn chips. Obviously I'm exaggerating but not by much.
bonus for open late for a street taco without having to go to the mission.  only got a single taco (al pastor) and they forget the additives.  average flavor.
Great food! The flautas are fabulous and it's a large portion!

This place has some super tasty food.  The people who work here are really nice and happy to explain to you what the menu items are if you're unfamiliar with them.  Try the panuchos with the poc chuc, yum!  Kind of a sketchy area, I'd recommend this place for lunch, probably not dinner.  It's good, it's still open, help them stay that way!
There aren't too many places in San Francisco that serve food from the Yucatan.

This store has the best coffee ! I go there every morning . I would prefer this over even starbucks! if your just into simple coffee . They also serve vietnamese coffee. The area and store looks a little sketchy due to the neighborhood, if your from san francisco you know how it is in tenderloin !  but it wouldn't be bein hoa if it wasn't ! i love this place, they also sell a variety of other beverages . The coffee shop is run by vietnamese ladies who are very nice and hard working . They are really nice , and they work from 6:30 till 10. sometimes they stay till 12 ! everyday including sat and sundays . I would suggest anybody in the Tenderloin area to visit them for coffee everymorning !

The exterior is covered with bars and can be easily missed if you're not TRYING hard enough to find a new place for Banh Mi. I walked in and spoke with a lady holding a chubby baby on the counter. Told her I wanted "One sandwich to go, please." I don't even ask these lil' places what varieties they serve anymore. I figure they'll let me know there are options when and if they ask me, "What kind?" She passes the chubby baby off and rinses her hands, no soap. Let me just focus on the sandwich...
Tasty Vietnamese in the tenderloin. Nothing special about the pho or prices, but good service and all around pleasant experience. I do feel my cold is getting better.....
What a diamond in the rough. Never thought it would be much, but stumbled upon with a recommendation and boy did it surprise!
the food is very good, lots of great flavors.

One of the more authentic Indonesian restaurant this site of the Pacific! I always get the rice plates with the various curries/sauces/rendang just so I can try them all. Service is impeccable as always. I seldom see a crowd - not because the food isn't good but probably because authentic Indonesian food is underappreciated here.

Excellent! Excellent! Excellent! My parents were visiting from Atlanta and we were going to go back to the Korean restaurant we went to on their first day here. On our way, we passed this place and wow, did we make the best decision. Everything was so tasty and the restaurant had a great ambience where we could talk. My mom got the Gado Gado, I got the Mei Tik Tik, and my Dad got beef and chicken skewers.
Wanted to try something in the city and we stumbled upon this new GO TO SPOT!!!!!!

First of all, service is super slow and they didnt check with us ONCE if we were doing ok. Forgot to bring our drinks...and then the food, ordered chicken and shrimp frieds rice along with couple of other dishes . Fried rice had 2 pieces of shrimps......2pc.
A taste of Indonesia.. We came here for the Nasi Goreng, loved it in Bali. This place has been here forever but still
Love their fried rice, Nasi Goreng Terasi Pedas!!! Though a bit pricey.

This was just okay. Not as good as it could be for vegetarians/vegans. They didn't seem to know what vegetarian meant when I was there, which is not excusable in San Francisco, mofos! Too much oil and grease on the roti.

Terrible attitude . No idea how the food is. We showed up 5 minutes before they opened for lunch. The guy literally waved is away rudely. We waited outside. He sees us, but never cares to come back and talk to us.

Found this restaurant randomly. Interior decor is nice. Excellent service. Ordered the veggie plate. OMG! Best tofu I have had. 90% of the restaurants don't know how to cook tofu. Not this place. Will definitely visit again.. Recommend this restaurant.

Great food.We ordered the Rijsttafel (complete rice plate) for three people. It costs 27.50 per person, and trust me that is a lot of delicious options. You get 1 appetizer, a soup, 6 main dishes and a choice among three desserts.

We thought to try out this place since there isn't too many Indonesian restaurants around, plus normally we usually cook Indonesian at home. I can't say it was great or too bad. Nothing really stood out that was mentionable. All I can say is that if you never tried Indonesian or craving it, it's not a bad place to try it out.

You could close your eyes and jab your finger anywhere on the menu and be sure you're in for a serious gastronomic treat. The food here is consistently delicious, flavorful, and so affordable. A real gem...wish they'd open one here in Los Angeles!
Food was very good and tasty. Service was okay. The wait was a little long for getting our food, but the taste made it worth the wait.
Amazing! There's such spectacular variety and I would recommend trying all of it! Family owned, cute place, good food, what else can you ask for?!

Came in with a big party and I have to say the food was mediocre and the service was bad. I have eaten a fair share of Indonesian food in Holland (they have good Indonesian there I swear) and I was excited to find a spot in SF. The food just seemed plain, no nuance and just slapped on a plate. We could not get the waiters attention, they filled our water glasses once at the end of the meal and all dishes and appetizers came out at different times, leaving people waiting and cold food. We joked at one point that maybe we should call the restaurant from our table to request more water.
A good go-to when cravings for Malaysian-like dishes hit.
Good for indonesian food.

Great food. Everything we had was amazing. The roti prata was really flaky and perfect and the sauce with it is great. It almost seems like a cross between Filipino and Thai food but with lighter more flavorful curries.

Something tastes just slightly off here, and I can't put my finger on it.  Not that it's bad or anything, because it's not, but something just doesn't feel right.  Maybe it just tastes a bit too clean to actually be authentic Indonesian cuisine, I dunno.
Food: very good Indonesian cuisine, with large portions. Try the prefixed menu
I was a bit concern in going after reading the mixed reviews but I'm glad we went.

I've gone here a few more times and every time it's just been okay. I still really like the Mie Tek Tek and would recommend for take out on the way home when your wanting something a little different than Thai, but everything else I've tried since isn't really worth it.

5 of us ate here last week and we couldn't get enough of this wonderful food!!! We found the young waitress to be personable and friendly, as well as her Father (?).  We also noticed the small restaurant filled up very quickly and then the few servers scrambled to get good service to everyone.  My suggestion is always make a reservation, come early for dinner, and order fairly quickly to beat the rush. We ordered #57:Mie Tek Tek Goreng. which were egg noodles with a rich, spicy sauce.  How delicious!!! We couldn't get enough of so we had to order a second dish of the same to share (not a big portion).  I believe we got the #53: Nasi Goreng Terasi Pedas fried rice because the waitress asked if we wanted it very spicy and if we liked shrimp paste, which matches the description on their online menu.  It was soooo spicy that it became painful to eat.  However the pain wasn't enough to stop us from taking bite after bite and serving ourselves more of this generously portioned side dish.  I wish I had ordered the Roti but I forgot.
Roti prata is to DIE for. Fried rice dishes are well flavored, although a bit dry. Service is slightly subpar.
A great restaurant and its in my neighborhood.  Always consistent and delicious.  Definitely worth going to...

Three stars for great food but not so great service. My friend recommended the place as one of her favorites in the neighborhood. I probably wouldn't go so far to call it that, but it's not the worst.
The staff minded their own business most of the time, but when each customer leaves they would go out of their way to say, "Bye guys! See ya!"
You shouldnt leave without trying the most tasteful dessert i have had in my life : es Campur!!! Enjoy it!

I was really eager for some Indonesian food, having had it in Holland and New York.  I found the food to be just good but not great.  The beef rendang was quite rich , but the sauce was not as flavorful as I was expecting.  The nasi goreng didn't really have any character, and basically seemed like fried rice you would get at any Chinese restaurant.  The roti was tasty and fresh.
It was a parade of lovely delicious dishes!

As an Indonesian, I can say that the foods here  taste ok.. Not really authentic like the foods that you can eat in Indonesia, but I think it's because  Indonesian foods really need a lot of different spices, and maybe it's hard to find in the US. I recommend you to try pempek ( Indonesian fishcake... Really yummy ) and rendang!  Don't try their ayam goreng (fried chicken), because it's not Indonesian style of ayam goreng and it's taste weird. Honestly, I came to Borobudur to support people from my country to open more Indonesian restaurant and introduce Indonesian foods to people here in US, but my GREATEST DISAPPOINMENT of this restaurant is their BAD SERVICE. I've came twice, and every time I came I got really bad service. The waiter and waitress are not friendly at all. When we came, they just busy chit chat and didn't greet us or ask us to sit down. They also never asked us how was the food and didin't refill our water.  I wonder was it because they knew we are Indonesian and think that we won't give big tip OR their service are just BAD. But seriously guyss you really need to improve your service. Just be nice and friendly to your customer...
Meh.. Such disappointment..

Came here on an unusually warm evening. Parking in SF is always difficult and I wish that they had told me earlier that they validate parking at one of the lots close by to the restaurant. Better call and ask is my recommendation since I can't remember now.

I'm not sure why this place doesn't have better reviews - then again, maybe I just lucked out (or everyone is ordering the wrong dish!) when I decided to go with Beef Rendang. I'm no Indonesian food connoisseur, but I did spend half my life in Singapore (which had Indonesian food aplenty) and I thought the beef rendang here was pretty damn authentic. The beef was tender and cooked just right. Next time, I plan on trying the roti... and maybe the Nasi Goreng!

I went to this place with a few friends. Inspite of having a reservation, we had to wait for about 15 minutes. The waiters are very unresponsive. We sat down to order and they took a long time to take the order. Even after they took the order, the entrees were not all served at the same time. One person was still waiting for their food, while others on the table even finished eating. The service is poor, the food is good, but I wouldn't come back here.
My family and I have been going here for years!
Just a few quick pointers id like to state..

One day, my boyfriend forgot to pick me up from dinner in the mission. So I took an über to get home to soma. I noticed the über drivers name was Indonesian so I asked... He confirmed and then I proceeded to do what any foodie would do (I hope) and asked him what his favorite Indonesian restaurant was in the city. He said it was this restaurant and I promptly bookmarked it and visited two weeks later.
Don't order what we order, because they weren't good.
The food was pretty bland, but the kitchen is open super late and they serve decent beer.
Average food, chicken came out cold and did not have right spice levels. Rotti came out 10 mins after maine. Ran out of Sapporo. But on the cheap side
This place was the bomb!!!! I came here hungry and left full....my man and I spent an easy $100 here...no regrets. I will be coming back soon!!!
Because the excellent food at Le Colonial is so over-priced, when we go there we dine here.

Excellent Thai food for those late night cravings. Every dish is made medium spicy unless otherwise stated. I go for all the curries. The pumpkin curry with shrimp or chicken is my favorite. The only drawback to this restaurant is the slow factor in service. I had to wave down someone for a menu, more water & rice. They don't check in with you. But if you know what you want & ask for it up front with ordering, no problem.
I was craving Thai food and this place was only a few blocks away from my hotel, so I decided to check it out. I had the rosted duck and it was tasty. This place is open late and it was convenient.

Have been wanting to try this place for sometime, but usually pass it up for my usual haunt for Thai. Ordered the Yellow curry chicken and potato. Short and sweet...not very good. Curry sauce was, for lack of a better word, "watered down" very thin if that makes sense. The chicken was overcooked and Thin as well. Small thin strips of chicken. The potato was undercooked. The rice overcooked. Perhaps I got the second string of cooks for this place.The price was reasonable, yellow chicken curry w/rice $13. No reason for me to ever come back.
We came here pretty early, around 5pm. The staff was super nice and let us come in to wait before they started their dinner time.
I am new to SF and love my food! I was in search for a good Thai food restaurant in the area and stumbled across this great place on Post. I am a vegetarian and loved this place!
Stick with it.
Went in waited 10 min for someone to take our order.  A girl cleaned 4 tables around us,but still did not wait on us.  Finally left .  We have had the food and it was basic, but okay.
Thai Stick has quickly become one of my go to lunch spots. I can't vouch for dinner (which is when it seems that people have the most issues with this restaurant) but at lunch they are great.

Poor service. Poor food. The rice is not even included with the main entree. 15% of gratuity are included without any warning (we were 3). We were really disappointed by that Thai restaurant and trust me we are not really picky..

I've never eaten in, so I can't speak to the service, but I really love the food, and it's cheap enough that I can order multiple times. Massamun curry shouldn't be so hard to find in the city, but sure enough it is, so I get my fill from here. Me and mine both get a large amount of food for under 25 dollars so we're pleased. Egg rolls were passable, but the Massamun curry was just how I needed it to be at the right moment.

worst pad thai I have ever had.  ordered it with tofu and it came with noodles with cabbage and a few pieces of tofu. No flavor.  Never had it so bad.  When I asked why there were no eggs or flavor, they responded that theirs taste different than others because it is more authentic.  Really?

I ate some damn good pad thai here the other night and got to enoy an ice cold beer while waiting for it. Fast and efficient for take out, reasonable prices, clean place and the staff are friendly. If you are in the area I would say check it out.
Before you make the mistake of coming in, late at night, eager for sustenance before embarking on your late night adventures...

Two stars because their Panang curry was actually pretty good.  But, their crab fried rice was way too salty.  We sent it back.  They brought the same plate with the same fried rice and just dumped it onto our table without saying anything.  We tasted it and it was the same fried rice we sent back just pushed together to look like they did something.  We left shortly there after with a small tip for the Panang curry and note to tell them that they should not bring back out what was sent back.  Middle Aged lady with the short hair (owner?) was very rude.
I love here's Pad Thai!
I really loved the meal in this restaurant. The waitress Oin is very nice!
They cannot keep an order in mind for 2 seconds, are very rude and try to take adventage of you. 3rd time in a row they forgot an item in the order. Go to osha instead
Food was pretty bad.  Ordered chix wings.  Scrawny, emmatiated, dried out.  No flavor.  Next came the pad thai.  Worst I ever had.  Made from leftovers.  On top of it all, I got sick.
This people is totally wrong. I ate here last night and tonight. The food is amazing and service is good!!!!
Poor service, good food.
This used to be my go-to place, but I was being charged 30% tax?!!

The yellow curry was alright, but our second entree was awful. The worst part was that we didn't even order it! When we tried to verify it the waitress pulled a "lost in translation" move on us so we were stuck with this horrid jalapeño and green bell pepper laced nightmare.

Awful service. we ordered the mussamun curry and the pad thai noodles. the waiter brought out a green curry and when informed that's not what we ordered took it back. we thought, ok, he realized his mistake and will bring us the correct one. instead, he came back and insisted that we indeed ordered the green curry (which we definitely did not order) and wanted us to try it. He kept insisting we were wrong. when we asked to speak to a manager, he said there were wasn't one. Waiter never did bring out the pad thai, didn't write down what we ordered or repeat back what we ordered - yup, was definitely his forgetfulness that he tried to blame on us.

We have been ordering food from your restaurant for a long time now. However, today when we ordered they gave us a bad order of fried rice. We ordered chicken wings , side of fried rice and 2 orders of the BBQ Chicken fried rice. Its so sticky that resembled paste. I complained and they wanted me to get the food from the garbage and give it back to them. I returned a whole box but they told me they cannot give me a refund. Phet - one the person from the counter was arguing bad at me and was even shouting. Im sorry but I have not seen the most rude people in this restaurant. They even questioned the time we complained. We ordered at 640 so we can actually have food for our lunch break at 9pm. He even said that I was a bitch complaining and if i really need a refund I should grab the rice from the garbage to get a refund. THEY NEVER APOLOGIZED and NO REMORSE THAT THEY DELIVERED US BAD RICE - it has a smell that's nearing spoilage. Im so dissapointed and tell you honestly you  just lost a client. We will never refer you to our guests nor members. I WOULD RATE THIS NO STARS AT ALL!! A RESTAURANT THAT HAS RUDE PEOPLE WITH BAD FOOD SHOULD NEVER BE PATRONIZED.

I order from here A LOT because I live close to this Thai Stick. This time, I submitted my order online and waited ONE HOUR AND A HALF and no delivery. I even had an online confirmation email sent to me. I called and they said they never got the order! It's now almost 10pm and I'm starving. They gave me no apologies, no explanation why they never got my order. THAT IS THE LAST TIME I ORDER FROM THAI STICK!
This place was ok. It was convenient for us since we were about 2 blocks away and in need of food immediately. We ordered a lot of food between 5 of us and all was good - not the best, but good.

I was really disappointed to be turned away at the door.  It was a busy Friday around 12:15 when we first walked by.  At 12:30 we were told they were closed even though there were people in the restaurant and their hours of operation are til 1:00.  I just wanted a salad and I called for a to go order.  They hung up on me twice!!! There's way too many amazing restaurants here to treat people poorly.  I won't be back, I think I'll go where they appreciate customers.

It's 2 Star Tuesday, so I thought I would share an experience from my last trip to SF.  We were looking for some drunk food in the Tenderloin, and my local friend suggested this place.  I quickly checked on Yelp and saw that the reviews were mixed.  I told him, but he was pretty hungry so my two other friends and I followed him in...
The food is pretty bad. There is a lot of competition in the area, and this place is typically quiet (and for good reason). Ordered 2 dishes - both were barely eatable.

I read a numer of negatives on this place.  After eating there I am surprised.  Perhaps it depends on what is ordered but for us we had a great time.  We ordered Pad Prig with chicken and the flavor was just right.  A good blend.  The service was just so so, but no worries, the food was on the money good.

Sea food Pad Thai.  Rubbery and flavored of fish.  Not worth the meal in an area swamped with moderately priced restaurants.  The service was nothing to write home about. weak beer and wine selection.
Someone in my building was appalled that I haven't at least gotten take out from Thai Stick.  This prompted an immediate dinner date.
I lived a few blocks up from this joint last year and I always seemed to have the craving for it.
Very disappointing! Had a late dinner of sweet & sour pork which was very low quality and poor taste. First time ever I tasted it with cucumbers and tomatoes!
I have been here at least 10 times, and every single time my food was under cooked and customer service was poor. So, I gave up and don't come here anymore. Too bad, as their location is great.

The worst subway i've ever been to. Allow the homeless to harass and beg from their customers. When crazy people come in here and scream at people, the staff do nothing. Awful service and a grim atmosphere make this a desperation option only- but even then, walk the 3 blocks to the one on Ellis.

Not a good Subway in the city.  Very unprofessional staff.  The guy I typically encounter has his shirt untucked, no hat, and re-uses the disposable gloves after running the cash register.  Probably one pair of disposable gloves is used for every customer the entire day.  Also, the food seems to be left uncovered during the slow times, which means flies can linger on the meat and vegetables :(
The food is tasty just like at other Subways.  Nice, quiet room in the back to enjoy my sammich while surfing the web.  Not sure what everyone's complaining about.  Anyway, gotta go..
This Subway SUCKS! The pepole that work there seem way irradiated that your there. Bad service all the way around. They also are not particapating in the National $5 footlong promo.
Under new management? This place got better. Sandwiches taste better, breads fresher! Keep it up. By the way Floyd who works here is still a jerk!
Including a restroom this place offers none of the BRAND expectations I have come to count on when I step footLong into a Subway BRAND establishment.

i always go to different subways, what ever is closest to me. i placed my usual order for a spicy Italian with lettuce tomato's, red onions, and olives when the lady at the counter only put one slice of peperoni on the sandwich, when i questioned her about it she gave me an attitude, i couldn't believe it. i left it alone. go back to work eat lunch, Then to top it all off i get food poisoning for 2 days. this was the only thing i ate that day so i know it was the sandwich. now I'm too paranoid to eat at any subways! never go to this place they will get over on you then get you sick!
I don't know why I eat here, it's just convenient on my way back from yoga. The tables and floors are ALWAYS disgusting and dirty, and now they stopped serving spinach.

I have been to alot of Subway resturaunts in Sacramento and they do not compare cleanliness like this one. Also the service was great I was treated with friendliness which let's face it always isn't easy to get from fast food places. You gotta try the Buffalo Chicken sandwich with Chipotle sauce oh yeah and toasted with lettuce tomato pickles and peppercini. YUMMY thanks Subway for the great customer service!!
I am really glad other people mentioned the BS about a $6 minimum to use a credit card.

I never give 5 stars to restaurants plus this is Subway! This Subway is in the ghetto so what do you expect their service to be amazing and its a subway geez folks. The owner is always nice to me when I walk in, but I'm not generally a person that has the time to make mindless chit chat with someone who is making my sandwich. It's your average subway faire, so the food is ehh!! If you want customer service go somewhere else oh and Ive seen ruder subway establishments!

subway; eat fish.  yes, you read correctly - the tuna is pretty good (i usually hate fish).  Onions, lettuce, tomato, and definitely oil and vinegar on a foot long slab of wheat bread is the way to go.

I come to a Subway about once a week to get their $5 special and in the county of San Francisco there is NO TAX on items that are not cooked and "to go" so I make sure to have my sandwich not toasted to save my self the $.48. For some reason this location illegally charges tax on  non-taxable items. When I asked the gentleman charging me for my meal about this he replied with a sharp attitude that all the other Subway restaurants in San Francisco County were wrong but his store was right.

I really don't understand why the franchise owner of this location doesn't throw in the towel. He doesn't honor Subway's promotions, even when they are posted all over his place. In addition, he also doesn't honor his contractual agreement with the credit card companies because he requires a minimum charge of $6. It may be the Tenderloin, but why scare people away with poor service and a bad attitude.
I'm a big sandwich fan. Whether here in the bay, or when on the go, seeing the Subway logo is always a good omen.

Every time I go into this Subway the owner/manager is very cranky.  They make a good sandwich, but it's no longer worth it to go here.  Yesterday I saw the new commercial for 2 6" combos for $8.99.  I go in and see the sign in the window, then ask the person making the sandwiches which subs are available for the deal.  I go through the process and the owner/manager rings me up at the register.  I tell him I want 2 combos so I can get the 2 for 8.99 deal.  "No, I took that out today" he said.  I told him I asked the employee about it beforehand and I just saw the commercial earlier today.  "Well it's not in the computer yet."  I asked why he has the sign in the window then?  "Where? What sign?"  I pointed to the large sign in the window advertising the new deal.  He then walks away into the back and appears out in the store a second later.  He angrily pulls the trashcan aside to get to the sign.  He tears it from the window and kicks the trashcan into place.  When he got back behind the counter he says "$9.86, and the deal starts on Monday."  Wow... it was bad and I will no longer continue to support this Subway.  I really hope this guy's disdain for his job will cause him to sell soon so a nicer owner can take his place.  If you enjoy bad attitudes then by all means, go to this Subway.

As a regular of Subway for some time now, mostly because it's no frills, fill-me up food that's fast and inexpensive. Most of the people who work at this location are so indifferent to being there, and they obviously hate their jobs. They make no attempt to cordially interact or even speak loudly enough to hear what they are asking which is why I am sure several orders are not made properly.

So I just started going to this Subway and had a totally different experience than the aforementioned Yelpers. All due respect...but I went in ordered my sandwich and it was typical Subway. Another time I went in and the owner was super friendly and chatty. I have been there when people ask for things like change for $100 bill and they respond sort of abrupt, "like no you idiot!" It's pretty much the Tenderloin so I believe they have to come with a somewhat tougher exterior. It's a shame if you can't get good service at Subway. I also realize that it's unlikely that anyone will take the time to look at Yelp to decide if they'll go to Subway so...whatever!

I agree with Kenneth. Omg, horrible. I too, am a fan of Subway. But I will definitely be avoiding this particular location. We ordered the turkey breast and tuna sandwich meal. She asked if I wanted the bread toasted, I replied, "no." Sat down next to the murky window. Avoiding the dirty window, trying not to lose my appetite, I bit into my sandwich and crrrruuunch. Uhhhh, I didn't ask for crackers. The bread was horrible- they did leave the oven door open. Maybe I should've asked for bread with my sandwich. I ended up removing the bread and had it like a salad. The sodas were all flat! And the manager didn't do anything. Who hired him? Hmm, someone should close this subway down.

I'm a big fan of Subway and have been for many years, but I will be avoiding this location and suggest others to do the same.  Staff is extremely rude including the mgr/owner and could care less.  Good news is there are many near by Subways cause I like their sandwiches and prices.
Sorry Troops but this place gets on my nerves....
Folks, this is THE BEST SUBWAY IN SAN FRANCISCO. Yep, that's right, you heard it from me.

There's nothing wrong with this subway.  The problem is that nobody bothers to Yelp their normal/good experiences with a huge chain like Subway, so this entry fills up with cranks and it currently has only 2.5 stars.  But I've been there several times, including today, and never had a problem.  It's bigger than most Subways and it's also open later (until 11:30pm except Sundays).  In a previous visit, their bathrooms was broken so they let me wash my hands in the employee sink.  They could have just said "sorry, bathroom's broken" instead.  And today, when my order came out to $11.02, the woman (her name tag said "Be") rounded my change (for a $20) up to an even $9.  She was polite and made the sandwich just as I asked, too.  Of course it is super cheap compared to nearly all nearby options too.  I'm not saying this place is exceptional or that I'd take a date there, but it's better than some of the other nearby Subways and it deserves much better than 2.5 stars.
I go to THIS subway every week.
Come here all the time. But tonight I was made a sub that looks like the picture. Best sub ..

Subway wise this place is really nice, i don't know how they do it but their food tastes alot better than other subways i've been to. Their dining area is nice and always clean. Live super close- will be back.
Bad customer service.
Sub-par.
I LOVE subway, well I kind of love subway, you learn to love it when youre a college kid trying not to eat noodles everyday.
All right.  I've gotten food from here like six times.  I don't know what all your problems are.

When you eat at several Subways, you will likely to the conclusion that I have, some are very good, others are pretty lacking. It apparently depends on how they are managed. This location is below average in as that the bread was never as fresh as you usually find in a Subway. Their breakfast is about as tasteless as it comes. Also apparent problems with understanding the English language at this location.
Meat in their sandwiches disgusting, and they routinely play the ESL "oh price is wrrongg' crap card trying to overcharge you for items they price on the wall above.
1.  Why has the meat tasted funny/old the last two times I've been here?
Never had a problem here.  Food is fresh here and the people serving you are friendly or cordial, so Im not getting the negative reviews, but I guess we all have our opinions.

HA. Alright I live a block away from this Subway and sometimes for lunch or dinner I just want to get something thats quick and healthy. First of all the service is HORRIBLE. I'm sorry for being so blunt but I guess I should of learned the 5th time I went in there that the employees were going to be rude again. It's the same girl every time I go in there too. I guess she forgot what customer service was and I guess she forgot that she should be lucky to at least have a job. PUT A SMILE ON YOUR FACE, I AM PAYING YOU. Yeah, I don't know her background or what she has gone through to be se rude, but I am over it.
