It really stinks too, because this place is so close to my apartment and I would give them more business if the employees showed a little bit of respect toward the paying customer....never going in here again...never ever. I'd rather walk miles to a different subway where the people are nice to the PAYING customer... Customer service is number one in a business you A-HOLES, drop the attitude.

Another case of incompetence?!!  They have signs up advertising $1 sidekicks when you order a foot long sub, and yet the cashier said the promotion must have been over as it wasn't ring up $1!  I had just earlier seen a commercial advertising the deal, so I think he just didn't know what he was doing.
I am poor,a student at the Academy of Art,did I mention I'm poor.
I'm not just saying this for the instant celebrity status it's going to give me on Yelp, but I've been eating Subway's flatbread sandwiches since, like, the first moment they hit the scene.
This Subway is the fucking worst.
This subway stinks. I always end up spending over $18 for a sand which for some reason when I don't at other subways. Plus they charge like 40 cents just to toast your sand which!

I'm going to go out on a limb and give this Subway a five star review.  As a regular of this Subway (someone who has been going there 3-4 times a week since June), I have been continually impressed that the folks who work there know how to make my sandwich without even asking anymore.

Clara Peller said it best in the early 80's: "WHERE'S THE BEEF?"  Okay, so I'm dating myself measurably.  For you young whippersnappers - here's an example of pure, unadulterated advertising genius from 1984:
Would you say and agree that going to Subways on a Friday-night seems pretty depressing?
I wonder how many babes Jared bangs in a week?
"Foot long Tuna Sandwich on a Honey Oat with Swiss Cheese...Lettuce, onions, cucumbers, Extra jalapeno's please. More please. More please. Mayo and chipotele Sauce.  Thanks Jared."
***ASSHOLE ALERT***

sometimes i have a craving for a meatball sandwich ... and this place is only a block away from me and it satisfies my craving ... usually when i'm hungover. i was happy they got rid of their spinach when all of this ecoli stuff was going around ...

In TL and nothing fancy but do yourself a favor and order some mint chicken over rice it's like minced chicken sautéed with mint leaves and it's not very saucy but flavorful.... and get some pickled jalapeños on the side to. SO simple and SO good. The bf was very impressed with this simple tasty dish. We normally order to go because we don't like leaving our car on this block....
Mint leaf chicken over rice is the best anywhere hands down! Its just the area is a little sketchy getting there.
My favorites:

4 stars just because  of the area but food is great, service is great and the inside is clean! Chilled not packed during lunch either!  Good place for food .  Their soups are good and their food is great as well  and Thai tea is not over sweeten  so it's perfect for my taste. definitely coming back
Really good food and reasonable prices... Not the best part of town... But where the locals go....
I used to get the basil chicken over rice at another restaurant within a couple block radius on Larkin and Eddie many years ago, but they closed down which is now Red Crawfish.

Good bang for buck here. I came for lunch and was quickly seated by a nice waiter, who then gave me a bowl of soup and hot tea. Good selection for lunch specials. I got the spicy chicken with  mixed veggies, and it was above average. The waiter then brought me a few bits of fried banana for dessert. $7.50 for it all. I would definitely come back.
I agree that it is a good value.

The basil chicken is AWESOME.  This place is a hole-in-the-wall in a not-so-good neighborhood, BUT it IS SAFE inside.  The food is amazing, and they often have really good lunch specials.  If you're in the neighborhood check it out!
Four words: MINT CHICKEN OVER RICE
excellent food and prices.
Excellent !  Today's special was spivey chicken and sweet peas. Very good !
I can't believe I gave this place a try. Due to Tu Lan being closed down, we decided to find a Vietnamese restaurant nearby with good reviews.
I only have five words for this place. Mint leaf chicken over rice. Enough said.
How good are you at math? See if you figure this one out:

Nestled in the 'loin, Hai's is a source of nourishment for its denizens and workers. They are a Mom & Pop shop with heart and soul and they specialize in high numbers, including several inspection ratings of 100!
My 2 favorite dishes:

Strange place combining Chinese, Vietnamese and Thai cuisine. Eating here for lunch last week, I decided on something "safe" and got their pan-fried noodles with pork and vegetables thrown-in. It was okay. The pork tasted like pork, the noodles and sauce were also okay; and they give you a fair amount. Service was good, and they were nice. So, you get a large quantity of okay-average-food for your hard-earned dollar. Additional note: Tenderloin natives hanging around the street in front; they didn't come inside to dine.
All I've ever tried is the mint basil chicken over rice (add a sunny-side egg) YUM. Hits the spot every time.
Mint Leaf Chicken over rice.

This place confuses me: on Yelp, it's classified as Chinese and Vietnamese. The storefront advertises Chinese and Thai. The menu is written in English, Chinese, and Vietnamese, but some dishes are "Thai style." What? I have a general rule to stay far away from places that claim to specialize in more than one cuisine, but since the rating was relatively high on Yelp, I decided to give it a chance. Unfortunately for an out-of-town friend, I combined trying out this place with meeting up with her, which I felt guilty about since it wasn't a stellar experience.

Whenever I come back to SF from college, I almost always go there just to satisfy my CHICKEN MINT RICE craving. I never get sick of that dish! When my parents dated in their early 20s, they knew the chef from another restaurant and they would always order this particular dish. Well this chef OWNS Hai's Restaurant and still makes this delicious dish today! I've ate chicken mint rice made by the same chef for nearly 2 decades now. I've tried chicken mint rice from another nearby restaurant (ONLY because this restaurant was closed...), and I was highly disappointed. Needless to say, my loyalty lies with the chef and I will continue to get my chicken mint rice meals from this restaurant as long as he's still the one making them :)

5 stars for great food. great service especially for a chinese restaurant. and great people! People love their mint leaf chicken! so thats a must try. Price is great. location could be better but who cares. I enjoy their food!

This place never fails me when I am looking for a place for a quick bite or for takeout.  I don't live in the city anymore, but when I do go down to the city to visit friends/family I always try to make my way over here for my favorite dishes.
Hai's never disappoints.  Although I no longer work in the TL, I still try to make it over there every month or so when I feel need my spicy chicken with string beans fix.

I could see how this place would be good, but my lo mein tasted burnt. I would go back and try it again because the texture and  consistancy was right, BUT and this is a big BUT... I will never walk though that area again it's so GHETTO!! (Larkin is fine but it takes a turn for the worst on Turk)
Mom's showed me this spot.. Minced chicken is on hit and I drive from east bay just for this dish
My family have been eating here since the place opened up. Hai's is one of my favorite places to get some takeouts when I am down in the city visiting my family.

small steamed white rice for $1.75. went well with my homecooked broccoli beef. woot! i love eating outdoors on a sunny day, even if it was windy today. the outdoor ambience is also interesting: lots of homeless and transient folks.

The place does not look like much from the outside. The inside looks nice, clean, and well maintained. The service was pretty fast. I like their Chicken and Mint leaves. That item seems to be very popular with yelp reviewers who dined at the restaurant.

THE BEST FRIED CALAMARI -bar none.The Salt and Pepper calamari is better than any restaurant in the city , of any cuisine or at any price. I eat here weekly and the food is great , the service is friendly. And the place is clean, really clean , inside of your dishwasher clean. I usually get the special and it's always tasty.

I've been eating here since i was a baby... and it's so good here! I would totally recommend their basil mint Chicken and their combination pan fried noodles! Those are my favorites! Overall, everything here is yum yum!
I ate here many many times. It's in the TL and it is awesome.

Their spicy chicken with mint leaves is delicious.  I only know one other place in the area that makes it and that is Red Crawfish on Larkin.  Red Crawfish's costs like a buck or two more and they give a larger serving, but I guess it is all relevant.  I prefer the dish from Hai's though.  It comes with jalapenos and has a nice balance of flavors.  I have no idea what culture this wonderful dish stems from, but I am hooked.
The meat is tough and chewy.  I tried the spicy chicken with mint, the spicy beef with double mushroom, and broccoli beef.  The flavors were good but the meat in all dishes was questionable.
Food: 4 Stars   Chinesee/Vietnamese   The food is pretty good, and cheap
Their spicy chicken with mint is EXCELLENT...
This is my favorite Chinese/Vietnamese in town:  fast excellent authentic food, cheap prices, friendly owners, large menu, and wonderful window seating for people watching.
Good cheap Chinese/Vietnamese food in the loins.  Good score from the Health Dept too, at 98 now.
Just to keep ya'all up to snuff.

This Subway has some of the worst sandwich makers! There's one guy in particular who does not know how to do something as simple as folding the sandwich in half before cutting it. It's so bad that I will turn around and walk somewhere else before I let him make my food. There's nothing worse than going to bite your sandwich and all the toppings are falling out.
Subways have become my fast-food-by-default provider.
Good food. Good area, by my work.

The Subway that is a block away on Ellis street has the same owner. The workers alternate stores. Not a lot of people know that this Subway exists because of the one on Ellis. I only go here when the line is out the door at the one on Ellis. Subway is like any order Subway. Subway's that have more traffic tend to have more fresh baked bread compared to others.

WOW Happy Thanksgiving! I called this location to order a pizza and when the pizza guy answered the phone with "we're closed right now" I was like, wtf what kind of customer service is this?  I truly don't care that you had to work on Thanksgiving but the fact is that you in the CUSTOMER SERVICE INDUSTRY and as we all know, your ONLY priority is GOOD customer service.  Note to the OWNER, whoever worked thanksgiving night at 8:15pm needs to be taught how to work for you.  Just know that this employee is not making a good name for your Papa Johns location.  Just for you information the proper response would have been, "Hello, thank you for calling Papa John's, but our location is currently closed."
I'm sick of these negative reviews based on "Papa John's" politics... that's just silly.

On a trip from Australia staying across the road and the food / help was next level amazing.... The girls name was Laurel and she was the most amazing helpful person we have ever met.... (call me on 13233789591 if you can!) eat here of your are in S. F. It is kuta!! H
Good food. Made fresh and fast. Very clean and friendly staff.
The pizza is fine, and the price is excellent. I've become far too fond of the fresh baked chocolate chip cookie "pizza", it's gooey and wonderful.
Far above my expectations. If you compare to other chains (Domino's, Pizza Hut, Round Table) it is far superior. Placed order at 7:30pm and it arrived at 8:15pm.
Veronica was very friendly & helpful. I took a long time for a large order and forgot to add the free ice cream from survey. She was patient & ill be making another large order soon.
Well, After always seeing the tv commercials, I was excited to see this spot open up not too far from where I live, so I excitedly placed a large order the next day to sample the wares.
After waiting more than a year to see what would replace La Mexicana, I was disappointed when Papa John's moved in with their lousy politics and $3.39 delivery fee (none of which goes to the driver).
Just watched the black Nissan of death almost run over another pedestrian at Sutter & Leavenworth. Who runs this business?

You are going to feel guilty ordering it. You will feel guilty walking there or waiting to get it delivered. You will feel the most guilty when you are holding two boxes of pizzas, cheesesticks, and soda. But that moment that that cheese and processed meat hits your mouth with some garlic butter sauce, you won't give a fuck.

Went to the new location on Sutter, they screwed up my order, but Dean, the manager, made up for it by giving us the incorrect pizza, the correct pizza and a cookie pizza for our troubles. Would recommend this location and manager.

Papa John's is here! This pleases my inner suburbia! Unauthentic? Yes please. Sorry SF, I'm not quite selfrightous enough to hate Papa John's. Brings back such great memories everytime I eat it. I wish they were open later but GET IN MY BELLY!

Really good food, with great service, and strangely, insanely goo plating. I got a standard garden burger, with a JAW DROPPINGLY good banana crepe with a scoop of ice cream, whipped cream with strawberries, and chocolate syrup drizzled on top. Clearly I recommend their desserts. Good food, bad place for a diet.
(See pics) Review #1173. Where you get breakfast crepes, salads and sandwiches from 7am - 11pm everyday, with Fridays and Saturdays it is planned to be open until 3am.
I think this business existed before. There is a lot on the menu, and the prices are pretty cheap. I'd say it's a good, quick breakfast.
Delicious place - no menu so just go for the greatest hits: spring rolls, fried spring rolls, bahn mi, Vietnamese ice coffee. This is legit.
Probably the best hole in the wall Vietnamese cafe you'll find in the TL (and there are a lot). No menus here, but everything is delicious, especially the spring rolls and egg rolls.
Cam Tho Coffee doesn't have a posted menu. seems they sell only coffee, bbq pork banh mi sammie, and a breakfast dish with eggs.
The guy was nice, but the black bean fish was made entirely of msg and the garlic eggplant tasted entirely syrupy.

We are from Canada and whenever we head to San Fran ... our first meal is at Wing Lum. They have wonderful vegetarian options. Their staff are amazing! Even when we've been away for a couple of years, on coming through the door they shout 'Canada!' Exceptional service, wonderful food and, for us, a tradition!
I can't for the life of me can't figure out why this is 3.5 stars.

You know, I was not expecting much from this place but was pleasantly surprised. Service was pretty slow on a Sunday for lunch but not too bad. There was just one server, I think he was a grandfather, Also he got one of our orders wrong (combination fried rice) and convinced us we had received a better dish than the one we ordered LOL.

We've been here twice now and will definitely be back! The menu has a good selection. The food is delicious and not overpriced. From the outside, this place may not look the greatest, but inside is peaceful and interesting. Wing Lum is a nice place to stop to dine and avoid the chaos of the busy street outside.  :-)

Went here today and was pretty impressed with the food! Decent serving, I had some to take home, decent- not amazing- prices, okay service, good atmosphere. Overall solid for good, high-quality chinese food. I got the vegetarian chow mein and really enjoyed it, and my friend got their beef chow fun and it was absolutely delicious.

I came on a Thursday night around 7pm, there was not a single customer, which is a bad sign. Unfortunately it was too late to turn around. I ordered some take out. It was bad Chinese! Don't think I will visit it again.

I love this place -- it's not gourmet food by any stretch of anything, but a great old-style Chinese-American family restaurant.  This is the traditional fare, tasting just like it did 50 years ago -- such memories.

I noticed I seem to like all the dirty chinese food places people hate.. not just in SF either. Maybe it's cause being chinese, I don't expect much in terms of sanitation or service from these restaurants. My takeout was delicious. Salt and pepper wings, fried rice, soup. All were salty and oily as they should be. NOM and they're open late so I can pretty much get my fix 24/7.

Came here for some take out and was not disappointed. I ordered the general's chicken made extra spicy and it was perfect. The restaurant is a little kitschy but it's decent Americanized Chinese food. I'll definitely be back to try some other items.

This place is a dump! Let's put it this way! It's dead and there food isn't that great. I'm Chinese and wanted some real Chinese food for lunch. I wanted home away from home and this place is a fucking joke! It's so dead I can hear a couple of tables next to me fart and talk. I visit this restaurant a month ago. You bet your ass I'm not coming back here! Ps. This place gives you little food for the price you pay and there's more veggie than meat on my plate. If you come here to eat here, you must be blind and lost your taste buds!!
OMG! Just thinking of Wing Lum salt and pepper fish has got my mouth watering.
Really amazing food!
I never thought I'd say it, but Wing Lum was the restaurant that saved Christmas!

Wing lum has been the destination of choice for my family for 10+ years when it comes to Chinese food. This place has great tasting food and the waiters there are very helpful. The decor and bathrooms have changed for the better, and it's open late. We always get a free plate or two on the house. This is your no frills place to chow down.
Wing Lum is hit-or-miss.
Pretty stoked on this place!
The Rainman that I spoke to on the phone refused to deliver anywhere further than "5 seconds away." Their food is awful and so are their people.
I thought the food was pretty much right on with tastes you get in China. Food portions were huge.

Absolutely disgusting! worse chinese food I've ever had, to the point where I had to throw away my sweet and sour prawns.  Ordered a take out, what I got was stale overheated food! And the takeout box seemed dirty..ewwww!!

I came here for lunch with my Mom over the weekend for a quick bite. I can't speak to anything other than the vegetarian won ton soup, but I loved it. It was healthy, delicious and the service was just as it should be.

Cool decor but the food is awful.  I don't even recommend this place if you are drunk.  However, the owners are so nice I have to give them a star for their attention to their plants and a star for attention to their customers.

Lord, please protect me from my curiosity. I knew that this place was terrible before I went in, but I was compelled anyway. Seeing a patron argue with the gruff, apparently overworked waiter twice (the place was basically empty), attempting to eat the over-sauced, overcooked chicken dish and having my eyes beaten senseless by the atrocious decor was enough for me to beg the Heavens for protection.

This has been my go-to Chinese food pretty much as long as I've lived here in SF.  I'm sure I'm biased because I'm vegan but I really dig the relatively large selection of veggie-friendly items.  And they always leave the egg out of my fried rice when I ask them to do so.  There are a number of places I've visited regularly for years, but I realize that this is a big city with a lot of people and so the number of places where I'm actually recognized as a 'regular' customer is only a handful.  This is one of those places and I really appreciate that.  Last word: once, they accidentally delivered me some beef dish with my order instead of whatever it was I'd ordered - they came back and got the beef and brought me my actual food in MINUTES, with sincere apologies.  I was really impressed.

This place is pretty tucked away and secluded, which is too bad because it has a cute kitschy interior that I find enjoyable. However, service is spotty. There was no greeting at the door or anything, literally walked in and stood around for a good while before people realized we were there. Tea is complimentary, but incredibly watered down. I may as well have been drinking plain hot water. The lunch specials are a good deal. Prices and portions are great, but I've had better food. We got some little bits of fried wonton wrappers as a complimentary appetizer. The hot and sour soup was great. I liked it a lot. The spicy eggplant with garlic sauce was totally not what I expected. I expected large juicy, purple, tender pieces of eggplant, but instead got deep fried strips of eggplant. It looked like the fried wonton wrappers, except drenched in sauce. The lunches come with a large amount of rice.

Awful food, even worse service (rude AND dirty/grimy waiters). The only good things are that it's dirt cheap (explains why the above is so bad) and cute interior. But getting sick after is not worth it.

I've been here a few times, and the food is pretty good. Very little interaction from the server. There are a few issues though. I've ordered several appetizers that were the same, but the server would deliver only 1 and count it as all of them. When one has a small portion. Also DO NOT let them box your leftover food to go. They took some of our food and left us with much smaller portions. I didn't discover this until I got home. I had a massive plate of chicken chow mein, and was only left with a box  that wasn't filled up. Very upsetting to know how much of a rip off this place really is. Definitely not going back.

I actually didn't mind the decorations/aquariums/plants/turtles/etc. I thought it gave it a cozy feel. We went on a Monday night so the restaurant was pretty empty. So if you want that bumpin' atmosphere, this place may not be the best fit for you.
I walk by Wing Lum almost every day and it always looks empty so I figured it probably wasn't good.
So, I live 2 blocks from this place, and have been eating here occasionally for the last  year and a half, and this is my first review... here's what happened.

I work for an after school program in the Tenderloin and we order a lot from Wing Lum for our family resource meetings with parents. The general consensus was that the food here is excellent-- especially the eggplant in spicy sauce and the chicken chow mein. You must asking why the one star then? My co-worker told me that our family resource coordinator was yelled at by the owner of this restaurant. She had offered to go to the restaurant and settle our account HOWEVER he stated that only our program manager  (who was out sick) could so because unlike other times this was a large amount. To sum it up, he was being an ahole since (his own fault) he wasn't being paid today. We immediately cancelled our order for tomorrow night. This is not how you do business. I work for a non-profit and we've had a good relationship with them up until now obviously. Do yourself (and I) a favor... take your business elsewhere. I

Disgusting dim sum. I ordered the combo for $9 and got about 8 pieces of soggy AND hard dim sum. There was one I can only describe as a yellow cube of hard rubber. The shrimp dumpling was a soggy mess that fell apart.
My favorite Chinese restaurant in San Francisco is House of Chen.

I am kinda a Chinese food snob, and this was not one of my favorite places. It was right around the corner from our hotel which made it convenient, but I left the restaurant disappointed. The decor seems to be internationally challenged with primarily Chinese themed decor but sprinkled with Mexican items and flags from all over the world. On the plus side, our server was extremely friendly and helpful, but he was not too attentive.
Still pretty good chinese food...

Found the decor of this place kinda creepy. It had an aquarium, TONS of plants, all sorts of chinese artifacts hanging on the walls and ceilings, and kinda dim lighting.. other reviews show me that some people actually appreciate such an eclectic decor.. I personally found it really crowded and stuffy.

I love this place. Since I discovered Wing Lum Cafe I have been enjoying it every week. I'm not sure why this place isn't packed for dinner. They always bring the food out in a timely manner.  Some of the best Chinese food ever. The spicy eggplant is to die for and the imitation general Tso Chicken is great. Me and my good friend always get a free extra dish when we visit. They are so nice to us. They are open on Christmas, this is a good thing considering that I am new to the city.  Also this is a great place to bring a date because the atmosphere sets the mood!
It's rainy, cold and windy.  Not wanting to leave our hotel, we tried to find a place that would deliver at 11:30pm.  It was pizza or Wing Lum.

I love the atmosphere! The people are soooo nice. The guys in here told us to take our time, hang out as long as we want. My sister and I ordered the veggie egg foo young and meatless lemon chicken. And a beer and a soda.

I love this restaurant we have been coming here for years... and not once have we had a bad experience. The quantity and the prices are great and if you order a certain amount of food they always gives us an extra plate. We dine in early, evening, very late and NEVER had a bad experience.. :)
The food (meatball, kale salad) is good, but ludicrously overpriced.  Cut the cost by half and I'd come by a lot more often.  As is, I doubt I'll ever eat here again.
Morroccan meatballs were TASTY and HEALTHY and DELICIOUS. Loved the side kale salad with golden beets and goat cheese. nomnomnom

This place is kinda in the cuts but it's worth it for their Vietnamese food! They have the most variety and options on their menu that I've ever seen at a Vietnamese place. In some places, this might mean everything is mediocre, but it works at Them Ky!
It's one my fav dives in the city and I get the bitter mellon with spareribs to go at least once a week. Amazing curry, egg loaf, and stir fried items. I would skip the pho tho.

This was our 2nd choice as Hai Ky Mia Gia was closed last night. We got into the restaurant and it was busy. No one came out to greet us for a long time. Finally we just sat at a random table and waited for our server. She brought us tea and we studied the menu as there are alot of choices. We waited again for the server to come out but it took awhile. We were in a hurry because we were going to a screening of "Lucy". So we ordered our food. We got the imperial rolls, BBQ Beef over vermicelli noodles and my bestie got the pho with everything in it. The servers speak chinese as there are alot of chinese that were born in Vietnam. Anyway, the imperial rolls were good but they weren't as crisp as I expected. The carrots and radishes that came with it were not very good. They did not taste fresh. My vermicelli bowl was HUGE! There were SO many noodles in it. There was no way I was going to be able to finish it. The beef was pretty good but again the carrots didn't taste that good. My friend seemed to be happy with her pho but she also could not finish it because it was a humungous bowl of noodles. It's hard for me to like new restaurants because I've been to alot of good places. This place was just okay for me. The servers were nice enough but there are alot of other choices in this neighborhood.
Great variety of noodle soup selections as well as plate entrees!
Good price, good food.
Fire roasted.
One of my favs when i am flush and slumming in that part of town.
Deelish!

Prices are very cheap (check out the Vietnamese sandwiches), and the food is no frills but absolutely great considering what they charge. This place is more Chinese than Vietnamese but I guess they're trying to blend in with all the Pho places nearby. Staff is very friendly.
Food was very good. Love that we were walked here by a stranger who saw us looking stumped outside Turtle Tower since it was closed for construction. Woo foodie central!
letter B. that is all.

Definitely not a place to take your family or date. Up next to the counter was ant/roach spray, behind the counter was a mess and the food was just okay. Very traditional food, without a lot of flavor. I had to ask for sugar, salt, pepper and other spices to make my broccoli beef tolerable. My friend had a sweet/sour chicken that tasted mostly like vinegar and smelled like bleach. (Yes bleach) Customer service was nice when we got the lady who spoke english. Most of the employee's do not, which is not bad but annoying when you need something and you have to go through a chain of command just to ask for some sugar, silverware, extra napkins etc.
I eat here all the time since I work 2.5 blocks away.
Cheap (~$8 for a big bowl!), but not that good. Beef Pho broth lacked rich flavor, but included lots of meat and toppings. There was enough noodles to fill 2 people.
Hmmm maybe 3.5 stars.

I adore this place! I've been to the more famous restaurant next door (Hai Ky Mi Gia) and I like Them Ky better. This place is legit with some pretty authentic dishes (a lot of offal to go around). I came here for lunch with a coworker and we shared the taro cake appetizer place and Ariel ordered the combination beef parts pho (don't know how else to call it, but it has beef balls, stewed beef, tendon and sirloin) and I had the beef stew pho.
I love this place. My Viet friend introduced me. All the food I've had is great but I always get the rice vermicelli bowl. The shrimp chip salads or Chinese pancakes are good to start.

For 3.5 stars it is out of this world. I lived in the SGV in SoCal for all my life and since moving up to the bay 6 months ago, I've been trying to find quality Asian food that reminds me of back home (which was basically Asia, relocated to a small town neighboring Pasadena). Them Ky, which I thought was a fluke, was randomly chosen by a friend based on cheapness and yelp reviews (golden rule: only go to restaurants with 3 or more stars, always).
The pho and portion sizes are great. beef stew is ok. the seafood is not so great here. I usually just stick with the pho ga. service is hit or miss depending on how busy it gets.
I had been there lots times.I like there.vietnam rice noodle and Chou ,beef Chou fen are all very delicious !

Came here for a vietnamese banh mi sandwich. It was made to order and the bread was fresh - crispy and flakey, just the way I like it. The meat had a great flavor. The one downside is that they don't have pate.
We wanted to go to Ha Nam Nimh  for dinner on Friday evening but as observed by everyone lately, that place opens whenever it feels like it.
pretty typical pho shop in the tenderloin.  i went out of my way to come here due to the good reviews and i was disappointed.  stopped by w kf after a chiro appointment.
We order two different things:
Their #43 will have to do (beef over rice w/ imperial roll) until my favorite Tu-Lan re-opens.
Hands down the WORST bowl of pho I've ever had.
One of the only places in Little Saigon that actually uses charbroiled pork in their Banh Mi.

With a few of my favorite pho joints relatively close to me (PPQ!), it's not often I head down to the TL just to get a bowl of pho.  If and when I would though, Them Ky was usually my go-to choice - solid food, reasonable prices, and plenty of seating.  So while it's great that two of the three are still true, the most important one (the food) is nothing like I remember.
Hungry and looking for tasty, inexpensive food? Them Ky is the spot.

OK, I have to admit I was kinda nervous eating here. I call it the Tu Lan Too Little Too Late Syndrome. It's that creeping feeling you have when you step into a family-run restaurant that looks rather run down with the slightly faded photos of their specialty dishes on the wall, but you feel like you committed yourself because you're the only one in the place about to eat their food. Your conscience overrides any health concerns you are about to face by sitting down and ordering something off their menu.
Was planning to visit the bigger restaurant next door but decided to give this place a try, good call.
Finally found a soup I like here, the combo clear noodle soup. Shrimp, porkcake, ground pork, chicken, and squid over chewy clear noodles, with some kind of fermented paste and soup on the side.

After a poor initial experience at Bodega Bistro, my friends and I got up, quickly checked Yelp for the nearest still-open pho restaurant (they were all closing as it was around 6:30 pm on Sunday), found this place just around the corner, and booked it over here.

I was pretty disappointed here. The inside is relatively small, with limited seating, and it can be hard to get a spot during the lunch rush. With so many people here though, I expected the food to be better.
This is a low 4, so I can see how it's a 3.5.
- The pho broth was bad, really bad
I came here on saturday looking forward to eating their pho as one of my friend's highly recommends this place... and unfortunately, this place is NG (no good)

I had the bun bo hue here (what else?), and it isn't very spicy, which I like.  It comes with the pale pork ham/sausage/roll (you know what I'm talking about), pork blood, beef and beef tendon.  I told them to skip the pork hock... the only part I never eat.  It's accompanied by raw bean sprouts, cabbage, mint leaves, and a lemon.  No basil... darn.  I don't care for mint leaves much.

You know since Golden House on Golden Gate Avenue closed, I've been searching for a place that serves a good bowl of bun, spring roll, and bbq'd meat.  I will say that Them Ky does serve a good bowl of that, maybe not quite as good as Golden House did or Pink Flamingo, for those of you that remember that place.  That being said, I would definitely go back if I needed a bun fix.

By far the best 5 items rice plate I have ever eaten!  I didn't give them a 5 star due to the decor, it looks old and run down but the food is great and at an affordable price.  You can choose from bbq pork, bbq chicken or bbq beef for the 5 items.  The food is consistent and I never had a bad meal.  Just make sure you have an appetite because it is a huge portion and once finished you will fall into food coma.  Located in the so call Tenderloin but nothing to be alarmed about.  Never had a problem eating there.  Just make sure you are ready to find parking because it can be difficult due to all the traffic around there.

Wow.  This place is terrible.  I asked for a regular carnitas burrito and what they gave me--especially in San Francisco--was completely bizarre and unacceptable.  What the hell?  There was maybe half a sprinkling of some unidentifiable meat.  I do not believe it came from a pig.  And who opens a can of tomato sauce and calls that "mild salsa"??  No self-respecting Mexican, fo sheezy.  I do NOT recommend it unless you're the kind of person who makes a quesadilla with Kraft Singles.  No offense.

If you are looking for a restaurant that gives you what you order, then this is not the place for you. If you, on the other hand, would like a place to give you whatever it is they feel like cooking up then this is right up your alley.

Went in to get lunch to go. It seems as if a crackhead was crying with her shades on and was sitting on the back. She was sleeping cause I saw her head dipping down as I was inside the subway. Micoh was making my sandwich. I told him what I wanted. He mumbled something. I asked him to repeat. "Do you want it toasted?"  No thank you. Veggies? So I tell him. I want this... He replies, " what else?" Ok... Mayo mustard please. He puts mustard on my sandwich. Mayo... Dribbles out. It seems as it was running out. Fine. As I noticed other subways do. They push the remainder of what's left in the container to the tip to get the rest out. He gently pats the bottom and there I don't get as much as I'd like to. I go to the register to pay and I ask for cool ranch chips. He seems clueless. As he doesn't know what cool ranch is. He turns around and looks at the selection. I told him Doritos. He picks up the nacho cheese flavored one. No, the one next to it... He rings me up. I hand him my 20, as the register opens, he leans over to his left and talks to someone behind the wall. Probably his co worker. I couldn't hear what was being said. Then I would expect him to hand me my coins first. $0.71 but he places $12 dollars on the table. Fans it out. Them places 71 cents on top of that. So I have to pick it up one by one along with the $12 dollars. Then pick up my sandwich and chips and the receipt. There were no napkins given to me and I wasn't asked if I wanted a bag. Is this guy new?
Lately I've found myself regrettably headed toward Civic Center which I try to avoid on business.  Since I take the shortest route walking down from Nob Hill I sometimes pass this place.

I've been coming to this Subway location for awhile because A. it's not far from where I live, B. It's affordable (love the chips/drink special) C. It's clean and I love the two ladies "Maribeth & Julie" who are always smiling, friendly & helpful, and Maribeth remembers my order!!!
BRING BACK SOURDOUGH!!!!
Time: 7:43pm

Typical Subway, but I love the old man that works here! I can see how there might be a wait at some times, but he was so courteous and sweet. Next time I have another show at the Regency and want a quick cheap stomach filler, I will come here.
Horrible staff at this location. I usually like subway but I had to give this location 1 star. It's just bad staffing.
The world's slowest employees coupled with the biggest idiots for customers. Never again.

Nothing special about this place... It's just another Subways. They are friendly nd I don't have to wait really long to get my sandwich, which is really nice/good. I come here usually when I'm craving a sandwich nd am nearby. There are two nearby Subways but this one is much closer to Quick's then tha Larkin/Goldengate one (which has Buffalo Sauce! :] )

Always fast friendly service. Pretty clean and its like a little cove off of a busy street. Love ducking in and having a nice lunch or snack. Could be a really nasty place considering the location but its not.....with that being said this Subway gets two thumbs up from this Guy :)

ewww I don't like this subway.  I don't know something about not being able to get the $5 foot long at that price after certain hours just doesn't settle with me very well.   I don't care to get the best service, especially from a chain in the TL but the KFC/Taco have a better attitude than this place.  I hate to just give my $$ to jerks, I always wonder if they don't care to be somewhat nice then who knows how they treat the food they are selling....just a thought.  Go to the Subway on Sutter and Taylor-they are the best!

To tell you the truth all Subway's are pretty much the same. They all serve the same stuff and the prices are always the same. I couldn't think of a better location to put this place in because while I was walking around I was also dieing of starvation and was glad to see there was a Subway a block away.

I eat here a lot.  The staff here knows me and they're always very friendly and have a great sense of humor.  The sandwiches are the same you'd get any subway.  I'd still go here if the staff was nice or not because I do enjoy subway. But the fact they're as nice as they are definitely makes it a pleasant experience.

I don't see what the big deal is with the negative reviews.  It's Subway.    My $5 Foot Long was decent, bread was the same bread you get at any other subway.  People behind the counter were your typical franchise fast food type workers.  Nothing good, nothing bad.  An A-OK place to go if you work in the area, are on a budget, and are sick of Taco Bell / KFC / Mcdonalds / Vietnamese Sandwiches.
It's Pride and I'm hungry.
I really appreciate you having the daily special sandwiches...$2.99 is definitely a deal...i'm officially on the subway diet and have been for the past few weeks straight- thanks to you love :)

I like this Subway. A lot of the subs at this Subway are pretty good. I highly recommend their Tuna sandwiches. I love tuna sandwiches and their Tuna sandwiches are pretty good.  I also recommend that you get swiss cheese on the tuna sandwich. It tastes hecka good. Their meatball marinara sandwiches, and even their turkey sandwiches are pretty good as well. The only thing that sucks about this Subway is that it's always crowded, especially if you come during lunch time and you are in a rush to eat lunch. You are guaranteed to be waiting in line for at least 5-10 min.

i've been coming here alot lately for the $5 subs deal.  they recently remodeled this place, new tables, new decor, and a new A/C system!  In the old place, their A/C was busted and with the oven in the back baking bread, it got hot as hell in the dining area.

As a former subway employee, I can always distinguish the details that make or break a quality subway sandwich. Some very important things for me are bread quality (wether or not it was squished while getting wrapped up, how flaky the outside is [which, fyi means it's more than a day old], softness, and volume), meat quality which is basically how long the meat has been in the sandwich unit, and the cleanliness of the sandwich unit which can contribute to or prevent unwanted ingredients such as hot peppers ending up in your sandwich. Any of these things being off completely ruins a sandwich for me. You can call me picky if you want, but if you made yourself a sub five days a week for a year, you'd be picky too.
Ok, it's a Subway so this review is basically comparing it to other Subways I've been in.
I love the BMTzers... just hold the pickles and olives. I love the warm toasted honey oat bread.... but you gotta get it toasted!!!
I went to lunch with my coworkers the other day.  It was pretty empty, so I was a bit worried.  I ordered #45: chicken with egg rolls and rice vermicelli.  I also ordered a Thai iced tea.
Delicious lunch enjoyed by large group.  Service was terrific and all the dishes delicious.  My favorite was a vegetarian dish with delicate tofu. Also loved the egg rolls. Will be back!

I come here pretty often! The service and food is super fast! Their meat to noodle ratio is amazing in my opinion, I am part carnivore. The prices are very reasonable. The only thing I don't like about this place is the neighborhood, but you occasionally get a meal and a show at this place if you face the window.

I place an order for pick-up at 8:30PM Sunday night. I get there around 8:50ish, and this restaurant's location is super skeezy. I know it's in the Tenderloin, but right outside the restaurant was a crowd of homeless people who eyed me up and down as I got out of my car, and when I came back to my car, they were sitting on it.

The most authentic Vietnamese food I've found so far in SF. I had the pleasure of enjoying the Banh Cuon and the Banh Khot. Both were amazing. My niece enjoyed the Com Thit Nuong and my boyfriend had the Pho. We were giving a huge helping of fresh veggies and a lot of fish sauce! I will come back again. Definitely a mom and pop place.

Our Vietnamese for standards are above average and we enjoyed every bite. Everything tasted homemade and super fresh, esp. pork and wood ear mushroom rollups. Great place for a quick bite before Orpheum. $33 for two and we could barely walk 3 blocks.
I'm giving this a 3 star only because I am always happy with the delivery. However, I came in for dinner and ordered the Pho. It was all broth - barely any meat. Food in the restaurant is - eh.
Avoid the negative reviews, this is one of the best vietnamese restaurants

My friend and I were driving around looking for pho on a chilly night and finally happened upon Vietnam House. The only other patrons were a group of Vietnamese men sitting around a table drinking beers and bantering; it felt authentic. I had the veggie pho which I had to ask about as it didn't seem to be printed on the menu. It had a flavorful broth and a variety of vegetables. My friend had the chicken pho. We walked away praising this low-key restaurant. Delicious Pho!

After reading some positive comments, I decided to give this place a try on a Monday for lunch. I ordered a grill pork vermicelli and an ice coffee. When the owner brought me the food, I saw TWO strands of human hair embedded in the vermicelli. I was immediately grossed out but didn't have the guts to confront him. The owner looked intimidating and I don't want him to spit on my food, so I decided to just eat it up and get the hell out of there.

I used to love this place when it was Saigon Cuisine. When it became Vietnam House, I was skeptical but I gave them a shot. I had ordered delivery and it took 50 minutes to get to me despite only being a few blocks away (I had to work through my lunch)

Not my cup of tea. I used to like coming here before it was Vietnam House. Tried it once for delivery when Vietnam House took over. Big.Mistake. Took 50 minutes for our food to be delivered after another phone call was made inquiring about our order.
well, it's amazing. it's super close and great spot to hit up, possibly catch a little football on sunday.

I have to give it 5 stars once more - its been about 1.5 years since my last review. I come almost religiously weekly with a friend. And sometimes take the family.. Each time service is tremendous. Extraordinary care, scrumptious food, my wife loves the crepes. Mom loves the chicken noodle soup. And I everything - of course. If you want to watch the game - its there as well.

It's been a while since I've reviewed any restaurants on Yelp but I want to keep this little restaurant around.  They have one of my favorite Vietnamese dishes that I rarely find in the countless eateries in town and they do it well: Banh Cuon. (Ground pork and mushrooms in a delicate rice wrap).

This place has pretty decent food, but it takes forever to get any food.  I think there is only 1 person cooking in the kitchen or something, either that or they are just ridiculously.  I've ordered delivery from them before and it literally took like 2 hrs to get our food.  I had to call the restaurant 3 times to see where our food was and each time was told it was on the way.  By the time the food arrived, everything was cold and soggy.  That was not the only time I experienced slow service either.  I actually dined at the restaurant for lunch one day and there was maybe about 4 other groups eating there, it was definitely not packed or busy at all.  Anyways, I ordered a noodle soup and it took 30 mins to get my food!  It's sad because I really wanted to like this place, but it's really not worth my time and I can't really recommend this place based on the terribly slow service.

I have eaten here twice and enjoy the foods.  I order Bun Cha Hai Noi and Banh Xeo.  Both was very good and taste home-made like how my auntie makes them.  Usually some places don't give enough vegetable for the food but not in this place.  I am a fan and will come back.

Very good place: nice ambiance, affordable (dinner enters around $7.50), and good service.  The Vietnamese style sweet and sour catfish soup was outstanding!  Very generous (enough for two with lots of fish) with a unique, delicious flavor.  Recommended.
Probably closer to 2.5 than 3.  It was a cold and rainy night, so we decided to get some noodles close by.  Pho 99 is our normal go to place in the TL.
Not sure about the other reviews because my meal here was disappointing.  Too bad service was so great.
Errr, 4.5 Stars on Yelp? SERIOUSLY?!?!?
The Scene: Vietnam House 30 minute before closing
Really good food at a really good price, not much more to say. Try it.

So I was thinking of a place to have lunch on Monday and I was just about to go somewhere for a rather more boring American sandwich, when I realized that what I really wanted was Vietnamese food.  Since I work near Civic Center, this was lucky for me, but I also needed a place that takes credit cards, which according to Yelp narrowed my choices down to... this place, pretty much.

I had my doubts when we walked in because there was NO ONE there, but my friend was battling a hangover and we needed water. Service started off well enough (we were the only ones there) but towards the end it was like trying to flag down a taxi in North Beach on halloween night, but that's because the restaurant was full by the time we left! Not surprising seeing the food was really good. We had the 5-spice chicken rice plate, the papaya salad, and the traditional pho with rare steak and tendon (Not on menu they just let me choose whatever meats). Oh and I can't forget about the fantastic vietnamese coffee with condensed milk, dark, rich, thick, sugary, and icy... there was no sluggishness after one sip of that.
Favorite Vietnamese place! Good simple food and price is very affordable.

Some co-workers and I called for delivery on a rainy Sunday. We ordered a variety of appetizers, meat and veggie dishes, and pho soup. Everything was so scrumptious that it was gone almost instantly! I usually ask for extra mint, cilantro and basil when I order Vietnamese or Thai because I'm kind of a freak like that and they totally hooked us up! The Chao Tom is so yummy I can't wait to order it again!!

Today anyway (Saturday night, November 13), the best Vietnamese restaurant  in the city, and I've been to over twenty this year. On my visit, my second, I had a wide array of dishes that were never less than very good.  The papaya salad w was one that reminded me of my eating experience in Hanoi--clean, fresh julienne slices of papaya with chewy slivers of slightly sweet beef jerky, tied to together with a lovely and very light citrus dressing.  The signature appetizer, custard tarts topped with perfectly cooked shrimp, eaten (awkwardly) wrapped in herbs, was warm and sweet and savory, while the caramelized pork was ..well, I can't figure out the flavors exactly but deep and smoky and the hit of the night.  The other dish that we liked was the fish with a ginger sauce, similar in a way to Hakka salt backed chicken but more balanced and less pungent then the Chinese version.

I have this theory.  You can't make asian noodle dishes with italian pasta.  Just like you can't make stir-fry without a wok, nor can you make pasta sauce in a wok.  It just doesn't work.  One time I tried to make a dirty martini with black olives.  They were proper expensive chic olives.  But not the right type.
My husband and I tried this restaurant today. We really enjoyed it!
vietnamese approaching the san jose little saigon level.  prices very reasonable.  interior decor better than the avg place around.
Very clean and very comfortable dinning area.  It's not much of a traditional Vietnamese cuisine IMO; instead, it's more like a fusion cuisine.
BOMBDIGGITY!
not usually crowded.  nice and quiet.  nice tv to watch.  i like their noodles better than most places.  they go a little light on the meat though.

recommended by bf's family so you know this place is legit (they're vietnamese). I had the banh cuon cha lua (steamed rice roll with vietnamese steamed pork). It was so good that I came back many many teams. The Bun Ha Noi is a must and they're vermicelli dish is substantial.
good food, clean, okay service (pretty good for an asian place)

We came to Vietnam House when our first choice in the TL was closed. I had the former restaurant bookmarked for a while. The menu posted outside drew us in since there was a good variety of real Vietnamesey options, and sometimes a nice clean restaurant is what you crave when you've been walking around the TL for a while.

Great, authentic vietnamese food. Laidback setting and much cleaner than surrounding restaurants. HUGE selection of vietnamese dishes in one place (there is a difference between the lunch and dinner menus although the lunch menu is the standard and they may not have items listed on the dinner menu).

Wonderful new find! The restaurant is decorated perfectly and is much cleaner than most of the other places in the area. The owner, Tuan, was my waiter and was extremely nice, recommending his favorites to me. I had the lemon grass spicy pho and for $7.50 it was perfect. If you are in the mood for Vietnamese and are in the Loin, def give this place a try :)
Waited over an hour for food, driver went to the wrong address, did not speak english and didnt read the address via eat24 correctly. Couldn't even communicate with him. Had to totally cancel.

I had gone down a few times ordering pizza twice and wings twice.  The pizza wasn't too bad except one time I ordered several slices, the sign out front said that I should have gotten a can of soda for each slice.  When I brought it to their attention I was told that I needed to ask for the soda.  I was like you charged me for it aren't you going to make good on the advertisement?  Their reply was no.  Ok.  The first time I ordered wings they were great, the next time I ordered them they were way over done, hard and crusty really.  I brought it to their attention and they said I should have looked before I left instead of throwing them out when I got home; who opens the box to check before they leave a pizza joint or any fast food place?  We assume that the order is right.  I am in a wheelchair I told them when I had gotten home I got out if my chair and didn't want to get back in it to go all the way back down there.  So far they haven't made good on the soda or the wings, they said they would make good on the wings the next time I was in but they haven't.
Food came after 1 hour 55 min (no joke).
I've been here a few times now and my experience here is always awesome. 2 thumbs up for the employees and the food. Thanks for being open soo late.

Excited this pizza joint opened up right next door to my place of employment. Their employees are always friendly and the service is excellent. We always order pizza from them for family events and employee parties. Their pizza is pretty decent for the TL and their spaghetti is legit as well. If you're not in the mood for pizza there's also hamburgers and fries. This place is clean and well lit. Stop by if you're ever in the TL.

Have ordered a few times since they are close by.  Food is ok but not great.  One thing I hate is they always either forget the drinks or get the number of drinks I ordered wrong. Check your order and don't pay upfront using a credit card.  At least with cash you can take the cost of the "lost" drinks off without trouble.
Terrible. The worst pizza I've ever had. Taste weird, I would never order again. Oh yah, and they like to plaster their shitty flyers all over local apartment buildings.

These guys arent bad. The pizza isnt the greatest but the pastas are ok. Service for carryout is food but the drivers try to pull that "meet me at my car, I cant find parking" bit often. Location is super hood.

I feel so fantastically bad giving this review. This is my first bad review of a place. But the pizza is just bad. It tastes funny and doesn't sick well in my stomach. I have given this place a few chances. Recently they have this special on spaghetti, garlic bread, and soda for like 6 bucks. The spaghetti is alright. Way better than the pizza.

I love a place that is open till 5am and still serves great burgers. Pizza is good but I like the burgers. Just do yourself a favor and never order the pasta it's like they must have a giant tin can of it soaking in sauce. it just taste off and watery. if anything great for a late night thing but not a regular spot. It is smack in the middle of the Tenderloin so the outside activity can be comical or can be scary depending on how you look at it.
Every time I see a Taco Bell/KFC the same joke pops in my head.

I love KFC and I love Taco Bell. But the location at Polk and Eddy is a disgrace. The lobby is filthy, littered with debris and homeless people/junkies. The employees act stoned and could not care less about how clean the place is or how fast the customers are served. They REGULARLY run out of original chicken, and extra crispy, and strips, and empanadas, and ranch, and.......  Tonight, they were completely out of all chicken by 830.  Many nights, there is no Pepsi and you are left to choose between raspberry iced tea or lemonade (YUCK!). Someone had their (daughter/neice?) working behind the counter tonight (maybe 10 or 11 years old). Really?!?!

This has to be the worst KFC in the entire city and by far the worst chicken I've ever eaten. I've been to several other KFCs in the city but decided to give this one a try since it's now closest to my apt. Big mistake!

Always friendly, usually organized, and far exceeds what one might expect from a TL KFC. Ask if they have a daily special, they usually still do, just not advertised. This KFC prevented me from starving through my undergrad years.
The bad thing about this place : Open's up late and Closes early.
Oh! And some random guy with no uniform serving himself some chicken and a biscuit! You can see the plate between these two on the counter.

This is the most depressing establishment I've ever walked into. Everyone, including the clientele, just looks completely defeated. I suppose it doesn't really matter what I say here, since you don't look at yelp to determine whether you want KFC.
We all know how this story goes right?
too bad to eat,
Good old fashion fried chicken. just the way i like.

I went in 30 minutes before closing that the manager Christina provided excellent customer service. I asked for a 20 piece and she had some more chicken made for me so i could get what i wanted. I have been in there other occasions when Christina wasn't there and i wasn't able to get what i needed. Normally when i go to most places the employee's are in a rush to get off work and don't want to make any more food and you end up either getting nothing or having to get something that you didn't want. Not this time.

Thursday is chicken pot pie day ($2.99) at KFC.  Instead of getting the pie, I had a BOGO coupon for 2 pc. boneless chicken, with one side, one b-b-b-biscuit (LOL) and a medium drink for $4.99.  Coupon had an expiration date of 5/12/2013.

This is the second year, we have used this KFC to provide the many buckets of chicken for our Kentucky Derby party. Again, the chicken was ready at our pre-arranged pick up time and the Manager, Cristiana, could not have been nicer or more  helpful. The chicken was enjoyed by all as usual. Left overs were in demand to bring home.
You're not reading this review to learn about the food. Good, because I'm not writing it about the food.
Slowest restaurant in the world!!! These people need to be slapped!!
I just came here few hours ago. I'm kinda lost at the area.. but the lady who are in the counter tonight 4/19 is so helpful she helped me to kn ow how to go back to downtown SF.

When you've got to get it you've got to get it. Even if that means leaving your nice little SOMA work neighborhood and walk through the Tenderloin to get to it. Don't go overboard, KFC adds up very quickly -- I'd recommend a nice three piece. There's a bus line right outside to take you back to Market St. safety once you're order is ready.
KFC is what all chickens aspire to. The news says there are steroids in the chicken, but that is because the chickens work hard to make the cut and naturally, some cheat.
This location scares me.  I was so concern about touching the door handle to get in...once inside, it got worse.  After less than a minute, I had to walk out and run back to hubby in the waiting car.
Unfortunately, the manager Francis is no longer working here, and the great morale that was so rare for a fast food joint, is gone... Back to a standard KFC now.
Love KFC chicken, not so crazy about Taco Bell but we all know what we're getting when we go to a KFC/Taco Bell.

This location was very dirty when i came. Tons of napkins/wrappers/food particles on floor, tables, and chairs. Service was relatively slow and food wasn't as good as other locations. Will probably come back, but only because of its proximity to my brother's apartment.
I Double Downed at KFC last night and am oddly unapologetic about it. [

This is a interesting KFC.  The suburban KFC's are pretty boring. This one located in the Tenderloin has a diverse clientele. Regular people, homeless people, hookers, and trannies. I have been coming to this place on and off for several years. I have seen a lot of weird stuff happening at this KFC.

On a typical day at this KFC if you order a bucket you may open it to find a homeless man laying in the bottom surrounded by bones,  but on tuesday nights its the two piece for 99 cent deal so they serve the goods up too fast for them to crawl into your food.  Add a side and drink for another dollar.  I dont care how many hobos you have to fight off to get in the door, this deal is effing epic to this fat boy.

I love KFC, I just hate this one on Eddy and Polk.  I called in a new batch of hot wings and when I got there, they refused to sell  them to me.  They lied and said they were all fried at the same time but if you look at it, there is a clear divide in the new and the old.  Old ones accessible from the front, new ones placed in from the back.  Didn't feel like arguing with them and was on my way.  I asked for hot sauce, she said they ran out.  I asked for jalapeno and she said they don't sell them.  Arrrgg!  And she was being a complete bitch!  Definitely not going back to this one ever again!
Good food selection. Staff is usually friendly and tries to get the line through quickly. Good prices.
It's a KFC/Taco Bell, what do you expect?
KFC was open on New Year's Day and was the perfect way to give the double middle-finger to any resolutions to eat healthy and lose weight in 2009.
Kentucky Fried Cholesterol, no further explanation needed. And as if it's any wonder why America is 60% overweight.
Most KFC's deserve 3 stars but this location deserves 4 stars.  Here's a couple of reasons:
4 stars.
This is a review for the KFC part of the KFC/Taco Bell location.

No KFC or Taco Bell should get more than 3 stars...but this one deserves 4.  Not only is this location entertaining, it is the ONLY KFC or Taco Bell that I have ever been to that the people working the register can not only articulate the English language (no I don't mean non-native speakers...I mean people that just are too lazy to open their mouths) AND that can make me laugh.  I have had more than one occasion where the guys working the register actually had a sense of humor!  can you believe that!!!
this kfc is pretty busy as it's in the tenderloin and in close proximity to the courts and city hall.  there is at least 1 panhandler outside, but they mean no harm.
I know it's bad for me. I know that when I buy it, I look like a walking stereotype... but damn it... I sometimes can't fight the craving for fried chicken!

Let's say you meet someone and you develop an instant addiction to them.  At first, things are great and you spend all your time in their company.  And even though he hits you, it feels like a kiss; and even though you sense the codependency, you still persevere.  But soon things degenerate and you wonder why you've been together for so long -- you realize you're slowly dying inside, fucking asshole never loved you anyway, so you pull a Bikini Kill by screaming "IT'S HARD TO TALK WITH YOUR DICK IN MY MOUTH, FUCK YOU NAT SHERMAN" and kick his ass to the curb.
This place gets 2 stars just for being so damn entertaining.

After a night of drinking, drugging, debauchery and destruction I finally found myself at home today around 4pm.  Needing sustenance badly.  I listen to my body when it needs food and today my body distinctly referenced its need for KFC.  Who am I to deny my body?  So I tried to weasel my way out of walking all the way down to KFC.  I called Adam M. but he had already eaten and was at a friend's house. Hmph, the nerve!  I texted AK next, hoping that she might suggest sending Matt capital r to the rescue and to get some chicken for her too.  No response.  WTF?! Where are all my friends when I need some KFC?!  Goddamnit.  This was getting serious.  My body was starting to double over in pain with the KFC withdrawals.  So I took a deep breath and headed out of my apartment at Sutter and Jones and took off for the dedicated Tenderloin area.  Mentally I had already prepared myself for what I wanted and so I recited the list as I walked: 10 piece honey bbq wings, popcorn chicken, mashed potatoes with gravy, biscuit.  Cold cherry coke already in the fridge.  I got to KFC and ordered.  Added 2 extra crispy breasts and made the decision to stop off for an ice cream and cigarettes on the way home.

I don't know which was more fun: the walk to KFC from my apartment, or the walk back to my apartment from KFC. I asked my friend meghan where to get fried chicken in the tenderloin, and she told me to go to Farmer Brown. (And I was excited to try Farmer Brown). Then I asked her where the nearest KFC was, you know, "just so I'll know." She told me and as we hung up the phone, I think we both knew where I was going. I was barely able to contain my glee walking down O'Farrell... Do I have any change? Yes, I do, but I'm gonna spend it all on fried chicken, or whatever it is they fry at Kentucky Fried Chicken--frankly I could give two shits. I stood in line, waited my turn, and placed my order. I spent $8.29 at KFC, ordering no drink, no sides, just chicken *substitute correct chicken substitute term here and throughout the rest of my review whenever you see the word chicken, if that's the kind of thing you worry about, which means you probably are not reading online reviews of Kentucky Fried Chicken.* Chicken was ready, lickety-split, grab that shit, high-tail it back to the apt, kick off the shoes, into bed with a box of delicious fried chicken. The popcorn chicken managed to stay warm all the way home, and that big breast--it was so tender inside I practically clicked my heels that I had gone with my heart and skipped Farmer Brown. BBQ sauce on my shirt and honey mustard on my bedsheets. Text message from Paul: ready to get a drink? Absolutely not. I need to digest.
I found out the taqueria turned into an Indian restaurant only after dragging a couple of people for tacos.  As soon as we walked in, "Um, Noel.  I don't think they have burritos."
The fifth (!) Indian or Pakistani restaurant in a single block of the Tenderloin, perhaps they're banking on tourists with old guidebooks who think it's still Dottie's, the breakfast place.
